reviews.review:
Favorite BBQ spot here in town!

They're tucked away in a not-very-pedestrian-friendly area, so if you're staying on the Strip, I suggest taking a cab --- or getting it delivered via Postmates! Either way, GET IT IN YOUR STOMACH.

They have several different combo options available, with a wide variety of delicious side dishes to choose from. I always choose from their smaller combo options (usually their pulled pork sandwich with mac & cheese or beans) because, well, to be quite honest, even then, there is SO MUCH FOOD.

Sad to say that this place has gone "corporate" and this is no longer a must go destination when in Vegas.  I get it, as this is a business and we all need to make your money but...

Gone is the mom and pop feel and the prices have increased accordingly and no longer a screaming bargain.  Some examples: they charge $3 for drinks, I could barely finish my meal before but now can so quite comfortably (but still is filling), I was never asked how my food was and when ordering, I was not given any suggestions or descriptions on their menu choices.

Ordered the meat trio $17.99:

Baby back ribs are not no longer fall off the bone and a bit dry.  The BBQ chicken is soft and tender but the smoky flavor and seasoning didn't sink into the meat.  The beef brisket is still pretty good but was chopped too much.

If you don't mind driving and for really good BBQ for dirt cheap prices, I suggest John Mull's in North Las Vegas.
Best beef ribs in vegas. A must stop when you visit sin city

Working in kitchens most of my life, ive been exposed to bbq from memphis, texas, north carolina, ect. This place is okay. The service was fast, food came out quick, but it just fell flat. Brisket was dry and along with pulled pork, you gotta coat it in sauce just to get it down. Ribs and chicken were good, great smoke flavor on both but 30 minutes later you still have a smokey taste in your mouth (usually indicates usage of liquid smoke). Hot link was mediocre. Mac and cheese lacked seasoning and needed more cheese in the sauce, slaw was good and the beans were also nice. Overall it was a disappointment. Save yourself some money and go to roadkill grill, better bbq, well seasoned food and lower prices.

My party came on a Saturday night and surprisingly it wasn't too busy. They have two rooms with long tables, perfect for large parties. The prices here are pretty good too! 

We ordered a few things to try, but my favorites were the burnt ends and St. Louis ribs. The St. Louis ribs are dry rubbed and the sweet and spicy sauce was perfect for dipping. My bf liked the vinegar sauce but it wasn't really my thing. We got the brisket three ways but ended up ordering more of the burnt ends because they were really good! 

For our sides, we got the waffle fries, corn nuggets, corn bread, mashed potatoes and mac and cheese. I loved all the sides but the corn nuggets were really good! I've never had something like it before, but it's basically creamed corned that's deep fried into nuggets.

If you want some amazing BBQ this is the place.  I came here for lunch after hearing and reading rave reviews.  I came around 11:50 on a Wednesday and it was still busy.  That lets you know that this place is jammin.  Apparently you can call in the order and they'll have it ready when you come get it, (total plus in my book).  It's a little confusing to get to, but that shouldn't stop you at all.  

I got the Spudtastic with brisket and a side of Bacon Potato Salad.  Everything was fresh and tasted amazing! This will definitely become a lunch/dinner regular for me.  The line never went down while we were there.

Picnic style seating.  We sat at a table with some other people while waiting for their food and everybody was so nice.  Staff and regulars.

Anybody who says this place is okay, and that  it isn't like "back home" is obviously prejudiced to wherever "back home" is.

This place is awesome and definitely worth coming to!!
Just left Rollin Smoke bbq in Vegas and let me tell you, this place is great! Food was so good and there was plenty of it! I will for sure be back!

This place is great.  Its a hidden gem that is busy during lunch time, but worth the wait.  Trio combo is the best deal.  Everything is tasty, jalapeno slaw is delicious! 
One recommendation is to not over cook the brisket!   Lately its been dry and chewy...not savory, tender, juicy, fatty, flavorful :(
Absolutely the BEST BBQ ANYWHERE  period!!!! You can taste the time and care put into the meats and sides. A must stop whenever we're in Vegas.

Finding a authentic homemade bbq place can be tough if you don't live in a southern state. Luckily this is my second find of great bbq. We arrived during the lunch rush. They had a line but it moved pretty quickly and we were able to snag some seats to enjoy our selections. The Woman that took our order was friendly and patient while we decided what to get. Before we got our food my husband made the comment well we found our bbq place closer to home. I told him how does he know we have not tried the food yet. He laughed at me and said the line is out the door you don't get a line like that with just okay food. A waiter brought out our food he was friendly. Our food was fresh and hot, the hotlinks has this snap when you bite them that your looking for when you bite into one of them. The ribs were perfectly seasoned and fell off the bone, the only complaint were they were a tad bit greasy. The chicken was cooked just right and had a nice smoked taste when you bit into it. The okra was hot and fresh and the chipolte dip was great! The brisket was great I always do a roll test where if i can roll it and it does not break apart it's cooked to my liking, they have hands down one of the best briskets i've had. The mac-n-cheese was the disappointment, it was thick and just didn't taste like mac-n-cheese that you would expect with bbq food. I will be back I see why they have the line they have.

Got call from leader of asian persuasion pack Terri R about trying someplace new out and ALWAYS stay down for trying new spots in town. More so ones that fellow yelpers rave about. Not sure the last time had some good old fashion ribs. So excited too get down and dirty. Talk about epitome of Hole in the Wall. Industrial Rd not exactly the prettiest road in Vegas but great for gentlemen clubs. Anyway so for second thinking going too one only too pass it and then once did get too Rollin Smoke Barbeque look down the street shocker another one. Once you do get here the smell from the pits literally parked right outside in the parking lot (I have no idea when they start but assume in the morning) and them ribs block out everything. I think Hole in Wall places have so much personality and character ALL its own. 

Once get inside the menu is fairly small but they do have chalkboard with their daily specials. You go up too the cashier too order then they bring the food out too you. You sit wherever you like or have room. They have two room adjacent too one another and other room talk about personality on the walls with the art. How can you not love the boars head or pig head looking over the restaurant from one corner? They do still T-shirts that like the logo but next time go get one of kind T-shirt. 

I decided too get The Trio plate. What better way too try little of everything or get my meat in. They out of the hot link so got double order of the pork. My sides went with the mac and cheese. I also ordered side of The Kickin Baked Bean. The pork was excellent! I could easily see myself tearing up pull pork sandwich. Guess is one of there more popular items. The ribs were solid little bit different style then the ones more use too but still solid. Wish could tell you about the hot links but save that for another review. The sides the mac and cheese was really good. It not cheesy cheesy but not runny also so had nice balance. The Kickin Baked Beans now that am FAN. I enjoyed the pieces of pork or beef that in it. I really did have nice little kick spice level too them. Even though it small menu fell like lot more thing for me too try.

The prices talk about reasonable priced! Compare too some of the other franchise places this place is a steal. You get so much more personality and one of kind experience. Under $20 you can fill yourself up with any combination and still have enough for desserts. The service is awesome! Small business owners that sense the personnel touch all around. It small place so just make sure you beat the crowd cause the place can fill out quick. If never been Rollin Smoke Barbeque someplace check out or fill like mixing up one night. 

Thanks my partners Mel C and Terri R!!! You guys rock!!

Started off trying out Rollin Smoke Barbecue around two years ago with my wife and a friend. Our experience left a lot to be desired as our ribs were tough, pork was fatty with no taste and chicken was very dry. We decided then to not come back.

Fast forward two years and WOW, what a difference, This food is dynamite!!!

Let me start with my favorite menu item, the beef ribs. These things are insane tender with a ton of flavor yet simple, literally fall of the bone, fall apart in your mouth and moist with a great pink smoke ring. The server that brought my food told me it was like "prime rib on a stick" and boy was he right! Bring your appetite if you order these, they are huge.

Brisket is darn good as well. Great flavor, nice deep smoke ring and thinly sliced. I have been back three times in the last two weeks (Hi my name is Paul and I'm addicted to good Q) and I have yet to get any point, only flat. I one day will ask them if they are smoking full packers or just the flats. If you ever get the opportunity to get smoked brisket point don't pass it up, it's heaven! (Point brisket is where the "burnt ends" come from) 

Pulled pork is good, but this is where they lost that coveted fifth star from me. I know it's tough to please everyone ( I have been doing BBQ catering for years) but I believe it's a big part of pulled pork to have a finishing sauce added when you pull the shoulder to add that extra level of flavor. I use a home made clear eastern Carolina style finisher on mine and everyone loves it. 

In all this is the best Q restaurant in the valley bar none and I am so happy to see a fellow pit master doing well on his own. While my co workers and I ate lunch today ( 5-1-14 ) the line of people went out the door and never let up the hour we were here. Rock on Rollin Smoke, keep doing it right, you have a loyal customer in me, but only when I'm not doin my own stuff!
Definately try this place! We went with a large group and everything was delicious. They even gave us desserts because we mentioned Yelp.

Hmph. So I had quite a disappointing experience here, so I'm giving a lower star. 

Here's what I had:
  
Out law burger- 5 star.  Meat is juicy and flavor is so rich and yummy. Share one with someone. 
 
The pit Special (4 meats and 3 sides for $20) - brisket, pulled pork, 2 spare ribs, and since the hot links were out i subbed it with baby back ribs for extra cost. 
  Brisket was SOOOOOOOOO good. It was shredded up and looks just like the pulled pork to the point that my bf and I were trying to figure out which was which from our photo.  I didn't like the pulled pork (lacked flavor and was dry) and the spare ribs were okay. 
  
 Sides:  Hush puppies (meh), Corn nuggests (THE DEALIO IS HERE), and kickin beans (yes!) 

 My bf thought this place was so legit, we went back 2 days later. I asked at the front where you order SHOWING the photo of my original Pit Special plate and asked him which meat was brisket and which one was pulled pork. We wanted to get it right, because one was substantially better tasting than the other. And, it was confusing, since they looked exactly the same shredded up together. He told me that the one that I had liked was brisket. 

 SO, I order the brisket.  What do I get?  Sliced meat. It didn't look like anything from the photo i had shown or what I had eaten 2 days prior.  Not only did it look different, but It wasn't as juicy and didn't have the same texture. 
  I found out from the server that the brisket comes in two styles (shredded or sliced). It would have been nice for the guy that took the order to specify it for me if that's the case.  AND, I don't know how he can get it wrong after seeing a photo. 

  Not to mention, I ordered corn nuggets (cuz that's why i came back 2 days later) and when the server arrived at our table with our food, that was when I found out that they were out of corn nuggets. I had paid additional money for this side. So, I ask this guy how long it'll take to make them (because I was willing to wait for it) and the waiter told me "several days."   
  My friend went there 2 hours later, and told me there were plenty corn nuggets. WTH dude. I woulda seriously waited 2 hours for my corn nuggets. Or come back in 2 hours for it. But I was told several days, and I was leaving the next day. 

  When you're a vegas native and can access a restaurant any day, probably these things don't matter. But, when you're a visitor, a foodie, and you pick a restaurant out of all the choices available, it's disappointing when you don't get what you ordered. 

  Next time I go, I shall ask for SHREDDED BRISKET. It's SHREDDED BRISKET versus a BRISKET, y'all!

The Beef ribs are awesome !! I had the combo-plate and still had food to take home.
This is where you can get a real meal and get the best deal for your money.

I love the clever menu like the BBQ Nacho Fries, BBQ Sundae, & the Outlaw Burger. 

The $8.99 Smokin Deals are a great value

I eat BBQ all over the U.S. during my travels. This was excellent!  Hand rubbed with great flavor. Not as spicy as Texas BBQ, but way better than the St. Louis and other sweet sauces.  The hush puppies were deep fried to a golden brown. The Jalapeño, cornbread and spices inside were the perfect blend of sweet, spicy and texture. 

I had the Trio of Brisket, BBQ spare ribs and pulled pork. All were melt in your mouth tender with the flavor profile you expect and desire for good BBQ. 

We will definitely be back!!!

Leave the Strip for this place, y'all. It's the real deal. Everything is delicious. The folks who run it are as genuine as they come. Don't let the fact that it's hidden underneath a freeway scare you away. Completely, 100% worth it.

The Best BBQ on the West Coast.. I cant tell  you how much this reminds be of HOME.. Make sure you talk to the staff they are amazing... I even met the Owner and he is a Cool Guy. Best BBQ Ever.. Order this late night and take it to the Rhino or take it home.. But order For your entire Family.. So GOOOD
Totally in love with the Spud-Tastic. A meal for days!  Yummy flavor and meat is perfectly cooked

Got a full slab of baby back ribs and it was very good.  Meat came off the bone effortlessly and the portion was large.  They were the biggest baby ribs I've ever had lol.  Their sauce has a good balance of tangy and spice to it.  The waffle fries were good and so was the kicken beans.  The peach cobbler wasn't very good.  I'll skip that next time.  Can't wait to go back when I'm in Vegas.  Great customer service.  I will be a regular here when I'm in town.

Great hole in the wall- just off the strip. Finally found a BBQ place in Vegas that is worth going to.  The pit special gives you the sampler of their BBQ. The Biggin is the best for the buck. Corn nugget is so yummy.

Don't expect fancy, just good BBQ at its best. Meat is smoked and not covered with someone's uncles sauce. You need not even put sayce on to get a great flavor treat. Hot links are thr bomb, spicy and in a natural casing. This BBQ is one of not the best I've had.
Been coming here since the early days and it never dissappoints. A must least once or twice everytime we're here. Rollin Smoke may actually be the reason I come to Vegas.

It's not bad. Honestly I just think its overhyped. Their brisket and mac & cheese would really be the only reason I'd go back. The atmosphere is really awesome no doubt, and the employees were awesome. But I think it'll be awhile before I come back again.
Really Good BBQ.  They re did their menu recently and their prices almost doubled. Save that crap for the strip and give us locals a break.  No wonder it is empty in here at lunch time.

Good for what you get. Prices went up on everything so the Value isnt as good as it use to be. It was incredible and the food quality is the same, but I think the concept before was awesome with the lower prices

It's been difficult for me to find a decent BBQ spot in Las Vegas...this place comes close, but it was just ok for me. I have been here a few times and they are always packed. I like the sauce and the service is decent.
A bit hard to find, but worth the chase for sure! Great sides and links. Sold out of brisket that's gotta be a good sign.

Best barbeque in Vegas, as far as I'm concerned! You'll see plenty of awards and accolades on their walls inside the (decidedly small) dining area, and you'll soon realize why they've earned them. It may be hard to find, but this place is worth the journey.

The most important thing I'd recommend is to go there on an odd day, like a tuesday or wednesday night, because on their busier peak periods the food isn't as fresh, I think they may just make huge batches of the common items and put them under heat lamps. If you go there for lunch you're guaranteed the freshest meats. And wow, are they worth it.

The meats are tender and flavorful, from the ribs that are soft and juicy, to the crisp snap of their spicy sausage. Their sides are to die for, particularly the loaded mashed potatoes and the baked beans. And you absolutely have to save room for dessert, their homemade banana pudding is a gift from the cosmos. It's simply unbelieveable. I'd recommend getting one of their multiple meat platters and sharing it, to get the full spectrum of what's on offer here.

My fellow lunch buddies and I were craving barbeque last week, but couldn't find seem to find a good spot. On our quest for barbeque, we found Rollin Smoke Barbeque. OMG this place is amazing and a hidden gem. Definitely off the beaten path, but well worth the drive. I had the Pulled Piggy Sandwich with Onion Rings and their Peach Cobbler. Their pulled pork was amazing. The meat was so soft & tender. Definitely going to recommend to anyone that's craving barbeque.
Its the BEST DAM BBQ in all of Las Vegas. Fresh tasty amazing!!! Service with a smile overtime! its worth the wait all day every day!!

Had a chance to stop at the Rolling Smoke BBQ in Las Vegas. It is located in an industrial part of town in an older strip mall. Once you get inside, the friendly staff, the great service, and the great food make it well worth the trip. As I only like pulled pork, I was pleasantly surprised by the pulled pork sandwich. It was moist and flavorful and very lean. The sides were also very good. The Chef came out of the kitchen to make sure everyone liked their food. If you are looking for good barbecue make this a stop  on your visit to Las Vegas.
the most AMAZING BBQ...chopped brisket, ribs, burnt ends, Mac & Cheese, loaded potato salad, and corn nuggets...you must try it!

I just ate some of the best barbeque in Las Vegas or anywhere else.  I had the 2-meat platter with an extra side: I picked pulled brisket, spare ribs, mac n' cheese, and loaded mashed potatoes.  Everything was AMAZING.  The brisket was rich, tasty and melt-in-my-mouth, with some interesting hints of sweetness in there: I did add some Arkansauce, which added punch to the flavor.  The ribs (there were supposed to be 2, but there were 3; maybe because I was a first-timer; recommended by the countergirl) needed nothing.  Best ribs I've had, anywhere.  Charred a bit on the outside (with the smoky-salty rub cooked right into the surface of the meat), tender on the inside, came off the bones with little effort.  Loaded mashed potatoes had good flavor to start with; bacon and green onions just added to the richness.  Mac n' cheese was richly cheesy.

Better than the food was the attention (I came in between lunch and dinner rushes, so 3 other diners and me had the place to ourselves).  I got visited during my meal by the countergirl, the dining room attendant, the manager, and the chef/smokemaster-in-chief.  I didn't have much to say to them, except that I was beyond words at how GOOD everything was.  The boss man was so happy to hear that, that he had a small dessert sent out for me - so I can also tell you that the blueberry cobbler a la mode (he asked what I'd like, and I asked the dining room attendant to surprise me; great choice, dude!) is also fantastic - sweet and just enough tart and tangy.  This was my belated birthday treat to myself, so that was a perfect ending!

The dining room is simple - benches and trestle tables - cheerful and fastidiously clean.  A great oasis from a rare rainy Vegas day.

Do note: Vegas locals get 10% off our bills when we show locals' ID.

This is real, local, down-home barbeque at its best.  The friendliness, flavor and authenticity can't be beat by any of the chains.  If you haven't had Rollin Smoke yet, you haven't experienced the rich, off-Strip local foodie scene in Las Vegas.

The best BBQ in Vegas! Had the best BBQ pork sandwich, best hot Link, best fries, and best corn bread I've ever had in Vegas. Very good quality ingredients, expertly cooked, and reasonably priced. Im a regular Texas visitor too, and this still beats any BBQ I've found in SE Texas!!

Went there for the first time last night. Coming from a local that's tried a few amazing BBQ restaurants in town, this is definitely #1. The owner dusty was awesome and came around talking to all his customers. I will be returning!!

OMG legit!  Went here tonight with a coworker from Texas, so she knows good BBQ and this was good!  Can't wait to go back before I head back home!  We tried the plate with all five meats plus sides. The baked beans were amazing!

Best BBQ I've had so far in the city! Came here for lunch and had the rib platter. So much food I had to take some home. Beef rib was huge, pork ribs meat fell off the bone. Didn't even get a chance to dig into the brisket! Will be back again for sure. Wirth the drive!

The BBQ is absolutely fantastic here! I had the brisket sandwich and cornbread and it was amazing. When my friend ordered their famous burger and they ran out of it, they took care of him and made him something extra special. I would definitely come back here.

I'm not happy being a nay-sayer, but neither hubby or I enjoyed Rollin Smoke.  We were feeling a yen for BBQ after seeing Lyle Lovett & His Big Band over at the Smith Center, so I Yelp-ed Barbecue and the rave reviews for Rollin Smoke made our choice easy.  We arrived a little after 10pm and were told that they were out of meatloaf, yams, cornish hen, burnt ends, and beef ribs.  Since they advertise that they're open until midnight, I thought this was rather extensive a list of food to be out of.  We ordered a combo plate of brisket, chicken, hot links, pulled pork and pork ribs, along with sides of cole slaw, corn bread and corn fritters.  Hubby had the brisket and chicken, neither of which filled him up... kinda small portions of both.  My ribs were tough - not fall off of the bone tender at all.  The pulled pork and links were both OK, not anything special.  The highlight, in my opinion, was the corn bread.  I'd go back for more of that... it almost tasted like it had a coating of honey butter, which was delish.  Hence, the 2 stars.

While driving around my girlfriend and I were looking for a place to eat prior to departing Vegas. She came across this place on Yelp. I'm always down for some good BBQ as she is too so we gave it a go!! As I also looked at the pictures and the comments on Yelp my expectations of this place grew. We pulled Into the parking lot and could smell the aroma of the wood and meat cooking, very promising. We ordered the three way brisket, BBQ nacho fries with pulled pork, and the rack of St Louis spare ribs. The St Louis spare ribs we such a disappointment. They were over smoked and tasted as if the meat had went bad. The brisket was good not great but good and the BBQ nachos were ok as well. But I'm writing this only because I was highly disappointed in the St Louis spare ribs, also I did not find any of their BBQ sauce to my liking!!! Since I did not like the ribs and we had left overs; we brought them home for our kids to try, the 14 year old said, " Your ribs are better!" The 9 year old spit hers out!!!!! 


I would say try it out and make your own opinion!!!

Good ol' southern style smoked meat!  All the owners are friendly and not afraid to come out of the kitchen to say hello and see how we were doing.  If you're looking for some good smoked meat...this is your place!

I met up with a few Yelpers on the day that Travel Channel's Food Paradise was filming here. We were too late for our 15 seconds of fame, but the film crew was still there and it was neat watching them work. It was also not as crowded as I had expected, so it was quick to order and many tables available. The food took a bit longer to come out, but I believe that's standard.

I ordered the "Duo Choice of Two Meats" Smokin Plate with Hot Link and 2 Spare Ribs (other meat choices are brisket, pork, or 1/4 chicken), Waffle Fries (there are 16 choices of Smokin Sides), and a drink for $10.99. The sausage or hot link was really tasty and they're not messing around with the heat! If you can't handle spicy food, watch out. I enjoyed the ribs as well, especially with their BBQ sauce. I definitely could've eaten more! I liked their offerings of sweetened and unsweetened iced tea as I mixed the two and had a nice balance.

We tried a couple cobblers, banana pudding, and the special Reese's PB bread pudding. The cobblers were all right and the banana pudding was decent. The bread pudding was off the hook though! Really good!

I think one of the best parts of their menu is the AYCE option for $24.99. It's offered all day, every day and has no restrictions (except no sharing or to-go, obviously). It's a ridiculous deal for meat! If I can get a few people together, I think that it would be a cool option to order all the types of meat and sides for everyone.

I first had Bbq for here several years ago at a catered event. The food was delicious. 
Recently I placed a take out order. The guy on. The phone was very pleasant but he forgot to add a few things to my order. I wasn't charged so it wasnt a big deal. 

hey are always out of the beef ribs. I've heard they are delicious. Hopefully one day I'll get to try them. 

Bbw chicken. It's not a whole chicken. It's 8 separate pieces. Very tasty and moist. 

They were also out of the baked potato the night we ordered 

Brisket.  I ordered 2 lbs to make up for the lack of beef ribs. The brisket was dry and had a very bad after taste that made it taste like old meat that had been. I tried to mask it with the delicious sauce but I couldn't. It wasn't the smoke flavor. It just tasted like old meat that should have been thrown out. 
The brisket has a very light smoke ring. Little to no bark. It was definitely not winning any awards. 

The sides were all ok. Nothing is ever crave but decent. 

I asked them for a variety of sauces but they only included one type. 

I'd go back but only because I'm still want to try the ribs.   The brisket was one of the worst I've ever had.  (Two pounds ended up in the trash). The chicken was good but over priced in my opinion.

We had read about the great BBQ here on yelp and was anxious to try it.  Unfortunately, our experience was not good.  My daughter ordered the sample platter.  The ribs were very pink and she was afraid to eat it.  The brisket had black charcoal all over it and again refused to eat it.  Her boyfriend decided to eat the ribs.  The next day he was sick and we are guessing it might have been the food.  The seating leaves something to be desired.  I can handle not so fancy seating for some good barbeque.  We sat at picnic tables and unfortunately my back was to where people line up to order.  Several times I got hit in the back by people's arms, purses etc.  People breathing down your back and gawking at what you are eating.  Go to Dave's Barbeque for a better meal.  The bread pudding was good though.

Killer spot. Sketchy looking location at night; but don't let that fool you, the food is legit. My wife and I both went to school in the south and always love when we find good bbq, and this place is top notch. 

The burnt ends are amazing. Excellent smoke flavor, excellent rub on the ribs. Just a solid bbq joint that delivers (consistently if you read the reviews). 

Good work guys!

Got The Pit Special for the two of us to share. More than enough for the two of us and a bunch of meat leftover. Brisket was my favorite. He liked the pork ribs. Ordered corn nuggets on the side...so delicious! We would definitely come back.

The best BBQ spot in Vegas! Too bad it is only one location.  

Got a full rack of beef ribs for delivery.  I could taste smokiness through the sauce and meat was tender.  Normally I prefer my beef ribs woth dry rub and no sauce but I didnt order that way since it is my first time and I fear it too be too dry (been burned by other BBQ joints this way) but i would imagine it wouldve been great and will order this way next time.  

This place is a gem and highly recommended.

The food here is amazing! For $13.99 you get 2 choices of meat, a side, and some bread. The meat is super tender and has great taste. There isn't a side that isn't good. I especially love the green beans. 
The customer service is always awesome. The pit guy was super friendly and chatted with us for a few mins after checking to see how we were doing. The manager even brought my 2 yr old a banana pudding "because he gave him a high five".  
This place is just overall awesome and worth the trip off the strip.

Best Barbeque I've ever had. Extremely friendly staff, highlight of our Vegas trip. The meat fell of the rib bone, the pulled pork melted in our mouths. We thanked one of the owners for the great experience and she brought us out a free dessert and refused to take our money for it, really feels like a family run business. Very casual atmosphere, a nice change of pace in Vegas from the pricier restaurants on the strip.

We recently read yet another article giving Rollin Smoke a great review so we had to try it. I rarely give anything five stars but here I have no choice. I have eaten BBQ in many major cities and several states and this is as good as I've ever had. We shared a big dinner that included ribs, chopped brisket, burnt ends, potato salad, beans, and mac & cheese. Every item and I do mean every one, was as good as I have ever eaten anywhere, any time. It was somewhat heavy and greasy but hey, it's BBQ! If this were health food I'd have it 3 times a week...as it is, I will probably go there once every month or two and be happy. If you like BBQ you MUST try this place.
Still searching for that "BEST" bbq joint. I think i've come to the conclusion im just not a big BBQ guy. For what it is though, Rollin Smoke BBQ was good

We were looking for a BBQ JOINT because it was just one of those days. I got the Brisket, pork ribs, BBQ chicken and bacon potato salad plate! Boy that was very fulfilling and tasty.. My other half got the pulled pork sand which and that was yummy as well. After we finished our meal I went ahead and tried the "banana pudding" it put me into a coma it was so good lol! By far one of the best BBQ Houses in Vegas... Must try if you have one of those days were you just want some old fashion ribs and meat :)

Rough looking neighborhood, odd order taking arrangement, side order mix-ups but tasty BBQ, "homey" hospitality and lower prices makes this a real find. Far from classy but some of the best ribs, chicken, fried okra and kick'in beans a person can eat!

Brought back 2 bags of this stuff on the airplane home. I was getting dirty looks on my flight back because all 250 of them could smell the smoked chicken, brisket, ribs, corn bread and Mac n cheese.....

I wanted to scout a place off strip as I do with all my trips to bring back some good local food home. Something which isn't available in the DC area. BBQ, no good or even average places in/near DC. So once I heard about this place being featured on Travel Channel and highly rated on Yelp I decided this is it. I got about everything on the menu from meatloaf to brisket and dirty rice to baked beans.

The brisket was wonderful but it definitely needs the sauce which they provide. The chicken is the best I've had. Forget about Peruvian chicken.... Even the best Peruvian chicken in DC can't hold its own. The beef rib was a dry rub which was also moist and had a nice kick. The meatloaf was wow, all meat. The dirty rice was spicy and the Mac and cheese was epic. The corn bread was fantastic too. Definitely do yourself a favor, step off that tourist trap (the strip) and give this place a go!!

Went here with my father today and the barbecue was so tender and juicy. We shared the $19.99 deal where you can pick 4 different meats and 3 different sides! It was a great value and we had a lot of leftovers. Definitely recommend the brisket as a meat. It was very tender. For sides, the beans were great as well. The fried onions were very crispy and flavorful, but I couldn't eat that many as it is fried. Super delicious!

Dammnnnn Good for sure! EVERYTHING is sooo good.  We had the four meat and three side meal my goodness.  The brisket, ribs, pulled pork, and chicken made me want to slap my mama.  The sides were superb as well.. Not yo mama's potato salad and corn nuggets. We will be local frequents from here on out.  I am kicking myself that I just found out about this joint.  A must try for certain.
Best meal we had in Vegas.  Wish we had this back home.  Loved, loved, loved every bite.  Don't let location scare you away.  Police officers were eating there when we left.

I love Yelp... I found this hidden jewel because of Yelp.  It is tucked away. I love BBQ.  This place was outstanding. The food is authentic and very tasty. I had the Biggin sandwich which had brisket, pulled pork and sausage for $8.99.  The sandwich was large and sooo good.  It was full of meat.  The meat is very smokey and tender.  I was very surprised about the size of the sandwich for the price.
Fantastic food. Beef rib was a giant smoked short rib that I could cut with a fork. I'll have to go back.
My family is originally from Kansas City and Memphis.  This is the best BBQ, we've had this side of the USA.  We will definitely return the next time that we are back in the area.

This place seems to be a hole in the wall, stuffed off of highland drive and in mixed used businesses.  I didn't know what I was expecting, I had seen some reviews and the pictures looked mouth watering, so when we arrived, I was still a bit unsure.  But once I walked in side and was greeted with a friendly southern howdy, and smelled the sweet scents coming from the kitchen, all my reservations left me!

I took a good look at the menu and decided I'd try the beef brisket sandwich and a side of the bacon potato salad.  The brisket was lean, moist, very smokey and I loved it.  The side, bacon potato salad, I love bacon, but not a fan.  I don't usually go for the potato salad anyway, but the bacon made me want to try, but I didn't love it!

Overall, a great addition to the BBQ scene for Las Vegas, will be one to come back too!

Yum yum yum. This was the best BBQ I've had. My husband had the beef ribs. They were enormous, I had no idea you could get super sized beef ribs like that. I tried a small bite and you can taste the smoked flavor. I had the pork ribs and they were falling off the bone delicious. I also had the jalapeño coleslaw. There was a little spice but not too much it was just right. 

Defiantly a hidden gem. Great service and very fast. We are hooked.
I'm from LA and I'm coming to this place every time I go to Vegas.  This place is awesome.  Try their bake potato "fabulous!"

I almost feel bad giving this place only 3 stars, but they just don't get me there!  However, at their price point, I can't say that I'm sad that they don't.  I've said before, "Nobody's ribs are better than my grandma's!"; a true southern Virginia cook.  
I've been here 3 times with my husband who loves their food so much, that he wanted it for his birthday dinner.  I'm just not a fan having tried baby back, beef & pork spare ribs, pulled pork, chicken wings, catfish (which were thin and not meaty), waffle fries, Mac & Cheese, greens, yams & the peach cobbler á la mode.... so, I have given them a fair shake.  I grew up on dumps and dives which I'd love to find one in Vegas that I can fall in love with.  Rollin Smoke BBQ just isn't it.

Hands down this is the best BBQ in Las Vegas.  It may take a bit of effort to find the spot, but it is so worth it.  Simple stated, the BEEF RIB.  You can get the combo plate with all different types of ribs, but the BEEF RIB will be something you can't forget.  Truly amazing BBQ smokey flavor that falls right off the bone.    The restaurant itself is just plane benches, so don't be expecting anything fancy (most good BBQ joints aren't).  This is certainly a BBQ joint.  If you want good food, good flavor, good value (even if it is a bit on the higher side for lunch fare), this is certainly a treat.

This place was incredible!!! I like my BBQ with the sauce on the side so that I can taste the meat. The brisket was tasty, the pulled pork was great, and the ribs were outstanding. I saw an AYCE anything of the menu for $24.95. That could be dangerous for me....
Always great food. If your short on money wait till you can afford it. Bit on the expensive side but we'll worth it.

My first time here, by far the BEST BBQ I've eaten. Rolling Smoke is now my Vegas go to spot when I'm in town, going to hit it up before I hit the road back to Cali. This is a must for any one in Vegas! The bomb.com just how my 3yr said even she knows good BBQ.  My lady, daughter, and I had the pit special 4 meats pulled pork, ribs, chicken, and brisket with 3 sides coleslaw, Mac and cheese, and mashed potatoes man it was good all for twenty five dollars even better!!

One word:  Legit.

Being a southerner at heart and also from the DC area - this place is as close as I'm going to get to some straight up dirty BBQ in Vegas.  I would go to this place just to smell the beautiful, and oh so addictive smells and then head off on my merry way.  Mmmmhmmm.

I have to mention the cornbread right away.  No BBQ joint would be official without some fresh cornbread.  They've got it right and tight!  So right, that I ordered a ton of extra to-go for a party I was attending later in the night.  Even more right, that I asked for a sample while ordering..  Sad, but very true.

With all the smells, I was a little overwhelmed on what to order.  I had my sides figured out, but my main plate was hard to pinpoint.  I was experiencing one of those "eyes are bigger than your stomach" moments..  Oh wells.  After jostling the idea of ribs around for a few, I kept it real and went with the Beef Brisket.  Ribs are tricky and I'm incredibly picky, so I needed to start slow.  :)  No regrets there.  Flavorful and plenty to eat for leftovers.  They offer a few selections on the amount of grub you order, which was neat in my book.  Now, back to the ribs...  They have a variety to choose from cooked according to whatever region in the states.  Loved that!   Next trip:  RIBS!

As far as sides go, I was also a little overwhelmed in this department as well.   Never overwhelmed in a bad way.  I went all out with the fattiest of the bunch and had the Mac 'n' Cheese, Loaded Mash Potatoes and the Bacon Potato Salad.  Yes, BACON.  POTATO.  SALAD.  #WINNING!

The service was friendly and they even complimented me on being so small but yet ordering so much.  "Is this all for you?"  "Hell yeah it is.. C'mon now!"  

Coolest part about this joint (other than the food, of course):  They deliver AND offer party packages where they'll actually wheel their smoker to your party and hook....you....up!   Whaaaaa?! 

Rollin Smoke has my foodie heart forevs!  

**This is a popular joint, which means.. lines, lines, lines.  Try to skip the food rush and go during a slower time of the day!  Don't get me wrong though, the long lines are worth it in the end.
Found this place on accident last year and thought I'd bring my friends from California. We all enjoyed the food! Again...be back soon

Great food nice clean place! No real BBQ in Vegas and this place is it, let me tell you! Even got a chance to chat with the Owner and the PItmaster! They are both VERY proud of what they do and obviously use the best meats and veggies! FYI get the BBQ meatloaf! Friggin awesome!
One of our new favorite haunts. Great BBQ with generous portions. The Pit Special is plenty to split with a friend.

I've been coming to RS for two years, but I'm finally done.

They unquestionably have some of the best BBQ I've ever had. So, if that's all you care about, read no further.

However, on Wednesday I ordered a five meat platter for my wife & I for our thanksgiving, along with a half chicken. The total was around $45.

I was asked if I wanted some sauce with my order...

Well, yeah, of course I do: 'I'll take a little of each," I said. 

Not only did RS charge me extra for the three sauces, they were half full. I was able to use them on my pulled pork & chopped brisket. However, my chicken, hot links & ribs went without -- essentially wasted.

Now, not only did RS charge me for sauce without telling me, NONE of the three small containers were complimentary. They gave me zero sauce on a $45 order. An order I intended to use for my Thanksgiving meal. That's a 1/4 chicken, a 1/2 chicken, pulled pork, brisket, and hot links with zero sauce included. 

Unfortunately, with no sauce, I scrapped those plans and went to Bachanal at Caesars.

I have one issue and one issue only with RS: they do not care about their customers. They do great business, they are always busy and they clearly take that for granted. Their prices are already astronomically high, but to not include sauce (and when you do, you charge without telling, and still come up short) is just bad business. It goes beyond just being 'cheap'; it's a slap in the face.

I support people who appreciate their customers, and I hope you all do as well. If we continue to reward poor service/standards, then what incentives do poorly run establishments have to improve?

I'm very happy to see the influx of quality BBQ popping up around Henderson. Now, I won't have to make the drive to RS for my favorite meal. Even if the quality is a little less, I'll sleep easy knowing I didn't perpetuate poor business. It's a shame because I've brought many folks to RS over the years, and we've generally had good experiences, but when you so blatantly ruin an important meal of mine, I can never forget that. 

Rollin Smoke is clearly making money. They've raised their prices by at least 25% in two years . Yet, they're too cheap, or they care too little, to complete their meals. 

Visit at your own risk.

Let me just say two words "Corn Nuggets". Darn tasty and I'm sure good or you since they are deep fried nuggets of cream corn heaven. This is my maybe 10th time here. My favorite is the pork and the hot links plus the corn nuggets of course. The service is always fast and friendly. The place is always CLEAN and I've never had a bad or even a mediocre meal here yet. Interesting neighborhood but well worth the trip for the food.

Hands down the best BBQ I have ever had!! I did the all you can eat so I could try a little bit of everything. They don't give you a "little" of anything!! The beef rib was the star of the show!! In my experiences with BBQ, the beef rib is kinda the red headed stepchild, not here! I highly recommend this place! Off the beaten path, just the way I like it!!

Have been here three times two of the three times my order has been messed up.  Tonight being one of the mess ups in my order I ordered half of slap of spare ribs only got four rids and what I did get was all dried out like eating the bottom of my shoe.  Will go else where next time.

I know I know. I'm like the last one to eat here. It's been on my list for a long time and I finally made it down here to see what the hype is all about and I can honestly say the hype is real. I mean you can smell the smoke all throughout the restaurant and all the way outside. We came on a Friday night and it wasn't packed but there were people coming and going the entire time. Me and the boyfriend decided to share a 4 meat combo with three sides which is a really good deal for 19.99. You can sample almost all the meats the have to offer. Almost not all. We chose hot links, pulled pork, spare ribs and brisket. Choosing sides I couldn't decide so quick and they were more than happy to let me sample both the fried okra and the corn nuggets. Easy winner there the corn nuggets are so fricking delicious! Sweet cream corn inside fried crispy with almost a beer batter exterior. The BOMB! We seated ourselves and the food came out not too much longer after. My favorite has to be the ribs. Fall apart tender and just the right amount of smoke. The brisket could have been more tender and the pulled pork was lacking in smoky flavor but still very good. I'm not a fan of hot links but these were pretty good. The greens were delicious and tender and the mac and cheese was very creamy. I prefer a less creamy mac and cheese but it was still good. My favorite were those corn nuggets. I could eat those all day but I don't think that would be a good idea. I asked for some chipotle dipping sauce and it was the perfect condiment. Sweet corn nuggets with a spicy smoky dipping sauce. I guess we were still hungry because. My boyfriend ordered more pulled pork and ribs with greens of course since I had the Mac and cheese. Service was great they called us by name the entire time and were super nice. The food is legit I just wish they had a better location.

First of all, I am not a connoisseur of barbecue, so don't take this too seriously. I got a small order of ribs and they were good, but not out of this world, and I thought expensive. I believe I paid $16 for 3-4 ribs and a drink. The place is very crowded and you wait in line to order. I went there with friends who wanted to try it. Everyone was satisfied with their meals, but no one was, like, over the moon. If you are a rib fanatic, this might be the place for you, but otherwise I wouldn't go out of my way.

This is some of the best food I've had in a while.  We stopped here after my boo wanted bbq! They did not disappoint.  The greens, mac n cheese, the corn nuggets and brisket are allll awesome. I will be recommending this place for sure. And the staff was super friendly. Dave told us the food speaks for itself and it did!!
Simply the best!!!  I have had a lot off the menu and have not been disappointed. Anyone and everyone that I know is craving BBQ, I bring them here! Oh and my kids love their stickers!
Great BBQ! The ribs were probably my favorite but the brisket and chicken were great too.

Wasn't impressed at all. Over priced bbq and apparently enough people keep going back for them to stay in business. Bbq had not much flavor either and forget about asking to get cornbread with your meal like most southern dishes already come with, they will tell you it comes with white bread that costs .25 so they can't substitute it. Lol amazing Save your money and go away from the strip to Road kill grill. Better food and prices!

お店に入る前からバーベキューソースの香りがしてきて食欲をそそられます。
Best Vegasに選ばれたハンバーガーを注文。
来てみてビックリ( _) ﾊﾟﾁｸﾘ｡
大きい...。
完食は1人じゃ無理、2人でも難しいかも。
大量のオニオンフライと紫キャベツの酢漬けからハンバーグをほじくり出します
ハンバーグはジューシーだし、バーベキューソースもバンズも美味しい(*´`*)
大きすぎて完食は出来ませんでしたが持ち帰り、ホテルで完食しました。

Hot damn!! Really good BBQ!! Get in there!! Brisket was too good!! Love that Mac n cheese too!! Off the strip, but sooo fricken good!!! Well worth the trip!!!
Going back for more the 2nd night

Went to this BBQ joint because another restaurant had an hour wait. Much to our surprise this place surpassed all of our expectations and this will be a must see slot every time we come to vegas!!! The staff is super friendly and the food was insane!!!

I heard about this place on one of those dive restaurant shows, and it was delicious bbq. And yes the outside looks pretty rough, but the staff was excellent and the food was amazing. I did the brisket and the corn nuggets. I will be back again!!!

After reading through the talk threads I kept seeing Rollin Smoke. I was convinced its time for some BBQ. As always there is a nice crowd inside and it's hard to get a table at times. We were luck to grab a seat in the side room. My wife and I split the 4 meat 3 side combo. We had the pulled pork, brisket and double spare ribs. Sides were hush puppies, mac & cheese and mashed potatoes.the brisket was good but I enjoyed the pork and ribs mostly. Great smoke taste and I add a bit of the BBQ sauce for extra flavor. All the sides where great. Mac and cheese and hush puppies are where it's at! A bit small in here but great food!

My boyfriend and I came here after we saw this place on the Travel Channel. I was very skeptical because its Las Vegas and its barbecue and those two words do not usually go in the same sentence, boy was I wrong. The food was amazing. I had the smoked meatloaf topped with fried onion strings, on top of a bed of pillowy soft mashed potatoes. My boyfriend had a plate of protein ( I forgot the actual name, but the plate came with beef brisket, chicken, ribs and waffle fries). The brisket was okay, but the chicken was fantastic and I do not really care for ribs. I would definitely come back.

Wanted to try a bbq while in Vegas. I used to go to Ellis Island but this place is soo much better and probably a better deal.
We got there no problem with the GPS. I was worried that the place would be crowded since I was dinner time but we just beat the rush. 
The plan was to order the "pit special" 4 meats and 3 sides. We got burnt ends, pulled pork, quarter chicken, spare ribs, one beef rib, corn nuggets, loaded smashed potato and bacon potato salad.
Everything came out in about 3 minutes which was great since I was starving. The burnt ends were delicious the pulled pork a little dry, the chicken breast was moist since most times chicken breast is dry. I tried the spare ribs and my was I surprised they were the best tasting spare rib I ever had. Great smoke and tender. Not hanging off the bone but still on and but so tender and flavorful and it came off the bone with a bite. The beef rib for me was no disappointment either. Big moist and the same as the pork ribs. They were a little fat but that's the way I like them. Probably too fat for some but that is where the flavor is.
Corn nuggets were good and the other sides were average.
I would definitely be back next time in town.

I BELIEVE!!! I BELIEVE!!! My first visit here, I was very impressed with their B.B.Q. My second visit, I was totally blown away!

I finally got the fellas at work to come here. I've been here before but did not have the honor to try their BRONTOSAURUS RIBS. The pictures left by some honorable Yelpers caught my gut. HOLY BAJAYZUZ!!! They are "DAMN GOOD!!!" The pictures of course do not do it justice. I get my combo. $13 well spent. This is all you really need if you're a beef rib connoisseur. They give you two Gangster Sized Ribs, a side (mine was the bacon potato salad), a slider bun, and a tasty cool beverage to wash it all down with on tap. The best DAMN BEEF RIBS I've ever had! They were freaken GIANORMOUS!!! Fall off the bone tender. I easily cut them off the bone and it looked like I had two big steaks. I cut off one nice slice and made a rib slider with the bun. I usually don't have trouble finishing my ribs, but these were like BRONTOSAURUS RIBS off of the Flintstones! FOR REALLY DOE!!!

Great service, great place to sit your phat @$$ to chow down, and AMAZING B.B.Q. Rollin Smoke B.B.Q. is blowing up. Keep up the great work guys!!! Will be back soon. I've been looking for a new go-to place for B.B.Q. I think I found my home.

EYE LIKA CHU PEOPLES!!!

I wouldn't want to come here during busy lunch time, because I don't think there's enough parking. 
Anyone who knows BBQ knows it ain't cheap, so don't come here looking for a six dollar meal. However the duo meal is affordable (two meats, a side and a drink with slice of bread) for about 11 bucks.
Limited seating so u may have to take ur meal to go during busy times. Fashion show mall is nearby so go eat there and cool off with their air conditioner.
The BBQ Sauce is the star of the meal here. It's on the tangy side and there is a bottle of it at your table so u can add as much or as little as u like.
The place is clean and the staff is very friendly.
Note* not the best accommodations for wheel chairs. I witnessed a patron struggling to fit in through tight spaces .

This place was awesome! My girlfriend and I just got back from a trip to Texas, where we had our share of BBQ.  I was still in the mood for more when we got back to Vegas, and we found this place on Yelp.  The spudtastic was A MAZ ing!  Loaded with pulled pork (my g/f got brisket on hers and loved it too), shredded cheddar, sour cream and onions.  I actually ordered the $24.99 all-you-can-eat.  I couldn't believe it at first, but it really was as much of anything on the menu as you can eat, as long as you eat what you order.  Awesome deal!  My only regret - not going with a bigger appetite because I was too full to try the desserts.  We'll definitely be going back for more baby ribs, more potato salad, more spuds and dessert...OH, and the meatloaf was great (and I'm not a meatloaf person)!  Thanks to the guys at Rollin Smoke!

Ok, so the food here is OUT OF THIS WORLD! Like, knock you on your a** good. You will want to slip into a food coma afterwards. The location is sketchy. In a bad area of you ask me, but if you take a moment to pretend that you aren't surrounded by a buffet of run down strip clubs the food is honestly worth the risk of possibly getting mugged. Seriously.

Unreal how amazing this place is. Best barbecue I have ever had in my life. My wife agrees. 

EVERYTHING on the menu is so amazing! You just can't go wrong.

I have personally been here twice.....my husband and his friend more than that and every time he is anywhere near the place! It is bar none the best barbeque I have EVER HAD!!! The cook, the staff, everyone super friendly and everything I've eaten is to die for!!!
Very good barbecue place. I had the outlaw burger and it is one of my top three burgers I have ever had! Have recommended this place to the numerous friends visiting Vegas!

We pickup parts next door to Rollin Smoke BBQ so this is a very convient place for us to eat. They also have sweet tea which helps on a hot summer day.
Try the chicken sandwich with Mac n cheese. It cannot be beat

Hands down ... best barbecue I've had so far!  Lucille's and Famous Dave's are delicious but do not even come close to this place.  You won't find the "dining experience" here that you would find at those other places which have that certain 'manufactured' feel.  I'm in no ways putting Lucille's or Dave's down because they are still good.  However, Rollin Smoke gives you plenty of delicious food at a very reasonable price.  Oh my gosh, the brisket was so full of flavor.  My friend shared one of his beef ribs with me and I just cannot desribe how heavenly it felt sinking my teeth into it. haha.  My only regret was feeling like crap after a sleepless night and with a hangover ... after all it is Vegas LOL.  I really wanted to come here again on my last Vegas trip but too bad I was sick.  

I came here solely based on awesome Yelp reviews.

Great food!!!!  OMG it is so nice to find a restaurant that serves a good barbecue ribs and the briskets is to die for!!  Amazing amazing delizzz barbecue food!!! Im sooo glad my kid brought me there.

We went there last night and the meat is as good as it gets. Just delicious. Had the Rib Plate special. Huge meaty beef ribs, baby backs and St Louis ribs that fell off the bone and melted in your mouth. Deep rich smoke flavor with a crisp flavorful dry rub. The house BBQ sauce is excellent. Not too sweet and complimented the meat. Great spot!!!!

I came across this place when I was in Vegas for 4th of July weekend. OMG! words can't express how good there food was. The guy helping us behind the counter was great. Me and my husband didn't know what to pick, there was way to many good choices. The guy asked us simple questions like "do you like spicy food, do you eat pork & how hungry are you". He ordered us so many different delicious things that me and my husband couldn't finish it. Even tho there's no hostess you can ask for a tray for your leftovers so that was a plus being that it was a bit pricey (Free refills on soft drinks). Seating is first come or whatever is available there is an outside area to eat as well. GREAT STAFF, GREAT GOOD!

Just got the pit special which is a variety of meats. The BBQ is really spectacular. They updated the inside entrance area and it looks so much better. Saw the picture of the BBQ nacho fries and had to try. Was a giant mound of meat, gooey cheese, sour cream, beans, and waffle fries. The entire thing must have weighed 2 pounds. It was quantity over quality because it so lacked flavor. I got half way through and stopped because I was bored.

Dam good! Nice casual place outside the strip. Lots of accolades from travel channel. We had piggy pulled pork sandwich with corn nuggets. It was delicious and make sure you pay extra for the too damn hot sauce. We also got half the pork baby rack ribs which was delicious and solid. It didn't come with any sides so if you want to balance with some vegeys would be good. Generous portions.

Best BBQ in Vegas!

I tried the brisket last time I was in Vegas, quite incredible. Will be going back next time, I'd rather eat here over any buffet any day!

This is the best bbq joint ever. If your in Vegas you have to check this place out. Food is amazing and the employees take in their job and food seriously. Employees are so nice. I will keep coming back
The food here is phenomenal. Rarely do you see a barbecue restaurant that has great ribs with great sides. You definitely have the support of this Henderson native family

Guess whose back ?
back again 
Biggies back to see
My rolling smoke friends !
Always a great experience 
Meat loaf to die for !

What up Dusty !!!!!!

Went here simply because we are huge BBQ fans and with all the good reviews we had to check it out. I have to say, I wasn't that thrilled and it may be because of what we order, which was 2 sandwiches - 1 beef brisket and 1 smoked chicken. The beef brisket was very greasy and lacked seasoning this came with waffle fries which were okay- nothing special. The chicken was nice, well seasoned but they were a bit skimpy on the portion and I got a side salad with mine that came with a vinaigrette that was very spicy and certainly not a traditional salad vinaigrette. Overall, good service and decent food but nothing wild.

Anything you get here will be amazing!
Great service! And very quick! You will leave extremely satisfied!!!

Vegas might finally realize good BBQ is a necessity!  This place has really good BBQ and generous portions.  We tried a bit of everything - beef ribs, St. Louis ribs, babybacks, chopped and sliced brisket, burnt ends, pulled pork and chicken.  All moist, tender and delicious.  The corn nuggets and bacon potato salad were excellent.  I'm a bit on the fence over the different BBQ sauces.  They were tasty, not bad...just different.  Inside and outside seating.  We got there very early and had no wait, but the lines quickly fill up.  I'll be back when we're in Vegas.

Adding my unqualified 5 stars to a great bbq joint with a 4 1/2 star average based on nearly 1600 reviews is probably an unnecessary form of piling on.  To the extent it may add a little sizzle to the bbq fire, I've judged a lot of KCBS sanctioned bbq contests over the years, and I can state without hesitation that this is terrific bbq.  5 star all the way.

I had the pleasure of meeting Chef Will while I was there, and told him I thought he was definitely an expert bbq chef, and that his work rivaled the best of the best bbq places in the country.  Interestingly, one of my favorite dishes from Chef Will was the beef ribs, something that is never part of a genuine bbq competition.  The beef ribs were amazingly tender, with just the right amount of beefy, smokey flavor, and exactly the appropriate texture for easy biting and enjoying.  My son and I chose to take advantage of RS's amazing bargain - $35 for any amount of any items on the menu.  What a great way to sample everything.

We arrived at RS before its 10 am opening, and we were not the first in line.  This place has definitely been discovered, yet it deserves all of the new reviews it receives.  The ribs are perfectly cooked, the brisket is tender, juicy, and has just the right amount of smoke and meat flavor, the sides and desserts are absolutely terrific.  And yes, the corn nuggets are in a class by themselves.  Wow, are they special and addictive.  If that recipe ever gets out, it could be the beginning of world peace.

Even Brenda, behind the counter, was as helpful and nice as could be.  She made us feel right at home, helped us with our choices, explained the system for ordering and receiving the delicious dishes, and generally conveyed an honest, feel-good vibe.  I highly recommend Rollin Smoke for BBQ that should be on anyone's list of the top BBQ restaurants in the country.
Hidden gem in vegas! This is the original spot on industrial road and it never disappoints. Great service, great staff & DELICIOUS BBQ!!  So good!! We are frequent customers.

OMG what a great place to enjoy good quality meat. We went there after a long walk up and down the strip. I was starving so I decided to order the "outlaw" burger while my companion went for a pulled pork "sandwich". The sandwich turned out to be a burger with lots of pork, home made sauce and coleslaw. My burger was a gigantic tower with a heavy meat patty, lettuce, tomatoe, pickles and onion rings. It was impossible to eat it without taking it apart. The meat was fantastic and all the ingredients were wisely chosen and harmonized well. It is the best and farmost the cheapest burger I got so far.
Though I'm not a big fan of the sauces. The food is really good and it's priced right

I had a chance to stop by this, coming off the Strip. I just thought it was OK only because I have had so much better. The hot links and brisket were good. The spareribs had some kind of weird greasy coating on them. I couldn't figure out what it was but it was like a layer of butter but I think it was just fat. The macaroni wasn't bad and at least was cheesy. I didn't care for the person who took my order. Since it was my first time, I didn't order fast enough. So while she was waiting (and it wasn't that long), she annoyingly was tapping her fingers loud enough as a hint to me to hurry up. I almost was going to tell her to stop tapping her fingers. I don't see myself going back there.

Went here based on the good Yelp reviews and the proximity to my hotel (the Trump). Note that this place is in a strip of office buildings in an industrial part of town off the strip. Lots if different BBQ options on the menu - I had the half chicken and green beans and it was really good. I saw some other patrons eating ribs that looked really good. This is not a restaurant but instead you order at the counter and the food is brought out to you at self seating picnic tables. The prices aren't super cheap so you are paying for quality. Overall, was enjoyable although not sure it's a must visit if you visit Vegas.

I love Barbeque and even though I make my own at home, I am not  snob about and enjoy most barbeque.  Alas, Rollin Smoke did not deliver.  

I ordered the 5 meat combo so that I could taste a good sampling.  Food arrived fast but it was clear that most if not all of it had set there in a steam plate for many hours.  Without sauce, all tasted bland and stale.  The sausage link was both dry and others while not try, clearly had that watery taste.  Ribs were decent but just like pulled pork was not edible without the sauce.

I could tell this food could be better if it were fresh but I have to rate what I ate and that was very disappointing.

I had three sides:
1. ColeSlaw.  I love coleslaw to cool my mouth between bites.  This one seemed fresh and nice but had a strong mexican flavor which ruined the experience.  This is a personal judgement of course.  The beans were both a little too spicy and sweet.  Again, I can see others liking it.  Last was waffle fries.  I liked these very much even though they too were not very fresh.

I also had a couple of rolls and these were excellent.  Nice, soft and fresh!

Back to the sauce, it had a magical ability to make the stale meats tasted decent.  Without it I would have walked out with one bite.  It is rather thin, medium spicy and sweet (this was the "American Sauce").

On the atmosphere, the place had a rather unpleasant smell to it.  While visually clean, it made you think it was not.

Anyway, disappointed after spending $36 for dinner for one.

I drove down from Henderson to try this place. Pretty busy inside. I ordered the meatloaf, two spare ribs, and mac and cheese.  I got this order to go, but when I got home no mac and cheese. I made a few attempts to call and left a message before I finally got through to a person.  When I told the guy who answered the phone that I was missing an item. He said "What do you want me to do about it?" Huh? I just spent 23 bucks there and I'm missing something. I will say that I'm pleased with the quality of the food. Just be sure to check your order before leaving...

The BBQ was good, but the sides were disappointing.  I had my mind all set on beef ribs, but when I got to the counter to order they were out.  Quick switch to a sandwich and shared some sides with my friends: hush puppies, corn nuggets, beans & corn bread.  
The beans were a strong disappointment, perhaps because that is one of my favorite parts of good old fashioned Kansas City barbecue.  Here the beans were a little too firm for my taste and the sauce was thin and not quite as flavorful as I would have liked.  The hush puppies were decent, the corn bread was moist but more in the style of a cake batter with a very small amount of cornmeal added.  The fried corn nuggets were ok.
My sandwich was good and the meat was tender, though as others have commented I added quite a bit of BBQ sauce to it.
One aspect I didn't care for was the "messiness" in the dining area.  I certainly understand that operating a high volume dining establishment is hard work, especially when the food is messy to eat, but it can be done.  After placing my order and looking for available seating, several of the spots still had used napkins or debris at the tables.  The open spot we chose had plastic utensils on the floor under the seats and the condiment bottles were messy.  I was facing the back station where customers could grab napkins or tea and the white front was covered with scuff marks and such.

Smokin'!!! The genuine customer service from entrance to exit was unbelievable for such a tiny joint. The ribs were so uniquely flavorful and fell right off the bone. The brisket yum! Chicken tasty! I even attacked the "Outlaw" burger which was quite a delicious feat but, overwhelmed with onion rings. The sides (collard greens, potato salad, Mac 'n' cheese, etc.) were a bit salty for me; they needed to break up the intense grease and salt throughout the main dishes to even the palate.

Everytime I come here, I'm treated well and this time was no exception. The food comes out hot and taste so good, consistently there food comes out tasting great! And now that they have upgraded their resturant! If you haven't been here you are doing something wrong with your life!
It was ok, wouldn't break my neck to go again. For the money I spent on this I probably could've store bought and enjoyed it more.

Wow, this place was great. Was it the best bbq ever? That might be a tough sell. Is it really really good? For sure. 

We wanted to branch out for a new lunch spot--something that wasn't on the strip or in our hotel. I Yelped "lunch" and Rollin Smoke was one of the first places to pop up. So me, my girlfriend and my sister piled into an Uber and set out for some bbq. 

The menu can be a bit overwhelming with all of the different meats and combinations. I wanted to sample a little bit of it all, so I opted for the 5 meat platter: pulled pork; brisket; hot link; chicken; spare ribs. Everything was really good and unlike some other Yelpers, my chicken was fall-off-the-bone tender. I love seeing that tasty smoke ring on the ribs and the meat melted in my mouth. The sauce selection was great and I really like that they allow you to sauce the meat yourself. Nothing worse than bad bbq being covered up by an abundance of sauce. 

With the 5 meat platter you are given a choice of 3 sides...I opted for the baked beans; collards and mac and cheese. All were very good and the bits of pork found in the collards added flavor and were a nice touch. The mac and cheese was gooey and had that homemade feel. 

Also, the service was great. The employees at the counter were helpful and it seemed like every few minutes a staff member would come into the room we were dining in to make sure everybody was enjoying their food. We were fortunate to not have a line when we came here but while dining, the place quickly filled up.

Rollin Smoke BBQ is a good place to grab BBQ from if you are close to the strip.  The food was good and the environment was fun as well.  We happen to stop by here on a holiday weekend, and the line was out the door.  However, with the line being out the door, the take-out service was fast and easy. The cashier was very nice and explained everything I needed to know for my first time.   I would recommend this restaurant to anyone wanting some good old fashion BBQ.

My bf and I got the $20 deal that comes with 4 meats and 3 sides and a drink. Enough for two!! Ohh and get the peach cobbler!! I didn't take a picture of it because I was so eager to eat. It was Ahhmazing. :)
If you are going to eat such meaty goodness in Vegas, this is the only place to go. Outlaw Burger...mmmmm. Burnt ends...omg. Love it all

Ordered D's sampler and added an order of beef ribs with sides of potato salad and cole slaw, and it was so worth going. Sure, it might be off the strip...but it was amazing BBQ. 

Dusty (D) the pitmaster was an awesome host. He made sure we were comfortable and well taken care of. I've definitely added this place as a must eat for when we're in Vegas.

Good quality and good quantity!!!
I had the pulled piggy sandwich with waffle fries, and my husband had the beef rib plate.

The quality of their meats are excellent, very tender and very flavorful. I am quite picky about bbq sauce.... and theirs is really good... I slathered extra sauce all over my pulled pork sandwich!

If you have a big appetite... you will not be disappointed by the amount of food they give you either.....very big portions! The beef ribs are gigantic.... We left full!!!

I really recommend giving them a whirl, location is a little rough, and the ordering process can be a little tricky.
oh yeah, and the closet you step into to get your drinks is another strange aspect that you just go..... "okay, whatever"..... 
I can deal with a few quirks for some good food!

This was our first time going here to this restaurant which was really good. The burgers and brisket are highly recommended. Not too crispy and not too chewy, it was a great BBQ meal. To top it off, put the delicious barbecue sauce on it. The prices were not high either for such great tasting food. Service was quick and helpful. Overall a fantastic place for lunch or a group dinner.

Outstanding Southern style BBQ with great prices for all budgets.  And there are so many choices on the menu to keep you coming back.  Best BBQ in Vegas and maybe the best in the Western US.

Saturday afternoon the line was 5 deep.  Walk up, order and find your seat.  Food was out in maybe 12 minutes.

Family run, served by the son and cooked by dad.  Can't do better than that.  Good food and good owners.
hard place to find if you don't have a gps, but once you do, it is bbq heaven. meat is tender, juicy, and the right amount of smoke. They have plenty of sides to choose from too.
I normally dont like beef ribs becuase they are tough, but these were the best ive ever had
Great BBQ, quick service, local atmosphere.  Prices are very reasonable and you can get all you can eat for $25. Best BBQ joint in town.

My wife and I stopped by last night to get a brew on our way back to Downtown. The bar was closing, so we turned around to get another uber. John, the GM and Owner called us back up the stairs and personally bought us each a beer. It made our night. We were unable to try the food, but the bar looked amazing, clean, and has a cool patio. We will definitely be back, and will be giving the food a try. Thanks a lot John, you made our night and look forward to coming back!
Was really hoping to have some real deal BBQ but it was not remarkable. Not bad but didn't leave an impression.
Stopped in earlier tonight and had the "world famous" beef ribs as recommended by Matt. I couldn't have been happier with the food & service! Will be back soon.
Best BBQ in LV. All I gotta say. We come here every time we're in Vegas. And if you're too scarred of the seedy off-strip  neighborhood, then you don't deserve BBQ this good.

Small Hidden place in the industrial section, but was a good find.
I've tried other BBQ places in Las Vegas and Los Angeles and Rollin smoke is up there with the other good ones. I had pulled pork/Brisket which was really tender, juicy and sauce wasn't too overpowering. I looked to my left and saw a monster -  the "Outlaw Burger" which looked like a burger on steroids. IT was stacked high with onion rings and brisket or pork (I forgot) and fat meat patty. You gotta see this. I asked the guys after they ate it and said" its amazing". Good food, good prices, good to eat with friends but kinda limited in spaces but open til like 1AM. I will surely go back...
Great tender brisket.  Loved the hot link, not oily, meaty with a bit of burn.  The Arkansauce was good.  Corn nuggets were good, but I will try potato salad next visit.
How about a pick up line fellas? Standing in the order line for 10 minutes just to pick up some food ain't good.
I finally tried this place and really liked it. The food is really good but it's in a weird location.

Definitely worthy of their many awards. We came by on saturday night and got the 3 meats combo, 1 side of corn bread, 1 side of bacon potato salad and 1 side of corn nuggets. Total came out to be $35.

We got Ribs (2 pieces), tri-tip and pulled pork. Everything was fantastic. The Ribs had a nice layer of smoked on. Tri Tip was nice and tender and the pull pork wasn't drenched in sauce. 

Inside seating was hard to come by but we didn't realize there was outside seating until we left the restaurant. 

I would definitely check this place out again for the AYCE option.

if i tell you pure yumminess omg the bomb.com. i'll be back again real soon. I can just say i left the happiest woman coming  from L.A. BBQ and not having any besides home cooked since 2007, i couldn't be happier. I would tell anyone to visit this place when and if you have a BBQ craving or want. I had the beef ribs, baby back ribs, the chicken, the hot links, mac n cheese, potato salad, and brisket and ill be back for it all!!!

Great food as always!  Excellent portions with prices to match.  My fav is the pulled pork sandwich and the potato salad.  Tried the blackberry cobbler tonight and it's awesome!  Thank you for giving us an incredible option for barbecue.

YES! Sooooo good! And the sauce...AMAZING!!!!! Be aware that parking is limited in the mid-day since the lot is small. The staff is friendly, the place is clean, the ribs...just order enough so you can have leftovers to take home!

My husband and I came to this little out-of-the way bbq dive on the advice of fellow Yelpers.  We were most definitely NOT disappointed.  This bbq is exceptionally delicious and there is nothing else like it in Las Vegas.  Or at least nothing else we have ever encountered, and we are bbq chasers.  First, the rich, smoky, flavor embraces you as you arrive.  You do have to go through a shady neighborhood to get there, but once you are there, you are welcomed with warm Southern hospitality.  Second, the food lives up to the tantalizing smell and some.  Juicy chicken, beef ribs, and pulled pork are cooked beautifully and given in generous portions.  The sides are pretty good, too.  Third, the atmosphere is charming.  They have made the most of the space and it is fun, clean, and unintimidating.  Lastly, the owner is quite nice and we wish him the best.  Worth a trip.  Enjoy.
Great food! The ribs were great. The pulled pork and brisket were also great. I really liked the potato salad. My partner loved the beans. We'll certainly be back!

I have seen Rollin Smoke on several Food/ Travel Channel specials, and have been anticipating my trip in since I planned a trip to Vegas several months ago.
We stopped in about 11:30 and though it was fairly busy it wasn't hard to get a table and we didn't wait in line or for our food very long.  The parking however is very sparse so we had to park on the street across the way a bit. 
I have to say that the main takeaway that I got from Rollin Smoke is that Salt Lake City (where I live) has some very underrated BBQ places. For what has been stated as one of the best BBQ places in the country I honestly have enjoyed certain items at places here in UT even better. 
That out of the way we were very please with the food and clearly their technique is flawless. The smoke rings were perfect and they did have hands down the best ribs in every way that I have ever had. One thing I did not notice on the board is that if you don't ask for it specifically they default to chopping up their brisket, and though it was quite tasty I would have preferred my brisket to be sliced, and I am surprised (since I've never seen it that way before) that chopped rather than sliced is their default. 
They also had the best mustard based BBQ sauce I've ever had which they call "Sweet Country Girl", and their other sauces are quite tasty too but I typically prefer a thicker Texas style sauce (didn't effect my review, just a note) to their Louisiana/ Alabama style thin vinegar sauces. 
I Ordered a 3 meat plate: Ribs, Pork, Brisket and a side of their potato salad. The portions were good but not generous, and as mentioned above the ribs were awesome, brisket was tasty but would have liked to have tasted it sliced, and the pork was good but not exceptional. Everything did have a very nice smoky flavor and a perfect crust, and I ate almost everything mostly dry, but added dashes here and there on my fork.
