My wife ordered their big baked potato (cant remember what they call it) which was just huge and loaded with all sorts of goodness and brisket on top. It was very delicious and I think that they smoke rather than bake the potato but I could be wrong. 
They take your order at the counter then bring it out to you when its ready. The service was okay but nothing great and they weren't particularly friendly at the counter, but they guy who brought out our food was pretty nice. 
I will certainly eat here again, but at this point cant say that it is my overall favorite BBQ place. Their prices are actually pretty good for Vegas, and I think they give a discount to locals (which is a bit annoying).

Here's the rundown regarding Rollin Smoke BBQ;

1.  Huge, I mean gigantic portions.  See pictures for yourself
2.  No one can compete with their prices when it comes to BBQ.
3.  Hole in the wall type restaurant, my favorite type 
4.  Great service
5.  Conveniently located near my favorite type of clubs.  Joking...I think. 

When I first met Heather H, the first thing that came out of her mouth wasn't "Hi, nice to meet you".  It was "have you been to Rollin Smoke?, You have to go there ASAP".  Actually, she did say "hi", but Rollin Smoke stuck in my head.  If you don't know Heather H, she's a well respected Yelper in the Las Vegas community.  And if Heather and her boyfriend love the food here, then it must be pretty damn good.  Read the reviews, rarely any complaints from anyone about Rollin Smoke. 

When I found out that we were having dinner at Rollin Smoke one Friday evening, guess who I reached out to?  Heather H of course.  I thought it was funny that while she responded to my questions, she was also on her way to Rollin Smoke for lunch.   She's a die hard for sure.  As for her suggestions, she suggested something she never had and the rest of the menu. I guess this means a Win Win situation for me. 

My Meal:
Chicken and Ribs Combo:  Read this closely.  Don't look at prices because it's deceiving. The portions are huge!!! Portions are so big, that I only was able to finish half my chicken and one rib.  I loved the chicken BBQ. It's cooked perfectly, chicken still tender (not dry), and the flavors poured out of it with every bite. As for the ribs, I only had one and thought it was just okay. I hate to admit that I've had better ribs elsewhere. But for the price, it was a great deal. 

Their mac and cheese is a must eat as well as their corn bread on steroids.  I finished the mac n cheese, but could only muster half my corn bread.  Both had a little kick to it.  Yes, even the corn bread had a kick to it. 

Service was pretty good too.  You need to order at the counter and the food is served to you.  Like most BBQ places, the food does take a little time to cook so be patient and enjoy your company. 

I ate a lot, Terri R ate a lot, and Chad S ate a lot. I guess that equals to all of us eating a lot.  $40 for 3 people to eat on a Friday night is not bad at all.  It's such a bargain here that you'll even be left with a few bills to hit the nearby clubs and make it rain.  

Chicken and Ribs Combo (Rib Portion):  http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/rollin-smoke-barbeque-las-vegas?select=GGZosl72mVr20EopFH0CCQ#JzVJa44kXIqmrTwzsB0Vog

Chicken and Ribs Combo (Chicken Portion w/their Mac N Cheese):  http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/rollin-smoke-barbeque-las-vegas?select=GGZosl72mVr20EopFH0CCQ#eBYim1tMqbyjwCSu_KomSA

Corn Bread:  http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/rollin-smoke-barbeque-las-vegas?select=GGZosl72mVr20EopFH0CCQ#KCz1AngCp_JfBfBADzCf_A
I LOVE THIS PLACE!!!  I have not had anything at this place that I do not love!! I wish I could figure out how they make the Corn Nuggets. I would live off these things!!

Service was great and food was delicious. I got the $28 plate which I split with my fiance. It contained bbq chicken, pulled pork, brisket, spare ribs and includes 3 sides. Bacon baked potatoe, baked beans which was not too sweet and meaty, and my favorite the cornbread. I will recommend for delicious bbq.

I am a first timer.  Oh what a first time!  I had the rib platter.  I was slightly taken aback when asked if I would like an extra beef rib for 6$. I thought to myself 6 bucks for a rib? I don't think so.  When my order came the beef rib was definitely the largest item on the plate.  When I tasted the rib I was speechless, this meat was more tender than any pork rib I have ever had.  The flavor was unbelievable.  I devoured the rib and was almost full when I finished it.  I forced myself to sample the other ribs, the dirty rice (which was wonderful by itself) and the corn fritters. Although it was a little strange ordering at the counter the wait staff was available most of the time. The food was great, the beef rib is second to none and I will definitely be coming back.

I'm from California and apparently I have been deprived of good BBQ for the 27 years of my life on this earth. This stuff is melt in your mouth, I can't stop eating good. I'm pretty sure I left 3 lbs heavier than when I walked in. We ordered and loved the pulled pork, brisket, and hot links. The loaded mash potatoes and green beans were great as sides but the yams were too sweet for my taste. I was impressed by the service too. While we were eating a gentleman sitting nearby complained about his bread. The manager (maybe owner?) personally came out to apologize and make things right. It showed how much he valued his customers and how passionate he is about the business. 
Side note: they're BBQ sauces are gluten free! Yay!

Had the half slab of beef ribs.  BBQ sauce is excellent with the meat falling off the bone.  Also had the side of kicking beans - spicy but good.   Most definitely recommend while visiting Vegas.  Looks like a local spot.   They also got an all you can eat plan for 24.99 where you can get anything on the menu.
Great food, great service, great deals. Mitch was our server and he went above and beyond to provide us the most excellent service - when eating here, ask for Mitch!!!

Simply the best in Vegas, Your taste buds will thank you. In our two week visit to Vegas we dined here several times. The meats melt in your mouth; the waffle chips are crunchy and tasty. The serving sizes are generous. Tried catfish for the first time
I loved it. The service is exceptional from all staff. Met the owners who are friendly and courteous. Seriously when your thinking BBQ don't go past Rollin Smoke Barbeque you will not regret it. Will definitely be going back on my next visit to Vegas.

When you see a big ole pickup side by side a just off the lot Mercedes in the parking lot of a way off the strip business/industrial section of town with one restaurant in sight, you know that's a good place to eat!

It's a humble and simple setup when you walk through the doors but the flavors roam about the air which play a prelude to bounty in which you're about to partake. The wall sized menu is easy to follow and offers a whole lot to choose from. This being my first visit, I had to take a while before deciding but everyone does that it seems. The line gets long and for good reason. If you get there after 11:15, expect to standing outside those doors leading in. There's ample seating on a sunny day or dry evening. The weather is perfect for both for now. All tables have unlimited napkins, ketchup and BBQ sauce. The people are very friendly and check in on you every 30 minutes or so to make sure you're enjoying your food. Indoors is splint into two eating areas. One is the room you come into to order with picnic benches set up and various displays all around the room including the giant sized menu. The other has a couple of flat screens going with a game or two on broadcast.

The food was savory and very tasty! We had a hot dog, the Duo which is a two meat order and a Trio a three meat order consisting of brisket, pork ribs and hot links. Other choices we could have had were a ¼ chicken and pork. Our sides were waffle fries and mashed potatoes. The hot dog was meaty with good chew and snap when you bit in. The fries rounded out the intake quite nicely, not too oily and plentiful. The hot links are sneaky spicy as they invade your palette bite after bite. So good! The brisket was tender and cut right. I needed extra sauce because that's what I like. The ribs were killer! Lots of meat on those bones, tender but held good form after the bite. Those were sucked dry. The mashed potatoes garnished with fresh bacon bits and melted cheese were thick, rich and flavorful. I could eat that all day! Unlimited drinks and BBQ sauce are always a plus. 

What's my bottom line? I have a saying about restaurants: You get one shot at the title; if you succeed, you'll get more shots at the championship! So yeah, I'm coming back! There's so much still to try and this initial visit definitely left a strong, positive impression. Great prices, championship quality BBQ. My actual rating is a 4.7 stars...

Amazing BBQ. Definitely do not over look this place when you are in Vegas! Friendly, helpful staff and simply amazing food. Portions are big and worth the price. Got the meatloaf and it was perfection, other got ribs and a wrap and all was immensely enjoyed!
First time there - fantastic!  Highly  recommended. Had  ribs and corn nuggets -fantastic!  Had sweet tea - fantastic!  Got a free banana pudding for free-fantastic! Go there-fantastic!

This place was pretty awesome. My husband and I came here for Labor Day for some good bbq, and they definitely served to please. We usually go to Famous Dave's for bbq, but wanted to try something different. My husband saw the great reviews on here, so we went for it. Small seated area, but nice enough to enjoy yourself. The staff is pleasant and very welcoming. I really enjoyed them. The prices are reasonable and the food is delicious. We ordered rib tips, the loaded mash potatoes, Mac& cheese along with two half rack ribs. It really hit the spot! But beware, they top everything with chives. So if you don't like that onion taste, make sure to remove them when ordering. Otherwise, you should really enjoy yourself

I have heard nothing but great reviews of this place. So, I had to try it. To my surprise, I was not at all excited about this place. Never had a pulled pork sandwich so dry that I had to actually drink 4 large cups of water just to get it down. That was even after I added there BBQ sauce to try to moisten the sandwich. I guess they left a little to long in the smoker, or maybe it was the left over that sat out with out being covered so it dried out. Who knows. Maybe next time when I come in, it will be better.
I'm a bit picky when it comes to BBQ.  Rollin smoke BBQ definitely is a legit place!  AWESOME food as well as service!  A must now every time I'm in Vegas!
Best bbq I've ever had. And I've had a shit ton of bbq. I don't really do sides but the links and brisket were out of this world. I'd skip the chicken, it was kinda dry.

Ok nothing but praise on this one. All staff were friendly and informative as this was our first trip. Then the food came, only planned on eating half and saving the rest for drunchies. That did not happen the food is great. Had the smoked links, pork and brisket. The corn nuggets are soo good. Check in on yelp and get a delicious dessert. A for sure return place.

You have got to be kidding me guys...It's 106 degrees outside, your prices are not fast food and you expect us to sit and sweat inside your restaurant and eat. Not only is it disgusting, it's downright RUDE to your customers. Who wants to sit and smell people's body odors along with your smokey BBQ...What a waste of my time today....Get a clue and act like a real vegas eatery, not some cheap hole owners that can't afford to run the A/C at $20. bucks per person.

Frequently thrown into conversations about the best BBQ in Vegas Rollin Smoke is certainly better than most, but is it actually good BBQ? I tried to write this view avoiding all hints of BBQ snobbery but that is just impossible for me- the snob is too strong. So you may want to take my comments with a grain of salt- for the average American RSB is probably perfectly acceptable BBQ. Having lived in the south and spent a lot of time in Texas and KC it wasn't all that I hoped it would be, but it was still probably the best in Vegas (probably need to due a more detailed head to head vs Road Kill) 

If you are from the south or KC you will prob find RSB to be pretty mediocre. If, however, you are a Las Vegas local who doesn't get to travel to BBQ hotspots frequently then it is a lifeline. Its all a matter of perspective really. There is nothing wrong with RSB, the food is pretty good. It would not, however, stay in business in large scale BBQ cities.

I got the buffet so I could try everything. My favorite BBQ, or really any, food is beef rib so I ordered one of those right off the bat. The beef rib was a little dry, something several people had warned me about in advance, but smothered with sauce it was pretty decent. Not life changing, but definitely good and considering how few places in LV even serve beef rib its probably the go to for that. 

Pulled Pork- this was better than the beef rib. Not dry, pretty flavorful, went well with the sauce. They showed the pig the respect it deserves

Pork rib- def better than the beef rib here. Seemed like it had been smoked for a good amount of time and wasn't way over done to the point where the bones fall apart or anything

Brisket- meh. The brisket I got had very little fat and so very little flavor and was somewhat dry. I like big thick slices of brisket, these were very thin and not very tall, so I'm guessing they weren't cut off a complete brisket. 

Chicken- this was actually pretty good. I don't normally order chicken at BBQ places because its chicken and pig is usually available but since it was all you can eat I gave it a whirl. Would eat again

Mac and Cheese- this seemed like it had some potential but was served pretty cold.  It was in fact Cheezy

Baked Beans- these were great, would eat again and in large quantity. 

Corn nuggets- fried corn, hard to go wrong, could eat about 3 lbs of these in one sitting.

Rollin Smoke is the real deal. Some of the best barbeque you will find for hundreds of miles. Service is always good there, and the meat is supremely good. Everything here is divine but I particularly love the generous beef ribs. If you are on a restrictive diet, like paleo or whole30, try the brisket which has a simple salt and pepper rub. Get out here and continue to support this excellent local business.
Food comes out FAST.  Also reasonably priced for the mind-blowing quality. New favorite BBQ joint!
Ribs are amazing, the duo combo with a side is plenty for two people. Try the chipotle Cole slaw

I just needed to update my review to 5 stars. Food is great every time! I love the new additions to the menu, specifically bbq sundae for $8.99. Lunch time can be very hectic, so I try to go in before/after the lunchtime rush.
Good stuff. Lived up to the hype. Had the rib platter and meat was melting in my mouth.
Amazing smoked meatloaf w/ mashed potatoes & onion straws! Definitely a must go to BBQ joint when in Vegas.

This place is AMAZING and you're definitely missing out if you don't stop by here. 

Went to Vegas for vacation and thanks to fellow Yelpers, we decided to go even though it was off the strip. They deliver to the Mirage but only for employees, not guests. If you take the taxi, make sure you have the taxi's company number or your hotel's front desk so they can call a taxi for you on the way back. Or you can try to walk to Trump hotel and get a taxi. 

It is a MUST you try their meatloaf and brisket. We eat a lot of BBQ joints and this place is hands down have the BEST brisket and cornbread. Trust me. 

The place is tiny, you order at the counter first then grab a seat. 

You'll know you're in good hands when you see a bunch of locals.

Location is not convenient. Service could be better. The food is good. I've only picked up for take out. I don't like how they charge for sides of BBQ sauce. It's a BBQ place I should be able to get it BBQ sauce for free even if I am picking up for take out. It's free if you eat there. The ribs are good but I've had way better brisket at Billy's BBQ!

If in Las Vegas it's a must to try Rollin Smoke. This place is awesome. Been here several times its always been good. Brisket is tender and pork rib tasty and plentiful, Mac n cheese, beans are great! Hope you enjoy it!

Had the brisket done three ways. I thought I couldn't be more impressed here after coming here a couple of times before. I was wrong. This was a special and they were right. Special is the word. I couldn't stop eating. If they have this get it. If not get the brisket done however they have it that day, you will not be disappointed.
Their beef rib isnt as good as the Brontosaurus Rib I get at Mighty Quinn's but their burnt ends,spicy links and peach cobbler were all very good. I would come back here to eat those items again.
This is one of the best kept secrets in Las Vegas.  This is an awesome treat for the family reserved for Friday night after long weeks.

well I saw the yelp reviews and decided to try it out the food overall was ok it came out very quick the bbq sauce was not as good could have been better but service was great I will come back and try some other things.
One of the better bbqs in LV. Love the hot links and the smokeyness of the meats. Mac & cheese is delicious. Place can get very crowded and busy.

As far as BBQ goes, Rollin Smoke is decent.  The menu is quite large and there are a lot of interesting items to choose from, including waffle fry nachos.  The burger is pretty mediocre (though it claims to be the best), but the rest on the menu is pretty good. My biggest gripe is the price.  It's as much to eat here as it is at a nice sit down restaurant. For a small shack that serves BBQ at picnic tables, it's a bit pricey. It certainly isn't the best BBQ I've ever had.  That being said, good BBQ in Vegas is virtually non-existent, and Rollin Smoke's existence is appreciated.  It's definitely worth a visit to see if it's your style of BBQ.
My absolute favorite bbq joint from now on! Yelped this place and decided to check it out. Everything we had was delish! Every time we're in Vegas this will be a must! & the staff was so hospitable!
Great food. Great service. Don't forget to buy a shirt and rep their company. Will be going again while I'm here in Vegas
The smoked chicken was delicious. Great service and Lizelle made some good recommendations for sides.

Real Good authentic dry rub smoked BBQ. Total hole in the wall with some of the best pulled pork I've had... huge portions and freindly staff... If you like the corporate heat and serve food nicely packaged in a themed resteraunt, go there and not here. If you want real food and real people, this is the place..
I will always go here when I'm passing through...
BBQ was so flavorful and tasty. The family loved it. Plenty of food for the price. Awesome service.

I absolutely fell in love with this place the first time I had the brisket where you could taste the smoke in the meat! Then I took a friend back for a second visit and had the rib tips...not a good idea...I had the bubble guts for the rest of the day and felt horrible. I would still go back however I will definitely avoid the rib tips! Besides that, everything else is amazing!

Having worked right next door - this was my bi-weekly treat to a job well done. 

The food is fantastic - just have to try it. Everything is done good ol' barbeque perfection. 

Try everything. You won't be disappointed.

This is an AMAZING mostly locals spot! The food is SO GOOD. One of my favorites!

BE WARNED!!!- They close at 8PM on weeknights!! Which is like a late lunch by LV standards! YES, 8PM. :-( Discovered this sadly when I brought a group of 10 people there and we arrived at 8:05PM to the door being locked in our faces. Before we even left, saw another large party arrive to be disappointed by locked doors as well. 
Be there BEFORE 8PM!!!

On the positive side, the food is SO FANTASTIC, they don't feel they need to stay open past 8PM, except on the weekends. Go early, be happy, it is worth the trip off the strip!
OMG this place is delicious....i usually go to Memphis Barbecue on Warm Springs and im not sure which i like best..

We were off for an adventure! A friend told me, if you want good BBQ you have to come here. I haven't had BBQ in quiet some time now so I was looking forward to it. Location is in a run down shopping center and not a frequently used street for the local but aren't all the good places like that?
It was a place you order and grab your seat. They offer an ample amount of picnic bench seating so don't worry about a rush and not having a place to sit. Just think you can make friends with someone new. I got here around noon on a Friday. I just beat the rush. But as I said don't let that steer you away; quick and efficient service. 
I ordered the duo plate; chopped brisket, hot links, mac & cheese and an order of hush puppies. My mouth is watering thinking about this meal again. There was so much flavor in every bit. My favorite was the brisket though. The hot links definitely had some kick to it so be sure to stock up on your sweet tea beverage. Hush puppies are like no others I ever had. They have jalapeños in them! Oh and I forgot the corn bread. This was like dessert, no butter or honey needed. It was almost like the consistency of a pound cake and never once crumbled. 
The part that always gets me & deserves that extra star is seeing the chefs come out asking how everything was.  Always puts a smile on my face seeing how much pride they have in their cooking. A must try off the strip restaurant!

Completely shorted us on the Food!!! We decided to order Rollin Smoke BBQ for our holiday Christmas party. We ordered the BBQ sandwich pack, as illustrated on the website we were suppose to receive 1 pound of brisket, 1 pound of pork, and 1 pound of hot links. As a concierge service at one of the hotels on the strip we have access to a scale. So when we opened the box and it did not look like enough to feed 10-12 people we weighed the box. 1 pound in total for the weight of meat. When we tried to contact them no one answered and when we returned to store front we were greeted by Big Mike who did not care at all. We have frequently recommended customers to this business during NFR or when a guest is craving bbq. These recommendations will stop.
Great food!!  Laid back atmosphere awesome service ! Will def go back and will recommend to locals and visitors !

I've lived in Vegas for 40 years.  I'm from Texas.  I know good BBQ!

I know, I know, peeps judge BBQ based on where they are from: Texas, Kansas, et al.  Different regions = different tastes.

Rollin Smoke has been, for years, my go-to, 5 star place in Vegas to go.  But I took one star off my review.  I don't eat pork ... and I can't find any place in Vegas that has great BEEF ribs.  

Yes, I know Rollin Smoke has a beef rib (it's great -- but expensive ...more like a rib-eye steak on a bone).  

...Still looking for great Texas BBQ beef ribs in Las Vegas.

Flew in just about 11 and had a couple of hours to kill before heading off to Fort Irwin. Did the tourist thing by visiting the Pawn Stars shop, then Yelped someplace for lunch. Husband really goes for BBQ, and this place had 4.5 stars. Must say that 4.5 stars is perfect. (Wish Yelp allowed half stars.)

I had the club wrap, and husband had the pulled piggy sandwich and onion rings. The wrap and sandwich were great, but the onion rings were the best we've had anywhere. (Yes, I snitched some from husband.)

Ordering was easy, and food came in about 7 minutes after that. Staff was friendly. Yes, it's a hole in the wall, but SO much better than visiting a chain restaurant when we're traveling. The atmosphere was fun.

Will definitely try it again when in Vegas.
Perfect BBQ!  Great local color and amazing food. Their sauce was great.  The chicken was great and the burger was world class, piled with crispy onion rings to a height is around 6-7".

i love rollin smoke. 
the rib tips are amazing 
my family love the yams,fries,rib tips,and the meatloaf 
my mom loves the meatloaf so much. it was really good . the place is really cool. it is covered with arkansas things. it is so creative and good.

Best BBQ 
     Meat Trio Rocks!!!
                         Brisket Dog !! 
                                               by Far off the hook , who ever has not being at this place does NOT know Vegas. Any thing that you order is FINGER LICKING awesome. 
 Keep doing a great job guys .

This place... Went on Saturday for brunch and decided to come back the next day so I could try something else on their menu and my date wanted to order the same meal he had, but they are closed on Sunday's! Needless to say, BOMB. I mean, we did try to come back the next day! Haha. 

I ordered the half rack of spare ribs, naked. Meat was perfect, beautiful smoke rings, meat was tender and juicy and just had great flavor that appreciated the flavor of the ribs itself (like, didn't overpower-ing-ly just taste like seasoning). The half rack was more than enough for me to eat. The side of green beans I had was simple, but flavorful. My date had the smoked meat loaf over mashed potatoes with Mac n cheese. I tried it and it was delicious! Nice smokey flavor, AWESOME SAUCE, meat was moist and perfectly seasoned, mashed potatoes were creamy and a great compliment to the smokiness, the Mac n cheese was very creamy, thick and super cheesy. He wanted to order the same meal again!

The ambiance of this place has a small town, hole in the wall kind of feel. It's kind of in an odd location, a true gem not too far off the strip. I can't wait to go back and explore the menu and I wish I would tried their banana cream pudding! It looked sooo good, but I was just stuffed!

Fantastic BBQ and super friendly staff.  The best ribs and sauces I've ever had. The corn nuggets were AWESOME. 

Go! You won't be sorry.

A rare value in Vegas.  Great food, we enjoyed the super platter with melt in your mouth ribs, brisket, pork, and awesome chicken with ample sides and the spicy Arkansas style BBQ sauce.  But what made this place stand out was the excellent, friendly and personalized service from one of the owners, who recommended items for our group, made substitutions to accommodate us, and stopped by to chat and check in on us throughout our visit.  A great experience overall -- and we even had enough leftovers for 10 of us to eat lunch the next day!

Eh another daylong upset stomach after baby back ribs? Overcooked and a small place where you wonder if they're smoking the meat with the cooks' pot smoke... Skip it and eat a salad! After 12 hours I'm still feeling the pig running up and down my intestines! However if you're in the mood to see some adult entertainment there's plenty of strip clubs in the area and even some strippers coming in to eat! I'll take the breasts no dressing!
Could not go to Las Vegas without eating at Rollin Smoking Barbecue. Staff very courteous and friendly, as usual. Thanks guys!!!

I came here for the 4th and my family and I really enjoyed Rollin smokes BBQ !! The meat fell off the bone and We were so stuffed we couldn't even move. Definitely the place to eat if you want A1 BBQ in Las Vegas !!
The best barbecue I have ever had. The ribs are amazing and the meat falls right off the bone. The service is also amazing the employees are very friendly and helpful.
Everything was great besides the greens (too bitter and unflavorfull). Highly recommend the corn nuggets and banana pudding.

Man let me say that this place is legit! I search out  BBQ places when I travel and this is one of the best.

I had the two meat plate, brisket and ribs. And the meat was very tender, the ribs were cooked perfectly, not fall off the bone, which is not what I like. 

I would say the BBQ sauce is perfect as far as heat and spice goes. It's a vinegar base and you can tell it's made from experience. 

The man n cheese is a must. Super good flavor and the cheese isn't runny or too thick. Cooked perfectly and by far one of the best I have had. 

Chef Justin and Matt hooked us up with dessert. We had banana pudding and berry cobbler. Both very good. 

I will be coming back when I am in town and would def recommend this place to anyone in Vegas.

I've been here about 4 times and every time was positive except once. That's a pretty good ratio for me. For me, this is the best BBQ in Vegas hands down. 

Let's start with the positive
corn nuggets
sweet tea
BBQ Chicken
baby back ribs
BBQ beef ribs 

I like the casual restaurant vibe, they bring you your food but it's pretty quick and easy to eat and go. Prices are reasonable-hope they don't change. 


On to the negative-brisket and pulled pork was almost identical. One of them was dry and I forgot which one. One was good. Guess I should have remembered.  The mac and cheese was nothing special. BBQ beef ribs was burnt one time and small the next time. Collard greens-just ok. 

I would suggest sharing food to try more things. We get the same things each time we go and I guess I am okay with that.
Great food. A must if you visit las vegas. The briskets is killer. Go for the fun atmosphere and great food.
Good BBQ food, I have had the nacho fries each time and even though they have been removed from the menu they will still make them on request.

As soon as you get within a few feet of the building you can just smell it's going to be good. It's a very particular thing - the smoke house style, and this place does it so well. The chicken is deeply penetrated with flavour, but nothing comes close to the brisket. The sandwiches and sliders aren't dressed up, those sweet buns capture every drop of moisture (and believe me, you won't want to waste it). They also come dressed with simplicity; signature sauce and pickles, of course, the star attraction is the meat, and it is epic. Id also recommend trying those cross crossed fries - absolutely loaded with flavour, and the perfect thing to scoop up any escaped meat!

I've been wanting to go here for quite some time. I tried their food at the Las Vegas Ribfest, and it was decent. I had company in from out of town and we are a bunch of gluttons, so all you can eat bbq sounded great. We checked the website to make sure they still had it. They did, and the website said $24.95 per person. We walked in, and there was a piece of paper over the price on the menu board that said $34.95. I told the girl that was ringing us up that her website said $24.95, and I didn't think it was right to do the bait and switch, we had driven two cars 20 miles to get there. She said "you could access the website?"! I pulled it up on my phone and showed her. She went to talk to someone in the back, then returned and said, sorry, that's the price. I said, "so you're not going to honor your advertised price?". She said, "do you want to talk to somebody else?". I said only if it might make a difference. She went and got the owner. He told me "sorry, I had to raise the price or I'd be out of business, that's been our price for three months". I of course said, "you've had three months to update your website and you're not willing to honor your advertised price?". He said sorry. I really wanted to eat there, it smelled great. I can not however patronize a place that will not honor their advertised price, especially if it's been wrong for three months on their website. I can't imagine how that can't be intentional. I will not ever walk back into that place.

This place was kind of hard to find. We got the Pit, which is all five of their meats, bacon potato salad, corn nuggets, and waffle fries. Their service is very friendly. Probably the best in Las Vegas. The meats have great flavor and is juicy. If you're a corn lover, you MUST absolutely get the corn nuggets. It's fantastic. This place is a MUST when you're in Vegas.

The food is excellent.  I recommend the spare ribs.  They are tender and juicy.  

We sampled most of the meat dishes.  Everything is good here.  The BBQ sauce is spicy and you will want to dip all of the food in to it.

The desserts are also excellent.  Try the peach cobbler!  You can't go wrong.

Hit the place again last week. Still superb. Not up to Lockhart, TX or Shelby, NC standards, but for Nevada the best you are going to find. Any place that offers collards as a side is to be respected. This trip it seemed like all of Asia decided to join us for lunch. They were all digging in and pigging out with the rest of the crowd, so welcome, tourists! Enjoy what BBQ is supposed to taste like!

Years in, thousands and thousands of customers later, Rollin Smoke is STILL maintaining a great restaurant. The recent popularity of American beef in developing nations has caused our prices to skyrocket. Personally, I can't believe I am paying what used to be "steak" prices for brisket (in 2000, brisket was about $1.50 a pound. Now, it's around $3-4 at retail), but that's the reality of the situation. Rollin' Smoke recently had to increase the price of their AYCE option and the rest of the menu should be creeping up soon, but there's nothing they can do.

I never thought I'd pay $53 for a brisket when I cook Q, but welcome to 2015.

I've been a handful of times (every three or four weeks) and perhaps it's talking Q with the owner, perhaps it's because I'm from Arkansas, he remembers my name. I'm not a big customer, but by golly, that's awesome.

They're still doing great meat and great service. This is top of the line barbecue and I have no hesitation to happily recommend it to my friends.
Delicious!!!! Everything on the Pit special was good!!! 5 meats, 3 sides...can't go wrong with that!
I never eat beef ribs but boy this place makes them so delicious! ! I'm currently eating our leftovers cold and it's still good!  Definitely coming back.

You know it's going to be an unforgettable meal when you smell the smells here. The aroma of meat tended in a loving way greets you upon approach, beckoning you to come inside and choose your savory adventure. Luckily, we had 5 adults in our party, so we had occasion to order the sampler and try EVERYTHING. Best. Day. Ever. 

All of it was good. The meat could stand on its own, prepared to perfection. Smoky in flavor, and complimented (not masked) by the accompanying BBQ sauce. The fried catfish was perfect; no soggy breading, beautiful sauces on the side, just right. We tried the spicy sample. Some laughed. Some cried. 

In a day when chain BBQ is the norm, finding a gem like this feels like discovering Atlantis. You can tell the people running this business love their work because both the chef and the servers asked how we were liking the food and toured the dining room to ensure the same with other guests. 

10/10 for THE BEST BBQ in LV, 10/10 for the service and welcoming atmosphere - will DEFINITELY come here again.

This place gives you an authentic bbq experience.  When you walk in, you have to order at a register. The staff is very very nice. I took around 5 minutes to order, as the menu is so big, and the person at the register was very patient and polite.

After you order, they ask your name, and you sit down at a table.  The inside is decorated like you'd expect a bbq joint in Alabama would be. There's also outside seating. 

I got the All You Can Eat option, because as a foodie I wanted to try EVERYTHING.

Their food is extraordinary. The tri tip squares were my favorite, but the meatloaf was a close second. The catfish was amongst the best I've ever had. The shrimp is very high quality. I also had the beef ribs, hush puppies, corn bread, mashed potatoes, Mac & cheese and fried onions. It was all good to great! The weakest item is probably the corn bread, but the rest is so good I didn't mind. 

Overall, if you want a friendly staff and the best bbq in Vegas, this is your place!

Amazing!!! Even though I spent most of my life in Texas, this is some of the best BBQ I've ever had! Loved the corn nuggets & green beans too! My boyfriend and I were STUFFED for less than 30 dollars! Can't beat it!

I've heard great things about this BBQ place so I decided to go try it on Fourth of July with some friends. We got there around 12:30pm, and surprisingly it wasn't as busy as we thought it would be. This place is a order and sit down place. My sister and I wanted to share one of the plates. We chose the three meats: pork, brisket, and 2 spare ribs with mashed potatoes and beans on the side. The service is excellent; they greet you, call you by your name and make sure you are taken care of. I believe it's family own if I'm not mistaken. Our food came out pretty quick and we didn't have to wait that long at all. The food was delicious and the meats are perfect! Don't forget to get some sauces on the side (spicy and mama's sweet sauce). The plates here are definitely shareable (if you want to share). You could also order to-go and catering as well. I will certainly be back next time or order to-go for a party!

Visited this BBQ joint on my last trip to Vegas and very glad I did! First off, I have to give Mitch at the register some serious credit here as he pointed us in the direction of the all you-can-eat option. $35 and you can literally eat anything you want from the menu in an hour. There was so much I wanted to try, this was really the best option and most cost effective.

Burnt Ends with Mac and Cheese was one of my favorites, as well as the smoked meatloaf. Peach cobbler ala mode for dessert really sealed the deal. Brisket was amazing as well. Honestly, if you're having the same commitment issues I have when there is good BBQ around, save yourself the trouble and try it all!

To top off this awesome visit, Mitch took us on a tour of the whole restaurant. Kitchen, all the smokers, got to meet the chef and our Pit Master! Truly an awesome experience. Will definitely be back on my next stop in Vegas in a few weeks!

After finding this place on yelp we decided to try it out!  Real good food!  The meatloaf was of the charts!  Mashed potatoes are GREAT!  Their yams were so good too!! We pretty much had a little of everything and can't say anything bad at all!! Great service too.  The venue is a little bit small but the food is worth it!
BEST BBQ I've had in Vegas!!! Hugh portions and traditional atmosphere.  Try the outlaw brisket burger, you won't be disappointed.

This is a proclamation and one that is long overdue:  after living in Las Vegas for 10 years I can now happily endorse a real-deal BBQ joint:  ROLLIN SMOKE BARBECUE!!!  As you may already know about me, I am a first-rate barbecue snob ...the kind of guy who is first to correct anybody who confuses grilling with barbecuing.  That is not a concern here.  We're talking about brisket and pork that is smoked for 18 hours -- baby back, pork *and* beef ribs -- wickedly good sides (like jalapeno coleslaw and corn nuggets) -- even some unique sandwiches.  It's in an odd part of town, off of Highland and under the Desert Inn overpass (yes, surrounded by strip clubs & warehouses) but somehow the location just seems to work.  
Make no mistake:  this is the absolute best barbecue that you will find in Las Vegas.  Period.  
If you like legit barbecue then you need to judge this place for yourself.   
You're welcome.

---Rant---

Great place when you are starving for meat!!!

Generally I stick with Tri-Tip, Chicken and/or Brisket when trying a new place.  These guys did NOT disappoint!  Meat was tasty, flavorful and juicy (not overly greasy, just juicy).

The Chicken was cooked perfectly and unusually soft (in a good way), same with the beef. 

The cornbread is excellent...tastes like it has a lot of butter, which is pretty damn good IMHO~

The seating sucks though; I had to have ma boy buy my grub while I went and sat in an open booth. There was a huge crowd of folks waiting to order (you order first, pay then go sit.  They bring you your food).  I kinda got some disappointed looks from the crowd as I apparently was the only one smart/clever enough to go grab seats while your buddies are ordering for you?! haha

Side Note 1 - Don't ask the staff if they have any to-go containers...they will look at you like a total dumbass as containers are plainly visible at the counter, next to the soda and utensils hahaha (the dude just rolled his eyes and pointed, I in turn looked a damn fool~ hahahaha)

Side Note 2 - This is on a side street that has about 4-5 strip clubs. The street itself is dark and looks like the kind of area you could get mugged, raped, etc.  So go with a nice sized group of people if you're gonna go at night, and bring tazers or mace~

---Overall---

Service: A.  We got our food pretty quick~

Food: A. Great food if you're looking for a heavy meat fix!!!

Atmosphere: C.  If I wasn't worried about getting ass-raped, I would probably visit more often.

After sampling the brisket, pulled pork and hot links, I can safely say the meats alone are plenty of reason to come here. The smoke ring on the brisket looks like perfection and tastes like a gift from above. Sampled sides were a delicious mac & cheese (with two home made pickles hiding under the styrofoam bowl) and these fried creamed corn poppers that cannot be properly described in text - they are a delightful experience. The home-made house sauce is bold and flavorful and more than enough for most meals, but there are two more home-made sauces as well - a sweet sauce that compliments the pork very well, and a "damn hot" sauce that is very tasty and has a sneaky heat that gets you after the second mouthful. Great meats, excellent sides, great sauces and a friendly staff make this place a must-visit on your next trip to Sin City.

I could not express enough how much my family and I enjoyed their BBQ . We had ribs, brisket and pulled pork and it was the best I have ever had. Not to mention the customer service was superior to any I have received in a long time. They are busy but every member of the staff was full of passion and great energy.

Came here on a rainy friday afternoon with Doriee, at 1pm, hoping to run into the Travel Channel filming crew. We did, but apparently filming started at 11 instead of the posted time of noon (oh well). We met up with Roger, as well as invited one other friend. 

Location, actually not as hard to find as i had thought. Though i had "scouted" the place a few days prior, still wasn't hard as some may have said. Coming from Fashion Show or Mel Tourne, taking a right onto industrial, then left at the light, then right again, and you are pretty much there ! 

Restaurant is a little small but lots of seating. Parking wise, decent amount. Unless there was some specific thing going, should be parking avail. 

Upon entry, first thing you see is their huge menu on the wall. Since Doriee was on break and didn't want to eat too much, we decided to share. And being "marketed" the beef rib so much by Roger (steak on a stick is what he calls it), we opted to get the Rib Platter Special. Comes with one side and a drink. For the side, we got the corn nuggets ! Or rather Doriee "excitedly" shouted corn nuggets XD ! Since she was on her lunch break (1 hour time, but work was close by), we hoped it wouldn't take long. Upon ordering, we were told about 25 minutes. 

Rib Platter Special - $17.99 - 3 Baby Back Ribs, 2 Spare Ribs, and 1 Beef Rib - Ordered with a side of Corn Nuggets. 

To our surprise, it came in about 20 minutes or less. Good on timing !! :D

Pretty big platter. Was definitely a good sharing size between the two of us. Corn nuggets were piled on the side. To our surprise (again), the corn nuggets were pretty good. Corn gave it a nice sweetness and it was nice and crispy ! The sauce it comes with is like a mix between thousand island and like the sauce from Raising Canes. Sweet, little tangy. 

Now the main entree. Ribs. The so-called "steak on a stick" was a beef rib that had a lot of meat on it, as well as a pretty thick layer of fat. The meat was not how i imagined it to be. Yes, as the restaurant name suggests, smokey, definitely a lot of smokey flavor (lasted the rest of the day lol!) but the meat broke off like it was stewed meat? I'm not sure if its because beef ribs weren't one of my favorite type of rib or its been too long since i had a beef rib but it was quite disappointing. Flavor was decent but meat texture wise, a little different. Both the baby back ribs and spare ribs were, yet again, smokey, but to our disappointment again, it was quite dry. Would have preferred it to be a little more seasoned/marinated to give it a nice flavor instead the meat but the dryness of the meat kind of made it saddening. Tried to help it with the bbq sauce on the table, but didn't really help. 

The BBQ sauce was a very thin sauce, so if you were to put in on anything, it almost rolls right off. Flavor wise, sweet, tangy, spicy. Not bad but not my favorite either. 

The following two items were ordered by Roger and another friend but im just putting what i SEE :P 

The Outlaw Burger - $8.99 - Brisket, Onion, Bell Pepper, Onion Strings, Red Cabbage Slaw, Lettuce, Tomato, Cheddar Cheese, and Chipotle Aioli

HUGE burger. The burger is, i believed a confirmed 1lb patty with tons of stuff stacked on top. Roger tried to press it down to make it smaller to eat, but to no avail. That burger was DENSE ! Not too much of a burger person but looked pretty good ! Maybe could try, if it was split with someone half n half.. 

Brisket Dog - $8.99 - 1/4 Lb Beef Hot Dog, Brisket, Smothered in Cheese and Onion Strings

I didn't even notice the hot dog in it until after my friend bit into it. Similar to the burger, ingredient filled/stacked. I was actually surprised my friend ate it fairly cleanly without everything falling out and onto the plate. 

Desserts !!!

Southern Peach Cobbler & Country Black Berry Cobber - sweet and flavorful. sauce was very thin and runny. kind of hard to eat (especially if you were sharing. would prefer the sauce to be a little thicker. still pretty good ! 

Mama's Banana Pudding - imagine a bread pudding but instead of bread, its vanilla wafers... with slices of banana and pudding. Yummy dessert :P 

Reese's PB Cup Bread Pudding - soaking in a RUM sauce, the dense but flavorful bread pudding is like hell on a plate. bread pudding usually is already pretty flavorful from it absorbing the heavy cream but in this case, it is a PEANUT BUTTER CUP bread pudding... rich peanut butter taste with a nice rum sauce glaze on top. Prob my fav on the 4 desserts listed. 

Overall. good place. though the ribs were a bit disappointing. Everything else was pretty good. Would like to try other things, like their brisket and such

We came here on a Wed looking for a late night restaurant past 11pm, and surprisingly, found a bbq joint on Yelp that was open!  Not a far drive from the strip, we were impressed by the many 4+ star reviews. Like many small bbq restaurants in the South and Midwest, they offered all the regular meats: brisket, sausage or hot links, BBQ Chicken, ribs, and pulled pork.  They offered a good selection of sides as well, and I ordered the 3 meat combo (brisket with 2 orders of pork ribs) with loaded mash as my sides.  

The food was decent, but not great unfortunately. The pork was definitely fall of the bone tender, and the brisket was very dry and didn't have a great taste to it. They did offer a good selection of sauces to go along with the meat, but it didn't really help and I was really looking forward to some good bbq.  The problem may have been that it was 11:30pm and the food was being kept warm from earlier in the evening, but I'm still judging it based on what it was served. Maybe I'll come back during the day when the food was freshly cooked and it will be better.

I don't know how I've never had this BBQ or even heard of it, really.  But some BBQ showed up for a catered work lunch and boy was it good.  Now I'm going to have to make a trip to the restaurant to see what it's all about.  I think the best BBQ I had in Vegas  before Rollin Smoke was Famous Dave's, and Famous Dave's sucks.  Glad to know there's good BBQ in Vegas!

After all the hype, my good friend and I decided to try Rolling Smoke. He had the Big daddy and I went for the two meat, ribs and brisket. This is my standard order and meal comparison for BBQ. Neither of us said we would come back.
Ribs were bland and dry, as was the brisket. One side of mashed potatoes actually was cold in a few bites. Sad to say, one of the worst BBQ meals I've had in Vegas and anywhere. 1 1/2 stars and not sure that's worth it.

Is it overreaching to say that Rollin' Smoke is the best barbeque in Vegas? I am not sure why it has taken me so long to visit. I just know that I will be coming around more often. If I could, I would have eaten more. My eyes were hoping for dessert, but my stomach said no way.

I got the rib plater and it was amazing. It comes with a monster of a beef rib, three baby backs, and two spareribs. For $17.99, you get a side and a drink with it. I got the kickin' beans and added the jalapeno coleslaw for $2 more. BBQ beans are often too sweet for me. Here, too. The coleslaw though is delicious. The perfect balance of creamy and spicy. The baby backs were my least favorite of the bunch. Mine were somewhat dry. I needed to smother them in their housemade BBQ sauce. Usually beef ribs can be tough, but I pulled the whole thing off the bone and inhaled. It was huge and contained so much meat. 

They have a $34.99 AYCE option for anything on the menu, but I felt like I was about to die after half of my plate.

Holy cow.!!!!
This place is heaven . A hidden Gem. Best bbq in the world . My husband & I will be here everytime we come out to visit I swear best food in world. Forget wasting your time on the strip . This food is amazing & excellent service I even saw the chef walk around ask every one how's everything. Best spot .
*amazing food 
* hidden gem
* excellent service
*clean

I've been here twice now and both times have been delicious. The corn nuggets are amazing as well as the Mac n cheese. Waffle fries are great too. Baked beans are "meh" and the coleslaw is pretty spicy. This is the only place in Vegas that makes sweet tea the way it should be, extra syrupy and sweet. The pulled pork is on point but last night it was served cold. I guess maybe that's just the way they have it, I don't know, but still very delicious. Now the only reason I deducted a star is because I absolutely LOVE ribs, last time I came I got the St. Louis spare ribs which were dry and disappointing, and this time I got the "world famous" beef ribs which were also dry but very fatty and just not good. Not only that it was $18.99 for a half slab which is only 2 pieces, kinda pricey IMO. But they do give locals discounts which makes up for it. Next time I go I'm going to try to baby backs, but if those don't impress then I'm going to be really sad because everyone says amazing things about the ribs!

This place never disappoint. This time around I got the Spudtastic, which is a baked potato with a choice of meat on top of it. I couldn't decide so I choice half pulled pork and brisket, which the staff confirmed was the bestseller. Also, spudtastic is top with cheese, sour cream and green onion. Yummm! 
They have everything from pulled pork, brisket, ribs, and chicken. The sides are great! It's fairly priced. The ambience is very relax and it makes you feel at home. The staffs are great and friendly.

This place knows how to cook some BBQ!  I've been going here for quite a while and it's the best!  The prices are starting to go up as they become more busy and popular which I'm not a fan of!.  Beat the crowd before noon or after 130.

Best BBQ I've had in Las Vegas. I got the rib platter which was about $17.99. It was delicious and the meat just fell of the bone. Service was great and cashiers were nice and courteous. I would highly recommend this place to any meat or BBQ lovers.

This place delights a southern girl's heart! When you are raised on awesome BBQ in the Arkansas, Oklahoma, Texas area, you get spoiled. Not only is Rollin' Smoke a taste of home, it's a taste of heaven! 

Must tries: The meatloaf, the hamburger, the rib tip, and the corn nuggets!
I am not a huge fan of fish/sea food. However, I tried there mahi mahi and it was DELICIOUS!!! Definitely will be back ;-)

We were in Vegas April 2013 and did a random Yelp search for some BBQ.  This place had high marks and they weren't too far off the strip.  I even feel badly about the low rating that I am leaving, because so many others were so good.  But this is our truth...

We walked into the place and the smell of smoke was potent and we were really eager to try a little of everything.  We ordered a sampler and because we "checked in" there we got a free dessert.  The meal was a HUGE disappointment!  What a shame.  We have strong roots in the south and this did not do it any justice.  

The chicken was flavorless.  The ribs had smokey flavor, but was borderline jerky!  The pulled pork was sub-par.  The sides were also a disaster.  The beans were hard and way too spicy, just underdeveloped flavor.  The mac and cheese was a mushy blob of fake-tasting cheese, just not good!  The bread they served was hard and cold.  I would have paid them extra NOT to bring the so called dessert to the table.  That was the poorest excuse for peach cobbler.  Marie Calender's from the local grocery store would have been way better.  The banana pudding was baby food grade, and gritty, just not right!  

Maybe we went at the wrong time of day (dinner time on a Tuesday night)?  Perhaps it would have been better at lunch time or on a Friday/Saturday night?  Maybe, if we're desperate, we might try again on a more popular night?  

I think the guys are trying hard, because the service was pretty good and hospitable (hence the 1 star).  For us, the service was the only bright spot.  We left a lot of the food picked over and with our pockets $30 lighter.  The waiter came over to the table with a big smile and said "Ain't it good?"  We just didn't have the heart to break it down for him.  It is terrible when you pay for food and it doesn't meet your expectations and you leave hungry...what a waste of time and money :-(

This place was number one on my list of places while in Vegas. I saw the BBQ meatloaf on the travel channel and it was a must try! Glad I did, the flavor exuded through the meatloaf, taste buds were in heaven. The ribs were tender and full of flavor, excellent sides, and the banana pudding topped off the meal. If you love BBQ, you cannot go wrong here. Will be back again before leaving Vegas!!!!

Let's face it people, Las Vegas is not known for epic Barbecue.  For the record, their  infamous burger was a bit lackluster.  The sides were mediocre at best and dessert was just okay.  On a positive note, the service was awesome!  Beware, this restaurant is located next to a strip joint.

Amazing REAL BBQ.   Ribs had a great rub and not drowned in icky sweet sauce.  Sauce was tangy and on the side as I requested.  They were still very tender and tasty.  I got the spareribs after asking their preference and was glad I did.  I also got a lb of brisket and it was so tender, juicy and the meat flavor shined!   To die for.  I had a side of baked beans and while they were good, they were not the best beans I have had but were pretty darn good.  I think they had pulled pork in them  and alot of it!
I had called my order in (after searching yelp) and they were very helpful in recommendations over phone.  When I got there, everyone was friendly.   They offered me a free drink while I waited.  My order was ready in about 2 mins.  They thanked me.  I didn't get a lot of nice service like this in Vegas so it was great to have nice people.  Location is odd and you wouldn't stumble on it.  Go and enjoy real BBQ.  You will not get food like this on the strip.  They do "eat in" also, on nice picnic tables and I loved their drink glasses (nice sturdy to go cup).  I can't give them enough praise.   I WILL BE BACK NEXT TIME IN VEGAS!!

Came here with 4 of my hungry friends and ordered the BBQ Sampler. It was delicious and satisfied our bbq craving after 4th of July. Even though we eat a lot it was enough to make us full. Best BBQ in Vegas imo

All too often we go out for some 'cue only to find that their sauces have gluten-containing ingredients (like malt vinegar, non-GF Worcestershire or soy sauce). Thank you Rollin Smoke for filling that gap! Their sauces are gluten free and the pit master / staff there will guide you through which sides are gluten free too.

Located in an industrial-ish area, yet close to Arts District, Rollin Smoke offers some really nice meats. We always opt for the Rib Platter Special with an extra Beef Rib. Oh my gollys, that beef rib.  Can't describe it without salivating so much!

Now on our last trip there, the pork spare ribs were on the dry side. Nothing that a dousing of sauce could fix, but hopefully they make it better next time.

PS If you're a local, just drive here rather than their location at the Pawn Plaza. Much better experience.

I was really looking forward to trying this spot, I had it in my bookmarks forever! But unfortunately my mind wasn't quite as blown as I had expected. Perhaps I didn't do enough yelp researching to make an educated order. I got the pulled pork and hotlinks with mac and cheese and the corn fritters. The pulled pork and corn fritters were really good, and I love there bbq sauce, but I really didn't care for the hot links or mac n cheese. I do want to go back and try some of the more recommended items. 

To end on a high note, their customer service and hospitality was awesome! This place is kind of located in a sketchy area so I have to admit I was a little intimidated walking in for the first time, but everyone was super welcoming and friendly.

I had not been to Rollin Smoke in a long time and was in the area (sort of) and felt like a little BBQ for lunch.  Dang I missed this place!  It's not far from the strip in distance, yet feels a million miles away.  This hole in the wall restaurant feels like it was transported from some small town down south, not the glitz of Las Vegas (in a good way).  Your olfactory sensors are hit with the heavenly smell of smoked meat even before you cross the threshold (prepare to leave with a new smoke cologne too).  

You counter order and pick up your utensils before heading to a table.  You can sit at the picnic tables by the counter, or cross over into the dining room that houses additional tables and a couple TVs.  Tables are equipped with a roll of paper towels and their signature BBQ sauce, which is a little sweeter than traditional Texas sauce, but good.

This trip we got combo plates of Sliced Brisket with Fried Okra and Pulled Pork with Kicken Beans and Jalapeno Coleslaw.  The brisket and pork were perfect.  Both tender and smokey.  The pork had some awesome burnt end pieces that were fantastic.  The fried okra was good.  The Kicken Beans had some heat and pieces of the smoked meats in the sauce.  Definitely a side I would order again!  I did not care for the Jalapeno Coleslaw too much.  It had a bunch of black pepper that overwhelmed the flavor of the dish.

I need to remember to keep this place in the rotation a little more often!
Absolutely the best BBQ in the city. I always get the trio combo or the 4 meat combo.
A taste of smoked heaven....try it and you'll be blown away, btw try the corn nuggets!

BEST RIBS EVER!   Everything else we had ranged from: OK to very good. But the ribs are truly something special. I've eaten tons of BBQ in my life and I can say without a doubt that Rollin' Smoke has the best ribs I've ever eaten. Kudos!

This is hands down the best BBQ I have ever had.  I had the three meat platter that consisted of beef hot links, ribs and chopped brisket.  It included Cole slaw, and a corn muffin - which was the best I ever had.

I have had both the sliced and chopped brisket and prefer the chopped as it is more moist and juicy...you will defiantly walk away with the meat sweats!

If you are a local from Las Vegas you can save 10% off the bill by letting them know at the register.

If you are in Vegas do not pass up this place if you like bbq!
Rib tips were delicious, staff seemed very dedicated and were die-hard Arkansas fans. It's off the strip and definitely out of the way, but if you want some authentic bbq, I say go for it!

This is rate as my top favorite Will and Liz have great customer service and welcome us Michiganders great love ! Ultimate potatoes is enough to feed four ppl! Rib tips were so tender the dirty rice is so good! I recommend to stop by here when in Vegas

As you enter, the pungent odor of the BBQ smoke greets your nose. Most of the customers seem to be local regulars who come for takeout. A few simple booths and a small dining room, walk up ordering, not fancy in the least but great BBQ. We had the sample platter for 4 plus a rack of St. Louis Ribs, sides of hushpuppies fried okra and greens. The okra was our favorite. The ribs were great, as was the pulled pork. The chicken was good but not outstanding. Give it a try for a totally off the strip authentic experience.

Best B B Q in Las Vegas. I love their ribs, brisket, collard greens, hot links and corn nuggets. Restaurant is a little shall we say rustic but clean. Workers are friendly. Affordable prices.  I definitely will go back the next time I'm in Las Vegas!
Threw up a few times after eating here. The BBQ was good but they use a smoking enhancer that made me barf the next morning.

Wow. What can I say? We found this place on yelp and had to try it. Got there right as they were opening and were greeted by the very friendly staff who helped us navigate through the menu. We ended up going with the all you can eat option for $25. Totally worth it. We got to try everything and had the staff bring us what they thought were the best options. 

If you're in Vegas this is one of the spots you have to try. You wont be disappointed.

We came here for the first time today. They were packed!  We ordered the meatloaf, two meat plate ( brisket and chicken) , and a piggy fry. They accidentally brought us an extra plate of brisket instead of the fries. As soon as we said something the fries were next on the line. The kitchen manager came right out apologized , gave us the brisket and brought out the fries within seconds, he was very friendly.   I thought that was great service. Being born and raised in Las Vegas I have a much higher expectation of service than most others. Anyway the kitchen manager came back out one more time. Offered us free desert , he said " even if you say no I'm bringing it out."  So we asked for the berry cobbler. He returned with his home made banana pudding along with an order of cobbler. The banana pudding was absolutely amazing ! The cobbler was a wine based and was excellent ! Overall the service and the food was wonderful. My father is still raving about his meatloaf and my mother says her chicken was great. I would recommend this place to anyone !

First time in from Los Angeles with my family got the $50 meal it was delicious for a family of 4 and still have leftovers + we made a lil room  for a slice of peach cobbler it was delicious as well Best BBQ in Las Vegas plus people where very friendly and nice will definitely come back
Worst bbq I have ever had. The meat was tough, fatty, and their rub was bland as hell! The only reason I gave them 2 stars instead of 1 was because the mac n cheese I got was fairly decent

Rollin smoke catered a 150+ resident pool party for Sky Las Vegas Condos. Amazing, everyone loved the food. Chef Tim, his crew were on point and everything was served hot, fresh and absolutely delicious! I had so many people tell me "this is their new favorite bbq" We will be using them again!!
I ordered trio meat plate with ribs, hot link and pork. They were all delicious and not dry! They also have 3 different kinds of homemade sauces. Owners are very nice! Best ribs place in town!

If you like Burgers don't skip the outlaw!

The staff is very friendly, and I will be stopping by every time I roll through Vegas.

Do not skip this location.

Went here on Friday night with some friends. This place was packed, but the service was great! I got the rib platter special. While the flavor was good on all of them, the beef rib was the only one that was fall off the bone. The other ribs were pretty tough. I also had the bacon potato salad which was awesome! I tried a bite of the onion strings which were tasty and stole a corn nugget which was really good. All in all, pretty good bbq experience. I would definitely love to go back for the beef brisket sandwich. That is what my friend went with and it looked phenomenal.

The food steals the show in this restaurant.   Due to the popularity with the locals, the establishment is under strain to keep up.

Food: 10/10 - This is where this establishment shines.  True barbeque.  The brisket and ribs have smoke rings in the meat and the building smells great when you walk in.   Great value!   You get a lot of food for not a lot of money.    Served on white bread just like BBQ should be!  

Service: 7/10 - The kitchen really cares about what they are serving.  However the ordering process is under strain to keep up with the largely local patrons who visit.  The line frequently stretches out the door and with one person taking orders the wait can be longer than it takes to eat the food.    The person taking the  orders is friendly and trying hard to keep up but the management needs to improve the infrastructure.  The podium itself is very simplistic and the whole setup is not build to handle a crowd.

Decor: 5/10 - They have a fish tank featured on the tv show "Tanked" but it is in sad shape.  The restaurant is worn out and a bit unorganized comprising of 3 disjointed eating areas.   The eating areas look like they were expanded to meet demand but in an adhoc manner.

Cleanliness: 7/10 -  The area to get your sodas is sub par.  Poor lighting and hidden for first time visitors.   There were no major areas of uncleanliness but the restaurant was not beaming with cleanliness either.   Some improvement is needed.

Parking: 6/10 - Parking can be tight.  Small shared lot.   Note: You are in strip club central in this area.

Restrooms: N/A - Didn't visit.

Overall: 9.5/10 - Don't bother with BBQ on the strip.  This is a local gem if you can go at off peak times or don't mind waiting for your food.  

The food is what brings the locals here and for good reason.   The problems that this establishment faces are good problems to have.  Namely, they are growing fast and are in a phase where they should be planning their next phase of development.  They are in need of a re-haul on the building itself to bring the eating area into one cohesive place with a modern order taking setup.

If they can overcome these obstacles there's no end in sight to the good things that lie ahead at Rollin' Smoke BBQ.

These guys are from Arkansas and boy do the know their BBQ. You just don't find BBQ like this in this town! Loved the baked beans. Will defiantly be back. I have eaten here many times, and had them cater a party. I love their ribs. I don't know where they find ribs with so much meat on the bones but they are fantastic.

Great Barbeque I'm from North Carolina the best barbecue found in Las Vegas it's exactly like the pulled pork from back east and also have all kinds of fun BBQ sauces. Not much of a dining area but it's different than most typical restaurants UC only bad thing is not open at night.

What can I say, best BBQ in Vegas. No question. Everything is yummy but the cornbread is a must. Even the smoked chicken is soft and moist. They don't kill the flavor with too much sauce like some places. Prices are very reasonable, and the staff is super friendly and helpful. The location is in an industrial area but don't let it scare u away. It's a bunch of "normal" people eating inside ;)

Rollin Smoke BBQ is awesome. Found this place on a Yelp search in Vegas where we were just looking for good BBQ. Great menu, food came out quick, prices reasonable. Love the picnic tables out front & the old throw back setting. Totally dig that it's located under a freeway exit off the beaten path. Keep Rollin !!

I see a ton of 5 stars for Rollin Smoke and I can understand why.  I'd give 4.5 for the family atmosphere and the food.  

The brisket was extremely well done and the pulled pork tasted amazing, unfortunately the ribs were a little on the dry side but the sauce they have made up for it.

When we visited here this weekend the owner's mom was there and she was such a sweat heart.  I almost feel bad giving 4 stars just because of her.  

The place itself isn't much to look at and the location is definitely off the beaten path.  

Rollin Smoke is at least worth a trip to give it a try, personally I don't "crave" BBQ all that often and usually Famous Dave's or Lucille's will do the job if I do.  Overall tho, good food, worth a trip to try once, but don't think I'll go out of my way to try again.

Best BBQ I've had!! So glad we found this place. Pork, spare ribs, corn bread, green beans, Mac n cheese, and baked beans were fabulous.. Full of flavor!! I think it's awesome they give locals a discount too!  I will definitely return very soon.

One of the best BBQ I have had in a long time. Great food great service.
We had the rib platter special wow it was amazing.
This place is awesome. I've lived in vegas for 20 years and just found this. I wish I knew about it sooner.

This place is awesome food here is excellent. I would really recommend getting the ribs they are so good. They fall right off the bone yet still retains a nice bite that you would want to get from a good piece of meat. Their sides are also really good the cheesy mac is super creamy and cheesy. 

The prices here are also pretty good. I would not consider it cheap but its a good value for the quality and amount of food you get. 

Service here is really good too. Everybody is really nice and helpful. Sometimes when it gets really busy it gets a little chaotic due to the tight space they have but you can still tell everybody there is giving it their all to try and provide the best service they can.
The food was good for the price. The Mac was good, but everything else was mediocre. The best burger in Las Vegas was good but it was meat loaf, not a burger and for that I am disappointed.

WOW! This place is amazing! I've been to vegas so many times wo even knowing about this place! SO glad I was introduced bc it is seriously one of the BEST bbq I've ever had in my life! Such a RANDOM location, but the definition of a whole in the wall restaurant. Tried the pulled pork sliders, waffle fries & baby back ribs...YUM! The bbq sauce has SUCH flavor & the meat tastes so smoky & DELICIOUS! Do yourself a favor & eat here!

Will be visiting EVERY time I'm in Vegas!

First time in Vegas, but didn't want to eat at typical local tourist-y spots. When I search for food in new locations, I usually search for Mom and Pop shops. This is THE Mom and Pop shop to dine at. The quality was amazing. The succulent beef ribs were cooked to perfection. My only regret was not ordering the buffet option and only being able to visit once. If I ever step foot in Vegas again, this is the spot I'll return to; and not just a single visit either. My suggestion is to with a group, order the buffet, and try everything on the damn menu!

Great, great, great BBQ. I had the Brisket 3 ways. All the meat was cooked to perfection. Loved the variety of sauces. If you're in Vegas and want to have a little taste of Murica' served with a side of freedom, this is the place!

Back here again!  If you guys are into bbq and are in Vegas, check it out.  Great service and awesome brisket and ribs.  Always friendly staff is awesome and the prices are more than reasonable!  Missed the owner this trip.  She's normally there all the time cleaning up and speaking to all her guests.

It's perfect.  A hole in the wall place located 5 minutes off the strip.  I've been coming to Vegas for years and never even thought of barbeque.  It's what you would expect to find for great food.  Don't run away as you will miss a great find.  Seating is limited so don't be afraid to share a table.  There was a line when we showed up so we had to wait about 15 minutes just to order.  Another 20 minutes for the food to arrive which we thought was long but hey, we had good table conversation.  The food was great.  I had a trio combo of sliced brisket, ribs and hot link.  I really didn't need sauce on any of it as it was great but I love the way sauce tastes.  The table sauce was super but there're some other sauces near the counter that you need to get and fill a little cup.  These are worth exploring.  Although I'm sure there are better place across the nation, this is a great place to feed an angry hangover.

My family and I went there on 6/15/16 and we had the full rack of ribs, pulled brisket, mac and cheese, and baked beans. Everything was good especially the mac and cheese but I did wish for some kind of green side besides coleslaw. The seating area is small with a long family style table in the middle and a wrap around bar. The staff was super friendly.

Was not impressed
Pulled pork was dry & brisket did not taste seasoned at all
Im not sure why my experience varies so greatly from the 4 & 5 start reviews but it certainly was not worth the price I paid

I do not usually take the time to make Yelp reviews (or at least, not to actually comment), but I had to share this secret with everyone... Rollin Smoke is the real deal!  I was in Vegas on a business trip and tried it on a lark... Where have you been all my life, Rollin Smoke Barbeque?!

As soon as I walked in, I could smell it... That authentic smoke that portents rich, savory flavor in meat (if it is done correctly, and Dusty - the proprietor of this gem - does it correctly).

Their prices were definitely solid for definitely solid for the portion size, which is a pretty remarkable thing in Vegas.  There is even a 10% off coupon on their website!  I got the all-you-can-eat deal (which is all you can eat of anything on their menu... anything!) because I wanted to try a bit of many different things, and it was $21.50 after coupon.  But their other meals and combos were very reasonably priced as well.

Now for the feast... I tried sausage, brisket, hot wings, spare ribs, and beef ribs, but they also had shrimp, catfish, baby back ribs, chicken, hush puppies, beans, and on and on and on.  The sausage was solid with a nice little kick.  The brisket was a little lean, but very tender and tasty.  I got the "Damn Hot" hot wings (I have won several wing challenges in my day), and I don't know if they were trying harder to hurt me than normal, but they were HOT, with a building heat that walked that line between pleasure and pain.  All of that was great, but the ribs really shined.  The spare ribs were large and meaty, with a deep-down smoke flavor that spoke volumes about the slow care that went into their creation.  And the beef ribs, which Dusty insisted I try, were the coup de gras... Meaty, mild, flavorful, and tender... The best beef ribs I have ever had, no contest!  And how did I finish this homage to gluttony?  With a homemade bread pudding (covered in whiskey sauce) that was heavenly!!

Dusty himself chatted with me and my friends for a bit - telling us about his cooking process, the pride he (as Pit Master) takes in his food, and the labor of love his restaurant has become - and we even got to meet the special chef whose grandmother's bread pudding recipe would now forever haunt my dreams.

This is THE hidden gem of Las Vegas...  I have lived all throughout the South (Texas, Georgia, Virginia, and everywhere in between), and this is the BEST BARBEQUE I HAVE EVER HAD!!  If you like barbeque, and you are coming to Las Vegas, I highly recommend you give this place a shot.

Note to Guy Fieri: this place needs to be on Diners, Drive-ins and Dives, immediately!
Amazing ..  So good. Lots of people here, but so worth the wait. It smells amazing and tastes even better

Hands down one of the best burgers I've ever had!  The Outlaw Burger!  When the unique ingredients are combined they become something out of this world!  And after you add their spiciest sauce... so much win!  Crispy meets juicy!  Gotta show those waffle fries love too!

The food and the service here is the BEST! 

We literally ordered for 20 people and handled everything so smoothly. When our order came out (which it was super fast too we waited like 15 minutes) they gave us a printer box to carry everything cause we had so much. 

Okay for the food some of my favorites were: 
+ BURNT ENDS are a must get! Super tasty and soft.. 
+ Ribs: Literally just fell off the bone when I was trying to eat it. It's that tender. Oh and it's marinated perfectly fine. 
+ Mac & Cheese - Ooey goeey goodness. Totally must get.
+ Corn Nuggets
+ Waffle Fries

There's also an AYCE option for 35 which considering the ribs is already 18 I suppose it's a good deal (if you can eat that much :p).

I searched best bbq in Las Vegas and this hidden gem popped up. When I first pulled in I was a little hesitant. It is right next to a strip club. Ordering is a breeze. We ordered 2 entrees and it came out to 40ish and some change. I got the meatloaf and omg it was such a heaping size and it was delish! I would come back! Service was great food was great everything was great.

Good food. Terrible service. Indifferent staff. 
My friend who ordered right after me got his order 40 minutes before I did. They lost my order twice--I asked for help when I watched the 25 people who were after me in line get their food while I still waited. 
  Employee checked in the back, disappeared for awhile. I wait ten more minutes and then find her again. This time she asks for my receipt and disappears for another ten minutes. Only sheepish apologies are offered

While I like the food, I would probably not go here again because of their indifferent attitude about their service error.

I am very picky when it comes to bbq outside of my family.  Not only was the BBQ on point (delicious), we had outstanding customer service.

The location is off the beaten path, but there was ample parking and easy to find using our navigation system.  I would consider this spot to be a step up from a whole in the wall kind of place, but it was clean and very good.  Don't take my word, try for yourself and I know you will be pleased.
Best BBQ I've had so far. Great hospitality chef Tim and chef Will. Got the 5 meat special with 3 sides . Good for 2-3 people

They practically were out of EVERYTHING when I got there towards the end of the night so my options were limited. I went with the hot links sandwich, cornbread and waffle fries (dinner of champions, right?).  

The sausage was seasoned so well I didn't need sauce -- but I would recommend getting peppers, pickles & onions on it. The waffle fries were a little undercooked but whatevs, still decent. The cornbread was AMAZING -- oh my god. I'm a cornbread enthusiast and wow! I highly recommend you give the cornbread a try.
