Great smoke house. Had the beef ribs and sampled the pork. These guys get it. Tender with a lot of smoke flavor.

This is our sacred home bbq speaking. Every year we travel from Mexico city to NAB and RS bbq. Justin, the cheff really cares for service and flavor; Lou the other cheff really achieves perfection in all of the menu dishes. While Matt and Dan are always friendly, smiling and moving lightning fast to fullfill all your bbq needs. Dont miss this spot in Vegas. Try the D Delicious sampler or the Outlaw burguer for a slice of heaven. Peace.
By far the best BBQ in Vegas!!!. Not a big fan of the Green Onions garnish. Kinda of makes it look a too gourmet "ish"... Otherwise great stuff! Love the sauce!!
Extremely friendly staff. The food was delicious, it was moist, juicy, fall of the bone well seasoned. Be prepared to leave smelling like smoke.

This place is amazing!!!  The smoked beef ribs are ridiculous.  The pork ribs are so good.  Best chicken wings I have ever had, they are also smoked!  The smoke does 98% of the flavoring and the BBQ sauce is the final enhancement.   The mac n' cheese is creamy and rich.  The guys that work there are really friendly and helpfull.  This will be a stop for me every time I come back to Las Vegas!

Came here with my boys the other day.  This is definitely a gem located in a hole in a wall in the middle of red light district.  We were a little skeptical at first but since the reviews were great, we decided to go inside and try it out.

The place is not that big but it is full of people.  It smells great inside... something you would expect in a bbq joint.  You pick a table then go to the guy where you can place your order and pay.  They will then bring you your food.  Drinks and utensils are self served.  

The menu is filled with great selection of yummy food. We ordered the following (our eyes were bigger than our stomach for sure):

1) The Pit Special (4 choices of meat + 3 sides) -  We picked the brisket, pulled pork, double on the spare ribs, corn nuggets, bacon potato salad & mac & cheese.  The brisket was disappointing coz it was dry. The pulled pork has great flavor. The ribs is perfect! I love love the ribs... glad we doubled up on this.  The corn nuggets and bacon potato salad are amazing!  The mac & cheese is ok, had better.

2) Meatloaf + corn bread for his side - my son loved this one. The meat taste great but the onion rings are overpowering for me (not a big fan of onions). Now the corn bread is to die for!  It's moist and totally delish... one of the best that I've had. 

3) Chicken Wings (Buffalo) + Waffle Fries - my husband loved the hot sauce but he said the wings was alright (he had the hot sauce on the side). The waffle fries was not bad but it wasn't great either.

4) Banana Pudding - this was disappointing for me. It taste like it came out of a package. 

Overall, this place is definitely a keeper for us.  We are all looking forward on coming back to try the other food on their menu.  The price is not bad, food is great, ambiance is casual & food servings are good size.

Went here today and it was off the hook.  Im from Louisiana and my buddy is from Tennessee and this joint is by far the best BBQ in Vegas.   It definitely brings the southern feel to Vegas....  chef is awesome......

Most incredible BBQ place ever!!!! The hospitality is amazing. Didn't realize that they were closed on a Sunday so me and 3 friends were waiting outside for an uber and the owner brought us out some ribs to have since we were so bummed to find out that they were closed!! Nicest guys ever. And best BBQ I've ever tasted, and I'm from the south!! Highly highly recommend this place to anyone looking for great BBQ from great people. Thank you!!

Cutest little hole in the wall BBQ place. Went with a couple friends and we all ordered something different to try each other's dishes and were not disappointed. All the meats were moist and smoked to perfection, sauces were full of flavor, and the best pickles I've had in a long time! Server were extremely friendly and treated you like family when you walked through the doors. If you're into a home-y, country atmosphere, this is the place to be!
BBQ doesn't get much better than this out West. This has become a must have every time we go to Vegas. The food is on point never takes too long to get. Great selections and REAL sweet tea.

Yummy!!  Called a few hours before we ordered to ask questions. Gentleman was very nice and answered all of my questions. Ribs are awesome!!!  Also ordered a BBQ sampler. Omg!!!  Everything is awesome!!  Corn nuggets are corn fritters if you are southern lol. They are bite size and awesome!  Baked beans and chipotle coleslaw are also amazing!!!  Just so you know, spicy sauce is very spicy!  I love spice, but I mixed mine with the house sauce, which is also amazing!!  Loaded mashed potatoes include bacon, green onion, bell pepper and cheese. If you want great BBQ, you must check this place out!!!

I moved out to Las Vegas a few months ago, and nothing has inspired me to write a review until now. 

I did a cross country roadtrip where I was able to sample BBQ from some of the best southern BBQ joints I could find -- and Rollin Smoke BBQ is amazing! Not as good as Texan bbq, but this is just as close to the Lone Star state it'll get! WAYYYYYYYYY better than Famous Dave's. Oh boy, do I hate Famous Daves -- such an insult to BBQ.

Atmosphere -- super laid back, picnic table, and family style. Very casual dining. 

Boyfriend and I shared a 4 meat platter, we had: RIBS, BRISKET, CHICKEN, and PULLED PORK. We went a bit crazy with the sides because we wanted to try everything -- loaded mashed potatoes, hush puppies, mac and cheese, cole slaw, onion rings, and waffle fries.

Everything was so good! My favorite was the pulled pork, it was seasoned really well and so tender. Close second -- the bbq chicken. SUPER JUICY! The brisket was melt in your mouth, a bit over seasoned for me. Ribs were okay, not the best I've had ever, but were good. 

All sides taste home made. My favorite were the hush puppies, mac and cheese (SO CREAMY), and loaded mashed potatoes. 

I kept seeing people order the Outlaw burger. ONLY SMOKES! It's humungus! Definitely trying that next time I come back! 

All in all -- bf and I are super excited to have a bbq joint we love and can bring family/friends to! We will definitely be coming around whenever we are near the strip. Definitely a must try if you are in the area!
What a Gem.  I am a Weekend BBQ ER  the food is awesome and the service was great too. I'm afraid this place is so so good that it won't be my secret anymore.

Rollin Smoke Barbeque was the first restaurant that I tried when I got to Vegas. I ordered the combo plate (ribs and brisket) with a side of coleslaw and mac n cheese. 

The ribs were perfectly seasoned, and the meat just fell off the bones. It was barky, tasty, and smoky. I loved that the ribs were garnished with spring onions on top. 

The brisket was just as amazing as the ribs. It was moist and had lots of flavor to it . Their seasoning had some secret spices in it, it was not your typical Texas seasoning. I liked the fact that they only put a tiny bit of sauce on their brisket. They didn't drown their meat with sauce. The meat was flavorful to a point that I decided to scratch the sauce off the meat. The brisket also had a great bark. You know what: it was barky, tasty and smoky.

Sadly, the sides were not on par with the meats. The coleslaw was bland, and the mac n cheese was too runny. It didn't taste fresh to me. I usually don't care about the sides as much as I care about the meat. I will be back next time that I am in Vegas.
This place is AMAZING! It's a short uber ride off the strip but well worth it. Definitely a small hometown type feel to the place.

LIP SMACKING BARBEQUE NOURISHED FROM THE GODS THEMSELVES.

Seriously this place precedes itself. Just so you can understand the level that Rollin Smoke is on they were awarded for top 20 best bbq restaurants in america from localeats AND best burger in vegas seven. Yeah...they're pretty epic.

It's pretty easy to miss this place, they're near the cross streets highland and desert inn, inside a signless plaza. Just look for a grill outside and you'll be fine. The vibe of the place is very relaxed mixed with decorations of tshirts, a pig, awards, and a mural. A big plus in my book is the amount of seating they have, from the times I went I never had to fight for a table. 

Customer service? Always on point. They strive for it. Anything wrong with what you're eating? They'll fix it. They always have a guy walking around asking people if they're doing fine. 

If you're coming here for the first time you should definitely try the rib tips, and outlaw burger. It takes a while for the outlaw burger to cook, nonetheless it's worth the wait. Let me start off with the rib tips. You can order 1/2 pound or a pound, if you're eating with a group of people, just share a pound it'll be more than enough. Their rib tips are mouthwatering!!! Cooked to perfection. And when you get those fatty pieces in your mouth you can taste the definition of a good bbq. The outlaw burger is just as satisfying. Let me just list the ingredients in the burger it has; brisket, onions, bell pepper, onion strings, red cabbage, slaw, lettuce, tomato, cheddar cheese, and chipotle ailoi. Yeah, all that in a burger. You know that one question? What do you want to eat before you die? This might be the answer.

Tip: There's no shame in getting your hands dirty and pigging out. Dam son just eat that bbq! And you can order to-go over the phone!

BEST BBQ in Vegas!!! Everytime we have come to Vegas we make it a point to come to Rolling Smoke! Brisket is always on point, ribs are tender and fall off the bone! Collard greens, and yams on the side are the best! Cornbread is moist and fluffy. Sweet tea is perfect! Service and staff is amazing!! Definately a restaurant you want to visit!

The food here is smokin', rollin', and amazin'! This was the food highlight of my Vegas trip and it was amazingly delicious! The parking lot and surrounding area may look a bit sketchy, but the restaurant itself isn't!  The staff was friendly and we got our food about 10 mins in, not bad! 

I got the duo choice of meat with sliced briskets and two spare ribs. The meat was tender, full of flavor, and cooked perfectly. I like sauce on my barbecue and their Arkansas sauce did not disappoint. The sweet bbq sauce was  also great although their spicy sauce was a bit underwhelming. Portions are great and filling, you get your money's worth here. 

The sides were just as outstanding. I got a side of mac and cheese and corn nuggets. Best mac and cheese I've had! Not many restaurants meet my expectations for good mac and cheese, but theirs were all the right amounts of cheesy flavor and taste. The corn nuggets were also amazing and rightfully hyped. They were a great combination of crispy on the outside and sweet inside with bits of corn.

If you're a fan of barbecue, you must make a stop here on your next Vegas trip, I certainly will!
Literally some of the best bbq I have ever had.  I wish there was better seating, but I'll be back no matter what!
Holy expensive!  We got like 4 bites of briquette for around $12, not worth my time or money, at that price for that small amount, I expect the best I've ever tasted and this was NOT it.

Amazing, amazing, amazing! Our first stop when we get to Vegas. Hands down best BBQ I've ever had. Such tender, flavorful masterfully cooked meats and super yummy sides. Cute decor & extremely friendly staff. Wish they had one in Cali!

Excellent bbq by really nice people. We had a mixture of sandwiches. Pulled pork, brisket, hot link, and pulled chicken. Great waffle fries and greens. Enjoyable first visit. Great bbq flavors and good sauce. What more could you ask for.

We got take out and the sauces are awesome!  We'll be back soon, the brisket is pretty freakin good!!

Definitely recommend!!!!

Loved the food!!!   The only reason why I did not give it 5 stars because the set up is a bit confusing. 2 entrance doors one to the dinning area and the other to the main entrance with a few tables, does not have any signage IE seat your self, order here...  So at first we sat down and waited 10 minutes and we realized that we had to order up front.  The menu is massive with all these delectable choices and sides and the smell inside makes you even hungrier.  The writing on the board on the wall is a bit small and intimidating since there are so many things to choose from.  When you get to the counter they only have one menu for you to look at so it holds up the line when you are trying to order.  I chose the mixed platter and the girl at the counter choose my meats and I had potato salad and mac n cheese as my sides, friend ordered all you can eat.  Food took a little bit longer than I would have wanted to but it was 4th of July weekend so it is totally understandable.  When our food arrived it was hot, and it looked amazing.  The food tasted even better than it looked if that is even possible.  I had baby, short and beef ribs and my friend had one of everything on the all you can eAt.  The ribs were perfectly cooked nice bite to it but still fell off the bone.  The bbq sauce on the table was refilled while we were still eating and it was warm and complimented the ribs perfectly.  These guys definitely know what they are doing and they have the recipe for success.  

Just a suggestion for first timers (I will be coming back and I will have your system down) 
Place a hostess podium with menus, make signage saying pick up menu, wait in line, place order and find a seat.  By having menus available people will stand in line less time and it will be easier for the order takers to expedite service.  Other than that I have absolutely nothing negative to say.

Thank you for all the delicious food you are serving us.

This was a great find. When we arrived they welcomed us as if we were family coming over for a southern lunch. The sweet tea is just that. We ordered the rib platter, catfish, peach cobbler with the corn 'out of this world' nuggets, yams, and the fresh picked GREENS. Since we ordered so much food for only 2, we were expecting a huge To Go bag. By the time we finished, we had a half of beef rib left and our dessert. We have plans to go back for the meatloaf.  By the way, this my first Yelp review ever.  They deserve it.  Thank you Mama & Chef Tim.
The best burnt ends in town. Smoked and tender to perfection. I don't need any additional sauces with this meal. Burntendmazing.

Don't make it out to Vegas often but this time I came prepared. How does driving 700 miles round trip for takeout sound?

Back in Vegas for the 2015 Olympia Pro Powerlifting Competition and I told my group, before we leave we are going to Rollin Smoke so we can eat & I can bring some Q home. This place seems to do everything right. While there, we had the ribs, meatloaf, burger, fries & mac n cheese. For my takeout I got some burnt ends, hotlinks and more meatloaf.

Disappointed in nothing. Amazed by everything.
The most amazing BBQ I have had my lips around. It's right on par with Franklen's BBQ in Texas. SOOOOO GOOOOD!

I haven't eaten at this establishment. I just watched the staff prepare the food on the travel channel.  No one wears gloves. The RAW MEAT LOAF IS MIXED WITH BARE HANDS!  When "liquids" are added...more bare hands.  Meat cooked more bare hands...oh my.

Holy smoke this place was amazing! Had the duo meat plate with brisket and pork with an a la carte order of the beef rib. Everything was fall off the bone tender and juicy, my only regret was not getting the all you can eat for 25 (including the drink I paid 20 anyways) and trying even more of the menu

BEST BBQ IN VEGAS!!!!! this place is awesome. the food was moist and tender the house sauce was out of this world delicious. I asked if they had a spicy BBQ sauce and the response was " challenge accepted". House sauce + Trinidad Scorpion = happy me. not only was it hot but the flavor was even better than the original sauce. 

Bottom line if you are in Vegas and like BBQ or Super Spicy food this is your place!!!

This is one of the best BBQ spots I've had the pleasure to eat at. Don't pass this place up if you're in the mood for some real southern eats.  It's located under a freeway overpass, in a tiny strip mall and easy to miss. The staff is real friendly and likes to chat with everyone. I ordered the Tri-Tip sandwitch and it was amazing.

Yes, yes, yes!  Now I usually don't like to buy BBQ, cause my husband has his BBQ business.  But we've been hearing so much about this place.  We have a friend that works in the area, we called him to meet us there.  Well he knows the owner well.  Our friend didn't get to eat with us, but the owner chit chatted with us, and then told the cashier to give us 20% off.  That was cool, so I got cat fish with fries, and my husband got a combo BBQ plate!  Yes, I loved the cat fish, yes, I loved the ribs, sausage, and the brisket! Only thing we weren't crazy about were the sides!  I had Mac n cheese, it was kinda weird, I've never had it like that before, it was creamy mac n cheese, with some sprinkled cheese on top!   And we didn't care about the potato salad.  Just give me some corn on the cob, and I would be good.  But service was good, the owner was really cool.   I could see us coming back for sure!

This place is all its cracked up to be! We looked up best BBQ in Vegas and after some debate/argument we agreed to eat here. Rolling up you might want to turn around, but dont! This place is the real deal! The inside is not that fancy, but who cares right as long as the food is legit. I would pride myslef as a BBQ snob and this joint hit all the marks. I walked up ordered the 3 meat combo with pulled pork, tri tip and ribs. Couldn't decide on the sides so just ordered some extras like okra, cole slaw, waffle fries and potato salad and boy was that a mistake afterwards. I needed to be wheeled out! This has to be one of the best BBQ joints I have been to outside the rib cook off in Reno and this place has every right to stand off to any National Rib Champion. What sealed the deal for me was the owner and his customer service. This guy was hustling all over the restaurant checking on tables making sure everyone had what they needed. They missed a side off our order and I offered to pay for it and he refused. At another table someone asked how good something was on the menu he brought them out a sample! This doesn't happen in most places today or the level of customer service. 
Then to top it off we meet this nice family while we are eating and they talk us into sampling their banana pudding desert. At first I was like no way I to full then my daughters almost refused to leave before trying so I gave in. This thing put me over the edge but wow was it good! similar to ice cream pudding only fills the cracks when your full...well worth trying or taking some home. This is a must when your in Vegas!

4.5 stars,

This is one of the more popular places to eat in Vegas. Located off the strip, it's kinda nice getting away from all the madness and enjoy a good meal. Although this is a smaller restaurant, the food is excellent. It's worth the wait..

We ordered all types of bbq, some of my favorites were the huge chicken wings. You can get them in all types of flavor, we got the honey bbq. They were delicious. Also, we had some tri tip, chopped and whole. The meat was super tender.. and it had the nice bbq/smoked taste I love. Nothing is better than some legit bbq with the smoked flavor, you can tell they spent a lot of time preparing and cooking the meats. They have all types of meat, to satisfy all your cravings.

Prices are pretty decent for some good bbq, it's never cheap. You get what you pay for, and everything is worth it in my opinion. This place is definitely a must go if you're visiting Vegas.

By far the best BBQ in Las Vegas! Absolutely amazing food and great service, if your looking for real BBQ in Las Vegas this is definitely the place! Amazing section of items to choose from. I definitely recommend the all-you-can-eat for $26 and that includes everything on the menu.
pure bbq heaven! love them, fast services.. super nice! the best bbq in vegas
Great BBQ, glad to finally find some good smoked BBQ in Vegas. The location is out of the way but the food is worth it. I absolutely love the brisket, can't wait to go back

Started coming here when the 2 meat lunch combos were $9 with side and drink. Used to have the best BBQ for the price. Since they got big, prices when up, quality slipped a bit. I used to call this place great, now I call it good. Still eat here on occasion. Arkansas BBQ is yummy.

Oh man I love me some BBQ, I always order me some ribs and this place is pretty damn good. I had to try a bit of everything so I got the basket with chicken, ribs, hot links and brisket with sides of onion strings, Mac n cheese and bacon potato salad. And for dessert, carmel cake! Hands down delicious! Haven't tried anything in comparison within Vegas.
Not really impressed. Lots of good reviews, but not a good place to sit down and eat. Food wasn't that great. There are many other great BBQ places in town.

Wow. Just wow. Succulent, smokey, melt in your mouth meat. Everything is so flavorful and savory. There's really nothing to complain about here. Prices are very reasonable, food came out quick, and the staff was very helpful telling you what's good. Definitely a new can't-miss stop for future Vegas trips.

Mac n cheese awsome but i didnt really like the bbq im sorry ive eaten at better places .i think famous daves its better .you people put to much pepper in your foods not good .besides that place is clean

First time at Rollin Smoke. Absolutely the bomb. The rib tips were smoked perfectly. They didn't need any sauce, but the Carolina sauce just complemented the rib nicely. The brisket dog was a meal in itself. The three meat combo was more than we could eat.

My son is a local and read many articles on this las vegas "find". word is out that rollin' smoke  has authentic,serious,very tasty BBQ. You will definitely need your GPS to find this place but it is well worth the search. I sense most folks get their orders to go here although they have a decent sized dining area. pretty spartan no frills establishment. my wife enjoyed her catfish po boy...with hush puppies and cole slaw. my son and I each had the meat sampler.....spare ribs,brisket and chicken got our highest grades. Help aren't really friendly but they get your food out without much of a wait. prices are extremely reasonable and as I said..,.the food is very good. close your eyes and you'll swear you are in KC or Memphis.

I've had this place cater my work's Las Vegas location before, but since my office is in Los Angeles, I never actually got to try it.  Our Las Vegas crew raved about it though.  Finally, when I made it out to Vegas for the millionth time we decided to swing by for some finger lickin' BBQ.  It's located quite a ways off the strip, just down the street from Spearmint Rhino, in an industrial looking area.  It's a pretty small place, but it's got some BIG flavors.   I got the 3 meat plate, since I felt like I had to stuff my face the first time to make sure I tried all the good stuff.  I picked the brisket (which is chopped unless you ask otherwise), chicken, and ribs.  For my side, I had the macaroni and cheese.  The boyfriend had the Big Hawg (pulled pork sandwich).  We didn't realize that they'd put an entire pig's worth of pulled pork in that sandwich, but we're not complaining.  The pulled pork was very tender and juicy, and the sandwich was stuffed with a whole pig, coleslaw and some delicious bbq sauce.  My 3 meats were pretty good as well, the chopped brisket had nice crispy pieces and nice juicy/tender pieces.  It was a good balance.  The chicken wasn't anything stellar, but it was good.  I really enjoyed the ribs though.  I'm not a huge rib eater because I don't really like to get my hands dirty, but these ribs fell right off the bone.  I'm totally down with that.  I'd skip the mac and cheese and go for the dirty rice (if you're brave enough) next time.  I had a few bites of my friends' rice, and I fell in love and then became insanely jealous.  

The staff here is super friendly and attentive.  They'd come out and check on you every now and then to make sure that you have everything you need.  The place is clean, but seating is limited.  We got there at just about 11AM, and it was empty, but moments later it filled up quick.  They also have several different BBQ sauces out for you to try as well.  I liked the spicy one, it went well with the brisket.  I may have to add Rollin' Smoke to my list of places that I must visit when I come to Vegas.  That list is getting long, and it's getting difficult to get through the list each time.  Damn you Vegas for having such good food!

I read about this place in the LV weekly, and after all the rave they gave them, I decided to try it for myself. I've visited rolling smoke a total of three times, and every time I try something different that was just as good, if not better than the last item.

First a warning, as soon as you walk into this place, you will experience an instant uncontrollable flow of saliva. The smell is just AMAZING! Now that you've been warned, lets begin with the menu. My absolute favorite is the rib plate and the brisket. The ribs are tender, full of flavor and just come off the bone with ease. The brisket is equally as delicious, with a good variety of BBQ sauces to complement the already great smoked flavor. 

A few tips:
The place to me seems a little hidden, so GPS it for easy directions. You WILL come out smelling like smoke. The staff is helpful, so if you are unsure of what to get, just ask for their recommendations. 

Bon appetit!

As I write this I am about 60 minutes removed from the table and I am uncomfortably full yet wholly content. I was told about Rollin' Smoke Barbeque about a week ago and I have been wanting to try it since.  I can check that off the list now.  I went with a co-worker, the very same man who told me about it in the first place.  Immediately upon my exit of the car in the tiny parking lot I noticed the smell of BBQ smoke.  It was only enhanced as I entered the establishment.  Aside from the delicious smell of BBQ, which has permeated every fiber of my clothing and still lingers, I was greeted by a huge version of their menu posted to the wall.  I opted for the smaller hand held version though.  It was easier to read.  After looking at said menu for a few minutes I decided on the brisket dog.  I also ordered a side of corn nuggets based on reccomendations from my dining acquaitance of the day.  The hot dog was immense to the point where I gave up eating it with my hands and went with the fork and knife method.  It was a heavy gauge dog with a fantastic red color and the nice snap of a natural casing.  But it was difficult to actually see that beneath the truck load of fried onions, chopped brisket and nacho cheese.  What a gut buster this behemoth is.  Then there are the corn nuggets.  Little bite sized fried pieces of corny goodness.  It is best described as fried creamed corn.  It is crunchy on the outside and creamy on the inside with the sweetness I have grown to love.  Frying it just adds to the alure.  After eating the dog and these corn nuggets along with drinking a cup of lemonade, I am stuffed.

Good smokey bbq with some very nice owners
Typically going to Vegas it's the same restaurants or small food/snack shops that keeps the stomach satisfied, but on the last trip a couple friends decided to come here for a birthday dinner. Upon reaching the premises my nose was hit with the mouth watering smell of bbq.
Our party of 18 or so people were given a spot at an empty room and were greeted with great enthusiasm and hospitality. My gf and I were probably the 4th to put in the order of the Outlaw burger and the Rib Plater special. After waiting in the room slowly everyone started to get their food and were enjoying the dinner while we waited. After coming in to check on us (forgot the gentlemen's name) he explained the food was forgotten or being remade, which I can't remember, but long story short they got us the food and also gave us a free A LA MODE Black berry cobbler.

Rating of the burger and ribs

-Jaw dropping sized burger filled with such tasty bbq flavor that's complimented with the onion strings (DROOOL)
-Very flavorful sauce (More on the tangy side) on the ribs and the meat slides right off
-The cobbler is something that needs to be ordered either by you or someone in your party. I was so full after the burger and a few ribs but was able to have a bite off the cobbler and it was amazing. Full of flavor and just takes over all that meat/bbq flavor in your mouth.

This place is right next to my work and i pass by everyday and decided to finally stop and try it and the food was amazing. Ill be eating here often and if your in vegas this is a must stop if you love good bbq.

So it was our first time coming here. We pulled up and it was in the most random area ever lol. But gps does amazing things. When we went inside, we didn't know what to order! The cashier told us about something (I can't remember the name but it's 5 meats and 3 sides) which sounded perfect for two people! We got the meats and it was like 3 ribs, pulled pork, chopped up brisket, chicken, and sausage. The sausage was perfect. It was spicy, but not too much to where you can't taste it. The flavor in that was amazing! The pulled pork was so damn tender and fell apart perfectly. Brisket is normally dry when I go to other places and it's always chopped into big awkward pieces but I love how small these were cut because it savored alllll the juices. Now what's better than juicy brisket?! And finally the chicken was the least dry chicken I've ever had! 




Now for the sides....

The Mac n cheese, my only complaint was that I wish the cheese on top was melted but other than that it was delicious. It was so creamy and amazing. We also got the mashed potatoes. It had bacon so it was automatically amazing so there's that. And the corn nuggets were so good for something so simple. 


To top it off, as we were leaving the owners mom was talking to me and she's so sweet and amazing. She's so proud of her son and does anything to help him. I felt the love through the food as well. I can't wait to be back. I found my favorite bbq place in Vegas!

Heard about this place in Vegas Seven, and had to try it. I'm so glad I did!

I went with my boyfriend and he got the pulled pork sandwich with the bacon potato salad. I got the 2 plate combo with brisket and pulled pork, and yams as the side. We got a free dessert for checking in and got the banana pudding. It was awesome! 

Everything was delicious! Best BBQ I've had in Vegas. Service is great too. We talked to the chef for a little while we ate and he was really friendly. We'll be back :)

I am literally experiencing a food coma because of this place. Although everything was amazing, my favorite items were the corn nuggets and brisket. I got the 4 meat and 3 side plate that came with a drink for $20 + tax and tip. It was a great decision. Anyways, I was worried about the wait for the food, because the joint was packed. It took less than ten minutes for us to receive our order. I will definitely be back.

This was truly the best BBQ I have ever had and that includes numerous stops in throughout Texas, Kansas City, and the Carolinas. The Burnt Ends were indescribably excellent. The Baked Beans were perfect and the Brisket melted in your mouth. Nothing that was served required sauce. I did try their original BBQ Sauce and it was very good!  

Be prepared to pay cash. When we went in on 22 July, their credit card system was not working,  but they had someone there working on it. 

This place is a little hard to find, but absolutely make the effort to get there if you are A BBQ fan.

Best BBQ hands down! This will be a Vegas regular. 
Great service fantastic owners! Come on in for some great food!

Top notch bbq! The pulled pork sandwiches are delicious. They used to park on valley view and russell and we frequently visted them at least once a week. The ribs were good as well, but I can dig in like I want in a shirt and tie.

I gotta visit again!

Tonight was a good night for new culinary experiences. After watching the new Maleficent movie and having a few glasses of wine, we decided to make our way to Rollin Smoke. I have heard nothing but great things about this place. After checking Yelp, I noticed their 4.5 star overall rating with about 500 reviews. OH-EM-GEE, how have NOT been to this place yet?!?!

It's not surprise, this place is in the middle of an industrial area, right under the freeway and next to all the strip clubs. Sketchy as heck, but holy smoker in their parking lot! The aroma of smoked meats filled the air. I didn't care what the outside looked like, I was more interested in what they had to offer! The inside of the joint is a down home BBQ joint! Different reds and yellows adorn the wall, different rooms to accommodate different types of parties. They have a few rooms and even outside space. There were metal table tops, wooden benches, TVs in each room and a mirage on the back wall of the room we chose to dine in.On every table there was a bottle of their homemade BBQ sauce. It was more of a vinegar base, a little too tangy but that's just my own taste. The staff was super efficient. The guy who took my order, I think was one of the owners. He was super personable and really seemed to care about how things were going, how I liked my food and really thanked me for coming in. For my meal, I wanted to try a few things. Here's what I got:

Half slab of beef ribs, 2 bones, for $15.99. This Smokin Plate came with a side, I chose collard greens, corned bread or roll and a drink. The beef ribs were the best beef ribs I've ever had! It literally just fell off the bone, no joke. The rub they used brought so much flavor to the rib! Every bite was juicy, flavorful and packed with smokey goodness. The collard greens were cooked with brisket, had a little spice and vinegar and so good!

Pulled piggy sandwich for $7.99. **There's a Yelp special when you check in** Every sandwich purchase comes with a free dessert. I chose the peach cobbler (usually for $3.99). The pulled pork sandwich was made with chopped pork, not finely shredded. I loved that because the meat had some depth to it. It was served on a hot dog bun which was different but seemed to work! The corn bread side was buttery and moist, probably the best corn bread I've ever had! I made a comment that my grandma's corn bread was unbelievable but this one gave my grandma's bread a run for it's money (Sorry grandma!).  As my free dessert, the peach cobbler was gooey and filled with chunks of peaches. 

I must say, this is THE BEST BBQ joint in Las Vegas, hands down. I've had a few BBQ joints here before but nothing compares to Rollin Smoke. This place really does a great job at serving great food. When I'm here, it's just good ole country fun. Looking around the dining area, every party seemed to have a huge smile on their face. I've been to lots of places down south, from Nashville, to Louisville, to Charlotte. BBQ joints different where every go but when you're in Las Vegas, you REALLY need to get your butts down here. You will NOT be disappointed!

I have been dying to try this place since I moved to town. The meat was everything I imagined. I got the double meat plate with 2 orders of ribs (4 ribs total) and bacon potato salad for the side. So delicious! The meat was so tender and full of flavor. It had a beautiful smoke ring on it and the house sauce was a perfect compliment to the rich, smokey meat. 

The reason I gave 3 stars is because of the cashier. He could not crack a smile if his life depended on it. After the person in front of me was done ordering, I gave him a second to finish up until he called us and was ready to take our order. When he did, he acted like we were the stupid ones for not immediately coming up and bombarding him with our order. It was pure attitude from there. He has zero people skills or manners. No, "thank you," "you're welcome," or "enjoy," from him during the transaction. I don't need someone bursting with energy but at least have basic manners.

Hands down the best BBQ I've ever had! It's a little gem by the dumpy strip clubs off the strip of Vegas. Totally worth the walk! Big portions and it's cooked to perfection. I would totally recommend the corn nibblers and ribs.. The meat comes right off the bones

Probably the best BBQ joint in town. The meats, sauces and the prices are amazing. I ordered a meat trio combo for $14. It came with 2 Ribs, hot link, brisket, 1 side, 1 drink and a roll. Their hot sauces lack a little bit of  punch, but that's not a deal breaker for spice lovers. The meats have a good amount of spices from the rub and marination. 

Overall this is the best location to go for a lunch on the weekend. Lines can be very long during their busy hours. The parking lot is big, so you won't be driving around for a while to find a parking spot.

Great BBQ spot near the strip, but not on the strip. its a small place so make sure you spot the grill outside the parking lot. Staff is very friendly, food came out quick and it was delicious!!! A must try!

*Thumbs up*
If you're craving for moderately-priced BBQ in and around the Strip, then Rollin Smoke should do the trick. It's a hole-in-the-wall, underneath the highway, tucked in a tiny strip mall near Spearmint Rhino -- uh, yeah so you should have no trouble finding the place. 

I had the 2-item combo, with the brisket and spare ribs. I also ordered an extra beef short rib. The only thing memorable was that giant beef rib. Tender, juicy, succulent and slightly sweet meat that came cleanly off the bone.

*Thumbs down*
The brisket was slightly dry, and the spare ribs were bland. It desperately needed some of their house made BBQ sauce, which is super peppery.

Oh my gosh I am mad I didn't know about this place sooner! Everything was amazing! If you are in the mood for BBQ and don't really need the "dining" experience that Lucille's or famous Dave's provides this is the place to come! They are by far better then both! 
The gentleman taking the orders was helpful to is first timers, funny and knowledgable! 
The food comes out quick so if you are in a hurry you won't wait long. 
I truly enjoyed everything we ordered - pulled pork, spare ribs, chicken, brisket, cheezy Mac and cheese, kicking beans and waffle fries. In saying that I do need to reiterate how delicious the waffle fries were. Normally when I think waffle fry I think slightly soggy. These were far far far from that in fact they were so crispy that I think you could cut paper with them.

Found this spot by accident bcoz of Yelp. Reviews were great so we decided to give it a try.
As we drove in i started getting worried bcoz the ambiance wasn't what I expected. It was a saturday noon when we arrived. We were in line waiting to order when suddenly people started coming in in groups. Suddenly they were busy... Oh coz it's lunch time. Wow! I guess they really are popular.
Since it was our first time we ordered the 3 meat meal with macncheese and extra order of mashed potatoes. I can't remember how much we paid but it sure was very much affordable than what we would usually pay at  Lucille's for the amount of food we got.

I wasnt able to take pictures as we were starving and we just ate soon as our food arrived. What we ordered again was a 3 meat meal with mcncheese and extra side of mashed potatoes and drinks. The meat meal also came with a roll. The serving was enough to feed 2 adults a preteen and a toddler. They were yummy!!!! Very flavorful. Serving was ample to actually alot (atleast for us).

Staff were excellent. The lady who took my order was very helpful. She gave suggestions and didn't quite rushed me despite the line behind me. 

We liked this place so much that i recommended it the same week when my workplace offered to treat the employees for lunch.

Too bad this place is far from our place. But we'll surely eat or take out again when we are in the area.

Things are really looking up for Rollin' Smoke Barbecue...from being one of the first 15 reviewers, that number has jumped into the triple digits and increases everyday. After a few write-ups in local publications to recently receiving National recognition as one of the top 25 BBQ spots in the country, that is quite an achievement from John, Dusty, Tim, and Mayra and they have single handedly put Las Vegas, Nevada on the Barbecue map!

We dropped by for some true Southern Q before going to see Pin-Up at The Stratosphere. Right away, Dusty suggests the Smoked Meatloaf which has become one of their regular items on their updated and expanded menu of deliciousness. We also got the Seafood Platter with Fried Catfish, Fried Shrimp, Hush Puppies and Fried Okra which they were out of, so one of the cooks suggested the Corn Fritters, and those did not disappoint! Seasoned well and the sweet creaminess of the corn was very tasty!

This huge slab of meaty goodness arrives on top a bed of loaded mashed potatoes, and sweet crispy onions with a sweet BBQ sauce and is one of  the tastiest renditions of an American classic that I've come across! The seafood platter is served with lemon, hot sauce, and tartar sauce was equally delicious. The Shrimp had a crisp outside while still keeping that plump, juicy interior, The Catfish was nice, crisp and flaky, and I'm no hush puppy expert but I thought those were just okay.

If you're still in search of some killer barbecue, you may want to bookmark Rollin' Smoke, it may just become one of your  favorite spots! ALOHA!!!

I'm so glad I finally gave Rollin Smoke a try and that I didn't go here by myself as I would've driven away. The location isn't that great. It's close to a strip club, adult stores, etc. Tits and BBQ - this is a man's restaurant. The BBQ aroma fills the air inside the restaurant and sticks to your hair and clothes (had to shampoo my hair twice).

The food was amazing!  I'm not the biggest fan of ribs so, for me to like this place is a major deal. We had a meat Trio: brisket, pork and ribs with waffle fries and Mac n cheese. I liked everything we got. The meats were tender, juicy and smokey. I poured some house BBQ sauce on the meats for more flavor. The waffle fries were very crispy and I wanted to order more. The Mac n cheese has a smokey taste to it as well but was runny...still damn good though. The chicken sandwich and a black berry cobbler were ok.

This is not a fast-food restaurant so, expect to wait about 20 minutes or more to get your food. It's worth the wait.
Best BBQ in Vegas hands down. I had no idea what I was missing! Plus they offer a locals discount !!!!! I'm smitten
Better than expected. The food was great and tasty. A little out if the way but well worth the trip. I will definitely will come back again.

I've been here several times for lunch because it's close to work and the food! It's a location that leaves a lot to be desired. Very sketchy area, no ac in main room, terrible and tiny parking lot and I wonder about the neighboring businesses and the cleanliness of the area. I was introduced to Rollin Smoke by their food truck at a convention I worked. Their ribs and brisket have amazing taste, flavor and texture. I just wish they would change locations now that they've grown in popularity and business.

Hype?....Legit?....or needs a second chance?!?

Hidden beyond the Vegas glitz & glamour, just underneath the Desert Inn Arterial over pass, comes a well known local bbq/soul food establishment of roots from Arkansas.  In what seems to be a shady location just blocks from famous Vegas strip clubs, comes a place called Rollin' Smoke. Yes, the area & location can be a little sketchy to those unfamiliar especially at night...but don't let that stop you from coming in.  Featured on TV...the marketing campaign and Yelp reviews can speak for it self. With more than that....The wifey and I thought we would pay homage and taste what all the hype was about...considering it too was recommended by friends and co-workers. We went on a Thursday night, about an hour before closing and service was pretty quick with a good amount of customers dining in and carry out. Fairly a small southern hospitality type of place, it caters to a back yard southern type of feeling.  We chose to try the 5 meat platter to taste the different flavors. Ribs, pulled pork, sausage, brisket, & chicken. Came also with 3 sides of your choice as we opted for loaded mash potatoes, mac & cheese and corn bread. 

To our disappointment, the ribs were a little salty & the flavor wasn't all that. The ribs were a little dry and not fall off the bone tender juicy. They also only had 3 types of sauces on the counter to choose from...one of which tasted like a mixture of mustard and ketchup. Still it was decent sauce. Not really sure what it was, maybe I got caught off guard because it was almost closing time, or maybe the meat wasn't as fresh or maybe I was just expecting too much from all the hype.

Maybe I should have said something or ask for recommendations and favorites...but I didn't want to make a big deal. Food was still good and plenty and did fill us up & even had left overs to take home.

Still, I only knocked off 2 stars because of my expectations. Service was excellent, atmosphere and staff were very friendly. I do want to give them a second chance and maybe even try their famous outlaw burger. I definitely want to give them a higher rating. I mean I could be wrong, because everyone else seems to love their BBQ.

Please Rollin' Smoke ... Make me a believer and want to come back...because whether it was hype or not...the place is legit & deserves a second chance!

All I can say is ditto to all the other 5 star reviews. Went for the bar b que only, had my own sides at home. Wow! Ribs tender, moist, smoky heaven. Chicken, well, wish I could have this everyday and twice on Sundays
Next time am getting something else, not sure what, but from what I saw others eating I don't think I will be disappointed with anything. 
My only complaint is that I couldn't find the street address listed on their website. It may have been that I was trying to read in the car, but actual street address or "turn on this street to get here " , I just couldn't find it. The little Google map helped, but we still got a little turned around. Hey, I'm old, it happens.  
Just...go there, eat, be happy!

Wow! the workers are the nicest people and the food is so good! I tell all my friends about how good the food is.  Thank you for helping to make our holiday menu a tasty success!!!
The Best BBQ in Las Vegas!

Great place, visited this awesome bbq house Memorial Day. Beef ribs were the take away for me. Meat was absolutely delicious, I cant stress that enough. I got the AYCE for a reason, since I'm in Riverside County it wasn't everyday I could visit even though I wish I could.

The one issue I had was the timeline with the AYCE. The place was a bit loud which was ok with me. When I purchased the AYCE the gentleman at the register said something about the time, since there was a very long line I didn't want to hold it up. In any case, I asked another employee about the time and for some reason he had no idea what I was talking about.  Well the thing is you only have a 1 hour window from the time you purchase it so remember that when you get the AYCE. Since the line gets pretty long you might wait up to 10-15 mins each time which limits you tasting their deliciousness. So keep that in mind.

And last, they had no corn nuggets which was horrible. Thankfully I survived....

My dad wanted us to go grab food with him, and told us about this place. Couldn't believe how GREAT it was. Little hole in the wall place that you never expected to be there. Can't wait to make my way on back!
I really like the BBQ at this place. The food is always delicious, and made quickly. I can't wait to go back and try the meatloaf.

We ate here after reading all of the great reviews from Yelp. Usually I like 95% of the places with high ratings but this falls in the 5% NOT.  We ate inside (MISTAKE) and ended up smelling like smoke so bad that we had to shower and wash our hair TWICE to get the smell out.  The owner was incredibly kind and he alone deserves 4 stars but this review is based on the food. 

The meat wasn't as tender as I prefer my ribs and the sides were bland. I wouldn't go back and probably wouldn't recommend it either.  The restaurant is very dim so it was hard to see our food but the taste is what's more important.  Overall, I've had much better.
Amazing bbq, some of the best I have ever had, good prices and excellent service! I will definitely come here every time i visit Vegas!
Friendly accomodating staff, large menu selection and very good bbq. A must visit for the bbq fan.  Excellent customer service.  Very easy to find. We had pulled pork and briscuit.

I'm known for flexing two things; my muscles, and my mouth. This BBQ joint forced to flex something entirely new to me; my floating ribs. (You know, so I could stuff more delicious meats into my expanding belly).
This was an impromptu visit- I had very little time to prepare, so little that I, (yes me) arrived wearing a pretty teal dress and high heeled boots. Clearly, I wasn't prepared for the feast of sauces and meats that was about to grace both my lips, and outfit. 
It's tucked in a gritty strip mall in Vegas, off the strip, near a strip club, and paired, ironically, with a Christian radio station. (WTF?) 
We pulled in after a convention, at 6pm, and headed into the small storefront, as the 5-0 pulled someone over in the lot. The interior is coated in a mural, some yellow paint and stocked full of picnic tables in the color of barbecue sauce. (Appropriately) If you make your way towards the giant pig-head mounted chest high on the wall, you'll find the menus. Or read it from the ordering stand in the back right, where you can see a glimpse of the kitchen through a swinging door as you await blurting out your overly excited order.
"Meaty sampler for two, for me, but add a half pound of burnt tips, just the tips, that's what she said, sorry, I can't help myself, I meant burnt ends." the guy behind the counter chuckled, and asked what sides, sizing me up in my frilly girly attire. "Corn nuggets" that was the moment. The defining moment of the night. (I also got the Mac & cheese and greenbeens- a girl's gotta be sensible) 
I gladly exchanged my cash for the idea that I'd soon have my hands (among other things) on this highly renowned meat.
We found an empty picnic table in the side room, and I filled it with napkins and little cups of barbecue sauces in preparation. As I anxiously awaited my trays of food, I was entertained by the 5-0 who were busy just outside the window arresting two hoodlums and launching them into a paddy-wagon. Dinner-and a show? #Winning.
I heard my name. "Meg-Ann" (close enough) and jumped up to claim my anticipated treasure. Before me was a tray coated with shredded chicken, smoked sausage, ribs, BBQ chicken and brisket. 
I'm fairly certain my eyes grew to a third the size of my face, and I began drooling as I inhaled the scent of southern deliciousness. A second tray graced my presence- I got so giddy I *almost* peed. There they were, Corn-freaking-nuggets. 
I squealed. The entire room responded to my outburst.
Burnt ends. Ooey, gooey, meaty, melty tips of immense flavor and fat and fabulous that trumped everything else..., everything, that is, but the corn nuggets. Those little fuckers could easily be responsible for my crossing over from the fit-side, to the obese, type 2, side. And all without question. They're sweet, crunchy, and tender, and easily justified by the fact that they contain a vegetable (not that corn is an exemplary veggie). I allowed a few before it began. I rolled my shoulders back, tossed my hair behind them, and wiggled my fingers before diving into the trough of meat before me.
I really can't explain what happened in those first few minutes. I remember the blue and red lights flashing across my face, lighting my blond hair in a blaze of color, as I mauled through flavors of carnal deliciousness. There was sauce everywhere... My face, my cheek, my forehead.... My hands, my arms, the table, my dress? And even some on the napkins I laid in preparation.
I don't think I had a fork. Maybe I had one, but in the whirl of BBQ sauce and meat stuffs, and smokey flavor and blue and red lights and burnt ends, I can't see where it fit in, how, or if.
I annihilated the burnt ends. They were truly the best and most succulent bits of yum that graced my lips (hair/face/clothing....) they didn't need the sauces, so I saved them for the chicken. All the meat was tender, busting with smoky flavor, and cooked with love. (Or lard. I get those two confused) 
I wasn't able to eat it all. Those sit-ups only allowed for a slight expansion of my diaphragm, and I wasn't capable of shoveling any more deliciousness in. I tried. I tried so hard. And it was worth the carnage. The other patrons stared at me like I was a mystical unicorn vomiting rainbows. The girl they saw walk in morphed into a ravenous monster hell bent on BBQ domination.
This was, by far, my favorite BBQ experience of my existence. I'm still questioning whether they laced the meat with LSD or some other psychotropic drug that could explain the transformation that took place that night. But I'll chalk it up to all that "love" they used in making my meaty meal.
Yelp- this place knows BBQ, just don't be afraid to lose yourself in the magic and mayhem that is Rollin Smoke. 
Side note- if you do come here on any type of psychotropic drug- be weary the wall mural- lots of faces- staring, judging, watching, waiting to steal what you don't swallow.....

Came here for dinner on my most recent visit to Vegas on 11/23 around 6:30 PM because I saw Nadine's check-in and read a bunch of other highly recommended Yelp reviews.

We weren't super hungry so we decided to just order the "pit special" which came with the 5 meats and 3 sides.  Since it was our first time here, I wasn't sure which sides to decide on so I did what any newbie would do, ask the cashier for her suggestions.  To my surprise, Jessica's rude reply in a rude tone was "everything is popular, just pick something!"

I was kind of taken aback, even if I was trying to be understanding that it is dinner time & there were five other people behind me.

The food was a 3.5, maybe 4-star, but I am deducting the 1-star for Jessica's rudeness.  Out of the five meats, I liked the pork ribs and pulled pork the most.  The hot links were pretty good as well.  Although, the chopped up beef briskets were dry & flavorless, but the BBQ sauce definitely helped.  The chicken was ok.

The three sides we chose included dried up mac 'n cheese which was very plain & dry.  The infamous corn nuggets were pretty interesting, but not as delicious as they looked in the photos.  They ran out so we had to wait about 10 minutes after our food arrived for the corn nuggets.  However, the baked beans were the saving grace of those three choices...I pretty much ate the whole thing to myself.

great service, reasonable prices, and really good food.  I had the dad sandwich and my wife had the potato with pulled pork.  Both had a good smokey flavor.  The sauce was not too sweet.  And had the berry cobbler for dessert.  It was good enough, where I considered having it more than 1 time, in the same vacation!

I would have given 5 stars, food is great, a picnic atmosphere, fantastic customer service.... Lost one because who in their right minds makes you pay for sauce when you order$30 worth of good? 
 Granted you get a measly 8oz container. If they gave me two I would bumped them up, as it I will rethink coming back.
 Such a small thing to cost them business.
 Just can't make one container stretch for the four people it says it feeds.
 Bummer.
Upon several more visits the good is good but $30 for five meats and three teeny Lil side fishes. No mo.

Really good restaurant. Although the place was a bit empty for being 5 PM, the food was very fresh and well-prepared. I had the piggy wrap and it was very flavorful! I will definitely try one of their meat platters next time that I'm in.

Hands down some of the BEST BBQ I have had in a LONG time!!! This is now my staple go-to place! Service was AWESOME! Food was PERFECT! The corn bread was like CAKE! The bacon potato salad was like Mom's but with BACON! The Mac n Cheese, was on point! Again, the experience and the service was just AMAZING!

I have been here a number of times now, and not once has this bbq let me down! The brisket and pork is always on point, the hardest part is picking what sides you want, there is a bunch and they are all amazing!

If you are looking for bbq in Vegas, this is where you need to come!
This is the best BBQ I have had since Pappys Smoke house in St. Louis. If you come  to Vegas and you don't check this place out you got cheated.

What a great find! Imagine a Dickey's-style BBQ joint but local/downhome. Great pricing for the LARGE portions of amazing food you get. Love the hush puppies - they have a kick. The spudtastic was crazy good. Ignore the strange placement of this establishment and GO!

This is one of the best barbecue joints in Las Vegas and the prices are reasonable. Having been eating at Rollin Smoke for several years now, they've experienced massive growth. The restaurant was featured on a television show named Tanked recently. Tanked is a show about building custom aquariums for people and businesses, and the one they did for Rollin Smoke is full of exotic fish and is in their newly expanded room.

The outlaw burger is a must try if you're just visiting from another city. It's basically a meatloaf type burger with onion rings on top, and tastes just amazing. 

For those of you that have already had the outlaw burger, I suggest getting the multiple meat platter with some sides. I like to get ribs, brisket, and chicken.

I would have given this place five stars last year, but this year it's four stars because they are always busy now, the lions are getting longer, and the portions seem to be getting smaller. They also changed their sweet potato side recipe, and I like the first version of this not the new one.

Regardless, I'm still going to continue to come back because there is no barbecue place like it anywhere near this part of town.

I've heard very good things about this BBQ spot, even though it is a bit hidden you cannot miss the bright colors of this place. So my bf & myself decided to try it & lets just say we were not disappointed! The corn nuggets were beyond good & very tasty, I've never tried anything like it. The brisket was good & so we're the hot links & brisket. The one thing I was not such a fan of was their ribs. I'm very picky with my ribs BUT the customer service we received was beyond our expectations! My bf & myself work in customer service so we both know how crucial it is to meet certain expectations, but everyone there was extremely nice & welcoming specially Brenda she was very helpful in letting us know what to get since they have so many options to choose from. We will definitely be coming back :)

This was a bbq joint that was on the "hit list" for a few months. This bow place takes pride in what they do !
Food tastes great and customer service is really great.

If you like baby back ribs try them here and next time I'll know what to order : pork spare ribs !
Much better than Lucille's rib shack or even than Bludso's in Compton,CA !
Nice place!!

--
6-1-2016

Still a great place, things that stand out:
Brisket
Peach cobbler with cold icecream on top
Mac&chese

O M G! This is absolutely the best BBQ I have found in either Vegas or Henderson. After reading several great reviews of this place I had to try it out. 

Ok, its not in the best area of town and doesn't look like much from the outside, but when you walk in and smell that wonderful smoke and BBQ flavor you know your gonna love it! We of course had to try the Outlaw burger made with brisket and fried onion strings as well as the brisket and rib combo plate with corn fritters. The burger was HUGE and the brisket was so tender and delicious. One of the best burgers ever. The brisket and rib plate was also great. The ribs were probably some of the best I've ever had. They were so smoky and tender and the corn fritters were golden bites of goodness. 

Our friends ordered the BBQ nachos which were waffle fries loaded with BBQ pork, cheese, beans and sour cream. So good. 

I will definitely be back to try the hot links and baby backs. Thanks for a great meal!

The food is good, no question. I'm not giving more stars because of other problems.  I ordered the trio, requesting ribs, pulled pork, and brisket.  Instead of brisket they gave me chicken.  My ticket said brisket, so someone in the back screwed up. Also, instead of a roll, the gave me a slice of bread. That would have been fine, except that they put it UNDER the meats...

Anyway, the food I had was very good--spare ribs, pulled pork, chicken, and kickin beans.

One more thing--when you enter, the place smells like it's on fire...but in a good way.

My girlfriend & I came here. Very crowded. No seating.

We ordered an Outlaw burger & waffle fries to share.

Outlaw burger was about 9 inches high. Huge burger.

Taste wasn't all that though. Wasn't bad but wasn't amazing.

Waffle fries were fine.. Good not bad.

If I do come back here, I will try the brisket or chicken instead.

The night before, I had dinner at the Bacchanal Buffet at Caesars. Their brisket was dry...so I decided to venture forth for better smoked meat. 

Yelp led me to Rollin Smoke. 

This place is the definition of a hole in the wall (which made the contrast with the Bacchanal Buffet all the more pronounced). There's a strip club two doors down. Do not judge the book by its cover.

I ordered at the counter and got the 3-meat combo (brisket, pulled pork, pork ribs) with a side of onion strings and a piece of catfish. Everything was incredibly delicious. The pork rib, particularly, stood out among the meats  - tons of meat, falling-off-the-bone, great smoked flavor. 

But the catfish was the star. There was a delicious coarse cornbread breading...like a hushpuppy around the fish. Unreal!

Maybe it was because I was eating alone, but there was something magical and welcoming about the atmosphere (a weird word to use for a hole-in-the-wall...) There was a stuffed boar watching me from the corner; i filled up my soda club in a dark closet, but the whole thing was unaccountably perfect. 

One of the DJs from the strip club came in and ate the taller, biggest burger I've ever seen. The two of us chatted with one of the other patrons about how great the BBQ is here. The owner (manager?) noticed that I had done a Yelp checkin and gave me a free dessert (I hadn't even asked). And just as soon as I was wondering how I was going to get back to Caesars...a cabdriver walked in to check out the place. 

I really wanted to go back the next night to try the beef ribs and maybe the baked beans, but alas...it wasn't in the cards.

My mouth is watering for my next trip to Vegas. 

One small note: Rolling Smoke closes kind of early (8 or 8:30) during the week, but it's open late on Fri and Sat. 

Go there now. You won't be sorry.

I usually question a place so close to a strip club, but the food was so awesome. Had the duo meat plate with brisket, ribs and mashed potatoes.  Yeah a real fat boy meal but I was starving. The brisket was very tender and tasty,  complemented by their super good bbq sauce that you should make sure you get more of. Ribs were also very tender. Not fall off the bone tender since the skin is cooked rather well but remains juicy. My favorite part of the meal though was the mash. Not to take away from other parts of the meal, this was just that garlicky, bacon infused, cheesyness good. Def worth it.
The most tasty BBQ ribs in Las Vegas have no rival fair priced as well other location is kind of hidden it doesn't matter it's worth the drive
Absolutely amazing! The pulled pork is mouth watering goodness. The brisket is de-lish and the HOT links are extremely hot and yummy. We will definitely be back!!! ****THE BEST BBQ IN VEGAS****

One of the best barbecue places I've ever been to!

When you walk in the door, follow the path on the right to get to the register and place your order. They have a large menu behind the register but they also have individual ones hanging on the wall for you to look at while waiting in line. 

I was really tempted to get AYCE (all you can eat) for $34.99. You start off with three meats and then keep going til your heart's content. What was enticing about it was that beef ribs are included and the AYCE is equivalent to a full rack in price. I told myself to be rational. "You JUST got to Vegas. There's so many places you want to eat at today. Don't jeopardize that by tapping out at the first restaurant."

Using my head, I ordered a 1/2 rack of beef ribs but then self-control went out the window when I also ordered the brisket 3 ways. I figured my daughter and I can share; don't judge. = p My husband went with the duo of choice of meats; he chose chicken and spareribs. 

I sorely underestimated the size of the beef ribs. See, I'm from the SF Bay Area and in my experience, it's been difficult to find places that serve decent beef ribs, or beef ribs at all for that matter. There are 2 places I found and well, they weren't very meaty at all. I ain't trying to pay for for mostly all bones. 

Anyways, I was full from one rib and a couple pieces of burnt ends. My daughter couldn't even finish one rib. By the way, they fell right off the bone and were fork-tender. Dip some in a bit of sweet country sauce, and oh my. So gooood! Side note, the sweet country sauce wasn't even sweet. It was thin and more on the mustardy/vinegary side, which I prefer over sweet bbq sauces. 

My husband took a bite of chicken and murmured "oh my god." He then took a bite of his spareribs and made a noise of appreciation. He was pretty much non-communicative for the rest of his mea, which didn't last very long because he devoured that ish. 

We got a chance to meet Chef Will. He was super nice! Hats off to you, Chef!

I've heard nothing but great things about this place, but was highly disappointed. First of all, I ordered a delivery through postmates. The first order was cancelled b/c Rollin Smoke said that they were too busy. I called the store and the manager said put the order through again and it wouldn't be a problem. That they were busy but the order would be ready in 60-90 mins. Slow, but I didn't mind much. I thoroughly discussed the order w/ him as the phone call took about 20 minutes. 

When the order arrived it is completely wrong! I made a $125 dollar order and couldn't even get the order correct. I called the next day to relay my complaint to the manager, but they were closed. I called back a few days later and an associate told me that there was not a manager who could help me nor was there anyone else at the business who could help me that was in the store. I wasted my time and money, I would not purchase again.

Oh. My. Gosh. This place is absolutely delicious! The Brisket is to die for. Tender and juicy! Sausage is great. You must try the BBQ nacho Fries. Out of this world. Loved, loved Rollin Smoke. Can't wait to go back to Vegas and have it again!

Oh man this place has delicious ribs the meat falls right off and they have this tangy/hot sauce so yummy with the meat. We got some sides with our meal mac and cheese and mashed potatoes I wasn't impressed they didn't have any flavor and the mashed potatoes were room temperature, that's why I gave them 4 stars.

When pulling into the parking lot you can smell so much smokey goodness in the air it immediately tempts your taste buds. I had my dog with & he couldn't stop sniffing the air. The place itself looks pretty dumpy but don't let that distract you because the food is wonderful. I've ordered the pound of pulled pork to go a few times to make sandwiches at home (didn't want the whole meal deal). Always good but they give you a small amount of bbq so if you like a lot you need to order more. Also, there is always a piece of bread on the bottom which I decline because if you plan on not eating right away it ends up stuck to the meat. It is still my favorite bbq spot in Vegas. Other places just don't seem to have that wonderful smokiness to the meat that Rollin Smoke does so well.

My Dad always said the very best BBQ are always found in a Hole-in-the-wall-joints and that continues to stand true here! This BBQ joint appears to be the perfect example of this and is incredible! The Pit Special provides a perfect meal of four types of meat and three sides, capable of feeding two adults easily (fed me, my wife, and our 7yr old son). The Corn Nuggets are an absolute MUST! For dessert we had the Butterfingers Bread Pudding a-la-mode, and it was a fine finish to an enjoyable meal of BBQ bliss.
Got dang! Brisket on point ! Beef ribs..... My husband is from Georgia and these are the best he's ever tasted!!! The mac n cheese is ridiculous and the potato salad.....ohhhhh girl!

Good but not great BBQ. A little too much smoke flavor for my taste. Yes, I know smoke is in the name. But it dominated the natural flavor of the meat. The BBQ sauce was good. The flavor was different.  It has a tang to it. The Kicken beans also had a unique taste which was heavy on the bell pepper. 

The mac n' cheese had an extremely liquid cheese sauce. My cousin enjoyed it. Me, well, it was acceptable. I prefer more of a casserole consistency in mac n' cheese.

Ribs and brisket were tender. Hot link was dry and over cooked.

 The owner and servers were friendly.
Best BBQ we have had on tour, and we had BBQ all over the country. Great experience and great service.

The food and service were above and beyond amazing. The ribs fell off the bone and melted in my mouth, the brisket was tender and juicy, & the sides are just out of this world. I've Been back three times and each time it gets better and better!

The other reviews have covered it pretty well. What's really great here is not just wonderful smoked food, but the awesome prices. Get the Pitmaster Special combo, and you'll get 4 meats and 3 sides, with your choice from the 3 breads they make -- all for $20. There is enough food there for 3 adults, or eat some and take some home. Such a deal!  And there is no charge for extra plates. 

The owners run the place, and are always present. They are very friendly, and love to meet new patrons. We loved the meal and the staff so much, we came here a second time during our week in Las Vegas just to try more foods. We loved everything we tried. If they take a liking to you, they just might tell you about some items in the kitchen that are not on the menu. Ask about the bread pudding and sweet potato pie!

What would give it 5 stars?  Esoteric things only. This business has not been in its current location for long. Hopefully they will continue to improve the seating and decor as they go along. 

Dusty, if you are reading this, Hello from California. We'll be back!
Was so so chopped brisket sandwich very fatty. Too much money for amount of food.  Wouldn't recommend

As seen on "Diners Drive-ins and Dives" Southern style BBQ in Las Vegas. It's hard to find, a hole-in-wall type joint with few seats indoors and some outside. The smell of smoked meats fills the air everywhere so just roll your window down and follow your nose. The brisket and ribs were exceptional.  We went at 3pm and the line was still out the door.

I could swear I wrote a review about this place a month and a half ago, but it seems Yelp ate it or something.

Anyway, I've been here a few times now (twice today, for some reason!) and the food and service are always top notch. This place puts the other BBQ places in town like Memphis Championship and Famous Dave's (Famous Who?, now) to shame. Their sweet tea is the bomb!

John even convinced me to eat something different tonight, because I always get the same thing otherwise, so I tried their Outlaw Burger. I think Wilford Brimley wants to have a word with me about Diabeetus or something now, because I ate way too much. Enjoyed every bite, though!

Good luck to the Yelpers participating in the rib eating contest tomorrow!
Wow some of the finest BBQ we have in Vegas, everything made with complete love and passion! You pay for what you get 100% I'll be back again and again! Amazing job Rolling Smoke team
I found the Dirty Rice to be flavorful but dry and crumbly. Beef ribs were dry, fatty and over charred. Used to be good but now wondering if their primary concern is customer or currency.

While on a trip to Vegas for work, my co-worker and I decided to grab some BBQ for dinner. Was hungry and ready to eat after a long day of work, Rollin Smoke is now up at the top of my list for BBQ. I had the trio combo with chopped brisket, pulled pork, and 2 spare ribs with a Mac and cheese side. The brisket was a bit too much pepper for me, but the house sauces were a great compliment to balance it out. The ribs were good too, nice smoky taste and not overpowering. I ended up throwing some of the brisket in the Mac and cheese to offset the amount of cheese and tang up the straight forward Mac and cheese side I had. 

Overall the meats are enough to attract any BBQ lover a few blocks away from the strip. Will be back and be trying some of the other sides, but the meatloaf platter was calling my name and plan on that the next time.
FINALLY...Vegas has a homestyle BBQ joint to call its own and be proud of!  Awesome food and very reasonable prices.  Try the rib tips if your on a tight budget. Best BBQ in Vegas!!  Give it a try.

Yes Virginia, there is a barbeque place in Vegas!

I kept reading reviews on this place and finally got out there to try it. I escaped work for a bit and hit it for lunch. I lived in NC for several years and really missed having great barbeque. This has filled the void.

First the meat, I had pulled pork sandwich and my husband had two meat option, pulled pork and brisket. They were both awesome! Cooked nicely on the smokers outside, just enough sauce, not too much, perfect smokey flavor.  Next time I will try the links.

The sides were terrific too. So many places seem to haves sides as an after thought but not here. I had jalapeno coleslaw. It had a nice kick, not too much mayo, super flavorful. Husband had the beans. So good with extra chunks of meat and a smokey flavor. We were both stuffed at the end. All very affordable too! Two meat special, two sides, sandwich combo including drinks for both just $22.

With the great weather I wish they had more tables outside. I could lounge out there and smell the smokers all afternoon. I also wish they could sell beer since that pairs so nicely with barbeque. But that great meat trumps those issues. 

I've been to the other places in town and this one blows them away. We will be back soon!

This is good stuff, its yummy bbq. The line a majority of the time is outrageous and long, BUT the service is very fast so you will not be there too long. Also, food comes out no later than 10 minutes. I have a bbq place in Vegas that I ADORE, and I have to say Rollin Smoke gave them a little competition. Great experience. The only reason why I didn't give it another star and made it 4 stars- there's no room to eat peacefully. Its so small and cramped with a ton of people that it gets claustrophobic in there and I hate eating messy when someone 3 feet away can see me pigging out haha! Also, parking is a mothaf**cka, too small of a venue for the volume of customers.

Meat, meat, meat! The Outlaw Burger was AMAZING. Piled so high it was difficult to fit it in my mouth. It was worth the effort! :). The ribs had a great flavor and the texture was perfect.  Pull off the bone delicious. Add the banana pudding. You won't regret it. Best banana pudding I've ever had, and I've eaten a monkeys share of banana pudding.
Amazing!!!! Point blank period. Amazing smoked flavors quality rubbed meats and amazing bbq sauces. Will be back over and over

I must admit that I'm not an expert on this type of BBQ due to growing up in Hawaii. The closest thing to this is our Kalua pig. The term BBQ is used to describe anything grilled in Hawaii. The only place I can compare Rolling Smokes to is BB King's. This place blows them away! The food is really good, the staff is very efficient, and our food was delivered to us in a timely manner. We had the "D's Delicious Sampler" and especially liked their ribs. We'll definitely eat here again!

I have never actually been to the restaurant but I had their food at a get together. The ribs were incredibly tender, juicy, and delicious! The beans were awesome and I wanted more but there was no more to be had. We will have to get to the restaurant one day so that we can sample more of their menu items!

Arguably the best BBQ I have had. The mac n cheese is hands down amazing. The corn tots are addictive, and dangerous, and your mouth will salivate at every bite for the pulled pork and brisket. If you pass this place up you've made a big mistake, HUGE!!!!

Amazing family owned BBQ joint. It's clear the recipes are a family tradition and everything is made fresh. The meats are tender and flavorful and the sauces are top notch. The sides are so good you'll keep eating even when you're full. The service was phenomenal. Everyone working there is very friendly.

Try beef ribs.  It is awesome.  Baby back ribs are ok but go with "all you can eat" style with 35 dollars and eat as much as you can.  Brisket is just decent but beef ribs (asado) will give you unforgettable taste and experience-!  Be ready to wait if you go during the peak time-!

So I had this when I just visited back to Vegas. Tried the Baby Back Ribs and the Mac and Cheese. I didn't love it. It was o.k. I really enjoy TC's RIB Crib more.  Nice place inside and friendly staff.

Tried the 3 item 2 sides with the wife. Brisket, Ribs and Pulled Pork with Mac and Cheese and the Potato Salad. I'd say the food was really good and that we'll probably come here again the next time we're in Vegas.
I liked that they had a variety of sauces, some sweet, some vinegary and some spicy which gives something for everyone to try. 

I will admit, that in the great world of bbq, this probably doesn't go much higher than a 6 out of 10, but in Las Vegas you're gonna find yourself hard pressed to find something better.

Oh man. Rollin Smoke catered an event at work and almost everyone I spoke with loved the food. Ribs were tender, mac n cheese was solid, baked beans were seasoned perfectly, potato salad was a tad too mayonnaise-y, and the cornbread was moist, sweet and delicious.
Wow!  The burnt ends are PERFECT!  Mac and Cheese- Delish!  Great BBQ spot!!!!  On a later trip I tried the meatloaf and banana pudding. They were also awesome.
