Absolutely delicious. Ribs and chicken were both perfectly seasoned and smoked. This is the only place I've seen corn nuggets outside of Alabama and they are crunchy and creamy sweet. Be prepared to wait because the line is usually out the door.

Definitely gotta sit down there and eat.  They rub their meets and my wife loves this flavor of bbq. she doesn't like sweet meats so she usually doesn't like bbqs but this one she does love.    You definitely have to try this at least once

I'm from TEXAS and to come to Vegas and find DAM GOOD Bbq was a shock I really doubted this place at first but boy let me tell you. They got something magical over there. My whole group of six was iffy but.....THE RIBS THE MAC & CHEESE THE CORN NUGGETS But wait that GOT DAMN MEATLOAF  Should run for President.

Burnt ends, get those. I sampled 4 sides (coleslaw, beans, mac n cheese, loaded mashed) and all were exceptional. Portions are generous, so price is worth it. Sweet tea was nostalgic. I can't properly eat BBQ without it. If you have even an appreciation for good BBQ, you should eat here. Even if you don't like BBQ, you should eat here.

I worked up an appetite shooting zombies at Adventure Combat Ops, the "pick two" was plenty to satiate.

I came here with a few friends during my first ever vacation to Vegas, and boy I was glad we did!  Before you even walk into the place you can smell the barbeque, like the smoke is just rolling towards you...  So hey! The name is quite fitting.  Anyways, if it smelled that delicious already before even walking in through the door, then I knew it was going to be a good time.

The menu was very extensive, but ultimately I decided to order the Rib and Chicken Combo with the waffle fries.  The meal was massive!  Now usually there's something to be said on quality vs. quantity, but this place most definitely had both down, and the price was good.  The ribs were so juicy and tender, and peeled right off the bone.  The chicken also was juicy and delicious, and the skin was well flavored with great texture.  I barely managed to finish it all and hardly left any room for the fries.  Needless to say, I didn't need to eat again for the rest of the day and my stomach was quite satisfied.  A lot of locals drop by here, and now I can see why.  Plus, it's more fun to mingle with them and get off the strip for a little while to try some real flavor. The staff was very friendly and the food came out lickety split.

Overall, it was an awesome experience and probably one of the best BBQ I had ever tasted.  The only negative I had was that they didn't serve any alcohol.  I will be back!

BEST RIBS EVER!!!!!  We are from Texas and my hubby is a BBQ/Smoking fool, but even HE thought these ribs were exceptionally good!!!!  Everything else was excellent, but the ribs....TO DIE FOR!!!!!  Can't wait to visit next week again!!!!!

Wow..best meatloaf on the planet!. We came from California specifically to have lunch here....we were not disappointed.  The staff is so attentive and greets customers during your meal to be assured you are satisfied with everything. They sure have a winning combination....we will be regulars for sure.
I'm always surprised by what a little restaurant off the beaten path can offer and this place is amazing.  Everything was delicious and the people were very friendly. Definitely coming back.
The meatloaf is perfection! The brisket is just right and the customer service is top notch. It's a must visit when in Vegas. Sketchy neighborhood but worth the trip. Clean and attractive interior.

Absolutely perfect.   Authentic smoked food that is tender and tasty.   The pulled pork and brisket literally is as soft as it can be.  The rib tips have an amazing firm texture and flavor.   Go hogs!

Look, I'm Texan.  I've grown up around barbecue.  And I've found that the West Coast didn't have much in the way of barbecue when I was living in SoCal (correct me if I'm wrong, I take suggestions).  And while I like Lucille's here, that's more Cajun than the stuff I grew up with.

On a whim, we found this place.  It's in the middle of nowhere, in an area you probably wouldn't venture to, in a tiny shopping center that you wouldn't notice.  But you'll notice that smell when you step out of the car.  And I mean BAM!

Once that scent hit my nose, I had to know more.  Also, not Texas based, I will graciously concede that Arkansas knows their stuff, and this place knows their stuff.

The staff is nice, and one look at them told me these people weren't anything but legit.  I liked the cook immediately.  We ordered a rib combo plate, and let the dining begin.

It was so good.  Nice and spicy, meat falling off the bone, a big squirt bottle of sauce on the table, I ate and ate and ate, and then I got kind of woozy, and asked for a "to go".  I moaned all the way home.  Partly because I was full, yes, but partly because this place hit the sweet spot of barbecue goodness.  I went for my leftovers, and shredded bones like a barbarian.

I regret nothing.

Will I go back?  Absolutely.  Small, subtle, out of the way, but so worth it when it came to dining options, friendly people, fast service, and quality of food.

They have something called a "BBQ Sundae".  That sounds intriguing, and I wish to know more.

Literally the best ribs, best food period that's really all I have to say if you want good real "legit" ribs how there supposed to be cooked try rollin smoke they mean everything they say and have the food to back it up would suggest this place to everyone! 


P.S: my favorite rib is the beef rib but I always get the rib platter special which is a great price and features every single rib for you to try :) I like to order an extra rollin smoke bbq sauce if it's an to go order just to pour on my ribs cause there literally right off the grill, hope this helped.

Tonight we visited the Rolling Smoke BBQ on Las Vegas Blvd.. This food was AMAZING! Tried the pulled pork and brisket. Both were full of flavor, tender and juicy.  The BBQ sauce was also delicious! The mac & cheese was a little different, Cajun or spicy - not sure, but so cheesy and good! The bacon potato salad was a highlight of the meal - we loved every last bite! Also, the corn bread was some of the best I have ever had! The staff was very friendly and hospitable. Also, the place looked very clean and well kept! If you love BBQ this is a must go to in Vegas! Look forward to eating here again!

Like this place needs another review!  But I am a jersey girl so I'm putting my opinion out there. AAAAmazing.  Every BBQ joint I have ever been to I get pulled pork sandwich.  However, I had to break out of the rut and order the BBQ meatloaf and mashed potatoes.  Best ever!!  My hubby and I split it, we ate at 3:00 and didn't eat another thing until breakfast the next morning!!   Would do it again...oh in 2 years or so.  I think I will be working off those calories until then:). But SO worth it!

My brother brought my mother and me here a while ago after reading the splendid reviews about it. We arrived sometime at night when it was pitch dark, and the place looked like it was straight out of a horror movie: It was dead quiet, and there were no lights around; the only thing to illuminate the dark night was the ominous flicker of the defective red "Open" sign. My mother and I were ready to bolt and drive straight back home to enjoy a dinner in safety, but my brother urged us on, so we reluctantly pushed open the door to Rollin Smoke Barbeque, and boy, did the atmosphere change!

Behind the dingy exterior waits a warm, casual, and welcoming locale that can only be described as a home away from home. The types of customers who eat here range anywhere from families with small children to single men with their buddies. The walls are painted with cheerful people, flowers, and green, and there are TVs for people to enjoy a little bit of entertainment while eating. 

Our orders came out quickly and were delectable. The meat was tender, soft, and buttery smooth at the same time, and the flavor was just perfect. At the end of our dinner, the owner even came out to talk to us, asking us if it was our first time, explaining to us how he prepares the meat, and giving us some insight on the Arkansas way of barbeque-ing. 
This must have been one of my most memorable restaurant visits, and I love how it ended. Definitely do not be scared off by the awkward storefront. This place is worth it.

Place in hole in the wall. Not fancy as bbq shouldnt be.  Im picky about my BBQ. This place had it down. Ribs were best thing i thought. Tender and smoked. Beautifull color and all around good flavor. Chopped brisket and pulled pork alot of places can do pork. 

I would say they would need to work on. I like a variety of sauces, they didnt have much. Spicey , sweet or vinigar. Bathrooms...place to wash after eating good bbq. 1 small single room. Also it gets busy and tables are hard to come by. 

I would definitly get it again. Especially to go!

BRING YOUR SMALL PARTY TO ROLLINSMOKE!!

I am a manager at a global enterprise software company and every year we go to Vegas for our Sales meeting.  I was looking for a place to have a relaxed team dinner and wanted to get away from the glitz for a bit.  Also, the team loves BBQ, so that was the criteria.

We went to RollinSmokeBBQ and this restaurant is just great.  Excellent tasting BBQ - the baby back ribs, brisket, hot links - just awesome.  Easy, casual ambiance.  Family owned business.  The owners were very accommodating to us.  The pictures on their website don't really show it but they have two small dining areas - the main area where you order your food, and then another separate eating area off in another room to the side.  That room can easily hold 30 people.  My group of twenty arrived, we sat down, ordered, grabbed drinks and the evening just got rolling.  It was easy as that.

We ordered 20 'all you can eat' packages but had the restaurant just bring it all out family style and place it on the tables.  The team dug in like piranhas - it was excellent.  It didn't take long for everyone to be bursting full.

All the food was great.  Excellent, friendly service.  The owners were very appreciative of our business.  After the meal, it was a nice walk back to the strip.  

I highly recommend the RollinSmokeBBQ for your next Vegas team gathering.

All You Can Eat !! That's where it's at! Delicious food- and the best part is if you don't like it- you can just order some other tasty treat on the menu! The staff is the friendliest in Vegas for sure! Any member of their team will help you out at any moment! The place was packed! 5 stars guys! Keep up the great work!

Love this place. The pulled pork, beef ribs, catfish, and yams are the best. They recently updated their establishment to accommodate more customers. The food is delivered to your table typically within 5-10 minutes always fresh. Drinks are self serve and they offer free refills. 

If your interested in getting your food catered then this is the place. They always come through for office parties and get togethers. It's definitely one of the best BBQ places on the west coast.

PRO:
This place is and easy 4 stars.  The BBQ here is simply awesome.  The brisket was extremely tasty and tender (smoke ring very apparent, none of that reheated meat you find some places).  I also had the Pulled Piggy, my favorite by the way, with the sweet and tangy BBQ sauce provided on the table.  In addition, our table also had the short ribs and meatloaf of all things and to say say they were delicious would not be enough.  Eat here for great prices great tasting BBQ, it's as simple as that.

CON:
The only downside I could find and the reason for the 4 stars vice 5 is the wait time.  Understandably this place had a line outside but if the wait time could be cut to under 20 minutes a definite 5 star.
The best beef Barbecue ribs. Staff is super helpful. Ask for Brenda. Also very good wings, and rib tips.

This is, by far, the best BBQ in Las Vegas.

Here's why:
THE BUSINESS MODEL!!!

-great BBQ, including catfish and beef ribs and banana pudding and BBQ nacho fries; choices you don't find at many other BBQ places.
-a family of charming characters who treat everyone like they were their best friend.
-a menu that overcomes the "combination" curse. 
What's that, you say? 
A combination curse is a combination plate that isn't exactly what you want, but you order it anyway, because you have no other choice.
At RSB, they overcome this curse because all elements of the BBQ universe are available "a la carte". 
For example, I didn't want a brain-dead combination with a "carb" side and drink...I wanted nothing but protein. So I ordered, a la carte, a beef rib (gigantic!), a piece of white chicken and a piece of catfish. I dare you to find that "combination" at any other BBQ place in town. 
It was sensational!

Oh and I almost forgot, one of the best burgers in town (next to Fat Choy) aptly named the "Outlaw Burger". 
You eat The Outlaw Burger, and when you go outside, your car has magically morphed into a tricked-out Harley!!

If you're a local, you're crazy to go anywhere else.
If you're a visitor, it's half a mile from the strip, just down the road from the Trump Tower.


Side note: 
They should do a reality show at Rollin' Smoke. 
If Pawn Stars, and Duck Dynasty, can be successful cable shows, a show set at this place can be blindingly, staggeringly successful! 
Kind of a combination between the Diner shows and the Down-Home shows.
More pleasure; more heart.

I had the AYCE and was glad I did! The pulled pork, brisket, and baby back ribs!!!! Mac and Cheese, yams, and collard greens so damn good!!!! I'm originally from the southeast region of the US where BBQ is a staple. This is a great place to eat if you are in Vegas and want a good meal. The staff were friendly and attentive.

This is a terrific BBQ joint in Las Vegas. I don't believe it is on par with Franklin BBQ or The Salt Lick in Texas, but this place does solid BBQ with LARGE portions. I base this review on only trying the brisket, chicken, pulled pork, and several sides. 

I will update the review once I try the ribs and other items. The beans were a bit too spicy for my taste.

I'm a bbq snob. Meaning that I make better bbq (home made sauce and rubs and queen of the grill and smoker!) myself at home! So when I eat bbq out it has to be damn good.

I LOVE This Place! 

Tender. Flavorful. Amazing selection. Everything I ever get here rocks!!! I really want to have a party so I can have them cater it soon!

It's interesting to find, but you must try it. I suggest getting there during early of off hours...because there's always a line when I go!

Great place to bring out of towners to show them our hidden vegas.

This was the best BBQ I have ever had! I grew up in the South and my family even owns a BBQ restaurant. The guys that run this place are super friendly and great hosts. I guess they moved to Vegas about a year ago from Arkansas and opened a BBQ joint. It is worth getting off the strip for quality non-chain restaurant food in a low key non-crowded area. Baby-back ribs and mac-n-cheese were bomb! I finished it off with a piece of sweet potato pie, not too sweet and not too big, just perfect.

Just came in from out of town. Had no clue what was in store for me at this BBQ pit, but wow I was amazed. From the wide variety of bbq sauces to the large portions offered, they kept us happy! I would definitely recommend this place to a friend and I hope to go back next time I'm in town to try their burger! The employees even walked around the restaurant to check up on everyone to make sure their customers were satisfied! Thank you for the kind service and delicious meal!

Ok this place is off the hook! Ate there last Tuesday April 15th, had the Outlaw burger and Mac and cheese, the wife had the brisket, chicken and pork baby backs. These guys know how to smoke meat, the bark is awesome and the smoke ring is perfect! The Outlaw burger is EPIC, it's made with their smoked brisket and is about 6" tall when served, good luck getting this in your mouth. The wife's ribs were cooked perfectly to competition standards and man what a flavor. 

We had to go back for round 2 and hit the place up on Saturday April 19th. This time I got the smoked meat loaf and a hot link, the wife got 3 types of ribs, the pork, the baby back and the beef rib. The meat loaf was the best I have ever had, smoked meat loaf is the the only way to make meat loaf, I can't wait to try it in my smoker! The wife's pork ribs were perfect again, but wait the beef rib is the bell ringer! This thing is actually prime rib on a stick (rib) it's about 3" thick and done perfectly, the smoke ring, bark and flavor are the radical, this is smoked prime rib at its finest. My only dig would be the hot link wasn't cooked enough (luke warm), but the flavor was great. We will be back, every time we are in Vegas, I can't wait!!

On another note you'll be safe at this place, every cop in town eats there. 3 squad cars were in the parking lot when we pulled up and then 3 more showed up when we were eating. I don't know who was covering the streets of Vegas, but they were all eating well! I had to have the tee shirt, way to go Rollin smoke!

We had the BBQ sampler, it was just amazing! The brisket just melts in your mouth, the sausage is slightly spicy and with a great flavor, the pulled pork is also delicious, and the sides we got were all great! (coleslaw, beans, mac n' cheese and potato salad).

We came on Friday night and got an excellent service from Matt and Dan and chefs Justin and Lou.

Thank you! You are the best :D

Killer spot in the seedy underbelly of Vegas.  A super Yelp find for delicious bbq with their own parking lot.  We rented a house a mile away and needed some sustinence without the need to venture into one of the big hotels.  This place hit the spot.  Good meats, cheap eats.

Me and my bf favorite BBQ spot. We came here once a month or once every other month. A couple of things changed since we first came here. Definitely longer line but they still keep the great food quality and customer service as before. We got rolling smoke catered at our house party in December n everyone loved it. I highly recommend this place to everyone.
The BBQ was good.  Seating was limited but overall the atmosphere was a good family friendly location.

When we walked in the atmosphere reminded me of a good ol BBQ joint! Being originally from Kansas City we have high standards. The food was killer. The roll the pulled pork was on was amazing and the sides were as great as the BBQ. We ended up taking a pint of the sauce home with us! New favorite restaurant in Vegas!

Searching Nearby Me on Yelp landed me here.  I was here on a Saturday night after running the RNR LV 5K.  The place is hidden at night.  It is located on a shady looking street near an overpass.  Get your GPS ready or you will miss it.  The parking is pretty small so you may not be able to find parking but there is also street parking.  There are tables outside in the patio but there are a number of tables inside as well.  You order by lining up on the right and then grabbing a table where the servers will bring you the platters of food.

For the five of us, we got the The Pit Special and the Ribs Platter.  It was more than enough food for us.  The best items in the meals were the sides.  The meats themselves were a bit dry (mainly the ribs) so I focused my eyes on the sides.  Of all the sides, I enjoyed the mac and cheese and the corn nuggets.  A must get when you are there.  Of the meats, even though most were dry, I liked the brisket and the baby-back ribs.  There were a couple types of sauces near the drink counter (honey mustard and a vinegar sauce).  Also on the table was a barbeque-like sauce.  But even with the sauces, the meats were still dry...  Such a bummer but I would still give this place another try.  I noticed the table next to us ordering a huge burger that was stacked like 6 inches high.  Crazy fatty goodness I bet and I wish because that is what I'm going to be grabbing when I come again.

This is the most amazing bbq spot. 

I live in California and I will now take a weekend drive just to eat here! 

And all of their sauces are amazing!!!

I'm in love!! We are now die hard fans of this spot. Las Vegas is lucky to have them in their city!!

Another post Caesar's craps session visit to Rollin' Smoke.  Arrived around 1 pm and the place was still hoppin' with the lunch crowd.

Ordered totally off special menu:

Smoked meatball sub with side ( went with mac n cheese) and drink ( $9)

Slider trio with side( picked cole slaw) - meats were pulled pork, sausage and chicken ($11 ?? ) 

Rib combo - beef, st louis and baby included ( $16)

we've yet to try the ribs since the other food filled us up !

The meatball sammie was actually 3 sliders - each had cheese and a decent sized, dense meatball drowning in a very spicy sauce - loved it ! 

The trio sliders - also spiked with the spicy bbq sauce - loved the pulled pork and the sausage - would've preferred brisket for the 3rd slider ( probably could've had if i asked ) - large pile of meat on each slider;  smoky goodness - all good !

As usual, the sides complimented the meat perfectly.

I've kicked my rating up a star since they've maintained the quantity/quality of the meat AND the service was excellent.

Oh yes, I'll be back !!

pics included

Taking this place for what it is, a good ole southern bbq joint, it's definitely worth the 5 stars. Great variety, and every meat we tried was delicious, cooked well (meaning good, not well-done) and not drenched in sauce (but you can do that yourself if that's how you like it). I recommend the brisket and the beef rib personally.

I don't know if I liked Rollin Smoke BBQ because I had a couple of beers before dining here.  And, I don't know if I liked it because of the people I was dining with.  Again, I don't know if I liked Rollin Smoke BBQ because sitting next to me was Christie O. who doesn't eat pork.  And, trying to tempt her into turning to the "Darkside" was my goal - no success though.  But, what I do know, is that I liked Rollin Smoke BBQ. 

I had a couple of pork ribs, bacon potato salad, white bread and a diet soda.  The sauce wasn't overwhelming or overpowering.  So, the pork came through.  BACON POTATO SALAD... that won me over.  Anything with bacon is so much better.  

The service was awesome as well.  The girl behind the counter was smiling the whole time she was taking our orders.  The food was delivered with that same smile.  Does it get any better than that.  I think not.  And, to be open late, to boot? Come on... awesome!

So, I don't care what the reason is, that I like Rollin Smoke BBQ.  I like it and I'll definitely return.
Yes Yes Yes, feels like home.  Try the meatloaf, corn, you really cannot go wrong.  The vibe is right, the good is great snd plentiful, loved it!

So far, the best BBQ I've had in town...which is 32 years and counting!  They have something for everyone on their menu.  Owners are very friendly and extremely polite!  I think the location is good because its very centralized in my eyes.  Keep up the great BBQ and friendly atmosphere Guys!!!
This is the spot!!  The brisket made me a believer that good barbecue exists here in Vegas.  The staff was on point, we will be back.

Made the mistake of showing up right before closing.  Ordered the trio.  The chicken was like beef jerky and dry, I guess from sitting all day.  The brisket was good and the ribs were pretty good.  I drove a long ways to get there and when I got home there was no sauce on the meat.  My friends were pretty let down by that.  Made a special trip to get there which I won't do again.  The best BBQ in Las Vegas?  Not even close.
friends have been telling me about this BBQ for over a year. I went tonight...it was the best I ever had, I will be back soon.

If I could add more stars for this review I would. Let me be brief. If you are in Vegas and you have a soul, go to Rollin Smoke and let them satisfy you. Their BBQ is possibly the best I've ever had. The beef ribs are out of this world. Lord, the Jalapeño cole slaw?!? and those cream corn poppers?!??...need I say more? It's a hidden gem just off the strip. Plenty of parking and seating inside. The service is great, everyone is friendly. I've been three times now and the last time I decided to be a hero and take an order back to my family in LA. The waiters carefully packed my meal in a foil carrier and even added dessert as a bonus. I've had the pleasure of meeting the chef and his wife, they are very passionate about their restaurant and you can taste it in the food. I LOVE THIS PLACE. YOU MUST VISIT....thank me later. I can no longer visit my grandparents in Vegas without stopping here...oh and maybe hitting a slot machine or two ;)

First time here and will be coming back again. Loved the brisket. It was so juicy and well seasoned. You can't leave without trying their corn nuggets.  Always keep an eye out for their daily specials listed on a board next to the drinks

You won't find a better BBQ place anywhere near this gem! Great, tasty food for a good price! The staff is friendly and knows what they are doing when it comes to BBQ! Stopping here whenever I'm in Vegas for sure!
My sweetie took me here after discovering it on his own a year ago. Loved it. My favorites were the chicken and the ribs. Greens tasty too. Big portions with a roll of paper towels on each table.
The super sample was so much food!! It fed 10 plus ppl!! My fave was the pulled pork, bread, bbq sauce and Mac n cheese!! I would try this again!!
This is the best bbq in Vegas! We have tried several places and nothing can compare. Everything on the menu is so delicious you wanna come back the next day for more.

Food is great. I'm not a huge fan of their BBQ sauce but it's good. Just not my favorite. Place is always packed at lunch time hard to find a place to sit at times. I would eat here again. I think they need to come up with a couple more options on sauces. I know all places have their own unique style of sauce. Just my opinion.

Best BBQ I've had since leaving the south. Was stationed in Louisiana a few years ago and since leaving have been looking for a place that does BBQ like I had there. This place delivers and then some. The pork was amazing. My picky 7 yr old loved her chicken.

Being a big guy I'm used to being able to"put a hurting" on some BBQ, but even I tapped out. Great portions and very friendly staff. Definitely going back before we leve Vegas.

Found this place to be very expensive for the amount food that we got. We order a rack of beef ribs it was &24.99 and it was 4 half ribs.  We also ordered the meal that said 2 to 4 people for $35.00 and was 2 small sides and 4 small biscuits and all the meat was in one styrofoam tray and didn't even come close to feeding 4 people. So $64.00 dollars was a good meal for 2.

Having grown up in N.C. I'm a big fan of BBQ. Mainly pork sandwiches. I drove by this place twice and even heard about it through the grapevine. Overall, I would give it a B. I'm not comparing NC BBQ to Vegas BBQ, but some of the side items tasted a bit off and the prices were high.

I ordered the pulled pork sandwich with mac and cheese. I should have noticed the word "pulled" pork as it has a different mouth feel than chopped pork. The pork itself was smoky and tender. Long strips of pork inside a hoagie roll. I added coleslaw to the top which was a mistake. The coleslaw (ugh) had chucky bits of cabbage stalk, jalapenos, carrots, corn and I swear I saw bacon in the mix. It wasn't sweet and it wasn't salty; It added nothing to the meal. The mac and cheese on the other hand was delicious. Oddly enough, it tasted like potatoes au gratin I just bought from the store. 

Aside from that awful coleslaw experience I would go back but not to order the pulled pork sandwich. The prices are a bit high and I wish tried something that was just amazing! I will have to go back when they aren't charging full prices such as after 5pm. Perhaps, the ribs and brisket are better.

I love BBQ like no other food on earth.   Juicy,  smoky,  tender meats and comforting sides are my heaven on earth. I just haven't been able to find anywhere in Vegas that can compete with Texas.  I mean you can get great BBQ at a gas station in Texas. Well thanks to Rolling Smoke BBQ, I've found a little bit of smoky heaven right in Vegas.
The meats and sides are wonderful. Nothing fancey or pretentious,  just great food. The portions are large and I think they even have an all you can eat option. there isn't much going on as far as decor.  Just Picnic tables. This is straight out of the Texas BBQ hand book,

Great bbq place.
The chicken was excellent.

Not a great sit down place but the bbq overcomes everything.

A little pricey but worth it.

There's really so much delicious food thats affordable off the strip!

Luckily a friend of ours rented a car for our vegas weekend so we all came here for some delicious BBQ!

The place was pretty packed when we got there but they were quick to take orders and expedite the line. You order first then find your seat so be ready! 

Everyone in my group was so hungry that we didn't even entertain the thought of sharing (which we really should have) and we all ordered separately.

I opted for the chicken wings with the sweet corn pups and a side of catfish. One of my friends got the meatloaf and others got the ribs and brisket sampler deals.

OMG SOOO MUCH FOOD!!! I loved the sweet corn pup things an the catfish was sooo good. Battered just right with alot of catfish meat. My wings were pretty tasty. I went for the mild sauce as its blazing hot in vegas already and I didn't want to suffer by eating hot and spicy buffalo wings. I really wanted to though ;(

Oh they also have sweet tea! Yes... I love bbq and this place does it right. Next time my friends and I will definitely go for the family meals and will split it lol!
This place is pretty darn fantastic! It's crowded most of the time, but you'll understand why once you've experienced the food.
Some of the best BBQ on the West Coast hands down.  Them boys from Arkansas get busy on the grill.

So, my comrade here is in a meat coma, so I need to speak for him. When I heard about the location, I knew right away this was a foodie joint and I was more than right! We ordered the brisket three ways with coleslaw and the meatloaf...unbelievable! Amazing! One of a kind! Whosever mother created this is a lucky person! The meat was infused full of flavor, tender, everything you'd expect and more.  The meatloaf was more amazing than you can imagine, there are no words. Highly recommended!

I am taking liberty of writing this review for both my wife and I. I leaned more to a four and my wife a five. Rounded off to a five. My issue is not really a complaint but a preference. The barbecue sauce had a good flavor, but a little too sweet for perfection and not spicy enough. I got the stock flavor and did not ask for options so partially my fault. My wife loved it so much she ate the trio burger without missing a step. I had the meatloaf with an extra side of Mac and cheese. The portions are a good size and get a free dessert with a check in. The staff also seemed to care about their product and asked me three times how I was doing.  Would definitely recommend and return.

I was going to be generous and give three stars but then I tried the peach cobbler. 

When I walked up to the podium to place my order I asked if I could sample their BBQ sauce. The man said he would bring out the house BBQ sauce and some type of sweet BBQ sauce. I did not like either sauce and this should have been an inclination of what was to come. I ordered the two meat plate with pulled chicken and pulled pork and for my side I chose the baked beans. 10 minutes later my food was ready. First, I tried the pulled pork and the pulled chicken and both were less then impressive. I used some BBQ sauce that I had at home to spruce up the meat. Next, I tried the baked beans. The beans were good, I liked the chunks of brisket and I think their house BBQ sauce tastes better when it is cooked into something. Lastly, the peach cobbler was inedible. I took one bite and that was it, all I could taste was nutmeg. Still in search of good BBQ in Las Vegas and that includes the sides as well.

This place is accurately rated at 4.5 stars.

Gave these guys a try when my family and I were staying at the Trump.  It was close by and we wanted something to take out after spending 5 hours in the car driving from LA.

I have to say that I'm pretty finicky about BBQ because my wife is from Texas and I have sampled most of the best of the best there.  Rollin Smoke does well to hold it's own.  We ordered a pit special so we could try a little bit of everything.  All the meats were fantastic, although I preferred my brisket sliced as opposed to chopped.  The sides were pretty good and I did enjoy a drizzle of the spicy bbq sauce with each bite of meat.  

Best of all, I thought that there prices were pretty reasonable for what you got.  I think we spent about $40 for three people and we had leftovers.  I would definitely eat here again on another trip.

Some of the best BBQ you'll find in Vegas. Just standing in line gets you hungry, the restaurant always smells like smoked meat. The portions are very generous, and the food is great. If you love Southern style BBQ this is one place you won't want to miss.

I never tried BBQ in the southern states but Rollin smoke is for sure one of the better BBQ places in Vegas. The location is I NV a weird place by the industrial strip mall behind the strip, but the food is good. Don't let the outside looks fool you.

I order a two meat combo which comes with a side and a dinner roll. For their side you have to try the corn nuggets. I always change my choices of meat between the hot links, ribs, and the brisket depending on what I'm craving. This place is always busy so be prepared to wait for your food if you come in during lunch hours.

Keeping this short and sweet.
This was stop #1 on my Food Adventure Bachlorette Par-tay! One afternoon - 4 restaurants off the strip. Exploring was fun :)

Living in Oklahoma has lent me a very specific palate for Que.  I like my meats with little sauce and plenty of seasoned flair. Rollin Smoke could give the mid-west a little competition! We were also fortune enough to drop by on a day where they were setting up a photobooth for a children's charity.

The decor was minimal, as it should be. Sort of picnic style. Ordered at the podium.
There was plenty of room for large groups. My party consisted of 7. We order a couple things to share and it was more than enough.

Chicken and pulled pork. Holy. Hell. Both were super moist and tender. The chicken was my favorite by far. Nice smokey goodness. It had great smoke flavor and fell off the frekkin' bone. My two favorite things!

Brisket- Sad to report that it was too dry for me.

Kudos Rollin Smoke! I'm bring the man zone here when we're in town!
I don't really get all the glowing reviews.  I'd rather go to Famous Dave's.   The bacon potato salad and loaded mashed were really good everything else was just okay.  Nothing special.

Love the ribs beef ribs chicken and coleslaw but the best thing was the mac & cheese. Would go back there again next time I'm in Vegas. Don't judge it by the outside inside is where the action is and the food is well worth the price. Really close to the strip and Worth the drive.

Seen all the reviews for the spot so I said well let's go an see what's really burning on the pit.

I wouldn't say its a hidden gem as some would say. 
Definitely ducked off on a side rode next to a strip club.

As you walk up your hit with all the signs letting you know its a BBQ place an when you walk in you clearly see the owner is from the razorback state Arkansas. 

Now to the food. I got spare ribs, brisket, corn fritters. 

The meat was tender but didn't fall off the bone. I wish they had more burst of seasons for all the meat. All our dishes tasted that they had been dipped in pepper.
But no other herbs was taste. 

If they didn't have there house sauces I don't think I would had finish my meal.

Now the corn fritters was to die for well o ly cause I'm from Texas an that's what we do with BBQ an fried chicken places. The batter was grand so don't change that. 

I would come again to try the meatloft possible. 

Hard to find good BBQ cause there's different kinds when it comes to ethics

OK it's a little off-beat for a location, off of Highland in an industrial mega-plex area, strip bars and mechanics shops vie for attention.  You can't miss the big smokers out front though, sitting in the parking lot like beasts of barbecue.   You go inside and like a magical mirror, the place is so much bigger in than out, with a side room and front room with tables and chairs to hang out in.  NOW, the amazing part, the part that astounds is the BBQ!  I don't believe I have ever had better BBQ sauce...EVER.  The brisket wasn't tender but delicious, the hot link was extraordinary and the beans had chunks of beef that were staggering.  Everyone in our group (there were 9 of us) shut right up and dug in (although keeping the 5th star away for now was the somewhat unorganized service).  If you love BBQ, there is NONE better in Vegas, or maybe even in the great state of Nevada.  Heck, I would put it up against the little smoke houses in my wife's hometown of Nashville!  Truly superb food and the banana pudding at the end was heaven itself.  If you are into "fancy" you don't know BBQ anyway so this aint for you.  IF YOU WANT the best tasting BBQ in town though, this is the place for you!   GET SOME!!!

I am a BBQ lover as other food items. I have tried several places here in town, one of them being a chain which was THE WORST hands down (no names mentioned).  Then my husband was introduced to Rollin Smoke and I have been addicted ever since!  A very small place with a BIG MENU! I have tried many things there and my favorite by far is the Beef Rib order. I  So meaty and tender I can't get enough! The Baked Potato "Spudtastic" is a meal in itself! You can order it with whatever meat you like and it is Loaded! If you are getting sides, don't leave without trying the Kickin Baked Beans, full of meat and flavor with a little spice kick!  No matter what you order, there is NO LET DOWN HERE!

HANG UP THE PHONE! I found this total hole in the wall on Yelp, and BOY Im glad I did!

Hubbys from Texas and cant find decent brisket here despite many a valiant effort. 

Until now. Heres the scoop:

This place is tucked behind a strip joint in the seedy area behind the mirage on highland drive.  

In fact, if you're squeamish about going to the hood, you may want to come at lunch time rather than dinner. 

If youre from out of town, dont expect much in the way of atmosphere. The decor is minimal. There are six tables total in the small front room, and maybe 6 or 8 inthe small side room.  . 

This place belongs on diners drive ins and dives for sure. 


Service was ok. At times we had to wait a few minutes for servers to emerge from the kitchen. However, When they werent cooking, they were polite & personable.

Despite all of this, the rating is five stars for the food alone. 

This food really is off the hook. 

1. Biggest beef ribs ive ever seen and thats not an exaggeration. 8oz of beef on each one at least. Sooo tender .& juicy, and the sauce was perfect

2. Best brisket in town, hands down. TENDER, MOIST, unlike at every other wannabe bbq place in town. 

3. The fried okra was the best ive had this side of the mississippi, OR north of the mason-dixon line. I dont like okra if its not perfectly cooked. This was. I was frankly shocked! 

4. Jalapeno coleslaw was very good if a bit hot!

5. Blackberry cobbler was pretty good. I enjoyed it. 

Portions are good sized & filling.

Note: Theres a soda machine tucked in an alcove thats hard to find. At first we thought all they had to drink was sweet tea with no ice lol

In short: if youre from the south and are craving authentic bbq, this place is worth the trip. Oh, and the prices are HALF that of lucilles bbq. Five stars!

The bbq spare ribs were the highlight for me. I tried the chicken, brisket, and pork and while they were decent, the ribs were fall off the bone moist deliciousness. I would come here again for the ribs alone. 

There is a Parking lot outside the restaurant but there's a limited number of spots as the lunch crowd rolls in.

I saw this place on Diners, Drive Ins and Dives and thought I would check out something local the next time I was in Vegas (as in non-chain and not in a major hotel).  Pulling into the location, it looked a bit shady.  I hesitated.  Then I noticed there was a good sized line inside.  Maybe this is a local favorite after all then, right?  The staff was super friendly.  The food was meh.  I've from Tennessee and I grew up having great BBQ so this didn't quite meet my expectations, especially after reading all the rave reviews online.  I would probably not venture this way again, but I also wouldn't complain if I got dragged along with someone else.  Maybe I have a different standard, but I though it was just okay.
All sides and meats were amazing with great smoke flavor. If I lived here I would probably eat here once a week maybe twice a week. Highly recommended.

Definitely love the beef ribs here. The second time I went, the beef rib wasn't as big as the first time I had them, but it was still a hearty rib. The baby backs and spare ribs are both delicious. The spicy BBQ sauce is awesome. This is my go-to spot for BBQ. I'll have to try the outlaw burger sometime, but with ribs this good how can I stop myself from ordering a big rib platter???

As a foodie who grew up in Kansas City, my great frustration with the Las Vegas food scene for many years was the absence of authentic wood-smoked barbecue.  The dirty little secret of the BBQ business is that a lot of it isn't smoked, but just baked in a regular oven.  Oven-baking is a zillion times easier - no fire to tend, no smoke burning your eyes - but it lacks the delicious smokeyness that BBQ fanatics live for.  You will never see a wisp of smoke coming out of Famous Dave's, Lucille's, or Memphis Championship.  But if you drive up to Rollin' Smoke, you'll see the smokers billowing away right in their parking lot.  Rollin' Smoke, Top Notch (both relatively new) and Annie's Kitchen (open for a while now, but not in the best neighborhood) are the only three BBQ joints in Las Vegas where they actually smoke the meat.  And believe me, once you've tasted the difference, you'll never go to the oven-baked frauds again.

For BBQ lovers who must know:  hickory is the wood of choice at Rollin' Smoke, the dry rub is fairly mild, and their sauce is closest to the sweet Memphis variety.  If you're not that concerned with the fine-print details, suffice it to say that Rollin' Smoke is exactly what barbecue should be:  smokey, meaty, and falling-off-the-bone tender.  If you're looking for a LOT of meat for a terrific price, go with the St. Louis ribs, the $12 half rack feeds two normal adults or one BBQ glutton.  The $20 full rack should easily feed a family of four; the size of the rack is straight out of The Flintstones.  While most people prefer babybacks because of their tenderness, my problem with babybacks is that there just isn't enough meat on them.  My eyes popped when I saw the babybacks at Rollin' Smoke because I've never seen babybacks anywhere (well OK, not in Kansas City, Memphis or Texas - 3 of the 4 "capitals" of BBQ) with so much meat on the bones - all the tenderness of babybacks but twice as much meat.

There are plenty of other great items on the menu.  The pulled pork and beef brisket are both winners.  For lovers of Texas-style, they even offer beef ribs, done to perfection (beef ribs are a lot trickier than the pork kind).  My favorite side dish is the bacon potato salad.  The mac & cheese is great too.  One side to avoid is the yams, which I thought were blechy.  True to the owner's roots, two Southern classics are available for dessert:  banana pudding and peach cobbler.  They also serve up a blackberry cobbler which is pretty good (even though I don't like blackberries).  Two caveats before you eat here: 1) be very specific about what you're ordering, because mixups can happen; and 2) order less than you think you can eat, because the portions are huge.  If you're looking for food late on a Fri or Sat night, Rollin' Smoke is open until 1:30 a.m. - a far better option than the overpriced mediocrity of casino coffeeshops.

The typical BBQ joint is formica tables and white plaster walls, bare except for a few pictures of the owner posing with whatever celebrities have eaten there.  Rollin' Smoke is a bit nicer than most because it took over its space from a failed restauranteur whose background was interior design, not food.  But forget the interior, all you need for ambience is a view of those beautiful billowing smokers in the parking lot.

I am so very glad I tried this place!!! I felt like I was in Texas and it was great!! 

I'm not gonna say more than TRY ROLLIN SMOKE BBQ!!!! You WILL NOT be disappointed when the cook brings your food out! GO HERE!!!

A HIDDEN BBQ JOINT IN VEGAS!!!
I was told about this place by a friend. Gotta admit I was kind of skeptical. One bite is all it took. I had burnt ends like I've never had. Heaven in every bite. You can get them by the pound!!!
In the mood for bbq. Don't miss this place!!
We waited a while to get our food it was ok not as great as i thought it would be huge portions good to feel 2/3 mouths.

WOW. I Love and Hate this Place. I Love the Food. Probably some of the Best BBQ I have had. I Hate the Fact that I live in Rosemead and this place is in Las Vegas. Screwed Again. Portions was Very Generous and the Flavor was Top Knotch. Heck, even the Service was Outstanding. I may go to Vegas just to eat BBQ.

Umm.. Am I missing something?! A friend of mine posted a picture on facebook with a caption justifying how good this place is. Like a typical Yelper I checked out the reviews immediately after seeing his post. I was impressed that they have so many reviews and 4 1/2 stars average rating, you really can't beat that. To be quite honest and I hate to put it this way but Rollin' Smoke is meritocracy at it's finest. My friend and I shared the pit special with brisket, pulled pork, chicken and ribs with sides of fried onions, mac n cheese and corn bread. We also ordered banana pudding for desert. I hate to say it, but my favorite part of the meal was the fried onions.. Yah, sad I know? The ribs were pretty tasty, but everything else was kind of blah. I can't really go into detail, maybe because it wasn't that good to me or memorable. Maybe it was a bit too authentic for my liking or the possibility they BBQ theirs Arkansas style. I'm only guessing the owners of this BBQ joint are from Arkansas considering they have University of Arkansas memorabilia around the place.  I tried a BBQ place out last week and I would definitely choose them over Rollin' Smoke. I was not a fan of the sauce either, to the point I scraped it off ribs. The prices here are pretty reasonable, so I can't complain about that. The inside of the restaurant is really rough around the edges, but maybe that's the vibe they are going for? To add to that, the restaurant is the oddest place one could think of. Pretty sketchy in some ways, but that doesn't turn customers away considering there was a good amount of people eating there on a Tuesday night. I was really expecting a lot from this place, but I should of ordered the cat fish like I originally planned?

Amazing!!! This place is a must.  Fantastic BBQ. Super friendly and attentive staff and don't even get me started on the sides... Bacon potato salad, corn bread and banana pudding.  This place is awesome!!!
The excellent reviews were appealing enough to draw me here. I wasn't disappointed. Beef rib and sides were very tasty! Can't wait to come back and try more options!
Smoked meatloaf and pork ribs!  Amazing combo. The "damn hot" sauce was just right.   Will try beef ribs next visit. Small place with picnic tables out front.

Barbeque is dear to my heart - wait, I done said that before ain't I? Damn, I'm starting to sound like a broken wagon wheel. Well hell, I ain't ashamed to say it - I love me some barbeque!    Yeehaw!

I spent a good bit a time in Texas, so it ain't no surprise Texas barbeque ranks up there on my list of the some of the best eats this here world's got to offer - brisket, ribs, sausage and of course, smoke. There's this little barbeque shack in Austin that smokes its brisket for 16 hours, can you believe that - 16 hours? It comes out crispy and as black as coal on the outside but just as juicy as all get out on the in, with the prettiest pink smoke ring, it just about makes you wanna cry. Why, I spect it's about as close to heaven as one could ask for. The fella who runs this place is a real arteest - leavin' just the perfect amount a fat to make that brisket as moist as a Guadalupe mud pie. Anyway, when I thinks of barbeque, well, that's what comes to mind.

So it ain't no surprise to the folks that knows me that Rolling Smoke Barbeque just doesn't cut the brisket - or rather, it cuts too much of the brisket. Where's my crispy, burnt, smoky edge, where's my juicy, tender beef, and where's my smoke ring - what the hell did you do with my smoke ring? Boy, angels is weeping in Amarillo.

Now don't get me started on them there sausages - they's got so much flavor, why did you have to go and overcook it like that? I mean this stuff was drier than a West Texas desert. It's a good thing them corn fritters was damn tasty (course, I'd had better) or I'da went to bed hungry that night.

Okay, I'll admit it, for Vegas this shit ain't bad - hell it just might be the best barbeque joint in town, but that's no damn excuse. 

For pete's sake stop cutting off the good stuff  for dem sissy-pant  intellectual types from Henderson. They's so terrified of this part of town anyway, they drive in and out of here so fast you'd think their asses was on fire. 

This is barbeque dammit! People's food. We knows its got fat, we knows its got calories, we knows it ain't healty, but that's the way we likes it - if we's wanted healthy we'd go to Henderson. Besides, it'a give us a chance to put a scare in dem locals up there.

Shit gets a 3 cause this is Vegas, but don't go thinkin I'm all happy or anythin'. Ya'll make me miss Texas.
The rib tip sandwich is brilliant.  The mac and cheese has just the right amount of kick.

I sure do miss me some Texas BBQ. Where everything is bigger and juicier. This place is fine though, especially for Vegas where there is surprisingly no BBQ king. But Brisket is always a good idea, even if served by the jesters.  

The meats are fine and the BBQ sauce is tasty, but they are stingy with their sauces and that's just pathetic at any rodeo. I will judge a BBQ joint by their sauce flavor and amount. Duh. 

I wanted real southern food and went for the catfish prematurely. It honestly reminded me of why some folks are afraid of catfish. Maybe I say this because I've had the pleasure of enjoying truly authentic southern catfish with collards greens and black eyed peas on the side. Speaking of which, I wanted all the fixings and sides with my ribs and meatloaf and I didn't get everything I wanted but I did get mac and cheese. And chicken wings. Fair enough. Could step it up though. And that's the real gist of this place: It's good but could always improve. 

The menu is larger than a lot of holey BBQ stops that I'm used to, but we are in Vegas. I'll have to keep that in mind, come again and try more. The 3 stars are because I don't believe the hype, taste and prices all align.

I am extremely happy this place lived up to the hype.  I ordered the 3 meat plate with chicken, ribs and brisket and everything was tasty but especially the brisket.  I also loved each of the sauces.  Sitting outside on the picnic table eating great bbq, life doesn't get much better than that.  As a bonus, for the next 12 hours, my burps tasted like brisket!
the service & Amazing delicious food is finger licking good!  Thank you for a  wonderful experience. this is what real BBQ food is about. Totally a 5 star review :-)

Had the smoked ribs, chicken, and sliced sausage link with corn nuggets, hush puppies and peach cobbler, 

Ribs  were perfectly flavored, smoked and tender. 

Their sides and desserts aren't anything to get excited about. Peach cobbler was sweet with chunks of bread. Banana pudding was no good. It was just pudding with hard cookies and no bananas. 

The only knock is CONSISTENCY. I went back the next day and the ribs were far from the first time. Still flavored pretty good . But not as tender. Bummer!

Still give them a 5 for my first experience there. Yesterday I thought I had finally tasted the best BBQ of my life.

This is my second time here in 2 days.  It was so good, I had to do it again.  Brisket is amazing.  They gave me a tour of the back and had the privilege of seeing the smokers and watch them putting the rubs on.  Top notch!!!

Was in Vegas for fury on ice. We wanted bbq after the game so I yelped bbq places in Vegas. This little gem of a place had such great reviews we had to try it. We get there and the line is to the door. Lucky for us most of the customers were taking their meals to go. That's always a good sign as this is a favorite of locals. We found sitting outside before we knew it out food was in front of us. The food is great there were about 8 of us so it seems we tried about everything. I didn't taste a thing that wasn't good. Our new go to place when visiting or passing through Vegas.

This is late but who cares. I went here 4th of July week 2014 with my girlfriend. She loved it.  You can smell the smoke when you pull up!! That's real barbecue to me. I'm giving this place 5 stars and I'll be back next time I'm in Vegas for sure. Ribs beef and pork were really good! Brisket was good too. Didn't really get a taste of the sauce because my dumb ass didn't shake the bottle at the table duh, so I basically squeezed the watered down crap on my meat that forms on the sauce in the bottle. The meat was so good I didn't care. The sides were ok. Greens really good. Potato salad not so much. I'm picky with potato salad, so you decide if you go here to eat. Overall this is good barbecue, and for the guys it's right next to a strip club.
Are you kidding me? A BBQ place CLOSED on Memorial Day weeken???? Memorial Day can just as easily be BBQ day and this place is closed. Wow. Sorry to say it's off the list

I have been here a few times. I have tried everything. Good food but not worth the hype. Great staff but the bbq is just ok. The banana pudding is great but the cobbler barely has any fruit in it. If you want some bbq a good place to go but not a place worth going out of your way for.

Went to check out Rollin Smoke on Saturday around 7.  The line was out the door!  My husband got in line while I went in search for a table. They have picnic tables in the area you order, a dining room connected, and then a completely separate room with some more picnic tables. Oh a few tables outside too. So I found a table in the dining room, which I shared with some people I didn't know, but none of us minded. 
We ordered brisket, pork, and chicken. For our sides we got waffle fries and loaded mash. Everything was delicious. Pork was so tender and juicy. Brisket was tender and was cooked perfectly. I didn't eat the chicken but my husband said it was really good. Everything had wonderful flavor. I like that they didn't drench it in BBQ sauce. There is sauce on all the tables so you can drench it if you want. The brisket came on a really soft piece of white bread. The sides were hot and delicious.  We also ordered the peach cobbler a la mode and it was ok. I would say it was my least favorite thing. It just didn't stand out to me, but it wasn't bad. I just didn't love.  We Really enjoyed eating here and are definitely coming back!  The staff was very nice. They all had smiles on their faces even though they were slammed
It is dawn good for sure!!!! Good service too!!!! They need multiple locations so more people can enjoy. recommended 5 stars.
Double check your bank accounts because they will add more to the tip after you hand them in the merchant copy. Will not go back again and will not recommend it to others!!!
Really tender and super tasty meats. Lizelle,Brenda and chef Damon were very nice and courteous. We'll definitely be coming back  here anytime we're back in Vegas

As much as I love barbeque, I haven't been happy with any one place in town.  Some have great meat, some have great sauce, but none had both.. until now.

Hubby and I went with a friend to try this place out and left with full tummies and happy faces.

First, ambiance.. it's a tiny place inside an industrial strip mall next to an overpass.. the word "dive" was invented for this place, I believe.  Trust me, you won't care.  The new tables inside are nice, though.

Service.. great!

Now for the best part.. the food.  The sides were average to good, but we didn't try a lot of them.  Cole slaw was "interesting", mac n cheese was "okay", baked beans were "good!" .. but we forgot those as soon as we bit into our meats.

I had the pulled pork sandwich, the "Piggy", which came with a side and a drink.  The sandwich was enormous.. first thing I did was cut it in half for taking home half of it.  Then I bit into it and all my taste buds jumped up and did a cheer.  It was the most incredible pulled pork I've ever had.  Superlatives abound.. juicy, tender, meaty, saucy, omg nom nom nom.  I'll be honest.. that other half never stood a chance of going home, I ate it all.

Hubby couldn't decide so he got a half rack each of the baby back pork ribs and the beef ribs.  He was exclaiming about how incredible the pork ribs were and then he tried the beef, completely forgot the pork was there.  He's definitely a beef ribs guy, always prefers those, and found a level of beef rib heaven he hadn't known existed.  And the size of those beef ribs?  Definitely brontosaurus sized, massive amount of meat on each rib.  

Our friend got "The Biggin" sandwich and the brisket sandwich.  He devoured the Biggin and was making lots of strange noises, occasionally coming up for air to proclaim the food amazing.  The brisket arrived a bit later, and brought out a new level of attention - he said it was as tender as a pulled pork sandwich and we all were amazed that there was moist and tender brisket, because every other bbq joint manages to dry the meat out.  Since he has two hollow legs, he ate every bite of both of those monster sandwiches.

The prices are cheap, the food is amazing, and it's probably good that they're not located closer to home ;D.  I'm willing to bet that the Pitmaster there gets marriage proposals on a daily basis, because of his great food.  Hubby was ready to ask for a divorce so he could marry him, and I would have understood... ;)

I too qualify as a bbq expert by way of living in Texas for 10 years
And this food is legit all these positive reviews are absolutely correct 
Driving across town is worth every mile 

We got Ds sampler and it was everything and more 

Brisket (chopped)- is a must, smoked to perfection 

Pulled pork- BEST I EVER HAD

Hot links- are seriously hot extremely spicy 
                 if you don't enjoy heat, don't try it

Ribs- are good and hold to their high standards

Sides are very very important to making or breaking
          bbq joints

Hush puppies- BEST I EVER HAD

Loaded mash potatoes- must have

Cornbread- order it 

Their rolls are potato rolls very good 


Im not getting in the way of the all these high reviews "Rolling" in
And I'm not blowing "Smoke" about this place


ALL BBQ LOVERS  DONT HESITATE  GO GO GO

Until otherwise Rollin Smoke is King of Las Vegas BBQ.

This is the best example of a small business that through word of mouth has become a smash hit with people everywhere!!! Rollin Smoke has come along way in such a short time, I remember when you could see the chefs in kitchen cooking up a storm from the front counter and the area when you walked in was the only place to sit.

Situated between the strip and the 15 highway, Rollin is on South Highland Dr inside a small strip mall. You will see the smoker and or food truck out front, so be sure to keep your eyes peeled.

The best recommendation for a Rollin Smoke lunch or dinner is: Everything..... From the Ribs to the Brisket and home made deserts, this place won't disappoint you. If your hungry go after the Outlaw Burger... It's one tough burger to get into, and you will be full after.

I will say due to being on a few tv shows recently, the lines might start to increase, so get in early!!!!!

Overall
Price: $$
Drink: 3-5 (soda - no booze)
Food: 5-5
Service: 5-5
Come back: everyday if I could 

Catering:
I'll add In here I had Rollin Smoke come to my house and cater my sons 1st birthday... There wasn't to many kids mostly adults.

The guys were amazing, coming early to setup and checking in on every one to make sure all was good throughout the party. 

Bringing in a smoker to cater the party was also a pretty awesome choice, I'm pretty sure the neighborhood was drooling at the smell. Highly recommend for anyone and everyone... Also a real decent price....

Overall: top shelf

I love when Yelp steers me in the right direction. I am not a BBQ connoisseur or really even a BBQ fan, but I had family in town and we wanted to try some place new. 

It was a little difficult to find, but I had driven by Rollin Smoke while I was in the area on a previous occasion so knew generally where it was located. We had initially attempted to go to Peppermill, but the wait was longer than we were willing to eat, so I made the executive decision to try Rollin Smoke. It's in a pretty inconspicuous location, so keep your eyes peeled. 

The restaurant was much larger and nicer looking than I had expected. Roomy, with plenty of seating, even booths which I always prefer, and very clean. You order at the podium and they bring your food out to you. Since there was a free dessert with Yelp check-in offer, I took advantage of this and ordered the pulled piggy sandwich with jalapeno coleslaw and peach cobbler. Our food came out quickly and everything smelled and tasted great! The meat was pretty good. I'm no expert, but I enjoyed my pulled pork quite a bit. The coleslaw was spicy and tasted pretty good. The cobbler was great too, but I would ask for no whipped cream next time. My family all love their meals as well. Some of the sides were hit or miss, but some of our favorites were the corn nuggets and coleslaw. The mac n cheese was ok, but I'd have to order it again to see if I like it better next time. 

Their menu is quite extensive and they have so many great options that I look forward to exploring on our next visit. Overall, the experience was great and if they were in a more convenient location I could see myself coming here much more often. They have an all you can eat option for $25. I don't think I could handle it, but it seems like a pretty good deal. They also have family packs available for large parties, which is great.
The smell of that place alone is amazing .. :p the pit special was enough for two, soo good can't wait to go back to try more

Went here based on watching the travel channel.  Had the BBQ meatloaf which was the dish covered in the program.  It was the best meatloaf that I have ever eaten.  Amazing dish.  Another in party had salad with smoked pork and said it was also amazing 

Very informal you sit at long table but worth it for the great BBQ.  On a backroad but only a few minutes from the Strip

The best BBQ in Vegas or anywhere.  Rating should be eleven out of ten!  Outstanding!  This is the perfect hole-in-the-wall BBQ dive.  Real Southern BBQ.  There were six of, us three adults and three children.  Everyone loved it.  We ordered a variety of plates and items and shared. Everything was fantastic. The atmosphere, the "Mom" greeter, with her "Sweet Southern Hospitality", the menu options, and the food.  Break away from the assembly line chains and go here.  The brisket, ribs, corn nuggets, pork, hot links, potatoes salad, and meatloaf can not be beat.  Real home style food.  Our new favorite.
This place is to BBQ, as Lola's is to New Orleans style restraints in Vegas.  As good as it gets.
This will become a new local's favorite.  Get away from the strip, big celebrity names, chains, and gimmicks.  All you need for your BBQ desire is right here.
Beef ribs. Got the full rack. Delicious and huge! Wife had the outlaw burger and it was very good as well. Will definitely be back

I had to try this place out after hearing so many good things about it - and I got to say, it's lives up to the hype! Food is absolutely delicious and the service is great. I ordered the duo combo which comes with choice of two meats and a side. I got the brisket, hot links, and potato salad. Brisket was nice and juicy - hot links were savory - potato salad was very tasty with bacon pieces and pepper. To top it all off, I tried Blue Bell ice cream for the very first time and it was a great sweet finish to my meal. 

TIP: Don't go at 12 unless you have time to stay. First time I went, the line was out the door! I only had an hour lunch break so I came back a few days later after 1PM and had plenty of time.

Plain and Simple.....Best Ribs in Vegas! N'ough said!
Pulled pork is juicy.  Peach cobbler is my favorite and don't forget to order a side if Blue Bell Vanilla ice cream.  This place really smoking hot.   We live in Henderson but we don't mind the drive.

Accessibility (Parking / Wait Time)

1/1 Star: parking lot.  No wait. 

_____

Service (Waiter / Cleanness / Ambiance)

1/1 Star: fast food service. Clean. Nice ambiance 

_____

Taste (0=Not Edible / 1=Edible / 2=Good (average) / 3=Must Try!)

2/3 Stars: brisket was good but the bread was a bit soggy. The cobbler is good. 

_____

Overall Experience

4/5 Stars 

_____

Last Words

Not bad. I was expecting more smoke smell and flavor.
Awesome place. The bbq was amazing. Great beer too.  Definitely a must if youre in the area

Highland Dr and Industrial Rd are better known for their close proximity to the Las Vegas glittery night life, where even the least physically attractive individuals can lease the personal attention of barely clothed seductive sirens $20 at a time.  But thanks to Rollin' Smoke Barbeque, this same area will also be known for down to earth, simply delicious BBQ. 

On a recent weekday evening, a handful of coworkers decided to meet here post work to try some BBQ that Nelson Q has proudly put his 5 Yelp stars stamp of approval on. In typical fashion, I was the first to arrive.  The parking lot was empty except for 2 cars, all the other businesses were closed, and there was a guy in suits finishing his early dinner.

The restaurant itself is very low key. It housed nothing flashy in terms of decorations, except for a big boar's head mounted on one of the walls. The lobby/ordering counter is in a small room, but the main dining area is in the adjacent room. The seats are comfortable, and there is a TV for you to watch sports or highlights, while you wait for your order.

Most of us opted to try the Outlaw Burger. For $6.99 + tax, this burger is the size of two of my fists stacked on top of each other.  It is packed with a 1 lb patty (60% brisket and 40% ground beef) and cooks down to about 12 oz, served with Rollin' Smoke's homemade tangy BBQ sauce, the usual vegetable fixings and some (lettuce, tomato, fried onions, scallions, and cheese) which not only made it physically big but the flavors complimented each other and resulted in a mean serving of burger that I can easily recommend to anyone not opposed to eating pork and beef.  For $2, you get a drink and choice of one side (bacon potato salad would be a good pick), and make your order a combo.  Currently there is also a Yelp Check-In promotion, where you get a complimentary dessert with your order.

Rollin' Smoke BBQ, now my personal #1 one pound burger in LV.

Decor:  3/5  No frills hole in the wall restaurant. You are here because you want good BBQ, not design ideas for your Texas ranch.

Food:  4/5  Good BBQ made with passion and love.  They serve Blue Belle ice cream too (coworkers said it reminded them of the ice cream in the Philippines. I will take their words for it.)

Value:  4/5  Good for the wallet. I estimate that 65%+ of you will not be able to finish the Outlaw Burger, side + drink.

Location:  5/5  Not far at all if you are visiting the Strip.  The cabbies will probably know it too, if not, it is just down the street from Sapphire. 

Parking:  5/5  It is practically all for Rollin' Smoke BBQ customers.

Easily 4 stars!

P.S.  If you stop by during lunch, I heard this is where some of them sirens get their lunch/breakfast before/after work. So I've heard.

I made a mistake and ordered the burger....the idea of hamburger meat and brisket was intriguing but there was wayyy too much onion straws. The burger was uneatable as a whole. The combo (w/ a side and drink) was $15 and I bet $5 of that was for onion straws. Additionally, I ordered the collared greens and received green beans instead. Because I took a bite I thought it was too late to say something. The green beans were decent on the first few bites but soaked in garlic oil. I should have played it safe and ordered the double combination plate. I'm sure the BBQ is good but I was pretty disappointed with my meal.

I love discovering new places. Don't mind the shady location - food is awesome! I tried the two meat plate with the brisket burnt ends and the hot links . I absolutely loved the brisket - I usually have never liked it. So good. The hot links were good and hot!!  Mac N Cheese was great as well as the corn fritters! So much food, I'm ashamed but I ate it all ! Mom would have loved this place!! At least my5k is tomorrow  And a shoutout to Will and Lizelle. Thanks!!!

I love this place, it's my favorite BBQ joint in Las Vegas. As soon as you walk in the door, look around and the smells hit your nostrils, you know this place is legit. Everything I've ever had here was great, but my go-to is the pulled port sandwich with hush puppies and sweet tea. If you like spicy food, be sure to ask for a side of their Hot Damn (or is it Damn Hot -- I can never remember) sauce, which is a very spicy version of their house made BBQ sauce. It's awesome. My mouth is watering just thinking about Rollin Smoke. 

They are soon to be opening a second location in the Pawn Star's new container park, just a few blocks above the north end of The Strip.

This BBQ place has very good food. I had the five meat combo brisket, ribs chicken hot link and pulled pork with three sides. Now this is touted as enough to feed two or three. I ate godanm near the whole fucking thing in one sitting, and I know my 150 lb twenty three year old son could have wiped the whole thing out. Maybe from Bakersfield our appetite for Que is a bit too much? Anyhow very good food, very nice people and the food was very fast too, literally within five minutes I had my food. I will come back if I am in the area. Highly recommended!

Very disappointed.  I dont know who is so impressed with their BBQ or the place.  These 5 star people must be smoking crack or dont know good BBQ.  I was SHOCKED at all the great reviews.  Is someone buying the Yelp reviews here?  Its seems insane they have so many 5 stars from people who claim to have traveled to good BBQ?

- BBQ was a little dry, seasoning ok.  2 out of 5 if you've had great BBQ and traveled the world.
- WAAAAYYYYYYY over priced for portions and quality.  Did I mention WAY over priced.  $33 for a lousy small helping of ribs.  
- Outlaw Burger?  Should be outlawed.  Horribly tiny and meat is awful.  Tastes like they put filler all in it of some time.  So gross meat I spit out one bite.  I dont know where that big burger they have on the Yelp photos is but thats not.  Bait and switch you ask me.
- Only one BBQ sauce on the table - and liquidy weak.
- We had 3 ketchup bottles completely empty.  Very old employee came round and just shrugged when we complained like "owell."
- Fake pretentious BBQ poise with a couple lame pickles and bad white bread ends.
- No air in main eatery, side eatery for parties has air.  Who wants to eat in a muggy bbq joint in Vegas.
- Bathroom, borderline poor.  The toilet seat had been pulled off so I guess if you where a woman or someone you just had to squat.
- Super loud inside so noisy you cant talk or hear yourself think.
- To top it off in a real dumpy part of town with crappy parking. 
- Really comes off as some tourist trap judging by the price vs. quality.

Albeit the people where nice.

Y'all want some good BBQ. Come on in!

I love that they serve beef ribs and I mean these are like Flintstones size ribs. Speaking of Flintstones they also have these huge smoked turkey legs.

My favorite is definitely their smoked meatloaf topped with BBQ sauce and fried onion strings over some rib sticking (no pun intended) mash potatoes. And  if that were not enough a side of their corn fritters dusted with magic.  

Not in the mood for meatloaf, try their famous "Outlaw Burger" and try to finish this in one sitting...waffle fries too!

Don't forget to sip some of their wonderful sweet tea and save room for one of their delicious desserts like their banana pudding.  

The food and service just don't disappoint!!!!

Went there to have a late lunch decided to eat there. I ordered the three meal platter ribs, brisket, and hot link we waited patiently for our meal the meat came out cold. And the yams was was like yam soup it was cold also, I sent them back asked for the baked beans didn't get them until 10min later I won't be going back.

Very good food..Family owned and they take pride in their BBQ!  Ribs..brisquet..burgers..their sides are to die for..its always full..people can't get enough of it. Though the wait is not long curiously enough?

I really wanted to like this place because friends of mine who have gone love the food. Maybe I went on an off day but I felt the meats were dry and lacked flavor. It wasn't like I only tried one item...our group had ordered a mixture of ribs, brisket, chicken, pulled pork sandwich, wings, corn nuggets, hush puppies and potato salad. Nothing really stood out. I am willing to give it a second try but maybe this time I'll go during the day instead of an hour before closing. Aside from the food, the people and service were great.

Amazing home cooking BBQ, fresh daily. Worth coming here every time I come to Vegas this spot will be visited! Love those corn nuggest, fresh crispy and cream corn inside is a must! The yams are so delicious and all the meat is seasoned just right with the variety of bbq sauce! Love this place is a must go and inexpensive!
Can't wait to come back here. My family and I had damn near the whole menu and EVERYTHING is delicious!! Incredibly friendly staff, too!

This is definitely the best barbecue place in Las Vegas by car was amazing the beef ribs are delicious as well... If you ever get the cashiers Jessica she is the best cashier they have always greet you with a smile

this place is five stars and I wish I could give it six
Omg! Mind blowing.  I didn't expect it to be this good. I had baby back ribs, spare ribs and burnt ends with corn nuggets.  Everything was seasoned right and juicy. Definitely coming back

Real friendly good people.

for 4 adults and 3 small kids (under 6 yrs old):

Ordered:

2 Pit Specials
with the followings sides:  2 jalapeño cole slaws, 2 waffle fries, 1 corn nuggets, 1 dirty rice
Peach cobbler a la mode (would pass on this)

Pit special was delicious.  And love all their bbq sauces
I combined the hot links, cole slaw and pulled pork and made a delicious sandwich.

Cole slaw was great
Not a fan of the waffle fries
Corn nuggets were good but you can't eat too much of them.
Dirty rice tastes like rice pilaf (won't order this again)

I wanted to like this place. Came very highly recommended, but fell very short! I think I'm being generous with 3 stars. Would not recommend or go back. 

More details coming, but Barbie's review is dead on. Bland, not tender. Owner or dude in front was nice. Employee was last with a simple question.

Food was great. Had the Trio Meat Plate with chicken,ribs,burnt ends brisket, and corn nuggets. Ordered catfish, potatoe salad, and peach cobbler Togo. 

Shout out to Christine and the rest of the crew for just great customer service. 

Note... Could here the kitchen crew doing cheers in the back!!!

The ribs and chicken were good, tender and flavorful.   The brisket was Ok.   I'm not a fan of pulled pork, though others seemed to be enjoying theirs. The sides were fine.   The cornbread was desert quality, very sweet. Dusty at the order booth hepled me not to over order, which I appreciated, especially on the road when I can't take home left overs.  I thought it was a good, meaty meal at a good price.  You may want to take a taxi there and back if you don't have good walking shoes.

Been wanting to try your place for a long time and finally got the chance. 

Burnt ends: pretty good, lots of flavor 
Sliced brisket: on the dry side with little fat 
Beef ribs: was decent, a little chewier then expected 
Corn nuggets: good stuff 

Side note: saw the fish tank from the show "tanked" and it was a little sad

Excellent food and amazing customer service! 
After a long day on the road, my girlfriend wanted bbq so we decided to give Rollin smoke a try, and I'm glad we did. 
The person who took our order was super friendly, informative and just great to deal with. His name was Dave and this establishment is lucky to have a person like him working there. Keep up the fantastic work Dave! 
Our food was also amazing, everything was flavourful and the portion size was huge.

My first time here! Very great customer service. My boyfriend got the Outlaw burger, it was humongous! Very good. It does take a bit longer to make, but it's worth it. Everyone was super friendly! Their mama's banana pudding was delicious. Can't wait to come back to try more BBQ goodness!

Great food, fast service, Fantastic, friendly and happy, people working here. Small place but I think that's what makes it the best. You go in order and pay for your food, and find a seat and they call your name and bring it to your table. This place is highly recommended by me as a first timer. I say to the owner of this business the food is great but the staff make the experience amazing. O yea, the chef was a very nice guy.

Rollin' Smoke is located in a weird business park complex which boasts the corporate headquarters of a place called "Kiesub Electronics", but also has 3 buildings in the same place that bear the Kiesub name. The complex/mini strip mall feels like someone's trying too hard to make their own little sandcastle come across as an empire. Tucked away on the side not visible to us immediately was Rollin' Smoke.
