This was also part of my Vegas journey to find a good burger. Rollin' Smoke's got a burger called the Outlaw that they like to pile with brisket. People dig it, so I set out to try it out...only problem was, they were sold out.

I settled for a Brisket Dog instead, because I enjoy a good potato chip sandwich every once in a while. "Puttin' Things on Top of Other Things Cuisine" is totally in my wheelhouse. If it was just the dog, the brisket and the Arkansauce that they serve up, I think I would have enjoyed it a lot more, but the cheese wiz on that sandwich really doesn't tie it together flavor-wise. I ended up scraping off the wiz after a couple bites, and it was much tastier that way.

The brisket...I dunno, man. I dunno what they do down in Texas that nobody else seems to be able to replicate, but this place didn't come close. It's just about Bludsoe's quality. Not quite salty and flavorful enough. Much as I hate being a locale champion, any BBQ that I've had outside of Texas just doesn't cut it anymore. I don't know what it is. The group I was with had the same impressions. It's perfectly fine, and it may very well be the best BBQ in Vegas, but it's pretty low on the totem pole in terms of overall rankings. The links are nothing special, and neither was the pulled pork. I'm not a ribs guy, but one of my group dug the ribs. So maybe order that if they're out of Outlaw Burgers. :)

We did all like their side dishes, though, so they've got that working, and the service was quite nice. People were pleasant and attentive. I probably wouldn't revisit the place, but it's not like it was an unpleasant dining experience.

Vegetarian?  Here's a pickle.  This is the carnivore's domain.

Note:  Everything I know about BBQ, I learned on TV.  I've been to Memphis, Kansas City, and Dallas and never had a lick of the stuff.  Even better, growing up in Hawaii, we boiled our ribs before grilling them.  I'm quite the expert.  But...

The wafting aroma of sweet hickory smoke.  The earthy, mild spice rub that has deeply penetrated the proteins; a moist, beefy rib with tender sinew and rendered fat;  fall off the bone baby backs; "suckably" delicious cartilage of toothsome spareribs, and glistening slices of brisket.  The acrid, bitterness of the smoke ring in strong contrast to the almost sweet meat.   Food porn!

The sauce has a good vinegar kick that helps to cut the one dimensional flavor and cloying, richness that becomes more difficult to take the more you eat and the colder it gets.  

Their signature, bigger than any human's mouth, stuff falling out, BBQ sauce on your face "outlaw" burger is good eats.  Brisket, sauteed onions, peppers, fried onion strips, slaw, veg, cheese and a chipolte aioli; what's not to love?

Remaining menu items less successful.  The breaded catfish and shrimp are both overcooked and rubbery.  The smoked meatloaf, excessively smoky and bitter.  Deep fried sides often oily with one exception, the outstanding cream corn nuggets.  Crispy on the outside, rich creamy corn goodness on the inside.

Prices are very reasonable for the quantity.  The $24.99 AYCE a winner; anything on the menu, one price.

The worthy indulgence is not without cost.  Suffice it to say, remember waking up from a drunken stupor after having smoked your first cigar?  All the mouthwash in the world...

Honestly I should have stayed closer to home and went to Famous Dave's. I wanted to be impressed with Rollin' Smoke and unfortunately I wasn't. Cool logo, but customer service and food was sub par. We were greeted (I take that back, the order lady, Sophia) just glared at us when we stepped up to order. No hi or hello, it was like we were annoying her. She treated everyone like this so I didn't feel singled out. We got our food, brisket sandwich and pulled piggy sandwich. I felt like the meat could only be saved by drowning it in sauce. Mac and Cheese and Cornbread was good, but I wanted great BBQ and it came up short. The restaurant is a weird layout too. If it's a cold day sit in the inner portion of the restaurant. The area by the order counter is by the door which never closes. Even the employees won't shut it when they go in and out, so it can get cold while you are eating. There are better BBQ joints in town...I suggest trying another place.

Been going to Rollin for two years, and the food is great.   They added several servers and they are just down right rude!  The first meal we had we ordered a to-go bag and it was missing the pulled pork. I figured it was an oversight and we would go again.

 The next day we tried to call in a large order but the phone went straight to voice mail so it took a while to get our food and when questioned how much longer, they made rude comments to us.  We have received good service in the past but the owner was working during that visit and this time he was out doing a BBQ competition. No matter how good the food is, I'll take my business somewhere else where I'll be treated as a customer.   Spent $190 on my two visits combined.

Resolution:  Train your help, food runners, to not to be rude to the customers!!
This is hands down the best food I ate in LV and honestly some of the best cue I've ever had, don't skip this place if you're in town, and definitely get the brisket

I ended up here in an entrapment sort of situation that is a long story....but, man was I super glad. 
I'm from Kentucky(Go, Big Blue!) and I"ve not had barbeque this good since....I lived there. The decor is just kitchy enough to add to the authenticity without being corny. 
You place your order at the counter and then food is brought to you, so we didn't really have a waiter, but everyone was nice and I wasn't without anything that I needed. If you check in on Yelp you get a free dessert. I got Banana Pudding cause duh...and it did not disappoint.
I would give 4 stars but my booth had a hole/gargantuan dip in it so it was kind of like sitting on a porta potty. Get the other booth though and you will be set.

Okay I have got to say I am EXTREMELY satisfied with the service. The story was that me and 2 other friends ordered the $50 sampler plate and were extremely dissatisfied with what we were given. The actual plate looked nothing like the photo. The plate we received was probably half of what was shown in the Yelp photo. When we compared it to the duo plates my other friends got (which were less than $20 each) the size of our plate wasn't that much bigger than theirs. When I went up to question the cashier about it, he told me that the uploaded Yelp photo was meant for Photoshoot and the quantity was exaggerated for photo purposes. And then he proceeded to tell me that the sampler plate we got is what they actually intended to serve. At that point I was extremely upset with the false advertisement and started giving the cashier attitude. In my head I was thinking "you scams......we are definitely leaving you guys 5 one star reviews." However, instead of taking it in negatively, the cashier took it really well. He told us he can solve the problem and will just give us more food to make up for it. The amount of food they brought out afterwards definitely exceeded what was shown in the Yelp photo. Our whole party really appreciated the awesome customer service and yummy food. We are also very satisfied with how fast the foods were brought out. It definitely went from a potentially bad dining experience to a very positive one! I would like to thank the staffs for making this dining experience so pleasant.

WOW! So I was really surprised by this place....

I originally wrote it off because it is a BBQ place in the middle of the desert. If I want BBQ I typically pick it up when I am on business in Texas and South Carolina. 

Well let me be the first to say...I WAS WRONG! This place is the real deal! 

The BURNT ENDS! That is all I have to say...

All the food is delicious, but certain things on the menu are MIND-BLOWING!
(Burnt ends, beef ribs, pulled pork)

The corn nuggets are worth the trip alone. We had the Rib platter with corn nuggets and a Duo with Beef Brisket, 2 Spare ribs and fried okra. This was enough food for 3 or 4 people. Another Las Vegas gem!! The beef rib was like something from The Flintstones size wise. My favorite was the baby backs. Don't miss out on this place.

"DEATH ROW LAST MEAL" , Had "The Pit Special" 5 meat 3 sides to go. Was watching "Green Mile" while enjoying this AWESOME BBQ meal! I was thinking if ever I was on death row( not that I would be) , this would be my request for my last meal!!! With the Blueberry cobbler ala mode for dessert. But would also need white rice , you know , being the staple dish for Asians. Everything meat is 'qued to perfection. Like John Coffey would say, " the sauce is the boss, Boss." After finishing the meal..." I'm tired, Boss. Dog Tired." 
 Spare Ribs- Fall off the bone tender. Brisket- juicy. Pulled Pork- chopped to perfection. Chicken- tasty, skin and all. Hot Link- just the right amount of spice. The blueberry cobbler- "Heaven , I'm in Heaven..."
The sides, bbq beans- great white rice topper! Corn Nuggets- should have ordered double. Mac & cheese- cheesy and Deeelish!!!
  Once a year I just might have to do the All-you-can-Eat for $35 but wouldn't eat for 3 days before going and just drink water.
I must agree with all the reviews here... Best BBQ in Las Vegas and the surrounding communities.
The Outlaw Burger will be next on my bucket list for lunch. With waffle fries!!!

These guys have the best BBQ in LV. The chopped Brisket and the Beef Ribs are the highlights and are must tries. The customer service is top notch and they have a locals discount (every little bit helps). 

Only drawback is they are closed on Sundays! LOL
Amazing food! The potato salad is my favorite ever. The neighborhood is super sketchy, though.

came here on my last trip to vegas .  my husband and i hardly ever deviate from our normal go to places in vegas but we decided to give this place a try.  

he got the trio of the meats ( chicken, brisket, and pulled pork) and an extra slap of ribs for me =D  and i also ordered a side of corn bread.  

The ribs were SOOO good!!! my husband is pretty picky w/ his meats and he really liked them.. there was really good flavor, good smoke and definitely good chew! 

the chicken was also pretty good too! brisket and pulled pork were just ok for me. 

i loved the cornbread! it was super uber delicious!
The place is SOOO GOOD ..... Little slow ... But it's due to how AWESOME THE FOOD IS .... One issue - sweet tea SUCKS !! Make your home made .... Please

My boss was coming into town and I know he likes BBQ so I turned to Yelp and found this place!  We arrived at the restaurant at around 1:30pm on a Thursday afternoon.  It was crowded, but we managed to find a table in the back.  I can certainly see how popular this place could get on the weekends or evenings!  We both ordered the Trio special and had pulled pork, ribs and burnt edge brisket.  The pork was very good and the ribs were delicious!  The burnt edges were a bit fatty for both of us, but the sauce on the tables was very tasty indeed!  I had the waffle fries and a side of mac and cheese - both very tasty.  Service was fantastic and everyone who worked there was friendly and accommodating to our questions about the menu.  I will definitely be returning with the family now that I've found this place!  Boss enjoyed it as well and will probably return next time he's back in town.  Definitely a word-of-mouth place as you won't pass by this place unless you do business on Industrial/Highland!
The MAC N CHEESE!! Best BBQ in Las Vegas without a doubt, great service and the beef ribs melt in your mouth! It's a must.

Some of the best low-and-slow smoked BBQ we've had anywhere. This is the real deal. Rollin Smoke is so good at smoking their meat that they slice their brisket on the thick side, but the slices are still perfectly tender. It takes some serious smoking talent to be able to pull that off. 

We tried their smoked meatloaf (with brisket in the meatloaf mix), spare ribs, brisket, and pulled pork. All were fantastic. Sides we tried were greens and mac-and-cheese, and it was clear they take pride in their sides as well. 

This is a small place in a small strip-mall off the Vegas strip just east of the I-15 freeway. If you blink while driving by you might miss it. You order at a podium then go find a seat and they bring your food out to you. We were there at 4:30 PM on a Tuesday and there was no wait and ample seating available, but it's easy to see how Rollin Smoke might get very crowded and seating might be hard to come by during peak times. Parking might be challenging during peak times as well. 

The prices they charge for their food represent an exceptional value in a tourist town like Las Vegas. For the price of a fancy appetizer on the strip you can have a 3-meat platter with a side and a drink. What a find!

This is some of the best BBQ you can get in vegas. Zero complaints about the food. The brisket is to die for, as well as all the side dishes. The only down side is that it is somewhat expensive. Good size meal will be almost $20, but you get a lot of food so it is well worth it. Also, expect to wait a while during lunch time, this place is very busy.

After trying most of the bbq restaurants around town, including the chain bbq places, Rollin Smoke BBQ is the real deal! SIMPLY THE BEST BBQ IN TOWN, the sides and the seafood are great too!!! Do yourself a favor, and treat yourself!!! Bring your family, bring your friends, hell, bring everyone!!! I guarantee you will love it!!! (I posted some of my food pictures here, so check it out!)
$25 all you can eat! Must get: popcorn shrimp, pulled pork, brisket, ribs, bacon potato salad, mac n cheese, mashed potato, corn bread and banana pudding!!

Legit. I had the ridiculously oversized Outlaw Burger and a side of Mac n Cheese. Wife had the chicken/brisket combo with a side of corn fritters. And it all got demolished. Do you hear me? ALL OF IT. 

Rarely am I impressed with BBQ places but Rollin Smoke had it rollin alright. Portions, taste and price were all above the standard. Its definitely part of my Vegas food rotation from now on. 

Good job, gentlemen.

Rollin Smoke Barbeque should definitely be grateful that their food is so damn good. My first experience was great. I had their Outlaw Burger which was delicious! It's definitely one of the best burgers that I've had. 

My second visit was crappy. I ordered take out late at night. My fiance was craving sweet tea so I made sure to order that first. No problem the lady said. The sweet tea actually comes with the meals that we placed free of charge. I go to pick up my food and she hands me two cups. I go to pour myself the sweet tea to go but it's empty. I go up to the counter to let the employee know. She apologizes and tells me that she'll get a new one out. I'm waiting for a good 10 minutes, maybe not realizing that it's been 10 minutes because I was on my phone. A male employee walks out from the back and starts cleaning up. I politely ask him if he knows that status of my sweet tea and I inform him that the previous employee said that she would have it brought out. Well apparently, she is now off her shift and he knows nothing about it. He tells me that unfortunately, they're out of sugar and so there's no sweet tea at all until they get a shipment. 

Ummm. Seriously? I realize that I'm the last customer there but they were a good hour away from their posted closing time. He apologizes for the inconvenience when in reality, he should have apologized for making up a piss poor lie and telling it to my face.  It's hard to believe that a establishment with that type of food would be out of sugar for it's sweet tea. I actually called the next day and lo and behold they did have sweet tea available. Hmmmm.

Again, they should be grateful that they're food is good.

Decided to go back and give it another try. The food was good the first couple times I was there. I walked in about the same time this other fellow did and we stood there waiting for somebody to take our order. This young man came out brought some food for a table so I know he saw us, place is not that big. He went into the back and never came back out. We stood there for awhile and I left. Never and that's a log time will I return.

I'm so glad we made a pit stop here to eat before heading into the strip. It has its own parking lot and the place is not on the strip so parking was incredibly easy. The aesthetics is the restaurant isn't anything appealing but the BBQ was fantastic. The meat falls off the short ribs like butter, the pulled pork and brisket was juicy and marinated well. I didn't think the chicken was as good compared to the the other meat options but the chicken was moist and good nonetheless. And LET'S TALK SIDES. I ordered the fried okra, corn puppies, cole slaw and corn bread and they were all AMAZING. A must try for those meat lovers and comfort food lovers.

I came here on my most recent vegas trip after finding it on yelp. The waiter at the front was super helpful at helping explain the menu to me. Food was very decently priced and this spot is located about 10 minutes from the strip. I ordered the 3 item combo with brisket ribs and hot links. I enjoyed the hot links and ribs but the brisket was slightly dry for my taste. Service was excellent here I felt at home. Will be back on my next trip to vegas

Lady at register was super rude!!! 
Rolling smoke = rolling eyes when asked questions , quality went down since last visit .... Very disappointed !!!
Food was excellent. The service was even better. You can't go wrong with anything on the menu. We finished off with sweet potato pie and it was amazing!! Would highly recommend it!!
Definitely a must try if your in the mood for ribs. Hot link was tasty!!   Brisket was just ok but all in all a great little joint.   I'll be back for more!!!!  Don't forget the fried okra!

Great BBQ food for a quick meal. They have multiple sauces from sweet to hot with all of them being great.
Very friendly staff.

Amazing amazing amazing! We fell in love and can't wait to go back. The brisket was wonderful and so was the CORNBREAD. The loaded mashed potatoes were definitely worthy of getting again. The only thing I would pass up is the Mac n cheese. Just not cheesy enough for me but everything else was so delicious!

Only reason I'm giving 4 stars is because it can go for a renovation. However the food is definitely 5 stars, I've had so much bbq that I simply can't tolerate the mediocre stuff. Rollin smoke has it down, ribs were tender and had good flavor, as did the brisket. BBQ sauce is a HUGE deal to me, and theirs was just right, not too spicy, sweet, or acidic. Sides were perfect, I couldn't decide so I had greens, mac n cheese, beans and hush puppies. Everything was excellent, I really did appreciate the atmosphere, the fact that they pretty much just give you your food reminded me of the southern bbq culture. BBQ is not a fancy upscale experience where your given limited napkins, its fun and loose, they definitely have that down. I'll definitely make this a go to spot.

Very good food probably the best we had in Vegas. My wife had the meat loaf omg very good I had chicken, ribs and pork very good. We were very pleased with the customer service also staff was very friendly and thanked us for coming in very enjoyable.

I wanted to go to this place after seeing it on BBQ Crawl. My wife and I were heading to Vegas with my daughter and her boyfriend, so we decided to have dinner there. We had the smoked meatloaf, the rib tips, and the burnt ends. Everything we tried was amazing and the staff was incredible. They were super friendly and were very fast in getting the food out.

Being a BBQ enthusiast myself, I wanted to takes look at the smokers. I met the owner's mother and she showed me around. She was very sweet and personable.

We are definitely going back before we head out of town.

If you are in Vegas, I highly recommend going to Rollin' Smoke BBQ.

It is hard to imaging better BBQ anywhere.  The only place I have tried that compares is IronWorks in Austin, TX.  I had the rib special and the beef rib was perfect.  Clinging to the bone just long enough to fall off with a slight pull.  The pork was equally amazing.  I also sampled the meatloaf which had a unique composition and flavor I loved.  Staff was super friendly.  

Right off the strip this place was surprisingly away from the crowds.  Will clearly do this place again.  It just might be worth the 5 hour drive by itself!
The best customer service, a little pricy but get a lot of food per order. Great tasting and lots of sauce choices.

Wow! Wow! Wow!! The best, most authentic BBQ I have ever tasted! We went as a group of four and each of us ordered something different.  We wanted a variety of meats and sides.  The meats were so tender and delicious and bursting with a flavor.  They have a great selection of "sides" but the Mac-n-cheese was my favorite.  Not overly cheesy -- just perfect!  And then came dessert!  Absolutely amazing!  We tried the peach cobbler, berry cobbler and their famous banana pudding!  Oh my goodness! The banana pudding was the best I've ever tasted! Rollin Smoke BBQ takes the time to perfect ever aspect of their menu.  You will not be disappointed.  We can't wait to come back!
My wife and I just moved back to Vegas and discovered Rollin Smoke last night.  We are stoked that Vegas has a real BBQ joint.  It made me want to cry...  My wife gave it the Texas approval too.

Can you say best BBQ in Las Vegas??  My husband is from Atlanta and is very particular about his BBQ.  We have eaten here a couple times, and have been very impressed every time!  The only complaint I had was the first time we went, the baked potato for our "Spudtastic" was way over cooked to the point of being inedible.  But I can say everything else is just amazing.  This last time we went, my mother and I split the "Outlaw" burger.  Probably the biggest burger we've ever eaten!!  It was humongous!!  Pork ribs are good, hot links are great, pulled pork is amazing, but the beef ribs are to die for!  Nice and charred on the outside and just deliciously tender with a hint of fattiness to it.  Absolutely delicious.

My honey brought me here for my birthday. I actually liked it. The food is really good but the area not so good. The side were great. I give it 4 stars because I did not care so much for the ribs. The brisket is excellent that made up for it. Very nice service. Friendly.
My favorite spot to eat in Vegas. Highly recommended if your a BBQ fanatics like myself or working on a empty stomach this is definitely the place to go!

Best BBQ in town and for quite some distance. The staff is great and very concerned that you enjoy your meal. It is a real BBQ joint so be aware of that if you plan on dining inside. The meat is very tender and full of flavor. Their homemade BBQ sauce is possibly laced with crack! It's very addictive. Tender ribs, flavorful pork and brisket, a must try if you want true smoked BBQ.

The smokers outside are worth the experience checking out. There aren't places like this in town that give you the true home cooked feel. This is one of them.
Best BBQ in Las Vegas. Great mac and cheese. Each meat item is outstanding. Wasn't a fan of the Brat Dog thing, but otherwise, everything on the menu is mouthwatering.
This place has some of the best BBQ in town. The pricing is also reasonable.

It's a little hole in the wall but the best barbecue in Nevada the cashier is really friendly and knowledgeable if you got any questions just talk to him his name is Dave it's hard to look for good BBQ in Nevada but this might be the spot from now on
The food is great the line was horrible but it's worth every wait and penny...This food so tastefully good I felt as if I was in heaven
little disappointed. couldnt tell pork and brisket apart.. chicken was overcooked. cobbler and potato salad were excellent. would give a second chance

"HOW MUCH FOR JUST ONE RIB?"

Actually if Chris Rock only ordered one beef rib here, that would be all he needs. I made the mistake of ordering a beef rib on the side because I thought the dual meat combo of beef brisket and pulled pork was not gonna be enough because I was really hungry. The beef rib itself  does not look like it came from a cow because if it did, the cow would have been as big as an elephant!

As you can tell, the beef rib stole the show. So lets break down my other choices.

First of all, those two black smokers you see outside are legit and im not talkin about Snoop Dogg and Dr Dre. They use hickory wood to smoke all their meats and it aint no joke! Their smoke flavoring is just one of their key ingredients that makes their barbeque so good. 

The dual meat combo of beef brisket and pulled pork smothered with their signature barbeque sauce will definitely get your salivary glands working overtime. The brisket has just the right amount of smoke flavoring and if the pulled pork was any more tender, Elvis himself wouldnt be any more proud singing "Love Me Tender".

As much as I would of loved to try all their barbeque being the carnivore that I am, that only warrants another trip or three to accomplish that. I would also like to mention their sides. I chose the bacon potato salad, but if you ask me, I think you cant go wrong with any of them. Just recently, they added fried okra and corn to their menu.

As for the desserts, assuming that the button on your pants has not busted off already, the peach cobbler is literally the icing on the cake not to mention the banana pudding.

Some random info: Yes they take cards. Yes they have sweet and unsweetened tea. Yes they have a decent amount of room with enough tables and chairs. Lastly but most importantly, their service is very remarkable (no surprise because they have the southern hospitality demeanor).

Oh, and one last thing. The area they are in is kind of suspect. Im not trying to scare you guys or anything, but the street they are on is dominated by strip clubs. Dont worry though, these guys are not open late so I dont see any problems, unless you are into strippers. LOL.

Toller unscheinbarer Laden mit exzellentem BBQ ! Wer also nach einem richtigen BBQ sucht ist hier absolut richtig - Wir hatten den Ribs teller mir Babyribs, normale Ribs und Rinder Ribs... sehr geil !  für meinen Geschmack war das Ganze vielleicht einen Tick zu rauchig - mag aber auch daran liegen das wir in Deutschland nichts vergleichbares haben und es einfach nicht gewohnt sind - deshalb 4/5
Great BBQ in Vegas!  I'd give it 5 stars if they still had Beef Ribs on their lunch menu as opposed to being Ala cart!  Great place and great brisket!

Got to love Vegas. Still eating our way through town and this place sure doesn't disappoint. Don't be afraid of the surroundings as its in the middle of a bunch of strip clubs. 

Great friendly staff and way too much food. Hidden Gem.
Went on friend's recommendation. Had better. Meats were fatty and had MUCH better barbecue sauce around town. Needs some work:-(

One of the few places left in town that understand and shares my love for beef ribs. Although I've had all there stuff and it's always amazing. Noting is better to me than a nice fat juicy beef rib! Thanks so much guys your all scholarly gentlemen :)

The staff were super nice & friendly. Although the food, it was VERY MEDIOCRE and overpriced. 

I was craving bbq and went yelp for some good rating. I don't know if they got good ratings cause of the service, cause they're really nice! But the food  ... I wouldn't come back again cause its nothing special
 I mean I get it, they wanna sell stuff but while I was at the counter, the guy kept up selling & upselling. Idk. 
Not a big fan. It's super hidden, expensive, & they dont inform you about the prices. me and my boyfriend ended up spending $50 and thats us not even saying yes to all the things the guy was offering.

The best BBQ in Vegas for sure. It's tucked away on an off street, like a hidden gem. The meats are smoked and very flavorful; the sides were ok nothing spectacularl. Portions are generous and very filling. You probably won't find a place with real smoked BBQ in Vegas like here. The staff was helpful and very friendly. I will be back!

This is the REAL deal! Being from Kansas, I know a few things about BBQ. So do these fine folks from Arkansas. This is the best Q I've found in Vegas, without qualification. Do yourself a favor and just GO and taste what REAL BBQ tastes like. The burnt ends, brisket and pulled pork are all spectacular! Beans, yummy! The sausage is just fantastic! You might have to wait in line, but it's totally worth it.

For LV this is a 4 star joint, as for the midwest, east coast, and south this is a 3 1/2 star. To become a 4 star elswhere I need a little more flavor and moist ribs. As a previous reviewer stated the pork ribs were a little dry. great beans, warning to light hearted these are spicy with a touch of jalapena, beef rib is moist tender and meaty. Ribs have just the right amount of mesq/hick smoke. Rib portions are proper, can stand alone w/o sauce, and well priced (avg $2.00 per bone). Not a fan of the potato salad to much mayo, not enough sugar and mustard. Bacon added to the potato salad is alright. If the ribs were taken off the grill 10mins earlier and just a little extra rub added before and after cooking, I would rate 5 stars LV and everwhere else. This place is a gem, lets see what happens.

I love this place. One of the best BBQ joints in Vegas. I don't go as often as I would like because I am not discipline and overeat every time I visit. I recommend you order a combo plate and share it with a friend.

This is the best BBQ in Vegas and quite possibly the best I've ever had. 

I ordered 2 Pit Specials to go and just sat and breathed in the delicious smells that envelop the entire business, inside and out. It was heavenly. 

The Pit Special consists of 4 meats and 3 sides. We got the brisket, pulled pork, 1/4 chicken and 2 spare ribs with kickin beans, bacon potato salad and onion straws with one order and cole slaw substituting the onion straws on another. I had to go up and place an additional order of corn bread, banana pudding and blueberry cobbler because the longer I stared at the menu, the more I wanted to try.

The portions were generous and each Pit Special fed 2 of us. The meat was awesome! All of it! I loved the chicken and ribs. Juicy, smoky, perfect. The sides were all delicious. The beans were a little too peppery for me but still a great flavor and the cole slaw & bacon potato salad were quickly inhaled. Oh and the BBQ sauce was sweet and also perfect.  We stuffed ourselves.

The staff were friendly, courteous and it was apparent that they loved their jobs. I see no reason to ever go to another BBQ joint in this town. Nothing else compares and I can't wait to try their many other offerings.

I love this place.  Its the best hole in the wall find that I have come across in a long time.  Its hard to get to and you literally have to know about it to eat there.  Thats the cool part.  I have had the pork ribs and then went back a week later for the beef ribs.  Both were awesome.  I am going to keeping taking my friends here.  These are the best ribs that I have had in town.  They also have a ground beef/brisket hamburger that I am dying to try.  This place has no thrills but incredible food.  Highly recommended for the food and adventure.
The food is delicious! I am in love with the cheesy Mac n cheese and their corn bread! It's a must!

Sweet. Fancy. Moses.

This place is amazing. I normally don't have a huge craving for BBQ, but maybe that's just because this town isn't especially known for it's fantastic BBQ. Rollin Smoke definitely changed that part of me. Since I first went there (about 3 weeks ago) I've been back 2 more times with a bunch of different people based on craving for that sweet magical BBQ they serve up. I feel like the more I eat there, the more wizard-like powers I will gain via BBQ sauce. Maybe I'm confusing that with my constant yearning for naps.

It is insanely delicious BBQ. Everything I've had there has been phenomenal. The pork, the chicken, and the burger...which I was unaware was insanely massive. I would recommend having the rest of your day planned for napping if you choose to eat the Outlaw Burger. It is tasty, but it is freaking enormous. It's got to weight a pound in your hands...It's a challenge to eat, but it's so good.

The sides are really great too. I keep trying new ones every time I go because they have a pretty significant list of options, so it's nice to switch it up and not be disappointed ever.

I really loved this place, and I really like the location. I know it's not the most convenient place on the planet, but getting there is easy, and it's kind of buried. Like a little local treasure. Places like these keep me exploring this city for more delicious dishes.

If I had any complaints about this place the only one would be that it can leave you smelling very smokey after you leave for quite some time. Not the worst problem if you're trying to get eaten by bears who like tasty things, but if you're going to a meeting with a new client or something immediately after, I might consider going in with a 'BBQ outfit' if that's even a thing.

It's tasty. Go eat it.
Sooo delicious....hush puppies are full of flavor and a little kick. The chicken, brisket, ribs...yummmm. staff is nice. When my mom is not around, I come here for BBQ!

I have tried this place 2x so far...  The first time was about 9 months ago..  I thought it was just good a place that i dont mind going to...On that occasion i ordered a half rack of ribs, mac and cheese, mashed and 2 beef ribs..  I thought it was good..

I went here recently with a friend of mine.. This time I ordered the meatloaf.. It was absolutely the best meatloaf i have ever had EVER... Cheesecake factory has a version of this but it does not even compare to this... It sat on top of a bed of mashed potatoes with this bbq gravy,, topped with onion straws..  I believe they smoke the meatloaf... Whatever they do,, I am a big fan... It was one of those meals that you will remember..  My friend got the outlaw burger,, He really liked it and it was impressive when it was brought out...  It looked like a mess to eat,, but looked good..  The desserts are decent but this meatloaf was slap your mother good...  Hope this Yelps


11/232014
It was about 11pm,,, i was really craving bbq,,  I remembered that Roling Smoke was open late... I ordered the rib combo... Lets just say dont come here for a late night meal,, at least this night...  All 3 meats were bone dry,, i asked for extra sauce,, but it wasnt  in my order,,, the sides were good,, but the berry cobbler,, seemed old... I have to admit it was after 11 but wow what a disappointment... I had to remove a star,,   I will try them when i think the meats would be freshest... Remember based on my experience,, I will not eat here again after 7 pm on a weekend...

BEST BBQ I ever had!! Went to school in South Carolina and had lots of great BBQ and this place tops it all! We ordered the Rib Platter and spicy link sausage.  Would definitely go back! Friendly service too!!

Note: I'm not a Bbq person I've never really liked the vinager sauce taste. I'd prefer dried rub.

My friends and I were in town and yelped led us here. My friends and got got the family mean for 4 or something like that for $30 something bucks not bad.

We got to try a bit of everything and it was soo good. The sauce wasn't too heavy or thick or vinagery idk how to describe it but it was good. Everything was nice and tender melt in your mouth good! Load mash potato and mac and cheese is to die for!! Everytime we are in own we must eat here.

This place definitely lives up to the hype. With that being said, it is a little pricey for the amount of food you get. I most certainly would recommend trying this place if you are in Vegas as it's not to far from the strip.

OMG...the BBQ sauce is sweet and spicy at the same time but definitely ask for extra. The cup they give you just isn't enough. The banana pudding is homemade and to die for. Go hungry and expect to leave satisfied.
Burger was awesome.. can't wait to go back and try the brisket

Did not expect what we received. What appeared to be a little hole in the wall turned out to be an AMAZING experience. 
A gentleman by the name of Mitch took out order and exceeded our expectations. We were with a group so he worked with us and gave us a group discount. Along with that he sat us down and hooked us up big time. Food is amazing and would highly recommend this to anyone. 

DO NOT let the outside location cool you. You will see why the inside is packed along with the parking lot.
First time here and I loved it!! Everything was delicious. They serve you so much, you will for sure get full. I recommend you go on an empty stomach lol Best BBQ in Las Vegas hands down.

Friday night... fridge has left overs but doesn't sound that great after over a 9 hour day of work... Pho? nah... Burger again?.. ehhh.. Ohh yes BBQ!
    
     ohh my goodness. The carnivore bug.. bit my neck; visions of falling off the bone goodness, sauces, and messy fingers! I just had to try out Rollin Smoke Barbecue!

   Located behind fashion show mall, near all the "adult" stores.. a little shack... other people drive up ; 3 guys and a girl in another vehicle pull up and order before us in line.. Too bad these male law students can't pay for the girl.. she ordered last.. I was like " Why are they not pitching in for a lady to eat at a BBQ!?"  i guess they are all on "friend status" only.....

   Special of the Day: Beef tips, with two sides and a drink for $13.00.. I got the LAST order. the gentleman i ordered from, w/ braids/dreads(dirty blond) was so nice and had the best hospitality.. it was so refreshing. 

    I want to try some chicken and pig.. so the Half Chicken and Half Spare Ribs was in order...
Mention a Check-in on Yelp and they will gladly honor a free dessert.. I asked" What's the best to get?"  the Braided gentleman in his accent.. "the Banana one".. i said "let's go for it!"

   At last the food arrived and it easily feeds for 6. but my bf and I could finish these trays of food in two sitting!  wow, THe food here is just so different.. Smoky and not too sweet but the beef tip and ribs had a special zing... not too spicy. i just say .. ZING" is the word and i liked it!

We chowed down.. even the loaded potato salad and chipotle Cole slaw was a nice accompaniment to the hearty meat. 

Dessert! ohh my goodness real ripe banana and the pudding with the vanilla wafers and spray of whipped cream! i want one right now ! soo indulgent that i almost had a big "O" ..no i didn't but it made me think .. How much time did they really make this banana goodness in a cup?. was it just jello instant banana pudding and i'm just having a taste bud trip? 

So... is it worth going to the Rollin? Yes! Go.and make sure to utilize the roll of paper towels on the table and don't get upset that your clothes smell like a Smoky BBQ plate!

No line when we arrived, but busy. We were able to find a seat. I was surprised how small it is. 
I ordered the beef ribs, and we got the waffle fries and corn nuggets. My DH ordered the spare ribs, and tot the beans with his ribs. 
The service was excellent. Very nice people. The food came rather quickly. It was generous portions. Too much for 2 people. 
I was only able to finish one rib, it was flavorful and had a lot of meat on it. The waffle fries were crispy, the star for me was the corn nuggets. So addicting. 
My husband enjoyed his ribs, the meat fell off the bone. He said the beans were a little sweet. 
All in all we had a good meal.

I wanted to like this place, I really did. We ordered one of the combo things for $35 and it was a lot of food! I was stoked to try it but when I found a pubic hair in our Mac and cheese I just couldn't. I didn't have the heart to say anything but it really ruined it. So gross.

I'm from southern Cali and don't even really care for BBQ. This place was AMAZING! The corn nuggets are a must! The pulled pork was so tender and juicy. Everybody here was absolutely friendly especially Lizelle at the register. I will most definitely be back again!
They said it was the best and they delivered.... New favorite BBQ! The burnt ends will melt in your mouth and the Mac and  cheese is super creamy with lots of flavor. Will be back again and again..

The Good. Let's just say The last time I had barbecue this good I was in St. Louis Missouri. I had the trio of the brisket, pulled pork, and spareribs. My sides were the dirty rice and the chipotle coleslaw. Let's get into the meat of it. The brisket was fantastic nice char not dry flavorful and delicious. The pulled pork is tender moist and succulent. The ribs were delicious flavorful and not even close to being dry. Lets get going to the sides.  the chipotle coleslaw was flavorful but not overly creamy. Just the way I like it! The dirty rice was fantastic combination of rice ground beef red onion and something else I couldn't tell what it was. I had all this for the paltry price of $24 it was a great deal for the amount of food that I got.

The Bad. It was a little bit of a drive from the strip, but that's not a problem because to find places like this you have to get away from the strip. Places like this that are affordable with great food are not always on the strip.

The Ugly. When I was done I wanted more and more and more. This could've gotten ugly.
When Ms. Brenda is away, the atmosphere is not the same. We miss her presence during our lunch break. The food is always delicious and hot! Love you guys to pieces!!!

I actually signed up to write reviews just because of this delicious BBQ place!  This little BBQ joint is legit southern style great BBQ.  First off, it's not a real BBQ place until it has fried okra as a side and this place delivers on that as well as so many things.  Sweet Tea, yep it's effin delicious too.  The meat we had as our dinner were- ribs (fall off the bone when you pick them up) brisket (tender and it's got that gorgeous pink smoke ring and amazing flavor) and smoked sausage (has just the right amount of spice too it!) sides- okra and mac n cheese.  We are from Oklahoma and miss the craft and care that goes into smoking and creating amazing BBQ but we don't have to miss it anymore!  Service is amazing and friendly and we plan on taking our friends and family that visit us!  Thanks to the staff for the warm welcome and friendly atmosphere, seriously can't wait to come back and next time I'm going to have the berry cobbler too!

I've been there a couple of times because people keep telling me how great it is and I think maybe I just caught them on an off day.  The ribs (my weakness) are just adequate. There wasn't enough of a smoke/grilled flavor. Road Kill Grill is king.
Amazing. The sides may even out perform the meats. The corn bread was just pure butter. Waffle fries and fried onions were fantastic. Ribs smoked perfectly. Just go try it

I have been here twice now and have had similar experiences both times. The food is very good especially for las vegas. I'm not comparing this to franklin bbq or anything but it is good. We have tried all of the meats they have to offer. The ribs are decent and the hot links are quite tasty. The brisket and chicken are also above average. The sides are extremely good at least most of them. Corn nuggets are really delicious and sides like loaded mash, dirty rice, and baked beans are flavorful and we'll prepared. The winner here is the service. The owners regularly come out to check on tables. All of the staff is attentive, kind, and welcoming. Both times we have been asked where we are from, and explained the restaurants style and philosophy. My kids are always given stickers and pens and treated as guests rather than burdens. I will continue to support these guys because they create really good food and make service as important as the flavors they achieve.

BBQ place that just don't go wrong.. I ordered the PIT Special and it was delicious!  The brisket was so soft it melts away in your mouth, the sauce is so good and it's on every table! So you can pour as much as you want.. All over them ribs! Chicken!! Hot link!! Anything!!  The chicken was the same as many bbq place, but the Hotlink are made special and it has a nice kick to it!  Don't forget the sides... Ordered the loaded mash, cheesey mac and the fries.. All delicious! And come with big portions!  So id you want a good BBQ meal with a good price this is it!  Worth 19.98 for the pit special w/drink...so come down and give this local area a try...
Fantastic BBQ. Not my typical style, but the best example I've seen of a thin sweet sauce. Great ribs, happy kids.

I was in Vegas this weekend with my family and saw that Rollin Smoke BBQ was highly recommended on r/vegas/. 

Upon entering for lunch, we saw that it was pretty busy, though we were only in line for about 5 minutes. We ordered the D's Delicious Sampler ($50) with Bacon Potato Salad and Loaded Mash for the sides. 

The service was pretty good. The food came very quickly and we didn't wait long at all (maybe ~10 minutes, give or take a few). We ordered that party pack because it looked like it'd give us a good taste of what Rollin Smoke BBQ had to offer, and it didn't disappoint. 

I can't say I'm a expert at eating BBQ (with only Lucille's and Phil's for comparison), but my family and I were very pleased with the St. Louis spare ribs. The meat was very tender and came right off the bone. The sauce, which we got on the sides, were pretty decent. Out of the possible 4, one of the best ones were the Sweet Country Girl and Mama's Sweet D-Licious; they weren't like your run-of-the-mill BBQ sauce. The Spicy sauce and the vinegar were mediocre, so we didn't get too much of those. The sides were very good too, though we never had the chance to finish them.

For a family of 4 (parents and two 18+ men), I was surprised that the $50 party pack filled all of us up, even to where we couldn't finish the sides. And I daresay we had quite an appetite already. 

If you're visiting Vegas and you haven't come here, I recommend coming at least once to see what it has to offer!

The food and the atmosphere are amazing.  This is a must visit place when coming to Vegas.  The people there are great at making you feel like they want you to enjoy your meal.  Everything I've had has a great authentic flavor and I can't wait to go back!!!

What a great little gem located under the freeway over pass. Just a block away fron the fashion mall. We love good BBQ and we were not disappointed here. Because we had a big lunch earlier, my husband and i shared a 3 meat plate and ordered 2 extra sides. Loved the corn nuggets! It was the perfect amount of food for us. The brisket was cooked to perfection with a nice smokey flavor. We loved the ribs and the pulled pork was melt in your mouth good. The owner came out and welcomed us and insisted on giving us a free dessert (banana cream pie!!!). We also got a tour of the kitchen/smokers. He was like a proud papa and happy to answer our questions and show us around.  We will definitely come back to this joint. Thank you fellow yelpers, we wouldn't have found this place without you.

Tried Rollin Smoke tonight on friend's recommendation.  It was okay.  The sauce was good (on the thin side as you'd expect for this style) with just a hint of sweet. 

I had the duo plate with brisket, hot link and jalapeño coleslaw.  The brisket was good, flavor and smoke wise.  The hot link was the worst I've ever had, it had so much connective tissue that I couldn't chew it and ended up looking like the clown with the never ending scarf being pulled out of my mouth (eeewwww, and not attractive, right???),  The coleslaw was fairly flavorless; as I would eat it the heat would gradually build but nothing other than that.

Husband had the pit special; brisket, pulled pork, spare ribs, hot link, hush puppies, mac & cheese, and collard greens.  He agreed with my assessment on the brisket and the hot link.  He liked the hush puppies but felt the mac & cheese and the collard greens were WAY over cooked and lacking flavor.

Sister had the pulled piggy with hush puppies.  She said the pork was moist, tender, and had a good flavor.  She liked the hush puppies but they were a touch spicy for her.

It was worth a try but I can't say that we'll be back.
So good. Loved it. Anyone visiting vegas needs to visit this place. Every time we go the quality is the same. Excellent. The staff checks on you to see if you are ok.
Awesome food! Best bbq I've had in a long time. Highly recommend if you are in Vegas.
One of my top 5 places to eat in Vegas! Definitely try to 3-4 meat option to get the a spectrum

**Summary**
       - AYCE - They have a $25 AYCE, anything on the menu deal. I'd suggest people doing this so you can try a little of everything.
       - Authentic BBQ - Walking in, you can smell this place knows how to BBQ. They have smokers in the back. That's how you know they're the real deal.
       - Hole in the Wall - The location is located on Highland Drive. Yep, it's the same seedy highland drive with all the strip joints.
**Ordered**
       - Pulled Pork - I've had a lot of pulled pork in my day, but nothing as tender and mouth watering as this. It's a must order.
       - Brisket - Not like the dry briskets you'll get elsewhere. Their brisket is tender and flavorful.
       - Beef Rib, Baby Back - Very meaty. Like I mean, TONS of meat on this bone. However, it's not really fall off the bone.
       - Baby Back and Spare Ribs - The flavor of their rub and BBQ sauce is delicious, but the meat wasn't too tender.
       - Catfish - Deep fried to perfection, but lacking in spices I'd say.
       - Bacon Potato Salad - If you like potato salad, adding sweet sweet bacon to it is a no brainer.
       - Corn Bread - Moist and hot out of the oven. You can't go wrong with corn bread.

**Recommendations**
       - I'd recommend this place if you like BBQ. The brisket and pulled pork were my favorites.

This is the most dry meat I've ever eaten.  Calling it bbq has to be a mistake.  Everything is just dry.  I'm wondering what the people ate that gave the good reviews. There was no smoke flavor and I swear folks think bacon makes everything better. Well it needs to start out decent to be made better by bacon. Bland potato salad with bacon, still bland potato salad.  The rib tips had to be a day or two old. The beef ribs were way over cooked. And the sauce exploding on my husband's shirt was the icing on the cake.

The 5 stars are for the chef offering to fix the situation and giving us fresh food. The first impression is a lasting impression. But the fact that they were really nice made it better. I may give it another try. I've heard good things about this place.  Maybe we just came on the wrong day.
Best place to go in Vegas. Wow it was worth the drive away from the strip. Would highly reccomend you visit. Try the brisket and pulled pork.
Awesome BBQ! The best meal in Vegas thus far! Excellent sides like the bacon potato salad, beans and collard greens!

Love this barbecue. It's a small little shack that serves great barbecue.

I haven't had much barbecue out here and was skeptical of how good barbecue could be, but yes, there is good barbecue in Las Vegas.

I've only been twice and both times I got their duo plate.

With these plates you get the option to choose from: Brisket, hot links, spare ribs, 1/4 chicken, and pork.

I got the brisket and hot link.

The brisket is very juicy and you can see the beautiful smoke ring around the edge of the meat. 

The hot link has a nice snap to it and is definitely one of my favourite parts of the meal. 

Along with the meat you get an option of a side and I've gotten the mac n cheese and the potato salad.

The mac n cheese was alright, nothing too special, but I do love their potato salad. It's creamy and the potatoes are still firm. It's a nice refreshing taste when eaten with the rest of the meal.

Definitely recommend this place if you're looking for a quick lunch or just in the mood for some barbecue!
The food is excellent with a huge portion for a great price. Service is great. I'd recommend if your in vegas you should go check it out.

Went there on January 20, 2015.  Been to Vegas many, many times.  We stay on the strip and pretty much always eat in the many restaurants/hotels on it. A few months before this trip saw Rollin Smoke on TV on one of the many food shows. I "adore", appreciate, and seek out authentic BBQ joints. The real stuff is not easy to find. Well this is it! The place is a dive and small. There were 3 of us and finding a table, even though they were busy with diners and take out orders, was easy. The various sides we had were good. The proof though is in the meats and it did not disappoint. The pulled pork, chicken, spare ribs, brisket and beef ribs were outstanding. They do not overload their rub with salt like way too many other places do. That potentially does not only tend to dry out the meat, but it overwhelms the flavor of it. Here it's perfect balance. Most BBQ places do not offer beef ribs. If you've never had one it's a must. These are not the beef ribs you might see in your grocery store's meat case. Those hardly have any meat on them before cooking, let alone after. These are short ribs. Yes, these you find in your grocery, but they are cut into short pieces for slow cooking and braising. I have never seen them in the case in full rack. I have a home smoker and I get them from my grocer and ask for the pack that they then get out of the cooler for me. These contain the full four rib rack.  "Short" has to do with where it comes from on the cow, not the length. But because we always see them cut up, its easy to make that connection.  Matter of fact, while not quite Fred Flinstone's bronto ribs that tips his car over, they're the closest thing to it.  They are 8" - 10" long and loaded with meat. While a slab of spare ribs stay in a smoker for about 4 hours, beef ribs have so much meat they are in there for 8+ hours. So next time in Vegas, take a cab or your rental car and go here.  We try to get to Vegas once or twice a year and now this will be added as one of our "must" eating places on every trip.  From Rollin Smoke to Caesar's Bacchanal buffet!

With the apparent demise of Hogs Heaven and Top Notch Bbq, there is no controversy about which BBQ is best. Rollin smoke has the tender smoked goods. The sauce is excellent and the menu is innovative and original. Make sure you get corn nuggets, there is nothing like them.
If I could give 10 stars I would. This is the best best BBQ I've EVER had. The beef ribs were so tender it  fell off the bone. Banana pudding good too!  It's all I've been talking about this week.

My husband just came home with this for lunch and now I want to go back for dinner!   Tonite!  
AMAZING BBQ!  Everything we got was tender, smoky, and delicious!  He got a combo platter with brisket, hot links, beef ribs, chicken and 3 sides.  The fried okra is a must-try.  The potato salad was meh--hubby liked it a lot, I did not.  And the bbq beans were outstanding.  They definitely have a kick to them.  
The ribs were SO tender!  Falling off the bone.  Brisket so very tender.  Hot links hot ;).  Chicken yummy.  They serve sauce on the side, but you don't need it because all of the meats are jam-packed full of flavor.  
Husband told me to make sure and mention Dusty, the pit master.  He was very friendly and made excellent recommendations.  I can't wait to go back!

Been waiting to come here.  Finally made it.  
Great place won't be disappointed love the funky atmosphere. Feels like a Southern barbecue joint should be like.

My husband and I are a regular customer here. We sometimes even come 2 times a week. We went last week and things from their menu had changed. We always got the pit special 4 meats and 3 sides. It was perfect for us to share. Now it's not even available and they aren't letting us double meats. And the prices have gone up dramatically. 
I know they are trying to keep up with the popularity.  But I miss the "we don't work on Sunday because we have to thank god for what we have" attitude. It's now all about getting the money from the tourist and forgot about the loyal locals.

Barbecue as the gods meant it to be made--that's the only way to describe this place.  This isn't a bbq joint on the main Strip of Vegas.  This is grub you have to hunt for.  Yet I guarantee once you've discovered this place off the map that the tourists have you'll never forget where it is.

People have meals they remember.  People have meal they never forget.  But very rarely do people have meals they have to ask themselves if it really happened.  No food should be allowed to taste this good.  They really shouldn't.  Because all it does is make all the other bbq feel bad, feel ashamed for their inferiority and their audacity to put themselves into the same class of eats as Rollin Smoke.  

Everything here is excellent--from their ribs to their sides, from the service to their decor.  It's like walking into everybody's idea of the perfect bbq joint and finding out you never have to leave... and that maybe you never should lest it vanish like the magical culinary paradise it really is.

As far as both bbq and burgers go, I was blown away by this place. When we arrived, the lunch rush was in full swing. I was kinda bored waiting in line for ten minutes, but after seeing others eating the food as I waited, I knew the wait would be worth it. One thing in particular caught my eye. I spotted it from across the room and knew we were meant for each other.

I ordered the outlaw burger, which was both inexpensive and amazing. This was easily one of the biggest burgers I have ever eaten. It has beef and brisket, onion straws, slaw and more on it. It towers over lesser burgers with a majestic stature that ensures you will be in mind blowing pain after eating this thing all in one sitting, which I of course did. The burger came with tasty waffle fries for around $9.

I so wish this place opened by me in NC, although if it did, I'd be 500lbs. I will return when I hit up Vegas again.

Best Mac n cheese I've ever had! Corn bread was nice and fluffy! Brisket burnt ends were way too fatty for my liking, had a couple of cuts of meat that were mostly all fat. Over all good. Place was packed and busy with Togo order. Will come back if ever in area again.

Best BBQ in Vegas.
And The Crew at Rolling Smoke are just like Their Meat...Genuinely Good

We Don't Normally Have Food at Hogs and Heifers,
But When We Do, We Call Rolling Smoke

OMG this is the best brisket I ever had I had three ways sliced shredded and the burnt ends they were all amazing just the right about of smoke flavor prefect bark the seasoning was so good had slot of paper I think they had three sauces all vinegar base I like the Arkansas sauce the best the mama's was good and they had one more that was just OK my wife like that one the best there was no name on it the banana pudding was just average all the people were super friendly explained what they did there they were just genuine friendly will be back next time I. Vegas

The bbq ribs are amazing. Tender, falls off the bone, and packed full of meat! And they're fast. And the corn bread is delicious. You also get souvenir cups when you order a drink. Probably the best ribs I've ever had.
Very Good BBQ & Service was Excellent!! Only problem that they aren't in California :) So had to bring some home:)

Delicious BBQ. Fresh and tender meats. I bought the five meats plate and loved every bite EXCEPT for the link because it had Anise spices in it (anise is what gives black licorice its flavor and I'm not a fan of black licorice) others enjoyed the link though so maybe it was just me. The sauce is ok but honestly you don't need anything with these meats they are literally smoked to perfection and seasoned proper. The owner chef Tim (if I remember correctly) was very kind and was constantly making sure everyone was taken care of. 

My only problem is that I wish this place was bigger and had ac. It's a tough road eating BBQ and sweating in an establishment :/ but honestly the food was so good no one even complained. 

In the future when I do come back to Vegas I hope to grab some Rollin' smokes, but next time I'll be ordering to go! :)
FIRE FIRE FIRE !! Bomb food!! The people working here are so nice they go around and ask if you enjoyed the food. Great atmosphere. Way better than any BBQ in Vegas!!

I'm originally from Texas where BBQ is easy to find. Been living in Vegas for 26 years. This is the first place in Vegas that would compare to what we were accustomed to back home. Amazing food and service!!

We ate here for dinner after reading other people's reviews. The Corn Nuggets were fantastic! I have never tasted anything like those before. Try dipping them in some of their dipping sauces for additional flavors. I will definitely return here on my next trip to Las Vegas!

Here's the deal. For a while, I've been searching for authentic BBQ here in the city. Chains restaurants like Dave's and Lucille's are great but missing more of that southern down home feel. Enter Rollin Smoke, located in the shadow of the Las Vegas Strip, this small eatery is does everything right.

We got here around the lunch rush, and had to wait in a small line to order. The host/cashier was Dusty I believe, friendly guy, and he was quick and attentive. Because the staff is well prepared, the food was out within 10 minutes, very quick for a BBQ establishment, and it shows great preparation.

I ordered the Pit Special, and for 20 bucks you get a pick of 4 meats, 3 sides and a drink. That's enough food for 2 meals or to share. I ordered a piece of the catfish on the side, which was very good as well. Catfish is hard to perfect because you have to cook it through but not over cook it. I'm willing to attest that the catfish is about as legit as it gets.

The meat itself was fantastic, the ribs were tender but not greasy. It was nice and smoky with a good texture. Someone on here said the ribs weren't "fall off the bone", which  is correct. That's not to say it's tough, because it's not. Being smoked they way they are, they aren't greasy, they pull off the bone with very little effort. That's better than greasy, mushy "fall off the bone" people talk about when they use that phrase.


The sides were fantastic. The loaded mash was pretty good, not as good as some of the garlic mash I've had, BUT, excellent in it's own right. The mac and cheese was great. I'm kind of a mac and cheese snob, and nothing is as good as my moms homemade, but this was better than most BBQ/Southern restaurants. My one and only complaint was that the food could have been a bit warmer. That's it. 

For not much money you can eat like a king. Fast friendly staff, and great food makes this hidden gem a winner in my eyes.

Amazing, delicious, fantastic bbq!  It's hard to believe a place can live up to the hype, but this place does! We had the spare ribs, a rec from an employee, and they were perfection! An unsung hero that deserves praise is the cornbread...moist and slightly sweet, it was the best I've ever had. This will be on our "must eat" list every time we're in Vegas. 5 stars isn't enough! Thanks Rolling Smoke for making such great food! :)
Came here for the beef ribs..DAMN GOOD! Bring your appetite cause they have generous portions. Definitely will come back. Its worth the visit!

OMG!!!  My boyfriend and I tried Rollin Smoke BBQ for the first time tonight.  Can you say YUMMY and SCRUMPTIOUS???

Let me start off by clarifying that this awesome restaurant is NOT in the ghetto.  It is in an industrial area.....big difference.  We found it to be clean and very comfortable!  Great service.....they made you feel welcomed, like you are a part of the family.  

We had the 4 meat combo with 3 sides and the hot wings.  All items were super yummy!  The brisket was moist and basically melted in your mouth!  The ribs fell off the bone and were very tasty!  My boyfriend is addicted to wings.  He could not stop raving about their wings!  Next time, we plan on trying the "damn hot" version.  The hot link sausage and chicken were delicious also!

But let me tell you about these addictive corn nuggets!!!!  Woohoo!!!!  Sweet and yummy bites of heaven!!!  YOU must absolutely try these morsels of yummy goodness!

We will definitely return for more!!!  Thanks guys!

This place was amazing. Excellent food and service. Restaurant isn't fancy and not in the best location but the food is so worth it. If you want the best bbq then ear here. Chef Tim was awesome and the staff  was willing to stay late because people kept coming in for food. Tim kept his doors open past the closing time. Love this place and so did my 8 yr old son. Two thumbs up. Slap yo mamma good.

Wow!  Smokin!  OK, I must say I really like this place a lot and for a barbecue joint, it is the highest review I can give. 

a. Location - WTF, I felt like I was driving to one of those back alley strip joints or toward that Erotic Museum.  However, I must say, driving there from the 15 Freeway was very easy!  Just in a very dingy area is all.

b.  Size - They must have increased size,  as I was expecting a really small place with like three tables and they seemed to have expanded next door with some bench like tables to sit good size parties.  I would say though, that the max they can have in this place is like 9-10 parties of various size.

c.  Menu - Pretty darn awesome if you ask me.  Simple to order and if you like meats you can make your own combo from the duo, trio or the Pit Special with a bunch of different meats. They even have large party size orders on the menu.  The brisket was great, the beef ribs darn good. I always order baby back pork ribs so these beef ribs were the right size and very tasty.  I loved the hot links and I did not care so much for the pulled pork, a bit dry if you ask me.  

d.  Hot Sauce - On the table were two types of sauces, and neither was too hot.  I did use quite a bit on the pulled pork. I generally like a hot sauce. I did not ask them, and I wonder if they have it.

e.  Friendly - The owners and workers here are all very friendly, ask about their food and they want you to enjoy your experience.  That is such a cool added touch!

f.  Ordering, drinking and etc - You order at the front and pay, but they bring the food to you.  The soda fountain and the ice tea area are in a small and tight area, so if it is busy, it will be tough to get to. 

g. Leftovers - They plenty of serve yourself plastics for any leftovers you have.

h.  The sides - Plenty of sides.  The potato salad was awesome. The beans were great, the corn nuggets were totally cool.  These were the only sides we had.

Results - Awesome finger licking food, great pricing and great service.  Loved it better than Famous Dave's and Lucille's. GK says check it out.

The beef brisket was delicious & very filling - I couldn't even finish it!  The beef ribs were HUGE and fell off the bone. Try the Mac & cheese if you like pepper - but it's good.

The owners are 2 brothers from Arkansas who really take pride in their southern BBQ food. It's not far off the strip and they have 3 big smokers right in front.  You have to keep your eye out for it or you might drive by - like we did!  

Definitely give them a try - it will be worth it.

Looks dodgy from the outside, but is absolutely amazing. Some of the best ribs I ever had, and really cheap. Perfect meeting place to go to with family and friends, very easy going atmosphere. This definitely was one of the highlights of my stay in Las Vegas!

This place is awesome! Delicious BBQ, great prices and very friendly staff. The prices are very reasonable for the amount of food you get. The all you can eat is the best deal on the menu. I would definitely recommend that people venture off the strip for delicious food.

It seems dumb to write a review for what is undoubtedly an already highly reviewed restaurant, but Rollin Smoke is so good that it deserves all of the praise it can get.

It's the best BBQ in town and it's not even close. My favorite is the Brisket Dog, but I'll happily get pulled pork or hot links if I'm in the mood. I don't like corn bread, but I could eat RSB corn bread for breakfast, lunch and dinner. It's like corn bread and pound cake hooked up and we get to eat their offspring.

I was really glad to see a change in the layout of the restaurant. It used to be really tough to navigate the small space when it got busy, but now it's much better. I like going when its quiet so I can snag a seat by the TV, otherwise I'll sit in the extra space by the fish tank.

Only negative is that they didn't address the bathrooms when they did the remodel. They are clean, but pretty old and small.

Word is out on this place. It is packed so dont bother going during rush hour or it is a 2 hour lunch easy! Food is awesome and priced reasonably. The ribs are some of the best in town. The outlaw burger will break any toilet in town.

3 stars because appeasing to the masses, sometimes, comes at the cost of dullness.
Smoked meats are fantastic, but without a uniqueness in choice of woods ( Bleh - traditional mesquite and hickory  :-P ) or without some real body of unique seasonings,,, what have ya got?  If flavor WAS there,, I didn't taste it, and I ate slowly. I had the pulled pork and brisket. Both of these should be oozing with flavor.. I had to lightly sauce every bite to enjoy it.
However, the brisket was cooked perfectly, pork a little over but no biggie..the table-side sauce is excellent which got me thinking... Maybe that was their intention? To leave it bland and let the customers sauce it to their liking?
In Vegas... No balls no blue chips.

If you go, get the ribs!
The ribs are the best meat offered at RSBBQ.
The brisket was tender.  The chicken a little dry.  The on table BBQ sauce had a good flavor but was too watery and didn't stick well to the meat.

Mac & Cheese, Okra were good side to accompany the rib.
Go for the ribs!

It seems like every person in my office had been here and was in love so I knew I had to give it a try. So when we had to choose a place for an in office lunch there was zero disagreement that we had to order from Rollin Smoke. The location is a bit of a hike from my home in Henderson, but not too far from work (lucky me!). 

We've now ordered twice since it was such a hit the first time. We ordered the Super Sampler which was definitely the right amount of meat for 8-10 people. It looks like a lot of food, but nobody will be able to resist seconds. Six pints of sides will not go far if choosing six different sides. I would suggest choosing three different items instead of six to make sure there is enough to go around.

The MEAT. You come here for the meat because it is the best BBQ meat you'll have the pleasure of putting in your mouth. All of the meats are obviously smoked and they do it to perfection. The flavor is really sealed into the meats. The ribs fall off the bone, chicken and pork are tender, and the sausage packs a nice heat.

I have enjoyed almost all of the sides as well. My favorites have been the Collard Greens (with brisket of course), Macaroni and Cheese, and Baked Beans. The only side that wasn't awesome was the Loaded Mash. Maybe my taste buds were off this day, but it tasted instant. 

If you haven't been here then you are missing out on great BBQ.

The thing about BBQ is that places tend to specialize. It's few and far between that a BBQ joint does everything well. Either they're great at ribs, or great at pork, or great at brisket. But for whatever reason it's really hard for any barbecue place to be great across the board.

Well, stop the press. Because Rollin Smoke just raised the bar.

Every meat that comes out of the smoker is perfectly done. The ribs are served dry - the melted fat of the meat captures the hickory smoke and the dry rub is as good as they get. The pulled pork is great. The brisket is worth going out of your way for - and I'm somebody who generally isn't a huge brisket fan. The hot link has a nice slow burn to it.

The sauces served alongside the meat complement it well - but they aren't necessary. The Carolina vinegar sauce pairs best with the pulled pork - especially with a little slaw on top.

Their sides are impeccable too. Just really flawless.

Portions are huge too. I'll order a 3-meat combo here at lunch and gnaw on it for another full meal and a half.

I just can't say enough good things about this place. It makes me happy even just Yelping about it.

I always look for different places to eat in Las Vegas for my bowling gangs yearly trip from Hawaii.  This year it was BBQ!  Rollinsmoke, was the best BBQ ribs my gang and I have had outside of Hawaii.  From the generous portions to the fall off the bone, meaty beef ribs...It was ONO(Hawaiian for DELICIOUS).  Anyplace with an AYCE option always attracts Hawaii Folk...But, lemme tell you that with the generous portions;I could hardly get past the first plate.  However, there's always room for dessert!  The cobbler with ice cream did not disappoint!  YUMMY!  Looking for Rollinsmoke was a lil challenge from the highway...blink and you may miss it.  Small on outside;big on inside...With seating inside and out;there was plenty of room to accommodate my group of twelve and then some.  Our group also included 4 kids(they have a kid's menu)this place is very family friendly.  In or going to Vegas? Check this place out!  I know my friends and I will!  Until next time, Aloha and Mahalo

The outlaw burger is basically meatloaf on a bun but it has good flavor. It just didn't hold up that well when you try to eat it like a burger. The side of fries came out cold. This was the second time that my side item came out cold.

Southern BBQ goodness in the middle of the dessert! 

This tiny restaurant hiding off the strip is a piece of tummy heaven. The taste reminds me of the Deep South. The sauce is spicy and flavorful, the meats are cooked well, and the sides are all good. The only problem is that my stomach isn't big enough to keep eating. 

Definitely going to stop by again before we leave town.

Friendly service and good BBQ.  Both of us got the two meat plate.... pork/brisket and brisket/ribs.  All meats were excellent, potato salad and mac and cheese sides were both just ok.  Sauce on the table was delicious but wish there was a spicy version. Also thought that the plate would come with corn bread but unfortunately it came with a soggy piece of plain white bread. 

Service was perfect except that they forgot my blueberry dessert....I asked for it and they forgot it again!  Finally waited and waited... left without even getting it. Booooooo.  (Minus 1 star)

I had to go there after all the talk on here.

The location is in a umm kinda shady part of town but I went there for the BBQ.

Its a true  BBQ joint. Plastic forks and knives, Styrofoam and paper plates.

The smell of smoke was pretty amazing. I was floating in like this place was the pied piper.

The menu is pretty simple like it should be. 

The owner was taking the food order. Its kind of different. You pay first and wait for a runner to bring out your food. The owners are very nice people and really care about their food.

I ordered The Biggin, its a sandwich with pork, brisket, and hot links and it was friggin delicious. There's no easy way to eat this monster. You have to dig in and understand things are gonna get messy.

One boy ordered the catfish po boy. Yes its not BBQ but he loved it and they did make it perfect.

Another ordered the Brisket Dog. I didn't know it was on a sesame seed bun which he was allergic to. They made it over at no charge and put it on a hamburger bun. The sandwich was as big as his head! I was entertained just watching him trying to eat this behemoth! Its a good thing they have rolls of paper towels on the tables because this kid needed a whole roll. He loved it too.
 
I will definitely be back again!

oh and guys, if you sneak there without your wife or GF, you will be caught because you walk out of this place smelling like smoke!

Once again, I've found a 5 star BBQ that is not even 500 miles from home... nor anywhere close to the south?! *sigh

This place fires on every cylinder!  From the main meats down to the sides.  I mean, I wish I could in some sense describe my experience here so that it even comes close to the actual event.... 

I ordered a rib basket, and for $14.99 I got a beef rib, pork ribs, and a half rack baby back rib.  Now that may not sound like much, but the ribs are HUGE.  The beef rib was the largest I've ever seen.  The meat was tender, juicy, and just shaved off the bone with my plastic fork.  The pork ribs were good, more dense as it should be but still juicy, flavorful meat.  And I can tell you I've never had a baby back rib that even came close to this baby back rib.  

Onto the sides.  I've never had a jalapeno slaw that came close to this one, a fantastic blend of spice and sweet, not soppy wet and not dry either.  Mash potatoes with melted cheddar and chives!  Holy crap.  The potato salad was fantastic.  Now I have one rule about BBQ is that I ALWAYS have room for the banana pudding.  I'm sorry to say I broke my rule, so I am not going to be able to inform on the banana pudding.

On my next trip to Vegas, you better believe this will be on my list to return to.  Maybe twice :)  And this says something, because the BBQ place is not a walk from the strip, it's a definite taxi ride, but if you are a fan of the show, Counts Kustoms is a little less than a mile walking distance from this place, up the same road so you may kill two birds with one stone.

Rollin Smoke is definitely worth the drive from wherever you may be in town. We ordered a whole rack of pork baby back ribs and the duo meat combo with pork and chicken. We had the waffle fries and a side order of sweet corn bread. Everything was amazing. I'm not usually one to write reviews of restaurants unless they are really good or really bad. This one was definitely worth the time. The ribs were fall off of the bone tender. The chicken and pork was smoked to perfection. And the corn bread was out of this world. If you ever get a chance please take the time to make a stop.

This is by far one of the best BBQ rib place that I've ever tried. I am actually not your typical BBQ and rib type of girl. I think it's messy and not worth the effort.  Unfortunately, my husband loves ribs so we have tried a few; however, this place totally makes up for all the bad ones that I have had to endure.  The seasoning is perfect, fall of the bone kind of meat, and was so tasty.  I honestly think this might be the "phils bbq" of Las Vegas.  The price is decent, and the venue is very home, no frills. Definitely a must try if you are ever vegas.

This spot was all the hype it was even on the news. We went there last night. And was very disappointed. The ribs was fatty. No banana pudding and no peach cobbler. No potato salad. We won't be coming back. Very small dining room.
