I'm going against popular opinion here but honestly, I've had better elsewhere.  I've eaten here several times and it's always been good but nothing to write home about.  I'm gonna go out on a limb here and say, Las Vegas has no good BBQ.  I'm still looking for that excellent BBQ, preferably baby back ribs.  My search continues for great BBQ in Vegas...
Wow the staff was super friendly and everything was super good the food was the best BBQ I've ever had I would totally give it 10 stars if possible anytime were back in Vegas this place is a must

Are you kidding me with the wait? 

The wait was way too long. I waited 1 1/2 hours and was quoted 25 minutes for my food. Had I have known it would have been that long of a wait time, I would have left. The order taker was not very friendly and did not make a good first impression. She seemed rushed and annoyed that she was taking orders, even though I already knew what I wanted and only asked one question about the pies. 

After waiting an hour in a half for our food, I was really hoping for amazing barbecue. In fact, I was so hungry at that point, I didn't think I could tell the difference. Anything seemed like it would have been yummy. But, I was wrong. I could definitely tell that the food was just okay. Definitely NOT worth an hour in a half wait. 

Ribs were good, hot links were good, but the chicken, pulled pork, and chopped brisket were bland. I had to drown it in sauce to make it worth eating. And even drowning it in the sauces (I tried all the sauces), it still did not help the flavor get any better. The baked beans were average, the corn nuggets - I did like and would say is above average. The coleslaw was mehhhh. Not impressed. 

One of the order takers was 'smart mouthing' customers who complained about the wait on their food. i was appalled. I kept my mouth shut. But, customer after customer steamed with frustration after their wait time pushed way pass 45 minutes, then an hour, then an hour in a  half. What was more frustrating is the order takers were still quoted a 25 minute wait on food, when they knew full well the kitchen was backed up to over an hour. I have no idea how this place got such stellar reviews and no one mentioned the crazy wait.  

I love BBQ and for the past few days I had been going to Famous Dave's. After this ridiculous wait at Rollin Smoke Barbeque, I'd rather go to Famous Daves. The food at Famous Dave's is just as good. In fact, what I ordered there was quite possibly a tad bit better. The atmosphere, service, sauces, and speed of food trumps Rollin Smoke Barbeque any day! 

At Famous Dave's, the wait was only 15 minutes for our feast for 6 people. In my opinion, a 15 minute wait for a feast of 6 is totally worth it. Plus, there was so much food we had left overs. The feast for 6 comes out to be $11 a person (if you have 6 people) and was so well worth every penny and every bite.

Have been there a few times and I will keep coming back. I have tried the ribs, beef brisket, links and they are all great. I love the yams....not to sweet but with a hint of brown sugar and pecans...awesome.It is a hidden treasure...try it you will love it.

The ribs and pulled pork are terrific. I ordered the corn bread and loaded mashed potatoes, absolutely delicious. I ha e been here twice and each time the staff is friendly and very helpful. Definitly the best BBG in Vegas Don't miss this spot while in Vegas

Don't be weary of the semi sketchy outward appearance. As soon as you open the door, the aroma of BBQ instantly increases appetite.

Lizelle, the cashier,  was friendly and helpful if it is your first time. Ask anything on the menu. Service was also attentive. Both Lizelle and Karina were making rounds, cleaning up spills on floors, and checking that everyone was doing well. 

Seating was on picnic tables which I thought was pretty cool.  Different sauces to try and generous if you're taking some to go too. The sweet sauce is like honey mustard, but even their default BBQ sauce is a safe bet for extra flavor. To go boxes and plates are on the counter next to cutlery. It's pretty  easy to get what you need.

I noticed their prices increased since last time I was here which was pretty disappointing though (minus a star) . BBQ is always gonna be a bit pricey, but is it worth it? I say, "try it." Trio plate is a safe bet, and for me, it was good for two people. Ribs, sliced brisket, and pork, a side, and a slice of white bread for $17.99. Old menu prices were much more reasonable and would've kept me coming back. 

Oh, Don't forget to bring your cup if you're a local...you save $2 on drinks if you remember to have it

The BBQ was ok.  I'm a big baby back rib fan and these were definitely not fall off the bone.  The sauces were watery I felt.  Also,  the sides were not good at all.  I would not recommend  this place On a positive note the servers were good.

It's DAMN GOOD BBQ. I came here in here with my boyfriend after a fun night on the strip and the food completely took my hangover away! It's a small hole in the wall family style place with an exceptional menu. Brenda (?) was there to take our order and she was so friendly. I ordered the loaded baked potato and let me tell you it was the best potato I've ever had. Not only did it have Bain but it had white meat chicken and sweet baked beans. I was in heaven. The portions are awesome. I was eating on my potato most of the day. I mentioned it was my birthday and some of the staff, I believe James and Will came out to sing me happy birthday and have some AMAZING banana pudding. They really made my birthday "brunch" a great one! I'll be back the next time I'm in Vegas.

A fellow BBQ nut that was visiting Vegas a few weeks ago told me about this place and that I had to try it out... So here I am on business and I found time on my last night to go.
Wanting to try several things and leave my options open, I went for the $25 All you can eat.  It is not buffet, don;t worry, they ask want you want to start with and bring you more of anything on the menu.  I started with the brisket, pork ribs and the beef ribs my friend could not stop taking about.  
These are not your normal small, barely any meat back ribs, these are short ribs, and contrary to the name, they are not short or small. These are the "Dino Ribs" and full of tender flavor.
Enough of that, the Beef ribs were among the best I had, the brisket was a lean cut, I wish I asked for the moist / fatty , not sure if they have it, but that is what I try to get.  I found this brisket to be pretty good, tender & flavorful, I just prefer mine from "The Point"
The Spareribs had a great flavor, the right 'bite', you do not want fall off the bone, many may think that, but the best have a bit of bite, but are also tender.  These were so.
The service was great, the guy that took my order was patient, he may be the owner, not sure, but worked with me on my order to make sure I got want I wanted.  The servers brought out my food promptly and since I had the all you can eat, they refilled me with more brisket beef ribs at my request.

The food was delicious and the environment was so friendly! The cashier was very nice and explained everything I needed to know for my first time. Such a great experience and their servings are huge!

It was very loud and crowded in there but that could be expected from the environment and it being so popular. Definitely recommend if you're in the mood for great BBQ.

I also loved seeing their custom tank from the show Tanked!
Rollin smoke has the very best bbq!! Have ordered samplers a couple times and this place is consistently delicious. Everything is cooked perfectly and does not disappoint!

What a disappointment! I have to wonder about the validity of all the positive reviews.

Great service? It's literally nonexistent.

I had beef ribs and one of them was 95 percent fat. The barbecue sauce tasted putrid for want of a better word, like it was unrefrigerated for a long time.

We split a four meat platter as well and nothing about it was in any way remarkable. My wife commented that the ribs at the Gold Coast buffet are better, and I agree.

She ordered onion laces and they were just a pile of greasy limpness. I wish we would have taken a picture.

This place is nothing more than mediocre at best. Don't believe the hype on here. Plus, it is nearly impossible to find.

The food and customer service was outstanding at rollin smoke bbq.  Lizelle, who took our order was great...it was our first time there and she gave us a run down of the menu and provided samples.  Mom and the rest of the staff were great as well, always went around and asked how things were going with all their customers.  
We had the meatloaf, ribs, chicken and catfish.  It was so delicious! The portions ... wow were large! 

This place is in the most random location but it appears to be in a safe area.  I would come here again and I highly recommend it.

This place was simply delicious. Perfect recipe for what makes these types of places last. Great food and great service. That's it. That's all it takes. All you chain restaurants out there thinking that your name speaks for itself, do yourself a favor and check out Rollin Smoke. This is how it's done. Keep it up guys. You're doing an awesome job!!

Beef brisket 3 ways and corn poppers whoop  
Anytime I get a chance to eat out this is my favorite BBQ place in Vegas. Such a small hidden shop of the strip and it still gets packed. I must not be the only one loving this BBQ place . 5 stars very tasty .

I had a Shrimp Poor Boy-it was pretty good but the 5 stars are for the Meat!!!  The sides that I tried were all good too.  We had a Potato Salad and Peach Cobbler.

We stopped in for lunch before going to the airport to fly to San Francisco.  The Meat was so good my husband and son decided to buy 2# of Burnt Ends and Some other kind of meat to hand carry to San Francisco to eat there.

I would definitely go back and have been recommending this place to everyone since we got home.
Awesome BBQ. Hard to find but well worth it.  A bit of a dive but that's how I roll.  Beef brisket and beans to kill for.

Quite possibly the best rib place I found here in Vegas... While I love other places, not to mention those other places are good... For the price, environment, and service, I definitely will be back here and also continue to being friends... Beef ribs, all kinda of ribs, in fact the whole menu is just bomb...

The outlaw burger is incredible. Their brisket is also very good. The atmosphere is about like most barbecue restaurants. Prices are reasonable and the staff is friendly. The food take awhile to arrive, but thats barbecue. I'll be back.

Everything was pretty good but I've definitely had better BBQ. About a 10 minute wait in line with an additional 20 minute wait for the actual food, which is understandable because the place is popular.
It's a little expensive for a hole in the wall BBQ joint. It's essentially of the same quality as Dickey's BBQ. I think maybe after they gained popularity from being on TV the quality of their food dipped down.

We moved here to Las Vegas from Ft Hood/Killeen, Texas last year and by far this is "THE BEST" BBQ restaurant. Thank god we only live a couple blocks from this place, were always here ordering to go plates and going down the menu list to try them all :-)

Best BBQ in the west and I'm originally from Kansas city! The beef ribs are big and meaty like Flintstones. The customer service is always excellent. The servers and owners always say hello make sure you're happy and have everything you need. Go early on busy days or holidays. They can run out of certain items they cook one batch per day

Very good BBQ, first time here, the sauce is what makes it for me, a little cayenne pepper in the barbecue makes it good with just a little kick, I had brisket and ribs and both were tender, brisket is better imo

Nice cashier.

Ribs, corn nuggets, hush puppies, bbq sauce: Good.
Brisket was normal brisket.. 
Pull pork - dry. Resolution: bbq sauce.
Burger - it was huge with lots of fried crispy onion. decent. to share.
Desserts - normal.

Nom, nom, nom!  Rollin Smoke Barbeque is an awesome place to get barbecue in Las Vegas!  Seriously, if you're visiting Vegas or live there, just try it, you'll love it.  They are located in an almost industrial center part of town, and there's not a whole lot of parking, especially when they are busy.  They are right down the street from our go to Tattoo shop, so they are really convenient for us to grab a to go order when someone's tattoo is going to take all day.  They also have two dining areas and seating outside too if you'd rather eat in. 

The portions are huge; my boyfriend and I can share one of their two or three meat platters easily.  On this most recent visit we ordered two of the three meat platters.  One for us to share, and one for the two teenage boys to share.  For under $40, all four of us were completely stuffed and we still had leftovers.   For our platter we had ribs, pork and brisket with the bacon potato salad and banana pudding.  The ribs were falling off the bone, the pork was flavorful and juicy and the brisket was really tender.  I grabbed a few extra containers of their sauce, but we didn't need it because the meats were great on their own.  The service is excellent even when they are busy.  I'll be honest, we're heading back to Vegas at the end of the month, and I think Rollin Smoke might be one of the things I'm looking forward to the most!
Service could be better better holy f$!#.... Pulled pork sandwiches marinted in jack daniels was awesome.. Bbq sauce was probably the best ive ever tasted.. Sin city knows bbq..

Spareribs were amazing! My boyfriend loved his chipotle rap. Their waffle fries are seasoned super tasty and a side of Mac n cheese was good. But the beef rib was too fatty to enjoy and the free berry cobbler was mush and inedible. We came around 2 on a Saturday afternoon and there was no line and lots of seating. The custom fish tank is super cute!
They definitely got the beef ! Smokin flavor & awesome bbq sauce! Spareribs were good too.
Seriously some of the best BBQ in Vegas. This is a BBQ place, so there's no need to go too much in depth with this review. It's good. Go and get messy and full. You're welcome.
Do not pass this by.  I had the three meat combo. The chicken was delicious, the ribs amazing and tender, and the pulled pork was DAM GOOD!!!

Everything was awesome.. ribs tender, chicken breast tender, sides pretty good.. but warning..DO NOT EAT THE PEACH COBBLER... if u are used to southern style peach cobbler this is not what u want... BUT everything else  was awesome....!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!###
This place has awesome ribs. I got the rib platter with 3 different meats. Beef, pork, n brisket. All were tender n flavorful. For my first time here I was quite satisfied.
Food is good I prefer savory BBQ this is sweet I got the BBQ brisket  nacho waffle fries

This place is awesome sauce, and, even better, the sauce is awesome (all right, I'll stop now).

Went to Rollin Smoke recently to see what all the buzz was about. Got the all you can eat special for $35. Worth every penny. If you want to know what to get, here's what you should get:

Burnt ends (incredible)
Beef ribs (amazing)
St. Louis pork spare ribs (delectable)

I went three rounds and, no joke, thought I was going to throw up on the way home. That's how much barbecue I ate. In my everyday life I try to abide by the principle of "moderation in all things." Rollin Smoke makes moderation impossible. Why are you still reading this? Go get some barbecue!

Went last night for a quick dinner and I wasn't expecting to like it very much since I don't eat pork often. I ordered the BBQ Pork wrap with some corn nuggets. I loved the corn nuggets especially dipped in their Arkansauce. My bf got the Outlaw burger and once I tried it I Loved it. It was delicious!! Next time I come to Vegas I will definitely stop by again.

The food is good but needs more choices of bbq sauce. The one they have on the table is ok.  The brisket on the sandwich was chopped - would have been better if it was sliced.  The inside setup of the restaurant is a little bit awkward. The fountain drinks are in a closet. The person taking your order in behind a huge podium - you can barely see them.  The bathroom is well....... sad. The bathroom is nearly like a gas station's - useful but don't touch anything.  The paper towel dispenser fell off the wall, but nobody put a roll of towels on the counter so you can dry your hands off. They have rolls of towels on every table - just not in the bathroom.  Looks like the owner spent way more money on the mural in the 2nd dining area than in the rest of the place.
This place has the best beef ribs in town. Beef ribs are hard to find so when you find some as great as these, you just have to write a review about them. Fantastic!!

Best BBQ I've ever had!! I'm from San Diego and was searching on Yelp for over 30 minutes, trying to find a good restaurant. My husband and I are foodies and love a good meal, weather it's fine dining or a hole in the wall. I hate paying for a meal that I could've made myself so it was hard to find a restaurant that was worth trying. The food here blew my mind. I ordered the duo plate where I could pick two meats and a side. I picked ribs and pork with a side of fried corn balls. My husband ordered the brisket meatloaf which came with onion rings on top and mashed potatoes. Every single food item, down to the pickles, was absolutely amazing. We didn't leave a single crumb on our plate. We also had the banana pudding that one of the chefs so nicely gave us on the house, just to be nice. He told us that there are several chefs, each one specializing in their own meat. How cool is that? No wonder it was all good. My husband hasn't stopped talking about our meal so we're going back tonight for more, I want to try the peach cobbler! Shout out to Matt at the register for helping us decide what to order. All the employees were so nice and friendly. The atmosphere is relaxed and fun. When we pulled up, our Uber driver wished us luck. It's kind of in the middle of nowhere and looks sketchy but it's really not. If you pull up and think of leaving, give it a shot. It's the best BBQ you'll ever have.

Friend and I split the The Pit Special with 4 meats (brisket, pulled pork, spare ribs, and hot links) and 3 sides (hush puppies, fries, and greens).  The meats were tender and flavorful, but the BBQ does get heavy after a while.  Very friendly service, and food come in generous portions.  The $20 Pit Special was very difficult for 1 person to finish alone, have some leftover for 2 people to make next day's sandwich, but great for 3 to share!

Don't forget to check in for free dessert offer! :)

I always think I will get my money's worth when I go to an all you eat so naturally when I was given the choice I chose all you can eat over all la carte. I shouldn't have done that because the portions are BIG! and you are not allowed to order more unless you finish your plate! The food was delicious but there was a lot! 

I started with the ribs that were easy to come off the bone and had a nice sauce to it. I loved the breaded catfish because the tarter sauce had a nice lemony taste to it. Bacon potato salad which also had a bit of chives sprinkled on the top. I like my potato salad chunky and not too creamy so it was perfect! 

The dessert was a hit and miss the black berry cobbler looked murky but I tried it and I wasn't too impressed. It tasted a little sour for me.  I liked that banana pudding better.  

Some advice is to buy a la carte if you know that you can't eat a lot. I felt uncomfortable after the meal because I over ate. If I was to do it all over again I would get the catfish especially , potato salad and the banana pudding. Those were my standouts out of everything I ate. 

I liked that there wasn't really a wait and we were served right away! The service was wonderful ! They kept  checking on us to see if we needed anything which was awesome!

If you're looking for good BBQ in Vegas, Rollin Smoke is where you're going to find it!

Located in a small plaza on Highland, Rollin Smoke is a fairly small restaurant and gets crazy busy at times. When you walk in, there's a large menu on the wall and after you place your order, you can go sit down and they'll bring the food to you. The menu is somewhat large and features classics like pulled pork sandwiches and meat combo plates. They've also got some not-so-usual options like the gigantic Outlaw Burger, Chicken 'n Waffles and even an all you can eat option. 

I usually order a two meat combo with brisket and hot link. Most places seem to serve a packaged hot link and just toss it in sauce. While I have no idea whether there's is or not, it's one of the better ones I've had. The sausage is flavorful with a great snap and they don't douse it in sauce. Since I'm a fan of spicy food, I like that there's has a little kick to it as well. And there's a reason I can't stay away from the brisket either. It's extremely tender, flavor is great and it's not overly smoky. Again, even though I really like their sauce, they don't douse the meat in it which is a huge plus. You have to try the sauce though, it's slightly sweet but has a mild heat...really tasty.

If you're into dessert, they have a few options there too. We've used the Yelp check-in for a free mini dessert a few times and always get the peach cobbler. My wife is a peach cobbler fanatic and this is her favorite in town. I've heard good things about the banana pudding though and I'll be getting that next time.

This a solid 4.5 stars for me and only because I've had inconsistent plate sizes. One time I got a combo plate that had so much meat I couldn't finish it, but then the two other times we've went, I finished mine and starting picking off the wifeys. Not a huge deal but it's a bit irritating. Either way, Rollin Smoke serves some of the best BBQ in town and at much better prices then most of them too. Top it off with friendly service and you got a must try spot!

Omg!! Thanks to my friend for recommending this place...

Food is awesome...very delicious & tasty....prices as very good..you get a bang for your buck....they got a very good menu....it's hard to choose what you want cause everything on there is so tempting...
It's a place to come to if your in the mood of good bbq...

Ate twice at SEMA last week, both times were excellent. First was the rib platter, the corn nuggets are to die for, the second visit I ordered a Flinstone Beef Rib, Burnt ends, and the corn nuggets and Bbq Baked beans, all excellent! 
The second visit I took about 8 People and they all were raving to the quality.
The chart on the wall puts them as nbr2 in the country. 
I'd definitely put them in the top ten, however I've eaten great Q in KC, TX, Memphis, the south, & all across the continent. JMO! 
Can't wait till next year's SEMA

This place was awesome and I can't wait to get back! Definitely the best BBQ I've found in Vegas so far!

Hubby, Mr. P and I shared the five meat plate with two sides. I'm pretty sure that their favorite were the ribs. But I have to say that the brisket is what really impressed me! It's served chopped and I couldn't believe how moist, tender and flavorful it was! It says a lot when you don't need any sauce.

It's also worth mentioning the hot links (a little too hot for me) and the pulled pork (tender and mild, but nice flavor). 

As far as the sides go, those corn nuggets were my favorite! They had that great balance of salty and sweet that you want.

Now this place is on the small side. I was certainly grateful that we happened to come at a time that wasn't very busy. We had no problem finding a place to park or a table. 

Service was fast and our food was out shortly after ordering.

First off NICE God fearing people here!! It's like you're going to church and it's one of those churches in the Deep South where the walls are rockin!! After church you get to have Uncle Dusty's bbq!!!! Chicken falls off the bone! Delicious brisket and ribs!! Now let's talk about them collards...Jesus is cooking collards in that kitchen!! Melts in your mouth!! Potato salad perfectly made and served COLD!!!! Mac and cheese was homemade and super tasty...the staff loves where they work and you are transported to a good ol Southern bbq place!! Thank you for a great experience Mr. James who is awesome! And Mr. Dusty for being so sweet and humble...congratulations on a wonderful place!! Keep it real always!! God Bless you all and the devil is not coming in your place because you keep preaching the good news! It was so refreshing to meet you! We have a special place in our hearts for Arkansas...Go Razor Backs!!!

Hidden gem in Las Vegas. Walked in and immediately knew I was gonna love this place. Got the pit special with brisket, pulled pork and spare ribs. Great flavor with a slight hint of a spicy kick. Sides were awesome too, tried the corn nuggets, mac n cheese and fried onion strings, Delicious, Definitely wanna try their All You Can Eat $24.99 Deal. Servers were friendly, food came out quickly and loved the atmosphere, Cant wait to go back and bring people visiting from outta town.

Looking for GREAT BBQ in LV? Not much selection but 1 mile off strip is some of the best BBQ I have ever eaten. Look for smoking smokers in parking lot. If you are a beef rib fan as I am you will simply not find a better smoked beef rib as good as this except maybe in Texas. Baby backs were top notch. Spares were also excellent but I like mine a bit more fall of the bone then these. Did not try pulled pork but will next time. Not fancy and no booze but who cares? Area is industrial but safe. Quick cab ride from strip.

First time here and everything was delicious!!  I had bbq chicken nachos and my husband had the outlaw burger (yeah, idk what he was thinking!). The food was good, seasoned well!!i got my husband some peach cobbler and after it cooled down, he devoured it. Lol. The employees are nice people and manner-able. It's tucked away, so if you don't look you'll pass it up. Overall, a great experience for the first time and will definitely return

First time here today for lunch and was thrilled to smell the smoke when we got out of our car heading into the restaurant. I ordered the trio with pulled pork,brisket, and chicken with sides of potato salad and Mac and cheese. Hubby had the pit master plate with the same meats but also had ribs. He ordered the coleslaw and hush puppies.  We both agreed the pork was our favorite. Very tender and a little fatty but that just enhances the flavor. 

My favorite side was the potato salad. Creamy and flecked with bits of bacon and green onion. Very tasty. Coleslaw was good too. Hushpuppies were very good also with bits of onion inside. The corn bread was sweet and super delicious!

The service was fast and our cashier/food server was friendly.  Will go back and try the baby back ribs next time.

This BBQ is the best I have had. The St. Louis ribs and hot sausage were outstanding. The ribs were meaty and the sausage was just tight in the spicy. 

The prices were a few dollars more minutes than what I would normally spend on BBQ but it was worth it. 

These people are obviously from Arkansas (by the decor in the restaurant). GO PIG SOOIE!!!

Friendly service, awesome meat, and solid sides are all I ask in a BBQ restaurant and this place has it all!

Greens and mac and cheese were good and chopped brisket was fine...

The burnt ends and beef ribs were really top notch, and that's coming from someone who has been to some of the best BBQ joints in the country and smokes meat himself.

I'll be back every time I'm in Vegas.

The best BBQ I have had in a very long time. Ribs, pull pork, brisket, everything was good. The beef rib was the best!!! very juicy and tendon, it melts in your mouth. Also love the BBQ beans that have so much smoke flavor and waffle fries was crispy. A little bit disappointed with the corn bread compared to other sides but we still ate them all :) 

10% discount if you go to the restaurant website and show the coupons via your phone to the cashier.

OMG - this place blows away the Phillips and other ethnic BBQ joints!  

Perfect bite, smoke, and 100% guaranteed to fill you up!

Beef rib was awesome.
Pork baby back ribs perfect.
Chicken was juicy and yummy!
BBQ sauce was just perfectly executed!
Gotta try all their sides - worth every penny.

Owner was very nice and bought us some extras when we mentioned we found them thru Yelp!

Must go to - get away from the casino buffets!
Excellent BBQ and deserts. The hotlinks have the perfect amount of spice and the brisket has an amazing smoke flavor:-))

Ok again I'm going against the grain and sticking to what I know, good southern bbq! This place is ok but far from the mark. The beef ribs were too fatty, the pork ribs weren't fall off the bone and skimpy. The flavor was pure smoke only. No real sense of the bbq flavor. The yams were drenched in liquid sauce and couldn't mix it in so it ruined it for me. And sorry to say as I was excited for cobbler, but this is far from cobbler! Gosh this is making a trip down south seem overdue! 
We called ahead our order and still waited a long time as they just said overwhelmed by orders. The little one wouldn't eat the ribs she was so excited for either. I so wanted to like this place so I can have a bbq place in town based on a lot of people's reviews but needless to say I'll keep on looking....

Yummm!! I can see why this place is so busy , best bbq I've had in vegas. I got the pulled piggy sandwich,  with the bacon potato salad. The pork just melts in your mouth!  It comes on a sesame seed bun which is alright , but delicious nonetheless.  My hubby got 1/2 rack of baby back ribs with cheesy mac and waffle fries. He hasn't said a word since he started eating ;) I tried it and let me tell you the ribs are smoked to perfection.  The mac and cheese is delightfully balanced , and the waffle fries are crispy and not too greasy.  Two thumbs up! Oh and we got it for around $37.00

I thought this place lived up to the hype and enjoyed meeting the owner, Lee and he's a really nice guy. I ordered the all you can eat deal for $25 and tried the pulled pork, brisket, sausage and ribs. For my sides, I had the beans, jalapeno coleslaw and collareds. However, the server had two faux pas by forgetting to bring out the greens and they gaved me St. Louis Ribs instead of baby back ribs so Lee went int he back and brought me out the baby back ribs and a beef rib and it was quite meaty. The ice tea was so so and the sweet tea did not have much sweetness either but guess it's better for my teeth! They had some football on the flat screen TV which is a must in September and the joint is nothing fancy but the bbq is definitely worth the trip and I was starving since I just arrived from the East Coast on an empty palate. I'll definitely make a return trip to this joint when I return in January and love the smoke smell whe you enter the restaurant. This place definitely puts Memphis BBQ to shame!

The food was decent and the staff was very friendly and helpful.  We went there around 9:30 on a Friday night.  The meat was dried out.   I would recommend going earlier when the food is fresh and it would probably live up to the high ratings others left.
Omg.... This is some gooooooood BBQ. I had the smoked meatloaf. You may consider splitting if you want to have room for their bread pudding!

After reading the reviews I was really excited to try this barbecue spot and unfortunately it was all hype. I ordered the brisket and ribs both were completely dry and very tough. After soaking it in about 2 to 3 cups of barbecue sauce it still didn't make anything better. I tried to let the reviews redeem themselves by ordering the peach cobbler, the crust was very soft and mushy. The peaches were cold and I'm sure they were directly from a can. They stated that the ice cream was Blue Bell and in fact it wasn't. I'm from Texas and know the ice cream very well, and what BBQ should taste like. I've had better ribs at chain restaurants where the meat falls off of the bone. Unfortunately this meat felt like it was fighting for its life to maintain a part of the bone. I was very disappointed to say the least. McDonald's McRib sandwich is a better BBQ choice than this restaurant and I haven't eaten at McDonald's in over 20 years.

I know I'm an outlier here but I think this place is 2.5 stars. I'm from the Sout and also lived in St. Louis and went with another die hard BBQer who grew up in fl and la. Everyone was very nice but was overwhelmed with the long lines for dinner and the food was just ok. Had baby back and regular ribs which were tough, brisket was dry, and Mac and cheese just ok. Maybe it was an off night but for vegas ellis island is still my go to place.

Right off the bat when you walk in, Bam it hits you! The Aroma of smoked meat somewhere in the back..I've been hearing about this place for awhile and well since I live in Henderson it's kinda far but I had a chance this time and I was in for a treat...
        
    I wasn't sure what to order.... oh wait yeah I was, Beef Ribs but I wanted like a combo so I got the babyback/ St. Louis/  Beef Rib combo with a side of bacon potato salad all for about $24 bucks. Holy smokes it was worth every penny. This was one of the best char and flavor. The meat was hot juicy exactly what I was looking for...

    Now on to the Beef Rib..I believe that you are not a BBQ place if you don't cook Beef Ribs, that's my opinion anyway. So I'm thinking let's go cause right at this moment for me Phil's BBQ Beef Rib was the bar for me and whelp no longer. I have a new bar and it's no longer in San Diego. Rolling Smoke you killed it! I mean the best. I'm gonna have dreams about this! I pray if I may that you open in Henderson..I'm fan and will continue to come back as long as you have Beef Ribs..Thanks Guys you rock \m/
Best BBQ in town hands down. My fiancé introduced me to this spot, so good. They also have a BBQ sundae that is not on the menu and it is SO good!

Great bbq for vegas.a very big portion of food and it tastes great.nice and flavorful and a nice big menu to choose from.and the sides are good to.and the deserts.this is a must do everytime you visit vegas.

We found this place last year & absolutely love it! We're halfway through our trip this year and have made our 2nd trip here already! We decided to try John Mull's Road Kill Grill yesterday & were disappointed that we wasted our time. Rollin Smoke is hands down so much better!
Have not been in the establishment, but they catered a BBQ for Pilot Air Fright. Great ribs, brisket, beans. Will have to go to the restaurant for s sit down dinner.

Pretty damned good.

The old saying is that the best food comes from a "hole in the wall" which fits this place perfectly. The dining area(s) are small, but from what I could tell, most people were carrying their food to go anyway. Oh, and don't expect to find it on the strip... do some exploring and you'll find this place a little out-of-the-way.

For a barbecue place, Rollin Smoke has a decent sized menu w/ some more odd options like the baked potato, or giant burgers not usually associated. Their sauce is really good with a nice kick, and spice that adds flavor to anything from ribs to their awesome fries.

Try the sides. I love how they add spice by-way-of jalapenos to macaroni, and beans. 

Is it the best I've had? No, but its close.

What a fantastic place for BBQ. If you're with a party of 6-8 get yourself a super plater.  Ribs,  pulled pork,  a Whole chicken,  sausage and well,  enough sides to feed a small army.  The bbq sauce is amazing.  Best place for BBQ in las vegas hands down

Experience:  wanted to grab some Togo for lunch, so I looked at my bookmarked spots close by and this came up. 

Facility:  this is a pretty small spot, in a strange location. Not convenient to a lot of different traffic, but good for the workers all along Highland Dr. The restaurant is extremely casual with picnic tables inside and outside. There was an additional room with seating off to the side, but I did not peek in. 

Service:  the staff was extremely helpful and friendly. Chef Will was awesome! He noticed I was staring at the menu for a very long time, so he asked if it was my first time here. Then he proceeded to go through the menu with me, and even let me taste a few things before ordering. What great customer service!!!!!!

Food: I really wish I could give the food a higher rating, but it was just not as good as I hoped. The corn nuggets were delicious!  The pulled pork and beef ribs were pretty good too. But the jalapeño cole slaw tasted more like black pepper cole slaw. The bacon potato salad was good, but too many onions for me. The biggest problem was I got my food to go and there wasn't any BBQ sauce in my bag. Not sure if that's standard and you have to ask for some or they just forgot it. Either way, it just wasn't BBQ without the sauce. 

Overall:  amazing customer service, and good food, by not great. I'd come back with friends, but I'd try something different next time.

Met my family there for our brother's bday on his recommendation. It's on highland near a exotic museum and strip clubs. But its a nice place in a small strip mall with other businesses. The other customers and owners were friendly.  Lots of interesting deco on the walls. The real boar's head scared me! The aquarium is original and everybody kept trying to open it. When you see it you'll understand.
The food was delicious and I will be back! I had catfish with greens and hushpuppies. An employee came and asked how I liked it. They checked on us a few times. Appreciate that! I bought 3 dinners for $52. Fair for food n service n atmosphere.
Best bbq in Las Vegas! The beans are the bomb. The sauces are all homemade and phenomenal.

This is the rare restaurant that lived up to the hype.  As many note, Rollin' Smoke is not in the best area.  But, there is a decent amount of parking close to the restaurant.  There are also plenty of places to sit, including tables outside.  But, since I came during the Las Vegas summer, there was no way I was sitting outside.

I was having trouble deciding between the Outlaw Burger and the 2 meat duo with pork and brisket.  The guy that was helping me suggested the meatloaf, which is made up of both brisket and pork and smoked.  It comes with potatoes on the bottom and BBQ sauce and fried onions on the top with pickle slices and a roll on the side.  I added fried okra, because if a place has fried okra I have to try it.

I was glad I took this guy's suggestion.  The slab is ENORMOUS, it easily fed me for dinner as well, and I'm a big eater.  The smoke in the meatloaf was incredible, very impressive.  I could have used more fried onions, but what dish couldn't?  I'll order more next time I eat here.  When you had a bite with the sauce and the onions, it was the perfect blend of crunch, meat and a bit of spice.

The okra was very good, but not the best I've had.  Service was fantastic, it took a bit to get my food, but they are super popular and making your food when you order.  So, it's worth waiting a few minutes.  Highly recommended, and the leftovers did great that evening with a second heating...

So I was looking for a BBQ place off the strip and this place came up the moment I ordered my beef ribs I knew I was in love the ribs,  they didn't fall off the bone but there was smoked just right there is sauce was right on the table so I was able to smother my ribs,  the macaroni and cheese was to die for it's really creamy and really tasty the collar greens were good I love this place so much I went back twice in a row will be coming back if I ever have a need and taste for BBQ in Vegas

I am finally have a chance to write this review about this AMAZING BBQ place!!!

At first my boyfriend and I were looking for steak, we have these weekend staycations we stay at the hotels because we like room service in bed! We headed down stairs to the steak house and decided last minute how YUMMY BBQ would be! 
So I YELP'd BBQ and a few places came up, one being Rollin Smoke and most others smack in the middle of the busy Saturday night strip time (no thanks)... 
We drove about the mile yelp said, and yes it was a super dark street not a lot of cars around... and I started getting that "I think I've seen this Law and Order episode" about the couple that goes to the dimly light bbq place and is never seen again. 
So we drive past and I say to my BF "you know it is normally these off the beat path ones that are AWESOME!!! And you can't ignore the 3 GIANT smokers in the parking lot!! 
So I say let's go!"

When we got in the place was quite nicely decorated and very clean, you can smell the food which made my tummy start screaming "FEED ME"
The 2 gentlemen running the BBQ place were as kind as can be! 
We each to get the ribs and chicken combo with side of coleslaw & BBQ beans.
The prices were great over there and they have a bunch of things to choose from which was great!!
SInce the place was not packed we got to sit in the room with the TV and they even let us watch what we wanted. 
Our food came out and we were shocked to see they there was enough to feed a small village in just one order! 
I don't even know the best way to describe this smoked deliciousness of ribs and chicken that hit my belly! Oh it was heaven, the chicken fell off the bone when I picked it up and the ribs were so tender! And I got the flashback of a few minutes earlier of the chef saying "he was from the (arkansas or Alabama) and he took much pride in his smoked bbq." NOW if ALL bbq places would care that much!!!
 
They must start cooking their meats early early to get them with that much flavor. 
In my life I only profess & save my undying love for very special things, so far only my doctor and a sushi place from LA have made it on this list, but I know I am adding "Rollin Smoke" to it now!!!

I had my leftovers for breakfast and my grandmother had some of my chicken left, she commented it was the best she had ever had!! (and that was cold leftovers)!!!   

I know it might seem sketchy when you drive up but DON'T be a fool and pass it by just for that!!!
This BBQ is some serious HEAVEN!!!!

Good BBQ in Vegas? It does exist. Rollin Smoke is where you'll find it. When you search for it some people might consider the location to be sketchy. Ignore that, look over at the mobile smokers, and then step inside to a recently renovated space. The bench tables may turn some people off but they are there to encourage people to sit together. But there are smaller tables, and even a second room (it's where the BBQ Grill fish tank is) if you want a little less of a crowd. 

But it's all about the food and Rollin Smoke delivers with excellent Brisket, chicken, and ribs that will make you think you're not in Vegas but in KC or Memphis. I could run long here but let's just say I spent 30 years in KC. I love BBQ. When I crave BBQ this is where I go, period. 

Service...if they're busy it can be hit or miss. It's not upscale. It's kind of a hole in the wall. But the BBQ keeps me coming back time and time again. 

5 Stars - Earned over 2 years of repeatedly great experiences. Worth the cab ride from the Strip if you're visiting.

This is probably one of the best bbq place to eat in the world. Got the rib platter and outlaw burger. They didn't lie when they said that the outlaw burger was the best in Las Vegas. It dam good!!! Must eat when you are in town!!!

I cant believe I keep forgetting to review this place! This is by far the best bbq I have ever had. Yes the location is questionable. Yes the restaurant itself could use some work. But the food... The food is incredible. The ribs are huge. The sandwiches are huge. The loaded mash side is delicious. The banana pudding is to die for. Get over there now and eat!

Me and my family are regulars, but stopped coming for a bit due to price changes and latency issues. Previously I gave them a one star review due to this. But we came back although it's not what it once used to be, they are definitely trying to make a solid effort to improve. I was greeted upon entering and told by the pit master, "let's see if we can do better this time around." It was definitely an improvement and me and my family will continue to be regulars at one of our favorite BBQ joints in Vegas.

You don't have to venture to K.C., Texas or North Carolina for 1st class BBQ. There's real deal smokin' Q right off the Strip in Las Vegas, NV. Rollin Smoke serves up a plethora of great ribs, pulled pork, brisket, chicken, hot links, burgers and much more. The Outlaw Burger is an award winner and the links are amazing. I'm a rib fanatic and love the St. Louis spareribs. They go light on the sauce and let the ribs speak for themselves. Beef ribs are huge, tender and delicious. They are also very proud of their smoked meatloaf. My girlfriend's 94 year old little Texas mama loved her catfish which was cooked perfectly. Many delicious sides. I recommend the corn nuggets. Loved them! Our host who also owns the place, Dusty, could not have been more accommodating or hospitable. I don't live in Las Vegas but whenever I am anywhere near the area I make sure to stop at Rollin Smoke. I've never been disappointed. Great BBQ right off the Las Vegas Strip! Who woulda' thunk it?

Tried this place on Saturday.  We read it was the best BBQ in Vegas.  Now, we haven't had others in Vegas, so that very well may be true.  However, comparing to other places we've eaten BBQ around the country and at home in AZ, it's not even close.  It was decent food.  Just a little over peppered and a bit dry.  I had the rib sampler.  Had beef, spare, and baby backs.  Beef was very dry, very fatty.  Best of the 3 were the baby backs.  They too were a bit dry as well.  My wife had the duo.  Hers was dry as well.  The brisket she couldn't finish because of how strong the peppering was.  Next time in Vegas, we'll try elsewhere if we want some Q.

This place is amazing!!!!  Any chance we make it down towards the strip this is where we go. The duo with pulled pork and two ribs is where it's at. Any of their sides are worth the money. Ordered the corn nuggets and had a mound of them on my plate. Enough for the whole family. The corn bread tastes like pound cake and anywhere in Vegas that has real sweet tea will get my vote.  Miss being in the south and this place makes me feel like I'm at home.

So glad we found this place. This will be the new go to joint for sure when we come to vegas. Love the fact that it's off strip. Had the brisket with waffle fries, side of loaded and mac and cheese. Everything was great and not overtop in sauce, flavor or size.
Not good BBQ at all and it was pretty pricey.. I've had way better in Vegas.. Billy's BBQ is still my fave..
I woke up at 3 in the morning with their Rib Tips still on my mind.. I'm looking forward too my second trip back here... I was very satisfied. .

Omg! Their bbq was heavenly good. My kids super loved the mac n cheese  

My fave was the corn nuggets  

I will definitely come back on my nxt visit to Vegas. The employees(Lizelle, Yandy, Mitch, Karina, Christian and Moses) were very friendly and greeted us with smile.  

Definitely going back here again!
Average...not as great as I expected. Portion were small for the price. Their sauce taste like regular bbq sauce...was expecting a bit of a kick to it. Overall, it was alright.
This place was absolutely delicious. The staff was very friendly I had the rib tips mac and cheese greens cornbread and the potatoes.

Holy nonsense! It's super busy in Las Vegas during the CES convention but they handled a huge crowd with ease! The best BBQ we've had in a long time! Loved Team Smoke but especially Mitch. He had great personality, answered all our questions and even had time to check on the groups, keep the place clean and cared for. 

Thanks for the great experience! See you next year!

TEAM SMOKE
DAM GOOD

So I decided to quit my job, and as a "victory" lap, I came directly to Rollin Smoke to get my mind off my troubles.  I asked for the trio meal, with brisket, pork and baby back ribs, but they refused me.  They said they could add the baby backs to the duo meal for an extra $6.  Not wanting to get off the "high" of quitting my job, I relented.

This time I asked for no greens and they obliged.  When the meal came, the food was cold. (It was about 7:30pm; they close at 8:30.)  I tried not to let it get me down.  The $6 baby backs amounted to exactly two (2) bones.  And I'm not even quite sure I got the baby backs, because they were meaty and chewy (and cold), resembling St. Louis ribs (which I could have gotten at a discount).  Anyway, that's not my biggest complaint.  This time, for some reason, I found the BBQ sauce to be very spicy.  I don't recall it being spicy the first time around (otherwise, I would have marked it down).  So for those of you keeping count -- I recommend the brisket and the pork but NOT the "baby back ribs" -- and also, come here during lunch, when the food is presumably fresher and hotter.  Aside from that, I think I'm done here.  Not that I can afford to eat anymore, now that I'm an unemployed bum.

Merry Christmas.  I'm going to kill myself.
Hands down the best BBQ in the state of Nevada. Ribs and brisket is amazing and the corn nuggets are the best. This place in now going into my rotation of regular weekly spots.

I don't think I have enough words in my vocabulary to say how delicious this food is!  The portion sizes are HUGE and allow plenty of leftovers (which I'm super happy about--lunch the next day?  Yes, please!). The pulled pork is some of the best I've tasted.  Each bite was extremely tasty and cooked perfectly.  When you pair that with baked beans on a bed of waffle fries and then smother it in cheese, you have a meal like no other!!!  The line was long which tells you the food is amazing, but we got through it pretty quickly and our food came out right away.  If you are looking for great BBQ, RUN to Rollin' Smoke!!!

Ok, so this is about as good as barbeque is going to get in Vegas.  That being said it doesn't quite compare with the likes of Oklahoma Joe's in KC and a few places in Texas, etc.  

I really enjoyed this place.  It felt like a barbeque joint should feel.  It had the picnic tables, it had the great hog's head, it even had a line going out the door, which is a good sign.   I took advantage of the all you can eat, so that I could sample a little bit of everything.  The catfish was divine.  The meat was excellent and so was the sauce.  

If you get a craving for bbq in Vegas, this is the place.

I love Bar B Que! I love ROLLN SMOKE!!!!  I at there today and I cannot wait until I am able to go back. Maybe tomorrow.  The trio plate was great! fantastic! tasty! awesome! the ribs were so tender. the links were amazing. great flavor. not too hot and not too mild. the brisket was a huge mound on the plate. for the price it was a huge plate of food!  I can't imagine being able to do the all u can eat, butI am eager to try it. they even brew their own sweet tea! add a little lemonade and you are set.  Get there!
Omg!!!! The best BBQ, I have ever had ... baby backs were my favorite.. Had 3 sides (Mac n cheese, bacon potato salad & mashed potatoes) All great!

OMG! Went to Rollin Smoke before the Clint Black concert.  Was easy to find due to friendly Yelper's directions.  The sexy smell of BBQ immediately welcomes you when you walk in the door.  Our order taker (sorry didn't get his name) determined the best combo when we told him what we wanted.  The corn bread was to unbelievably moist and delicious.  We would have ordered more for dessert with Blue Bell ice cream if we hadn't been so stuffed.  The beef ribs were huge and melted into smokey heaven in your mouth.  The brisket was plastic fork tender and moist.  You have to get corn nuggets - spicy fried creamed corned!  We were supposed to share but I ate more than my share!   They must be world famous as a large van of Aussies (in for Red Flag) filled up the place and took their orders to go!   The place has a lot of seating...can't wait to plan a lunch adventure for my co-workers!

I had the outlaw burger with fries. The fries were ok but the burger was oh so yummy!! It had strips of fried onion, cabbage, lettuce and tomato. Pickles and a banana pepper on top. It was huge!!! I could only finish about a third of it. 

Guy at the register warned me the burger would be big. It was a lot more than I had expected. 

Also had a plate with brisket and pork. (Not pictured). Also very yummy.

They're open kinda late. Located NEAR desert inn and highland. 

On the other part of the place- through a different door- you'll find the hog fish tank that was featured on Tank'd!!! How awesome is that? :) 

I'm not usually a fan of BBQ but I'll definitely be coming back here to try other things from their menu.

The best BBQ I've had in a long time!!! Will definitely recommend to friends that come to Las Vegas! I shared the meal with my sister that came with 5 different kinds of meet (ribs, chicken, brisket, pulled pork, and sausage) and 3 sides (Mac and cheese, yams, and bacon potato salad) and of course added corn and 2 soft drinks. Might come back before I leave for New York City!

So where do I begin. This place is very high on my list of places for BBQ. Too bad I don't live in Vegas because I think I would be coming back again and again. We ordered their whole chicken wings, which was flavorful and delicious. We also had the baby rack ribs, which were already cut so we didn't have to be too messy. The ribs were meaty and flavorful as well. For sides we had the yams, waffle fries, mac n cheese and baked beans which all were tasty. They have a pretty good variety of sauces. I highly recommend having a taste of Rollin Smoke BBQ while you're in Vegas We had a great time here and will definitely be back before our trip is over!
Food was great. Especially the corn bread and corn nuggets. They also have the cutest expo runner that looks like he's in middle school so tip him well! We did

I lived in North Carolina for 12 years, so I'm picky about my barbeque. When I heard about Rollin Smoke, I knew I had to give it a try.

The food here went above and beyond what I ever could have expected from BBQ in Vegas. The location is off the beaten path, but once you find it you truly feel like you've found a hidden gem. 

I'm not usually big on okra, but the fried okra here was perhaps the best I've ever had. And like I said, I lived in the South for 12 years.

This is a great place to grab a low-price, good quality meal in Vegas. If you're a tourist, like I am, and you have a rental car, it's well worth the trip for a tasty meal at an awesome price.

by far the best bbq I've had in vegas but that's not saying much.  I tried the brisket (a little dry), pulled pork (a pleasant surprise), and spare ribs (very nice).  they were out of my favorite (hot links).  sides included beans (I asked for pinto but got baked.  they were ok), greens (nice heat but I like collards and mustard and I don't think they used either), mashed potatoes (very good), and mac & cheese (same as everywhere else). corn bread was good.  nice portion sizes.

OK so I went to the electronics store in the same small strip mall with a friend. We decided to try out Rollin smoke. The small Asian gal that took our order did not smile, did not seem friendly, and it was only 11am so not sure why she would be so grumpy so early in the day. I had the catfish po' boy for $12.99. It comes with no sides, with nothing. The sandwich has two pieces of fried catfish, not big and not small, also lettuce, tomato and a yellow mustardy 'tartar sauce'. The fish was mushy, not sure how else to explain it. The lettuce wilty, the tomato over ripe. It also came with sliced onion. The menu does not mention the onion, had it mentioned them, I would have had them removed as I am allergic to onion. Not worth the $13. My friend had the two meat plate for $13.99. He chose the pulled pork and the chopped brisket. His also came with a side so he chose the cheesy mac n cheese. His was all good. Not a lot of meat, not sure it was worth the $13.99 but much closer to being worth the cost than the catfish sandwich was. 
So to recap, do NOT get the fried catfish sandwich. Not worth it, and not that good. The onion taste on the wilty lettuce with mustard instead of real tartar sauce on mushy catfish.... the duo meat plate was not bad. And just deal with the grumpy order taker. As you can see from my reviews, I rarely give a 1 star rating... so listen to it. Better to go to the Big B's in Henderson or the John Mull's Road Kill Grill on Thom blvd in northwest Las Vegas.

Fantastic all round but for me the brisket was a stand out...had to go for a second order! Hot links , ribs and pulled pork with sides of slaw, waffle fries and potato salad rounded out the pit special  The service and hospitality were fantastic! This is a must do in Vegas if bbq is your thing!

This place is amazing. 

Immediately stepping out of my car into their parking lot the smell of bbq smoke floods your nose. You know it's going to be good. 

I must say, to my disappointment that I did not get to try as much as I should have. I had the Pull "Piggy" as it's called, which is pulled pork on a hoagie roll. I read some other reviews that it was pretty large and since I was coming for lunch I didn't want to over do it. My mistake. It wasn't that big at all. Simple six-inch hoagie roll stuffed with smoked pulled pork with a drizzle of their bbq sauce and some green onions. It was very stuffed, but I still wasn't full afterwards. My fiance got a sandwich as well, the beef brisket. Both were absolutely amazing. The meat is tender and packed with flavor. The bbq sauce isn't overwhelming and heavy - enough to add flavor and more moistness. 

All-in-all, I cannot wait to come back to this place. They have AYCE for $25, anytime any item. Challenge accepted, soon.

Fabulous BBQ.  Before this joint, the best BBQ I have had was a tie between a place in Raleigh, NC and the shack on Corpus Christi Naval Air Station in TX.  Very authentic, not too smokey but just right.  The beans were nothing short of incredible.  Next time I will be trying the jalapeno cole slaw.  I certainly hope business is good for them because it is downright impossible to find reasonably priced, authentic bbq in Vegas.  Good advertising having the smokers in the parking lot or else I would never have known it was there.   Only suggestion I would make would be to add more sides such as collards, etc.

I walked in not really knowing what to expect. Upon opening the door, I see just what looks like a small little shack with some tables you might see at a camp ground. I was with my girlfriend and her mother and they had been here before but we still needed a little help with the menu about what to order to which Brenda the lovely lady at the front was more than happy to give us a hand. They had mentioned that they had been here before and who had helped them the last time they had come here which to our surprise happend to be one of their chefs, chef Tim. Even more surprising was the fact that he took the time to come out and acknowledge us he even said he remembered my girlfriend and her mother last time. I can say that this place has some of the best customer service that I have ever experienced. Everything was smiles and great food from beginning to end. The food was absolutely superb and I can honestly say this is my new favorite place to get BBQ. I would even go as far as saying this is the best BBQ place in las Vegas everything was amazing and definitely will be back. 5/5

Met up with some local Vegas friends on our last visit out there. This restaurant is hidden, located very close to a strip club, in a dark plaza, windows are tinted, and is missing a bouncer outside. However once you step in, it's like being in Texas again.

You order up at the counter and take a seat. They bring your food to you. The cashier was cool and even know how to say my name correctly. Respect given. 

Like any good BBQ joint, they better give you a good bang for your buck. I expect finger licking seasoned grilled meats and a slew of sides. They sure didn't disappoint. They sure know how to rub their meats!

Brisket: Seasoned perfectly. The best brisket in Vegas
Spare Ribs: Fall off the bone and flavorful
Chicken: Not dry and seasoned very well
Mashed potatoes: Buttered and smooth just the way I like it
Yams: Sweet and juicy
Corn Nuggets: Awesome deep fried corn nuggets. Never had these before

Everything pretty much was on par with great BBQ. Not Austin, TX great, but for anywhere else, it's up there. It's cheap and filling for some good rubbed meat!

5 STAR FOOD with 5 STAR SERVICE! I ordered the 2 meat combo. 2 ribs, sliced brisket and Mac n cheese. Everything was GREAT! I first tried them at the Pigs for Kids BBQ competition. My favorite BBQ place in Vegas. Thanks RS BBQ and thanks to Karina at the front counter!
skip the shrimp, it was a little overcooked, but this is a BBQ place, everything was well priced and the food was great.

3.5 stars. It's well worth getting off the strip to get BBQ here. Is it up there with the best BBQ I've had (lockhart's)?  No, but it's still darn good and great value for being near the strip. It scratches the BBQ itch every time!

Our neighbor recommended this place and it's definitely the best BBQ YET in Vegas!  

The food is excellent and portion is great!  Wish they would open one up in Henderson!

I was tired of paying 50 a head for food on the strip and yelped this place out of curiosity.

We went a little before closing on the Saturday before memorial day and unfortunately they had run out of all meats except the pork ribs and pulled pork. The person who took our order was very kind and cheerful. Unfortunately the ribs were a little chewy, not fall of the bone tender, but the aside from that was tasty and had a nice little bit of spice to it. I got the combo with the loaded mashed potatoes and they were okay; potato with green onions and shredded cheese on top.

I would definitely like to try this place again during earlier hours to try their other meat choices.

The best Ribs in town!  Everyone there is helpful and the service is good. My only complaint was the last time I was there my order was incorrect. The food was still great, and after a phone call they did apologize for the mistake.  I would still say "GO THERE" you will not be disappointed.

Two words: freakin' awesome. If you love BBQ this is a must. A little out of the way but worth the drive/cab ride. You will not find such awesomeness on the strip...and super reasonable prices. Their burger was amazing-it was actually smoked! Their banana pudding was simply perfect. I have never had a better one and I'm a bit of a banana pudding addict. Just go- you will be so happy you did!

Hands down best BBQ in Vegas 
The location is sketch for sure, but that's what makes it such a good hole in the wall. 
I've tried several different things, but the smoked meatloaf is my favorite! So amazing and very flavorful!

This is the BEST BBQ in town!. Very convenient from the Strip. Great service, always have pleasant staff.  The food is delicious, Try the Meatloaf or outlaw Bigger if you want a flavor adventure, but EVERYTHING IS GOOD! Chef Tim is AWESOME!

very good bbq.  when you walk in you can smell the smokey flavor.  wide variety on the menu at a reasonable price all entrees include a side and a drink.  i had the rib plate with 3 baby backs 2 spares and 1 beef rib with the mac and cheese.  i was very hungry when i walked in and couldn`t finish it the beef rib was hugh and tender mac and cheese was good.  my friend had the pit master special 4 meats 3 sides brisket was a little dry but still tasty we left very full and happy.  i will return!!!

WOW!! amazing def a place i will be returning to.  the corn bread is soft and moist the ribs!! Delicious! we also tried the famous MEATLOAF i can def say it is a large portion. We also ordered the duo LET ME JUST SAY GO THERE YOU WONT REGRET IT! and dont forget to try their homemade bbq sauces!

I'm not one of those guys who will pretend to be an expert on Barbecue.  I'm not going to get into the debate of Texas vs. Carolina vs. Arkansas vs. wherever.  You've seen those charity ads with the tagline "Hunger knows no borders?"  Well, as far as I'm concerned, good BBQ knows no state lines.  If you insist upon knowing however, an Arkansas flag hanging inside provides a clue as to their roots.

As others have remarked, this place is located off the beaten track, and easy to miss.  Even with the GPS bleating at me and the smell of the smokers wafting through my windows, I blew by it and had to circle back.

The shopping center it is located in is a bit down-at-heel, but not dangerous.  Walk through the door and there is a podium at the back of the room with an "Order Here" sign.  It may be unattended, but there is a hotel desk-bell to help you get their attention.  

There is a nice selection of dishes, sandwiches, platters, and combos, so you should be able to find something however small or large your appetite.  

The BBQ is excellent.  Thoroughly smoked flavor; not dried out.  They provide sauce, but it really doesn't need it.

All in all, a great find, and worth the visit.

Their corn nuggets should be a new food group because I think I could live off of those creamy fried bits of goodness that taste less like they're from sin city and more like they came from heaven.

Burnt ends, sliced brisket and rib tips were all tender and flavorful. Having sampled BBQ from all over the country, this joint definitely holds its own and offers up some delicious and authentic BBQ.

AMAZING!!! We tried the chicken sandwich which was all chicken breast and deliciously moist! With corn nuggets....WOW!! A must try!!  The pork spareribs were also very good. Great smoky flavor and super tender as well. Variety of sauces available so we tried several. The green beans were garlicky as well as peppered. Next time we're trying the mac n cheese tho. Mamas banana bread pudding was also very good however we were so full were taking it home to hopefully enjoy later. The cashier was really nice and the inside was much bigger than it looks from the outside. Overall a great experience and we'll be back!

All you can eat BBQ, costs a little bit but you get to keep going up to the counter and stuffing your face with new delicious things. All the BBQ is well executed and seems like a great family run joint.

First off, it's a little pricey. Some may argue you get what you pay for, but for some reason it just seems a bit overpriced. For a single person eating lunch, with a sandwich, side and a drink and you're close to $20. If you get a meat combo or such, that'll push it up even more. That being said, the stuff is good. The signs all say Alabama BBQ, not sure what that means but it's good! One caveat...when you leave this place all of your clothing will smell like smoke for the rest of the day. Sauces are good too, they have several to choose from, the house and the Carolina vinegar are my faves. They have a hot one too, that is pretty spicy. Also, the neighborhood is a bit sketchy, its in the shadow of the DI super arterial.

OMG!  I am originally from Texas and miss very much the ability to get BBQ on every street corner.  This BBQ is as good as I am used to back home. 

I had the pulled pork sandwich (tender as butter), the baked beans (spicy with huge chunks of meat), and the cornbread (incredible, not the least bit grainy with the perfect amount of sweet butter). The prices were reasonable, and the smells when I walked up were enough to work me into a feeding frenzy while I waited on my meal.

The service was friendly, and a bit disorganized, but in a very charming way.  You can tell that everyone there was very concerned that every guest was happy.  The location isn't the greatest, but any true BBQ lover will not let that get in the way of the only true southern cooking I've had in the 8 years I have lived here.

I am very excited to try more items on their menu.  I can't wait to go back.  Thank you for easing some of my homesickness.

This place is a little hole in the wall dice type place that was simply amazing!! The service was excellent and the food even better. I got the brisket, spare ribs and Mac N Cheese. All were excellent. Mac and cheese was my favorite. Everybody else with me said it was equally as amazing. My brother ordered the chop brisket sandwich with coleslaw, and cheese. He said it was amazing so when you order it that way ask for "the John". Overall excellent place and a must try in Vegas.

Hands down the BEST BBQ place in Vegas. The meat was perfect! The sides were delicious and the sauces are amazing! The sweet corn bread melts in your mouth and even the sweet tea blew my mind! Makes every other BBQ place taste like a McRib. I could not stop raving about this place afterward... Famous Dave's is for CHUMPS!

Being the owner of two Big Green Eggs, I usually make these meats at home, but seeing it is summer here (enough said), it is really nice to be able to go out for this instead of doing it myself all day. 

Hubby had the outlaw burger and I shared my meat plate with him. We also had sides of mac and cheese, yams and corn nuggets.  First off, hubby loved his burger.  I had one bite and it was good, but too much like meatloaf for me both in taste and texture.  I like that they smoked the burger. We do that at home as well and there is nothing better.  Next visit hubby is getting the meatloaf he said. Something about loaded mashed potatoes.......yum.

I really enjoyed the brisket, it was moist and had just the right amount of smoke infused into it.  Some of it was cut too thick for my liking and as such, didn't have that tug and pull apart you expect, but thankfully, it wasn't served drenched in sauce, that is a no-no in my book.  

The pulled pork was good, but not great. It lacked that smoky flavor but it was very moist.  I have the same problem making this at home. It is difficult to get that smoke all the way into the deepest part of the meat.  Their BBQ sauce was very nice, not too sweet or just tasting like spiced-up ketchup. The two together were nice and next time on a sandwich it is.

The chicken was also good, but my favorite for flavor was the homemade sausage. It was nice and smokey and had a great kick at the end.  I would like the grind a bit finer though.  The sides were all tasty.  You could taste the cheese in the mac and cheese and it was not greasy at all. The yams were nice and chunky and sweet but not too sweet. The corn nuggets were perfect, nice and crunchy on the outside, tender and sweet on the inside. H&J on Eastern, take some lessons from this place on how to cook these. 

We shared a banana pudding for dessert and it was creamy good, but I would have liked to see some banana slices in it. The vanilla wafers were nice and soaked with pudding goodness.  I am not sure how we had room to eat it all, but we did.  We took plenty of meat home for leftovers.  

Will we be back? Yes, of course.  This is by far the best BBQ we have had in Las Vegas so far.  Just wish they were closer to home.

Do not hire for catering events.... as the food was not bad the service was and is terrible.   I was not only over charge more than the agreed amount contract. . But also the additional labor request was a waste of money... they did not have the Staff bus anything as agreed.  Via email amd text message. We were prepared to hire bus staff from another vendor but they stated they had to have their own team bus the tables and serve.   They didn't do anything.

Now they are not responding to any of the items we have in writing and i will have to bring in our lawyer. 

Not worth the headache. And if you saw the mess they call an invoice you would understand why they do not have any kind of business skill other than cooking.

I would suggest using any other BBQ company in town to not have to deal with this chef and his lack of business

One more thing.. if you do use them be sure to check the math .. as I had to correct it for them during this process

I was on my way to Shake Shack (Nelson Q. of Las Vegas put it in my head) when I asked Tim C. of LA,  "Shake Shack" or "White Castle"? He texted back,  "Neither. .."  At the same time, William of LA messaged that he hadn't had a chance to go to Rolling Smoke Barbeque...ah...how to decide?   Shall I explore for William?  Why not? 

My GPS took me down some road that I have never heard of or been on. It seemed like I was in an industrial area.  I saw a sign with the name of the restaurant clumped up with other businesses. I pulled in the driveway. There were two police cars already parked there.  I messaged William about the location. He said there are strip clubs in the area.  "Thanks!", I messaged back.  A little worried, I walked in anyway. 

The place was about half full and I stood in line to order. The cashier, Dave, was very friendly and helpful. I decided to get the Platter which had 3 baby back ribs, 2 St. Louis spare ribs, and one beef rib.  Then I had to select a side dish. I figured that I knew what Mac and cheese was about, so I got the Corn Nuggets.  Yes, I didn't know what that was either. ..  Dave said that it's Sweet Corn,  breaded, and deep fried. Intriguing!  Let's try it!  Then, Dave give me a cup. I asked if this meal came with a free drink because I noticed that the drinks are $3 with refills.  No... I got a complimentary beverage!  Yay! Thanks Dave!  The soda dispenser is self service! !

I guess I was supposed to sit down and have the meal brought to me.  The other room had a table occupied by police officers. I sat in the corner, under the television. Another option was outside seating, but it was dark and cold. I left my jacket in the car, prepared to battle some ribs. ..

The Beef Rib was on the top. I couldn't stop eating it. The moist meat fell off the bone. It was like smokey, soft, stew meat. The charred "koge" fat layer on the top was scrumptious! I wanted to give equal attention to the baby back ribs and the St. Louis spare ribs, but I couldn't let go of that Beef Rib. It was that good!  Later, I realized that I ate everything without sauce. There were containers on the counter, but I was so mesmerized that I stayed in my seat. I got up for a soda refill and a take out container & package which are self service along with utensils.

I wasn't able to finish everything in one sitting,  so I brought it to my hotel room and had a perfect midnight snack! The only thing that might turn some customers off would be a cockroach. I saw one crawling across the wall at the entrance of the restaurant. However, I'm not going to let this get in my way of a BBQ meal.  I would go back again!

July 21, 2014:  11:15 AM

Imagine waking up at one of the best hotels on the Las Vegas Strip and you've just had a great meal at a famous chef's restaurant the night before, but you're wondering what the locals eat.  You're wondering if a town like Las Vegas has local places that most tourists don't know exist.  If you're like me, you go to the source, Yelp, for good information, and Yelp came through in a great way.

On this date we found Rollin Smoke Barbeque, and it was a good, make that great, find.  It is a hole in the wall joint tucked into a strip mall off the beaten path, and, as of this review, it was averaging 4.5 stars after 455 Yelp reviews.  This is a very good thing, as Yelpers can be unkind and unforgiving on occasion.  Typically I look for consensus when using Yelp, and that is usually achieved after 100 or so reviews.

On our trip there were three of us arriving, my wife, my sister in law, and me.  Of the three, I was the most committed to the experience, and the other two were good sports.  After the food arrived, they were also sold.

We ordered so that we could try almost everything, as we got enough to share with each other.  We had beef ribs, pork ribs, chicken, jalapeno cole slaw, beans, potato salad, and, as its two days since we were there, I'm sure I'm forgetting something.  We also 'checked in' on Yelp, and when we did this they offered us a free desert.  We chose the blueberry cobbler.

If you are 'high maintenance' this is not a place for you.  You order like you're at Carl's Junior; stand in line, place the order, give them your name, find a seat, and they bring it out to you.  The room does not feature fancy table clothes or fine silver.  It does include a plethora of paper towels (on a roll for your immediate use), and a TV tuned to a sports channel.  In the room with us was a crew of air conditioning repair men, about ten guys, and the fact that they were there, locals, helped me know that this not a tourist spot, but a local's place.

The $40 worth of food that we ordered literally arrived in about four minutes.  It is important to note that we had attempted to avoid any kind of lunch rush, arriving before the lunch hour.  There were probably 10 other people already there, and I suspect that the lunch hour features a lengthy line.

Regrets?  Yes, just one.  I wanted to taste one of their links, but I didn't get the chance, but next time, and there will be a next time, I'll get one.  Las Vegas is many things, and there are a lot of really great places to eat, and, as in all big towns, there are some great locations off The Strip that you've got to find, and Rollin Smoke Barbeque is on that list.

This is really good food!  They really know how to make bbq!  I particularly like their bbq shrimp.  Brisket is pretty awesome too.  The employees are friendly also. Would recommend this restaurant to anyone that enjoys good bbq.

Back again! This time I had the brisket dog. 1/4 lb beef hotdog with brisket, cheese and onions. Pretty good. My gf had the rib and chicken combo, we brought a friend and he had the same.

Everything was good as usual!

I don't know where to start!  First of all this was an order for takeout and to get 5 stars from me on a takeout order is a pretty big deal!  

I ordered the brisket trio which was exactly as described. It was not drowning in spicy barbecue sauce or seasoning. Only down side was not enough to be off putting, but again with the darn green onion garnish on top of all the food!  

I can't even with this banana pudding too!  Probably the absolute best I've ever had!  It's almost like a frosting consistency but not overly sweet or banana flavored in any way. Incredible!

Can't wait to go back for more corn nuggets and pudding!

This place is pretty good and definitely provides decent value for being so close to the strip. The barbecue is fine, the brisket, pulled pork, ribs and links are all decent. The meet is well Cooked and has good flavor. The sauce they give you is fine too.

The real star however is the outlaw burger. This thing is a true monstrosity. With all the meats, onion rings and veggies I am not sure if you're even supposed to be able to put the whole thing in your mouth. But it's very good and enormous. And only nine dollars! Sweeet.

The sides were a mixed bag. Kicking beans were good, hush puppies were terrible. Oh well! Not a bad spot and seems to be popular but the line still moves fast.
