Truly a hidden gem here in vegas. Great ribs, great brisket and even greater service. Had a hearty meal with our friends yesterday. Another place for me to take any out-of-towners to!

I had one of my favorites, Catfish and hush puppy plate with a side of Okra and of course the sweet tea. Catfish= 3 tender, juicy, the batter is seasoned and light but satisfyingly crispy. Hush Puppies= bold flavor. Fried Okra=order it. Rollin Smoke is one the best BBQ places in Vegas!

Had the outlaw burger. Fantastic!!!! Would go there again, my buddy had the ribs, they fell off the bone!!!!....whatever meat you get, get in pulled. Its juicier that way. Or all you can eat meat plate for 25.00 cant go wrong....

My family and I just got Rollin Smoke to go. Ordered at the counter. Saw a long line but figured that was a good sign and it would move fast. Wait ended up being 15-20 mins to order but once ordered 5 minutes to get our food. Got home to find the "brisket dog" had no brisket. Which was a real bummer especially paying $8.99 for a plain dog and $3 extra for a side. My husband had the "big Hawg" (huge pulled pork sandwich) huge was right but the flavor lacked without sauce. Unfortunately we didn't pack extra sauce.
Aside from the messed up dog order and flavor lacking pork, the outlaw burger was amazing! Would definitely get that again.

I'm a Southern girl, raised in TN. So, when I moved to Las Vegas, I just about gave up on finding anything near what we in the South call "BBQ." Other places claim to have BBQ (ahem, Famous Dave's) but they DO NOT. Rollin Smoke is heaven on a spit. They know what they are doing and they do it well. If you are super hungry and want something that will hit the spot, go to Rollin Smoke. These guys are from the Carolinas (sorry, can't remember if it's North or South, apologies), and they do BBQ well. I won't go into whether this is dry rubbed or not because if you are from Las Vegas, you won't even know what I'm talking about anyway. Just go there if you want great BBQ here. You'll love it. 

Also, for those folks who complain about Rollin Smoke running out BBQ, I have to remind folks who don't know that real BBQ takes time. Lots of time. Smoking is a dedicated process, and if this restaurant runs out of meat, they run out of meat. They can't magically smoke more in 30 minutes or less. So, get there early so you can get what you want. My kids had the pork sandwich and it was huge and they ate it all. The bacon potato salad is heaven. My husband had the 3 meat Brisket Dog, and loved it. I had the Smoked Meatloaf, and I thought I'd died and gone to heaven. I had plenty of leftovers for my husband and I to share. We saw (and were frightened of) the Outlaw Burger, as it was easily a foot tall. So, again, please note: Bring Your Appetite. 

This is a "get in line and order" place, with seating in three different rooms. We loved sitting in the room with the "Tanked" fish tank that used to be their original smoker.

As a visitor going off strip is usually only done based on reputation, including the advice of locals and sites such as Yelp.
I am happy to report that Rollin Smoke more than lived up to it's great reputation. 
We arrived a little early (11:30am) for lunch, which was fortunate given that we just got ahead of the locals and the lunch rush.
We ordered 4 different selections off the expansive menu and were all heartily pleased.
Great brisket and pulled pork, amazing flavour, delicious sides.
It is not fancy, mostly banquet seating but let's face it, BBQ is about taste, quality and selection. 
For visitors without rental cars it is only a short taxi ride from the strip. 
If you want a great BBQ experience at a reasonable price, Rollin Smoke is for you!

This place never lets you down. Kind of an awkward dining room set up but the food makes up for it then some. The menu is on the wall with alot of options.  The outlaw burger is the BEST burger in Vegas & huge. I usually get the duo which is a 2 meat combo its $11! Also they have all u can eat! So many awards in the wall you lose count. If you're in Vegas you cant miss this hidden gem.
My top 3 bbq place. Away from strip, fast turn over, workers with good attitude. Definitely place to hit up and try at least once.

Meh, not awful but far from my favorite in town. I wanted to love it...loud, hot, crowded(good sign) but being 115 outside the only seats were by the line. Kinda uncomfortable having people and kids over your shoulder and touching your back while you scrape the fat(a lot way more than half) off your $7 rib. Good flavor and texture on the 4 bites I did have though.
Best bbq in Las Vegas. Smoker in parking lot. There is always a line out the door and for good reason. Prices are very reasonable.

We just ate there again, one thing that has to be found in a good restaurant IMHO is consistency, there is no point in having a place that on one night can serve a great meal and the next night it sucks.

Well Rollin Smoke keeps delivering fantastic BBQ, end of story, I cannot recommend this place enough.

I was assisted by Lizelle and she was an excellent consultant while assisting me with my order. I ended up going with the rib platter, which was absolutely AMAZING. I'd recommend it to anyone visiting the area and needs some classic BBQ in their lives.

We walked to this place from the strip. The walk is through some less than glamorous streets but it is totally worth it. My wife had a spudtastic which was huge and delicious. She had it with pulled pork on it-- great choice. I went for the brisket dog which was amazing. It is a hot link with brisket, cheese, and a huge pile of fried onions. The service was great. The ambiance was, well, appropriate. Bottom line, I would go here again and again.

Killer food! Corn nuggets, sliced brisket and spare ribs were outstanding! The workers are extremely friendly and personable. We gave this place 10 out of 10! This will be our place to go when we come back to visit!

Surprisingly good BBQ in the oddest of strip malls. We missed it the first time around, it's by a Diamonds Cabaret Strip club and when we pulled in the store front is dark so it looks even closed. You'll see large BBQ smokers in the parkinglot so you know you're in the right place. It's open late-ish during the week, and 1:30 am during Fridays and Saturdays! 

Bobby, Misti, and Mamie said something about grabbing some food to eat here after a UYE and somehow it struck a cord with everyone that BBQ sounds amazing and talk was rumbling about hunger that the rest of us decided to sort've crash on their idea. 

The BF and I shared two dishes, made both a combo (drink and 1 side) -

Smoked meatloaf  was awesome. The BF says one of the best he's had. It's definitely great flavor and is a different style of meatloaf being smoked, then basted in some of the sauce and topped with crispy onion rings. It was on a bed of pretty good red skin mashed potatoes. If you love meatloaf, this is something to try. 

Beef ribs are normally something we skip over, but seeing as they looked good and people were actually saying they were quality I decided we should give it a go. It was meaty, juicy and tender which is rarely achieved. I have to compare it to my holy grail of Phils in SD, and while it doesn't have that cracktastic crisp outside to moist (haha CHRISTIE O. ) inside, the quality is definitely there and satisfies that want for a good beef rib. So many places don't even serve it, just because of how hard it is to cook right. These were solid. 

Our sides were also solid. The baked BBQ beans had pulled pork pieces in it and was very good and hearty. Potato salad is the red skin potato style mayo (no mustard) style and had crispy bacon bits and green onions on top. I like all kinds of potato salad and this was good.There was a little bread piece on the basket which was kinda stale and dry which was the only hiccup.  They have one kind of BBQ sauce and it's on the zesty and a tad spicy side which I enjoyed it a lot. 

I really wanted to try a dessert, but we already had the major meat "itis". Maybe one day I will come back and eat something "lighter", you know, like a sandwich chaulk full of meat. 

It's a order up type of place at the counter and serve yourself drinks out of the beverage closet (it'll make sense once you're there). The staff was friendly and made sure to check on us. 

 Apparently the owners are Arkansas folks and while that is a "fringe" state that normally people don't think about slanggin' the 'que, it takes on influence from the best ideas of the rivalry states, really.

 I definitely think even from this first visit, this place raises the bar on BBQ offerings in this town. We will be back, probably really soon.
This is the best cue in town. Not even close. Friendly staff. Phenomenal food. Amazing sides. Exactly what you want from a barbecue place.

Really enjoyed the food here, the pulled pork sandwich was awesome, along with there Mac and cheese and bbq beans. The pulled pork was perfect, not to salty or bland,plenty of flavor.The staff were very pleasant to talk to, the grill masters were super nice also. I will be coming back for sure! Don't miss out, hands down best bbq in LV!
Excellent meat choices. I think this place is the best bbq place in Vegas. Reason why I give it a 4/5 is because they raised the price for the all you can eat deal. It is a bit on the expensive side.

I visit LV every year and explore eating establishments away from where I stay. I had a taste for BBQ and decided to visit RSB because the reviews were excellent. I love good BBQ, Dinosaur BBQ in New York is fantastic, so is Woody's in South Central LA. When my plate arrived, I couldn't wait to dig in. I ordered a half rack of the baby backs and the bacon potato salad, beans and peach cobbler. The ribs were adequate, very lean but something was missing. The potato salad had bacon sprinkled on top, would have preferred that the bacon be mixed in. The beans were delish. The peach cobbler was inedible. I think I found 1/2 of a peach slice and the rest was a mixture of soggy dough. I spent $34 for my meal, which is outrageous given that I threw the cobbler away. At Dinosaur, the ribs are excellent and a 1/2 slab, cornbread and two sides is less than $20 and believe me, you'll leave with a smile on your face.
Pork and brisket were awesome, ribs were a little dry but everything else was great. We will be back!

I'm giving this place 5 stars, because they made my friend happy. She's never happy with eating out. Everywhere we go, when we get back home and I'm all excited because I've had a good meal, but she just sits back and say, "It was ok."

No seriously, everything was awesome. We got a lot of food, not JUST because we were starving, but because we wanted a large variety of food so that we could give them a fair chance to impress us. Well, job done! I have to say, we were impressed!

With the help of the perky and oh so passionate cashier, we ordered the Pit Special 5 Meat 3 Sides for 27.99. It came with Brisket, Pulled Pork, 1/4 Chicken, 2 Spare Ribs and Hot Links for the meats and we got Mac & Cheese, Yams and Kick'n BBQ Beans for the sides. We also ordered a Peach Cobbler on the side.

We enjoyed The whole meal and we ate every bit of it. The best part to me was the Hot Links and maybe the Mac & Cheese, if you force me to pick. To be honest, when we go back, the only change that we would make is, instead of the Peach Cobbler, we would order Mama's Banana Pudding.

I do want to mention that the Peach Cobbler was really oily. It was probably because of the cream that was on top, but either way, we've both had better. I wouldn't order it again.

All in all, the customer service was great and the food was more than just good, it was great lol! We added this place to our Favorites list.
Awesome!!!! Had the spare ribs, brisket and pork and was phenomenal! Highly recommended with fast and friendly service.

I don't know why it took me over a year to come back. Rollin Smoke deserves more of my visits.

I brought a friend in today for dinner. It was her first time, so she spent a few minutes to look at the wall-sized menu. I also found myself staring and trying to decide what to get. I wasn't feeling up to tackling a big portion today, so I didn't get the outstanding Outlaw Burger again. Instead, I went with the Catfish Po Boy ($8.99) and a dessert of Country Berry Cobbler (free with purchase of sandwich and Yelp check-in).

I spent some time nibbling on my friend's Dad's Favorite, which is actually a sandwich (and thus qualifies for the dessert, although we didn't know it at the time). The brisket, pork, and hot links were all pretty tasty, although my friend could have done without the hot links because she is even more heat-averse than I am. She definitely went for a soda refill at least once.

My po boy took upwards of 10 minutes longer to come out, which I felt was a good sign. It was worth it for that catfish. It was quite moist and flaky, properly seasoned, and lightly crunchy on the outside. The catfish was definitely the star. No complaints about the spicy and tartar sauces, which I ended up spreading all over the sandwich. Lettuce was fine, lemon was helpful, and tomato brought a nice lightness. Only thing I would have liked is if the bread was buttered or something. The bread was merely toasted, and it actually looked a bit burnt, but thankfully had none of that off-putting flavor.

The country berry cobbler actually came out at the same time as the po boy. Unfortunately, by the time I was ready for dessert, the whipped cream had died. I actually had the peach cobbler last time, and while I would probably take the peach if forced to choose one, the berry cobbler is also very good and has enough of a tartness to offset the sweetness. It was also still warm, since it was served in a foam bowl, but I'm thinking that it contributed to the downfall of the whipped cream. I'll have to remember to try to ask for a delayed dessert presentation if I do this again.

I noticed that at least 3 tables had people doing the AYCE, and that made me wish that I hadn't had lunch today. I definitely want to try the all you can eat option some time. I enjoy that sort of thing, and I would finally be able to get my hands on all of their meats at once. Maybe I'll be ready to bump it up to 5 stars on that day, but until then, I still highly recommend Rollin Smoke Barbeque to all lovers of meat - and catfish.

I'm not a bbq lover at all but I did enjoy the burnt end brisket.  My husband is a major bbq person coming from Houston TX so I had to ask him to get a true honest review.   He rated it a 6 out of 5 stars.   Definitely 100% better than Daves.  We called in our order.   Luckily we did because by the time we got there, they ran out of almost everything. .. and this was at 5:00 pm.  The sauce they give I believe is adequate for the amount we ordered.   Just in case,  we ordered more but ended up not needing to use it.   My hubby is also a big time spicy eater so we ordered a side of their spicyest sauce and he said it was hella spicy.  I loved the collard greens as the side.  Like I said,  I'm not a bbq person but this place earns the best I've tried.

Absolutely amazing!!  Hands down the best bbq in Vegas and the best I've had outside of Texas.  This is TRUE bbq, you can tell they don't just slather bbq sauce on the meat and call it barbecued. You can taste the smokiness in the meat and it's unbelievably tender. There were 3 of us and we got the all you can eat so we were able to try a bunch of items on the menu:  chicken, brisket, pulled pork, hot links, spare ribs, baby back ribs, beef ribs, mac n cheese, coleslaw, fried okra, banana pudding, berry cobbler, and a root beer float.

The highlights were definitely the ribs. The spare ribs and baby backs were my FAVORITE things we tried. Spare ribs had a bit more kick and spice, and the baby backs were juicier and fattier (in a delicious, perfect way). The beef rib was also delicious - not to mention the biggest rib I've ever seen - but very rich and filling. The coleslaw was excellent to cut the richness, sweetness, and smokiness of the meal, and the fried okra was simple and perfect. Mac n cheese was also great (I totally judge a bbq place on hthe quality of their mac n cheese... ie Big Ern's at Container Park sucks). Brisket wasn't thrilling, but I admit I like my brisket with a little fat on it and this was quite lean.

The prices are insanely good, cheaper than Famous Daves or Lucilles, and the food is better! We got AYCE but would've been fine sharing the Pit Special, Rib Platter, & adding a couple beef ribs - which is basically exactly what we ordered, except we paid more because we chose AYCE and they added extra to the platter, which we didn't need and had quite a bit leftover. Also the service is awesome, they genuinely care if you're enjoying the food. The entire experience was great!  I can't wait to go back and try other things on the menu, I have my eye on the collard greens, loaded mash potatoes, and "bbq parfait!"

Slow service and the food is a little bland and no smokey flavor what so ever. However the pork was very tender. The bbq sauces were good. This place does not deserve the 4.5 stars. Its not that good.

Decided last minute to try this place before work, first time and will definitely not be the last! The owner was very welcoming and accommodating. The menu is very diverse with lots of options for everyone. 

The barbecue sundae with your choice of meat (I chose brisket) was extremely flavorful and had a great balance. The barbecue nacho fries also with your choice of meat was BOMB!! Words cannot describe how delicious it was.

Very impressed by this restaurant! Will definitely be back soon!!

Wow! Eating it as I type! Awesome taste, portions, and customer service. We got beef ribs, rib tips, and greens are they were all so delicious! Liezel had awesome customer service and the food was great! Would recommend to anyone looking for good BBQ!

Great find during a quick stop in Las Vegas. Affordable, quick and excellent. Stopped by around 9 on a Saturday night. Family of 4 shared the 4 meat plate. Added a side of corn nuggets, they were amazing! Good Mac and cheese. Loaded Mashed Potatoes are to die for.

Daaaaang, so good!!! My husband is from Texas and we have to frequent local BBQ joints when we travel. This is one of THE best we've ever been, topping over many of the so called famous spots in Texas. We had the brisket three ways, along with a side of fried okra and Mac n' cheese. All five stars. This was the first time we had ever been to this spot, but the five star service could also not be ignored. Locals were giving employees hugs, and we must've been asked 3-4 times how we were enjoying our food. Dusty kept bringing people samples of other meats to try. We heard that they have recently teamed up with the Pawn Star guys to open another location. Smart men!! We will be back!!!
Mr. V from San Antonio.  Great service and killer bbq.  Great food all around.  Can't wait to go back!
There food is so EXPENSIVE and quite frankly not worth the price.  The sides that come with the combo are 4ounce servings.  I ordered the 5meat/3 sides combo and with tax came up to $30.

You can easily missed this spot even though it's just off the strip. It's in this dingy little corner lot that no one cares to notice.

Not going to deny but I had high hopes and it was sort of a let down. We had the Pit Special 5 Meats 3 Sides. While the flavors are good it was barely lukewarm. And why would you chop up the brisket? More like scraps to me. All jokes aside.  The menu did indicate it is served chopped unless otherwise requested. Again, who notices that? Shouldn't it just be mentioned when you order upfront? I personally think they just want to get rid of their scraps as obviously captured in my photo.

The sides are pretty sorry. The waffle fries is nothing more than criss cross fries. Cheesy mac and cheese was not only cold but the worst I had. The yams is more of a dessert.

Tip: Ask for their special spicy sauce. It is so damn good! Skip the regular bbq sauce and vinegar out in the open.
Bomb barbecue!!!! They'll even com out to your event. This is good ole finger lickin good barbecue!!!!

Hands down, the best barbecue I've ever had. As their motto speaks "we rub our meat" and you can tell by the amount of flavor it in. The meat was moist and yet had a nice crust. I loved the vinegar based sauce that went well with the wonderfully cooked meats. 

My husband had. The three rib combo, and the meat was tender. Not exactly falling off the bone, but came off the bone cleanly, which I prefer. 

The portions were ample and I would definitely return.

This is da bomb for BBQ in Vegas and what's even better it's not packed full of tourists yet very close to the strip.  Don't be afraid of the office park feeling, get in and get down and bone greasy with some tasty sauce....I'd recommend the brisket. YUM

Oh and bring your appetite, portions are solid.

I was in need of some good bbq, then all of a sudden I smell this place. So I stopped by staff was very upbeat n happy to take my order. Delicious n juicy the taste was superb can't deny it this place is damn good. All I have to complain about was the lack of bbq for my ribs besides that great place!!!

Huge fan of this place, but not of its beef brisket sandwich.

Not sure why they have opted to serve chopped beef brisket instead of sliced. The chopped variety has way too much in the way of questionable ingredients like grizzle and fat, even some bones.

Their barbecue is so good that it's hard to understand why they have opted not to serve sliced brisket sandwich. This would be a huge improvement and worth at least one more star.

UPDATE: Decided to head back to Rollin Smoke for some BBQ on a weeknight.  Got there around 8:10 pm on a Thursday night and they were CLOSED! 

CLOSED? at 8 pm?  WTH?  This is VEGAS, not Arkansas.  Dang hillbillies. 

One star demotion for lack of awareness of their market.

Now less be honest down right dirty dank BBQ is tough to find in Vegas. But this place has cured my babay back bluezz, and thank you baby jesus for it! This is where its at. We ordered the brisket pulled, ribs, and baked beans with a side of corn bread. Often times with BBQ the meat can be cold or be tough because it has been sitting for a while; this was not the case. It was absolutely finger lickin' delicious.  The ribs are incredible don't  waste your time beating around the bush go for the gold and this ribs are it. I recommend the Sweet Carolina BBQ Sauce, it was my favorite. The corn bread is light like and angel cake texture almost, its surprisingly scrumptious it really soaks ups the other foods well. I'm thrilled to finally have found  my local BBQ in town.

Wow!  This place is awesome.  I was originally introduced to it when they were serving it for the free lunch offered at my favorite strip club (Little Darlings).  Anyways, went to the restaurant and it was even better!   Had the shrimp + mac and cheese + waffle fries.  All excellent.  Quick service.  10% locals discount and excellent friendly staff and a cashier who could explain the menu well.  Overall, A+!!!
Fantastic food and fantastic people. Met their pit master and he let us try practically everything! Their pecan pie was Divine!!!
First visit tonight and holy hell it was good...if you need me, I'll be passed out in the sofa.

we went there for lunch today had 3 meat tro and ala cart white meat chicken.
first there sauce is awe full 2 the meat doesnt have a smokey flavor at all brisket uck! spare ribs tuff and no flavor, chicken bland and flavorless tasted boiled.
 Only things that were edible were  the hot links and the potato salad was dank. hands down worst bbq Ive ever had   bar none

On our last visit to Las Vegas we decide to try Rollin Smoke BBQ.  We arrived at around 6PM and they were already out of brisket.  It is what I use as a benchmark for BBQ so I can only provide feedback based on what we had.  We opted for the Baby back ribs and the beef ribs.  Overall the food was great.  I would certainly recommend the beef ribs.  They were fantastic and meaty.  The service was prompt.  This is a dive so don't expect a fabulous setting, but we knew that going in.  The staff were very friendly and the place was packed.

We got the Pit Special that came with 5 meats and 3 sides. All the meats were mediocre with the exception of the pulled pork which was actually really good. The sides we got were the waffle fries, loaded mash, and bbq beans. The waffle fries were tasty and seasoned well with a nice, crisp exterior. The loaded mash isn't worth it, they tasted like instant mash potatoes which it probably was. Also the baked beans weren't that great either. Lastly, usually if the meat isn't great the sauce makes up for it but not this time. I did like that there were a variety of sauces to choose from but they weren't that great and some of them kind of tasted similar.

This is by far the best BBQ ever!  We all had something different and everything was outstanding.  Tough decision but I got the meatloaf that was on the travel channel. Amazing!!  My son had the three meats and everything was amazing. 

Super friendly staff. Oh, the macaroni and cheese was the best I ever had.  I told them I will be waiting anxiously when they open one in Chicago.  

Don't mind the location or the ambience. Just great BBQ!

I made my son bring this home for me On the plane. They pkg to go!!!

Best BBQ in Vegas/ everywhere 
I am from Texas and this BBQ is better! 
You have to try the bacon Potato salad, co slaw, mashed potatoes! We get the pick 3 meat chicken, sausage and pork ribs fall off the bone.
Sweet tea taste like its from Texas! 
Eat here if you want amazing BBQ!

Wow, close to 400 reviews and I only heard about this place recently? How did I miss this? But then again, I rarely find myself driving on Highland Drive, which mainly seems to be a business district with strip clubs. Anyway, I'll try to keep it short and sweet. 

This place is all about the sides, I absolutely love them! I secretly think they are even better than the meat, LOL! My favorites so far are:

Cheesy Mac N Cheese - very creamy cheese sauce, and they top it off with even more (shredded) cheese!
Corn Bread - always hot and fresh! I love how they put a good amount of butter on them and are not dry! 
Corn Nuggets - one of the employees suggested that we try this, and I'm glad we did. Creamy corn on the inside. Crispy goodness on the  outside. Great with ketchup, A MUST TRY!
Kicken Beans - I don't eat beans (unless they are soybeans), but my husband and friends have said that this was delicious. 

The one side I was not crazy about were the waffle fries. They were soggy and cold the one time I had ordered them. 

OK, OK, the meats are pretty good too. My husband and I shared The Pit Special and I did like the brisket and pulled pork. Both were juicy, tasty, and cooked perfectly. Their barbecue sauce is good, but a bit tangy. I still say it's all about the sides! :P The employees are very friendly. They walk about asking if you enjoy the food and if you are happy. Drinks, utensils, condiments and to go containers are all self-serve. 

Sometimes they can get crazy busy, where the line is out the door. You know what they say, the hole in the wall places are the best! I'm glad we found this spot, I think they have the best barbecue in town!

Four of us stopped here for lunch after hiking yesterday.  This has been bookmarked for a long time so I was glad we were going here.

We ordered on the right side where you enter and then waited at a table on the more dining room side.  I ordered the meat trio with pork, ribs, and hot link.  I also showed them my Yelp check in offer for a free pudding with a sandwich which they honored even though I didn't order a sandwich.  Since the trio is more expensive, I guess it doesn't matter.

I could tell from the time we walked in that they did their own smoking.  The place is heavy with the smell of smoke.  In fact, the first thing I did when I got home was to change my shirt.

The trio of meats was OK.  The pork was lukewarm at best and was dry.  It needed their BBQ sauce.   Two of us had gotten that and both were the same so there was something not right with the heating in the kitchen.  The meat fell off the ribs and was very good.  I'm surprised I liked them as much as I did.  The hot link was also good.  As a side I got the kicken beans but there was nothing these beans were going to kick.  They were just normal baked beans with some spice.

The banana pudding was OK.  It was nothing special and I'm sure it comes from some kind of bulk make your own package.  The serve yourself soda was great.  I was really thirsty after the hike and I went back and refilled several times.

I guess I sealed the deal yesterday and realized I'm really not a BBQ person.  Lunch was OK but it's nothing that I would crave nor go out of my way to get again.

Excellent! Ordered the 20 dollar four meats and three side combo! It was delicious! For a three dollar up charge you can get the best part of the brisket! Holy smokes! This was finger and plate licking good! A must if you are in vegas!

I asked the guy who took our order what was most popular. He gave us a rundown of the menu and boasted that they were the best BBQ restaurant in Vegas. I thought, "that's quite a big claim..."
Since my boyfriend and I were Rollin Smoke virgins, we decided to go all in for our first time and ordered the pit special (5 meats + three sides) to get a taste of everything.. WOW I don't think I've really been eating BBQ all my life.
My boyfriend stated that the ribs were the best he's ever had. The brisket was SO GOOD it makes me wish that cows weren't methane machines. Pulled pork came in a close third place to all the meats we tried, with the chicken last. Some parts were somewhat dry, and lacked flavor.
Sides were delicious too. Sweet, soft, and moist cornbread. Corn nuggets got boring to eat after a few bites. Don't get me started on the Mac n cheese though- I'd like to buy a gallon or two for me, myself, and I and eat myself into cheesy pasta oblivion. Best macaroni and cheese I've ever had. It has been on my mind since I came here last. 
I've seriously been missing out. And you are too if you haven't tried Rollin Smoke. 
You're right, guy. Best BBQ in Vegas.
The only reason I'm giving this place a four star is because there is no bar. The food is really good and it's a nice causal restaurant. It's a good place for a family meal.
BBQ in the desert done right. Rollin Smoke kills it with properly smoked goods. Try the smoked meatloaf....it'll change your life!

Located within the dark shadows of las vegas. The only bright lights in that neighborhood are from the strip clubs, and outside that, complete urban waste land consumed by darkness.

However, the food shines bright! Especially the World Famous Meat Loaf!! Sooo soft that u cant distinguish the meat from the mashed potato.  Just a delicious soft gooeyness that melts in your mouth.  The ribs are good too but I can say that I've had better ribs before.

Quite an experience, from the ambiance of the neighborhood to the melt in your mouth meat loaf.  But proceed with caution, I would have been quite nervous if there weren't the entire Las Vegas Police Department dining with us in the restaurant that day loll

The place smells like heaven.  Delicious BBQ.  A little off strip but it's worth the cab over

Check out the babybacks.

I want to give this place 5star but the cashier rolled her eyes at me as I asked her what she said because she was slurring her words.  Granted I'm sure it's been a long shift from her,  no reason to be prissy

Update:  The owner of the establishment got in touch with me and offered his apologies to the service issue I mentioned above.   I'm updating my rating to 5, and hope to go back next I'm in town.

I'm not into leaving reviews for places that I go to, but WOW. This place was without a doubt the best bbq I've ever had. If you are visiting from out of town, I definitely recommend taking the time out of your trip to stop by

Five Stars. Nuff said 
Everything these guys grill is straight fiyah. This is a must eat place while you're in Vegas.

Absolutely delicious! Well worth the ride, down by the strip. The ribs were cooks to perfection. The sliced meats were falling apart and perfect. Choices of sides, great verify. We will definitely be back, best BBQ in Vegas, hands down!!!

You really can't say nothing bad about this place.  Rolling smoke has amazing BBQ, friendly staff, and is reasonably priced.   The flavor of the smoked meats cannot be duplicated.  You can tell that tender care and love was put into every bite ;)

This place was recommended by a family member who aye here last week. Just got done running a 1/2 marathon and was looking for some protein. BBQ here we come! It was tough to pick one thing to get so we shared the pit plate. Pulled pork, tri-tip and ribs. Sides were Mac-cheese, greens, cole slaw and corn bits! Everything was so good. The smoke ring on the ribs were pure perfection and everything tasted great. They have this burger that is the size of a football and looks awesome, but it would take a REALLY big stomach or to be shared by two. 

It was too hard to find and it has lots of seating. Staff was awesome!!! Will return the next time we hit Vegas!

This bbq place is awesome.  I have to admit pulling up to it in a small shopping center in the middle of nowhere was a little odd, but once you open the door and enter the place, it's a whole different world.  The nicest people ever work here, the guys at the register that take your order are so friendly, the ones that bring out your food to your table and super friendly, nice people come here to eat, and everyone was happy and friendly.  The corn nuggets and yams are the best side dishes ever.  The ribs were good, the chopped brisket was delicious, links are spicy but good, great portions, great side dishes, perfect seating on large tables to accommodate big parties.  I will definitely come back when I visit Vegas again.  I don't always like the crowded restaurants in the casinos, so this place was great on a night that we arrived and were very casual and just wanted a quick bite.  Thanks Rollin Smoke, keep up the awesome work, great service, and yummy food.

This is my new favorite BBQ place.  My mom ordered the beef ribs.  I made the mistake of tasting the beef ribs first. Not only did I not eat the two meats on my plate, I ordered a full rack.  I had the pleasure of meeting the "smoke master" and his quote, description of the beef ribs was perfect.  Just as tender as a filet.  

The corn nuggets were excellent. Sweet tea was not too sweet.  I chatted with a couple who ordered the famous burger and the meatloaf.  The guy couldn't pick his favorite out of the two.  But the lady said the burger was a clear winner.  All I can say about the burger was this is the first time the real food looked better than the pictures.

The interior is not very large but large enough.  Service was excellent.   

Excellent job!

Ate lunch here during my stay in Vegas and was the best meal of my 9 day trip.  Little whole in the wall but delicious and reasonably priced food.  Authentic barbeque.  Packed to the rafters as the food is so fantastic it is understandably busy.  LOVED IT!!!  If I'm ever back in Vegas I will be back!!!

Great on many levels:

food quality
portion size
price
customer appreciation by staff

Im usually leary of fan favorite bb-q joints as mostly they r overcooked meat smoothered under gallons of sauce.  

Not at Rollin Smoke!  
here they present perfectly cooked/smoked meats that are moist and delicious.  

their homemade sauce, which u can add on the side, was delicious and sweet.

another plus:  no waiters.
self seating and clean up.

nice atmosphere inside.  

the only down-note is location:  its located under the highway.  another note of inprovement is that the bread the meal comes with, under the entree, should be toasted.

The brisket was good; i just wished they didnt chop it up.  

Ribs- best ever!

Enjoy.

Looking for something better than all the franchised spots, stop your search. Rolling Smokehouse is the bomb. Large servings, fair prices, great food. I ordered the 3 meat plate with beans and cornbread. All were outstanding but the beans even more so. My wife got the catfish plate...taste like my grandmas! Seasoned so well, fried to a crispy golden brown! Can't wait until my next trip!

Well from being raised in the south and going to school in Texas I like to think I know a little bit about good BBQ. This place in my opinion has the best BBQ in Vegas! Everything about it reminds me of a down home southern BBQ spot! I usually get the pulled pork sandwich aka the "Pulled Piggy" and every time I get it it's amazing and constant! If your in the mood for some good down home southern BBQ come check this place out!!

This review is on the food only because we took it togo.  I read all of the review and it seemed like a good bar b que restaurant.  We ordered the brisket, ribs, hot links, peach cobbler and the banana pudding.  I do not believe they gave the banana pudding the name of grandma's banana pudding, this didn't taste like any grandmas pudding I ever tasted (it was awful).  Everything we ordered was awful. If we stayed at the restaurant we would have sent everything back and got our money back.  We  ate a few bites and threw the rest of it in the trash.  This was a waste of my money since I spend about fifty dollars on the horrible food.
Ordered a mix of ribs, pulled pork, chicken, and sides for our party. Everything was fantastic. Haven't had BBQ this good since Texas.

This place is hands down the best BBQ food in Las Vegas. Seriously - I didn't know there was such a place until recently, and thank God I found it! The staff was polite, and the management very friendly. But most importantly, the food was amazing! 

I had the brisket 3 ways - you seriously should try that. Don't hesitate getting the cobbler, too.

I ate so much I couldn't walk afterwards. This is now bookmarked, and it's a favorite spot for my girlfriend & me! Nothing but good things to say about this place. Thanks!
The best BBQ I've had in a long time. My husband and I shared The Brisket Three ways, and it was moist and delish! Just wish we had room to try and eat more.

This place has the most yummy and the biggest variety of side dishes of any BBQ joint right now. I'm not a big rack of ribs kind of guy so my review doesn't really pertain to the ribs, I am a burger guy....The Outlaw burger is awesome and huge... There's spudtastic potato is good for a slightly lighter meal.
Best BBQ place I've been to! The brisket, ribs, rib tips, the greens and potatoes. I mean everything here is absolutely yummy! Must try it!!!
SOOO Delicious!! Visiting Vegas from San Diego and I'll be back for sure. Brisket is delicious and the corn nuggets so good. Definitely check it out! Friendly staff as well.

Just yum.  I wasn't in the mood for BBQ when I got here, but after sampling my boyfriend's plate, I changed my mind!  Service was pretty good, but seating can be a bit difficult to get at times.  Thankfully people go in and outta this joint relatively quick.  Will be back here again!

I was visiting town and wanted some good BBQ, and Rolling Smoke delivered. We got there just before the lunch hour rush, so we were the only ones in line (I was told that is a rare occurrence). Since I hadn't been before, the super helpful cashier gave us the run down, before we decided on a platter. On the platter there was ribs, pork, chicken, brisket, and hot links, and we got sides of mashed potatoes and slaw. Everything was awesome! We left so full. I was so satisfied that I stopped for lunch again on my way out of town. Will for sure be eating here every time I'm in town.

Tried Rick's Rollin Smoke at the PAWN PLAZA. 725 Las Vegas Blvd tonight! The BBQ and the service are over the top! I had the duo, burnt ends & pork ribs...the best ever! Side of the Mac&cheese was awesome...and I had to get their BBQ beans to go..great value for the price. Quality and quantity. Hubby had the Big sandwich with a side of Mac&cheese and a craft beer. He loved it. We will be going back!

Hungry after hanging at Velveteen Rabbit, a bunch of Yelpers headed over to Rollin Smoke (sorry I got a very patient Tom F lost: but in my defense, there are lots of tittie bars in that area!) Even as a sometime vegetarian/full time pescetarian, the smell from the car park smokers was intoxicating. 

One could say the air was moist with flavors...Huh?!?! Ya had to be there. They do have moist towelettes which I grabbed (forgetting the crew I was with) for post feast clean up. 

They were out of greens and the fish and okra were deep fried (will try another day) so I opted for the yams, jalapeño slaw and baked beans: the latter has some type of meat in it, tried my best to pick it out, but veggies be aware. They also had Smoked Tabasco on the table = went right into my moist jalapeño slaw! Love hot sauce :)) 

Service was very friendly and checked on us frequently - even one of the owners! The unsweetened fresh brewed tea was delicious. Nibbled a piece of corn bread and all of the carnivores loved their bones, pulled pork, smoked meatloaf etc...Misti gave the Southern gal stamp of approval to the okra. 

Still offering dessert with Yelp check in and the banana pudding looked old school divine, and moist!  Can't wait to come back and try more options and bring carnivore friends. I'm sure they will appreciate the moist delicious meat! There may not be "Sex in the Champagne Room" next door, but there's terrific down-home eats till 1:30AM on weekends, guaranteed!!!

Yelp 100 Challenge

Ed. Note: the word "moist" was used in this review many times because one should never share phobias/words that creep you out etc with Yelpers and expect to remain unscathed (in a good natured way :)))

Like a pimp, Rollin Smoke BBQ is whoring out their entire menu for $24.99.  That's right....You ever walk into a BBQ joint and want to try everything on the menu?  Well here you can.  I wish I would have noticed that before I ordered.  Just the $28 rack of baby backs would have made it worth my while to do the all you can eat.  Smoked Meatloaf sounds awesome, and the burgers looked great too.  You can bet I will be back to try them on my next Vegas trip.  

Truth be told, I should most likely give this place 4 stars, just based on what I ate.  The pulled pork was kind of a let down for me.  Not much sauce mixed in with it, I found it kind of flavorless, and not smokey at all.  However the sauce on the table added a much needed zing and saved it - 3 stars.  The brisket was better and had a nice smoke ring to it as well as a dry rub.  It was sliced in thick slices how I prefer it - 4 stars  http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/rollin-smoke-barbeque-las-vegas?select=dTv25Jp39MplokBxlgRkkg#0Lk8zyIUqCEMxyYmpGMTyg

The baby back ribs were the best of the three meats that I tried.  They had a nice bark to it, but still fell off the bone.  There were plenty of meat on these ribs and it was clear they were slowly smoked and had a great hickory flavor to them.  Ribs are always the main test of BBQ for me and these baby backs clearly passed the test and are darn good - 4.5 stars http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/rollin-smoke-barbeque-las-vegas?select=dTv25Jp39MplokBxlgRkkg#fSy8vbKrCQuI8Sgv8I5qmA

For the sides we tried the bacon potato salad, the kicken beans, the mac 'n cheese, and some sliced pickles.  The pickles were very good and had a nice vinegary flavor to them.  It's clear they will stand out well on any of their sandwiches.  Tasted exactly like the large dill pickles you get at Disney, in case you need that for a reference.  The kicken' beans, lived up to their name and had some spice to them along with a good peppery flavor.  There were some shards of brisket added in for some smokey flavor.  I personally prefer sweeter southern baked beans, but for some reason those are hard to get outside of the south.  Bacon potato salad, could have had more bacon in it as I couldn't really find any in there.  I still enjoyed it and it had a texture of a smashed potato salad.  The clear star of the show was the mac 'n cheese.  Some of the best I've had, it's very cheesy and creamy.  I don't see myself ever coming here without getting a bowl of it.  http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/rollin-smoke-barbeque-las-vegas?select=dTv25Jp39MplokBxlgRkkg#ph5LXQhF8FkZ-8nd6jVSfw

Although we were plenty stuffed, I noticed a free dessert with check in.  All the desserts sounded great, but we went with the banana pudding.  No matter how full you get, for some reason, you can always manage a little banana pudding.  It just kind of slides down.  Rather than vanilla wafers it was more of a swirl of vanilla crust in the pudding.  It was ok, but I think I would try another dessert next time - 3.5 stars. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/rollin-smoke-barbeque-las-vegas?select=dTv25Jp39MplokBxlgRkkg#B-ruv_7a2ibeC_2NaLAEWw

I love the vibe of this place, it's clear these are men living their dream.  The toys they have to play with in the parking lot are impressive, all kinds of mobile smokers and dressed up cars and trucks with their logo painted all over it.  It's like the bat cave of BBQ.  Holy Smoke Batman....To the Rollin' Smokemobile Robin!  And just like that they are on the move to provide smokey BBQ goodness wherever hungry folk most need them.  Also make sure you visit their party room and you will find a fun pig shaped fish tank that looks like a BBQ smoker.  Look inside and rather than coral you have all kinds of smoked meats for the fish to swim with.  Hit the button and smoke even comes out of the top of the tank.  Apparently this tank was featured on Animal Planet's show - Tanked. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/rollin-smoke-barbeque-las-vegas?select=dTv25Jp39MplokBxlgRkkg#QMwyRQhoijuHeKKEaQLoeA

http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/rollin-smoke-barbeque-las-vegas?select=dTv25Jp39MplokBxlgRkkg#VrpJ5wb8xPouU_LyfaecEw

Food was ok.  Had pulled pork and brisket.  Pork was real fatty.  Kids had the ribs.  Wife had the chicken.  Place gets pretty busy.  Crowded seating area during those times and tough parking.  Be careful you don't get your car towed.

*Military discount* 

Went on Saturday 2-20-16 at 5pm.  This restaurant is located in the dark seedy underbelly of Desert Inn & the 15, surrounded by strip clubs and industrial yards.  We actually came here one time before but it was dark and we were scared of the area so we went somewhere else.  We're fraidy cats! I'm glad we gave it a second chance.  

$18.91 got us a two meat combo and an additional side of corn nuggets.  For my two meat combo I chose chicken and pork, and chose mac & cheese for my side.  The combo comes with a drink in a cute re-usable cup.  

They do have one high chair for the kiddos.  The ambiance is casual, staff is friendly, and there's more seating than you'd think from looking at the outside.  It was a little cleaner than I was expecting but not much.  

The chicken was juicy, tender, smoky, and wonderful.  The pork....oh deer sweet 8 lb. 10 oz. baby jesus that pork is somethin' else.  It will melt in your mouth.  And their house bbq sauce is perfectly sweet and tangy.  The mac & cheese is made with perfectly cooked cavatappi and swimming in runny cheesy goodness.  The corn nuggets were served hot and fresh.  

Next time I wanna try the catfish, collard greens, and banana pudding!!!

Since this restaurant was featured on The Travel Channel as one of the best BBQ restaurants in the US, we decided to give it a try.  It was very quaint and felt like a 1940's family BBQ place.  Our order was taken by a charming young man of maybe 10-12 years old.  I ordered the BBQ meatloaf because that was the dish highlighted on The Travel Channel.  It was a very large portion and OK but I wouldn't order it again.  My wife ordered "burnt tips" the ends of BBQ brisket) which the owner said was very popular.  It was also OK but nothing to rave about.  My son (a sous chef at The Cosmopolitan in Las Vegas) ordered ribs which he liked.  

A lady at the next table ordered a hamburger which came with an 8 inch stack of fried onions wedged into the bun by a long stick.  It was clever and looked pretty good and I overheard her say she really liked it.    

The bill was over $75 which I felt was very high for what we ordered and for a counter-service BBQ restaurant.  

We lived in the BBQ belt in NC for 30 years so we are very picky when it comes to BBQ.  Unfortunately, this place doesn't measure up.

I doubt we will be back.

When in Vegas gotta stop thru Rollin Smoke Barbeque joint over the strip. Small but very friendly. The food spokes for its self. The corn nuggets melt in your mouth, the beef ribs are juice, the rub are smokey. The mac and cheese was cheesy and peppery which is different. The country girl is a mustard based sauce that was everything.. Love it!

Who would've ever expected legit Southern BBQ a 5 minute drive from the strip? The owner must be from Arkansas since the place is covered in Razorbacks stuff. This place would be right at home back in the South. The ribs were smoked just right and were excellent but weren't fall off the bone tender. The chopped brisket was lean and tender with a little bit of a peppery flavor. I was happy to see they have fried okra and it was just right. The beans were tasty as well and have a peppery flavor that's kinda unique and i haven't seen that before. The tea is the real thing and goes perfectly with a BBQ meal. Portions are HUGE and I was barely able to finish my meal. I'll be back here and it's a must try for BBQ fans in Vegas.

Full ratings because not only was the food awesome, but the owner gave my dog beef bones and offered to get him water as well. He was really personable and checked in on us frequently. Go here. Go here. Go here.
AMAZING! nondescript place we found by accident and they had SUCH friendly staff, cheap enormous piles of amazeballs food, and felt nothing like the artificial touristy stuff on the strip.

Yes, I finally rolled in to Rollin Smoke after the many raving reviews from my Yelp Peeps.  I am super WAY over due for this joint.  I do think I have told at least 15 people about this place since our visit last Saturday.  If that doesnt say how I feel about this place, how about the leftovers that I ate for breakfast the next day.  Yes, I must say this is simply (but not simply stated) the best BBQ I have ever EVER had.

Dont let the location fool you...its part of its finger lickin good charm and you cant beat the smell of pure goodness when you pull into the parking lot.  When we first arrived a couple was leaving voicing that they will be back next year - as they come here every year when they visit Vegas.  I think that says alot too.
...a must have for tourists too?!

We both ordered the sliders-both coming with 3 and you can pick what meat you want.  I had the chicken and the brisket while my man had the chicken, brisket and the hot link sliders.  He said the hot links were his favorite-IF there could even be a favorite.  All of it was totally fab.  For sides we had the waffle fries and the mac and cheese.  The waffle fries were sprinkled with a sweet and salty flavoring that I loved and I'm still craving and wont be satisfied until I have more.  The mac and cheese was super creamy.  I thought it was very good.  Alot of the times mac comes out all dry and coagulated.  Not the case here.  I could literally eat a big bowl of it and call it a day.  ***ehem But I wouldnt recommend it only because there is SO much more important things to savor.  Lets talk about the meat - yes their slogan is that they "rub their meat" and however you take it consider that some good lovin (hehe).  The meat is smokey and savory....meat with FLAVOR!  The sauce was perfect (not too sweet, not too thick)-and Im very picky about sauce.   The portions were so huge.  I'm sure the guy thought I was not sure what I was getting into when I ordered the 3 sliders.  I brought home 1 1/2 that was leftover and like I said I think I must have been dreaming about it all night because I did have to dig into that first thing the next morning.  As I opened the box all I could smell was the smokey heavenly goodness and I knew right then it was going to be a good day.

So yeah on Wednesday I was sat down and asked to not be mad.....hmmm yes my man went there for lunch without me.  And YES damn right I was mad.  LOL  Yes, peeps....it is JUST THAT GOOD.  I cannot wait to go back.  Well heck Ive already checked into the catering menu so I can order for my next party.  If you are looking for a winner.....this is IT.   

*side note...they are closed on Sundays.  :(

We drove down from Hurricane, Utah and had to try this place. This place did not dissapoint .For starters the corn bread is the best we have ever had! Period. It was light and not dry, didn't need any topping.The different meats, baby back ribs, pork ribs, beef ribs, pulled pork, brisket, and chicken were superb. the beans were spicy  and good. The sauce did have too much kick for us, so we left it off everthing. Can't wait to try something else next time. We talked to the owner, an Arkansaw young guy,, real down home freindly.

I started looking for barbecue in Las Vegas and had already bookmarked a few, but nothing looked like what I had in mind.  Then I stumbled on Rollin Smoke on Yelp and thought, this could be it.  Now the name Rollin Smoke has a completely different connotation if you're not thinking about smoked meat, but let's not go there.

Let's go to the 'cue.  What to get?  I read about smoked meatloaf, and the pictures look good, but hey, it's meatloaf.  You don't judge a barbecue place by the meatloaf.  You want brisket and you want ribs.  I was particularly interested in beef ribs, and they have them on the smoker here every day.  How about some pork ribs?  They have a rib platter with baby backs, spare ribs and a beef rib.  Add another beef rib for $6.  Sounds good, but too much for today.

The beef rib was just what I was looking for.  Thick and meaty, dark with smoke on the outside, and juicy and fork tender inside.  Just pull gently and it releases from the bone with a puff of steam and meat juices rolling down to the plate.  The meat is seasoned, but not overdone.  There's some rub and some smoke flavor, but it's not dominant.  You can really taste the meat.  Barbecue sauce is offered, but with meat this good, who needs it?

Spareribs were also terrific, again partly because they are nice and thick.  They have good texture and are juicy and moist, with good smoke flavor and seasoning.  Baby backs were a little disappointing, still tender, but a little drier, and at least on this day, didn't stack up to the flavor of the spareribs and beef.  

There are two dining rooms inside and a few tables outside.  The store is just a few blocks off the strip, just on the other side of I-15.  Parking can be tough, but come between the lunch hour and the dinner hour and there's no trouble.  Who doesn't like linner?  Staff was friendly and helpful, joking and laughing, and made a point to come around to all the tables to check on everyone to see how they liked their barbecue. 

There are plenty of sides, and I had the corn fritters.  Folks rave about them.  They're good.   They're fried nuggets of batter encapsulating some sweet corn kernels, but I was here for the ribs, and was not disappointed.  I'll be back again for the brisket and some burnt ends.

After hearing the hype for the past couple years and seeing this place featured on TV, I was really excited to come sample some delicious Q, especially since the line to eat at Caesar's buffet was 7 hours long. The Q here isn't sauced and tends to run a little on the drier side, relying primarily on dry rub and smoke for flavor, but they have a variety of sauces to moisturize your meat. We ordered a little of everything, here's the breakdown:

Spareribs: probably one of the better meats here, it's a little dry but with solid rub seasoning, decently flavorful.
Pulled pork: my favorite meat option, probably because it was the right balance of smoke and natural pork flavor, appropriately tender.
Baby back ribs: too dry, more than a bit of a letdown.
Smoked chicken: we got white meat, so the dry theme continues. My lady friend said it basically had no flavor, I didn't think it was actually fairly decent.
Brisket: could be more tender, and not nearly as seasoned as the other meats.
Hot links: essentially smoky and spicy kielbasa, not bad but nothing earth shattering
Burger: this may have been the highlight between me and my lady friend, they use a combo of smoked brisket with ground beef to make the patty so the burger has a depth of flavor that you wouldn't otherwise typically expect. It's practically impossible to eat without a knife and fork given the mountain of onion strings on top, but that's not really a serious complaint.
Mac and cheese: nothing special, a little on the watery side, needs some seasoning.
Corn nuggets: these things are like crack, I could eat these all day. Not nearly as creamy in the center as ones I've had in the past, but the sweetness and textured crispiness are on point.
Corn bread: I want to say the bottom is soaked in a light honey syrup, fairly moist, I'd consider it a win.

We walked out with nearly 2/3rds of our food as leftovers, which is probably better for my health but a bit of a disappointment since it means I didn't try to gorge myself to exploding. I don't know if this is the best that Vegas has to offer for Q, but I'll probably hold off on coming back here unless my friends really feel the need to satisfy their smoked meat cravings the next time we're in town.

Not bad, but the wait was fairly long, given the number of people in the restaurant. The brisket simply didn't have the delicious fat cap and smokiness that I associate with the better briskets I've had (see Blue Smoke in NY). That being said, the place was packed at lunch, so they must be doing something right. The barbecue sauce had a nice tang to it, and the caramel cake was a little on the sweet side but still tasty.

Came here with the wife and a buddy in town from England.  He was craving BBQ since you can't get anything good over the pond.  I had the brisket and it was pretty good.  The greens were excellent and so were the mashed potatoes were also good.  Wife had pulled pork and said it was better than any other place in town (except mine).  She enjoyed the good bark on it.  Buddy had a four meat platter and loved all of it.  The quarter chicken had really good flavor.  The BBQ sauce on the table was just so so.  Would rather come here than Dave's or Memphis BBQ.

I've had BBQ all over the Bay Area and in the South but this was the best I've ever had.

We had ribs, pulled pork, chicken and brisket.  I couldn't believe how moist everything was.  I didn't use the sauce because is was absolutely not needed.  Its a new "must stop" on our Vegas trips.

Soooo good at a phenomenal price. I could happily just eat sides at this place they were all very tasty: okra, potato salad, bbq beans. The brisket was my favorite, but the chicken and ribs were also great. The pork had great smokey flavor but wasn't very moist. It was the lighter meat which always seems to be less juicy no matter where you go but with a little sauce it was fine. Staff was exceptionally friendly and the decor was cheesy but fun & endearing.

I love this little spot. Everything about this place is good. The brisket and the smoked chicken are my favorite. Their homemade barbecue sauce is smoky and delicious. Their sides are also really good as well. Let me tell you something very important.. ALWAYS GET THE CORN NUGGETS. They are the most addicting thing ever. It's like fried creamed corn balls. Best balls you ever put in your mouth. Support this local business! They know how to make some delicious food.
Great food! The catfish and shrimp was tasty but my only complaint is the mashed potatoes tasted sour
Great food and super huge portions. It's almost impossible to finish any of their platters.

Rollin' Smoke really does deserve the praise they receive here.  Authentic southern BBQ and a first rate menu of sides.  I like their pulled pork and Brisket best.  The ribs are good but I don't think they're exceptional.

Even though I can't impress people with the awesome credential of being from Kansas City or Texas, I still recommend Rollin' Smoke if you like great BBQ and sides served in a genuine dive (next to a strip club and almost under an overpass).
Overrated. The short ribs were dry and tough. The chicken was flavorless.  However, the burger was pretty good and the brisket was good. The yams were also good.
Made our way off the strip to this gem based on a friends recommendation- so stoked I did!!! Incredible everything, do yourself a favor and go here. Love it!!!
Been here numerous times. Nothin fancy at the hole in the wall (actually two storefronts combined), but damn good BBQ and sides.

WHEN IN VEGAS, EAT AT ROLLIN SMOKE!. 

Holly cow this has to be the best damn MEATLOAF I have eaten at a BBQ place.
Its called the SMOKED MEAT LOAF 
it has ground pork and beef and I believe smoked brisket. It sits on a bed of mashed potatoes and topped with fried onions. 

Its was a perfect combination of flavors on every bite. You had chunks of different type of meats with the creaminess of the mash and the saltiness of the onions. I also got the mac and cheese(YUM!)

As for the BBQ, it being two boys from ARKANSA that opened up the place the bbq isn't your typical thick sauce type. It's more of a  RUNNY consistency FULL of flavor. 

The drinks are self serve and so are the sauces TRY THEM ALL!. 

Customer service. GREAT. I don't rate on CS but do provide it in order for you to know what you're getting yourself into.

CAN'T WAIT TO VISIT MY SISTER TO GO BACK AND TRY SOMETHING ELSE IN THE MENU.

I love their burnt ends. Their BBQ sauce isn't my preference, but I don't think their burnt ends need it. I tried a little bit of my daughter's ribs and they were good, even with Arkansas style sauce, but I doubt I'll ever order anything other than burnt ends for myself. I haven't tried any of their side dishes, because the burnt ends are too good to eat anything else when I'm there. The sides on the menu sound good though.

Our St. Louis ribs were fatty, but had great flavor.  The baby back ribs were very lean and almost tasted like pork loin.  We needed to hit it with a lot of sauce, otherwise they were too dry.  Speaking of the sauce, it was pretty decent, but it's a little spicy for my taste.  I think they should offer a regular in addition to the spicy sauce.  The pulled pork was average at best and was more like chunky pork.  The texture and flavor profile wasn't quite right.  The brisket was fairly bland as well.  Either they had an off night, or their meat supplier let them down.  The service and staff really delivered, however.  They were friendly and helpful.  I had much higher hopes for their BBQ based on the reviews.  Their pie and ice cream rocked.  Overall, a bit of a bummer.  I had hoped for 5 star grub.

This place is Great it's been featured on multiple tv shows.... And for good reason ... They have an all u can't eat option that is worth the money and way better than a buffet ... The beef rib had a great flavor and was way meatier than I've ever seen b4...the meatloaf was my other favorite it is triple smoked and u can definitely taste it... It came on mashed potatoes with home made French onions on top ... Besides the food the customer service was fantastic ... Our waiters name was Mitch he made our expierience fun and made sure we tried all the best items... He also told us how some of it was done but made sure not to give up the secret recipes of spices used to do it ... I will defiantly return again!!!!!

The best BBQ that I have ever tasted and I love me some BBQ!  Our family travels a lot and I try to sample BBQ where ever we go and this was hands down the best so far.  I come to Las Vegas a few times a year because my friends and I drag race so this will definitely be on my list of food places that I must eat at before going back home to Los Angeles, CA.

Was looking for a burger, found this. This is a new must go-to place every time I return to Vegas.  I wanted to keep eating and come back again but we were heading out of town.  So super yum I can't even explain it.  Odd little space, but not important once you taste the food!  Really wish they had a place in the San Diego area.

We used to come here all the time but with the ridiculous price increases, it's not worth it anymore. The bbq is good, but not $50 for lunch for two people good. And I even skipped the $3 fountain drink.

Really good BBQ in Las Vegas served here. A bit off the beaten path, but not far from the strip and pretty easy to get to from the highway (15). Family owned it seems, friendly service. 

I like the menu a lot. Decent mac & cheese, slaw, and other sides, and interesting items like wraps, stuffed with meat and other fixings. There's even fried fish if you're in the mood, and yes, it's just as tasty as the meat. The prices are reasonable, and the wait is never too long, even on busy days. I started eating here every time I needed my BBQ fix - check it out.

The food was good. I wasn't a fan of the seating area. It was awkward that the line at lunch time went around the tables of people sitting down eating. The group I was in sat in the other room which is outside the restaurant area and in another room. 4 stars for the food and 2 stars for the seating.

If you like smokey awesomeness then this place is for you.  The best spare ribs I've  had in ages.   The sauce is very tasty with just the right amount of kick.  We had dinner there tonight and it was great.  The owners are very friendly and accommodating.  There is nothing fancy or pretensions about this place -- just solid BBQ at reasonable prices and a quick 15 min walk back to the strip.

I'm primarily interested in ribs when I visit a BBQ spot and usually do not visit a place if I don't see smoke and can't smell BBQ from about a block away.  There is a big pit on the side of the building but I got close to it and it wasn't hot, not even warm so it was obvious that it had not been used that day.  I have also noticed that "BBQ" places that serve things like nachos, seafood and meatloaf usually have bad BBQ.  I saw excellent reviews here so I decided to give this place a shot.

I ordered the two meat duo with spare ribs and links.  Took forever, about 25 minutes, they should be able to get food out faster, especially if the food is not cooked to order.  The ribs were OK, very little flavor, rather bland, the links tasted like spicy hot dogs.  I also don't understand the green onions.  I've never, ever seen that on BBQ but as I looked around they were on everything.

I'm still on my quest to find decent BBQ west of Texas, doesn't look like it's gonna happen.  I've had BBQ at a gas station in Texas that is better than anything I've found in Cali or Nevada.
I love their Outlaw Burger! I always take my friends out of town here and they all love it.  Weird location, but awesome food.

awesome spot for Real BBQ , met these guys when they first started a few years back, these guys are good businessmen but the food really sells itself, unlike most mainstream places out here this stuff it's the real deal n they take alot of pride in there cooking, always busy in there but it doesn't take too long to get your order even still, beef ribs , corn nuggets, bbq sundae!, yams!

Rolling Smoke is easily the best BBQ in Vegas! The "Biggin - Dad's Favorite" is the best BBQ sandwich I have ever had. Layers of flavor with hot link, then pulled pork, and then topped with amazing brisket. I slather on the homemade BBQ for an otherworldly eating experience. Get the baked beans, fried okra, and cornnugget sides for that authentic southern BBQ experience. 
The family begs me to take them back almost every night - this place is worth the effort to find. AWESOME!

The restaurant is in a very odd industrial area near auto shops, strip clubs and warehouses, and is probably the only one in the area. You walk in to a haphazard restaurant with not much of a front counter, but instead a confusing podium to order at with no one standing there most of the time. The menu is on a wall kind of near this podium, so you better know what you want before you walk over to order. There are a handful of two, four and large top tables between the two awkwardly cramped rooms of this place, sparsely decorated with a few down lights and some reclaimed wood on the walls. You can tell it was thrown together cheaply, but it seems to fit with the homegrown feel of backyard BBQ. The great smell of smoke fills the space the whole time you sit there, and never really fades away while you're there or from your clothes when you leave.

The menu features pretty much all the standards you would expect from a BBQ joint, but as I said I was suckered into ordering their Outlaw Burger: brisket, onion, bell pepper, onion strings, red cabbage slaw, lettuce, tomato, cheddar cheese and chipotle aioli. I'm skeptical of any BBQ place that can't get sweet tea right, so I was nervous about this thing given the somewhat flavorless tea I sat with while waiting for my burger to arrive. And what came out was just too big to enjoy; the patty alone is a thick mass of meat that's possibly a bit overcooked just because of its size and how long it has to cook. The bun was far too small and thin to hold up to this mess, even with a decent helping of lettuce at the bottom to create a buffer from any sauce. Probably the best flavor in this whole thing were the onion rings, which tasted far better on their own than in the burger where they got lost in the myriad of flavors. The huge glob of cheese had good flavor, but like most other things in this burger there was just a bit too much of it. As for the aioli, slaw and other items, I couldn't really tell you much because I didn't notice them enough. I think if this were your typical 1/4 or 1/3 pound burger it would probably be pretty good, still a far cry from the best burger in Vegas as they've claimed, but maybe in the upper half. But like my recent complaints about a huge burger in San Diego, this is just too much to properly enjoy.

Something extremely puzzling and disappointing for me was the complete lack of fries with my burger. Looking at their menu online now, apparently the $8.99 "smoking deal" for the Outlaw Burger is a deal for just the burger, you have to read the small print at the bottom where it says to add $3 for a side and drink. I wish the guy that took my order would have said something as I spent $2 for just my iced tea expecting the fries that were in the picture with my burger. What burger doesn't get ordered with fries?! I guess maybe one of this size, as I surely wouldn't have been able to finish it if I ate anything else, but fries are almost always a necessity. For $11.88 I certainly got a lot of food, but I don't know if it was worth the cost or stomach bomb. I have a feeling that you should stick to the true BBQ that this place is known for, and not their "best burger". I know I'll be back to test this theory.

I currently live in Dallas, so BBQ is everywhere, good and bad. I didn't think I'd be hitting up a BBQ place in Vegas on my last trip out, but we saw the reviews and were nearby (I had to at least go see the cat show at the Riviera), so we squeezed in. The layout of the restaurant was a little disorienting upon entry, given the vast light/dark difference from outside to inside. They have a huge menu on the wall, or printed menus you can take and look at. Order at the counter/cash register/stand thing. They have lots of specials/combos where you get a fountain drink (self serve, with refills), a side, and a main (sandwich, wrap, salad, or just meat by the 'slab'). I was feeling obese that day, so I got a salad with pulled chicken, the cole slaw, and a cornbread. All three things were amazing. My companions had half a smoked chicken which was just ridiculously juicy and smokey. The rest of the crew got brisket sandwiches (pile of brisket on a hotdog/small hoagie bun), mac n' cheese, and beans. The mac n' cheese wasn't met with much enthusiasm given the runniness of the cheese sauce and the firmness or thickness of the type of noodle used. The beans were described as 'kickin' by both the owner and the one at my table eating them, so I imagine that was a good thing. Overall, I will definitely be back here for more BBQ when I'm in Vegas. The food was just too good to not go back.

I love this place. It is the best BBQ place in Las Vegas. Everything on their menu is delicious and cooked to perfection. Staff is very friendly  and seems to be family owned & operated. I would recommend stopping by Rolling Smoke BBQ if you are looking to taste authentic BBQ.

Usually when I'm rollin' and smokin' somethin'...it ain't food. This place is worth rollin' into cause the food is smokin' good. The dudes that runs this place are extremely personable-servin' some heapin' helpings of hospitality along with their scrumptious offerings. Most everything I have had here is excellent. The highlight, as mentioned before is the Outlaw Burger, that thing hits the bull's-eye! I am especially fond of their jalapeño slaw, a wonderful kick to that stuff. The potato salad is not one of my faves, a little too bland for me, but that said, it still has this delightful subtle flavor that I can see lots of folks digging, and honestly I would order it again. Great bark on the meats. The sauce at the tables...should you feel the need...offers a complex mix of flavors with a welcomed spicy kick. Most of the sides are prepared in house. One employee told me the fried okra is frozen, but I (and one of my friends) seriously thought it tasted fresh. They must have found a great supplier. This interior is not divey at all, though for some, the location is. Fresh brewed regular and sweet tea. Two separate dining areas with 2 different vibes. Holy smoke, Rollin' Smoke ain't no joke, I felt high driving home and didn't even toke.
a good place to eat and taste mouth- watering bbq. it was my first time to try it and it was aoooo good! definitwly, will be back

It was good, but i've had better. I was really looking forward to trying it since i heard about it on the travel and food network. The burger is massive but too many onions, and the brisket was dry and wasn't very tender. I was looking for that fall part goodness in your mouth bbq and well the only place that is good that i've had to far is Lucille's BBQ.  Oh well, another place to calk up....
Can't say anything more than I absolutely love this place. I recommend all my guests to it when they are looking for great barbecue. The definition of finger licking good.

After friends told me this is the best year they've had out here in Vegas I had to give it a shot and I will say that it is a very worthy spot if you're looking for quality barbecue the flavors and portions are solid. Not the best I have ever had and I have traveled cross-country and had Memphis Kansas City Texas and North Carolina, but this Q is worthy of a revisit so is worthy of four stars
Good for Vegas, but not mind-blowing. Notable exception was bacon potatoes salad- yum!

Seriously such good bbq for such a great price! The chef Will is the best chef ever and I'm telling the you, cute girl Lizelle is just as sweet as she looks if you know what I'm saying! The staff is so friendly they made me care to remember their names, very welcoming. Definitely coming back and telling everyone !

Despite being practically located under a freeway overpass and literally right next to a strip club this place is a hidden gem.
I compare all bbq to Oklahoma Joe's back in kansas city. This was the best I've had in quite some time but doesn't quite reach the pinnacle that is Oklahoma joes. 
We ordered the smoked meatloaf-very good but VERY smokey. It was like it was cooked over a campfire.
Also tried the outlaw burger- this was amazing. Too big to realistically eat in one bite so just take the onion strings off and eat those as a side. 
You must order the corn nuggets, they are the best I've ever had.

Come for the BBQ meats
baby back RIBs MELTED right off the bone! super tender and delicious with a nice smokey touch
Brisket was delicious! and tender and just great
Pulled pork, needs the bbq sauce. it was good, but i would not get this again
mac and cheese and fried okra were standard, not amazing but it went well with the bbq. 

the service was great: the guy told us about each dish and checked up on us to make sure we were enjoying the food. its not a sit down restaurant, but he took the time to do so anyways

restaurant:
this is a shabby place in a shabby neighborhood. nothing special about it at all. 

Coming back to this place for sure! the food was delicious!

Destination BBQ.  Located in an industrial area well off the Strip, you drive past all the strip clubs wondering whether you made the right call.  Buried in a strip mall, I almost missed it coming from the north.

Really good, no particular style BBQ.  It's rubbed and not sauced.  I had the rib combo, getting baby back, spare, and beef ribs.  All were delish' fall-off-the-bone good; even better with the house BBQ sauce.  Classic potato salad topped with bacon and scallion and mac & cheese were a perfect match.

So Rollin Smoke BLEW UP. These days you are lingering around people finishing dinner in hopes of snagging their seat when they get up. Is it still great BBQ, yes. Has the huge rush of people made them slack just a little, yes. The last 2 visits just weren't that amazing food that I experienced the 5 times prior. I love the meatloaf. The catfish is hit or miss. It's been bomb many times, then soggy on one occasion. And I am not 100% sure of this, but I swear they HAD beef hot links and now I think its pork? Both are decent links, I just prefer the beef. No biggie. The sauce, well it always has been and still is, an all around GREAT sauce. 
I am happy for the success of these guys. But I miss when it has been just the family back there cooking, making sure every meal was perfect. The service is still pretty good. They really seem to handle the stress of a crazy, busy, demanding BBQ joint really well. I have never had bad service, EVER. 
A couple tips, get the beef ribs if you want ribs, they are huge and great. 
Even though the AYCE price is not $35, if you can handle all that meat, GO FOR IT! Still a great deal. Get one of each side, because they are all good. I am a big fan of the loaded potatoes and jalapeno slaw. 
I just read they are partnering with Gold & Silver Pawn to open a second location. I look forward for what's to come.

Great place In the middle of industrial Vegas.. I knew it was going to be good when I saw all the cop cars in the driveway. Eat where the cops eat.. That should be my new motto. We spoke to a cop once inside who said he patrols the area but will come out from Summerlin as this is the best bbq spot in Vegas.
