I ordered some baby back ribs and banana pudding. The food came out very quick. The food was amazing. Bbq sauce on the tables so you can put as much as your heart desires. I could only eat about half as it is a large meal for a woman. My husband chowed down his 2 beef ribs no problem. 

The onion rings.. Very thin, dipped in batter and fried. Reminded me of the kind you would get on a cheeseburger. They were delish. Banana pudding --pure heaven. As your dug in you got some of the cookies and whip. I pretty much ate it first.

Wish they would open some more locations.. And even maybe expand the location they have. It's so popular and a well loved establishment by all. Share the love!

Not entirely sure what Arkansas-style BBQ is actually, but it does taste pretty damn good. Best items: pork, brisket, chicken. Ribs were a little tough in my opinion...wondering if it should be falling off the bone? Anyways, everything was very tasty and well-done. Favorite sides were the beans and slaw.

Looks like people just park on the street underneath the overpass when the parking lot fills up.

Not much more can be said about this place that hasn't already been said. But here goes. Drink a bunch of water prior to your visit the stretch your stomach out.  Hours in advance of course. Then come here for the All you can eat deal only $35 plus tax. You can mix and match, but you only get 1 hour.  You can have as many sides as you want. Portions are smaller but that's so you can try everything. 

The sauces I tried were good. I went for their spicy and homemade Arkansauce. Mac n cheese was nothing special and came out Luke warm at best. The cheddar cheese sprinkled over the top hardly melted. Waffle fries were good and a generous portion. 

Enjoy!

For the past month I've been visiting different BBQ's in the city and I can honestly say Rollin Smoke has a fierce reputation for being one of the best BBQ's in Las Vegas!!!

I ordered the trio plate which consisted of the brisket, pork and hot links. 
Sides: Baked Beans and Mac&Cheese.
The pulled pork is smoked perfectly, and goes great with the BBQ sauce.  The hot links were quite peppery and succulent. I felt that the brisket was slightly over cooked, but it was okay when i mixed it with sides.

The portion size was quite filling, and I only paid $20 so it was worth the price tag!!!
The staff was friendly, courteous and overall the place has a great vibe. 
I can't to wait to try other stuff on the menu like the smoked meatloaf looks incredible!

Good Food! Was out in Vegas for friends bday and decided to go there and eat instead of eating out of casino or on strip. Maybe 10 minutes away from "Rio" and its the real deal on BBQ. Friendly and fast service. Clean tables as well. I will be back whenever I am in the town!

The sauce, I literally contemplated drinking it straight from the bottle, but every time I looked around people were watching. Its not that thick, disgustingly sweet sauce, its thin, perfect spice level, slightly sweet with vinegar notes. Perfection.

Now the meat, had the 5 meats and 3 sides. Brisket is on point, ribs smokey deelish, chicken, cant go wrong with chicken, and the pulled pork? Yum! Hotlinks had a nice peppery smokiness to them too. 

Sides: we had several and shared. Mac n cheese is pretty decent. Baked beans, tasty, but Ive had better. Cole slaw was unique and had a nice smokey flavor without the chipotle heat as suggested in the name. Potato salad was meh, typical potato salad with bacon crumbled on top. Now, the star of the sides show- those little corn nuggets. There is something magical in them. Not sure if they sprinkle opiates in them(kidding), cause they are seriously addicting. If you get one side, make it these magical little corn bombs that explode in your mouth. There are no words.

Now for service- amazing!! Everyone was super friendly and on point! I was impressed. You dont get service like this anymore! We will definitely be back :)

Here in Las Vegas for a conference and heard about this being the best bbq in town.  I haven't tried them all here but it was definitely very very good.  Some of the best brisket I've ever had.  Baked beans and corn nuggets are must haves. I'm glad it's not close to where I live as I would gain serious weight!

I ordered to-go, but I felt so comfortable while waiting on my food that I decided to eat there. Great service + Great food= 5 ALL DAY! 

I ordered the burnt ends with the corn nuggets, both were DELISH!

We went here as a group of 7 from NY. The food was fabulous. We had a variety of different things for dinner. Service was quick and as ordered. We complimented the chef and were welcomed into the back to see the smokers and kitchen. I would definitely, definitely go again.
Food is good at an ok price. I've had better barbecue, but the food here is decent.

Rollin Smoke was just ok... It's not the best bbq ive had -- i dont always go for bbqs. It's comparable to famous daves and memphis bbq but a little on the mom and pop's restaurant kind of service and ambience. Though they could use a little upgrade -- the place was tight, bbq were served on plastic basket with a wrap over the basket, sides were served in styro containers, you have to ask for plates or get it yourself if they have some out, the plastic utensils didnt look clean, sprite tasted funky or maybe it was the ice.

We ordered the platter (good for two) with four meats -- brisket, pulled pork, chicken, ribs. Pulled pork was the best out of all of them but again average compared to other bbq places. They only have one sauce on the table and it was watery -- the kind that will squirt on your shirt. The tip of the sauce container was not as clean as my (sort of ocd when it comes to food and food handling) self hoped it would be.

There were a few regulars but mostly tourists it seemed...

Despite of all that ive mentioned about the place being average, it's worth a try.

Okay, so my son and I went to RS last Friday night. He got the Biggin' and I got the 4 Rib plate. And that where things got crazy..........

It's been 5 days and I am still struggling to figure out where to go with this review. Some of what happened was 5 stars and more. Some of what happened was 1 star and less. So I will keep it simple; my son's Biggin' was incredible! My 4 rib combo was okay. I would have liked more flavor, both smoke flavor and seasoning flavor. The service was a mix of being both incredibly entertaining and incredibly bad.

Bottom line; although our visit didn't go as well as i would have hoped, when all was said and done they did their best to make things right. It's a great little "mom and pop" Q joint that is feeling the blessing/curse of yelp and LV weekly notoriety. I have no doubt they will pull through and I have no doubt I will be back.

This spot use to be the business. But between the prices going up and me getting stomach aches the last 2 times I ate there, I'm over it. Rollin Smoke what happened to you? You opened up by The Pawn shop and your making us all pay the price??? Rip off.... $27 for 2 beef ribs and a drink!?!?! Fuk-outta here with that. Then stomach pains to boot on 2 stops!!

The briskets and ribs were so moist and perfectly smoke. The pit master did a great job.  The kickass beans were also very good. The bbq sauce they have at the table is more of a vinegar base. I am not a fan of the sauce but it  was decent. I like the sauces at Famous Dave's. 
Will be back to try other meats.

First time eating here and it was GREAT. I had the "duo two meat combo" pulled pork & brisket.  The meat was extremely tender and moist as it should be. The flavor was pure BBQ greatness. They have a nice selection of bbq sauces and are very friendly.  My order was out in less than 3 minutes.  Great for lunch or anytime you want great BBQ.
Only the best comes from this place it is an institution btw my friend said it was there spiciest bbq sauce ever
I thought the food was pretty tasty. I enjoyed the Smoked Chicken, and Brisket. The Collard Greens and Mac 'n Cheese was nice too. I only wish the food came out hotter.
Gotta try the beef ribs! Very pricy for a small piece but very tender and juicy.  The pork ribs  was okay, a bit tough but good also. The corn fritters are soo yummy!

AMAZING!! Best BBQ I have eaten in a long time!!! Cole slaw and macaroni and cheese are awesome as well!!! No bad food at this place!!! Definitely worth waiting in line so don't pass this place without trying it!!  Staff is very helpful!!!
If you're ever in Vegas and looking for good BBQ, this is the spot. Didn't disappoint at all. Love the brisket.

Best BBQ I've eaten in YEARS! We are foodies and are often disappointed when we go out to eat.  THIS PLACE WILL NOT DISAPPOINT!!! It will exceed your expectations BY FAR! We tried 5 of the sides and 5 if the meats.  All I can say is ALL of them were top notch amazing!!!! You get your money's worth and walk away satisfied.  FANTASTIC PLACE.  Food, staff & atmosphere are wonderful!

My name is Robbie and ive lived in Vegas for 4 years now and let me tell you, It was the best BBQ experience I had here in my whole time living in Las Vegas. I can't believe I never heard about this place until my friend showed me where it is. Don't be fooled by the location, on the outside it may look like you're not even from Vegas at all and you'll contemplate why you're there, but the moment you step inside, it felt like I was actually in Arkansas and the overall vibe was awesome! All I ever saw when I walked in was all the awards that this place got. Not to mention the service was excellent! David (the guy who took our order) is literally the most helpful guy who can explain the best options to get for the menu. We got the "Rib Special Platter" (27.99 after taxes) but everything on it was enough to feed at least 2 people and we were a party of 5 so we all shared and pitched in for the food. I can tell you right now, the food was so appealing and mouth watering that when you see it being served, I felt like an animal ready to attack it's prey. LMAO. I was just that hungry to be honest and I've never been so happy and impressed with the service. David complemented me and Daniela (my friend) and just gave us super funny compliments about our names saying I had a cool name and she had a beautiful name. We just bursted out laughing and I swear I couldn't forget that moment. Working in the food industry also for Las Vegas ( I work for Fuku Burger) it reminded me a lot about how much we work so hard in the industry to make sure our customers have the best experience. I have to say this place has really lived up to the standard and as a fellow worker in the food and beverage industry, I salute the men and women who work hard in this. They really give you a one of kind hospitality and make you laugh haha. Maybe it's just the southern hospitality, but you have to experience it to really have a great time. Not to mention this place is perfect for sharing and the food is instagram worthy!!!! I swear I'm coming back to this place now to take girls out on dates and stuff just because it's so unique and fun. Anyways I've had enough to say. I really liked this place and you won't be disappointed.

This place is just amazing and I love the feel because it's not too big it too small. The food taste great and everything feels like a down home Southern BBQ. They don't hold back on anything, it's like being in a butcher shop.......freaking amazing!!!!

Just get there and try it. I had the slider trio w/ sausage, pulled pork & rib meat and waffle fries as my side; all of which were soooo tasty. Loved those fries, they had an awesome season on them- not the typical seasoning that places sometimes use - this is a first for me and I loved it all!

Get some hush puppies too, they're great. That's all from our table!
Went to the New Pawn Star location - Nice Place - Great Staff and Good Barbecue which for this southern girl is hard to find in Las Vegas .  And you must try the Mac and Cheese

Great food, great prices, great service.  The meats had so much flavor and fell off the bone on the ribs. My husband got the all you can eat special for $34.99. Very well worth the money because you can try everything on the menu....everything! The staff and service were amazing and really made the experience that much better. This will be a regular stop for us now.

The BBQ here is amazing! I tried it today for the first time and I will definitely be returning.  My favorite was the BBQ nachos with beef brisket. The meat was smokey and tender...pretty much perfection! Service was also great. They greeted everyone upon entrance and really made you feel welcome.

My brush with fame in Sin City continues.

I dined---more accurately, binged---here where that famous guy who reviews diners, drive-in's, and dives dined.

Guy Fieri?  No.

Rod U. ("DA MAN!")

I liked the spare ribs best in "The Pit Special"---a carnivore's love fest of brisket, pulled pork, a 1/4 chicken, spare ribs, and hot links + 3 sides for $27.99.  Expensive, but not too bad if you split it with someone or even a couple of someone's.  With "Loaded Mash", collard greens, and chipotle coleslaw as our sides, my fellow field researcher and I ate our fill and still had quite a bit of leftover's.  That monster could easily feed 3 hungry hombre's.  Or my wife and daughter for a week.

I'd go again.  I just love me some good 'que now and again.  I'd be a bit more discreet in ordering though.  I think I could be satisfied with just the "Outlaw" burger or a half rack of the "St. Louis Spare Ribs".  I don't need the extra calories anymore.

That AYCE "Anything On The Menu  Any Day, Any Time" is now $34.99.  For others, the feeding frenzy continues.

Let me start off by saying I am a BBQ snob.  I have had BBQ from all across the country and I like all styles.  I got the pit special - 4 meats and 3 sides.  I had no hope of eating all this food, but it gave me a good cross section of the menu.  For the meats - 1.  Brisquit - nice smoke flavor, good texture, but too dry for my taste.  2. Spareribs - nice smoke flavor, good texture, needs no sauce to be enjoyed - my favorite of the 4.  3.  Beef rib - beautiful bark, good texture, flavor was good, but needed sauce to be enjoyed.  4.  Last and certainly least was the chicken.  It was all dark, so I had high hopes, but I found it over cooked, dry (for a thigh) and pretty flavorless.  I can't recommend the chicken at all.  3 Sides - 1.  Kicken beans - not bad, but I am spoiled by Jack Stack beans in Kansas City - none other has so far come close.  2.  Bacon potato salad - just ok, a bit bland for me.  3.  Side salad with Chipotle dressing - my favorite side.  I would give this place 3.5 stars when compared to the other bbq I have had.
The best BBQ I have ever had. The smell when you walk up to the place is amazing, the staff is super friendly its just all around a great place to eat.

The BBQ here is amazing! I've been all over the US and live in Texas so I know BBQ. We had the chicken, brisket, something burnt edges, the spare ribs, mac and cheese, and greens and it was all great.
Some of the best BBQ on planet earth. The ribs, brisket, chicken, pulled pork, as well as the baked beans and potato salad were fantastic. Do not miss this joint when visiting Las Vegas.

200th review!  And yes, it is a worthy one!

First of all, this is a true hole in the wall place...I would have never tried it if it wasn't for Yelp, and I would have barely found it if they didn't have the BBQ grilles parked out front!

Start off with the food....the Pulled Pork sandwich is truly amazing  :

http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/rollin-smoke-barbeque-las-vegas?select=GGZosl72mVr20EopFH0CCQ#3VPTArn4TCy4jDYzeSJbyw

Beautiful char carmelization on the outside...tender juicy goodness on the insides....and the tangy BBQ sauce sets it off!  Not spicy, but it has that flavor depth that is needed for an interesting (but not overpowering) BBQ sauce.  It is easily the best pulled pork sandwich I have had, but it is actually one of my most favorite ways I have consumed the pork beast himself.

For the side, I asked what was most recommended.  I was told to try the mac and cheese :

http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/rollin-smoke-barbeque-las-vegas?select=GGZosl72mVr20EopFH0CCQ#uGQtCaucN0VVUbvSjXBlkQ

It was good!  Lots of spices in here...not spicy, but with more depth and distinguishing tastes put into the food here than a normal mac and cheese at most other places.  I can feel the love :P

Yelp check-in merited a free dessert...I was recommended the Peach Cobbler (pictured with the sandwich).  It came out piping hot, gooey and tasty....just wish I had some crust in there like the one I love so much at Wing King.  But besides being crustless, this was an excellent rendition.

I will say that there was a miscommunication at order though, and my side also never came out with my food until I reminded them it was missing.  I was strongly considering dropping my 5 to a 4 star, but the food and prices are so good, that I feel guilty holding it against them.  If the order was taken correctly the first time, I doubt I would have had anything to complain about...again, just a miscommunication.

I'll be back!

Pulled pork sandwich was excellent.Baked beans had way too much black pepper,and the portion was extremely small for $2.00.Some of the prices are very high,28.00 for a full rack of baby backs?The guy that took my order said they would be using larger containers for the sides soon.As another poster said the staff is very friendly.I will definitely go back,its close to my work,and i would like to try some other menu items.

I was very excited to try this place out after seeing all the excellent yelp reviews. Me and my family decided to try it out and I was a bit disappointed. Don't get me wrong, it's still pretty good bbq but it's not amazing. The staff is super sweet and the Outlaw burger was pretty amazing but everything else was just ok. I will give this place another chance next time I'm in Vegas.

OMG...I travel lots and ashamed to say I am a foodie...Sorry the ribs and corn nuggets are better hear than Vegas. Danny thank u for GREAT suggestions..brisket ends/tips soooo good. First time here n not my last. I will tell others.

Went to Rolling Smoke for the first time. I had heard so much about this place. I wanted to check out all the hype about the best BBQ in town and was very disappointed. All six of our meals were cold. The burnt ends were extremely fatty, and all of our pulled pork plates came without any BBQ sauce. I brought this problem up to the person behind the counter and was told someone would be right over to help me. No one came. I went back to the cashier but she was too busy and couldn't acknowledge me so we tossed the food and just left. I will never go back to Rolling Smoke nor will I ever recommend it anyone. I would rather pay the higher price and eat at Lucille's, better food better service.

I have been on the look out for outstanding BBQ in Las Vegas, and I finally found It!! I tried this place solely based on the yelp reviews, and you guys did not let me down!!

I went on a Saturday night around 8:30 pm. The parking lot was packed, the outside picnic tables were packed, and there was a line out the door. The line moved quickly & we ordered within 5 or so minutes.

The menu is huge, so it might be worth checking it out ahead of time. I ordered the Outlaw Burger with waffle fries, and my husband got the Duo plate with chicken & brisket. We, also, got a side of corn nuggets & a peach cobbler. With 2 drinks, everything came to $25.

You order at the counter, and seat yourself. Drinks & silverware are self serve. And, when your order is ready, they bring it to your table. While we were waiting, I observed a few people who were obvious regulars. Another good sign.

Every single item we ordered was excellent. The chicken was super moist and flavorful. The brisket had those delicious crispy pieces on the edges. Waffle fries were crispy and well seasoned. The peach cobbler was warm and gooey!! But, the rock star of our meal was definitely the Outlaw Burger. It. Was. Huge. Like 10" high huge!

When we were wrapping up our leftovers, they didn't have a lid for our cobbler...so they gave us a whole 2nd one to go. It was a little thing, but their service really impressed me.

We left super full, and already planning what we were going to order next time. I, also, like that they are open late since I'm a night owl.

If you like BBQ, you need to check this place out!

Best BBQ in Vegas!!! I've tried numerous bbq joints but this one has them all beat. The brisket was excellent, so were the chicken and sausage. The macaroni was outstanding. 
It is in a weird location but worth finding.

Way back when this was the only place to go for great bbq. Unfortunately it seems success has gone to their heads. For yhe 2nd time in a row they forgot to put items i had ordered in the bags. At 70 bucks a pop per trip feeding me and my kids, I would expect a bit more quality control on their part especially when its not even busy. I called to complain and all they could tell me is "we left a note by the register, come get them when you come in next and u wont be charged". SO SORRY ITS MY FAULT YOU FORGOT MY ITEMS I PAID FOR! Im done with this place. For those hankerin for bbq try it once you wont be disappointed, but as a repeat customer thats all you ever will be....disappointed.

Great Bbq!  Cured my hangover with each delicious bite.  Thanks to all the staff that fed us today!  Lizelle, Karina, Mitch, Cristian, and Yancey.  Been here about 10 times now and can't wait to come back!

Don't judge this place by the outside.  Their food is yummy and plenty of it.  We had ribs, brisket, pork, potatoes, string onions, salad with chipotle dressing, and it was all good. The place was packed, not a lot of parking.  It's a family friendly small location with southern BBQ that is awesome!  The staff are great, service is quick and friendly.

Serious BBQ!! Dusty really knows his stuff!!

I ordered the mixed rib platter minus the babies, and instead subbed another beef rib. To round out my meal was the loaded mash and I added some greens. I won't be hungry again until at least this time tomorrow!!

Rollin' Smoke's rub compliments the flavor of both the beef and spare ribs nicely. I added a little of their spicy BBQ sauce because I like my BBQ to have a bit of a kick. The spareribs were perfect and the beef ribs were very impressive. Smokey but not overpowering. Dusty came to my table and asked how everything was, and I couldn't compliment him enough. He shared his technique on how he preps the beef ribs. I guess I'll be back, because I certainly don't have that kind of patience!!

If you're in Vegas craving BBQ, this is the place to go. The portions are big, the prices extremely fair, and the atmosphere removes you from the strip and puts you in a true BBQ joint that you leave smelling smokey! This is real BBQ and not that over salty crap that Famous guy prepares in several spots around town.

BARBEQUE LOVERS TAKE NOTE
The ratings on this place did not exaggerate at all.  This barbeque is among the very best I have ever eaten.  Being from the South, I can distinguish true smoked meat from the posers.  Rollin Smoke Barbeque is barbeque at its finest.  The meat has an excellent smoked flavor and the sauce complements it perfectly. The dishes here are unique and do an excellent job highlighting masterful barbequing skills.  I had the Barbeque sundae and highly recommend it.  With layers of mashed potatoes, beans, pulled pork and slaw, it combines all the perfect sides with the 'que in one handy cup.  The side of baked beans iI had were equally up to the task with the just the right amount of sweetness with a nice spicy bite as well.  

Well done Rollin Smoke--I will return.

I'm a very picky eater when it comes to me liking food. Rollin Smoke BBQ is an awesome place to eat. It's not doused in BBQ cause I like to dip...so it's just right. Gotta bring my hunney cause there are few places that he can go to and I'm sure he'll love this place.

I heard so much about the Outlaw burger from Seven and Las Vegas Weekly that I had to try it for myself!  After a well worth 15-min wait a massive burger came to my table...  This burger has lettuce, tomato, cheese,onion straws, a burger patty and brisket.  To take a bite I had to open my jaw as wide as possible and smash the burger down in the process!

There is no doubt I can say this is the best BBQ burger I've had in my life and for $8 it left me very full (that and the free dessert I received for checking in on Yelp!).  I'm really looking forward to trying other BBQ items on the menu, there was so many good looking things to choose from that it was overwhelming.

6/10/13

Just had the brisket sandwich over the weekend and it was awesome!  Very tender, melt in your mouth good.  I brought a group of friends and everyone thought it was amazing.  I'm so glad they have a large menu because I will want to come back here and try everything!

Happened upon this place when I was on vacation (11/2015) and wanted some BBQ, so I just Google best Las Vegas BBQ.

The place is a hole in the wall but the food is soooooo good! The sauces are really good. I loved the ribs, macc and cheese and the greens. 

Would definitely recommend to anyone.

I've had Arthur Bryant's bbq in KC, I've had LC's bbq (also in KC near the stadiums), I've had Sonny's BBQ (a chain pit-bbq in the SE US), I've had Brad's BBQ in Alabama, I've had Abe's BBQ in Clarksdale, MS at the Crossroads.  And now I've had Rollin Smoke BBQ in Vegas, and it compares with Arthur Bryant.  It is excellent bbq and I will visit again!  I've had their meatloaf (amazing--made with brisket) and the brisket.
I am a beef Ribs lover since I don't eat pork.... I have tried many many over the years and this is the best by far I have found......will be back for sure....
Good food and atmosphere. Felt a little fast foodish. Brisket a little dry. Great sauces. Overall I would say this is the 2nd beat bbq in Las Vegas.

I have been trying to eat here all week. It was pretty good. The corn nuggets are heaven. The right ranch dressing would make them perfect.  Links are good nice and spicy.  Chicken wings were good nicwand big.  The baked beans were spicy spicy. My daughter loved the Mac and cheese wish I had gotten a taste it looked good.
Great BBQ! One of the best in Vegas! I highly recommend them.  They're just minutes from where I work and I stop by on my way home a couple times a week!
Went back in June of 2016 and had the meatloaf, I HIGHLY recommend it! It is a meatloaf like no other. AMAZING!
Amazing beef rib & baby back pork ribs!!! Super cute place & great prices...the outlaw burger was ok..not so great as i expected it to be..

We enjoyed this place a lot. We walked 2 miles to get here over train tracks in the hot sun wanting this food. We arrived and as we waited in line, we looked at the menu and prepared our appetites. We decided more was better than less and went at it. We order the Big Hawg, Duo choice platter, and the Spudtastic. The portions are huge and highly suggest you get everything. It does lack BBQ sauce before you get your meal, but the tables are fully stocked. We stuffed ourselves full and wobbled back to our hotel.

Rollin Smoke Barbeque is the epitome of what a BBQ joint should be. My roommate and I came here to satisfy our BBQ fix, and were actually really impressed. 

When we first arrived, it was busy and no one was at the counter for a while. However, the wait was well worth it because Rollin Smoke Barbeque beats out all the chain BBQ places in Vegas.

Inside, there are two dining rooms with one of the rooms being where you order. The rooms fill up quickly when it's busy so if you want to dine-in, try finding a seat first. There are also a few wooden picnic tables outside for outdoor seating.

As for the food, I ordered the trio choice plate with a side of fried okra and an a la carte order of cornbread.

The trio choice plate was your pick of 3 meats (out of: brisket, pork, 1/4 chicken, 2 spare ribs, or a hot link). Everything about my order was on point. The pork was soft and succulent, with a tenderness that made it practically melt in your mouth. The brisket was probably the highlight of the trio platter. Whenever I go to BBQ places, they usually end up burning some of the brisket, but it was perfect here. Savor these tender cuts of meat because it's THAT good. As for the chicken, it was a little on the pink side, but the parts I did eat had a smokey BBQ flavor. (Don't be afraid to literally drench your food in the BBQ sauce they have on the table!)
The fried okra were little bite-sized pieces of heaven. The cornbread wasn't dry like most places; it had a good texture with the classic, sweet cornbread taste.

The parking lot to this place is on the small side and it can get awkward getting into if you're not alert, but who would've thought that this little treasure would be in the midst of all the plumbing and electrical buildings nearby. 

Rollin Smoke is a meatlover's dream. If you want BBQ done right, you should definitely go here.
had really high expectation for this place , but unfurtunately it wasn't what i was looking for . too little flavor for my taste

This place boils the meat & the sauce is boring.
Mom was not impressed... but then she is from KCMO and we are accustomed to the barbeque of KCMO, TN & TX.  

My fried-shrimp was great, but I would have preferred a cocktail sauce and not the their barbeque sauce to dip them in.

Move over Phil's BBQ in San Diego and Lucille's of SoCAL, this place is rollin! The beef rib was perfect! It was meaty, tender and flavorful.  Next time I'm in Vegas, I will get ayce just for the beef ribs, corn nuggets and the banana pudding.
Best BBQ and amazing people! We tried almost everything on the menu. You must try the fried okra! They were so nice and friendly we will definitely be back.

This is probably my new favorite BBQ spot in town. It's in a sketchy part of town, almost under an overpass, but that's how you know it's great food. I ordered the baked potato that came stuffed with BBQ brisket and beans, honestly the best baked potato I've ever had. I couldn't put down the fork until I was done. I totally recommend this spot to anyone who loves BBQ.

Loved the Pulled Piggy Sandwich and Hush Puppies. Sandwich was on a soft sesame roll that was like home-made. Only one tiny piece of fat in the pork, so much better than most places. Pork was moist and tender, and had great flavor. The Hush Puppies had a mild jalapeño tang to them, and I thought about ordering more since I finished them early, but the combo meal with a Country Berry Cobbler side completely filled me up. The cobbler was THE best I've ever tasted. Will definitely be back here next time I'm in town.

We went for our first time for lunch on a busy Friday afternoon. I had the brisket sandwich and my boyfriend and the three meat meal with three sides. Everything was amazing. The corn nuggets were my favorite side and all the meat was cooked to perfection.  The reason for the 4 stars was that it took quite some time to get our food. I know they were busy but it took about 45 minutes after we ordered to get our food. I am sure we will be back.

I want to love it because its local and close to home.  Been three times and never thought anything was wonderful.  Their baked sweet potato was watery and mushy.  They shouldn't steam them in plastic wrap.

Tried this place after a search or barbecue in Vegas, still looking for a great spot.  So gave it a try and got the Biggin' sandwich which is a combo of their brisket, pulled pork and hot link all on the same bun.  The bun, is great. Soft and soppy.  The meat, 2 out of 3 were outstanding.  The hot links are great and made in house.  The pulled pork was as good as I've had in Vegas. Didn't care as much for the brisket.  I didn't hate it and it was tender, but it just didn't hold up flavor wise to the other meats.
   Their Mac n cheese side was solid as was their peach cobbler.  Def gonna come back and work on some more menu items. So far this is the best BBQ in town.

With all the great reviews I was expecting a little more.  Rolling Smoke is good bbq for Las Vegas but don't expect it to match Texas or Missouri greats in the taste department.  Their portions are big, the restaurant is cool, and the prices are fair for usual bbq, but the meats just aren't as good as they were hyped up to be.

I had the two meat platter with pork and brisket.  The brisket was fine, but I did not like the pork at all.  It was spiced rather than an authentic bbq-esque dish.  I also had the chipotle coleslaw which was just average.  The house bbq sauce was actually quite good, though.

I'm gong to need to try other bbq places in Vegas to compare, because Rolling Smoke could still be the best in the city, just don't expect the meat to compete with the well known bbq throughout the U.S..

MAKE SURE TO TELL THEM YOU'RE A LOCAL to get a discount. The person who takes your order will ask. I was wondering why the asked me where I was from. I told them I was from LA. My friends discovered that if you tell them Las Vegas, you get a "Local's Discount."

The BBQ is AWESOME. Yelp to the rescue, once again. Don't overestimate yourself; they give you a ton of food. Unless you just want leftovers. Then that's cool!

My favorites are the brisket, pulled pork, and the ribs!
I'd pass on the Waffle Fries. Those were a little disappointing.

Parking is super easy in their lot.

The brisket is amazing.  Probably the best I've ever had. 

The hot links are really good, have a nice spice to them

The pork was good but a bit on the dry side

The ribs were good but not ZOMG amazing or anything.

The BBQ sauce was excellent.  Great flavour with a bit of heat

I'd recommend just getting the brisket and hot links based on my experience.
Great service & great food. Even though we got there 30 minutes before closing, customer service was great & the food was delicious. Banana Cream pie was the bomb!

This is the best BBQ in town. It's a bit pricey but in my opinion you get what you pay for. There was a very long line to order but the food comes out quick. I had the trio platter the pulled pork and hot links were just awesome. Staff was very helpful and polite. Make sure you check out the grill fish tank while you're there.
Excellent barbecue and very reasonable priced. We really enjoyed the ribs. They were tender and very tasty
Best in Las Vegas! Worth finding! The large Rib platter is for the very hungry and the Half Rack of Beef Ribs makes a great Lunch.

Great food, great service. Cant go wrong if your in the area and craving bbq food.
GO HERE!!
Outlaw burger didn't stand a chance. Place is freaking good.

An awesome experience if your looking for great BBQ! It's more cafeteria style in that you order, then sit down and then the food is brought to you. I ordered the brisket sandwich. The brisket is very soft- almost as soft as the bread itself. The sandwich consisted of the brisket, BBQ sauce, and some chopped green onion. I appreciate the simplicity, but everything was the same texture and it could have used a crunch. I liked it though, and I would order it again. My boyfriend got the rib sampler which consisted of spare ribs, baby backs, and one beef rib. Baby back are excellent, spare ribs are everything you would expect, beef rib is very good as well but he doesn't normally like beef ribs. The sauce itself is good and I liked that they only gave one option, because that's the only one you need. We also had the sides Mac n cheese and jalapeño coleslaw. In my opinion, these two sides can be skipped. Mac n cheese tasted a little too artificially cheesy, and the coleslaw had an overwhelming jalapeño flavor. Cornbread was everything you want, sweet, soft, warm, delicious. What really made my experience though, was the amazing staff! They are so helpful and so nice throughout the entire experience. Go here. You'll love it.
The food was soooo good. The meat was tender and the sides were delicious.  I ordered the brisket and rib combo and it did not disappoint.  Staff was friendly, attentive,  and courteous.

We shared a single order - 1/2 slab beef ribs and a pork spare rib with jalapeno coleslaw and waffle fries - and finished only half of it and had to put the rest in a box. Enormous portion for the cheap can't be a bad thing, but ... ridiculous would be a better word to describe it.

Seating outside felt nice on a surprisingly warm day in December.

This is one of the best BBQ I've ever had, and... we're still giving 3 stars.

Probably it's just that we're not that into BBQ. We must admit that we need some enlightenment to enjoy that part of American culture.

Dude!, this's a hole in the wall place that will make you cough of you have any kind of lung issues. Aside from that, you are in for a real treat with their Outlaw burger. It is a big beast. I ate that thing like a teenage v***** And the ribs are to die for.

Haven't had BBQ this good since we lived in Texas!   3 meat platter was super tasty- got brisket , pork , and ribs.  Side plates were great.  

The clientele was all locals; it's a little ways off the strip. No frills but a fantastic meal.

My only complaint is they don't serve beer .

Absolutely delicious. We ordered the outlaw burger, pulled pork, brisket, and chicken. All incredible. Tender high quality meat not overpowered by BBQ sauce. One of the owners greeted us and went out of his way to be kind and helpful. The chef brought us our food and have is free potato salad and banana pudding to try, which were most delicious as well. He even came out to check on us later. The owner was very proud of he and his brother's business and said it was the American Dream. Will definitely return here next time I'm in Vegas. This is some of the best BBQ I've ever had, topped off with excellent customer service.

It is not often that I give a BBQ restaurant five stars. I found the food to be very, very good. If this place was in KC or some other BBQ city, I'm not sure that I would give it five stars...Maybe I would. The meat (ribs, chicken, brisket, & pulled pork) was succulent, mouthwatering, flavorful, tender...I could go on and on. You get the picture. The sides (beans, mac & cheese, greens) were cooked perfectly with a southern flare. The sweet tea was oh so yummy. I didn't have a dessert, but I will next time. The service was fast and with a smile. The only thing that bothered me was the place was very smokey (the smell). It was a good thing, but it lingered in my clothes after I left. To most people, I think that is a good thing. To me, it's just one of those things that I perseverate on. LOL...I can't wait to go back.

The food was awesome and the service even better. The owner practically held our hands through the ordering process as we had a big group with kids. He kept checking on us every 15 minutes or so too.  This place lives up to its high rating.  I'm from the south and am a tough critic of BBQ, but Rollin' Smoke BBQ is worth the hike off the strip.

Great BBQ but really disappointing dessert. I know that is not really why you  go to a BBQ place but for almost $6, it should be more than blueberries with yellow cake mix mushed up in it. So, lesson learned...at a BBQ place expect great BBQ but get dessert somewhere else.

Have been here numerous times and tried most of the menu. Brisket is my bf's favorite!  I usually get the pulled piggy sandwich. This place is so delicious. Plus it's a small business so love helping support locals versus big chain resteraunts. You have to try this place or you're missing out.

Vegas is such a minefield as far as its restaurants are concerned, with so many meals beginning with high expectations but ending in disappointment, that I wanted to say a few words about a place that I feel is one of the absolute gems of the Vegas culinary landscape.

I've eaten at Rollin' Smoke BBQ twice now, and left both times feeling as though I'd eaten some of the best BBQ of my life. I'm a true lover of good BBQ and have even taken pilgrimages to places like Memphis, TN and Lockhart, TX in search of the country's best. I feel I have a good frame of reference for evaluating what good BBQ tastes like, and, let me assure you, Rollin' Smoke is damned good BBQ!

Everything I've tried on the menu has been excellent, but the dishes I dream about are the smoked meatloaf--which I have to say may be the single best meatloaf dish I've ever eaten--and the burnt ends, waffle fries and corn fritters. The ribs, chicken and everything else is excellent, but the above dishes were my favorites.

Las Vegas is frankly very lucky to have BBQ of this caliber, as very few cities in America do. The manager is super friendly, and the whole staff is very friendly and accommodating. They also give a discount to locals, showing that they appreciate those of us who live here and support these businesses on a regular basis.

I know I'm going to leave with a smile on my face every time I eat here, and I cannot recommend this place highly enough. Unlike many on Yelp, I don't give out five-star ratings easily, but Rollin' Smoke has earned it! Please support this great Las Vegas restaurant! My only complaint is that they close at 8pm Mon-Fri, but the most important thing is that their food is truly outstanding!

WOW!!!  Our office had them cater lunch for us today and this is how BBQ should be!  The meat on both the chicken wing I grabbed (and yes it was nice and meaty!) and the rib ripped right off the bone!  The flavor was outstanding as well!!  Chopped brisket was awesome as well!!  The bacon potato salad (because everything is better with bacon!!!) was the best potato salad ever!!  Beans had a nice kick...YUM!!  And the cornbread was perfect not dry at all!!  Wish they had a west side location!!  Will have to make the drive though...the food will totally be worth it!!!

Best BBQ I've had in Vegas in more than 30 years here.  Had brisket, chicken and rib tips, with mac& cheese, and yams.  Excellent quality all the way around...the chicken was perfectly cooked...fully done but still moist...the mac & cheese was nice and creamy.  this is definitely my "go to" for "Q.  Oh, and the sauce was really interesting...a little thinner than some sauces, and with a really nice balance of vinegar and sweetness.  Really glad I tried these guys and looking forward to more.

One-word "Meatloaf".  Never tasted meatloaf this good. Price 13$ includes drink. no waitress in the classic tense but a young gentleman took our trays and seemed to be actively interested. Only bad thing is that it was a Razorback restaurant and I am   Alabama RollTide.  
Will definitely come back.

Haven't been here since our last visit to Vegas in 2014.
This place is still amazing-we had a pit special and some amazing sides. 
Staff are incredibly nice, this place is the best, will definitely visit again tomorrow :) 
Updated 
Just visited again today and had another amazing lunch . Place was packed , but the service was quick and friendly and there was lots of staff cleaning off tables and making sure everything was in good shape. Really good atmosphere there. 
We met the owner today and he's a great guy - wish I lived in Vegas so I could enjoy this place every week !

I ordered a pulled pork sandwich and loaded mashed potatoes. The sandwich was tasty but smaller than expected for the price. It was also served on what looked to be a hot dog bun instead of a roll/hamburger bun, strange. The mashed potatoes were okay but not great. Customer service was friendly and quick even though there was a big line.
This is a great place to go for a BBQ I will go back for sure.They are very welcoming Dusty was a great help Thanks for a great dinner

I travel a lot for business and I always make it a point to find great local restaurants.  This time I was traveling with my family and we ended up in Vegas.   This is a must visit. It is easy to spend the entire time eating on the strip but this is only 10 minutes away.  It is definitely worth the trip.

The beef ribs were cooked perfectly.  The burnt ends were moist and tasty. The baked beans and yams were also great side dishes.  Did not try any of the pork products but I am sure they were the same or better. 

The place is very informal.  You order and pay on a line then site at one of the picnic tables either inside or outside.  They will bring the food to you.  The staff is great, friendly, and as I was ordering for 5 strong willed people they were patient too.

I've heard how amazing Rollin' Smoke is since before I stared Yelping! I was super happy when the stars aligned and we got Jessie and her hubby Bill, Dyanna and her man Brent and Joel and I all in one place for dinner. This was also Jessie's and Bill's first time as well as ours. 

It was a Saturday night so it was busy. It's the kinda spot you order first and then you find seating. Joel ordered the famous Outlaw burger and I got the Triple meat with brisket, ribs, and hot links my side was potato salad and Joel's side was Mac & cheese. We totally lucked out and scored a large table big enough for all of us. It seemed like we just sat down and our names were called and out came the order. Wow! Joel's burger was huge! Like so big he didn't know how to start on it. He enjoyed it a lot. The Mac & cheese was ok nothing special. I really liked my brisket and hot links. The meat was tasty and tender. I was disappointed that the ribs were tough. Because I expected fall off the bone tender. Not a big fan of Rollin' Smokes sauce either. I prefer a thicker sauce. I did enjoy the potato salad and it reminded me a lot of what I make at home. Joel also used the Yelp check in offer for a free dessert. He choose the banana pudding which he loved. 

The atmosphere was bare, but had picnic tables and TVs. The dining area is split into two rooms. Because the turn over is so quick the tables tend to get dirty which is the downside. The staff was friendly, but since they were super busy they might have needed more people. 

The food didn't blow me away, but it was good. I want to go back again to try some other things on the menu. Plus, they did have excellent pickles!!! What a fun night! Glad to be able to check Rollin Smoke off my Yelp bookmarks list!
Rollin smoke is excellent bbq authentic tasting like you made it yourself. Never dissapoints.
Baby back ribs were good. It's very casual place. It's pretty pricey for a casual place.

Well I finally got to try this place . I can tell you it's the best in Vegas hands down . It's not so called bbq (aka boiled and grilled) , this is really smoked and tasty bbq . The bark was delicious and the smoke ring was insane . I give this place 5 stars not only on the food, but the top notch service . I got a moment to talk bbq with Dusty, stand up guy and I can tell he has real love and passion for bbq. I would recommend the brisket 3 ways, it's a good eat alone but that sauce puts it on point . I'm in town around 10 times a year and this will be a place I visit every tine, 100% legit !!!
I was recommended here from a friend who knows his food. And we where deffinatley good food

This is the best Barbeque I've had in Las Vegas. Its a small place off the beaten path, near to, but not on the busy strip. There are a couple tables outside and a handful of tables inside...but, be warned, open seats and tables are at a premium at times as this place gets packed because they are just THAT good! I ate there for dinner yesterday and woke up craving their food...agh! The beef bones were out of this world flavorful and tender...the meat just fell off the bones. I wanted to try the bacon potato salad and they were out of it so I tried macaroni and cheese and yams...these are now my favorite sides. They brought us an order of potato salad after they made a new batch, but I liked the yams and macaroni and cheese the best. The owners and staff are very welcoming and friendly and stop by the tables to get feedback from their diners...when they spoke to us, they informed us that they are opening a second location that will include a bar. Of all the many places I've had the pleasure of eating BBQ this makes my list of my top three favorites...the other two are in (1) San Diego and (2) Winnipeg, Manitoba. Give this place a shot...I'm so glad I did!

On side of freeway, off beaten track, little more than hole in wall, good food joint.  Meat really tender.  I like a tad bit more seasoning on my que, but tenderness made up for lack of seasoning.  Loved potato salad and corn bread.  Beef rib was huge.  Bbq sauce was okay.  Menu was a little overloaded, confusing but just order some meat and you will be good!

After hearing about Rollin Smoke from one of their employees, Dusty, that came into my shop to get a tire replaced, my wife and I decided to give it a try. Being someone who barbecues and smokes a great deal, I was a bit skeptical since other "bbq" joints we've tried just never measured up. I am happy to say this one did. We both had a three meat combo, with both of us having the pulled pork and brisket. My wife went with the spare ribs and I had the hot link for our third meat. We both found the brisket to be moist and tender with a great flavor and just the right amount of smoke. The pulled pork was moist and tender as well, though it could have used a bit more smoke and maybe some bite to it, more of a personal preference though. Fpr the sides my wife had the waffle fries which were good, but it's hard to screw up fires. I went with the bacon potato salad which was excellent, I also got an order of the corn nuggets which were nothing short of Oh my God good. Though it is a bit of a drive from where we live, we will be back.  To Dusty and the rest of the folks at Rollin Smoke, thanks for giving Vegas good bbq.

Did I go to the wrong place? Did I go on the wrong day? Did I order the wrong thing?

I was so excited to try this place. With stellar reviews and a line out the door, it had to be the bomb, right? Unfortunately, I really wanted to love this place but I just didn't.
Based on reviews, I went early to avoid the lunch rush. Luckily, there was no line yet. Staff was very nice and kept checking on me while I was waiting on my colleagues. Didn't have to wait too long for our food and by that time ,sure enough, the line was out the door. I had the slider trio with pork, brisket and hot links. The pork and hot links were good, but nothing that different or special. The BBQ sauce was decent. I was completely disappointed with the brisket. It has so much fat in it that I didn't eat about half of it. Now mind you, I like leaner cuts of meat and I know some people like the fat, but this was just way too much. Those at the table also got the bacon potato salad, the waffle fries and the corn nuggets. All were just ok - nothing great. 

If I'm in the neighborhood, I'll give it another try, but I won't go out of my way - it just wasn't worth it.

Il me tardait de manger au Rollin Smoke Barbeque au vu de tous ces commentaires positifs. Bien que la cuisson de la viande soit faite au barbecue, le goût si particulier au barbecue ne se sent pas du tout. Une vraie déception! Je n'y retournerais pas et je ne le vous conseille pas !


I was really looking forward to have a taste of the Rollin Smoke Barbeque as so many people put so many positive comments. The meat is supposed to be cooked/smoked on a barbeque, you won't find this specific taste in your meat... at all !
A real disapointment, I won't come back and I would definitely NOT recommend it
From a Kansas Citian-home of the world's best BBQ.  This place is outstanding; will definitely be back on my next trip to Vegas.  Great food, great service and very friendly employees.

My previous review of a measly little 4 stars was not sitting right with me.   I have to make it right.  

I have been back on several occasions.  I always received great service from ordering to receiving my food. Aside from the fact it's not located in the best of areas, the parking lot is always packed.  Can you blame them? Not at all.  When you want some of the best BBQ, you will make it to Rollin Smoke for a taste of their smoky and tender feast.   

Of course there is the monstrous Outlaw Burger.  Have you seen the pics? It's large and in charge.  By the end you're probably using utensils to gobble up the tasty meat but it's definitely worth it.  I would definitely suggest sharing.  

My other favorite is their meatloaf.  You're probably thinking 'C'mon... Meatloaf?' Oh yeah.  It's combination of smoky meats baked, placed on loaded mash and topped with sauce and onion straws.  It's mouth watering fantastic.  

I have yet to find something here I didn't like.  When I try other BBQ places around the city, none compare to the great Rollin Smoke!

Damn good BBQ @ Rollin Smoke Barbecue! My husband and I split the brisket 3 ways and I was really impressed with how good everything was. My favorite was the burnt ends. The brisket was so tender, the meat just fell apart and melted in your mouth. They also offer several different dipping sauces, all you can eat on the sauce at no extra charge. 
I found out the owner is originally from the south which explains why the BBQ is so spot on. He really brought his roots to Las Vegas!

While visiting Vegas for New Years, I had to try the "best of the best", this place did not disappoint! Exceptional quality and a team of craftsmen that know how to get the most flavor out of their meats. Generous portions and many sides to choose from. I can see why this place is so highly recommended. Multiple sauces to try, they complemented the meats and did not overwhelm. Very friendly staff that was quick to point us in the right direction for recommendations. They even have a cool fish tank created out of their original smoker...now that's dedication to their craft!

A friend told me about this place.  Let me start with - everything I ate was excellent.  All good cuts of meat, flavor, sauce, etc.  I had the corn fritters and potato salad as sides and both were perfect.  Their prices are very fair for what you get.  The service was top notch with about 3 people asking me if everything was good.  Unless you are maybe an ultra bbq snob, you will love this place if you love bbq.  This is a place I will definitely remember when I am in town again.  The only downside is that it is in the industrial area of town, and even that really doesn't matter.  The food does.  6 stars.

BBQ heaven. Finally it has arrived folks. Ive tried every kind of bbq in vegas looking for that special place. here it is. phenomenal. its a little whole in the wall not in the greatest area but by all means safe. I had the beef ribs and potato bacon salad. my wife had macaroni cheese and the pulled piggy sandwich. Everything was flavorful and very delicious. they didnt over due it with a whole bunch of mediocre food like memphis. very proportionate. id say its a little pricy but the food is to die for. ill pay for it anytime when i want great bbq. props to them hope they expand.

I love this place! The main reason is because as they've grown you can see it in the improvements of their restaurant. It won't be much longer before they are hiring Front of the House staff to man the tables! 

The food is good, The staff is nice. I like that they are getting their name out there and a local business being successful. 

On this trip I had the chicken, which is always good in flavor and spare rib, in the duo smokin plate. The spare rib was tender and tasty. I got the jalapeno coleslaw...it's so good! The BF got the Brisket Dog, omg! If I wasn't eating right, I'd devour that whole thing without a second thought! It was so good, anything with nacho cheese is good! The BF got the potato salad, which was basic but the bacon of course added a yummy touch! 

We love this place! We wish it much success and don't forget your free dessert with your Yelp check in.

Well I have a lot to say !!! I would give 10 stars if I could !!! First off the guy behind the counter (Dave I believe) was soooo friendly and soooo helpful as this was our first time there. We told him we were there for my daughters birthday (which is important later in this review).. Anway we ordered the trio and my daughter didn't want the chicken, so he replaced that with another rib ..(you can switch anything around , and depending what you get there may be a upcharge which is not bad. Now I had the brisket trio...OMG... burnt ends, sliced and chopped.. Plus I asked for a beef rib as well. The beef rib is gigantic..looked like a bone from the flintstones...so damn good..it was tender and just so damn good. My fiancé had the outlaw burger... OMG..Huge and delicious. Those onion straws are also the best I ever had.. Now after our meal, next thing we knew the cooks and Kathy (love her) came to our table and sang happy birthday to my daughter and brought a little dessert out for her.. How great was that..The staff are all so friendly and the service was speedy and all I can say is we can't wait to go back !!!!

This review is based on one visit only and the smoked brisket sandwich that I ordered. After reading all the rave reviews I was really disappointed. The brisket in the sandwich was very finely chopped instead of being sliced and it contained too much fat and gristle. I tried to doctor it up with their BBQ sauce but I didn't much care for the sauce which I assume is made in house.

With all the favorable reviews, I have to believe that all of Rollin' Smoke's menu items just can't be as bad as that brisket. So I may give them another try to sample some of their other items. And I'll bring some of my own BBQ sauce with me. If I do, I'll update this review.

I stopped by here last night as I have been meaning to do so for a while.  The place was loaded with people.  The servers were friendly, the food was good, and it wasn't hard to find.  

I came a bit after 6 and it was loaded.  Almost every seat at every picnic table was taken, and it is not a huge place.  There was a line of maybe 7 people in front of me.  I was going to get the all you can eat option, but decided to go was in my best interests since it was so packed.  

I had the corn nuggets which were great and the club sandwich which was comprised of many different kinds of meat- perfect for me as I was trying to decide which one I wanted.  The sandwich was pretty good, the bacon in the sandwich made it awesome.  

The only reason I give it 4 instead of 5 stars is because I rarely have bbq here in Vegas, and I have no idea if it is the best.  It was a little pricey and the wait was a little long. The food was good though, and some day I'll be back.

Scoured Yelp to find some BBQ for my In-Laws who were in town from Georgia (shout out to Yelp for the solid recommendation). We were definitely second guessing when the directions took us within a stones throw of a half dozen strip clubs, but we were so glad we went inside. 

Both of our Southern guests were blown away with their food. My wife (who was NOT thrilled when she heard we were getting BBQ instead of the salad/juice bar place she suggested) was beyond stoked with her meal, and I was hoping for a good selection of sides since I was the lone vegetarian entering hostile territory. 

The in-laws ordered a brisket sandwich, ribs and a handful of sides. My wife had the BBQ salad with white chicken, and my veggie ass had the mac n cheese, side salad, green beans, and waffle fries. We were all SO STOKED with our food that we kept bringing up how good our lunch was throughout the day. 

The place was clean, the staff was helpful and friendly, and the food (and wide array of sauces) really hit the spot. Don't let the neighborhood dissuade you, GO HERE, FOOL!

Just went and picked up a Big Mans from Rollin Smoke to have everyone in my office here in Henderson try it. Lets just say that everyone LOVE'S it. I had told everyone here in the office about it a while back but everyone lives out here in Henderson and never goes on the other side of town. From the time I walked in the door the smell of great BBQ filled up the offices. Everyone came out of their office to the front room and gasp of how much food and how great it smelt. I will always give John Holland and the guys at Rollin Smoke a 5 star. For a guy from AR he sure does know his stuff. I would also Like to say that Chief Yancey can make a MEAN melt. SOOOOO GOOD.. 
Love this pleace and Love the guys there.

OMG.  Stop reading this review and get yourself there before they close.  Awesome, awesome barbeque.  Ordered the 5 meat platter and seafood combo - gone in 5 minutes.  Yeah really.  Why are you still reading.......

This place loves hot spicy flavor!

I ordered a platter with ribs and pulled pork. It came with toast and a choice of side. I was hard pressed to find a side that wasn't spicy - jalapeño coleslaw and kickin' beans?! They let me substitute cornbread, and it was the best dang cornbread I've eaten in my life. So fluffy, so moist, so delicate, so smooth and sweet. Next time I need double corn bread! The ribs didn't have much of a smoke ring, but the smoke wasn't lacking and the rub was good. The sauce is spicy, but a perfect amount. The most impressive thing was when I asked for butter, they served me a container of warm melty butter, YUM!

My husband got brisket, which was kind of dry, but the seasoning was great, and it was perfectly salted. The loaded mashed potatoes were awesome, as if they mashed it using some of the bacon grease from the topping - so yummy.

Even my kid's food was good. The hot dog was a fat juicy meaty delicious thing, and he got hush puppies or corn nugget things that I couldn't stop stealing. The only thing he didn't like was that the cheese he ordered was spicy nacho cheese. No surprise.

This place is better than Dickeys, Road Kill Grill, and Famous Dave's, but Lucille's still takes the cake.

Went here around 7pm on Thurs nite. Not too busy so found table in the side room. Typical plain Rib place without too much atmosphere. Ordered the 4 meat combo and a 3 meat combo for 3 adults and 2 kids. Came with 4 sides. The pork ribs and pulled pork were very good, brisket was good but bit dry, BBQ chicken was fair as was the huge beef ribs. Mac and cheese was better than avg, waffle fries were good, fried okra and spicy beans were fair. Overall we all left full and satisfied. Not the best ribs I've had (love Bone Daddy's in Grapevine, TX) but satisfying. Don't go here for atmosphere or service.

We ordered brisket, hot links, pulled pork, kickin beans, jalapeño coleslaw, fried okra, & cornbread. Every single thing I ate was delicious. The brisket & pulled pork basically melt in your mouth. The hot links were the perfect amount of spicy. The jalapeño coleslaw had was a great mix of spicy sweet. I enjoyed every last bite and I could go on for days about the corn bread. I can't remember the last time, if ever, I've had such delicious mouth watering moist cornbread. Stop reading this & just go...go now!!

This place was amazing I have zero complaints other than I wish I had the appetite to try more items. I was in Vegas for about a week and this place stood out to me above most of the places I ate at here. I came here after walking around Fremont Street so it was on my way back to the Hotel.  At night this side street is dark and in an industrial part of town so if you're not used dark back roads come here in the day. The place seems small from outside but once inside it is pretty decent sized with outdoor seating. I got to the counter and the lady was nice enough to recommend the Rib platter special since I wanted to try so many different items. I also ordered the peach cobbler a la mode and a side of baked potato salad with two sauces their signature and their damn hot sauce. I took everything to go and once I drove 15 minutes to my room we tried all the food and it was amazing. It had a good hint of smoke and all the meat was soft and falling off the bone in the best possible way. The signature sauce was like liquid crack and I was about to drink it and the Damn hot was exactly what it says. I love spicy but the hot sauce burns all over your mouth so I am good with that but it had flavor so if you can handle it go for it. AS for the peach cobbler it was good and I like it but my wife likes crust and would have liked a bit more but flavor was on point. So I know I am coming back when I am in town and that happens at least once a year
Brought my coworkers here. Some of the best BBQ I've had. Make sure you get the fried onion strings as a side. Sooooo crispy and delicious.
Just ate there for the first time the other day...now I can't see myself going anywhere else for BBQ!  Hands down, the best in Southern Nevada!

I love my Ba Ba Barbeque Baby! And after going to the U.H. Warrior Football game.......what better way to end the evening then to eat some Ba Ba Barbeque!!!!

My friend suggested this place called - "Rollin Smoke Barbeque" so we flipped on our GPS and headed to the back roads to a seedy part of town (where there were a lot of strip clubs, bars, & adult book stores).........but then when we finally found this place and walked in............ I was in Ba Ba Barbeque heaven!!!!

The restaurant was really packed, and as we walked to the counter, the friendly clerk took our orders. After you order your food, you find an open table (good luck), and when your food is ready, they will bring your order out to you.

There is a Sauce station within the restaurant where you can get additional BBQ sauce. I want to point out.........try the "Mama Sweet" BBQ sauce! It was bomb @ss good! My friend liked this BBQ sauce so much, I actually saw him put it in a little cup & drink the sauce! That's how much he loved the BBQ sauce!

Before you sit down at your table, you will also have to get your own plastic eating utensils, napkins, as well as your own drinks, as the soda fountain within the restaurant was self serve.

For my meal that night, I ordered the "Trio Choice of Meats" - where I picked the following - Brisket, 1/4 Chicken, & 2 Spare Ribs. ($17.99)

One of my friends also ordered the "Trio Choice of Meats"  - where he picked the Brisket, 2 Spare Ribs, & Hot Links. ($17.99)

And my other friend ordered the "Duo Choice Of 2 Meats" - where he picked the Brisket, & Pulled Pork. ($13.99)

With our meals came with a side, and I ended up taking the corn bread. All of our meals came with collard greens, and the collard greens had some kind of smoked meat mixed inside.

What can I say about the grub?

I totally loved the BBQ Chicken! The chicken meat was all so soft, and the meal literally fell off the bone.......nice smokey flavor too! 
The spare ribs was also delicious, and I just loved how the meat came off of the bone so easily! I really loved how soft the BBQ ribs were....... 
As for the brisket.........it was just okay for me. Loved the smokey flavor, but I gotta tell you the brisket wasn't very soft. I've had better tasting brisket on Oahu.......from "Verde" in Kaimuki.

Overall a pretty good barbeque joint! No frills..........kinda of place, and they definitely churn out some pretty great barbeque meats! 

Be careful of your surroundings when coming here........if I was with my girlfriend, I'd probably pass on this place.........my friend also mentioned to me that if he was here with his wife & kids, he'd probably do the same.

Came here on advise from a friend, and he was right best BBQ South of Texas
Will be coming back again  got the Pit Special 5Meat
All their meat are on point  
Their BBQ sauce are as well pull together great Carolina sauce  their Sweet  BBQ sauce had just the right amount of sweet 
The  service was incredible. You are greeted at the Order counter by the sweetest lady (Brenda) she was very helpful in guiding you Thru  the menu   
And for all you Veterans out there they do give military discount  !!!
So if your in Las Vegas make the effort  you won't be sorry

The is the best BBQ place I have ever been to! I always get the brisket 3 ways plate, it's chopped, sliced and burnt ends. It's delicious! I have only tried the Mac and cheese, but other people I have been with said their sides were all very good. They had the baked beans and the loaded mashed potatoes. I recently went around 7 pm and the place was still crowded. It's become a tourist spot, but I would still recommend this place to anyone. It's not in the best area of Vegas but that's a small price to pay to get the best BBQ in town.

Great food, cheap for the size you get.
Make sure to come hungry or order one dish for two of you

Very classy location in the heart of the kinky sex district. All you can eat used to be a decent value, but ever since they raised the price by 20% it's no longer worth it. If the sushi places can offer all you can eat for $25, why is a barbecue place charging $10 more? Last I checked sushi-quality fish is a little pricier than beef brisket.

While in LV this week I drew on Yelp for a nearby recommendation and was pointed to Rollin Smoke BBQ. While the BBQ meats were very good the sides were great. Couldn't get the potato salad and mac & cheese off my mind so I headed back the next day and everything was better than the day before. I will stop in again anytime I'm visiting the area.

We got a platter with briskit pulled pork chicken and hot links, a spudtastic with briskit and a half rack of baby ribs. Jalapeño slaw, yams, fries, Mac & cheese. The food was out of this world then they gave us free dessert!!! Seriously out of this world. Best bbq I've eaten in Vegas. Ps this was more than enough food for my family of 6!!!

My husband and I have had the hardest time finding a good BBQ place in Vegas...until now. 

When you get out of your car and walk up to the door you are immediately hit with the most wonderful smell. Ordering happens at the cashier up front and the wait wasn't bad but considering that we went on a Saturday around 11:30am it probably gets incredibly busy later in the afternoon. 

The lady taking our order was super friendly and she recommended trying the burnt edges brisket. They do have an up charge and I am not sure how much but it was totally worth it. I ordered the combo two meat plate: burnt edges brisket & chicken and for my side I choose the corn nuggets. 

My husband got sliced brisket & chicken and his sides were Mac & cheese and collards. 

The burnt edges were so delicious and I can confidently say way better then the sliced version. I would pass on the collards and the chicken. The collards were too salty for my taste and the chicken was dry. However, the Mac and cheese and the corn nuggets were excellent. 

We will be back from some more burnt edges brisket and Mac&Cheese!

I am currently pregnant and as everybody knows it's not easy to please a pregnant lady.  I had the smoked meatloaf and it was DELICIOUS! you do leave smelling like smoke but it's worth it. not too pricey. We even took the leftovers home and i had enough for for three others meals. I'd def. recommend it!

Read about this place while on the and and decided to come here straight from the airport. Was not disappointed at all. Ribs just fall off the bone,  the outlaw burger is huge!! It has brisket in the party. Prices are good.  We will be back!

Came in for dinner, cashier was confused about the menu questions, it was my first time.
Ordered a combo, was tasty, only complaint
Was need more bbq sauces on the counter for customers, also the bbq chicken was not fully cooked, aside from that I will try again.

It takes a lot to satisfy me, I'm known to out eat men, maybe that's why I left feeling unsatisfied. 

The place itself is not hard to find, unless your GPS gives you the wrong directions and makes you drive right by it, thanks a lot Siri! 

I came in for dinner on a weeknight with my friend, since it was my first time I had no idea what to order and I failed to read the recommendations of others. I ended up ordering the beef hot link sandwich combo. It came with a drink and one side. When my order came out I looked at it and knew it was not going to be enough to fill me up. The price you pay for the amount of food you get was not justifiable to me. You get a small side that's as big as a KFC side and a plain hot link on bread. For my side I ordered the mac and cheese, it was okay, nothing spectacular, I've had better. The hot link was okay as well, it tasted like the ones you buy at the grocery store. 

Service was fast and cashier was friendly. When we came in there wasn't a line so we were in and out pretty quick. I'll update my review once I'm able to try more items but I was really not that impressed with my first visit.

We stopped over to Rollin Smoke on our little guys trip weekend! We stopped in on April 3rd 2015. Let me tell you this was the best BBQ place I have tasted in 15 years, that's right! The smoked Meatloaf was to die for, and the pulled pork and TriTip just melted in your mouth with the greatest flavor! I cannot express how much we can't wait to go back and fatten up with their awesome BBQ!! You have to try Rollin Smoke When your in Vegas! It's a cab ride away and you will be stunned of the food quality!

This is a must-go, must-eat, must-try bbq spot in Vegas.
If your'e visiting vegas, it's worth a short 4-5 minute drive from Fashion show mall to taste some of the best bbq i have ever had. We were staying at TI and it was right  across the freeway. 

This was the first time I tried beef ribs. It was cooked to prefection. It was tender fall off the bone, and paired perfectly with the zesty bbq sauce. My friends ordered the trio bbq, the hotlink sandwich, and the brisket sandwich. No one was speaking, we were all too consumed eating the food lol. Their curly fries were crispy, mac n cheese was cheesy, and their cobbler was fantastic.

The service was excellent. Food was brought out to our table. We sat on the outside bench, which was convenient for a party of 8. They checked up on us on several occassion to make sure we were happy with the food. The Chief took his time to come out to ask how we like the food. My boyfirend is a bbq fanatic, he had to go shake the hand of the man who made these fantatic food. 

They have made  a fan of me. I will definitely go back.

Family owned place, great customer service and even better food. I ordered the outlaw burger and my friend had the biggin. We both finished them quick since they were so good and we had our peach and blueberry cobblers waiting (a la mode of course). The cobbler was absolutely delicious, the bluebell ice cream really completed this meal. I wouldn't change a thing about this place. I'll travel from Henderson any day for this kind of service and food.

I visited this restaurant at the end of March because I heard the food was great. I was very disappointed with the customer service. The cashier Caleb was not very friendly as he greeted me .  No smile or have a nice day in fact he didn't seem too pleased to take my order.  The waitress Jessica also wasn't friendly . There was no kind word or smile as she shoved my food into my hands. Never once did I hear , "have a nice day or thank you "  The food was great but the customer service didn't make me want to return .  I visited a place called Yardbird and all their staff smiled and said , Hi .  As I left Yardbird every staff member I came across smiled and said , thank u for coming, have a good day or come back and see us as they smiled .  I felt more welcomed and appreciated at Yardbird.  Good Customer service is very important to me.
This place is marvelous. Great Barbeque and Southern cooking. I am thrilled to have found it on Yelp and its now part of my very short "must eat at" list of restaurants.

This place is tucked away but not far off the strip. I have been here twice with my boyfriend and it has never disappointed. Cute clean place, very welcoming and great service. We have had the shrimp Po boy, the three meet special and their mom's meatloaf. God bless it all but the one dish that made us almost cry was the meatloaf. AMAZING!!!! Taste and texture co mingled like 2 swans on a lake. The flavors opened up beautifully. All the sides have been fantastic especially the corn nuggets & bacon potato salad This is one LA girl who cant wait to go back.  Try hard to save room for dessert.... Oh and....I like pig butts & I cannot lie!!!
This is by far the best barbecue restaurant in town. The banana pudding, mac & cheese, and corn buffered  were  amazing sides.

All I can say is those darn corn nuggets are to die for!!! The beef ribs were tender and the hot links had a good kick to them! The service was great and the food was amazing! Will definitely come back for more whenever I'm in town.

I eat a lot of BBQ... I thought the portions were excellent along with prices... I really try to eat a variety of things before I make an informed decision.... I had every thing on the menu... The taste of all the smoked meat was nothing short of excellent... And sides are excellent too. Especially the beans and cole slaw.... It was lip smacking and finger licking good... Kudos for bringing some excellent BBQ to Vegas

Amazing find! This BBQ rivals or exceeds the best we've found anywhere in the U.S. their brisket is smokey and falls apart ... the staff, especially James and Dusty the owner made the whole experience even better.

No matter what we tried ... every meat was distinct in flavor and texture and their selection of 5 or 6 homemade BBQ sauces provided unique new experience to each.

Don't even get me started on the sides ... from the mac and cheese to the collard greens (oooh those greens) 

The best surprise of all was the prices, yes best surprise ... so reasonable and for generous portions.

Take your time when you go ... enjoy the food and the people ... Strongly Recommend anyone from the BBQ novice to a competitive BBQ judge give it a try, you will not be disappointed.

I haven't had BBQ this good in years.  We did take out and set the food on the counter to start serving up. We never got to the table! We were all surrounding the kitchen island chowing down.  Yum Yum.  The beans are to die for. They must put in the brisket scraps into it, I was pulling chunks of meat out of them, along with the tasty brisket fat.

Best BBQ I have ever had.  Chef Holland was super accommodating to cater a small party.  Brisket & beans were absolutely the best.  Fantastic item not prominent in menu was the pulled chicken - melted in our mouths with amazing flavor.  Cole slaw is very spicy - watch out !  Potato salad was really tasty.  Did not get to try the ribs - next time.  Our experience with Rollin Smoke was just outstanding.

Good barbecue is one of the most rewarding finds in the culinary world. First, one has to learn about the place, then one has to hunt it down, then one has to resist the urge to leave... because NO barbecue restaurant worth it's prices boasts the most upscale  atmosphere or structural amenities. 

But then the food comes; and one is suddenly more happy to be sitting at that grubby, sweaty little picnic table than they could have ever anticipated. 

So, that being said, Rolling Smoke Barbecue is the finest quintessential barbecue experience I've had in fifteen years in Las Vegas.
