I learned about Rolling Smoke from one of their newest team-members, "Chef" Nick. He's been a close friend of mine for years, and he has been doing an amazing job promoting the business. He greeted me when I came in, too, which was classy. 

The service otherwise was gracious and friendly, the Atmosphere was as modest as barbecue gold mines can get, and the food...

Wow... The food.

The ribs, brisket, and pork I purchased practically melted in my mouth, leaving behind only the subtle texture of the meats' not-so-subtle spice rub; a rub that thankfully doesn't overpower the undeniably robust flavors of the proteins themselves. 

...A flavor that makes it completely understandable that the restaurant is perpetually inundated with a line of hungry patrons. Don't worry - though - the kitchen has it down and they churn out an order every fifty seconds or so.

Oh, and at just over $15 (prior to well-earned gratuity), this barbecue meal is certainly worth the price. 

Please, go check this place out. It will leave you entirely satisfied and grateful that you stuck around.

simply great! If you drive there with your windows down you can smell the goodness of the smokers from a block away. once I walked in my mouth started to water. Everything I have eaten there has been great. If you love BBQ this is the place to eat.

Amazing food.  The BBQ nacho fries are to die for.  Wish there was more room inside for moving around and sitting.  I like that they rearranged the main room to make it easier to order and pay.  Hope they build new locations that are closer to my area.

Great and tasty meat! Superb place off the touristic LV strip. The ribs and the Brisket were perfectly cooked. The outlaw burger was huge but had all the flavours it needed. We will for sure visit this place again on our next visit in Sin City :-)

We heard about Rollin Smoke through a show on the Travel Channel.  Since my family are true BBQ fans, we had to try it.  It's off the strip in an industrial area, but it is SO WORTH leaving the strip to try this restaurant.  When we arrived, Dusty was at the smoker & spent a few minutes showing it to us & chatting. I ordered the pork BBQ & beef brisket & it was the best I've EVER had & we have had BBQ all over the south.  The sauce was terrific, but the meat was so good, it didn't need sauce, so I ate 1/2 with & 1/2 without.  My son was excited to have good ol' sweet tea since we now live in Utah & it's hard to find.  The banana pudding was the best I've ever had at a restaurant & truly tasted like grandma made it.  Dusty joined us again & chatted some more, showing us the overflow room & the cool cooker fish tank built by the guys from Tanked.  All in all, it was one of the highlights of our Vegas trip.  Can't wait to go back!!!

The hype is real. Rollin Smoke is bomb. I took my man here for his birthday dinner and he LOVED it. He got the AYCE special for $34.99, and I got a 2 meat combo plate and added a drink. The total was around $60 for both of us. This is an order at the counter, seat yourself place which I dont mind at all. 

The AYCE special is anything on the menu any day and anytime. The menu consists of a plethora of meats, burgers, sandwiches, sides, and desserts. My bf loaded up on the meats, I think he tried pretty much every meat in the place. Ribs, meatloaf, chicken, pulled pork and wings, just to name a few. His consensus is the meatloaf is bomb and the baby backs are delicious. He enjoyed the other meats as well, but those were his favorite. He had 3 plates each consisting of 3 meats AND sides, so he definitely got his moneys worth. If you have a hearty appetite, AYCE is the way to go.

For my meal, I got a 2 meat combo with chopped brisket and spare ribs, and for my side I chose mac & cheese. The food was delicious. I really loved the ribs. They were so tender and meaty and fall off the bone. A good rib needs no sauce, and these did not need any. Speaking of sauce, they have like 5 different bbq sauces, ranging from sweet to spicy. I personally love a good vinegar based sauce, so I enjoyed their Carolina sauce the best. But they have something for everyone. The chopped brisket was yummy too, although I would probably get the brisket sliced next time. The only thing I did not like was the mac and cheese. It was realllly runny and pretty bland, but they have like 10 other sides to choose from. I can't wait to come back for some more yummy BBQ.
Some of the best BBQ I have ever had. The staff was azing and the Arkansas BBQ sauce is to die for. I hands down recommend this place to anyone looking for delicious, fall off the bone BBQ.

Found this place on Yelp! while on vacation. 
We were about to give up when we saw the dirty industrial area you drive through. 
We found it and it looked small but smelled good. 
We were glad we stuck it out. They're food is well worth the drive. 

PROS: 
Great taste
Good portions 
Cool tables outside 
Meats were very tender

CONS: 
Area is very industrial 
A little hard to find at first 
Staff do not come and wipe tables often

Best BBQ place in Las Vegas! Their food is so delicious that I just crave it all the time!! The employees are always super friendly. And their Hot Damn Bbq Sauce is the hottest barbecue sauce I've ever had! And I just love it. It's definitely a burn your face off sauce! Just a great place!! It's a must try type of place!!

The best BBQ my family and I had ever! 
Don't forget to try their peach cobbler! Out of this world!

I enjoy these self-serve spots where you refill your own drink and clean up after yourself. Don't even have to tip and you can quickly eat and leave if you're pressed for time, rather than having to wait on someone to refill your drink and bring you the bill. This is similar to a fast food spot in those aspects, line up to order and pay. When your food is ready, they'll bring it out like a sit-down restaurant and call your name. 

Prices are reasonable. 

Outlaw burger: it was good but nothing amazing. Lots of onion straws. 

BBQ nacho fries: I like the waffle structure of the fries, it gives it a different texture.  The pulled pork in it was flavorful.

Ok, saw this on triple D and have been looking for good Que since I have arrived 6 yrs ago. I think I have accomplished that! 
We had the mighty beef ribs, spare ribs, and boy were they good!
Beef rib moist n meaty fun finger food. The 1/2 rack of the spare ribs... also tried the mac n cheese (forgettable.. Very creamy but no cooked crust and not so flavorful), and the kicken beans. I can't WAIT to go back.

If you want texas style BBQ, this is probably the best in town.

I haven't found any sides here that I would rate 5 stars by themselves. I won't deduct points for that.

Amazing service, great crew and to die for BBQ. We were served with a smile. And our group made some fun friends today. They even came out and served us some burnt ends for free to try. I was blown away. Never have I had better service. 

So to the point. If you want amazing food and an even better experience. Go here. That was more than lunch. That was a great time. Thanks for making us feel so welcome.

If I ever decide to give up having a meaningful physical relationship with another human being, I will buy a booth in this place and proceed to eat BBQ and "the fixins" for the rest of my days.  Until that time, I try to keep my visits here to a couple a month.  Given how good the food is, that has proven difficult.

Two weeks ago, I took some co-workers here and one of them ordered the fried shrimp.  I know!  Stupid, right?  WRONG!  Because she eats like a bird, she gave each of us a piece and dang!  That was some amazing fried shrimp.  The batter has a lot of spices and is similar to the cornmeal batter used for catfish.  So good.  The regulars in our group agreed that the fried shrimp is our next order.  

Lately, I've noticed that business is really picking up.  Glad to see it, but I considered keeping my mouth shut about this place from now on.  My duties as a Yelper won out in the end.  I go to lunch pretty early, so my current mission is to make it here when the greens are ready (these take a hot minute to cook right), because there's really not much I love more than good greens.  If my meaningful physical relationship with another human being does not work out, I may marry The Pulled Piggy with a side of kickin beans.

Absolutely delicious BBQ, exceptionally friendly staff! 

I've lived in Vegas for about 9 months now and people have often mentioned that I need to try this spot. SO glad I finally did. Visually, it's no beauty and it's not on the most beautiful street in town. HOWEVER, they're putting out some of the best BBQ you've ever tasted. 

I went with the burnt ends brisket, hot links, and waffle fries. For dessert I got peach cobbler a la mode. 

The guy at the checkout counter (Dave) was unbelievably nice. Even though the line was long he took the time to give me suggestions specific to what I like and what id ordered. So matched the best sides with my meats. The wife went with brisket chopped and yams. Everything was GREAT. 

The sweet tea is housed in Nestea containers so I thought it was going to be the syrup mixed with water. But I watched them pouring brewed sweet tea into the top. Impressed! 

The dessert was good but I would say that in the future I won't get the ice cream inside on top. I think it may have taken away from the deliciousness of the cobbler. 

Regardless, I highly recommend this place.

This is one of my favorite little hidden secrets in Vegas!!  Great prices,  great good,  a gem in my book.  This was my 2nd time here and just as pleased as the first time.  I had the BBQ meatloaf last time,  which was amazing,  I would call it one of their signature dishes for sure.  The ribs are great,  the chicken was a little undercooked today but great flavor my friend said.  I got the catfish as the guy there told me it was the best in town,  and that it was,  big claim but he came through and delivered.  Light,  flaky,  crispy with a ton of flavor,  served with hush puppies,  I got the greens as a side and it came with cornbread and a drink for $10.99. You can't beat that!!!  It is on my foodie list and highly deserved!!

Ok I am at Rollin Smoke right now and I can tell you for sure this is one of the best places for bbq in vegas! Oh my goodness its so good! Ordered the beef short ribs (not short at all, almost a lbs of meat), loaded mashed potatoes and mac & cheese. Every single dish is phenomenal and the ribs are something special. The meat literally falls off the bone and is incredibly tender. The bbq sauce is just spicy enough and has perfect flavor. Love the atmosphere, just off the strip a little joint not hard to find. Great place 100% recommended!!!

All I can say is BRISKET. It was so delicious and tender. The hush puppies were a great surprise...they were little jalapeno  and cornbread bites of heaven. The chicken was also pretty damn delicious. My mom had the potatoes salad and she pretty much scraped the cup clean...so I'm sure she loved it. 

And last but not least, we experienced some of the best customer service I've every encountered in Vegas. Rusty, the Pit Master, and the rest of the good folks here were super hospitable. They made us feel right at home. 

Definitely coming back

Good barbecue for Las Vegas. Not the best barbecue in the world but it definitely hits the spot when you're traveling in Sin City. I recommend the ribs, fried fish, and their greens are excellent. The location is a little bit sketchy after sunset but the interior design is pretty cool. The staff is always polite and helpful and their recommendations are pretty on point. The macaroni and cheese and potato salad aren't quite up to par with the rest of the menu. Overall it's a decent place to grab some barbecue.

We were referred here by Acrylic Tank Manufacturing (Tanked) as not only a local place to see one of their tanks, but as one of the best places for BBQ in Vegas, and especially I should try the Meatloaf. 

The restaurant is way off the beaten path, on strip club alley, in a dank industrial part of town, under a freeway overpass. I was impressed with the overfull parking lot and the line out the door, thinking this must be some good stuff. 

The place seemed kind of run down, and the Aquarium was really disappointing. I guess it lets you know how much they care about their place. After all, who pays thousands, or tens of thousands for a custom aquarium, then replaces the amazing fish with feeder goldfish, the tank was dirty and the special features didn't function. 

Back to the restaurant though, so I order, and while ordering my wife wanted some sauce to go, and the menu has prices for cup, pint, quart, gallon or whatever. I ordered a pint of house and a pint of Carolina. We ordered to eat there and paid the $50 for the 2 of us. We went and sat down, about 20 minutes later I went looking for our food, that never came, and found a girl, food runner, whatever, with our food boxed up to-go in a bag wandering around looking for us... Confusing since I ordered for dine in...

Took the bag to my wife and we opened it to start eating, and there were in addition to the 2 Styrofoam clamshells with our food, like 16 little tiny 2oz sauce ramekins. Not the glass Mason jars in the case. 

I thought the meatloaf was borderline just ok, It pretty much just crumbled apart, had to use the mashed potatoes as a binder to keep the bits of meat on the fork. I make better meatloaf myself, in fact I smoke better food in general than they do. My wife had the Pulled Pork, she "enjoyed" it, but didn't finish it

As a BBQ connoisseur, having enjoyed BBQ in Texas and several other states, I would have to say this does not even come close to ranking as good BBQ. 

Life is short, so I would not likely return.

Was surprised at the high rating. I will say the chicken was excellent. The pork, brisket, and hot links were all average at best. The sides were average too. The man taking orders was nice, but the guys delivering the food were so rude. I can't believe I tipped (you tip when you pay for the food at the beginning).

It's always a good sign when you show up at a BBQ place and several smokers are fired up in the parking lot. I found this place on Yelp and wanted to try a new BBQ place on my business trip to Vegas. This place did the trick and then some.

Excellent, friendly service. Pulled pork, brisket and mac and cheese were all very good. Very tender meat with a smoke flavor that was just right -- not overpowering at all. Sauce was slightly vinegary and was definitely peppery, as someone else mentioned, but I like that. Next time, I want to try the hot links and ribs.

And don't skip the banana pudding.

There's plenty of time for the chains. This is the kind of place that I hope both locals and tourists would support.

Ok. Second & third trip here has verified Rolling Smoke as the best BBQ "Joint" in Vegas for my money. Links are far and away my favorite. Their ribs, brisket, & potato salad are very close seconds. The service is friendly and the price is very fair. The sometime long wait is to be expected when you have food and the associated reputation that goes with it this good. A must for bbq lovers and non cooks

Went there for lunch..... again.  They never disappoint. The food is great, the service reminds me of the mom-n-pop places back in Georgia.  Will keep going back again and again.  Easily the best BBQ place in town.  They do it right there, and make you feel at home.

Phenomenal. These guys get barbeque, AND southern hospitality.

There's not much to say. I'm from the deep South and they made me feel right at home. 

There's a little more Arkansas flavor to the bbq than a Texan is used to, but don't get it twisted. This is the best barbeque in all of Vegas.

If you're considering going, just do. You'll be glad you did. And yes. They've got sweet tea!

This is the best BBQ I've ever had in Vegas and the food is a solid 5!   The 4 is actually a 4.5 (unfortunately Yelp doesn't offer that option) because I rate my dining experience on food, atmosphere and service. My few niggles to follow later.

If anyone is hesitant about the area,  don't be.  You can smell the smoky goodness down the block and it will draw you in like the crack den of BBQ that it is.

This is a family run hole in the wall and the plastic cutlery atmosphere suits it.  We sat in the mural covered back room, our first hint that the owners hailed from Arkansas.  We didn't even know that Arkansas "did" BBQ, my who knew concerning that state began and ended with the now Vegan Bill Clinton; little did I suspect that I would be in for a presidential Q.

We arrived around 3:00, as they close at 8:30 PM Monday-Thursday and made our way to the back room before we placed our order at the podium in the front room.  And here comes a niggle-most of the tables were not wiped down and nor would they be for some time after we arrived.  I don't mind lolling around in my own juicy, fat and Q juice runoff, but I'm not a fan of cleaning up someone else's.  Niggle two was a less than pristine bathroom.  I'm hoping that all this was due to the time of day, more than a recurrent daylong drawback.

We both ordered the $24.95 all you can eat, so we could sample a greater number of things and graze off of each other's plates.  We placed our order with John (one of the owners) I was trying to gauge the amount of food that we would be getting and he thought my beef rib order would be a bit too much, but I let him know I was a good little eater.  I may be short, but I do have some amazing chow down capacity.

We then prepared ourselves for a leisurely wait, eagerly sniffing in the smoke fumes.  There were only two diners in our room, and one of them decided to share his phone Gangsta Rap at mega-volume, I stopped sniffing at the air and unleashed a very annoyed and loud "REALLY!?!?!" but it wasn't until his food arrived (fortunately quickly) that this rude dipshit lowered his personal jukebox.

Then our meal arrived and the gluttonous food orgy began.  For sides we had the corn bread, fried onion straws, greens, corn nuggets-all contenders for a pure outstanding deliciousness award, some tasty curly fries and a ok roll.  For meats we had pulled pork, hot links, beef ribs, pork ribs, rib tips-all perfectly smoked and overwhelmingly delectable.  The chicken and brisket were good and the sauce was nicely spiced not too sweet. We ate till it hurt; leaving the final stretch of mass stomach expansion for dessert, a tasty berry cobbler and banana pudding.

Halfway through my cobbler I hit my max and gave up.  If we could have lolled around and napped we might have been able to finish, or explode.  I stopped short of saving a well picked bone to save and use as a Pebbles Flintstone hair clip just so I could savor that smoky goodness for the rest of the day.

Big kudos to John and his family for taking the chance on this business.  We loved their attentive service, hospitality.  We will be back once we recover from the meat sweats and BBQ hangover!

Awesomeness!!! They catered our work lunch and everything was excellent! When they ran out of food, the wait for them to bring more wasn't bad considering it was lunch time and they'd already fed 300+ of us. You could tell that Matt (one of the servers) felt genuinely bad that we were waiting but he kept a smile and sense of humor the whole time. Great food and customer service! Definitely will be having this again and again =)

Please note that the platters may be a little on the pricey side, but there's enough to feed two people.  Very good food, fun atmosphere, but the huge tables make it so that you'll probably be dining with strangers.

Man this place is insanely good. I hope it stays a hidden gem. Their beef ribs are super moist, juicy and falls right off the bone. Brisket, smoked chicken and catfish are just amazing. I brought my father in law here, who is from the south, and he said this is the best southern food he's had since he left decades ago. Definitely my go to spot a least once a week. 

Dusty is also the man.
This is true southern BBQ and absolutely delicious. Certain items can be a little pricey but overall it is all worth it and you will leave full and happy.
This place has some of the best BBQ I've ever had. The pulled pork absolutely melted in my mouth! I didn't have a sandwich, yet, and I can't wait to try one.

Was drawn to this place by yelpers.  We over ordered and there's nothing to write home about.  There's no smoke flavor, spare ribs were dry and cold, catfish soggy, and the rest is meh.  Dickies or Phil's would smoked this joint any day of the week and pun intended.  Oh, a little guidance during ordering would have avoided us over ordering...but after tasting the food, no wonder you're eager to push out as much mediocre meat as you can.  One and done for me.

The food was awesome and the place was packed!!! Our sons had the Outlaw Burger and they said it was the best they've had. My husband and I had The Pit Special and Smoked Meatloaf and it was delightful. This place is a definite . We also had the Kicken' Beans, Collard Greens and Dirty Rice

Sadly I must update my rating based on my most recent visit on 8/14/15. A mere 5 weeks ago I posted a rave review on this business and its food; however, I must take a step back today from my initial review, but not because the food isn't any less than great.

I can understand the rapid success of a business making ownership proud of their product, but the immense price increases noted on the new menu (3rd increase in just a few months that I am aware of) are quite staggering to say the least! On 7/9/15 I ordered a 3 meat plate w/one side and drink for $13; yesterday, that same 3 meat meal "deal" came w/one side for $17.99, AN INCREASE OF 5 BUCKS and NO DRINK???? Not a single person in line when I ordered and still a 10 minute wait for my smaller 2 meat plate order (only due to new 
price increase). 

Similar price increases across the board on most all menu items; has success spoiled RSB so much that it has decided to cash in now at the expense of the customers who helped them get there or is this just another case of ownership killing the goose that lays the golden eggs?

Great barbecue; YES. Worth the wait and $$$; sadly, not for me anymore.

I saw this place on tv so I had some time on a Tuesday afternoon while I was in town for work! Holy crap... Awesome! Small homey location! The service is great... Everyone is super friendly the food came out fast and they didn't run out of anything! Sooo good ! I will definitely be coming back with friends in tow next time! I love it ... I never really think of Arkansas as BBQ state but damn is it good ! I loved all the meat particularly the baby back ribs and brisket but I found myself using the meat as a vessel to all their awesome BBQ sauces to my mouth lol! All of them were good !

Best barbeque I have ever had. Great flavor with the pulled pork and the brisket, ate more than I should have at lunch, which allowed me to skip dinner. Good waffle fries. Not a place for the diet conscious as your stomach will take over.

Found this place via Yelp when it just opened and have been going there ever since. I take friends and family to try this delicious family-owned BBQ spot. Love Dusty, his dad and everyone who works there; the whole staff is super friendly! The location makes it a diamond in the rough, but it's worth the drive always! 

The food is AMAZING! You can't go wrong with anything. My favorite is the pulled piggy topped with jalapeño cole slaw. Just took a friend today and she got and loved "Dad's Favorite." They also have yummy dessert options. I always get the sweet tea when I go; it's a staple. 

If you're reading this and haven't gone, what are you waiting for?! :)

Very good BBQ. Some of the best we have had. A few different sauces to choose from. Brenda at the counter was so friendly and made it a great experience. Located in a industrial section of Vegas. Might want to consider take out if you have kids.

Easily one of the best BBQ joints I've ever had the pleasure to pig out at. Granted, I've never eaten at any smokehouse below the Mason-Dixon line (shame on me), I can easily say a trip to Vegas would be incomplete without stopping by Rollin Smoke.

The place itself is off the beaten path and very unassuming on the inside. You'll need to venture outside of the Strip to get here, and if you're walking from your hotel, you might just come across a tumbleweed. But if you do make the wise decision of coming out here, your mouth will thank you for it.

Everything I tried was pure barbecue heaven. And I did order a lot -- smoked sausage, pork ribs, beef ribs, pulled pork, and brisket. The brisket is at the same level as the stuff they serve at Fette Sau in Williamsburg, Brooklyn, and that's saying a lot.

4.2 in all reality I really want to give it a 5 star but something doesnt allow me to. Don't get me wrong delicious brisket, sausage, ribs, pulled pork. The load baked potato also blew my mind.

They only have one BBQ sauce, gracias a dios, it was really good. I just like a variety of tastes in my mouth... take it as you will. My personal favorites were the sausage and pulled pork. The initial kick of the brisket was good (we got burnt tipped) but I was over it after awhile. 

There sides are what really blew my mind. They were all really good, coleslaw, beans, mac n cheese, everything!! They were so good, i recommend all of them. We dropped about 40 dollars which was enough to feed four grown men... or three grown men and me, which is the equivalent of a 13 year old boy. So 3 and a half people. 

This is also on the outskirts of the city BUT it is totally worth the trip if you are in the mood for BBQ.

THE VERDICT: Get your BBQ on here... i have not tried anywhere else but... I am pretty sure there are other places but... this is now my place in LV. The sauce will will light up your mouth, and you will not be disappointed. In fact you will be happier than you have been in years... and thats a guarantee.

right next door to Trump - and some Damn good BBQ!  Service was quick and friendly.  You come here for the food and not the ambiance, but the place looks nice - it's just in a weird, but safe location

Wanted to try this place for a while. I'm sure glad we did I had two meat plate with chopped brisket an hot links side of mac n cheese Brisket a little fatty but real good hot links great  flavor. GF had pulled pork sandwich and side of beans She loved it The beans were spot on great flavor You must try this place.
Excellent food.  Good service.  I'm a fan.  I have had this on my restaurant bucket list for quite some time, but I finally tried it.  I will go back.
The best ribs in town!!! All the food is so good. Have to stop here every time I'm near.

Rolling Smokes Barbecue is hands down, the best barbecue restaurant in Vegas! I stopped by for lunch, and ordered the chopped brisket sandwich with a side of mac and cheese. Everything was amazing! The chopped brisket was cooked perfectly, it was very tender and it didn't contain any fatty pieces. Rolling Smokes barbecue is a bit expensive but it's worth every penny. Their barbecue is excellent!

Amazing food! Incredible service! Stop reading this and go there now, you won't be sorry. 

Las Vegas did not have Barbeque until Rolling Smoke opened, thank God they are here.

Everything about this place is GREAT!  I could go on for paragraphs about the food.  We ordered some of everything,  even the catfish. 

Brisket - AMAZING (not fatty,  cooked perfect),  Pulled Pork - OUT OF THIS WORLD, Spare Ribs - MOUTH WATERING, Chicken- VERY GOOD (it may have been touch dry but I couldn't tell because I covered it in their delicious sauce), Catfish - one of the best I have had,  light crispy and flavored perfect a  definite surprise for a BBQ joint.  There is basically no dish on the menu that you can go wrong with, even the sides were great.

Now about the service:

I was worried when we pulled up;  the place is small and there was literally a line out the door (Saturday night dinner).  Remarkably,  the line was so quick we barely waited - I don't know how they did it but it was perfect.  We got amazing personal service and it was quick (figure that one out).  If the food is amazing,  then the service is AMAZING x10!

After we placed out order our waiter,  a younger guy with blonde dread lock type hair, delivered it to our table.  The place was packed,  I had been watching the waiter and he never stood still  or stopped moving,  it was BUSY but he took the time to tell us about each dish and came back 3 times to see if we liked everything. Not only did he come by the but the Chef came over to each table to welcome the customers,  tell them about the dishes and make sure they liked everything.  We even had one more guy from the kitchen come over and check on us.  It was amazing service,  you just don't get service like that in Vegas anymore.  You can see everyone obviously loves their job and loves that restaurant - the attitude a made the place fun and enjoyable to a whole different level.  I can't say enough good things about our waiter,  he was 5 star service and just a nice guy- we would probably go back for him alone but the food is the shining star of this place.

The only regret I have is that I forgot to buy Barbeque sauce to take home,  good excuse to go back this week :)

WE WILL BE BACK- so much on the menu to try.  Between the three of us we had a good variety and everyone was happy, happy, happy.  Little bit of a wait to get the food, but the tables outside were a perfect place to catch up with an old friend while we waited.

Some of the Best BBQ you can get in Vegas.

Neighborhood is a little industrial, but don't let that stop you.

I have only eaten her once but I was impressed. When I first pulled up I was hesitant but after I walked in I no longer felt that. The staff was super nice and the food was very good. I will defiantly return.

Reasonably priced and the food was great. Really is the best in Vegas for BBQ. Servings are pretty big, so expect to take a small box home. And the baked potato is the best I've ever had. However it is a meal on its own.
Dave the rocks excellent food excellent customer service and I recommend you to come you will be back

This place is awesome!!! Like seriously! The food is bomb and everyone was very friendly and helpful without even asking. I felt very welcomed and comfortable. One group had a special request and the cook came off the grill to make sure everything turned out great. #CustomerService Get The Pit Special.
The barbecue was great but the side dishes need to bigger for Catering, like beans n Mac cheese.

The best food experiences are always the unexpected ones. We happened to be driving around off strip and saw this place out of the corner of our eye. Feeling the hunger pangs that had been growing all day we decided to go against the Vegas standard of hitting up a buffet and stopped in. It's a small place, rather unimpressive from the outside and your standard BBQ joint in the inside but you won't regret the food! We ordered the rib tips, the burnt ends and the hot links, all by the pound and shared between the all of us as a snack. Everyone was in agreement that it was some of the best bbq they've ever tasted and I'd have to agree. Spicy, smokey and not the overly sweet stuff other places serve. The favorite had to be the burnt ends, I could've eaten just that with some of the sides that I was eyeing. Next Vegas trip, I'm forgoing a buffet and spending a few good hours and eating the all you can eat special they've got there. Here's to next time!
Wowzers. The outlaw burger is so good it should be outlawed... Get it ? No. Kay cool.

SOLID BBQ! This is one of the best BBQ places I've ever had. It's a must. 

FOOD: 
Brisket- We ordered the burnt ends of he brisket and I'm glad we did. They were melt in your mouth pieces of bbq heaven. Great smoky flavor and once again, beyond tender. 

Pulled Pork- Excellent flavor, great portion size, nice and smoky. This may be the greatest pulled pork I've ever had. 

Sides: Mac N Cheese (Cheesy and delicious), baked beans (best I've ever had), coleslaw (Excellent). 

Service: INCREDIBLE! I couldn't believe how fast they got the food out. They were extremely friendly and knowledgeable. I can't say enough about how awesome their customer service was. Top notch!

IN CONCLUSION: This place is a MUST if you are in Las Vegas. It will become my got to place while visiting Vegas. This isn't just a BBQ joint, this is an experience. To get the full experience in sin city, don't even think about skipping out on this place.

Okay so here we go the BBQ needed more flavor the top part where the smoke was was okay but when you get into the rib it had no flavor the brisket was the same way I'm a chicken was the same way really lacked flavor when you bit into it the rib tips however had a lot of flavor also good was the corn nuggets and the banana pudding the peach cobbler didn't float my boat now let's get onto the hamburger it had a lot of flavor is very moist and I would order it again but that's only if I go back I'm still looking for the best barbecue in Las Vegas and Dave's barbeque still is the best in my opinion years ago they had a gates barbecue in town but it closed down because the owners son like to gamble which is a shame because that was the best barbecue in Las Vegas they're also famous in Kansas City and still have a store there all in all not the best barbecue in Vegas I'm going to keep searching
Super busy line went quick food was fast. Sides are great gonna go back and try more side. Beans and mac&cheese down

So Delicious... Food game out fast and was succulent and tender. I ordered the beef ribs and they brought me two HUGE ribs and I ordered a side of mac and cheese. The mac and cheese was the BEST Ive ever had! Like au gratin style with cheddar cheese sprinkled on top. I am definitely coming here again on my next visit and bring some new comers as well.

The food was AMAZING!! If you want superb BBQ this is the place to get it! 
The reason I only give 4 stars is because we were kept waiting for 35 minutes after we ordered, and people who came in and ordered after us got their food before we did. AND they must have had a VIP come in shortly after we ordered because they were sending out trays and trays of food before we got ours too. I mean, I understand having a VIP, but We shouldn't have to wait 20-25 minutes longer than we were told for what we paid for, and receive our food after others that came in and ordered well after we did. 
We will be back again and maybe we'll give 5 stars :) the food is definitely 5 stars, service could have been better.

Do not miss the beef rib, probably the best I've ever tasted.  The brisket may be too lean for some, for me it was perfect.  The only thing I'd steer away from: the spare ribs, go for the baby back instead if you must have ribs.  As everyone else says, the portions are enormous.  By far the best you'll find in this town.  And would measure up pretty good anywhere.  Go here by all means!

Location: located off the strip and in a very shady area. Very hard to find even w/ GPS.

Ambiance: typical smokehouse feel

Service: the cashier was friendly, not a lot of service, it's like a fast food/ take out. 

Went at 2:30pm on a Wednesday, there were still walk-in traffic but no line.

Food: order the platter of Brisket/ Chicken/ Pull Pork/ Sausage/ Rib and 2 sides of Mac n Cheese and Corn Nuggets w/ Sweet Tea.

Chicken was very moist and juicy w/ a hint of smoke. very good.
Pull Pork was also very good
Sausage goes well w/ the bread they serve, also very good.
Rib: wasn't try, right amount of sweet but didn't like the raw green onion they sprinkle on top. they can take that out for all i care, but it was also very delicious.
Brisket: totally chopped up and shredded into pull pork sizes. very peppery and flavorful but never had brisket like that before...

Both sides were solid and very good. 

For the price, all that for $30 was reasonable for me as it was shared and we had plenty of leftovers.

Was very good for restaurant quality BBQ. Would def. come back and will crave whenever I'm in town.
The food is unbelievable.... Once you try it you are hooked.... A must when you come to Vegas... Tried the rest of the BBQ places this blows them away !!!

Just got in from visiting Texas so Hubbs and I decided to compare what we ate out there (Texas) to Rollin Smoke BBQ , here in Vegas. Mmmmm. Very good. Had the Duo plate and ordered an  extra side.. had the ribs, brisket greens and yams.. Delicious!!  The BBQ sauce was on the side , in a bottle and had fantastic flavor.. We will be back for sure!! Only thing is the yams were a little too sugary but everything else was delicious!  Buy a shirt while you are here. They are funny!!

WOW! So Great

My son and I went there for late lunch. I ordered the Biggie Dad, (brisket, pork, and hot link) on a bun with pickles, mac n cheese. My son got same. We really 3 enjoyed it. We back and order one to go, and the Guy ask me if I was local, said Yes! He ask me since I had on my Danica Patrick shirt if I like Nascar, said yes. He gave 4 free tickets to the truck race this weekend. How cool is that! A great place to return back too.

I like this place but the service is slow and food was not bad. The table we sat in was sticky and the general cleanliness of the place was sub-par in my opinion. Maybe I was expecting too much based on the other reviews but I can't give this place high marks. I'll try it again in the near future and see if I come to a different conclution next time.
Hidden Vegas treasure! The food was awesomesauce! If you want bbq this is definitely the place to go!

Fantastic little hole in the wall BBQ joint ! 5 stars does not do this place justice, I have been dying to try this place for months now I bookmarked it when I knew we were coming to Vegas I will definitely make this a pit stop every time we come into town. We had the bacon potato salad with Mac n cheese & the biggin sandwich. The meat was so flavorful and just melted in your mouth, with just the right amount of seasonings. We got our food in a timely manner, you definitely won't be disappointed with whatever you choose

Items Selected:

AYCE Plate 1 - Brisket, Pulled Pork, Spare Ribs, Corn Nuggets, Hush Puppies
Banana Pudding
Corn Bread
AYCE Plate 2 - Beef Rib, Smoked Chicken, Smoked Meatloaf, Loaded Mashed Potato, Fried Onion Strings
Peach Cobbler with Blue Bell Ice Cream

Having recently returned from a Lone Star State tour of smoked meat Meccas ranging from Black's and Snow's to Pecan Lodge and Franklin it was with modest expectations but high hopes that I approached Rollin Smoke, a space many locals and critics have hailed as the best barbeque in Las Vegas, and opting to explore the menu through a generous $24.99 all-you-can eat program I must say I walked away a (very full) believer.  Located on South Highland where outdoor smokers and burning hickory alert the senses to something more than industrial surroundings Rollin Smoke is as small and homey as many a' Texas or Kansas City 'cue spots and staffed by Razorback pitmaster Trey Holland plus a dedicated team of enthusiasts the service is every bit on par with that down south - a true love of the art noted in lengthy answers to questions about woods, temperatures, and process while simultaneously making sure every guest is content.  Featuring a diverse menu with spices and rubs harkening the style of BBQ found across the south but a bit more aggressively sweet than that in Texas it was with a trio of smoked meats, two must-order sides, and buttery cornbread that I began and although brisket was a bit drier than I'd prefer the smoke was prominent and flavor was on point - a trend extending to fatty ribs and supple pulled pork that lacked not for juices, the latter falling just short of KC's Oklahoma Joe's reference standard.  Still nibbling at the creamy corn nuggets as plate two arrived it was here that I sampled Holland's two most raved items and with a blackened caramelized crust overlying tender flesh and melted collagen the beef rib wowed just as much as the signature meatloaf, absolutely rife with hickory notes and light heat amidst a delicately packed beef.  Ignoring decent but mundane chicken and mac n' cheese I found inedibly bland compared to the rich potatoes and previous fried sides it was with a duo of desserts that I rounded out the tasting and suffice it to say that while banana pudding tastes straight from a box the focus should instead be directed to the cobbler, a bubbling bowl of soft peaches with buttery pie crust crowned with Texas' own Blue Bell vanilla - a perfect end to a pretty damned good meal by any standard.

truly amazing !The brisket  Awesome!  Hush puppies, Corn balls .Tasty.Yams are the best  I ever had , the Mac and cheese is to die for.The cole slaw wasn't too good but  everything else was so good it did t matter will definitely come back

This place is amazing. Forget all the gourmet burger places on the Strip. The Outlaw Burger is the best burger in Vegas.  I've tried a few different things here and you just can't go wrong. All of their food is incredible. I make it a point to stop by here every time I'm in Vegas.

Delicious bbq. We got their gigantic bbq burger and the trip of meats. The corn fritters were a must, the Mac n cheese was okay. Comfy atmosphere and great good. Bread pudding portion was very small but tasty.
the best bbq in vegas baby!!!!whoooooooooooooaaa. ..super great food..and staff the very best !!! whoooooooooooooaaa. ...
Yummy! Absolutely delicious BBQ, expect a wait because it's always packed at lunch time, but well worth the wait!

when you crave meat...and bangin' Southern bbq...you come here.  I'm talkin' smack yo' mama good!  When my bod craves seriously kick ass bbq, this has always been my joint. The staff are crazy funny and efficient. Rollin' Smoke. ..you had me at "hello".
Outstanding food! Great BBQ, brisket burger & sides! Super outgoing & friendly staff. Best meal we've had in Vegas! We'll definitely come back here next time we're in Vegas.

This place is outstanding!! I consider myself choosy when buying ribs away from home because I have come to prefer what I usually cook. Man, this place has a great menu and well-prepared ribs. They ribs were just what you want from wood-cooking. Tasty and tender. I will be visiting this place every time I go to Vegas!

I was referred here by a friend and wow was I surprised.  Not the place I would expect good simple BBQ.  The brisket was tender and the pulled pork with the jalapeno coleslaw was fantastic.  I will be back.
This place is good I came here on a trip to Vegas. It is DAMN GOOD BBQ and the folks were great. The sides were delicious they had everything you could imagine. Next time in Vegas I will be back.

Let me start by saying the food was good, once I got it.

I came here for a business lunch with the rest of my coworkers from my office. I ordered The Outlaw Burger, and I ordered 2nd out of our line of 7 people.

We all went to sit outside and wait for our food. Fast forward a bit to after everyone else has their food, I decide to go in and see what's up with my order.

The lady checks my ticket and goes to see where it is. She comes back and tells me "it'll be right out". I wait another 10 minutes and see many other orders come out, but not my order. I ask again and she checks again, then tells me "just a couple more minutes". 10 minutes later I ask her "am I going to get a burger today?", so she checks again. 5-10 minutes after that she comes out and says "they have it on now".

A full hour after I ordered, after all my coworkers have finished their lunch, and after every other table in the place received their order, they finally bring my burger out. I had to take it to go, since I spent my whole lunch break waiting for it.

The guy who brought it out was nice and threw in some fries, but I was upset at that point. I paid $13 for a burger, even left a good tip when I signed the receipt thinking I'll be the nice guy who tips at these places, and the lady who caused all of this didn't even attempt to apologize.

Needless to say, even though the food was decent, they just lost business from 7 locals, out of which I was overly excited to try the food here.

We most likely will never be back.

Thanks for the fries, mr. server.

First time we went and it is was great, this time we showed up fifteen minutes before closing, who would have thought any place is closed before 10 in Vegas lol but it was 7.45 and they were. FYI to management, MULTIPLE taxi loads full of people had to be turned away while we were sitting outside so you are missing out on business with those crazy early hours. We were told nothing fried could be ordered as the deep fryers were off. Look, if you're open to 8, have all the food til 8. Jeez. So, the ribs we spent $30 on were so dry and old, we felt slighted. Friendly staff but really, that's not enough. I can say for sure that was our second and last trip there. There's way too many places that want business to deal with old and dried out food we had to dump in the trash. Passing on this place permanently and I work with many tourists on the strip daily and always recommended this place but never again.

The BEST Bar B Que place in Las Vegas, Hands down!! The meat was so tender and juicy. Pretty much perfect! This is Vegas NOT down SOUTH but this will def compare to some southern Bar B Ques. No I havent ate at 38 bar B Que places (Seeing as its horrible for you and good way to get huge) but out of the few I have in Vegas I will never go back to any except for this one. The Pulled pork was the best I have had in Years. DEFFFFF need to try this place.

Really good BBQ.  This location closed on Sundays, made that mistake!  But the other location is only 5 min. away.  Cool staff, a bit on the pricey side, but the day we were there for $20 we got choice of 2 meats, chose chicken and brisket(very fatty, but delicious), and got 2 St, Louis style ribs.  and 2 sides, chose bbq beans (a bit spicy) and corn bread (good but too sweet).  Best I've had in Las Vegas.
The brisket, the brisket, the brisket... it's absolutely PERFECT.  {Kanye shrug} *drops mic*

This is in my top 3 BBQ places ever. We had the smoked meatloaf, ribs, pork, and brisket. All of it was amazing. We had the Mac n cheese side and corn nuggets both great. We had two different sauces the arkansasauce and the country sauce. We preferred the country and it was excellent on the ribs. Finished dinner off with peach cobbler

Finally got a chance to give this place a try. I got to say I was pretty disappointed. Maybe it was high expectations due to the many 4-5 star reviews, maybe I just don't know good barbeque when I eat it. By no means am i a BBQ connoisseur but here's my take on this place. I can only comment on the brisket and the sides I ordered. I got a to go order of 1lb. of brisket, a side of loaded mash, yams, & mac n' cheese. When I opened up the container with the brisket I was really irritated because it was chopped. Maybe that's my fault because I assumed it would be sliced. I know some places ask if you want it sliced or chopped like Dickey's but the cashier never asked so I guess I assumed. Ok fine it's chopped no crying over that. However it wasn't really even chopped it was really in small, tiny pieces, like the kind of little pieces that are left from sliced meat. I feel like it was all the scraps leftover from slicing. All of the pieces were dark, like the outer crust of the meat. I couldn't find any pieces in there that were grayish like it is in the center. This probably explains why it was overly salty since it was all the outer pieces. Thank goodness there was a slice of bread underneath because it would have been really hard to eat alone. I didn't even want to put any sauce on it since it was too salty. Oh and I got a little small container of sauce for 1lb of brisket but I guess in my situation it didn't matter. It just wasn't enjoyable at all. As far as the sides go, they were ok. Nothing spectacular. Yams were good, mac n cheese decent, loaded mash was similar to Dickey's mash which is decent. Maybe I need to try their brisket sliced, maybe I need to try something else on their menu. I don't know. I don't think I'll be going back any time soon which is too bad because I really wanted to love this place.

Well, it smelled great, but no room to park or eat. We waited in line for 10 minutes and they have one register and one person working it. If you can put up with all of this then the food was probably great.

Husband is a big fan of BBQ. So, I came along with him to this joint. I personally thought the food was below average like a lot worse than The franchise DICKIES that we have in California. 

I HAD the lemon pepper chicken wings and had the dirty rice. I also tried the brisket and beans... Which all were not quite good. The wings had waaaaay too much lemon pepper seasoning and the dirty rice was not anything special. 

I gave zero stars to the food but service was on point so I gave a two star for that.
Solid BBQ in Las Vegas! I'm from the South so my expectations are high but Rolling Smokes delivers a solid meal and excellent service. I am especially partial to their pulled pork.

I'm pretty stingy with my 5-star ratings but this place wins all five.  Was craving BBQ this evening and fired up Yelp.  Proximity search brought this place to the top of the list and I headed over.

From the outside, the place looks like a real hole in the wall, which it is...this place has soul.  Before you even walk through the doors, the aroma of smoked meats sets forth the salivary glands into full production.

I ordered the Trio plate with pulled pork, spare ribs and brisket with a side of hush puppies.  For the money, the volume of food is a very good value.  I managed to eat about 3/4 of the plate and the leftovers easily comprised a separate meal.   The flavor of the meat was delicious and the sauce complemented the meal perfectly.  Even the hush puppies had a nice underlying spice to them that was quite addicting.  Something as simple as properly seasoning hush puppies tells me there is attention to detail here. 

Good food can get you four stars but its the staff that pushed it to five for me.  They were incredibly friendly and upbeat.  You can tell when a place is well-run by just listening to how they interact with each other.  It was clear that this staff really cares about what they do and have a passion for their craft.

Thanks for a great meal!

DE-LI-CIOUS!  I'm from the South and I've had a hard time finding GREAT BBQ and sides....no more....Rollin Smoke has great BBQ.  

My husband and I had the last serving of the evening of the baked beans as they ran out.  This was by far the best baked beans I've had.  I also had the beef rib which was very tender; my husband delighted in the baby back ribs and goodness they were so good.

Thank you Rollin Smoke for great BBQ!

My husband and I ate there for lunch today. We have been sick since. I am up now 12 hours later with extreme stomach distress and the symptoms that come with it!!! I can see that another yelp user left a review stating that she got sick two days ago after eating the same thing I ordered (pulled pork). Avoid. The food is not worth being this sick :(

"DAMNNNNNN GOOOOOD! DAMNNNNNNN GOOOOOD! DAMMMMMMMMMMMMM GEWD!"

Those three words are the celebratory chants of a Rollin Smoke Barbeque meal. Alright so maybe the chef will encourage you to shout it when you leave, but it takes little convincing, trust me!

My knowledge of barbeque is limited, but I mean I own a Traeger Grill, does that count for anything? No? I didn't think so either... but while my Traeger makes deliciously smoked clean meats it doesn't compare to the smokey glistening glory of RSB. Their ALL YOU CAN EAT BBQ is what makes Vegas or America in general really freaking awesome. I mean sure we're in the top 10 for most obese countries, but hey at least we do it right, RIGHT? 

The special is $25 and includes EVERYTHING on the menu, except drinks ($2), you gotta buy that, BUT... its pretty much all you can drink too. Don't pass on the Outlaw Burger,  the beef ribs, or the nachos, but do pass on the pulled pork. Don't wear a belt, its useless, no belt will make look skinny after the massacre. You can of course also just order ala carte.

Take the booth with the pig, it will give you extra encouragement when you savage through his four legged cousins. 

CONVENTION PEOPLE... COME HERE!

How was my review? DAMNNNNNNN GEWDDDDDDDDDD right? Thanks!

OMG I followed the scent of smoked flesh all the way from the airport. My rental guided me down the strip and turned left at TRUMP Hotel and crossed under freeway till I land in the industrial dump of parking lot. But when you want the best BBQ who cares about its surroundings. 

Now I had this place on my radar for sometime and finally manned up and went. BBQ so damn good make you wanna slap your own face. I'd say the best BBQ on the West Coast and defiantly in Vegas. I've had BBQ all over the country however the  BBQ meatloaf is flipping sensational. In all my barbecue eating sessions I had never encountered BBQ meatloaf and it didn't fail my tastebuds. Meatloaf set on mash potatoes and sauce plus a stack of shredded deep fried onions for crunch and scallions for extra flavor.

I've been back and had the ribs which are nice and meaty with perfect smoke rings. No sauce needed on them cause there amazing and very tasty. Also the hot links hold there own with a nice kick to them and condiments of Mac Cheese made your meal. It's a perfect side dish here cause it's not creamy or watery but cooked just like mom makes. 

I've got a wish list of items to order so I'll be making pit stop soon. FRANK gives a double thumbs up for Rollin Smoke BBQ, so put this on your list of culinary needs to consume.

Best BBQ I've had.
We stopped here for a late lunch on a Saturday afternoon. It's in a strip mall located near a Christian radio station and other assorted businesses.

I had the BBQ club wrap and DAMN was it good. Delicious, filling, tasty, flavorful, cheesy, meaty. Plus they have sweet tea and I'm a sucker for sweet tea.

The man had 1/2lb of brisket, and it was sooooo tender and delicious.

Did I mention the BBQ sauce on the tables? Delicious.

Our friends got a plate of various ribs which were fall off the bone good, and the same wrap as I.

You must try this place!!

First things first, this place does look like it's in a sketchy part of town but let me tell you, when you walk in you get greeted by a delicious smell of barbecue. There is a line but it moves really fast. The man that took my order was really friendly and fun. I ordered the BBQ Nacho Fries with pulled pork and my boyfriend got the Out Law Burger. My nacho fries were soooo good, omg the best thing I have eaten in a while I highly recommend them, my boyfriends burger was so talk and stacked I don't know how he was able to take a bite out of it. It's cool when they take you your order because they yell out your name and where your from, everyone working there is super friendly the atmosphere is great. I would definitely come back to this place next time I'm in Vegas and would tell anyone going to Vegas to go try it.

This is a must stop while in Las Vegas. Eating here makes me think I've never had BBQ before. I've always been focused on the sauce and sides. You don't need sauce for these meats. Had the burnt ends,ribs and pork. All the meat was extremely tender. The rib coloring,  flavor were above and beyond my tasting experience. I'll be back many more times.
Great food along w great southern hospitality type of service. Seriously nice people. The food is great. I had the chicken BBQ sandwich. It was perfect. And they even sang happy Bday to my buddy.
Best barbecue in Vegas! These guys do it right. Very Friendly and Awesome food.
My new bbq place to go to. Best bbq spot in the valley!
Good all American bbq. Friendly staff  good portions, and good price. No complaints. Will be back for sure

I walked into this place and almost walked out due to the diveyness of the place.  As I was standing in line, 3 separate people told me how good the food was.... and holy crap were they right.  The food was AMAZING!!!  I plan on hitting this place up every time I go to Vegas in the future.  The prices are very reasonable too!

Expect a ghetto ambiance and go there for the food!  You won't regret it!

Was there fri July 18 and wow was the food amazing , had three meat platter and was blown away by the pulled pork , ribs. But the show stopper was the brisket. The flavour was like nothing I have ever had before. When in back I vegas will defiantly be back.

Best BBQ ever! I ordered the pulled pork sandwich, mac n cheese, and corn bread. I had to not eat the bread on the sandwich so I could make room for it all. It is amazing!  Definitely a must go to when visiting Vegas...

Great food for great prices!! We're from Los Angeles and were looking around for some good bbq before our hotel check-in time and found this little place behind the strip on here. It had great reviews so we decided to try it out. My husband ordered a 4 meat plate with 3 side for just $19.99! I've been to places that charge at least double (sometimes triple) for all that food. It's meant to feed 2 people or one very hungry person, like in my husband's case. I had a brisket sandwich for $7.99. I usually like bbq sauce to be sweet and tangy, and their sauce has a little kick of spice. I loved it!  Everything was delicious & we will definitely be back soon... maybe for a couple of sandwiches for the drive home!

On vacation for a few days. I went there the first night I arrived, and then the next night, and the next. you get the idea. The first night I had the pulled piggy. It was awesome sauce and I ate it too fast so then I ordered the chicken nacho fries. Put me to sleep. While I had the fries someone else ordered the Outlaw burger, at that moment I knew I was coming back. The next day I had the Outlaw Burger and the 3rd day I went with the all you can eat. And with a free dessert with the Yelp check in..Child Please!

When I ate meat we went here all the time. Food is outstanding, best BBQ in Vegas. You can tell the chief has a passion for the food he makes. If you haven't tried this place yet you may want to. Great food, good price always friendly people working there. If you go and they have the chicken and waffle it is better than Roscos in LA!

The best bar-b-q in Vegas. Nice smoked meats and delicious sauces. Came here with the family and was impressed with the quality of the food. The location is hidden away a few blocks from the strip. The parking is limited, so get there before lunch time.

This place is really good for BBQ food, they also have all kinds of bbq sauce, I tried it out for the 1st time. I really like Beef Brisket, but from what I saw on the menu it looks like the don't have any ? There peach cobbler is amazing! Highly recommend that for sure. But other then that I give this place a 4 stars! Good job!

ambiance//****
try not to be alarmed by the exterior or surroundings
*imagine* 3 females wanting to try some BBQ late in the evening and stumbling across one of undoubtedly many of the town's ROW of gentleman's club to find this place
yes i'm the horrible friend that cajoled the 2 others into satiating my carnivorism

while the exterior of this strip mall doesn't say much, the interior is a fun family oriented grub vibe with plenty of benches and long tables for big parties

service//***
the service was pretty much what you expect from a fast food type place

food//*****
oohlala~ so their stuff is fall of the bone good and i like the spicy kick of their homemade sauce~ =9

you know the bbQ is good when two mostly vegetarian girls are impressed by how soft and juicy their meat is

everything was devoured...and the portions are decent sized
i finished mine and my two friends shared an order
~*~
yelp finds me the best hole-in-the-walls!!  finger lickin' good~~ ;p

I've had better BBQ outside of Vegas, but this place was pretty good.  Service was friendly.  Food was good.  The brisket was moist but a bit bland.  The ribs were smokey, but I prefer a thicker bark.  We had to park on the street because the lot was full.  I would return.

Been living in Vegas for about a year and I finally went to Rolling Smoke BBQ.  It's a little gem off the strip that serves huge portions.  Being from Texas where BBQ is a must, this place stands amongst the best BBQ I've ever had.  Im glad I finally decided to come cause I've been missing out. If you're not from Vegas I recommend this place be in your itinerary.

Thanks to other reviewers for this recommendation - this place was definitely worth the side trip. Everything we had was great - even the seafood platter I had, which had a nice gritty corn-meal coating, and was not greasy at all. The corn bread, hush puppies, and fried okra were all as good as I've had, and I'd definitely recommend them. Especially the okra, as many places ruin this dish. 

Very friendly owner from Arkansas made us feel welcome. The free refills on the drinks were welcome, as some of the sauces were pretty spicy. The only bad part was that the neighborhood was pretty unseemly, even for Vegas. We ate out at the picnic bench, and let's just say the sights were pretty interesting. But a very authentic restaurant with excellent, inexpensive food.

Love this place!  Super yummy, prices are very reasonable, and lots of outdoor seating, as long as they aren't too busy.  (There's indoor seating, too.)  The view is of the parking lot, but that's ok. It's so worth it!

I ordered brisket with nacho fries with outlaw burger. Ordered before my cousin and he got only the outlaw burger with Mac, and he got his order first. And I look across of me and I see a guy that ordered his food after me, and he got the same exact burger before they got my order. 
So I ask the waiter why he got the burger before me when I ordered before him, and he just simply said that yours is coming up, playing it off knowing that he messed up. 
So after 10 mins later they bring my food, but I only  got my fries no burger. Waiter said its coming right out. 
After another 10 mins I finally get it. Was kind of hard to enjoy my food. But nevertheless fries were good and the burger was just as good. And the price for all the food was just. I would of given 4 stars if they didn't mess up my order and not try to play it off that it wasn't the waiters fault.
Don't get me wrong I would definitely come back again and hopefully get better service.

Pretty damn tasty bbq.  Came here with 5 friends and we were hungry for some good bbq. We ordered 3 lbs of brisket, 1.5 slabs of spare ribs, a slab of beef ribs, and some sides of potato salad, mac n cheese, onion strings, and corn balls.  

We ordered all the meats dry and with sauce on the side and also asked for their spicy bbq sauce.  The test for good bbq is how their meat tastes without sauce.  This place definitely passed the test  I'm not usually a fan of bbq sauce anyway, but this place definitely does not need sauce.  The rub they use on their meats were delicious.  The beef rib was so nice and fatty and it basically melts in your mouth.  The flavor of the spare ribs were good too.  However, the meat on spare ribs should easily fall of the bone, and these did not.  

The sides were ok.  I liked the bacon potato salad.  I wasn't a fan of the other stuff. Although my friends really liked the corn ball things. 

Definitely worth a shot, but it can be busy.  Some of the other reviews said it was hard to get a seat.  I can definitely see that happening on the weekends during peak hours.  We went on a monday at 6pm.  There was a line for the food, but we didn't have any problem finding a table.  However, as we were there, the place filled up and the line got much longer.

We love BBQ 
This place was the best we have had , even better than Memphis Tennessee,  Famous Daves, Lucille s  etc..
Our beef rib were huge.  Moist, tender and a beautiful smoke taste that didn't even need BBQ sauce.   Same for the baby backs and the brisket burnt ends.
Then there's the Mama's smoked meatloaf over a bed of mashed potatoes topped with onion rings.  Never has meatloaf tasted so good.
You have to try their little corn fritters,  their string beans and potato salad.   Extra large servings.
Casual atmosphere,  plenty of seating in and out.
Staff was so friendly,  helpful.  Our food was served without much of a wait and hot out of the kitchin.
Wish we had one of these in California
Found this place by yelp and stopped in for dinner with my gf... Cheap prices and amazing food :) highly recommended if your looking for smoked BBQ, I'll def return and recommend this place to others

Amazing bbq. Was extremely surprised to find a nice bbq place in Vegas so close to home. The ribs and macaroni and cheese are to die for. Highly recommend this place between the good food and the people who run it are very friendly.

Haven't had much BBQ in town but this is my go to spot with the trio platter of meats and sides.  Noticed a price increase on their menu recently which bothers me but I don't mind paying for their excellent food.  Always have leftovers so better make sure you're hungry.  Sides I recommend include the cornbread, greens, mashed potatoes and onion strings.  Made the mistake of going on a Sunday when they weren't open so check them out Monday through Saturday!

Nod yes. Nod yes while chewing. You're going to be nodding vertically all through the meal if it's your first time. Beef ribs were tender juicy fall off the bone with a perfect char on the edges. No one gets close to this style cooking. Brisket was okay. Chicken was perfectly spiced with hotness. It was a normal sized chicken as it should be. Bbq sauce was fantastic!!!!!!

I'm not sure how many 5-star reviews I give, but if I could give 6, Rollin Smoke Barbecue would get them.  We came early on a weekday, and before we had finished our meal there was a line out the door.  We sampled several items, including the pulled pork, cole slaw, banana pudding, and ribs.  All were wonderful, but the hot dog with absolutely everything and the kitchen sink piled on top was a winner.  I don't even like hot dogs that much, but this was among the best things I ate in 2014.  The restaurant is in a run down commercial neighborhood and your eating on benches (inside or out), but if you're a foodie, this is a must.

Im from Arkansas and this is the best BBQ period.  I brought my wife and baby and for $75 we ate all day and its not a buffet they cook it and bring it to you as you order .  

YOU MUST TRY THIS PLACE!!!!!!!!!!! 
                   GO HOGS!!!!

I come from a family that treats bbq as a religion and this may be the best bbq I've ever had.  I've never written a Yelp review before this, but I feel it is my obligation to tell the worlds how delicious this food is.

I came to Las Vegas to play poker and eat good food.  After eating dinner at this place late Saturday night, I am heartbroken that it's closed on Sunday because I was ready to head back the next day for lunch to have the $25 all-you-can eat (ANYTHING ON THE MENU!!!) feast.

The ribs literally fell off the bone.  I cut the brisket with a plastic fork.  The bbq sauce was incredible.  Do yourself a favor and get the smoked meatloaf, which is served on a bed of some of the best mashed potatoes and is smothered in tasty onion strings.

The staff was super friendly.  They were happy to tell me all about the food.  They all seemed to have a great deal of pride and respect for the food they served.

Eat here.

Happy to see good BBQ in a city surrounded by such upscale restaurants. 

This is a very small, hole in the wall looking bbq joint. Small seating area inside. Parking lot is decent sized. 

Call ahead if you want your order ready when you arrive. They charge if you want sauce to go, pretty stupid, who doesn't want sauce on the side. The spicy sauce is good.

They have a 10% off coupon on their website, just show them the coupon online and save some money.

Rib Platter - $24.99 - Comes with 1 beef rib, 2 spare ribs, and 3 baby back ribs. I love when bbq places have combos like this because I love to try everything they offer. Beef rib was huge and had tender flakey meat. Spare rib fell off the bone and was moist. Baby backs were a little dry. Seasoning was peppery with a little hint of sweet. My side was the Corn Nuggets which were like cream corn poppers, so good.

Brisket, fatty, 1lb - $18.99 - Meat melted in your mouth. You can pull it apart with your fingers. 

Half Smoked Chicken - $9.99 - Good smoke. Had some good juicy meat but some pieces were dry.

Burnt Ends, 1/2lb - $12.99 -  Disappointing. Not moist or fatty. Very little bark. They do not allow quarter pound orders either.

This is one of the, nope, the best bbq joint ever. We had the outlaw burger which was sick, perfect blend of taste and crunch from the onions. No need to request medium rare as the burgers smoked to perfection. The biggin dads favorite had a mix of 3 meats that taste like they were bred in the same farm. I cant say how happy we are with the food and service. The hot sauce made my buddy tear up, tasty stuff. I feel like I can make a mess of myself,  wear a bib made of paper napkins and feel proud doing it. Free refills on the drinks and quality friendly staff make this place a obvious no 1 choice for bbq. Gordon ramsey abd his 20dollar burger can rot compared to a gem like this. one of the best burgers I ever tasted. The staff is so wholesome and authentically country with the way they carry themselves and the food, by mere presence they made me think they are co owners with the pride they have for their food. I didnt detect any of the fake kindness you often see at regular food joints. The owners should be proud of themselves and their staff.

Why are you still wasting your time looking for over priced food on the strip. Quick head over to Rollin smoke barbeque and enjoy the best BBQ in Vegas.  I had brisket and pull pork only 10.99. You can't find that on the strip.

Oh boy, oh boy, oh boy!  I have to say that BBQ is one of my least favorite cuisines, but this place made me reconsider.

ALL of the meats are full of flavor, tender, and juicy.  Those waffle fries though.......why are they that good?!  Between those burnt ends, the meatloaf, and the brisket...I have to say that everything is simply delicious.  Shout out to the Chef (think Chef Tim) who is absolutely wonderful, personable, and friendly.

"Heads up" If you like beer with your BBQ, you'll be disappointed to find that one of the locations (bigger one) does not have a bar or sell alcohol.

You MUST check this place out when in Vegas!  Hands down, some of the best BBQ I've had in my life including that from Kansas City.
So far the best bbq place I've ever been to here in Las Vegas! Mac and cheese good, kickin beans, and greens, bomb. Best local spot for great bbq!
This food rocks, the best barbecue I've EVER had. Service was really nice, they were totally swamped, line up out the door. Fast service, line moves quickly.

Our family of 4 stopped here for lunch.  We try to avoid The Strip, so the anti-glitz location and easy access from the freeway were pluses for us.   The moment we stepped out of the car and caught a whiff of the 'cue, we knew we were in the right place.  Dusty at the order desk was great.  His southern hospitality was a welcome break from our power drive (SLC to LA). The adults in our party shared The Pit Special so we could try lots of things.  For $20 you get a choice of 4 meats and 3 sides.  We had the chicken, pulled pork, brisket and spare ribs with cole slaw, onion strings,  and potato salad.  We filled up and still had enough left over for one of us to eat for dinner.  We will return!

Man I walked my 12 family members more than 4 miles up and down the strip today to come here and if it wasn't "DAM good" I was never going to hear the end of it! These guys were so courteous and sat down with us to explain the whole menu.  Everything  looked exactly like the pictures and tasted like real down home barbecue.  

You have to visit this place when you're in Vegas.  Don't be scared to stray off the strip for some real food!
This place really great... we eat here once a week... we bring our family from cali here and they love them. People are very friendly and nice.

Have you ever tasted pure Heaven before?

You will when you sink your teeth into the succulent, juicy, out-of-this world BBQ at Rollin Smoke!

The meat is prepared immediately after you order on their grills which are on-site.  You will get exactly what you ordered prepared EXACTLY how you want it!  The staff is very quick and responsive to your needs and the menu has extraordinary options in terms of BBQ preparation.

You can get an amazing assortment of meats from brisket, ribs, chicken, pulled pork, hot links, and yummy sides like beans, mac & cheese, and cole slaw.

Plus there's an 'All-You-Can-Eat' option for $25.00...wow...if your stomach can handle it., I highly recommend taking it on!  ANYTHING AND EVERYTHING on the menu for only $25 bucks!

I recently decided to take it on by getting the brisket, the baby back ribs, the chicken, and hot links, along with sides of baked beans and mac & cheese...I think I really did see God at one point!

This is not just some BBQ Joint where they'll throw any random meat in a bag onto a grill...this is BBQ made from the heart and the soul delivered fresh and hot to your mouth.

There is no more to say other than, if you truly want a taste of BBQ from the Gods...Rollin Smoke is the place to go!
I absolutely LOVED this place! the brisket was melt in your mouth deliciousness and the beef ribs were the best I've ever had. I can't wait to go back.

Definitely a great hole in the wall! We tried the all you can eat and it was well worth the $25! The staff was super friendly. Definitely recommend the spare ribs, loaded mash potatoes, and the shrimp.

After looking at their YELP reviews, we had to try this place.
We were truly impressed by their food and great service, and yes, the food was unbelievable!
We shared a combination plate that included brisket, baby back ribs, and hot links. We added the rib tips which were also great. The little corn nuggets were a big hit as well. 
If I find my self in Las Vegas, this will definitely be on my short list of places to go. 
They have a variety of sauces too.
OMG This place is amazing! If you're looking for the best BBQ ever then you should definitely come here! Seriously I was so full and I wanted to keep eating because it was that good!
Amazing Bbq from start to finish. Meatloaf is a must, jalapeño coleslaw is an awesome twist

Best BBQ in town! Located under a freeway overpass, it doesn't get more hole-in-the-wall than this. While Rollin Smoke's location may be subtle and discrete, its food is definitely not. All their smoked meats and sauces are gluten-free. The meat here is simply phenomenal. If you you're a big boy or girl that can eat, go for the AYCE for $35 - anything on the menu is fair game. 

The times I've been here, I've stuck to the combos. The pit special is more than enough for two people if you like variety. I love the brisket, pulled pork, and spare ribs, but less of a fan of the chicken and hot links. Today's visit, my friend and I shared the rib platter special and were not disappointed. The baby back ribs and St. Louis spare ribs were some of the best I've had. One beef rib would've been enough to share, but we added on an extra for $6. To top it off, we added a 1/2 pound of burnt ends with a side of waffle fries and corn nuggets. I've had burnt ends before, but they were nothing like these. These burnt ends were juicy, tender, and so flavorful that they required no sauce. The corn nuggets are now my favorite side! I've also liked the mac & cheese and cornbread in the past. 

Despite having over a thousand rave reviews, I like to think that this joint is still one of Vegas' best kept secrets. It reminds me of Freddy's BBQ from House of Cards - amazing ribs and food, but only if you're in the know. I still have yet to try the infamous outlaw burger, but I saw it pass by today and it had me mesmerized. Until next time my hungry friends.

I've had the privilege of enjoying real southern BBQ down south, South Carolina, Georgia, New Orleans...I've tasted authentic. Rollin' Smoke offers what I consider the most authentic BBQ in Las Vegas by a long shot. There aren't any competitors even worth mentioning to compare.
1) Atmosphere: it's a rather small property that's divided into a few section, one where you place your orders/grab your drinks, utensils etc/some seating available, and two other sections offering seating as well. Regardless of how you're eating (take-out, dining in, a la carte, all-you-can-eat), there is one line for all. You can sit wherever you'd like while you wait for your food to be delivered including outdoors. 
2) Service: Everyone on staff is super friendly and very helpful. It was our first time there and we didn't feel rushed while we took a minute in line getting an explanation of how the menu works. Food was delivered timely and correctly. 
3) Food: I'll start with saying my ribs literally fell off the bone when I picked up my first bite. Now...
All-you-can-eat is $24.95 and includes anything on the menu. Pace yourself! You can always come back for more. We grabbed a bit of each meat and were very pleased with every type- ribs, brisket, chicken, catfish (very fresh, lightly crunchy and not fishy-tasting). Everything was exceptional, including our sides of Mac and cheese, cole slaw and hush puppies. Oh the hush puppies! So yummy! Dessert was awesome. Next time we'll have to try our berry cobbler a la mode. 

Looking forward to coming back next time. Thanks guys!

Because of how hidden this location is, unless you're a LV strip club connoisseur, I would consider this a hidden gem of the city.  

Been here on multiple occasions and their food is consistently delicious. I get beef every time (beef ribs, brisket all ways), however I try their other meats when my friends get them and they are solid as well. Its one of those places that always makes you leave satisfied and feigning for a nap. The staff are warm and welcoming, and the decor is barbecue-y (a lot of Arkansas Razorbacks stuff). 

A definite highlight of this place is their sauces. Their sauces have a ton of depth in flavor, and for the spicy lovers, their hot bbq sauce has a kick to it as well. 

Prices are decent as I would definitely not consider this cheap eats, but this place is definitely worth the money. Visitors of Vegas should definitely try to visit this place. Oh yes, if you're going to strip clubs at night, pick one that is near this place because they open LATE. 

Only downsides of this place is the location of the place (industrial, empty during the daytime, and I haven't been at night) and that parking is hard to come by because their lot is small. If you are not driving, consider using a rideshare program like Uber/Lyft to get there.
