BBQ was ok. I wanted to try some BBQ when i was in Vegas. I checked yelp and came here. I got the pit special chicken hot link 2 ribs and brisket. On the side I got greens mashed potatoes and fries. It was done pretty quick. about 10 minutes. The ribs were pretty good. The hot link was spicy but not hot. Same goes for almost every thing else but the ribs fries brisket. I'm guessing they cook it earlier and warm it up I am not sure. I am pretty sure it was not fresh. Fries where just ok. Greens the same. Mashed potatoes where a little better. If i were to go back i would definitely probably just get ribs or a brisket or chicken sandwich. Sides taste like something on the strip. Over priced and over rated. The BBQ I would try again. Also there Ice tea wasn't that great either.

Rollin Smoke is located off the strip away from all the lights and glamour. This makes it easy to get to by car, more difficult to get to by foot. Even though it is located nearly under an overpass and directly adjacent to a strip club it felt strangely southern and comfortable. The people were excellent. Fun and friendly. The decor felt completely original. It enhanced the experience and wasn't distracting. There were a few picnic tables out front which I have come to love about authentic barbecue joints.

Brisket (upgraded to burnt ends), ribs, and coleslaw with a drink and a piece of bread for $22 felt steep for the amount of food we got, yet by the end I was thoroughly stuffed and for that reason, I actually feel like this is a good deal. I believe the quality of the meat and technique were excellent, which deserves a higher price point. Did I mention that it was delicious? It was delicious. The brisket was crispy on the outside with the soft, delicate, juicy interior that I have come to love. The ribs fell right off the bone. They had authentic Carolina vinegar which cut through the fatty brisket. Their mustard base sauce had excellent tang and was good, but I bet it would go better on smoked chicken. Their sweet sauce really shined though. It is tomato based (instead of molasses) and it was just sweet enough. Really complemented the smokiness of the meat.

I love great bbq and this place certainly lived up to expectations.  I had the pulled pork sandwich which comes out on a hoagie roll that made it easy to eat and to add in copious amounts of pork.  There is something special about meat that is just so tender that taking a bite is more about flavor than actual chewing, I left not only satisfied but with thoughts about when I could next return. 

There are many options for sides from waffle fries, mac n' cheese, potato salad, and a baked potato.  I only tried the waffle fries which was provided in enough of a portion for adequate sharing but also were great to soak up more of that delicious tangy bbq sauce.  

This is a bbq place that requires several visits since you'll be wanting to come back and try what everyone else had in full quantities.

My work got their food catered in. It...was...amazing! I kept their business card for later. SOOO good, like..wow. If you are in the mood for some BBQ and comfort food side dishes make a B line to this place.

Awesome food!! The pulled pork sandwich is the best. I also loved their corn nuggets and okra. The baked beans are a little too spicy for my personal taste, but if you like a "kick" in your baked beans, you would enjoy them. The restaurant doesn't look like much from the outside, but it is a great place to eat. I will definitely return when I visit Vegas.

All that needs to be said is...

BEST PLACE FOR BBQ IN LAS VEGAS! HANDS DOWN!!

The beef rib is blow your mind, amazing! 

I try to come here as often as I can, anytime I have a hankering for BBQ! Plus, you know it's a good sign when you can see the Smoker out front and when you open your car door, you get a whiff of them smoking some meats!

DON'T GO ANYWHERE ELSE FOR BBQ OR IT WILL BE A MISTAKE!

The food was delicious and the staff was fantastic. My husband and I ordered the "Pit Special" to share, which included 5 types of meat (pulled pork, chicken, brisket, hot links and 2 ribs) and your choice of 3 sides for $27.99. It was plenty of food and we loved getting to try each of the meats. The brisket was Hands down the best. For our sides, we ordered the dirty rice, loaded mashed potatoes, and corn bread. We LOVED every single side. The chick at the register (Brenda) was so warm with all her "hey honey's" and "of course baby". Then the girl who served us (Lizelle?) was so incredibly helpful and sweet, offering to help us take our selfie... And grabbing us extra utensils so we didn't have to get up from the table. I mean... The food, the service... We scored on this trip.

This is a gem! Best BBQ in Vegas.
I ordered the salad with Brisket. Good greens melt in your mouth brisket. Low Carb heaven! 
Very tasty 
I will be coming back.

I go to vegas quite often for business.  Because most of my associates are turning in their expenses for reimbursement, they opt for the fancy expensive hotel restaurants.  Me?  although i love a juicy $50 steak someone else is paying for, when i spend my own money, i love to find treasures like RSB.

A hole in the wall that you need to travel off strip for in the industrial district, but, ROLLIN SMOKE BARBEQUE is well worth the effort!.  

The menu is pretty simple but with a wide variety of options.  I asked for a suggestion and was told the brisket and rib plate with slaw.  FABULOUS choice!

The brisket was tender and thinly sliced.  The subtle smoke flavor was deep in the meat.

The ribs fell right off of the bone with just the right amount of sauce to compliment the meat.

The slaw was fresh and spicy and had some corn in it to add to the flavor.

Team was friendly.  The place was clean.

If you are looking for a burger, i saw one being delivered to a table that looked incredible.

If visiting from out of town and want a real treat at an affordable price, go here!

We found this place while visiting Vegas for my birthday. OMG! Best BBQ ever! All the sides we seriously delicious. The corn nuggets....I couldn't stop eating them. And the mac and cheese..OMG! I'm a mac and cheese fanatic and this is one of the best I've had from a restaurant. Very cheesy and seasoned very well. I will be making it back there when I go back to Vegas.

Had to kiss the cook, this bbq was so good!  Honestly the best I've had.  The meat so tender and moist with the perfect, delicate smokiness that only comes with hours of loving atten-tion.  Get the combo platterWe loved the sweet bbq sauce and Mac n cheese, but they have choices for all tastes. Enjoy!

Decided to come here based on the Yelp reviews. It was good! Personally I am a bigger sweet barbecue fan so this wasn't really my taste, but overall the quality Nd service were good. Got the trio or meat plate and was able to share it no problem.

We went here on a Friday night late and had a hard time finding the place. It's in a small strip mall, near a bunch of strip clubs and we were a little nervous. Once we got in, we were greeted by one of the owners and we were very pleased. 

We both ordered the Duo. The brisket was fantastic. Tender, moist and very flavorful. The ribs were fall off the bone good. They definitely take pride in what they serve. The Mac n cheese was great and well. Went perfect with the meal. 

You order at the counter and they deliver your meal to you. We talked to the young man quite a bit and it sounds like they have had quite a nice little success. This is a hidden gem in Vegas. Not to be missed!!

The real deal!  Great ribs.  The beef and pork fall off the bone.  The sauce is added to the ribs just before serving.  You have to look in order to find this joint which is hidden away in an industrial area.  You need to go there!
The food is incredible and the people who work there are so friendly and sweet! I will most definitely be going back to this place every time I come to Vegas! This place is gold!
Good BBQ and pleasant staff.  Bacon potato salad and jalapeño coleslaw were tasty.  Would go back again for sure.

The best barbecue in town. You can taste the passion in the food and I love that - that is what you get out of a local joint that lacks at a Famous Dave's. The people that work there are great and always engage in conversation, they're not just order takers.

The side of cornbread is awesome. Super moist and covered in butter. And the brisket just falls apart. I'm also a fan of hot bbq sauce, but their house sauce is great. I eat here whenever I'm in the area. 

The only downfall is the service time. But I understand it's a small place with high demand so I already account for that prior to my arrival. Heard there's a second location downtown -- will be checking it out someday soon!

Meats sweats and not even mad about it ! The meatloaf kicks major butt ! I can't say I've had anything that was less than stellar from here. You know you're somewhere good when there is almost a line out the door !
I go to Texas at least once a year and always make it a point to eat some really good bbq because I could never find anything as good in Vegas....until now.

Loved this place. Absolutely met the hype. There was a wait, but it's well worth it. Got the smoked chicken sandwich and it was excellent. Tried all of the different sauces and they were excellent. Got mac n cheese as a side and it was very good as well. Loved everything about this place. Just became a Vegas staple for me.

This is hands down the best BBQ I've ever had!! I hs the "Outlaw" burger and it was amazing!!! The staff is friendly and truly treat you like family. If ever in Vegas, this is a must stop!!! I'll be back!!!

Yes, I too had to do a quick u-turn to get to this location.  Located off-strip in an industrial part of town by an underpass - yes, it is by strip club alley.  But, this mere fact should not deter you from getting some of the best BBQ in LV.  

I opted for The Biggin "Dad's Favorite"
I was confused thinking it was a plate; it is actually a sandwich with beef, pork and hot link.  The meal includes a side and drink.

Each meat had its distinct flavor.  The portions are big; I was quite content with just eating the meats, I didn't even get to the roll.

My shirt still smells like BBQ, and I wouldn't have it any other way. Seriously, man. This is heaven on earth. And good people. Pay, or not, it's all on the house when it's this good. Like how is it possible to have links that are better than other links? Links! Brisket, the blacker the better. Or not, cuz it's good no matter what. What about ribs that fall apart, not in that food channel fake take-me-I'm-yours way, but in the way that it just gives you a little push back before it lets go and fully causes a charry, unctuous mouth earthquake. I mean, a mouth is a mouth, to quote Ray Donovan's dad, but this is a mouth that's gotten the news.

Smoked meatloaf tomorrow.

This is by far one of my favorite places in all of Las Vegas. As a southern boy out in the west I am so very very happy that Rollin Smoke exists. You can't find BBQ this good even in Arkansas. Believe me I have tried! Hush puppies done right is something that I never though I would find outside of my own kitchen this far west but when I need a fix and don't feel like frying up a batch, Rollin Smoke is there for me! If you have a hankerin' for some fine BBQ then head on down and git yer grub on.
I only have good things to say about this place! food was great! and I got it fast! the ppl were friendly. I will definitely come back. :)

Melt in your mouth BBQ.  It lived up to everything it was supposed to be.  I had the slider trio, and the pulled pork was AH MAZE ING.  I wish it had more pickles, but that's because I'm a pickle person.

It's a small place so make sure you grab a table while you can!  Food is quick, came out in about 10mins.  Plenty of big tables for larger groups.
Best BBQ in Las Vegas, hands down!  The food, especially the peach cobbler is always spot on! The only thing that could possibly make it better is more seating.

On a visit to Las Vegas, come upon this restaurant. For those that want authentic barbeque is is the stop
 Food was delicious, and the meat was smoked to perfection.  This was definitely a highlight of the trip. I will definitely come back and will recommend to the friend that travel this way. Both thumbs way way up!!

Holy mother of God this place is fantastic. The moment I stepped in to this place from the smell alone I was expecting gold and I was not disappointed. I ordered the Outlaw Burger and is was huge, and delicious. The brisket was tender and smoky and the burger was moist and perfectly cooked. 

Others ordered the pork and I got a sample. It was melt in your mouth good, savory with just a little sweet. This is one of the best BBQ places I've ever been. If you're in Vegas, to hell with Gordon Ramsay, Wolfgang Puck, and those other celebrity chefs on the Strip, and get thee hence to Rollin Smoke.

Great value for what you get.  Compared to other barbecues I've been to, it isn't quite up there with the best, but it's not bad either.

If you are in vegas and in the mood for loads of greasy, fatty hangover food for cheap, this is the place!

The food is amazing and the staff is the bomb. The biggest con (more than the prices) is the location. This place is literally under a bridge. Imagine someone tells you to pick a place where you don't want a restaurant. You will definitely pick this place. Now since good that out of the way. The food is amazing!!!!! You have to give to go here.

Danny set the tone at the counter. This shop is a well oiled machine that has the good stuff. The Mac and cheese was my son's favorite. Got a little more to take home on the way out. I went with the meat trio. Ribs, chicken and hot link. Hot link wasn't very hot and wish I had ordered more pork. Now the chicken...oh yes. As lip smacking good as the ribs were it was the chicken that stole the show for me. I should have opted for all you can eat deal. I could easily eaten two of these plates. Mom went with the pulled pork. Two thumbs up and 5 stars from her.
I had to order some peach cobbler a la mode when I ordered extra Mac and cheese. Home run. I am only sorry that we can't come back for a long time. You guys are great!

After spending the day walking the strip, we went off the beaten path for some good old bbq.  We were not disappointed.   We are not from Vegas and can't enjoy it like the locals do.  But I would certainly choose this place  over an over priced Gordon Ramsey any day.   Very friendly staff.  Will certainly be back next time we are in town

Chris M.
Orange County,  CA

Came in after reading all the great reviews and because my husband really wanted to try it. I don't really like bbq, but this place was great ! The mac & cheese was great and the fried okra was amazing !!!!!

We waited 20 minutes  only to find out they closed at 8pm... no one in sight to let us know . Doors should be locked!  When someone  finally  came out from the back we asked to at least take some cornbread  to go... the guy said no.. was not willing to go over and  beyond !.. working in this industry  that is the key to having customers  return!... need to rethink about closing  at 8... its VEGAS !
Hands down the best barbecue spot I've been to in Vegas. Highly recommend the brisket and ribs. Mac & cheese and corn bread is also pretty bomb.

Arrive early, because they run out of meat selection early in the evening. Also, space inside is pretty limited. But everything I've tried, every time I've come, has been outstanding! Mouthwatering, juicy, succulent, and flavorful.

I finally tried Rollin Smoke Barbeque and let me tell you Pit Boss you are doing a DAM fine job!  If you notice the way I spell Dam and youve ate here youll understand.  The barbeque itself is 5 stars as is the service hands down.  Reason for 4 stars not 5 is the price for the amount of food they give you.  I paid 30.00 for the "pit special" that i split with my wife and was still hungry.  I should of ate hers and i probably would have been just fine and told her, "well honey you did say you wanted to stick to your diet right?" jk.  All in all ill be back eventually with more money and order more food and evenrually die of a heart attack.  My wishes after that are to be stuffed then put outside as the Rollin Smoke Mascot.

Thank you RS!
Uncle R
oh my gosh disregard my last review, order the nachos! Waffles fries with brisket..... I am never ordering anything else off their menu. Their nachos were AMAZING.

I tried a lunch combo, pulled pork and brisket with mac n cheese and potato salad. I also wanted a sweet tea, which was never made in time for my visit. I was not impressed. The pulled pork was not at all pulled, it was chopped. Not a single piece had any fat, bark or irregular shredded shapes. it was boring dry sliced/chopped meat. The brisket was sliced very thin, cold, tough and had minimal smoke ring, bark etc. The sauce on both was too sweet for my taste. The sides were mediocre. The mac n cheese a bit too watery, tasting more of black pepper than cheese and the potato salad dry and bland. It all came with a dry toasted little dinner roll. Service was minimal, the guy at the podium seemed annoyed to take my order. Order and pay in advance at the podium and the food brought to your table. No one asked me how anything was after the food was brought. They have annoying tiny flimsy horrible plastic cutlery. I would avoid returning just to never have to use those awful plastic forks again. I may try the ribs  someday but am in no rush and certainly wont go out of my way for it.

I've been to this place a few times in the last couple years. I'm a local but it's far from my house so only on occasion. I got the beef brisket sandwich and my wife got the Spudtastic(which is the equivalent size to a small baby). Everything was very good as usual. The meat and sauces are fantastic. I've also notice they've remodeled a little since my last visit. This place is excellent, come check it out.

Wow 3 smokers in the parking lot. Hard to add any more Kudos to previous reviews. Arrived  around 12 noon and lunch was in full swing. There were 4 people ahead of us in the order line. Had to wait a little while as only one person was taking orders. (Not a complaint just a comment)  The order taker was friendly and conscientious. He would repeat the order back to you after entering it into the system.The entire time we were there the order line never had fewer than 3 people. 
Food is delivered to the table by calling out your name to determine where you were seated. The tables that were mentioned in another review have been replaced with ones that have clean stainless steel tops.

The following items were all excellent with the right amount of smoke.
Pulled Pork, juicy with just the right amount of sauce.
Sliced Brisket was fork tender. 
Ribs perfect fall of the bone.
Several delicious sides. Jalapeno cole slaw, pinto beans.
Sorry no room for dessert. Maybe next time

These folks are doing some fine BBQ. They could be serious contenders at Memphis in May if they choose to compete. 
Keep on Smokin!!

This place is off the charts! Highly recommend a stop here-no matter how long the drive.
Loved it so much-bought an extra Slav of ribs to gnaw on during football Sunday. Best part-no mess and not stuck in front of the Q all day!

I have bookmarked this joint a while back and finally managed to swing by today.  I was heading toward Spring Mountain through the south off ramp from the I-15 flyway to get my pho sesh when I realized that Rollin' Smoke was right off Highland Drive.  I don't know about y'all, but there is only one thing I do in this industrial area at involves poles and minimal clothing, so yeah....great place to put a BBQ establishment!

I decided to go with something not too heavy, not knowing that a light meal here is equivalent to a light meal in Hawaii...no such things as smeediums here.  The sandwiches offer a check in discount to include some dessert as well.  I ended up saving mine after being more than satisfied following my meal.

I opted for the Outlaw, for those that know, you know.  It comes with a brisket burger, deep fried onion crisps, there very own BBQ sauce, cheddar cheese on a lightly toasted bun and topped with some pickles and peppers.  Additionally, I made it a meal and added fried okra on the side.  

The meal came out rather quickly, considering that there were other patrons that were there before me, but have not yet gotten their dishes...and when their dishes did come out, it wasn't anything huge or extravagant.  So note to self, burgers and sandwiches come with the quickness.

However, there is something about burgers that in now way humanly possible can fit into anyone's mouth, no matter how much you smash it down by hand.  I had to cut the bad boy into 4's in order to get it down without getting cited for indecency.  Kinda like getting a salad from a place that serves it on the smallest petrie dish ever constructed...I never seemed to ever get the logic in that.  But seriously, I'd rather complain about my meal being way over sized versus being a meal for an action figure.  

One thing I noticed though, they do not ask how you would like your burger, meaning that it comes standard as what looked to be medium rare plus, but not quite well.  It was moist and flavorful, but started to toughen up towards the end when it cooled off.  The Okra was on point and the BBQ is a nice compliment.  

The decor is like most BBQ joints that is accustomed to getting thrashed following a nice serving, evidenced by the whole paper towel rolls at each table.  There is no sense getting all done up if you are there to get dirty.  Yet, there was three flat screens playing three different ESPN channels, always a good sign.  The place appears to stick to it's Arkansas roots and has the Razorback Fight Song posted on the wall in the extended dining room.

What rubbed me the wrong way was that I dropped a few bucks in the tip bucket right in front of the waiter, and he did not even acknowledge it.  That was disturbing since I actually clean up after myself pretty well.  I almost felt like sticking my hand back in the bucket like I was fishing for catfish, but oh well, I may be making too big a deal about it. 

I definitely want to come back to try the ribs and other offerings, so if its BBQ you want, this is the place to be.

This place is as good as it gets when it comes to BBQ. Not only is it authentic,  everything is fresh and fast! Everyone there is super friendly and Mike and the whole crew make you feel at home.  We actually came in when the Travel Channel was filming if that tells you anything. Highly recommended and five stars all around!

This is the best Barbeque in Las Vegas! Great prices for the amount of food you get! Everything was delicious  Especially the brisket. This place has a great feel as well super home-y. Will definitely be returning!

Tried Rolling Smoke for the first time about a week ago & I'm already back. I got the pit special which included ribs, pulled pork, brisket, & chicken. it was all absolutely delicious. Their bbq sauce is unique and semi sweet but amazing. Both times I have come here the staff is very friendly and this time Big Mike was up front and actually thanked me for coming in and told me how happy he was I liked their food. Small business customer appreciation at its best. Would recommend Rolling Smoke to anybody. You won't be let down!

Drove from Henderson due to seeing it on TV(Food Network). Expectation were high. My husband and I arrived, obviously first timers. We walked in didn't even know what to get, their was so much to pick out off. I let the cashiers know, Hey! It's my first time, what do you recommend? I didn't even get answer. He replied, are you going to order? My husband got a whole rack of spare ribs n I got the Trio Choice of 3 meats. I asked for mashed potato and cole slaw, i only got cole slaw. We didnt get told if their was any sauces or utensils. I came across them because we were walking out after we ordered.  The ribs had no flavor to them, they werent dry which is good. I felt like the service coulve been better, due to being a first timer. Lets not mention my plate! I had to add soooo much sauce so i can ger some taste to it. I could see the rub on the meats but no flavor To them. It was like grilling food myself in my back yard m. I wasnt impressed, really thought it be really good since I seen it on TV! Hi5 on the cool cup, it's reusable!  Btw, I don't think what we paid ($55.00) was worth the drive nor the food.

Oh yeah, this place was good. After a failed attempt to return to Gordon Ramsay's Burgr, where I went up each level of the Planet Hollywood parking structure without finding a single spot, (not even a false hope spot like "Yes! Wait there's a Prius. Shit.) I decided to search Yelp for an off strip spot with top notch reviews and ample parking. That's when I stumbled across Rollin' Smoke BBQ and boy I'm glad I did. Although the hot links weren't very spicy (like I prefer) they tasted great with the "Country Girl" mustard based sauce. The brisket was on point and the ribs cooked to perfection as well. They have several sauce varieties, all good, especially the vinegar one ("Alabama vinegar" I think.) The staff was very friendly and our food came out within 10 minutes. I'll definitely be back to this place and wish them continued success.

Try it or Diet Final Word

Oh you better believe it, you need to try...this...place. Solid, solid BBQ without all the hustle and bustle of the strip or the long celebrity chef lines.
amazing food and service. the price for desert is a little bit much but i got it for free with my check in. never knew this place was here.

Just went here yesterday for the first time and it was delicious.  My husband and I split a full rack of ribs and got a couple of sides and it was more than enough (we still had left over ribs)!  It's moderately priced and definitely worth a try if you have a craving for BBQ!

I can't give this place 5 stars because the brisket & sides were quite underwhelming. That said, the spareribs (naked, of course) and the bread pudding (flavored with Heath bar on this particular night) were absolutely to die for! Our server (his name escapes me, but he was a big Okie dude) was very personable & very knowledgeable about the menu. We'll definitely be back!

I don't write reviews much unless something is worth sharing or a place needs more reviews. In this case, I just HAVE to rave about this place even if it has more than enough reviews. The stars it dawns are definitely earned. If you love meat or Southern food, you can't go wrong here. I've had my fair share of meat experience and Rollin Smoke BBQ is high on that list. 

The Food: "Pit Special" - $20 + tax
You receive 4 meats of your choice and 4 sides plus a drink. Portions are pretty big although I'm on the smaller side (4'10, 90lb) so an average build will definitely not leave hungry. I got the brisket, spare ribs, hot link, pork, potato salad, corn nuggets, Mac n cheese, and lastly corn bread. The meat was delicious, some bits were dry but nothing too bad, mostly moist and falling off the bone. Cooked well with a little pink in the brisket and ribs, subtle smoky flavor, and had a slice of bread to cushion the goodies. The corn nuggets remind of corn muffins I've had growing up in the Philippines (corns bits, crunchy bread) so I loved them but it might be a hit or miss for others. The corn bread is TO DIE FOR. Soft, moist, amazing flavor. Boyfriend had to promise me that we'd take some home when we leave Vegas back to LA - it's just that good. Can't vouch for the other two sides since I was too full to try them and I don't want to review it non-fresh. 5/5

Atmosphere: Spacious considering the location. Has outdoor seating and a private party room to the side. Couple flatscreens to entertain you. Steel tables - easy to clean and sanitize. No napkins, just a huge roll of paper towel since you're bound to get down and dirty. Interesting mural of people on the wall and mascot merch scattered around. All in all, eating there was good. 3/5

Customer Service: You order and pay at the front then seat yourself. Cashier was nice enough, not super welcoming but helped me out with recommendations and they were all hits :) Although she did accidentally charge me extra on the 4th side (put as separate from the Pit Special) coming out to $25 instead, no biggie if it's not a repeat mistake. I only saw 3 staff on the floor: main cashier and the other two switching off delivering food and checking up on customers. The one guy was very nice and welcoming! 4/5 

Definitely recommend this place.

Holy BBQ heaven Batman!!
This place is fantastic and exactly what a BBQ joint should be. 
We had the club wrap STUFFED with chicken, pork, bacon and fixings; waffle fries, corn fritters (A MUST) and the 3 meat combo of burnt ends, hot links and spare ribs. There was a ton of food and not a single complaint! 
Can't wait to come back and try everything else on the menu.

Man...thank you Nelson Q for checking in! I came right after he left! We had the Pulled Piggy sandwich for $7.99 and the Trio Choice Plate which gives you a choice of 3 meats. We got the brisket, pork, and 2 spare ribs for $13.99. Oh it was divine! The meat on the spare ribs just slips right off of the bone, and the pulled pork was just juicy and full of that smokey flavor.

The owner conversed with us for a bit, and based on his choice of decor in the place, you can tell hes an Arkansas fan. He was super humble and couldn't stop being grateful for all the Yelpers who had Yelped about this place. He also helped us with making choices. With a party of two he suggested the trio plate and the pulled pork sandwich if we wanted to have variety since the plates were more than enough to share. We chose beans and mac and cheese as our sides, and I tell you it was also just as good and homemade tasting as the meats! He also told us a little bit about the process in which they smoke the meats in their smoker right behind the restaurant, and smokes it for 16 hours (no wonder it's so good!). He wanted give Las Vegas a taste of good old Arkansas bbq, and he sure did!

When you check in you get a free pie with your meal! I got the sweet potato, ala mode of course! Super delish, and a must try. I will see you soon. Hands down one of my favorite places to eat.

Tried this place the last time in Vegas. I have to stop by again to validate that the FOOD IS AS GOOD as any review on here. I know BBQ..and they got BBQ. Stomach could not handle eating anything more. Thats why i have to go back and try the rest of the menu. This is where I will have my breakfast when I land. Don't overdress....the smoke is in the air literally and you will smell like BBQ.

Wow this hole in the wall rocks! Their food is great and huge and for a great price.  
I took close friends there and they loved it ( being that they are over 6 feet tall and 200 plus and always hungry)

Theeeeee Besssssst BBQ Everrrrr. You gotta try the loaded nachos. It's like half a pound of waffle fries, topped with your choice of meat, (I always get pulled pork), chile beans, nacho cheese, sour cream, BBQ sauce, and green onions. OMG delicious. $14 a pop, but can fill 2 people easily.

Hands down the best BBQ you will find in Las Vegas. It's tucked away in a seedy part of town but thats the classic markings of a great food spot. I usually get their combo plate with brisket, chicken, and their fried okra. If I'm feeling ambitious I'll get some mac and cheese on the side too.
I love their different options for BBQ sauce and how the meat tastes so good by itself that you only need the smallest amount to amp it up a bit. They also offer an all you can eat, but I can barely make it through a combo platter so I don't think I'll ever order it. However, if you have a big appetite I would highly recommend the AYCE.

This place is great! My husband and I went there for lunch today and the place was packed. When you pull in the place it is a lil hole in the wall which makes it even more surprising at how delicious their food is. We ordered the Rollin smoke plate special (5 meats and choice of 3 sides) @ 1st they brought out our sides and after waiting about 20 minutes we had to ask what happened to our meats. After about another 10 minutes we were served our meats and give extra order of sides for our wait. Over all everything from the service to the food was great!

Came for the famed Outlaw Burger. Hoped that it would remind me of some burgers from restaurants I grew up with which are now long lost. It didn't.

Food was OK. Service was quite nice. In the end, probably won't be back.
Love Love this place The food to die for!!! This place is phenomenal!! Don't miss it

Located in a really... interesting area of Las Vegas, right off the freeway, this place is a HIDDEN GEM!!!! 

Parking lot is small, but a good size for the establishment. Right outside are two or three picnic tables (the kinds you'd see in the park), and on the door there is a menu for you to look at. In the room where you order there are a few more picnic tables, menu is along the back wall and the cash register is in front. The lines can get very long, but thats because a lot of people have a billion questions like WHAT DO I GET?!? WHAT'S GOOD!??!

Yes, lines are long but they get the food out pretty quickly. 

Hot link is super spicy IMO. So if you like spicy, then go for it! Best bang for your buck would be any of the platters. My bf and I got the rib platter or something like that, it came with spare ribs, pork ribs and beefy ribs along with a side of your choice and a piece of bread. It was about $30, and the tray of food gets brought out to wherever you're sitting. Make sure you listen for your name. When I saw the platter I thought... meh, nothing special, presentation isn't great, just seems like a bunch of burnt meat piled on top of each other. BOY, was I wrong! Don't eat the beefy ribs FIRST because they are SOOOOO good. Everything just falls right off the bone. Save that for last! The spare ribs and pork ribs aren't bad either but, seriously if you had to pick just ONE thing off the menu, go for the beefy ribs. 

Add some Alabama (?) sauce to that and it'll be like a party in your mouth. Also, I'm not a huge fan of banana pudding but the one here is delicious.

I've been by several times and loved everything I had each time. The employees are very courteous and make you feel like family when you are there. I like how affordable the menu is for the quality of food that you get. For $7.99 I got a "Smoked Brisket Sandwich" and for a few bucks more I made it a combo which included a side and a drink. I also added an additional side of "Cheezy Mac & Cheese" to my order. The brisket is smoked for 18 hours and is the best brisket I have had in town. The meat has such great flavor! When it comes to flavor the beans have it and like the brisket, the beans here are the best I've had in town. The macaroni and cheese was very good too. I'm not the type to eat meat off of the bone, but I did try a rib and I enjoyed every bite! So tender and flavorful! For dessert I had "Banana Pudding" priced at $3.99 and it was the perfect ending to a perfect meal. 

Inside is clean and smells like heaven. So does the parking lot where you can on most days see the man himself outside smoking up some of the tasty meats they offer here. If you want to eat at home they offer a variety of party packs. They will even come to your home and bring their own grills and smokers to cater your event. Call them to find out about the packages they have and pricing. I am going to definitely keep the catering in mind for the future!

This is in a dark corner plaza off strip, so it's hard to miss! It's right after the freeway bridge if you're coming from the main strip. 

I shared the three meat plate with my boyfriend. It was enough for both of us, and you get 3 meats, 2 sides, 1 drink, and a roll for under $15!

Bacon potato salad was super yummy! :)

Spare ribs were my fave. Fall off the bone, tender, and sauce was great (peppery bbq sauce). 

The hot link tasted like any other bbq'd hot link... Nothing special but was delish with the sauce (they cover all their meats with the same sauce I believe..)

Brisket.. My bf liked it.. But this was my least favorite. It was dry and flavorless. :(

I wouldn't recommend doing the ayce unless you can eat A LOT. because one of the meat plates is already pretty filling.

THIS PLACE IS AMAZING! Me and my friends came here after searching on Yelp and this was the top one. And I'm so glad we did. First time being in Vegas since I turned 21 and I'm so happy we did not go to the typical Vegas buffet. They also offer an all you can eat option, which I was eyeballing but glad I  didn't because I was stuffed and didn't finish my tray. MITCHELL is one of the coolest host I've come across. His upbeat personality made my first time here very memorable and he is a man of his word! He said that the food would be out in about 10 minutes and jokingly, I said I was timing him and he was definitely up for the challenge. 3 minutes later, my food was personally delivered by Mitchell himself! He was so hospitable - I am beyond impressed. We were even able to take a tour of the kitchen. 

Mitchell, thank you so much for making our time here so memorable. I would give you 10/10 stars because that's what your deserve, but Yelp limited me to just 5. I will definitely come back next time I am in town!
Some of the best restaurant bbq I have ever had!!! There was a nice smoke flavor to the meat and the sides were a decent size. I would definitely eat here again!

Anything less than 5 stars is BS. This is in my top 3 of all time BBQ joints. Burnt ends... On friggen point! The biggun, simply epic as are the individual components that make it up which are the hit links the pulled pork and my favorite, the brisket. Waffle fries are as good as they get. Add some corn nuggets and you are in high cholesterol heaven. Staff is cool, courteous and helpful. The location is  a bit sketchy late at night if you're not familiar with the area. Its fine though, nothing to worry about.

First time here and If you want really good BBQ this is the place! Dave's nor Lucille's has anything on this place. Beef brisket was to die for and the ribs fall of the bone, seasoned great, and the homemade BBQ sauce is delicious. Was so good we decided to get a second order to go.We will definitely eat here again!

Honestly left that place feeling like I was part of the family. Dusty sold me on the place before I had even ordered my food. I have never experienced "Good Ol Southern Hospitality," but if its anything remotely similar to the way we were treated at Rollin Smoke Barbeque, I'm moving to Arkansas!! 

We ordered The Outlaw, The Piggy, and the Brisket Sandwich with Mac and Cheese, baked beans, and corn bread as our sides. All three of us left 100% satisfied with the service, food, restaurant, and everything. 20 min later and we're still talking about it. 

Dusty and John built that place from the ground up and if you treat um well, they'll return the favor. I'll definitely be stopping in again!!! No complaints here. 5/5
Damn good food!  You must try this hidden gem for your bbq fix. Perfectly located by Strip Clubs galore, so you can go before and/or after you get your freak on!

Have been coming since it opened. Seems since they got the good reviews and "best of Las vegas" they have gotten greedy. The changes to the menu now it's 3 bucks if you want a drink. 3.50 for sides if your meal doesn't have a side. They raised the prices for the tourist but for locals it's 10% off if you show a Nevada ID. Food is still good but for two now it's about 50 dollars.  Will be looking for the next best BBQ in Vegas.

I long ago retired from writing Yelp reviews because I figured, "Why should I just DONATE my amazing writing/reviewing talents to Yelp, helping them make millions of dollars off my endorsements?"

I still feel the same way, but every once in a while I come across an experience that calls me back into the Yelp game. This was one.

Had Rolling Smoke last night for the first time.
It was the best.
No seriously, I think it was the best I've ever had.
(I'm writing this at 5am so you know it's real)

I had the 4 meat combo: chopped brisket, burnt ends brisket (OMG), chicken, and beef ribs. I paid extra to have the burnt ends and beef ribs and it might be the best decision of my adult life.

David at the front is super engaging and welcoming. I assumed he was the owner, he made us that comfortable.

ATTENTION ROLLIN SMOKE OWNER/OWNERS/OWNERSHIP GROUP
Make this dude an owner or something. Sign him up to a long-term contract or just give him lots of money and make him promise not to leave.

That's about all. It is 5 in the morning and I have a fridge full of leftover bbq and it's not going to eat itself.

Thank God.
Legit!!! Had the ribs and loaded potato. Wow! It was great! Highly recommend this for anybody looking for authentic non commercialized BBQ!
The Best BBQ in Las Vegas! It was amazing.I had the baby back ribs and I have to say I wanted to go to the back and kiss the chef. Very meaty very delish!!!! I will be returning!

I love BBQ and try to hit different spots nationwide.  I was in Vegas and wanted to do off-Strip stuff this time around.  We decided to give this place a try given the great reviews.  Location, we are talking about a dark street next to a gentleman's club akin to uber hole in the wall.  Only in Vegas!

So we were greeted at the door by a taxidermed hog and in front of us in line were three police officers... My thoughts-heck yah we were in for something good!

Customer service was top notched.  I ordered the 1/2 rack baby backs ($17.99) and a pound of the brisket ($10.99).  Floored that sides were not included as with typical BBQ spots, which makes the pricing on the expensive side.  

Baby backs came out and the color was a rich coffee grind black and just brilliant.  I was expecting some excellent bark.  But, oh Romeo, alas it was not meant to be!   There was no texture to the bark although the meat did fall off the bones.  The dry rub was mehhhh.   The three sauces had a more watery consistency than traditional BBQ sauces, which is absolutely fine.  There were three varieties - mama sweet, house, and BBQ.  The house had a nice balance between sweet and vinegar and was our favorite.  The brisket had what amounted to a peppercorn rub.  They love the peppercorn at this place. Perhaps it was the end of the night, but it came out very dry.   We ended up not eating most of it it, which was a shame.   

While dining, we eavesdropped on a conversation.  Apparently this is Rick's (of Pawn Star fame) favorite spot and he and Rollin teamed up to open another spot in Rick's strip center by his pawn shop.   Well, sounds like Rick is rollin in the dough with his Rollin location, which we will check out next time we are in town.

Overall 3.5 stars. Not good enough to round to 4 though considering we've had so much better nationwide.

Not too fancy on the outside but the food here rocks with flavor! Such a great value for all the southern treats you have been craving. I'm from San Diego and WISH this place were closer so that I could frequent it weekly. Service was A+  and the cook came by to offer us samples of the various cobblers and bread pudding. I thought I had died and gone to heaven!

The food at Rollin' Smoke BBQ is awesome! My family and I were first-timers. We'd heard how good it was, so our expectations were very high. Rollin' Smoke met every single one of them. We all ordered different menu items but somehow we all wound up with the brisket, which was perfectly cooked. My husband isn't big on Carolina sauce, but he must've used half of the bottle while we ate. It was that good! I could've eaten a gallon of the Mac 'n' cheese all by myself. Which is a good sign because I'm very picky about Mac 'n' cheese.  I also could've eaten a gallon of greens, they were perfect!  There was so much food, I gave my leftovers to my brother. I think he may have finished them in the middle of the night.  Another thing I liked about this place was how friendly the staff was. Good food AND good customer service? Yes, please! Dusty was such a gracious person, I wanted to hang out with him and talk BBQ for the rest of the night.  

We were a little nervous when we saw a line out the door, but once we finished eating, we understood why.  There is no way that food that good wouldn't have a huge line.  The only downside about this place is that it's in Las Vegas and we live in Los Angeles.  But from now on, this will be one of our stops when we're in town.

Definitely way too much hype for this place. I went once and it was OK. Will not return. 

I had the pulled pork sandwich and, unfortunately, had small chunks of bone in it. Nothing huge, but come on...that's not supposed to happen. The meat is tasteless and you are forced to douse with sauce to get any meaningful flavor. 

Also, the prices are pretty steep. You get the pulled pork sandwich for just under $10 (not a problem), but then you must pay an extra $4 for combo/drink (problem)! So, lunch for one person is nearly $15! Too much for BBQ.

Good proximity to the strip, though. However, the area can be sketchy at night.

Once you've had authentic Texas BBQ, it's tough to meet that standard again and this place doesn't even come close.
The food was cold! The brisket was fatty, cold, and nasty! The hot links tasted like smoke sausage! The beans were good but had too much pepper! And Lastly, the fried okra wasn't crispy!

Ok, been to both places now...old location (super charming for under the bridge) and the swank Pawn Plaza...um...I don't know how this could be, but the new place is even more incredible. Guys guys guys, get the ribs and they've got awesome craft beers in the can. 

RIBS RIBS RIBS RIBS RIBS RIBS RIBS RIBS RIBS...

I had best, most tender ribs from this place! My family has been dying to go here but it's a little out of the way for locals, so we finally made our way here. The line took about 20 minutes and it was a little cramped inside, but there seemed to be enough seating. I got baby back ribs, mac & cheese, criss cross fries, and peach cobbler. The ribs are. so. good. Seriously. As well as everything else. Best BBQ I've had in a long time.

I stopped here while visiting from out of state. I ordered The Biggin and it exceeded my expectations. Being someone that makes my own bbq I always look for a smoker, if there's no smoker then it's liquid smoke and that's not good bbq.

This place is legit and seriously one of the best bbq places I've been to. I'd come to Vegas just for this. It's easy to get to by taking the bus & a short walk.

The sauces range from Country Girl (Mustard based), Sweet, Carolina Vinegar, & Arkansauce. The meat didn't need any sauce, but I tried all 4 on fries and they are top notch.
The ribs were burnt to a crisp and the brisket was so dry.  I can't believe this place has 4 1/2 stars. Wtf
Excelentes Cortés de cerdo, las mejores ribs, cerveza muy buena , gran ambiente y la mejor atención . Imposible irse de las Vegas sin probar la mejor barbacue que recuerde.

Just had some really excellent BBQ here, the brisket was so tender and flavorful and the beef rib was enormous. Also had the hot link, which was good but not anything special and same with the mac and cheese but the greens were very tasty. This place gets high marks and I would definitely come back.
Great off the beaten path place. Clean restaurant, awesome BBQ. The pictures say it all.
Excellent! Can't say enough good stuff about this place. The BBQ sauce is incredible and the Brisket falls apart and is so moist. This is my new favorite place.
Great Smoke! Awesome BBQ! Always looking to grab another bite!

Last night on 10/9/14, I ate here and I cannot even give this restaurant one star but they make you pick a rating to post. We went there to eat for a club function. I don't know who picked it but this place is terrible. They serve you with plastic forks, knives and spoons that look like they've been rewashed. When I complained they brought out a new bag and when I took the spoon out of the new bag that I opened it had a dried worm on it. The food was greasy and my chicken was half raw..my friend's was cold. They use breed as filler for everything including massed potatoes.   The peach cobbler had two tiny slices of peaches and the rest was something I can't even describe. I will never ever go back there again and I would never ever recommend it to anybody.
First time and I fell in love with the place. The Outlaw burger is amazing. The pulled piggy sandwich was small but tasty. Will be back!

Best spare ribs I've ever had.  Same for the beans.  The brisket and cornbread were darned good, too.  You can tell the meat is done right, rubbed with spices and cooked low and slow for many hours in a hardwood smoker, not just brushed with liquid smoke and baked in an oven. Chef Tim promised a special sample of the pulled pork next time.  Very friendly staff loves to talk about the food.

Wow! Found this gem as I was searching on yelp for a good place to eat while we were in Vegas for SEMA... I sure am glad I found this place! Their food was amazing and a great price. The beef ribs are insanely good, definitely a must try if you are in Las Vegas!
The service and food was fantastic. I had the duo of brisket and hot link with coleslaw which was delicious! Great tasty BBQ!

Nice place.  Friendly.  Made me feel at home and seems to be family oriented.  I ordered the AYCE!  Big mistake,not because it was not delicious, but because it was way too much food.  I started with beef rib, pork ribs, hotlink, mac n cheese,greens, and somehow they threw a piece of fried catfish on my plate too.  Everything was awesome, especially the beef rib, very meaty and smokey.
The only problem was that the link was not very hot both in heat and spice. I also had the fried shrimp and hushpuppies (I asked them to half the normal order for me cuz I was so full,  they said no problem)
I finished with sweet potato pie and carmel cake. ohhh and i even asked them for a glass of milk to wash it down.  Not bad, not bad all!

Yay, I have a legit bbq place to go to when in Vegas, and one block off the strip so convenience of location without the traffic. The pit special basically covers all the bases 5 meats and 3 sides....corn nuggets are pretty legit

This place is amazing. Definitely the best BBQ place in Vegas. It's a little out of the way, but definitely worth making the trip down there. The food is awesome and the staff is really nice too! And the prices are really decent for the portions they serve. The outlaw burger and the beef ribs are a definite must try. I would definitely go there again if I'm ever craving for some good BBQ!

Fantastic!
Wish it was in my town!
Service was friendly, food came out in great time. Hot  and tasty!
RSB club wrap so good and tons of good.
Mac and cheese OMG yes. Khiken beans Spicey and great.
Wings are complete drum &  flapper in one, so good.
Duo platters chicken &  pork fabulous and tons of food.
Duo chicken &  ribs  awesome.
Fried okra tasty, crispy and not greasy.
Corn fritters moist with real corn.
SWEET TEA yes!
Will visit again!

The best catfish I've ever had. The service is awesome. They've created a family environment that's unique. People were talking to each other like we were all guests at someone's house. Mamas banana pudding tasted just like my grandmothers.

An easier location is right across the parking lot from the Gold and Silver Pawn Shop, and this location is open on Sunday.  The BBQ was very good -- we had the brisket.  It was the sides that were surprising.  They were very good!  Potato salad with crumbled bacon bits and fresh chopped chives?  Yum!
Pretty good barbecue and pretty good food. I wish the beans did nor have meat in them, there is already enough meat in the meat. The place could also use some remodeling.

BEST. BBQ. EVER. You must go. 
First off, thanks to all the yelpers for the reviews! Burnt ends, ribs, brisket, hot link (aka sausage) all fabulous. Corn nuggets are a definite to order. However, if you never order anything except the CORN BREAD it's all you really need in life.
Light, fluffy, buttery perfect. Can double as a dessert. Why? It's the perfect finish.
Having said that, I got the recommended peach cobbler. Ahhhhhhhhh......good choice. We ordered corn bread to go. :) Yep.
Shout out to Matt, great guy, nice smile. The staff was super. We even met the Pit Master. This staff wants one thing-for you to really like the food and have a great experience.
My regret? We didn't eat every meal here. I am crying because we have nothing that comes close to this. A family member has travelled all over and said the only thing that comes close is in San Antonio.
Please, do this. Any wait is worth it.
I come from California I wish this place had a second location in Los Angeles always come here when I come to Las Vegas best bqq I ever had.

Best BBQ ever! Yum! Better than anything we have in San Luis County in Cali!!! Kids loved the cornbread and the coleslaw was perfect chipotle spicy! Ribs were amazing, piggy was fabulous and brisket was tender and perfect! Loved the variety of BBQ sauces - Arkansas was my favorite!

Hand down the BEST BBQ I've had in Las Vegas!  Beats the pants off those chain places and Big Mike is down home good people!  Stop in and git ya some BBQ and homemade cobbler ... you won't leave hungry.
Best bbq I've had in town. When family visits from out of town, I bring them here. Had everything on the menu and am fully satisfied.

All I can say is wow. This is the real deal BBQ. Ordered the rib sampler and brisket, greens, cornbread and Mac n cheese. Just look at the smoke ring on the brisket and the dark pink color of the ribs. You know they know what they're doing. I went to Pot Liquor at town square 4 weeks ago and it was during their soft opening so I didn't do a review. So far Rollin Smoke by far is much better.

I'm a native Texan with BBQ sauce running through my veins and must say this is one of the top 2 smokehouses I've ever eaten at! When a meatloaf, of all things, was blowing people's minds you know Rollin Smoke is doing something right!

After an extensive search for a BBQ place on here. I decided to go with Rolling Smoke. I was NOT disappointed. 
This place is the shit. Straight up good BBQ. Great staff. A no frills setting with bench and park bench seating. Wasn't too hard to find either. The menu offered some great choices. 
I went with the half rack baby back ribs, beans and cole slaw. Man the Kicken beans was kicken. So tasty. The cole slaw didn't appeal to me too much. My wife loved it. 
The ribs were very tender and tasty. 
Adding their BBQ sauce only made it better. We also ordered corn bread. Omg that was da bomb. Buttery and soft. I really can't say enough abt this place. My only regret is that I don't live in Vegas. But hey it's a great reason to come back.

Solid barbeque establishment that is worth trying out.

The brisket and pulled pork are decent but when at the Rollin Smoke Barbeque you will definitely want to order their ribs.

Their pork baby back ribs has an excellent smoky flavor to it and the meat is very tender. It isn't quite fall off the bone but nonetheless it is very tasty. The prices aren't too bad either and the quality of the food puts it above Famous Dave's.
The baked bean sides is about average but the macaroni and cheese is quite creamy and smooth. The noodles they use for it is different and the cheese isn't as sharp. It's more of a mellow flavor. The macaroni and cheese isn't bad, it is simply different.

The portions unfortunately aren't large for a two meat combo.

The service here is excellent with a friendly staff that is attentive and kind.
The decor here also is neat as it represents the hole-in-the-wall kind of grimy joint.

I would eat here again.

I'm usually just medium on bbq, but I thought Rollin' Smoke was awesome.
We split the 5-meat sampler and the meatloaf and everything was really good. But I mostly looooovved the meatloaf! And the fried corn fritter things. Man, those are so good.
This was a ton of food. 2 adults and 2 kids ate that night and had leftovers for all of us for another night. 
I can't say much else that other reviewers haven't mentioned.
It's worth a trip, whether local or tourist.

Went here 2 weeks ago for dinner. I saw that this place got rave reviews on here and other sites and, honestly, I don't understand the hype. The location was a bit sketchy being literally under two freeway overpasses. I ordered brisket, chicken, with a side of mac & cheese and bread. The chicken and the mac & cheese were ok but the brisket was downright bland, even with a little bit of glaze on it. I'd be willing to give this place a second and possibly order different, but as far as first impressions go, I was not impressed.
Incredible BBQ!!! A must have when in Las Vegas. Pulled pork nachos were delicious. Will be returning time and time again!

We catered for our job 4th of July party globalindustrial.com. Excellent food and service. Chef pants and Big mike came and set up everything up and served us. They were polite and fast. The ribs were tender and fell off the bone. This was my first time trying brisket and it was good. The chicken was smoked and juicy. It was seasoned. I didnt expect it to be good and it was. The mac and cheese was cheesy and good. The baked beans had a kick to it not to spicy and no where near bland. Next time u are looking for bbq check them out. Catered or go in...

Great soul food. Ribs were great, sides awesome, they had sweet tea free refills. The coleslaw has a kick to it. Greens were good, Mac n cheese great, bacon potato salad good. Corn fritters to die for. Can't wait to come back to Vegas to go here again.

It was a bit too much about being BIG instead of being great. The best part of the Outlaw Burger (the obscene meat building in the photos) is the onion rings. I also thought the red cabbage was a nice touch. Baby backs are not fall off the bone, but good flavor. Really liked the homemade BBQ sauce sitting on the table. Sides: corn nuggets - OK, not much flavor; waffle fries - no Bueno, probably a frozen product and they were served cooler than room temp; Jalapeño Cole slaw - good (not great), I did like the contrasting sensation spicy and cool-slaw. This is a great place for families. And the price is right. Worth a trip - Yes.

The people are extremely friendly.  My favorite by far are the spare ribs. They are perfectly seasoned and smoked to perfection. they literally fall off the bone and melt in your mouth.  The loaded mashed potatoes and mac not cheese are perfect pairings, so much to choose from. We will be back very soon to try more things off the menu

Best BBQ I've ever had in my life. Hands down. I don't know how they do it. At one time I truly believed I was a revered BBQ expert, and after eating here, I never want to bust out my grill again, because it is just going to be inferior. The ribs and the chicken here are absolutely phenomenal, and the price is very friendly.
If you love bbq then this is the only spot you need to come! Real wood real smoke, real flavor!

Went back a few weeks ago since my relatives had seen it on TV and wanted to try it out.  So I took them there.

First, the taste of the BBQ has really improved since our first trip.  This time it was nicely smoked with just the right amount of spice and flavor.  Meats well done and cooked well.  I wasn't that fond of the pulled pork, which seemed too salty but the other meats, ribs, beef and links were A OK.

But, this time the food was cold.  Not freezer cold, but it tasted like it had been sitting out on the counter way too long and was medium to medium minus warm.  

If they could get the quality improved this place would rock in my view, but until then, I'll stay away until someone else I know wants to head over to Rolling Smoke.
Brisket sandwich lacked any smokey flavor at all. Very disappointed. Over priced for the lack of quality.

This place is the best I've found out here in Las Vegas. Ive alway love going to Famous Daves, but once we found this place we haven't been back, ( i couldn't even remember the name of the place we used to go to, i had to ask m wife) We ALWAYS come here now. One liner i give it from a movie, "It'll make you slap yo mama."

Exquisite outlaw burger. The burger had a smokey taste to it and it had the consistency was more of a meatloaf burger then a real burger but it was delicious anyway. The onion strings on top of the burger were delicious.My wife had the brisket sandwich. The meat was soft and tender. The only thing I didn't like about it is it didn't come with any extra toppings like tomatoes, onions, or lettuce. If you make your way to Vegas make sure to visit this place. It lives up to the hype. I had to knock off a star because they could've done the brisket sandwich a little better as far as toppings go

I love this place!! I always bring a lot of business to this place. I refer a lot of visitors in the convention business to order from here on lunch break. I have arranged a deal during the BlackHat (a convention at Mandalay Bay) to treat the crew to a very good lunch from here and the crew loves it as well as the client. So, this place has helped me better my business relations based off of happiness from good food.

Awesome, Fast service even though they are always busy. Got a free desert for making an appointment with Yelp, liked that . All food is great, tried almost everything at one time or another, nothing bad ever.

You can't get better BBQ than this in LV. It's BBQ heaven. They offer an All You Can Eat! We had the brisket, chicken, spare ribs and the Best Beef Rib this side of the Atlantic Ocean. So tender and juicy! All the food has serious BBQ flavor.  The beans (omg) are what BBQ beans should always be. Don't forget to ask for the Damn Hot BBQ sauce, just to kick up the flavor to spicy. Great staff that will make your visit more enjoyable.

This has been my favorite barbecue place since I found it through a friend, not long after they opened. I was coming here weekly for a long time. Get the trio platter with brisket, chicken and hot link. Best sides are the kickin' beans and the jalapeno coleslaw.

I've been using Yelp for years, but I signed up today just to tell you how great this BBQ place is. Kind of a hole in the wall off the beaten path, but soooo good. Probably the best greens, too. The staff is very polite, friendly, and helpful. They have 2 smokers running, it's the real deal!
Go now before they're discovered!

I had the pleasure of dining here with nine other people after one of them suggested it for lunch.  Admittedly there was trepidation at the idea of eating at some new location at of all places on...Highland Dr.  

Located in an area known for plumbing supplies, auto repair, strip bars and this that or the other thing and BBQ!?  RSB was a totally unexpected "Hump Day" treat.  It was the rave upon our return to the office.

 The outside upon initial glance may look greasy spoonish but this is by no means the case. The inside was comfortable with seats to spare.  It has a contemporary look inside but the smell and hospitality which leaves no doubt that this is serious BBQ.  That and the large smokers out in the parking lot.

I went with the "Spudastic" a baked potato filled with beef brisket and smothered with cheese and sour cream.  I combo'd the meal ordering as my side the jalapeño coleslaw and refreshing sweet tea.  It was pure joy to eat.

The ten of us dining while marveling the smoked pieces of brisket, pulled pork and sausage on a lone picnic  table outside in what is almost December...INCREDIBLE! 

I will no longer tolerate the now benign flavor of that served up by the corporate so called BBQ joints. My taste buds are forever ruined.  SUPPORT LOCAL BUSINESS!!

The best barbecue place I've found so far! Their St. Louis pork ribs and corn nuggets were DELICIOUS!
 
Would've given a full 5 star review, but my first time going there wasn't very pleasant. The cashier didn't even bother to help out with the menu. She only gave an "Idk there's a lot of those. Idk what's in there." I was a little taken back, but I thought maybe she's having a bad day (oh well). My second time going in there though was WAY better!! Lizelle and everyone there was very hospitable! They made my experience and my last day in Vegas even better!!! Keep it up!!! 

Definitely coming back!!!!

Rolling in deliciousness! 

As a local, I have found it difficult to track down the best bbq in Las Vegas, but after walking into Rollin Smoke I was assured I had come to the right place. The intoxicating smell of authentic bbq smokiness gave my sense of smell a run for its money and my hope was that my taste buds would follow along in happiness. I was so pleasantly surprised as the ribs, pulled pork, brisket and chicken arrived at our table. We ordered the four meat, three side combo to be able to try a little bit of everything. The sides we picked included the jalapeno cole slaw, bbq beans, mac and cheese and an extra side of dirty Vegas rice and cornbread. You know you've come to the right spot when everything you try is finished with an mmmm sound, a smile and a look of agreeable satisfaction to the person you are dining with. Just to describe a few, the brisket had an intense flavorful smoke on it you could see and was tender and delicious. The ribs were perfectly large and full of rich meat with a sweet intense spice rub. The jalapeno cole slaw was crunchy, a little spicy and had just enough dressing without drowning it. The mac and cheese was the perfect cheese sauce to noodle ratio with noodles cooked just right without drying out the dish. The cornbread was cooked perfectly,  sweet and salty with a warm layer of melted butter on the bottom that made it a little more guilty of being just so good. We look forward to going back and letting our friends know this is where they can find the best bbq in town. Thanks for bringing great bbq to Vegas!

If I could give 10 stars I would. This place makes me sad for one reason... we don't have a place like this in LA. Not only is the food EXCELLENT, but the owner and everyone there is so friendly! You can really taste the pride and attention they give to make your meal.

The best bbq in the nation. Better than Rudys, better than the shed, better than Texas pride, better than all others. I tipped the chef $100 because it was well deserved. God bless the hand that makes this amazingness.

The pulled pork and chicken were bland but definitely
Go for the spare ribs, brisket, kickin beans, hot link, price, and portion size. This place is delicious, great place off the strip, local hangout, and crowded. Go during off hours so you beat the crowds. If you stay at Trump Hotel, you can walk over there easily.

I tried Rollin smoke on a whim and I'm very glad I did! I had the three sliders combo; two pulled pork and one brisket. For a side, potato salad with smoked bacon. It was very tasty and filling. The only reason I didn't give five stars was because some of the pulled pork was a bit dry; it was easily remedied with copious use of house BBQ sauce!

I got the trio meat plate with brisket, chicken, and ribs and I'm telling you it was the best bbq I've had in a while. This is real bbq in the heart of Vegas and a must stop if you're visiting! My brother finished his outlaw sandwich in about 5 mins because it was so good Hahah

Great BBQ place. You know it'll be good when there's a big line at 4PM.  Pretty small dining area so tables can be difficult to et; by its ok to share with others; and there's also an outside seating area.  We tried the spare ribs, baby back ribs, chopped brisket, 1/4 chicken, mac and cheese and yams. All were fantastic. Although the next time I will definitely try the pork and hot links to confirm everything on the menu is great. One side note is that the baby back ribs were better and had more meat than the spare ribs. I will definitely be back.

When I'm craving barbecue, Rollin Smoke is the place to go! We've met friends here and taken our out of town guests here. They even give locals a 10% discount which is a plus in my book. There is an overflow area to provide additional seating which is almost always being utilized due to how busy they usually are. We try to order something new every time we come, but we always order the Burnt Ends, and the creamed corn nuggets. The reason for only giving them 4 stars is because they don't offer fresh brewed Iced Tea. They have the fountain type that tastes terrible. Just my opinion, but I just feel like a barbecue restaurant should take the additional steps to brew the iced tea in house.
Absolutely the BEST BBQ in LV. Chopped, burnt ends, and great potato salad. Must be homemade because it tasted better the next day. Be sure to ask for onion strings too. Secret menu item.

The only TRUE BBQ available in Las Vegas. I have eaten BBQ (true, smoked BBQ) all over TX and Kansas City and have tried all kinds of places here in LV but this IS legit!! Excellent dry rub and smoked to perfection. The brisket and baby backs are my favorite. The baby backs are melty tender in the middle and nice and jerky like on the ends.  The brisket is comparable to Rudy's and Blacks BBQ in TX - some of the best I've had. SUPER nice folks and a family run business. Location kinda sucks but it just adds to the true BBQ ambiance. (Ha Ha!)

Large menu, seems consistently busy and a BBQ buffet to purge on!

We both ordered the all you can eat ($25 pp) which is good value! Round 1: ribs, 2 orders of hot links, pulled pork, 2 orders of brisket with the jalapeño cole slaw, kicken beans, mashed potato casserole and potato salad.

REVIEW: meat was all tasty except for pulled pork was incredibly dry. Took a lot of extra bbq sauce to enjoy. The hot links are sure tasty with just the right amount of spice. We LOVED the kicken beans that were slightly sweet and savory -- Mmmm! The jalapeño cole slaw is unique and one to at least give a try. 

Round 2: chicken, 2 rib ends, ribs (again) and sides of fried okra, corn nuggets and onion straws. The chicken was juicy but came smothered in sauce which I don't care for. Rib ends were crunchy and had true smoke flavor. The corn nuggets are AMAZING with a sweet inside and perfectly crisp outside. The fries okra came with a side of sauce that complemented it well (sort of a Raising Cane's creamier sauce). The onion straws were average but tasted good.

Luckily for them the 2nd round is smaller (less wastage). We left smelling like smoke and were super stuffed. We are not sure if we will give it another shot or not but we can say that we have been there.

given the hype, i was a bit disappointed.  nowhere near the best bbq i've ever had but for the price point and diverse menu it's not a bad choice if bbq is what you crave. could have been that we went late afternoon on a monday and the turnover isn't as high as peak times.

we got the pit special.  i found all the meats to be average at best and quite a few tasted re-heated.  the baby back ribs were not enjoyable for me. the bbq sauce was nice - found myself adding a lot to the meat to help the flavor.

the sides were excellent - we got: bacon potato salad, jalapeno cole slaw, and mac n cheese.  the cole slaw went well with a fork full of pulled pork (which wasn't all that good on it's own).

banana pudding was terrible, i threw it out. i can make it better myself and i'm no chef.

although i feel like we didn't really pig out to our normal extent, i was disgustingly full for the rest of the night.  felt like it expanded in my belly for hours to come.

Hands down the best BBQ I have had since living in the south. The portions are huge and the prices are very reasonable. It's not far from the strip but better than anything I have had all week. Bummed I found this place on my last day in Vegas, I will definitely be coming here on my next trip and thinking about it until then! The staff is also great, really nice and down to earth! Do yourself a favor and stop in!

Great BBQ joint! The staff was very friendly (cashier even introduced himself and shoot my hand after ordering!) and the food is great! As you get out of your car you can instantly smell the smoke that goes into making the food so good! The ordering process was easy and my food was quickly delivered. The meats are smoked to perfection and the sauce to is due for! I would highly recommend this place, and I'll be back again for sure!

-Reasonable price
-Delicious food
-Extra friendly staff

A couple of friends suggested my fam and I try this place out. Needless to say, we were all very pleased. They had quite a large menu with some pretty excellent deals. The gentleman who took our order was very friendly and was happy to offer recommendations/opinions on certain dishes. We didn't wait very long for our food to be ready. The guy who brought it to our table was personable and excited for us to try it. The dude who took our order came to check on us shortly after to ensure we were happy with our meal and to make small chat (not in the annoying way we've sometimes experienced at other restaurants, he was actually sincere and nice). He told us how he and his fam moved here from the south and we chatted about the show "Grill Masters". 

The food was great! Definitely better than most I've had in the valley and for a much better price. No complaints AT ALL. As long as this place is around, we are never going to Memphis BBQ again. HAHA.
I've never really cared for bbq or smoked foods, but the food here is amazing. They have made a convert out of me!

Disappointed!!
All hype no substance. I am sorry to say i was veryyy disappointed with my fist experience at  this place. I am big foodie so I opted for the "all you can eat" option to try different things.
I ordered Beef ribs first which were pretty average. Then I ordered baby ribs & to my utter shock I got 2 pieces of ribs as hard as a rock. It seems as if there lying on the side for hours & someone just reheated them. Totally tasteless & not chewable.
I don't know if they offer/prepare different food for "all you can" customers.
Trust me, I am not new to reviews & am a well traveled person (been to 34 countries so far) & I ALWAYS gives benefit of doubt to any restaurant as anyday can be a bad day for them (as its for us). That's why I try more than 1 thing on multiple days before crossing out any restaurant.
But my first experience here was so bad that i don't feel like going there again.
To all the fans of this place.. sorry folks.. Don't agree!!
The all you can eat is not all you can eat! The ordering system sucks. Waited over 30 minutes for them to give my food to another table.

Went to Rollin Smoke a couple of days ago. FINALLY I find a bbq place in Vegas that I can eat at!!!!!!!! This place is great, but I did take off a star for no table service, they just bring out your order. Now back to the important part--THE BBQ. Outstanding  covers it quite well. I got the Trio, the brisket, the thinner slices were juicy and smoky, the one thick slice was a little tough and dryer, not sure why. Ribs were meaty and good with the bbq sauce applied, which was a little thin for my taste, but flavorful. The sauce brought out more flavor, but flavor dropped off alot with no sauce, but still good though. And finally the hot link, I think WOW covers it. A lot of flavor, right amount of heat and perfect snap. As for the sides, beans were great, potato salad just OK, could have cooked potatoes a few minutes longer, were just under crunchy, but flavor was good. Overall absolutely will go back, but Famous Daves ribs are still better, not sure why, will have to try both again and report back.

I recommend anyone coming to Vegas to always consider trying spots off the strip because you'll always find hidden gems like this one. The best bbq west of the Mississippi hands down! The brisket is tender and the baby back ribs have a ton of meat & fall right off the bone. I recommend the kicken beans and the loaded mash potatoes for sides. The catfish here is very good and melts in your mouth! Place is actually known for their meatloaf and their outlaw burger. The staff is very courteous, friendly and hard working. They put a lot of love in the food that's for sure!!

This place is a small hole in the wall and from the outside it doesn't look like much. However the line out the door and the BBQ surrounding the business was a good sign!! The price is $25 for all you can eat dinning in which is extremely affordable. I seen the plates going by while in line and knew one plate was going to be plenty. I ordered the 3 meat combo chicken links and brisket w a side of Mac n cheese!! The sauce was a condiment and the meat w so juicy and seasoned just right!! My God the chicken was AMAZING I was so impressed I got the breast and it literally melted in my mouth!!  I can't say it enough this place was sooooooooo good!!! This is added to my list of must haves when I go to Vegas!!!
AMAZING!! I've lived in Las Vegas almost 10 years and just discovered this hidden gem. The food is delicious and the service is amazing. Definitely the only BBQ place to eat in my book!

This place never disappoints. It's one of my favorite BBQ spots in all of Las Vegas (Ellis Island is my other fave). I always get the burnt ends (brisket) and links with a side of corn nuggets and yams. What I love is that there is enough flavor, but not too overbearing; the brisket is sooooo tender. Not too much of that smoked flavor or seasoned with too much pepper (like some other place that will remain nameless). The customer service is GREAT....their sauces are a nice touch especially the Sweet Country Girl. Depending on day and time, seating can be slim pickins.

The reviews do not lie. Vegas is a must with Rollin' Smoke. We decided to get bbq on our way back home and it really made our trip back home a lot more bearable. 

The cashier suspected we were knew and handed us cups of waters and menus and told us to take our time reviewing the menu. There were a lot of open seats so we grabbed a picnic bench and pored over the menu. We settled on the plate with 2 bbq choices and a meatloaf. Good thing we were hungry--the portion sizes are huge. 

The meatloaf was the best I ever had. With the crunchy onion and the mashed potatoes, it was heavenly. The ribs were fall of the bone delicious. The brisket was none like I've had before. Their sauces are to die for. My favorite is the vinegar sauce--pure amazingness.

Aside from pesky flies that were bothering me the entire meal, this was a solid experience. I can't wait to be back. Thank you for showing me what real bbq is about!

Okay again. Glad I drove 25 min to this place instead of wasting my money at other BBQ places. This is THE REAL DEAL LAS VEGAS NV. If you want real BBQ this is real BBQ!  Can't say it enough. Their love shows through the food,   it's not just another person trying to get rich off of another popular food item.   They ARE smoke masters!!   Clean, fun, chill envirement! Everyones there for one thing. Good BBQ. SPEEDY service and worth every penny. Make sure you tip these guys. They deserve it!!
