This place rocked my socks. It's so good and has an authentic southern feel. Their ribs & chicken are so bomb! Try the jalapeño coleslaw. It'll leave you on your ass!! It's so good and hot.  The wait varies but it's worth it. Kinda lowkey spot too from a tourist point of view ^_^

Bookmarked this one.  I dont want to forget it.  Not that I could.  Exceptional pulled pork. Lots of smoke.  

Try the corn nuggets.

Another first yet again. 
This place is very down to earth. It's not a sit-in-waiter-take-your-order-and-serve kind of place. 
As you enter, you place your order as how you would in a fast food joint.  You get you own fountain drink, take the plastic spoons & forks, and plates. They bring your food to your table and you dig in!
The food is very superb! THE BARBEQ OF BARBECUES and we are not disappointed. 
We ordered the Pit special (5 different meats) plus three sides (your choice). The barbecue flavor is amazing and this place doesn't under deliver. In fact, I think they over deliver!!! Yummy food!!! 
The other patrons in this place are all very friendly too. Attitudes are all very kind and positive. 
A very well recommended place for locals and visitors alike to visit and I guarantee that you will be liking the barbecue sauce off of your fingers in no time, just like we did!
Best BBQ I've found in Vegas so far.  My husband and I love it here, and will drive well out of our way to swing by here when the mood hits.

Little off the beaten path, but it was busy. I had the 3 meat combo brisket, ribs and pulled pork. Brisket very tasty, nice smoke. Ribs outstanding, not as fall off the bone as i like, but good no less. Mac and cheeze, wow awesome. Wife had the catfish, shrimp and hush puppies. Hush puppies over cooked and stiff as a rock. Catfish dry and so-so. But this is a BBQ place, not sure why she wanted seafood when we were at a BBQ spot, but it was not a wise move. For BBQ, its a good spot with really really tasty sauce.! Reasonable prices as well!!
WOW ! The BBQ was very good. The brisket could be cut with the side of a fork which is how I judge BBQ. The peach cobbler was outstanding. After just one spoon I could tell this was heaven in a bowl.

Had the all you can eat special.  Plenty of good barbecue and no limit on the food.  Includes the side dishes, desserts and drinks.  The employees are all friendly and go out of their way to help in any way.  The dining area appeared to be clean and employees were quick to clean up any mess.  We will return for more of their excellent food.
This place is reminiscent of a bbq place back in L.A.. Unfortunately, that place now sucks, and this place is the new old place.

I like it. Menu is limited, but that seems the course for all barbecue joints.  Definitely family owned and operated, and food and service is always consistent. If there is a wait, handle it, it is worth it. The brisket is great, meatloaf reminds me of being a kid, and the Outlaw burger will take you out. Kid's menu is a bit steep so we usually work with a full menu item and split. Just solid, non-chain food style barbecue that satisfies.

Hands down best BBQ in Las Vegas.
I have now been a couple times and quality has always been consistent.
As soon as you walk in the aroma of their signature bbq-sauce floods your nose and the picnic style tables and comfortable setting puts you at ease. 
I recommend the brisket or the burger!

Service was super friendly and fast, but I am perplexed at the high average rating.  

We got to try several items on the menu w/ the $25 AYCE deal and pretty much found everything to be just ok.  The pork and brisket were on the dry side and the ribs did not fall off the bone.  The meatloaf, onion strings and outlaw burger were tasty.  The best thing we had were the corn nuggets - fried creamy goodness!  Mac and cheese and loaded mash were ok.  Desserts had so much potential but didn't deliver.  Their sundae was ice cream with a little choco sauce on top, nothing else.  Banana pudding and peach cobbler were meh.

If you do go, don't have too high of expectations based on Yelp.

The food was good, flavor was on point. Staff was nice. Atmosphere was down home. Service was fast. The price as opposed to the portions was off tho. I felt like it was a bit over priced for the amount of food you receive. But overall not a bad dining experience.

This place was delicious. Outside the strip. Everything was made with love full of flavor. 
We got the sample platter with grilled chicken, beef brisket, links, ribs and pulled pork and choices of BBQ sauces.   Side we had the Mac and cheese and sweet potato yams.  Must try if you are a BBQ lover.

Beef Ribs. Beef Ribs. Beef Ribs. Those succulent, fall off the bone BBQ marinated goodness. There's seriously no reason not to get the beef ribs. This is exactly what they are known for and each bite will remind you of why they are given such high grandeur. Of course you should get some sides! Maybe a piece of cornbread and some good mac & cheese and don't forget to wash it down with some really good sweet tea. 

This place is a gem you wouldn't have known Vegas would have but trust me, you'll enjoy every bite and glimmer.

This new spot is one of the few good bbq places in town. We got the AYCE on our first visit to try everything - the beef ribs are definitely the best, the most tender and packed with the most smoky flavors. Baby backs are also quite good so I might get them again. 

Note to self: avoid the dry brisket next time and not a fan of the Memphis ribs.

But I also got to sneaked a peek at the burgers the staff was serving to the other table and they're GIGANTIC. I doubt anyone would be able to keep the burger intact while devouring it... but they look hell of delicious!
Little pricey and sucks they are closed on Sunday... But still hands down the best BBQ joint I have found in Vegas! Damn the beef ribs are fire! This place is worth giving a try.

Until Rollin Smoke opened up, the barbeque  in Las Vegas was HORRIBLE!

The guys at Rollin Smoke know their BARBEQUE !!!  Everything on the menu is fantastic!!  More specifically, the pulled pork, the brisket and the meatloaf.

This is the only place in Vegas to get GREAT barbeque; and to make things even better, they are Razorback fans!!

If you're in Vegas and you're lookin for some great food; stop by Rollin Smoke!!

Woo Pig Soooie!!!!

Was a regular since I work down the street I normally get lunch here but until today I ordered over the phone same thing I normally get when I pick up my food it was more than I usually pay . They obviously didn't mention that they raised their prices . Place is ok but not worth 12.99$ plus tax for a baked potato for lunch . If you raise the prices you would think they would put extra meat  they're very stingy with the meet .

My quest for excellent non-chain restaurants continues, and finding this one was a happy accident.  There are large smokers in the parking lot which is originally what drew our attention to the place.  Usually we find our gems from Yelp, but this time it was a drive-by (or I should say that I find places on Yelp as the bf is in the food industry and like many industry people has a baseless grudge against Yelp).  

Since i am not a huge meat eater what I really care about are the sides.  The sides were amazing.  Which is great because a lot of times at BBQ places the focus is on the meat only and the sides are kind of an after thought.  The peach cobbler was insanely good.  And I have been dreaming about the loaded mashed potatoes since I had them.  I also had the mac n cheese.  The waiter (who I assume is also one of the owners since he thanked us about 20 times for coming in) recommended the mac n cheese.  Listen if you can't execute a delicious mac n cheese you should throw yourself off a bridge.  It's macaroni, cheese, cream and bake.  It was really good but I was more impressed with the other sides that are nonstandard and were amazing.  On my next visit I plan on trying the banana pudding.    

It does have its advantages and disadvantages, depending on who you are.  It is right down the street from the Rhino - a disadvantage to me, but an advantage to any dirt-bags.  The parking lot is kind of sketchy, again a disadvantage to me, but like home to dirt-bags.  The BBQ sauce is really peppery.  I personally like milder sauces and I am not a big meat eater, but I could still appreciate the execution of the sauce and that it was made in house.  I am not used to eating smoked meat so was a little concerned that the chicken looked pink, but the bf explained to me that that is how smoked meat should look that has actually been smoked in a smoker and not just marinated in smoke "flavor".  All the meat was very tender, but the sauce was a little too intense for me.  That being said I was more than happy to stick with the sides.
5/5 stars. Came from San Jose,Ca to Vegas and when we come back were definitely coming back here. I tried the outlaw burger and my husband the Biggin daddy sando.
Probably the best BBQ ive ever had. Savory flavor and just straight up delicious. Servers are very friendly and helpful and inviting. We will be back for sure. Would Highly recommend.
This place it awesome..if you are looking for real bbq this is the spot. Good prices excellent service. It's a little hard to find so make sure u have map quest. It is way worth the cab ride.

The food was good but service was questionable. Found a hair in my hot dog and the manager asked me what should he do and lied about not having someone with long hair. I ordered dessert and a worker with long hair brought my dessert out. The manager offered $5 in cash on my $60 bill. Never coming back

let me start by saying that there isnt really any good bbq places that ive tried here in vegas. But rollin smoke is something else.  this place is awesome.  ive had the outlaw burger and it was great i give it a 9.  ive had the trio plate. which consists of 3 meats of your choice a side a roll and a drink.  i ordered the pulled pork,  brisket, and ribs.  with a side of mac n cheese. the meats were juicy amd tender great with. their house bbq sauce.  this place is a go to if you are looking for great bbq at good prices.

I want to write a review where I describe "how I love putting meat in my mouth", but I'm seriously too full and happy to be witty.  Plain and simple, the brisket and pulled pork were delicious.  They come pretty sauce-less.  Don't fuck it up by throwing 2 gallons of BBQ sauce on them, kids.  I mean, the sauce is legit, but the flavor of the smoke in the meat is amazing.  The jalapeno slaw wasn't super jalapeno-y, which is good.  You could tell there was a kick, but it didn't overpower it.  The greens would have made Popeye's eyeballs explode.  Mine were boss-level.  I do dig greens, though, so I might be biased...

All in all, 6 meals for my coworkers for $77, plus tip, was definitely worth it.

Hidden gem off the strip!

This place is always part of our Las Vegas itinerary! The meat is sooooo good! It's cooked to perfection! The portions are huge!
Yams are delicious!

The place looks a bit shady outside and the bathrooms are eh but it's not worth taking away stars. The food will speak for itself.

This is what smoked meat should aspire to. The combo plate and two side had brisket, pulled pork, & hot link. It was all served a top a slice of bread as it should be. The pork was tender with no hard ends. It had plenty of moisture but not heavy rendered fat. The smoke flavor was good but not overwhelming. The brisket had good smoke penetration and the pink ring didn't overpower the flavor. Just the right smoke. Finally the hot link was hot enough without canceling out the flavors. 

Overall well played. Worth the wait. The sauce on the table had flavor with just a little heat. The location has zero parking and the dinning area is challenging. 

I still love this and would rate it up with the like if the Salt Lick in Driftwood TX. A must visit.

Perhaps I'm spoiled because I've been spending a lot of time in the South recently, but my whole party had the same reaction.

The staff was friendly and welcoming, and it was an easy place to be, but the food was just OK. We were ready to be wow'ed based on all these other reviews, but that just didn't happen. I think, between us all, we tried all the big items on the menu. 

I wouldn't mind returning, but it definitely didn't live up to its str rating I see on here. 

Not bad, but no rave reviews here, sadly.

Ordered a brisket sandwich and an order of baby back ribs and two drinks for 33 bucks. Over priced for the quality of the food. My order was to go and we ate the food about 15 minutes receiving the food. 

Brisket sandwich was horrible. It was so dry that I couldn't take more that 2 bites. Waffle fries were stale hard and cold. The baby back ribs we're ok but cold and they forgot the side item I ordered. Will never go back.

And we got a winner here folks! May have just taken my #1 BBQ spot in Vegas. Nothing flashing about the ambiance, but some damn good BBQ! Ordered the Duo with Spare Ribs n Brisket w/ a side of Bacon Potato Salad. The vinegar based BBQ sauce was just right. Great smoke ring on the ribs. Brisket was tender and juicy. Go here! Trust the fat kid!

I was expecting this place to be extremely good from the reviews but it wasn't really my taste. The ribs were dryer than I'd liked them to be but this is a really good place if you like dry rubs. I am personally not a fan of dry rubs so this wasn't my cup of tea. The loaded mash was really good though!

Delicious BBQ! I had the brisket sandwich with the Mac n cheese and it was very flavorful. Tried the corn fritters and those were amazing as well. The only reason I gave it four stars was that a few of our meals were cold.

Being from Texas, this city is seriously lacking good BBQ places, until now. Weird location but the inside was nice looking and comfortable. Everything was solid and I have my eye on the All you can eat option for next time. Do I dare?

Rollin smoke is as close to southern smoke as you will get west of the Colorado River.

Let's get to the good stuff

Meats

Spare Ribs: The highlight of the meal. If you're evenly in love with spare ribs as much as you are with baby back ribs, then I suggest to just go with these. Teeeender *TJ Detweiler voice* added with the taste of the meat will make you laugh at your visits to Bludso's or Phil's. 4.5/5

Baby Ribs: I want my baby back baby back baby back..these were less impressionable, maybe because I had them second? But don't get me wrong they were still very good! Fall off the bone and tasty but your stomach will tell you it was only a fair investment and you should of "spared" it some space. 4/5

Hot Links: The perfect meat side for my rib meal, yes I get meats as a side to my meat. The taste wasn't as "hot" as you would think, then again my mom raised me with a molcajete. Tasty to dip in your favorite sauce. 4/5

Sauces..Ask them for a sample tasting of them before you make a decision of such high importance

Sides 

Corn Bread: My relationship with corn bread has always been 50/50. I approve of this one. Soft at the bite, taste home made, the style of it was made to be had with this meal. 4/5

BBQ Beans: These are my babies when it comes to BBQ meals, there was a hint of flavor that elevated it past average but nothing that I'd recommend in bold if you're not such a fan of beans to begin with. 3.7/5

Waffle Fries: The side I dipped in the least. Missing a good seasoning, lacked a crisp taste. 2/5

Potato Salad: In a league of it's own. Someone was a side hog with this one but the 2 spoons of it were very good. Hard to break down the flavor but Javier approved. 4.25/5

Dessert:

Banana Pudding: I'm so sad I was too full to indulge in this the way my inner child would have liked. But this swirled me back to my cubbie days when I thought snack packs were the bomb. The nilla cookies added to this only makes it sound that much better, right? And that's because it is. 4.5/5

Woah, looks like I guinea pigged it for you.

This all was not a bad price either, considering Vegas is Vegas. It was $40 something, The only downward arrow is that the sides are uber small, meaning it's a portion for one. Order 2 of the ones you think you may like the most if you're meal sharing.     

Service:

This was a to go order. It was ready in the said time, they sent me off with sample tastings of their sauces, their customer service enthusiasm was meh. I'd say they're their BBQ beans equivalent in this department. 3.7/5

My Final Say

We all know somewhere in Kansas City or Austin there lays an establishment that is probably better than Rollin Smoke, but regionally speaking, I have not met a close competitor to this place in the West. Let that serve as my 5 star justification. 

I recommend coming here, unless you're a part of Hank Hill's blood line, I am sure you will be satisfied with your meal here.

To Whom It May Concern

I apologize for lack of pictures, I turned into Joey Chestnut one bite in and forgot to take more.

Absolutely delicious.  I wasn't sure about it when we pulled in at 830 on a Friday night but the second I walked in the door, I was greeted by the aroma of the sweet sent of BBQ. Pit Special is what was ordered and nothing of it was a disappointment.  I am pleased to recommend Rollin Smoke Barbecue to anyone looking for great cooking, mouth watering food.

I don't understand how this place has so many good ratings. Terrible place for bbq especially for how much they charge. I ordered their 3 meat combo.  Their meat was dry and the amount that they give you is just disappointing . I had better bbq then this crap. I'd rather go to Famous Daves atleast you get what you pay for.

Just wanted some bbq. Heard about Rollin Smoke Barbeque and decided to give it a try. We were not disappointed. Everything was delicious...rib tips, bbq chicken, ribs, cornbread, greens, potato salad, macaroni and cheese...The lady at the counter was very pleasant and the staff was attentive.  It did not take long for our order to arrive. Will definitely go back, because there were lots of choices that we didn't get to try the first time!

We tried Rollin smoke on a recommendation from a friend, this was going to be our Thanksgiving in Vegas, we loved it. We had sliced brisket, burnt ends and rib tips all were fantastic for sides we chose loaded mashed potatoes and mac and cheese. Friendly staff and near the strip, easy to find. Treat yourself and get some!

I came here because I read all the reviews that were good. Unfortunately, my experience was not as good as everyone else. Our food was cold. I think I went at a bad time. There wasn't a lot of people there so I guess the grill was not kicking out hot food. I guess they just gave us what was leftover hanging around in the kitchen. I ordered the beef ribs because most reviews said to get them and they were really fatty. Rolling Smoke needs to understand the average customer had good bar b que in their lives and know what to look for when eating it. I say that to say, I have a strong feeling the meet I was eating was not made that day. I think the meat was leftover from the prior day because it had a very older texture to it. The links were good but it is not hard to cook a link. The chicken was ok and probably would have been better if it was served hot. The best thing we had was the kick ass beans and cornbread. 

Lastly, I been in Vegas long enough to know that most of these restaurants have good days and bad days. Most places, you are not going to get good food unless the establishment is crowded and they are forced to keep making hot food. I went to Rolling Smoke when it was not that crowded so I believe they just gave me the meat that was cooked a day prior. No way that meat was cooked that day. I think they didn't want to waste money by throwing it away. In my opinion, restaurants should never risk a customer by serving old food that should be thrown out instead. We are coming there for an experience and we are paying top bucks for it. 

I have been to restaurants and had a fantastic meal, just to go back to the same restaurant and have a horrible meal. Therefore, I will try Rolling Smoke one more time. I will chalk it up as one bad experience hoping to get the experience most people on this board received.

BBQ Heaven....Wow....i am glad I stop by to have some bbq and it was very tasty and tender...parking was easy and the service was great...and the bbq was very tasty and juicy...oh yea and the bbq was very tasty and smoky goodness...

Can't miss this place with the huge pits out front....with delicious smoke coming out of them.....

Went here for the 2nd time earlier this week. It's in an industrial area, a little off the beaten path. There was virtually no lighting in the parking lot, I wondered if it was open. The number of cars in the parking lot suggested it was and there was an Open sign with some other flashing signage so I went in.

You order at a podium like desk. I had a Lehigh Valley IronPigs hat on, displaying a pig, and the order taker took a liking to it. I went with the brisket sandwich combo and ordered cole slaw (not the jalepeno cole slaw this time) as my side.

Quite promptly my sandwich was delivered by one of the staff. Overflowing with tasty shredded brisket. The cole slaw was a nice compliment. I left stuffed.

The place has a casual atmosphere, couples, buddies, and families.

I'm glad I found this place and will definitely be back.

Honestly was expecting better for the way everyone raves about it. Service was fine, ambiance is cool and casual, but the food was just blah to me. I had a pulled pork sandwich with waffle fries, it was nothing special. And the bbq sauce is another bummer.

I finally got to go to Rollin Smoke BBQ with my son tonight . We live in Las Vegas and have gone to many BBQ places in town and of course I grew up in the Carolinas and lived in Texas too , so I know my BBQ ! Well , it is good but I didn't think it was great as others do . The meat is definately smokey which alot of places here don't seem to do . I got the 3 meat plate and my son got the big burger . The burger was cooked perfectly and was good , but I have to say the Famous Daves Ultimate Brisket Burger is better . Now , the ribs here are more moist and flavorful . I like the pulled pork a little better here too and I like the Southern Girl sauce better than any of the others . The BBQ beans tasted a little old and not good and I love BBQ beans ! The sausage was ok , but again Dave's beats theirs . The corn nuggets were good and I don't know anyone else around here that serves them . It would have been nice to have corn bread in my platter than the one piece of bun underneath that was oily . All in all , I think this is a good place and will probably try again and they also offer a locals discount . The lady at the counter was really friendly which I appreciate since I am also in the service industry it is nice to talk with people who aren't just doing their job and go next in line . I would recommend this place , but not my favorite , but better than a few others I have tried in town .

Maaaaaannnn let me tell you, you can't go wrong here!  Everything was Awesome!  I had the beef ribs and they were so tender, no knife or teeth needed!  Only negative is the banana pudding, just pudding and a few cookies!  Will definitely be back when I come to Vegas!

Every day im hustlin...for some lip smackin good bbq!!

So glad I found this place thanks to good 'ol trusty yelp here. Was craving some bbq late sat. night and saw that this places closes at 1:30am! Hollah! Its off of South Highland and if you're like me, I discerned the location to be close to Spearmint Rhino. When we got there looked a lil sketchy on the outside but saw that they had these huge smokers out in the parking lot. Walked in, the lady was really nice suggested some things. I got the ribs, 2 BIG A$$ ribs and a side of fried okra. THE BEST RIBS I'VE EVER HAD. Thats it. you can stop reading and go getchur grub on. I've never had ribs that meaty and juicy before and even the fried okra was fried to perfection. And it was all for $13!! please don't raise your prices Rollin Smoke! Apparently there was a rib eating contest that same day, bummed I missed it! So thankful to have found some southern bbq here in the city. No longer going to Famous Dave's!

"I found love on a two way street and lost it on a lonely highwaay"(Stacy Lattisaw). We decided to hit this place up after a night of Tikibombs in Frankie's Tiki Room.  
I mean its only RIGHT. This is a little hole in the wall place but packs the BOOM! In BBQ.  I Had the 3 meat platter which you can choose any combo of meats.  I opted for the ribs, brisket, and smoked sausage or as I call it The Holy Trinity. We also shared Bacon potato salad, loaded mashed potatoes, and macaroni and cheese. YES, YES and YES.  The BBQ was so tender and savory and topped with a vinegar based BBQ sauce that enhanced the all the smoked goodness it could make a grown man cry.  Now to address the sides....as if the BBQ wasn't enough to leave you in meat nirvana the sides comes at you from the left and pulls you in tight.  It comforts you and makes for a very happy tummy.  I am very stingy with my ratings so the 5 stars speaks the universe about this place..but hey you'll only share my joy until you go in and taste for yourself....let the meat sweats begin.

We have eaten here several times.  I have noticed the quality of food dropping lower and lower with each visit.  I will not be returning.  I purchased 2 pounds of pulled pork.  I got 1.25 pounds of meat and the rest was fat. It was discussing and the staff could care less.

Well this was my first time.  I will make it short and sweet and to the point.  Yum yum yum.  It was all good.  I had the beef rib and it was super tender and juicy.  I had the pulled piggy and it was the best darn pulled piggy I ever had.  I had the burnt ends and that was not my favorite and I will probably not order it again but he sides made up for that.  Beans had a little kick!  The coleslaw was super unique and delicious and last but not least the little corn nuggets were tasty.  I ended my meal with the berry cobbler it was alright best.  I swallowed it all down with some sweet tea mixed with regular tea it was perfect.  I am coming back for sure to try lots more!  Mmmmmm....

Service was good.  The staff was so nice and everyone said hi and seemed to care if they messed up to make it right as soon as possible.

I've been here a few times in the past and the food was always quick to come out and the portions were pretty generous.  I went last week for lunch and got more bread than meat and it took almost a half hour for the food to come out.  Granted they were busy, but it never took that long in the past and when I saw the portion size, I was disappointed.  I dunno what changed but I have to only give it 3 stars because of that.
Amazing barbecue the flavor everything is delicious and super friendly highly recommend it, however the location is too small.

THIS PLACE IS DANK! 
I got the brisket 3 ways. Chopped, sliced and burnt ends. 

I wasn't the biggest fan of the chopped or sliced, not fully moist and not entirely dry. But the BURNT ENDS WERE THE Holy canoly of mama aunt jamaima (definetly spelled wrong) 
Also got the chipotle coleslaw and the BBQ baked beans. 


I was told the smoked meatloaf is a favorite ( featured on the travel Channel) 

Also try their corn nuggets. Creamed corn fried

it was my first time here, and everything  was so delicious.  mitchell at the register gave me a military discount,  since i was wearing a veteran tshirt,  and thanked me for my service.  very top knotch. i had the briskey,ribs,amazing corn nuggets,  and a burnt ends. i will be back and will recommend  this place to all my friends.

Good food, prices are bit expensive considering the location is right next to strip clubs, in a kind of seedy area.   And I don't understand having a menu where you run out of portions of it before half the day is up?  If you can't keep your food in stock, make more?  Outside of that, it was alright (aside from the massive amount of smoke that seeps into the restaurant area, making you smell like a chimney sweep from the turn of the century).  Have a lot of friends that love the place, but for me, once was enough.
relly good place cant find this anymore

Wow wow wow this is amazing they use a lot of pepper in the cooking the brisket has this amazing pepper crust and so do the ribs. We have tried a lot of BBQ places and they may nail the BBQ but they always fail on he sides..... This place nails the sides and the BBQ recommend this place to anyone going to Vegas!!

My boyfriend wanted barbeque but then again he always wants barbeque, and at first we were planning on going to a barbeque chain restaurant in Henderson but then I remembered reading reviews about a really good BBQ place near the strip clubs. I looked on Yelp and voila, there it was, Rollin Smoke Barbeque.

 We came last night around 9 PM and it wasn't busy but there were people there enjoying their dinners. You order and pay at the counter/booth and they bring the food out to you. I got the beef brisket sandwich with a side of okra and my boyfriend got the trio with ribs, brisket, and pork with a side of mac and cheese. My sandwich was delicious! I ate it with a fork because it was so stuffed with meat that I knew it would spill out of the bun once I had it in my hands. The okra was good too. My boyfriend couldn't stop raving about his trio of meat! He loved every bit of it. 

It's a small, simple restaurant located down the street from Spearmint Rhino. The person who took our order was sooo friendly! My boyfriend was having a hard time deciding on what he wanted and the guy offered several suggestions, even stating which ones were his mother or grandmother's recipes. He even told us how he and his brother got started in the barbeque business. 

I wonder if they've ever been featured on one of those travel or food network shows? Because if not then they really should be!
The fam bam loved it. Fast easy and delicious.  The hardest part was choosing what to eat on the menu cause we wanted everything!!!
This place is real BBQ!!  If you are looking to eat at an amazing place in Vegas this is it!  #foodcoma

We were in Vegas for our honeymoon and asked some locals about where a good place for decent priced food was.  It was hard to find, but once we found it we were thrilled!  We are from Texas, so we know BBQ.  I had the outlaw burger which was HUGE!  We should have just split it.  It had almost a meatloaf texture, but it tasted smoked and I had to eat it with a fork and knife.  My husband had a full rack of baby back ribs and they were as big as the beef ribs we are used to.  They were fall off the bone tender and we couldn't finish them.  We are big eaters but after this lunch, we skipped dinner.  The owners friend was the cook and he came out and talked with us.  He was super helpful on giving us pointers on what to order and what else to do while we were in town.  Everyone was nice and the food was great.  (it's three weeks later and I'm wishing we could go back for more).

My friend took me here today. First time for me. It was delicious! Everything tasted great, I had the pulled piggy sandwich side of beans and Mac n cheese. My friend had ribs sausage and chicken I tasted his as well and I liked it all except the sausage but that's just me. The bananna bread pudding was really good too my friend raved about it, you gotta try it!  To top off the good food the staff was exceptionally nice and welcoming. They seemed to really care how the costumers were liking their food. They came out and were interacting with everyone and making sure they were satisfied. This place is awesome I would definitely recommend. It would even be great to cater a party! Hope they can make it to the strip .. People would love this place on the strip.

Best BBQ I've ever had, the wife and I stumbled upon this gem on yelp. The reviews were great so we decided to try it. We fell in love with this place. We ordered meals with two meat choices each. let me tell you the pork was delicious. The ribs were outstanding,
Real tender, they just fell off the bone. But my favorites were the brisket and the hot link they were amazing. We also shared their BBQ nacho fries one word. AMAZING!! you must try these with brisket. You won't be disappointed. Also get a side of corn bread, it's moist and delicious. This will definitely be a staple to come back to when in Vegas. Please open a location in California! Lol.

Great food! ! Visiting from san diego,  definitely try the meat trio! ! 
Service was fast an definitely a good experience

After reading many reviews the hubby and I decided to give this place a chance and let me tell you it was a HUGE disappointment. Don't get me wrong the staff was really nic e and the place was clean but, the food was totally different. First they got my hubbys order wrong, second our food came out COLD not warm cold, third my Rib Tips were so dry and though most of it was inedible, Fourth all the food that came out was sooo dry and flavorless it had no salt.  What a let down and waste money.    Oh and by the way this food also gave us upset stomach and disgusting burps.  Ps i recommend the Roadkill which beats this place by far.
Best ribs I've ever had in my life. Meat fell apart perfectly from the bone, they weren't stingy with portions and it was perfectly sinful, making our vacation in sin city even more memorable.

A good friend Dave F. took me here for lunch today. I like good barbque but this was off the charts good! I live 500 miles away but I will be back because this is the best I've ever had. The ribs are to die for, the smokey meatloaf is excellent and the brisket is just great. An amazing place run by very friendly folks. Kind of a strange location but anywhere food this good is served is a good spot. Do yourself a big favor and check it out!
Tom Leo

We ate here for the first time after hearing how great it was.I can't wait to go back.We ordered the 4 meat 3 side plate for $19.95.Great way to sample the food.Practically licked my fingers after we ate, it was that tasty.You must be patient as there is a line to order usually.All of the food we ate tasted fresh though.Great ribs and meats Worth a try and you will want more.

The BBQ was good but I was really impressed with the corn nuggets.  They tasted like deep fried corn cakes.  Outside was super crispy, and inside was sweet and moist with little bits of corn kernels.  This item definitely sets this place apart from other BBQ places.  The house made habanero paste sauce was also excellent.  

My wife and I ordered the trio meat combo with pulled brisket, 1/4 lb chicken, and hot links.  The brisket was juicy with a nice smoked flavor; chicken was tender and flavorful; and hot links were spicy with a nice snap to them.  I put some Carolina vinegar on the brisket which helped cut down some fat and added a refreshing flavor to the meat.  The house BBQ sauce was tasty although a bit watery so I mixed some of the habanero paste to thicken it up.  They tasted pretty good together.  The sweet BBQ sauce, which tasted like honey mustard, was also pretty good, and went well with the hot links.

Service was friendly.  Chef and some of the staff members walked around greeting people and making sure everyone was doing ok.  

Seating is set up in a family style with picnic benches and tables.  

This will definitely be one of the stops we make whenever we are in Vegas.  We actually walked over here from The Trump Hotel despite it being in a sketchy area.  It was fine in the day but I probably would be too scared to walk here at night.

This place is so delicious!  We got brisket, baby back ribs, pulled pork, and tons of sides. Everything was so flavorful and the sauce was delicious! 

I wish they were closer to the southwest, but definitely worth the trip and we will be back!
31 years living in Las Vegas and I just found the holy grail of BBQ.  I've been everywhere including the strip and this is the place.  If you are visiting,  do yourself a favor and eat here.

It's good. But "As Good As It Gets?' Taste wise?  I dont think so. There are not many dedicated bbq places in town, so there's not much competition for RS BBQ, hence "Best BBQ in Vegas"  and the anointed darling amongst the Yelp community. 

The bbq does have a nice smoke ring I give it that, thin pink line, crisp crust, easily pulls off the bone. The bbq hickory smoke aroma in the air is intoxicating and draws  you into this place!  Taste wise it's good, not great. I've had better bbq with better spice rub mix and sauces.  

First impression was a hit for the ribs, a miss for the brisket. It was not as moist like our favorite place. Our recent returns here have been good. Although sometimes the ribs are a tad dry. It could be because we got the ones left in the warming trays longer. 

They did a nice job expanding the dining area. As far as picnic bench seating; it's great if you are with a large party and you take up the majority of the table. But when you have to share a table with strangers that have no table manners or have poor hygiene, it puts a damper on my dining experience. 

The price they charge for what you get is great! That is always the highlight of conversations I've had with other diners and why another reason this place rates high on here. It's cheap! For two meat two side combo meal under $10,  For the amount they charge for decent bbq there's no reason to leave here disappointed. That's why I don't mind coming here.
Pretty darn great barbeque. Don't be afraid of the line. It goes fast and it is worth it. Brisket, a little dry, but tasty. Ribs, beef and pork juicy and yummy. Sauce is not overbearing.

Working at Zappos, I've seen many of my coworkers order catering from this place, I've also had a taste of the amazing ribs pulled pork.

I hosted a team building for my team and thought I'd order from here to switch things up from other typical places I order catering.

The team was super excited for my choice.. 

I ordered the "super sampler"!

The ribs were my favorite. Tender, smoky, and the BBQ rub has just the right amount of flavor.

The pulled pork with the sweet bread is a great combo.

Spicy sausage has just the right amount of heat.

The sides were good, especially that potato salad with bacon! Wow!

I tried to order the corn bites, I hear they were out and will be out for awhile.

I had the opportunity to meet chef Tim twice. I let him know the food was superb.

If you want good BBQ, I would recommend ordering from this place

:)

I grew up in North Texas, Virginia, and North Carolina. In my opinion Vegas had HORRIBLE BBQ before this place opened up. Bar none some of the best BBQ I've had in Vegas or anywhere else. Period. Do not let the location scare you off, this is some of the best food in the valley. Well done rolling smoke!

Had the three meat combo with ribs, links, and chicken.  Ribs were on point and cooked perfectly!  Chicken was tender although a bit over-seasoned for my taste and the links although flavorful were dense.  The sauces were good not great and the beans that I had as a side were so-so.  Would've expected much better for $25 but I'll give them an a-ok for the ribs and the great service.  They need wet-ones though!
Loved this place....was welcomed and the food was AMAZING! !  My favorite was the meatloaf!

When you think BBQ what do you think of? Famous Daves? Lucilles? Memphis bbq? I was confused for many years thinking that these three were the best of Las Vegas in terms of BBQ, guys listen closely.  ROLLIN SMOKE, BEST BBQ IN VEGAS!!!

Location: Its funny when i tell people where this place is located since its in that desolate strip on highland near the Spearmint Rhino. Initially people are turned off, "you're taking me where?"  "Han take me back"  but once they have the food they go, "omg... Han pleaseeee take me back here"

Service: Service here is great.  They try their best to get the customers orders as fast as they can despite being busy during the peak hours of the day.  Another big plus about this place is that the chef will come out when he has time to ask his customers how the food is and a brief history of the restaurant.  Nothing like the person who makes the food to really care about what the customers think, bravo!

Food:  You really can't find anything bad to choose from but i'd avoid the brisket (a bit dry when i had it last time i was here)  Their famous outlaw burger is literally the size of your head.... like a mondo burger (good burger reference).  So juicy and literally will leave you so full, you won't be able to eat till tomorrow.

BBQ: BEEF RIBS!!! that is all.  Literally picked it up and the whole piece fell off.  St louis ribs are also very delicious and juicy.  Meat is so succulent and the juices that exude out of the meat is parallel to wringing a wet sponge.  I might just pass out from describing how good the ribs are.

Overall. Just go here!
This is the best BBQ in town! Whenever I can in here for lunch. The line is always long but who cares! It's always worth it.
Absolutely delicious! Better than Phil's BBQ and much cheaper! If your craving comfort food like meat loaf, hush puppies, peach cobbler or banana cream pudding than this is the place to indulge!

The reviews are right the food is GREAT
The meat was tender and the best was the bacon potatoe  salad. A slice of bread comes with the meal. But dont let that stop you from ordering the fresh corn bread   The corn bread i  give 2 thumbs up
Get here now to have some of the best BBQ in Vegas! Awesome food nice people clean inside dining.

If you like authentic BBQ this is your place!  We were greeted at the door by a very helpful server.  He gave us recommendations.  Everything we ordered was great. We shared the trio meat, hush puppies, Mac and cheese, a berry cobbler and 2 drinks all for under $25.   Yummy.  The restroom was clean and even had seat liners. It is an industrial location but don't be intimidated.
Great food! I love BBQ and have to say it was the best. People need to come try this gem off the strip!

Wow this place takes the cake for best hospitality. It is rare nowadays to find a good place with superb service and have the most amazing food. This place takes care of you like family! 
On to the food:
The corn fritters... OMG! Can I say a party in my mouth?!!! I could probably eat these forever or until I get a heart attack. I was never one for corn fritters but this totally converted me! 
The outlaw burger: totally agree with reviews of having the best burger in vegas. Prepare to share as the portions are huge! Or don't share and keep it all to yourself  
Will definitely be back for this place. Thanks for an amazing experience!
So many good options to choose from!  Love the brisket!  We got takeout from here while we were working nearby.  Great service and great food!

Mmmmm. sooooo goooooood!

Every chance I get I sneak away here on my lunch break from work.
The meat is so tender and flavorful. I must say I use a gallon of their delicious barbecue sauce on my pulled piggy sandwich. Sorry not sorry. When I get back to work everyone is so jealous when they smell how amazing I smell from all that smoked barbecue goodness.

Prices are great and you get a whole lot of delicious food. Sides are pretty delectable too. I typically go with the corn bread though, it comes with two big squares.

I leave this place so happy, full and smelling of smoked meat but it's so worth it!

Not to mention the staff are super friendly and will remember you since you'll become a regular here.

Came here to find out if it lives up to the hype. I have a really good smokehouse close to my house that had better meats and sides (I had the two meat combo with pulled pork and brisket cause it's the staple of good BBQ). Like I said this was good but not great. It has an awkward layout but they get it done. Wouldn't go out of my way to get it again but if you want real BBQ in Vegas this is probably your best bet and directly behind Strip.

The food was flavorless not worth your time. Doesn't compare to Road Kill Grill's Barbeque. Co-workers told me about this place so I decided to try it. The Ribs only had a smoke taste, no seasoning what so ever. The Greens were a good texture but no seasoning as well. Not worth my time or money.....

There were 4 of us--- 1 from The South (Trio (2) 1/4 Chick and Ribs with Fries);  1 from the Midwest (Duo Brisket and Chick with Bacon Pot Salad); 1 from the East Coast (Pulled Piggy and Fries; and 1 from the Islands (Duo Ribs and Chick with Mac n Cheese).... Plus all meals came with drinks. 

1) It was clean... Picnic tables were large, though seating is limited. 

2) EVERYONE enjoyed their food... I loved that the Chef came out to see if all we're doing well and even at times delivered food. 

3) Again, the food was good ;) It looked good, smelled great, hit the spot and was plenty. Almost all of us brought a part back to our rooms. 

4) I read other reviews and came when we wouldn't have to wait in line. It would be worth the wait even if we hadn't.

Bomb!!  Definitely must try everything we tried was fantastic the Mac n cheese, ribs, chicken,pulled pork brisket and peach cobbler!! It so hit the spot!! We will definitely be back and let are friends and family know about this place!!

Walked in and saw the Arkansas Razorback flag, and thought this place has to be good. I was wrong.....it's GREAT.  The baby back ribs were the best I've ever had. Ever. And I don't know what they do to the cornbread, but I hope they serve that in heaven. Good job!  WPS!

I've had this place bookmarked forever and finally had a chance to go a short while ago. It's got a "dive bar" feel thanks to it's location and the old, weathered building it's in. But, that just seems to solidify their reputation as the town's best barbecue. No legitimate barbecue place could occupy a clean,modern building, right? For my first visit I had to try the rib platter ($22.99). With fall-off-the-bone tender baby back ribs with a good crust/bark and smokey flavor, thick and meaty spare ribs, and a massive, charred and fatty beef rib, this was a great option to try multiple proteins. For a side, I went with the mac 'n cheese. Made from elbow pasta and sitting in a thick, creamy cheese sauce topped with cheddar, it only served as a speed bump in my road to devouring the barbecue. I'll agree with many others in saying this is the city's best 'cue, at least from what I've tried so far. Locals get a 10% discount.

Definitely GOOD BBQ

I live in San Diego and we have a few decent BBQ spots one being Phils which in San Diego seats about 300+ and always has a line out the door. 

This place blows phils out of the water, they use a rub on the ribs and a little bit of BBQ sauce you can add more to your liking. I usually prefer a moloasses based bbq sauce with little to no vinegar flavor. There sauce was a great combo of both and add it to the rub on the meat its like a match made in hell at high heat cooked to perfection. 

I was in vegas with my father so we split a half rack of ribs and the meatloaf which is a looks like meatloaf but thats about it because they fill it with pork and different bbq favorites that take it to the next level. 

Great spot off the strip, went on a weeknight no lines, parked in front, great food and experience. BTW if you have had Phils BBQ in San diego this blows it away.

One of the best BBQ joints we've been to in Vegas. Rollin Smoke is located in the backstreets (Highland Drive) behind the strip & is conveniently located on a strip club alley. We've been there twice already ordering to-go & every visit has been worthwhile. The employees are friendly, the service is fast, & the chef even jumps out to get in on the cashiering action. The prices are totally reasonable & the flavor of the BBQ overall will keep us coming back for more. I ordered the half slab of BBQ chicken & my guy ordered the Pit Special with  4 different types of meat including the Brisket, spare ribs, hot links, & pulled pork. The side order of yams is a go-to!!

We had the pleasure of dining at Rolling Smoke BBQ this afternoon, taking a break between watching college basketball games we decided to pop in to this outstanding restaurant. It's located on Highland near the Sahara exit and the 15, close to the Las Vegas Strip. We were greeted by the friendly staff and two of us decided to try the all you can eat option which basically gave us the opportunity to eat anything and everything from the menu for $34.99. Starting with 3 meats and two sides and then two meats and one side on all subsequent orders. If you want good BBQ at reasonable prices, and friendly service I highly recommend you try this place. It's not fancy and you may have a decent wait in line to order but the food is delicious. The burnt ends, baby back ribs, pulled pork, rib tips and brisket were our favorites. The chicken, hot links and fried shrimp also received high marks. As far as the side orders, we all loved the corn nuggets and Mac and cheese, however everything was awesome! The desserts included banana pudding, blueberry cobbler and root beer floats! Our sincere compliments to the entire crew of Chef Damon, Chef Christian, Moises, Brenda, Lizelle and James Monticello who went above and beyond to make our experience so awesome! Keep up the great work Rolling Smoke BBQ! We will be back and wholeheartedly recommend this hidden gem!

Today was my third time having Rollin Smoke and some how every visit, my expectations have been exceeded. 

Today, I brought my family to show them the food I've been bringing up so many times. I order the outlaw burger with my sister and my mom gets some pulled pork. The owner comes out and sits at our table and apologizes to me saying they just ran out of an ingredient of the outlaw but asks if it's okay if he "hooks me up." Knowing there's nothing on the menu that could let me down I'm completely okay with it. He comes back with extra sides and twice the food I was originally receiving. Everything was amazing.
From the food to the customer service. I'd go in depth of how good everything he brought out was was but it would make this review too long to get through. Long story short; This remains my favorite local BBQ joint and it'll be yours too.

1 out of 10, I'll give it an 8. All the meat is tender and juicy and has a great flavor. The sauces are amazing and sweet tea is a must! Peach cobbler is a no, banana pudding is a yes! Only downfall...the rib itself was all bones, barely have any meat and platters are way too over priced. Restroom was filthy dirty.
Best BBQ in Las Vegas hands down. I am originally from Tennessee and have eaten a ton of BBQ. Rollin Smoke is up there with the best i had anywhere.

I've been here a couple of times and the food is usually on point. 

Hot links are juicy with the right amount of heat (I like spicy food)

Brisket is pretty good although the their burnt ends are actually burnt ends.

Burgers are pretty good value and most of their sides have good flavor (try the corn nuggets or loaded potatoes)

The real problem is that their service is pretty bad. I've spent over 20 minutes waiting while my friends got their food in 5 minutes. I asked them to check on the food and they said "I'm sure it's coming" and shoved my check back in my face. 

Their new reusable cups are a plus for repeat visitors, $1.00 off for refills. There is also a locals discount as well as coupons on their website.

Good for food.
Bad for service.
Come hungry.
Leave spending a little more than you wanted to.

This place is LEGIT! It does BBQ for real and conveniently located off the Strip. Pulled pork sandwich and rib plate was yummy. Don't expect the glam scene//// but will get great customer service and the food.

Wow - simply the best meal I had in Vegas last week.   Much better than the very high priced restaurants on the strip.

I had the baby back ribs, and a colleauge had the 4 meat plate with chicken, hot link, brisket and ribs.    My baby backs were better than any I have had - ever.   Great smoke flavor, tender, and simply delicious.    

I'm looking forward to my next trip to Vegas and visit to Rollin Smoke.

Wooooooo  Pig Sooooooie
Besides the amazing food .. Mitch was awesome he made our experience . He guided us Thur the menu .. All you can eat is a must .. Danny was also a doll..

Hands down the best BBQ in Las Vegas. The side dishes are the best I have ever had at any BBQ or restaurant. If you have not been here yet what are you waiting for? Corn bread corn things (forgot name) are amazing. Bacon potato salad awesome. Ribs are the best. Pulled pork check. Brisket is my least favorite but I would eat it everyday if I could. This place now makes me go to the gym three times a week just so I can constantly eat here. Owner is the man too loves what he does and it shows in his food.

I was pretty impressed. Never expected to find barbecue this good just off the Strip. My wife and I split a combo plate (I forget what it was called) so we could try everything. So, from best to less best:

Brisket: Top-notch. Moist, flavorful, well-smoked. A delight.
Ribs: Split verdict. I thought they were great, wife finds beef ribs a bit too chewy but admitted the flavor was great.
Hot Links: Excellent. Spicy and flavorful.
Pulled Pork: A bit dry and not up to the standard set by the other meats. That said, there sure weren't any leftovers.

Sauce: Pretty ordinary, really. Not bad, though, and the meats don't need its help, so it actually works pretty well in a supporting role.

Beans: Fantastic. Almost like a bowl of chili. You could make a meal out of these alone.
Potato Salad: Maybe the best ever. Bacon really does make everything better.
Cole Slaw: Unique and original, but didn't really work for us. The only real misfire in an otherwise exceptional meal.

This is a really good barbecue joint, bordering on greatness. When you factor in its unexpected location, it probably deserves five stars. Barbecue snobs that we are, we just can't quite grant that ranking when comparing it to Kansas City's best. Guaranteed, next time we're in Vegas, we'll be back. Friendly folks and good food bring us back every time.

Being a Texas native, I'm pretty discriminatory when it comes to my BBQ! Rollin' Smoke is probably the best BBQ I've had outside of the big "BBQ hubs" e.g. Memphis, Texas, the Carolinas. It's a relatively small establishment that definitely pulls a crowd most evenings and on the weekends you may stand in line for a bit but the food is entirely worth it.

Delicious, excellent quality, fast, friendly! Loved it!

Try the pulled pork nacho fries and corn nuggets.

Glad to have stopped by this barbecue place, right off the freeway! Our grouped really liked all the items we got, from their outlaw burgers to assorted platters of ribs, brisket, and corn tots. Friendly and efficient service as well; we were well taken care of. No complaints!

EAT IT or BEAT IT!

Coming from SoCal... Phil's BBQ is the standard. Guess what? This has taken the TOP SPOT for bbq in my books. UNBELIEVABLE. It's one thing for ribs to fall off the bone but this just falls and MELTS in your mouth. The beef rib... Wow. Rib tips are so amazing as well. And the corn fritter nuggets... WOW. This place is 6 stars if I could give it. Now each time I visit Vegas... This is a MUST MUST MUST! 

EAT IT!!

Purpose of visit: looking for an early lunch after a heavy night of drinking. We received a great recommendation from a family visiting from Hawaii. They had already eaten there twice going there right when they open at 10am. We decided to check it out since they raved about the place. We ordered the sandwich platter and some ribs. Owner made an exception and gave us 1/2 brisket and 1/2 pulled pork. Homemeade BBQ sauce was sweet and tangy, the brisket was moist and very tender. Tasted great with some coleslaw on a pun. Pulled pork was a little dry but tasted fine. The ribs melted off the bone and were extremely flavorful. Perfect place to get some local food at a very good price. Owner was very nice and made sure our experience was good. Definitely a repeat place.

This is a real hidden treat off the strip. When you walk in, you order at a podium then sit either inside or out at big picnic tables. The food is brought out to you fast and is delicious. We ordered the Outlaw Burger, the beef ribs and sides of greens and cornbread. The burger (which is HUGE)  is made of brisket and is topped with cabbage slaw, fried onion strings, chipotle aioli, lettuce and tomato and was perfectly cooked. The beef ribs come with two bones and are Flintstone size. They have the perfect amount of char and completely fall off the bone. The greens are cooked with brisket instead of bacon or ham and are well worth adding on as a side if not included with your meal choice. The cornbread was a little sweet for our taste but certainly good. Prices are very reasonable. As new residents of Las Vegas, we will definitely be back.

Such amazing food here, would highly recommend trying this hidden gem if you are vegas. Great service at the counter, had a small talk with the chef seems like a very happy team. Wait time for food was not long at all. I give this 5 stars because it meets basic standards and tasty food. Location is a little hard to find but once you do u will be happy.

Were do I start everything was great. Greens and yams were on fire. Even the banana pudding omg. They bring the food to you. The place looks like a whole in the wall but don't let the looks fool you. This is the place in vegas for ribs. I didn't eat the ribs but everybody else did ...lots of meat

The food was 5 stars. I'm docking  2 stars for the rude useless lady working the counter. She was tatooed everywhere and is probably somewhat racist. I walked up the counter and heres how the converation went.

Me: how much food is the half pound of brisket, is it enough for one person?
lady: its a half pound
me: ohh..okay. not sure what the difference is between sliced brisket vs chopped brisket, is it (gets cut off)
lady: one is sliced, one is chopped

at this point, i figured shes only going to regurgitate any questions because they may be too complex for her, she wasn't very friendly, crappy customer service, didnt smile, reminded me of the elementary cafeteria lunch lady

of course then i see white patrons walking in and shes very enthusiastic and smiley with alll of them and actually answering their questions

(i'm an asian male)

the younger girl walking around was really nice and checked in to see how we were doing, the older cashier lady shouldn't be here.

What a great place to eat!!! The owners/chefs are friendly and fantastic. The special for the day was a mountain of food for $5.00. We spent $43.00 for three people today and ended up taking more food home than we ate because the portions are so generous! 
   I've reviewed my share of smoked BBQ places in my current home town of Jacksonville FL and this is the standard by which I measure. For all of the BBQ restaurants that earned less than 5 stars: This is what you want your food to taste like!

Rollen smoke was worth the drive. We had a party of 11 and all were satisfied.  The prices were great. The food really good. My ribs so tender and tasty. The chicken moist and flavorful.  Tritip great!

Stellar BBQ, solid pricing, and huge portions made the trip to Rollin Smoke worth every red cent. Tried the full slab of Beef Ribs, Rib Tips, and 10 piece Wings. The Beef Ribs were like freakin' brontosaurus bones. Huge ribs, tons of meat, perfect bark, excellent charred rub, and juicy as all get out. Perfect combo of meat and fat, and a sure gut buster considering the slab consists of only four ribs. One order of chicken wings was similar to that of about two full chickens. Served as five pieces, but each is dished up as a whole wing and drum. Judging by the size, the chickens are prehistoric, much like those rearing the beef ribs (freaking monsters). The Rib Tips were fine...great sauce, rub, perfectly smoked and charred. Served as 8 pieces, it was a filler-upper like everything else. GO THERE HUNGRY! You'll absolutely be impressed with what's coming out of Rollin's smoker!

As always...soooooo yummy!!! Except, they were sold out of corn nuggets. Damn damn damn!!!! We were headed back to Cali, so now I'll have to wait until our next Vegas visit. Can't beat the $27.99 deal with 5 meats and 3 sides...greens, mac&cheese, dirty rice..paid extra for sweet corn bread. I luv their sweet & spicy bbq sauce. Yummmmmmy!! Enjoy!

Top notch bbq at a great price. I would say the bbq is a little better than the sides. Not bad sides but not the best I have had. I tried the greens and jalapeño coleslaw. Coleslaw was a little dry. For meat it was the brisket, pork and 2 ribs.

Allow me to begin with " ummmmmhmmmm, that bbq is so good it will make your shoes fall off!"  Or something like that from my time in the deep south.  I've decided to try one item at a time, starting with pulled pork. I ordered for carry out, and had to stand around until my "table" was up for service.  There does not seem to be a distinguishing of take away orders vs table service, so expect to wait.  The only area in which to do so is a service station and I had to keep moving about.

The pulled pork was worth the travel and wait time.  The meat is tender but holds together.  It has an intense smoke flavor and mild flavorful sauce.  I'm thrilled to have ordered 1lb so I can pig out and still have some to share.

Go here.

Pit Master and part owner "Dusty" is amazing! I called before Hand to make sure I could eat there with my gluten allergies and he assured me everything but the bread is gluten free! I ate there with no issues and the bbq was AMAZING! I'm from the south and for bbq to impress me is a hard feat! Dusty and the gang at Rollin Smoke are at the top of the class!

I traveled from Seattle and picked this place from Yelp. It was GREAT!!! I had pulled pork and hot links with mac cheese. They have many kind of bbq sauces you can try. Staff was friendly and helpful. 

You order from the counter and seek for a seat. They will call your name then enjoy it!

I'd recommend this place to anyone

Awesome BBQ! Reasonable prices! Nice employees! The location isn't great, but most great BBQ places aren't in great locations, you gotta want it!
I loved the food here and will go back next time I'm in Vegas!

Good as it gets BBQ with excellent sides - served by friendly staff who get it out to you promptly. Ambiance is only cause for concern, but who cares when the food is so good! Odds are you will become a regular customer!

IT AIN'T LOVE BUT IT AIN'T BAD!

First the disclaimer: I am from Texas and believe as fervently as any fanatic that the world's finest BBQ is produced in Central Texas and the sauce should always be served on the side. That said, I am not in Central Texas now and Rollin Smoke is real BBQ for sure.

I have eaten here three times and was satisfied every time, The pork shoulder is mighty fine, brisket real good too, however the ribs have been a little dry both times I ordered them. Maybe I just played unlucky and ordered them at the wrong time. I like their sauce quite a lot, it's tart, not too thick and spicy enough that one is not tempted to overdo it.

I called at 8:40 PM last night, although they were closed Chef Tim was gracious enough to let me pick up 2 lbs, of sliced brisket after hours. The brisket was excellent, juicy with a very dark crust and just enough fat. Had just received a selection of sauces from Franklin BBQ in Austin,TX; favorite of Texas cult BBQ and uber hip Austinites, wanted to do a taste test immediately.

I cannot believe that I drove by this place for 6 months before I stopped, such is the sad state of BBQ (and Mexican Food) in Las Vegas. I expect to be disappointed so I postpone it as long as possible. My advice is don't wait another day, go now.
great dive location...can't beat the food. Industrial area behind the fashion show mall.

I've never had a bad experience at Rollin' Smoke. We order food for the office on occasion. When we do, for some reason there aren't many people missing from the meeting when they know we are providing BBQ. If you haven't been, I suggest you make it a priority.

This food is decent, but when looking at what you get for the price, feel like a rip off. Super small portions

We have to order $40 just to feel comfortable for 2 people and the sides are truly a joke! Tasty food, but I feel like I'm on a diet! If I am eating this type of food I don't want to feel like that! 

Good Ribs, chicken and spicy sausage, I just need a bit more for the price!
place was just ok.  not cheap. people were nice and friendly.  ribs just ok. beans were the best i have ever had.  not good enough to go back again.

Awesome place. Found it thanks to yelp after checking out of our hotel on the strip. Perfect post-Vegas-debauchery food!

Easy to find right off the 15, just a mile from the strip. Parked in front, was immediately greeted by Mike (the owner I think). Super nice guy, helped us choose our menu items and was genuinely appreciative that we came in. Love that.

We sat ourselves at a picnic table and our food came out shortly. Hubs had a trio of sliders and they were huge! I had the pulled piggy sandwich. Portions were big and sides were super seasoned and greasy in a good way. Hangover cure! The brisket and chicken sliders were seriously amazing. Best I've had anywhere. The pulled pork was also very good. Super tender and no fat. 

We got a free hot peach cobbler a la mode for checking in on yelp. Heck yes!

Our ONLY suggestion would be better buns and more sauce on the table. Overall, this place is great with amazing service. We'll be back next time we're in Vegas!

Best BBQ in Vegas. Best prices for BBQ I've seen. Best damn BBQ I've ever had. The workers are really awesome too. Split a 3 meat plate with a beautiful girl (just buy an extra coke) and you'll both be full and content and hopefully you get laid because she owes you now.

In Vegas and the little one says she wants ribs. Uh oh. But Yelp wins again. After a terrible dinner we needed a winner meal.
We had a time finding the place but as soon as we got out of the car we were stoked. A guy passing by asked two old biker cats out front for directions. They gave them then said the guy was at the best rib place in town, he should order. He did.
We had a bunch of things. All tremendous. We'll be back.

Excellent food!! This was our first time here and we were certainly not disappointed. The line was long but moved quickly and we were greeted by their chef who patiently helped us select our food. My husband got the Outlaw burger and loved it. I did the combo brisket, chicken, and hot link which was also heavenly. Don't forget to add the jalapeño coleslaw and bacon potato salad. Oh and the corn nuggets were Amazing!
Had the smoked meatloaf dinner with loaded mashed and greens tonight. It was slap your mama great!!! Defiantly going back for more!!

I look forward to coming to Vegas from LA since this is the best place to get BBQ that's not in San Diego (Phil's), NorCal (Hot City BBQ) or Texas (Hunter Bros H3 BBQ and Smokehouse). Price excellent, stick to the sausage and pulled pork, brisket is only ok. Sides are also excellent, especially the onion rings.

I really just don't get the hype quite honestly. Maybe it was because I didn't have the barbecue, I had the seafood platter but even when I tried my friends' barbecues, it was just "okay." Nothing to fall in that hefty, hefty line for or stand for 10-15 minutes waiting for a seat in their very small seating areas! Maybe for a true Barbecue connoisseur this would be a great fit - but it was so-so in my eyes!
Best bbq ever!! Portions are big and the cornbread is to die for! The staff is super friendly and very helpful.

You absolutely have to get the beef ribs. They are unbelievable. This is, by a wide margin, the best bbq joint in Las Vegas. Sides are amazing but it's all about the meat. Spare ribs, beef ribs, baby back ribs. All unreal. 
The beef ribs are so tender you can just pull off delicious pieces with your fingers. Get em!
I spent $43 there and my dog ate $40 of it. The food was cold, old and unseasoned worst barbecue ever don't trust any rating over 1 star this place is horrible.

I found this BBQ place through Yelp.

Location: We went at night, not a well lit parking lot or lit sign, we were near a lot of strip clubs, but the lot was full, so we decided to peek inside.

Service: You get in a line, order and pay, and hope to find a seat. The wait was an hour to get our food. People who ordered after us got served before us, which was maddening. The staff brings your food, but that is all. 

Food: Big portions! Had that good BBQ flavor and they had 2 different sauces you could use. 

Overall: Staff could be a little friendlier and more helpful with ordering, maybe implement a seating system, and invest in some signage for the street that is lit for when its dark.

This place is a little off the beaten path, but it's always the hidden gems that deliver the most delicious dishes. There were so many choices on the menu, my head was spinning. So my husband and I decided to go with the pit special so we could try as many meats and sides as possible. I'm just going to say you can't go wrong with any of the BBQ fare. The ribs, brisket, pulled pork, hot links- all amazing! The hot links were nice and spicy and all the other meat was super tender and delectable. 
The beans were a great side- thick and chunky with big pieces of pork mixed throughout. Yum yum. The potato salad had crispy pieces of bacon on top which launched it into a new level of awesome-ness. The fried okra was perfectly breaded and fried. No extra salt required. The mac and cheese just seemed like a dud next to all the other sides, so I'd skip that one if possible.
As for the dessert- the peach cobbler was too much peach and not enough cobbler. You could tell that they used a canned peach to make it and it was just not doing it for me. The peach cobbler wasn't the best, but maybe i'll try the banana pudding next time.

Don't let the the outside and the neighborhood deceive you.  As soon you open the doors,  it's like being transported in to a Devine BBQ place.  The smell,  the people,  the food it's what's all about.  This is damn good BBQ.

Hands down the best BBQ in town,, I am a southern girl transplanted in Vegas.............. I know my southern BBQ and this is the only TRUE southern Q in town.. Price is right... Its not fancy but its perfect

Not sure how I have not reviewed Rollin as I 've been here at least 5-6 times.   On my first visit I had the brisket sandwich and the rib combo which comes with their spareribs, baby back ribs, and beef ribs.

I'm a Texas BBQ snob and although I cant get my Texan BBQ fix, Rollin Smoke is about the best you'll get in Vegas and they do their beef ribs perfect.....falls off the bone, tender, juicy, and so delicious you'll be in a meat coma.  

Speaking of meat coma, I was talked into getting their AYCE the last 2 times for $25. This is the best value because you can literally get EVERYTHING on the menu but their portions for regular items are huge.   For AYCE, i typically get alot of beef ribs, get some brisket, and catfish.  Their catfish is perfectly fried with a nice crust and I squeeze a little lemon on it and pour a little hot sauce and i devour every bite of it.

Their desserts, cobblers are great too.  AND this place is open till 1:30 on fri/sats.  Also good for groups - came with a group of 10-12 people and they sat us all easy.  This place is a locals gem and i often see tourists finding their way here.  Def one of Vegas's best!

We were visiting Las Vegas from L.A. We had heard about Rolling Smoke and it was terrific-- everything is delicious, particularly enjoyed the hotlinks and the baked beans. The pork, the beef... just beyond reproach. You will not find a more committed, courteous staff, these folks were serious about business, while being friendly and sincere to patrons. I understood they are from Arkansas; if so, that is one place where manners matter. Will absolutely visit again!
Incredible pulled pork 1 block off the Vegas Strip. Bacon potato salad and jalapeño slaw.

The Beef Brisket Burger is absolutely delicious!  Lots of great items on the menu and they always have some specials as well.  The staff is always friendly and helpful.

It's an easy to get to location between the strip and the 15 on Highland.

 I will definitely be back for more of the excellent food!

True Story.....

I get a text from a long time friend that he had some amazing BBQ and now is at a strip club next door getting lap dances.

Friend: Dude they have over a 100 beautiful women.

Me: What? Wait BBQ??

Friend: Sends pictures of this drop dead gorgeous brunett in a red,white, and blue bikini.

Me: What? Wait BBQ?

Friend: They even have this amazing short person stripper.

Me: What? Wait BBQ?

I had to make this my first stop straight from the airport...and I am glad I did. I was lucky I hit them at an off hour as right after we ordered...the line went out the door!

The food: Lean baby back ribs that are thick, meaty, smokey, and flavorful. Brisket to die for....incredibly tender, smoke ring ladden...OMG....get a combo of the sliced and chopped. 

I would also recommend the burnt ends ( this is something not a lot of places offer). Tons of crunch, tons of flavor, and little fat.

Great sausage and great smoked chicken...but I would not waist stomach capacity on those two.

They offer four great sauces: I had the momma sweet delicious...get it, it is delicious and complex. I also had the sweet country girl....both complemented the meats...and are great to drip the rolls and bread in.

Sides that were outstanding were the bacon potato salad, the jalapeno coleslaw and mac and cheese. I would pass on the cornbread (tasted very pedestrian), corn poppers ( hard as rocks if they are to go), and Yams ( too sweet and syrupy).

I was lucky enough to meet one of the owners and she was sweet as pecan pie and just  a nice person to talk to.......they care about what they serve and how they treat their customers and employees.....nice.

If you like bbq and your in veags this is the place...easy to get to from McCarran airport....and if your bored after the bbq...you can always watch a short person pole dance!!!!

Ok, for you out of towners. This place is located in the industrial district part of town. In some ways it reminds me of having BBq in the Midwest. The decore is very, very simple.  When you enter i was greeted with a large menu on the wall, and a gentle men standing at a tall podium, I felt as if I was ordering from Bbq god, later found out that I was!! The food here was awesome I ordered a Trio: brisket perfect smoke and great seasoning. Pulled pork flavor was spot on yet a little dry, nothing a little sauce didn't fix.  Ribs were the best I have had in LV. A friend of mine had the outlaw burger and I tried a small bite.  Perfect balance of flavor, my only suggestion is to not over mix the ground meat, also mix the meat when it is really cold. The texture of the burger was off for a med/mid rare burger, really dense as if the meat was over worked, it was like meatloaf. Other then that, its worth the wait. This will now be the only place I will go for Bbq for a while.  GREAT JOB, R&S!
Best BBQ in Vegas! Love the brisket and ribs..but cant go wrong with anything on the menu!

Bring on the hate mail!  As an update to my prior review from June of 2013...this place is decent but it seems their success is getting the best of them now and things just aren't what they used to be. It's not only me who is noticing this...I rarely, if ever, see anyone check-in here anymore whereas 2 years ago it was occurring nearly every day.

Service; not as good as it used to be, plain and simple.  Prices; seems like a 30% increase across the board.  Quality; meh, this is now on par with Lucille's if you ask me.  The last few times I've been there or had delivery the food was not fresh and seemed to be of lower quality.  Some items were cold, others old left overs and rubbery.  Don't believe the hype...anymore.
One of the best BBQ spots I've ever been too. It definitely lives up to the hype, be prepared they are a little crowded, but SO Worth the wait. One of my stops when in town
Good bbq brisket and chicken. The wings were a little disappointing. Good service. Good value.

I like that Rollin Smoke renovated the dining room.  It makes it a lot more welcoming.  However, I still believe its too small cause I almost always have to wait for a seat.  

The food here is amazing.  The service is great. I appreciate that the food is made to order.  Its a true BBQ joint, so the ribs and brisket have been cooking for hours when you get there, and the rib meat falls off the bones.  I have never had a bad meal here.

My go-to when I'm in Vegas! Rollin Smoke never disappoints. From the great customer service on down to the most amazing finger licking ribs your mouth has ever consumed. I recommend the brisket with the burnt ends. Thank me later

I've been eating at this spot since the first few weeks they opened. Every time I go back, they are growing and busier than the last time. This time, the line literally wrapped around the restaurant but I patiently waited anyways because I couldn't resists!!!

Everything I've ever had here has been amazing so you can't possibly go wrong! If you love BBQ, you won't find anything like this anywhere within 1,000 miles of this place!
Amazing BBQ joint. My husband and I found it from yelp a few months ago and have been back many times since.. We have been satisfied with the food and staff every visit.

Delicious!! Got a bunch of yummy things from them including their hot dog, corn nuggets, greens, ribs, brisket and more! The bbq is made to order so it takes longer, but not quite as long as some places like Lucille's. The greens were good, but not as creamy or good as John Mull's Roadkill grill. They have a bunch of sauces but they are all pretty liquid and didn't seem to have much distinguishing tastes from one to the other. Their prices are decent for be and overall it was extremely delicious and satisfying. Even though John Mull's is further away, I think I prefer their style of bbq (dryer).

We were lured here by the great reviews and found all the dishes and sides to be average and not memorable.  We tried the pulled pork sandwich, the brisket three ways (sliced, chopped, burnt ends), and the outlaw burger.  We also tried the waffle fries, the corn nuggets, onion straws, and potato salad.  

Brisket was tough.  Burnt ends were overly soggy.  Pulled pork was decent but not a wow.  Outlaw burger is huge but was dry and overly cooked.  

The sides are just ok - with the onion straws being the highlight.   

We did enjoy the variety of "arkansauces" that added significant flavor to the meats and are a recommended addition to food.
OMG!!! Sooo good. The bbq was amazing. Service wasn great. Can not wait to go back.

Great BBQ and deserts are okay. Place is located in a shady part of town near an overpass but dont let that scare you off. The food will make up for it. Tried the pulled pork sandwich it was really good and the sauce is great !
