I hate this place!!!! It's the best BBQ in town and I can't stay away! It's almost life changing. The brisket burnt ends are a must have, so delicious. I love the spicy BBQ sauce and the sweet Carolina girl. Really good sauces and really good meat. The corn nuggets are amazing, like creamed corn that's been deep fried. The Chipotle coleslaw is ok, not amazing but not bad. You can't go wrong with this place that's all I know.

Being from North Carolina, my BBQ standards are pretty high (that goes for the fixins that come with it as well). I'm in the military, so I moved out here from NC almost 3 years ago, and in that amount of time I've never found any place that was up to par with what I considered good BBQ. Memphis isn't very good. Famous Dave's is okay. Lucille's is pretty decent, but for the drive to Henderson (and fairly high price), it's just not worth a regular trip. Then I got tip from a new friend (who was also a fellow North Carolinian) about a place that was a little off the beaten path but well worth it... Rollin Smoke Barbecue. So we decided to give it a try. That leads me to this moment, as I sit here with a full belly typing this review. My wife and I both had the pulled pork sandwich. Her sides were Mac & cheese and potato salad, mine were Mac & cheese and hush puppies. All of which were delicious. The meat was tender, the bbq sauce was delicious and had just a little bit of spice to it. All the sides were awesome. And we washed it all down with the only kind of tea that should exist... SWEET. Then to get our sweet tooth fix we shared some banana pudding that was amazing. Even as I stuffed my face I was studying the menu so I could plan my next visit. Rollin Smoke is the real deal. Great barbecue and extremely friendly staff. If you're a local or just passing through and you're looking for an authentic barbecue experience, Rollin Smoke is where it's at!

Perfect for a 3.5 star but I will do 4.

It is a bit on the pricey side and I don't think it is as good as sns or road kill grill. That being said it is still very good.

We actually cater from Rollin smoke for our office and it is delicious. Some of the best beef ribs I've ever had! The beef brisket is moist, tender, and great. And a BBQ joint has to have great sides and rolling smoke doesn't dissapoint.

This is what I think of when I look for BBQ.  I have been trying all the places in Vegas I can find.   The owners are from Arkansas.  So, if you like Arkansas BBQ, Louisiana, or Texas BBQ you will be in heaven.

They have beef ribs that are juicy and delicious.  Smoked 19 hours.  They have a rub on them and then you add BBQ sauce. The Pork ribs, chicken are very good too.  Haven't been able to find any food to complain about.  I get a little quiet when I am there enjoying the food so much.

People have complained about cost to portion, but the portions are big enough for my husband to be stuffed and full most of the day.  Cost wise, it seemed reasonable for good quality BBQ to me and I will be back frequently.

I tried the catfish and it has a crunchy cornmeal coating with and no weird after flavor you sometimes get with catfish.   I have had it twice now since it is so good.  Once in a basket and once as a poor boy sandwich.   Love it.  I can't decide which is my favorite the beef ribs or the catfish.

The sides I have tried are:  mac and cheese -flavor is good, but I prefer a baked thick cheese sauce over this one.
Hush puppies: pretty tasty
Corn fritters:  tasty, the corn is inside a breading.   Being from Virginia I have some expectations that probably aren't normal or liked by many others.  I felt these were good, but a little blander than I like.   I enjoy the corn tucked into a spicy hush puppy myself

Haven't had space for any desserts yet, but I will have to get some to go next time.  I am usually going somewhere else after.

They also will cook up a whole pig for parties.  Price varies depending on market price so call them.  Very cool.

Can't wait to eat there again.   Also if you go early enough in the day they have a cool electrical store called Kiesub next door.   If you are tech oriented you will enjoy it.

Updating on the baby back ribs which we didn't try last time.
Based on baby back ribs we've had most other places, these were not from baby piggies. These ribs come in at close to 3 pounds per rack! (two of us shared a rack and it was plenty... and we have big appetites) They are from huge HAWGS and are tender, delicious, loaded with meat, and did not have much residual fat.
They are cooked nearly perfectly to a slight dryness. Use their BBQ sauce if you like. I had forgotten how much I enjoyed their sauce... one of the best ever. 
Next visit will be for their Brisket Dog and the Outlaw Burger. If you didn't read my first review, let me say again that the Bacon Potato Salad and Corn Nuggets are also very good.

I had brisket, ribs, and pulled pork. The brisket was so super chewy, the rib was far from juicy and tender, the pulled pork was better cooked but had lots of sinew in it. The bbq was probably the worst i have had it cooked. My wife had the catfish plate which was good. The bbq flavors were good just needed more love on the cooking side along with some care not to serve chunks of things people cant eat in there pork
This is one of those places you go when you just say F--- it diet, im going hog wild! Really decadent food, a great occasional treat
We loved the food and service. We got there close to closing time and they were nice enough to stay open for us.  We took our friends and they loved it too

A MUST go to!! The portions are HUGE, prices are dirt cheap!! Have tried several different menu items there, ALL A+!! The chocolate thunder dessert with almond crust is impeccable! Every item smoked there on the property . Have never had any better here in Las Vegas. It is a well kept secret that many others need to discover. One visit and you are hooked to return!

oh my 

We got the pit special, outlaw burger, Mac and cheese, kickin beans, loaded mash, onion strings, catfish, and corn fritters! you can just taste the smokiness from the BBQ! so much flavor. 

I loved the kickin beans, it has brisket and has a perfect sweet and spicy kick! 

the catfish is cooked perfectly and is a must, it comes with two sauces, but is also good on it's own. 

the best thing was the corn fritters, OH MY GOD. I don't think a gallon of this would be enough  sweet corn and cheese deep fried nuggets. I could eat this all day. if I had to order one thing only it would be this. 

a place can have the most amazing food but the last star can only be earned by amazing customer service. thank you to MIKE for helping us out! you can tell this place truly cares about their customers leaving satisfied. if I could give an extra star just for how amazing the service is alone I would. will definitely come back!!

hands down the best bbq I have ever had! it was only appropriate to sit next to the piggy at our table since that's what I felt like while I was eating. oh and I don't know why there's two $$ signs, the prices are so cheap! definitely bang for your buck!

I don't typically leave reviews... actually I never leave reviews but this place was THAT GOOD! I recommend everyone who's in town to come regardless of the sketchy location. We ordered the rib platter with macaroni, coleslaw and mashed potatoes as a side. Everything was delicious! My boyfriend and I devoured everything in less than 20 min! The cashier didn't even have time to ask us about our meal! Perfect cheat meal ;) now I'm trying to find an excuse to come back again!
Best Mac n cheese I've ever had. The only one I would ever eat again. The bbq is good but expensive.

The best buffet in Vegas is not on the strip. The best buffet in vegas lies a bit off the strip at Rollin Smoke Barbeque. 
The BBQ buffet at Rollin Smokes is only a mere $18.95 for all you can eat meat AND sides:
St Louis Ribs (Cooked perfectly and ultra meaty)
Pulled Pork (Oh so tender)
Barbeque Chicken (Juicaaaay)
Sausage (smoked to perfection)

There was more, but in Vegas nothing is ever a certainty. The walnut candied yams were my favorite sides, and the others are all worth a bite or 50. BBQ in Vegas has arrived and it most definitely is not on the strip.

This place just blows me away ! Look do yourself a favor , go here get the all you can eat for 24.99 and eat some or all you want of everything they have. It's all good.And I guarantee if you have any appetite at all you will come out ahead of a regular dinner order at Lucilles and have infinitely more food.

By far the best BBQ in Vegas. I love getting the duo plate of Pork and Hot Links and the either the Corn Nuggets or the Mac N Cheese. Simply amazing food at a great price. If you're local pull out your ID and ask for the local's discount!

Great food, great value and excellent customer service. Came here based on the 4.5 star reviews from Yelp and we were not disappointed. The ribs and chicken have a great flavor and definitely coming back next time we come here from Cali!!
Did the all you can eat. One of the best 40 dollars I spent in my life as far as food goes. Walked out of there very satisfied. Very friendly cashier. Will definitely come back

Pretty good! I'm not a big fan of beef ribs but these are meaty and tender.  Sides were cold but tender ribs made up for it. Mac and cheese not the best. Yams on point and greens good but they were stingy and they were cold. Container was half full. New spot just a hop skip and jump from my place and they deliver too!

Best BBQ I've had in a long time. My date and I did the all you can eat and boy did we eat. I ordered their brisket plate and the brisket was cooked to perfection. I also ordered their brisket nachos and they were delicious as well. Will make a trip to Vegas just so I can go back and eat there again.

Rollin Smoke BBQ catered my daughters 21st birthday party and delivered it to us at the Cosmo!! They were really nice and professional and easy to communicate with. They handled my huge order with ease.  We had brisket, beef ribs, baby backs, spare ribs, sausage, burnt ends, and chicken!! Everything was excellent. The brisket and burnt ends were devine!! The beef ribs were huge and tender as everyone loved the selection of meats that were put out. And then there were the sides. We had a pan of the bacon potato salad, a pan of the jalepeno cole slaw, a pan of the kickin beans, a pan of greens, a house salad as well as some candied yams. Just let me say that there was nothing left after the party as people went back for seconds and thirds! They will even do speacial orders on items not on the menu! I highly reccomend Rollin Smoke as the best BBQ In Vegas!!

There are a few times in life when I get a great bbq sandwich . It won't be at this place. Hipsters , if you are going to pay $9.00 for a pork bbq sandwich you need your head examined. 
I'll just wait until I'm in Arkansas and pay $4.00 for a truly delicious bbq sandwich. These people claim they are Arkys but they are actually Texans. They don't want any smart people to walk in. Hence the menu and outrageous prices posted on the front door. Shave your stupid beards, stop wanting what you can't get here, and get down to Arkansas.  You'll thank me later.

If yelp had a .5 star rating this would be 4.5/5...

This place maybe better than John Mull's even though I felt like Roadkill Grill was cheaper. It's weird but it's the similar pricing.

I had the trio of 3 meats with Hot Links, Chicken, and Chopped Briskit w/ Mac & Cheese. I also had their ribs as well. 

Their hot links are good, their chicken is excellent but their briskit was firrrrrreeee!!!

Their ribs are excellent as well. Most def Top 2 BBQ place that I have been to in Las Vegas so far and the fact that it's so close to the strip (....clubs) makes it no excuse to not go here.
Awesome little atmosphere... Food is legit! Small place away from the strip and it almost makes you forget you are in vegas...

The place to be if you have a barbecue hankering.  I do mean because they cover everything.  I have BBQ ribs, baby BBQ ribs, pulled pork brisket it is a meat lovers delight. The prices are quite reasonable the portions are huge. Service is quick and the atmosphere is average but the food more than makes up for it.  I must say upon finding the location you will feel like you dropped out of Vegas (dark surrounding) but the building  itself is lit nucely. If you're a true barbecue lover I highly recommend that you stop by and give this place a try you will not be disappointed.

My buddy convinced me to try this place for lunch today and we made the trip to see what the buzz was all about.  Usually a high rating place on Yelp can be suggestive, but the reviews truly do not lie.   Southern true cooked Mesquite BBQ is what this place is all about and when we got there they had a line a mike long going outside.  That can only suggest one thing: the food is excellent.  I was fortunate enough to be able to try the ribs, brisket, and corn taters.  All were very delicious and food came out very fast.

My only little quirk was the menu was too far away from the register to place your order and there was only one register for the long line.  Seating was very limited and the location is an off the wall spot, but that's kind of it's hidden gem.

I loved the fact I left the joint smelling like Mesquite BBQ and that smell is very delightful.  When I got back to my office, everyone asked me where I went, because they could smell the BBQ smell.  Go see for yourself and you won't be disappointed.

Best BBQ in Vegas out of the seven or eight places I've tried. Amazing whole in the wall kind of place, but with plenty of seating. They could probably fill up a restaurant the size of Olive Garden if they wanted to. Food is amazing. Had the brisket sandwich with fried onion straws. Pretty sure I could live off that the rest of my life breakfast lunch and dinner! Yummy! Hubby had the outlaw burger. He's a big dude and couldn't eat it all. Might wanna bring a friend to take on that brisket burger!

Holly smokes!! Now that there is some good BBQ. We had the $28 meal that feeds 2 and it was well worth it. My brother lives in North Vegas and he never heard of it before. He said best BBQ in Vegas. Even the employee came to our table and ask if we liked the food. Must try!

After reading Misti's review we couldn't wait to try Rollin Smoke! The waif of smoky goodness starts to hit about a 1/4 mile from the parking lot, which btw looks pretty barren, except for the sign that mentions YELP and you know you are in the right place.

Simple, reasonable and downright southern style bbq, all was awesome. Staff was super friendly and educated us newbies. Had the sampler of pork, hot link and brisket.... mmmm mmmm good. The jalapeno chipolte laced slaw as well as the hot link sausage were great and packed some substantial heat. Hubby has the rib sampler plate and couldn't finish it was so loaded. 

Just an old fashioned joint, order, come as you are and sit yourself down place to eat some great Q.

Might be the best BBQ I've had, but im from the midwest. I love the sides and sauces, especially the collard greens and baked beans. The atmosphere sets the place apart as well. Plenty of space to sit outside.

Best barbque in Las Vegas!  Had the rib tips and it was the best I've had. It was soft and boneless. Each taste had a kiss of smoke taste with the sweet and tangy BBQ house sauce. Love it. The sweet tea was not too sweet, perfect. The only BBQ place in town to eat. Open until 130am on fri sat NICE!

Had the Peach Cobbler today. Wow.  It was sweet with peach and warm like a hug from an old friend you have not seen in a long time.  I'm not a cobbler fan, but this made me a believer and I'd order it again!

Not good for me . Did the all you can eat offer for 24.99. Every one of he style of ribs were dry . The downfall is the tomato flavor the rub/sauce has... Only great item is the fried shrimp. Service was also very friendly, but not even close to good BBQ for me.

This place is awesome!  Service was really fast and the staff is super friendly.  I had the brisket three ways plate (sliced, shredded, burnt ends) and it was very good!  Definitely recommend it, you will be full when you leave!  Not far from the strip.
Always great.  I typically get the smoked meatloaf... but I also love the spare ribs and beef brisket.

Awesome. I came to LV from San Diego for fun and got hungry.

I am spoiled because I life close to the world famous Phil's BBQ in San Diego. This place is heads up with them. This is the best compliment I can give to a BBQ place. 

We had the all you can eat, and everything was awesome, but the Beef Ribs have been world excellence!

We were in Las Vegas towards the end of Sept.  We were there in May also.  We ate at a lot of the very expensive restaurants.  Rollin Smoke was easily, easily the best meal we had at any price.  It was also the best BBQ any in my family had ever eaten.  And, everyone at the restaurant was friendly and gracious.  If someone offered me a free meal at Wolfgang Puck's Cut (we ate there also) or Rollin Smoke I go to Rollin Smoke.

All you need to know:

Peach cobbler is so good, it'll make u slap ur momma!

Brisket is moist, juicy and melts in your mouth.

Fried Okra is the best in town hands down.

Catfish is properly seasoned, crispy on the outside and juicy and flaky on the inside.

So we walked in on a Saturday night at around 11 or so and we were the only ones in there. So I will admit, I wasn't sure if the reviews were going to be right. I mean if this place was going to be as good as everyone said, then why isn't this place packed?

But we sat down and the guy was friendly and down home. I love a southern gentleman, they win me over every time. He told me that they were out of the beef ribs but if I wanted to wait 45 minutes that they would be ready. So I didn't want to wait 45 minutes and went with a meat platter. I got the brisket and st Louis ribs and hot links. Already told you about the brisket, the ribs I enjoyed too. They were tender and smokey and very flavorful. If I am being honest, then I would probably pass on the hot link. I think they were just bbq'ed too long for me. 

So we got dessert with our yelp check in and I wasn't too sure that they would taste so good based on their appearance. We ordered banana pudding and peach cobbler. I would alone come for the peach cobbler but again, if I am being honest I would pass on the banana pudding.

I love BBQ. It is just always so hard to find a good decent eats for BBQ in this town. But the quest for me has ended here. I rave about this place to everyone. 

The BBQ sauce here is amazing too. Sweet and Spicy. I tried to see if they bottled it and sold it but they don't. So instead they gave me a to go container for free.

I can't wait to come back.

This is a go-to for my husband...decided I had to try it. Got the trio of sliders with pork, brisket and the spicy sausage. Om nom nom. The Kickin beans are hot and tasty. Bonus: I checked in and got a free peach cobbler. Fantastic. I'll be back to try the ribs.

I am somewhat of a BBQ snob. I've been all over Vegas and Henderson to BBQ places recommended by others. Each one a disappointment. I had the 3 meat platter, mac and cheese and a drink. My friend had the same and hush puppies. We both agreed we would have been better off with the "all you can eat" option. We had burnt ends, brisket, chopped beef, and ribs. The burnt ends were to die for. The meats melted in our mouths. The mac and cheese was good but watery. I wasn't a fan of the hush puppies. The place is quaint, the service was fast, the people were very kind. Finally, a place I will revisit.

Omg! I'm a barbecue addict I've had great ones in California Arizona and Chicago but this place is on another level!!! I got the brisket and links and then they have the nerve to sale catfish!!! Had to get the seafood platter too!!! Service was impeccable!! If you're in Vegas this is a must stop ask for Matt the best in the west!!!

Went to Vegas for the weekend with some friends and wanted some good BBQ so my friend found this place. My bf and I shared The Pit Special Trio platter.. just the right amount of food w/ a little bit of everything, it was really good! The staff was very friendly. We even got a tour of the kitchen! There's even a really cool fish tank made out of a grill in their party room if you're into that sort of thing..

What a great place! Not only is the food fantastic, but the staff is top notch.  Everyone was friendly, attentive, and we really felt like we eating at a friends house.  Jeannie went with the smoked white meat chicken salad and I went with the trio of brisket, pork and ribs.  Best bbq ever!  Finished the meal with peach cobbler a la mode.

Their food was delicious, their staff was fun and personable, the wait was reasonable. The only negative things I have to say is that they seem to have a cramped place of business and they seem to cater to families which means someone like me who finds children irritating would find the atmosphere a little lacking.

Brisket!!! plain n simple the one thing that consistently keeps me coming back when I am in LasVegas.  Make sure you have your GPS on because you'll blow right by this place because its tucked back off the strip.  The have GREAT food and the prices are good.

I cant remember the last time i said "oh my god" while eating good barbeque! The ribs literally fall off the bone! All the meats were delicious !
Great customer service, and every one that we spoke with in the restaurant had a favorite to recommend! 
We will be going back.......  A LOT!!!!

I was visiting Vegas and planning on driving here after looking at reviews.  But I pulled up the map on my GPS and found that it is around the corner from where I was staying at the Trump Hotel.  So we walked over, (which was a bit scary, due to industrial back side of the strip...)

Food was very good we had the 3 meat option.  I very much enjoyed the Pork, Ribs and Brisket.  This place also has a very good sauce.  It ranks better than anything in Utah, and you have to go to Texas to find something better.  The only reason I didn't say 5 was because of the Texas experiences I have had.

What can I say, I like barbecue... With that said, I like this place a lot.  Great menu with lots of options.  

It's our first time and already were planning on our next trip (probably on our next day off).  The location is quite hidden, but thanks to Siri we found it with no problem.  The restaurant is small but there are outside seating/dining area.  There is a big menu, which we needed a minute to read.  But don't sweat, there's something for everyone. 

Long story short, come to this place hungry.  If you're looking for a salad, please stay away.  Some whiney guy was complaining about how he couldn't order a salad his way.  Seriously, if you're worried about eating a salad at a barbecue place, you have bigger issues than just a salad homie.  

I gave minus points for the lack of space in the restaurant, but it's not a deal breaker.

I wish I could give this place 10 stars! If you look at my previous reviews, you'll see that I've been to a number of BBQ places and hands-down this one is the best barbecue I'Ve had in a BBQ joint! 
They have a all you can eat option which gives you three meets and two sides and once you are done they'll give you another 3 meats and 2 sides. I am for sure going to come here every time I am down here.

Good guys, good BBQ.

They are a small BBQ place and the guys there are all nice and attentive to your needs.  
The meats were yum yum DAMN GOOD.  They are quite proud of being the little BBQ shop that is making a big name for itself in LV.  

The location is definitely out of way, but is definitely worth it.
Super awesome bbq. Been coming here once a week for couple of months now. The brisket is the best. Never had a bad meal here. This place gets packed if you're heading here for lunch.

This place is really good BBQ, I hate fat and gristle so I stay away from some of the meats; I got the hotlink sandwich, the baked beans, and loaded mashed potatoes. It was all very good. The location has something to be desired. During the day I felt fine; I have a feeling at night the safe factor goes way down. Two, what I assumed to be, strippers were here when we got lunch and one of them out right propositioned my boss. After a good laugh we all sat down and ate our meal. Everyone was full and pleased. It seems this place gets more business by the day. During the lunch hour they ran out of seats and the line can build up quickly.

Best damn BBQ hands down! If you have any sense at all you will eat here!!
Food = Amazeballs!
Service = Equally amazing!

This is the best bbq I've had since TEXAS!!! They are amazing. They even know how to properly cook okra! I wish the place was bigger, but its great!!!!  Their prices are great (please don't raise them) and the food is awesome!

The BBQ was yummy to everyone who came to dinner with me.  The brisket was tender but alittle too burnt for my own taste bud, but everyone else enjoyed it.  When we were in line to order we waited awhile because the person was on the phone but then we realized he was on the phone with a " sweety" because I heard him say I have to go it is getting busy here sweety, really you delay taking our order for a sweety.  I thought he was taking a take out order.  Came to realize that he was the owner, now that is just not good customer service. That was the first reason it didn't deserve a five, then the next reason was that I came to look at the photos to see if we for what was in the photo since the owner was telling everyone including myself to yelp for him 4 and 5 only please.  He even said you can do it from your cell phone.  I told him then i saw you got 4.5 stars. i don't know if you get as much as some of the photos featured, for sure the burger was Hugh but the trio and such I am not sure.  The strike two was on one of the photos it said free dessert if you yelp, well when I ordered my blueberry a la mode he didn't give it to me for free or even mentioned it.  He has been there for a year and at this point as a business owner wouldn't you do this to get people to come back? Or suggest this place? Or even yelp for you?  What is 6.00 dessert? Strike three:  they didn't bring out all the right sides well I mean he said this it I had to tell him we still have a side of rings and an order of waffle fries.  This is the reason they got a three from me.  The food was delicious to everyone that went, the baby backs didn't seem to fall off Like the spare ribs.  The brisket fries were Huge and yummy.  The Brisket dog look great and I heard it was delicious.  I couldn't try it because I am not a fan of smoke burnt BBQ, there is Noy one kind of BBQ sauce and it was not my fav with the tangy taste.  I like the sweetness of BBQ sauce. I am also big on service even if the food is awesome for them to get a five.  In some cases no service is okay but it want because they were super busy and for god sake it was the owner not an employee.  Oh and the bathroom is weak, one single one and it doesn't flush well after you have been waiting, luckily it was not a number two for me.  The toilet paper just would flush...yikes. It is the worst feeling standing there trying and trying.   I am sure the owner will read this and make it a better experience for you future yelpers. Btw, the honey fried chicken was not that good, so stick to the BBQ, dud that is why you came right? I am a bread lover and the little buns were weak.

This place is GOOD! AT least the rib tips corn fritters and beans anyway. Brought a friend who thought it was great too! So sad I haven't been here sooner, but so happy now :) I'll definitely be coming here for BBQ from now on!!

Had the pulled pork and hotlink. The pork was pretty good, as was the hot link.  Better than most places I have been but not the best.  Rollin Smoke BBQ is of the strip so if you are walking as I was expect about a 20 minute jaunt from the Wynn properties.  Their BBQ sauce is good but I would avoid their beans...

Holy cow talk about BBQ this place is awesome. It was my first time there and it was packed and now I know why. Food is excellent. Service is good. The meats are amazing had the brisket, chicken, beef ribs, Mac and cheese, salad etc....oh and the corn bread the best I ever had.
I have been to the restaurant many times. Also had them Cater multiple office functions. Cant wait to use them again.

3 stars A-ok. The location kinda creeped me out being in the shady gentlemans club part of town. The ambience was pretty down to earth. and The food was all right. It wasnt the best bbq I have ever had but its far from the worst. The only real complaint I have is that I smelled of smoke after eating. I guess its true to the name rolling smoke. Good but not great.
My first time here and it will not be the last. I thoroughly enjoyed my meal. The brisket sandwich meal was delicious!  I would highly recommend Rollin Smoke Barbeque to everyone.

Amazing Bbq ribs: pulled port amazing, chicken a little dry but add sauce and it's good. Must haves: Mac & cheese, baked beans, potato salad, corn nuggets, corn bread!  Ask for secret sauces there's two - sweet sauce & hot sauce - not on tables
This restaurant is a small hidden gem..staff is great and the food is phenomenal!!!!..it's how BBQ should be done!

Extremely delicious food, very friendly employees and amazing ambiance there. It feels like you are in a great barbeque fest! I absolutely recommend pork and ribs with mashed potatoes with green onions and bacon.

They should call this place Holly Smokes BBQ! Best BBQ is Vegas, hands down. Fast, quality, comfort, yum, DAMMMM!! These are all words that came to mind while I stuffed my face. Tried everything I could...catfish, shrimp, hushpuppies, meatloaf, loaded mash, brisket, ribs, and Mac N' cheese. Topped it off with a little sweet potato pie AND banana pudding. Love the community table concept. Love that it feels like eating at home with family. A little crowded at times, but for the most part it's pretty quiet because people are too busy shoveling the smoked goodness in. Will be back as soon as this food coma subsides.

Ok, where do I start. I am here now, I have been to Vegas on several occasions and I have been trying to get here. It was certainly worth the wait. I usually give a review after I leave the restaurant but, this couldn't wait. I love this place, the service from our waitress Jessica was fantastic, she even gave us a complimentary peach cobbler because we were out of state & was dying to get here. We had the ribs, chicken, brisket, Mac & Cheese, greens & loaded mashed potatoes all extremely delicious. I will for sure be back next time I'm out here.

The smell right when you come in is amazing. Everyone was super nice, and the food was great. Meat fell off the bone and the loaded mashed potatoes were amazing. My husband go the outlaw burger and he said it was awesome.

I had the all you can eat meal for 24.99. This place kicks ass.  The chicken and beef ribs are incredible.  Everything tasted great, the cole slaw had jalapeño in it and was an excellent side. I plan on stopping here everytime I'm in Las Vegas.

This is my new favorite BBQ place in the Springs! I went there a couple weeks ago, and it was delicious!! My group ordered the rib combo plate, so we got ribs, chicken and brisket. All of the meats were so well-cooked. You can also ask for the meats "naked," which meant they only had a BBQ rub but no sauce, and then you can add your own sauce from the selection of BBQ sauces at the table. We did this because I was not sure which sauces would be spicy. The sides were pretty good as well, but the portions on those were somewhat small. We were also really impressed with their selection of beer on tap! They had a list beers, all from Colorado microbreweries, and we got to try some beers we hadn't heard of. Also, we were all super impressed with the friendly and helpful service we received. It was so fun!! This is definitely the place I recommend if you are looking for great BBQ in the Springs.

I would actually give this 3.5 stars if I could.
We were in Vegas over the long Thanksgiving weekend and had been craving some good BBQ. I found this place doing a search for "Best BBQ in Vegas" and this was a top contender. 
I ordered the Brisket sliders with BBQ beans & my husband ordered the Brisket and mashed potatoes. A friend of ours ordered the ribs. My daughter just ordered a hot dog and Mac n cheese as she's not a huge BBQ fan. (Weird kid)
The brisket itself was pretty good. The BBQ sauce wasn't that great at all though. 
I would pass on the sliders because the bread was so greasy that I ended up just taking the meat out and tossing the bread. The beans were great. A bit spicy, but I love spice. The Mac and cheese & the cornbread were pretty good also. 
Overall, it was good. I can't say for sure if we'd go back or not the next time we're in Vegas, as I think we'll continue our search for amazing BBQ places (which by the way, the most amazing BBQ place is in Austin!)

Excellent beef ribs!!! some of the best outside of Austin, TX.   We got there about 30 minutes before they closed so I was worried that they may have run out of ribs but lucky for me they didn't. The ribs were on point, they were tender, full of flavor and when the meat came off the bone, the bone was smoking,  so they were fresh and not just warmed. 

The brisket was Ok, a little dry but had flavor. 

We got the corn nuggets which were nice and crisp on the outside and awesome on the inside. One of the best side dishes I've had.

The mac and cheese was awesome too, with shredded cheese on top to add more gooey-ness to the mix.

The peach cobbler was fantastic also.

Their bbq sauce was good and if you ask them for spicy sauce then they'll give you their hot sauce and their 'too damn hot' bbq sauce.

I'm giving this a 4 because my hubby loved this place. I would give it a 3. I'm a bit pickier with meat so I wasn't too impressed. I've had better in San Diego and NY believe it or not. We ordered the BBQ fries with pulled pork and the smoked meatloaf. The fries were good although the pork didn't really seem to have much flavor. The meatloaf was weird it wasn't your typical meatloaf. It was a lot of pork and fat, I did manage to find some lean pieces and the flavor was good. The Mac and cheese was pretty good but the star of the show were the corn nuggets. They were so sweet and crunchy I would go back just for those!!

The ribs were over cooked and dried out, and the sweet potatoes and mac & cheese were bland. But worst of all, the place simply wasn't clean. We did like the sweet tea and baked beans, and the servers were friendly enough, but that doesn't make up for the dirty floors and soiled table clothes.
Awesome BBQ! Can have it mild or crazy insane hot. The sides are good and the yams are off the hook. Best yams I've ever had.

Overall good experience.  I had the slider trio with a side of jalapeno coleslaw. Was expecting the slaw to knock my socks off but was anything to write home about. Pulled pork wasn't my favorite texture seemed more like pork roast. But the hot link was fantastic! Very spicy!  I was very disappointed with the country berry cobbler, lacked sweetness entirely. The place packed & decor and atmosphere were real homey. Liked the personal touches with their murals. We'll definitely go back. Looking forward to trying the smoked meatloaf.

Excellent BBQ, tucked away in an industrial-ish neighborhood.

I wanted BBQ. Yelp led me to Rollin Smoke. We drove there. Upon arrival, I was somewhat skeptical, because this place is in a somewhat sketchy area. Surrounded by strip clubs, warehouses, and a few rundown places, it doesn't really look like the place you'd take your family. But when I got past that initial impression and walked inside, I knew I was in a good place.

The location is pretty small. There is seating out in front and two rooms of seating inside. Most of it is communal in style--just picnic-style tables with attached benches. The place is permeated with the smell of smoking meat. What a great smell! There are a number of good options on the menu.

As I do pretty much without fail at a BBQ joint that is new to me, I got a sample plate with some brisket and chicken. The combo comes with a few pieces of brisket, 1/4 of a chicken (a leg and a thigh), a piece of Texas toast, a couple of pickles, and a side. I got the green beans side (despite normally going for the BBQ beans) and ate that first. I was pretty impressed with just the green beans. They were fresh and crisp and were seasoned to perfection. Then I worked my way into the chicken. It was seasoned perfectly as well and cooked just right. It was nice and tender and delicious. I often skip the skin on chicken, but this was great stuff, and I ate it all. Finally, the star, the brisket. Brisket is the standard by which I measure any BBQ joint. This is excellent brisket. It's sliced to the right thickness. It's nice and tender and falls apart with just a little work with the fork. And it's delicious. With or without any added sauce, this stuff rocks!

Speaking of sauces, there are a few options. I went with the Arkansas version, which turned out to be pretty darn good. When I first squeezed some out of the bottle, I feared that it was too liquidy, but the consistency was great when put straight onto the brisket itself.

My friend got a brisket salad, and I ended up finishing it for her. It too was delicious. I'm not really a fan of romaine-based salads, but the greens and tomatoes were all fresh, the peppers were spicy, and the brisket was delicious on the salad as well.

There are a few options that are intriguing to me for when I visit in the future with a healthy appetite. The $35 all-you-can eat option is a rarity among BBQ joints. And the picture of the burger on the wall made the burger look like quite the challenge.

This is great BBQ, not just for Vegas, but in general.

Lets start with the food. Holy god, it's good. Damn good. The sides are generous and filling, the pulled pork is very satisfying. The hot links are cut and oozing flavor. You get a free dessert if you use yelp too so that's a plus. I also ordered the outlaw burger and was warned it takes about 15 minutes to make. I was okay with that until 35 minutes later it still had not come. The burger was amazing and I had only ordered a 1/2 pound of pulled pork and received well over a pound (I assume it was for the wait)  I ordered for two people and my name was the same as another patron so I'm assuming there was some confusion there. Which brings me to the only reason I give 4 stars instead of 5. The ordering and service wasn't great, but It wasn't bad either and the food more than made up for it.

No matter how hard I try, there is no way I can come close to the amazing beef and pork ribs I had here.
Amazing smoke, juicy and tender beef with a crispy black crunch bark that can only come from heaven.
This is my newest best spot whenever I visit Vegas.
No alcohol but you know what? This little dive doesn't need it!

First the 10 year old young man who waited on us was remarkable!! He knew the menu and assisted me in making my selection (beef rib, collards and yans).  The food was great, we'll seasoned and just TASTY!  I must say that I will go back cuz I was too full to eat dessert :-)  THANKS little guy for the EXCELLENT customer service.

At best, mediocre. I'm not sure of the hype but I was disappointed!! Walking into the place, it seemed promising. It was packed; we had to share a table with another family. The staff was very accommodating and the menu was loaded with bbq delights however the food was lacking. I ordered the brisket beef hotdog and the wife had the bbq chicken sandwich. Both lacked favor and were over priced (imo). I wouldn't go back.
Excellent bbq....like being back home in Missouri.   They know how to do it rigjt.  Staff friendly and helpful.  Prices are great for what you order.  Definitely worth a try...you'll be back!
Great bbq! Many things to choose from. The owner was very friendly.  The food is worth the short wait!  A hidden bbq gem.
Love this place! I'm not much of meat eater but find myself craving there ribs & brisket! Highly recommended giving a try

What I look for in a good barbecue is moist and tender meat with a strong smoke aroma and a spicy rub. Looking at the good reviews for this place, my group and I decided to come to this place.  The place itself is small so try not to come during the rush for lunch because you won't find a place to sit.  What really did like right off the bat here is that they have a large smoker you can see by the side of the building as you walk in, and you can smell the smoke already! My group ordered a combination platter called The Pit and it came with spare ribs, brisket, sausage and pulled pork.  We also shared the outlaw burger, which eventually stole the show. The sausage had a mild smokey flavor but it was a little dry. Everything else was very moist and tender and had a good smokey flavor.  The pulled pork and brisket were very tender and flavorful and didn't need any sauce.  The ribs were a little tough to eat off the bone I   I thought, and I didn't get any extra spiciness from the rub. And when I tried to kick it up a noth by adding their bbq sauce, It didnt work.  Their bbq sauce is very bland.  It has no spiciness or tang or zing.  Just mildy dressed up tomatoe sauce. The best thing I tasted there was the OUTLAW BURGER.  The baddass big flavor patty, the onion strings, and the tangy mayo were awesome together.  My advice is to come for the Outlaw burge, pulled pork, and the brisket!

Pros-Great place with authentic bbq. Flavorful and very southern style.  They missed my order once and gave me extra for being patient.  Will go to again.  

Cons-the area is a little sketchy.

Wow this place was amazing! It's up there with the top bbq places in Vegas! I had the smoked meatloaf and the flavor was delicious. My brother had the outlaw burger and he said it was the best burger he has ever had and it was huge! And my boyfriend had the rib platter. The beef rib was huge and they were fall off the bone. Can't wait to go back and try different things!

Definitely the best barbeque I've had in Vegas. Don't waste your money at expensive restaurants on the Strip. The quality of the food is amazing at this place and the portion sizes are generous. Will definitely be coming back!
Chef Seddy has the best burnt ends ever!!! Love the sweet Bbq sauce! Had to get dessert...The peach cobbler was good, too! Everything my group ordered was delicious!

Top Notch!!! The food was amazing, service was almost better than the food and that's saying a lot. Dusty was super friendly. Being raised back east, it felt good to finally go to a restaurant and actually feel wanted!!!! Thank you guys! Definitely get the ribs and the brisket, melts in your mouth and the ribs fall off the bone, perfect amount of fat and the smokey flavor is unreal, you can literally taste the smoke before you put the ribs in your mouth. From start to finish just awesome, we will be back time and time again. Keep rolling out the great food guys, it's humbling to see people have a dream and follow it through.

The drive alone to this joint is fun. A lot of scenery but you if are not paying attention, you will drive right by this place while looking at all of the craziness that is Las Vegas (hookers, cracktivity and strip clubs). Great smokey flavor on the food. The brisket, ribs and chicken are all very good. I honestly believe this is the best BBQ joint in Vegas. My opinion and I'm usually right, once again, my opinion. Customer service is great and food comes out fast. This place stays busy and has outdoor seating. There is always a line to order but the line moves fast.

Best damn BBQ i have tasted!

I ordered the outlaw which would fill a normal human but with my appetite i also ordered the pit special and shared it with my girlfriend! 

I'll start with the burger. Humongous burger I had to take on the onion straws just squeeze that bad burger in my mouth! Burger topped with theirs meatloaf which was moist. 

The meat platter was like heavenly everything was fall of the bone I ordered pull pork, spare ribs and double brisket! Everything was cooked to perfection!  They have an excellent bbq sauce which the meat doesn't need but the sauce is damn tasty!

Definitely coming back... Gotta try me some of that dessert!

Amazing bbq!! Huge portions but very reasonable prices and a lot of options. The brisket was definitely the best followed by pulled pork. My group went with the 4 meat, 3 side sampler and it was plenty to share. Probably five people could eat off this plate! Everyone working there was super friendly and the environment was great! Will definitely be back when in the mood for good bbq.

I don't know how this place gets so many stars. For the price the serving sizes are terrible. The brisket and pork were dry and so were the hush puppies. I'm extremely disappointed in this place. If you've had Big Paul's bbq then you know what real bbq is like and this isn't it.

Best BBQ in town! Amazing everytime!! The staff is super welcoming whether it's your first time or 100th visit :) Best catfish and hush puppies I've had too.. Stop by!! You won't regret it. TIP: ask for a side of the spicy bbq sauce ;) soooo yummy

The food was good, but the hot links and smoked chicken are better at John Mull's meats. Rollin smoke has totally awesome juicy brisket, though, and super delicious sides. I had fried okra, even though it's not listed on the menu. I found the collards a bit on the salty side. Love the selection of sauces to choose from- even had North and South Carolina sauces.
If your visiting from another state try everything.  I took plenty of pics.   Finish it with cobbler and blue bell.

This places BBQ is amazing! Every time I visit the people are easy to talk, and the food is delicious. Even if you're not a huge BBQ kind of person like me, you have other great choices. The corn nuggets are a must try! I personally get the baked potato, super tasty and fills you up quick. The atmosphere feels like an outside picnic without being outside. They have outside tables if you do like being outside! I definitely recommend this place if you just want some fresh tasting BBQ in your mouth. The reason I give it a four star is only because they never refilled the ice machine. Even after being told 4 different times that there isn't any ice. I know that the drinks are already a good cold temperature, but I like my drinks with ice. Work on that and I'll definitely make it a 5 star.

Great food! It's a small place and doesn't look like much outside. I actually drove past it the first time. Once I found it I was glad I did. Possibly the best ribs I have ever had. The wife's pulled piggy sandwich was great too!

My first time in Vegas and I was looking for some good bbq. Well this place rivals some of the best spots in Dallas TX. We had the 5 meat sampler and famed Outlaw burger and both were incredible. 

I have experienced some joints that do a couple of meats well but fall short on others, this place is knocking it out of the park. Brisket was juicy, pork was tender, sausage had great flavor, and chicken was smoked just right. The ribs tasted fantastic but we're not as juicy as I like, again this was the sampler so I think a slab will be juicier.

Sides of Mac n cheese, hush puppies & bacon mashed potatoes were also delicious. With drinks total came to $45 for a family of 5. They do have 10% coupon on the website. Do not leave Vegas before trying Rollin Smoke!

This place was good, I will have to go back and try more menu items.  I kept it simple and got the bbq pork and chicken wrap with loaded mash and sweet tea.  Everything was good I think the wrap could have used more sauce however I did add bbq myself and that was good as well.  The sweet tea was good and the loaded mash was pretty good even with a little bbq sauce on it.  I want to try the ribs and more will definitely come back.  More of a quick eat or take out kind of place.

Baby back ribs, slab, pulled pork, all smoked to perfection. The beef ribs were a little dry. 

I like very saucey BBQ meats and this isn't what they serve. Their sauce is thin, not over-powering. If you like good, dry rubs or just good meat, eat here. 

So many options to pick from! I wanted to try the wings, brisket, bacon potato salad, burger, onion rings...

It may be worth it to starve yourself for a day to get all you can eat for $25. 

Really cool vibe! Picnic benches indoors, simple podium to order from, really enjoyed it!

I had been meaning to try Rollin' Smoke for some time and so my husband and I checked it out recently for lunch. As soon as you pull into the parking lot, you can smell the meat and it makes you drool. We decided to share a pulled pork sandwich and the rib platter special that includes baby back ribs, spare ribs and beef rib. We thought the pulled pork sandwich was ok, but honestly it's an unusual pick for us, we both think they need veggies to lighten the sandwich up. But the rib platter was f'ing amazing. HOLY CRAP. This is some quality meat here folks. The meat isn't dripping in sauce so the flavors of the meat shine through. And holy cow, the beef rib is incredible. I had never tried it before but it is literally fall off the bone delicious. 

You must check this place out!

ordered outlaw burger with fried okra side, and 4 meat 3 side special with pulled pork, pork ribs, and brisket...amazing amazing amazing!...to top the food are the fantastic and friendly "lil piggies" of rollin, smoke bbq
I had trio special. Hot link, brisket and chicken.  With corn nuggets. It was fabulous. Service was top notch. Only thing that sucks. Parking.

Pretty good BBQ spot! I haven't tried many here in Vegas, so I can't definitively say that they are the best, but I enjoyed my meal.

First, don't come expecting anything fancy or close to it. While not a hole in the wall, it's pretty basic, picnic benches, wait in line to order your food (luckily, when we arrived, there was no wait, but there was a long one about midway through the meal), and a server will bring your food to you. You get your own drink (fountain drinks), plastic ware and plates. It's very close quarters, so people will be all around you while you eat. 

The cashier was very sweet and a real jokester! She told us that they were out of everything but hot links and got a good laugh out of seeing my face drop! She reassured me that she was just kidding and we proceeded from there. 

My friend and I decided to split the 5 meat, 3 sides platter ($27) and get an order of cornbread on the side. The platter comes with: chopped brisket, pulled pork, hot links, 1/4 chicken, and 2 ribs. Of everything, I liked the ribs best- they were tender and seasoned well. The hot links were spicy but good. The chicken was fine, but nothing to write home about. I was slightly disappointed in the brisket- it was SUPER fatty. Like almost all fat. It tasted great, but greasy and just not enough meat. The pork was pretty dry, sadly.

The sides, however, were all awesome. I could have eaten a tub of corn nuggets, they were that good! The Mac and cheese was delicious, and I really enjoyed the baked beans as well. The cornbread was yummy- sweet, dense, moist.

We had enough food to take some home, so that's always a plus. Someone did check on us during our meal, which also was appreciated.

Next time I crave some bbq, and I'm in the area, I may stop by!

This place is the truth. I came here with my family after reading the reviews on yelp. It's in the same neighborhood as a number of strip clubs so be prepared to explain if the kids have questions. There were a lot of choices but I went with the brisket dog. It's a giant all beef hot dog topped with brisket, onion straws, and nacho cheese. This thing didn't mess around. It was big, messy, and delicious! It was a little bit spicy but not overpowering. My wife had the baked potato and she loved it. My son had the sliders and they were bigger than expected and he loved them too. My wife recommends the corn nuggets. I had one and they were great! The decor was fitting for a barbecue joint with benches and picnic tables. The wait wasn't long and I enjoyed myself. I highly recommend it.
Everything's hot and tasty. Can't go wrong with the brisket nachos! Busy but always goes fast, perfect lunch spot.

This place was amazing...the only reason I gave it a five star is for the MEAT and meat only! The sides are just okay okay, the Cole slaw was below average and the potato salad I thought was great it had BACON (nice touch), but the hubs said that was the only reason the potato salad was decent. The sauce I could do with or without. 
Okay let's get to the main reason I'm posting this review, the MEAT! The meat was amazing! The flavor is spot on. I'm originally from Oklahoma and haven't been able to find BBQ that is even is the same wheel house as Oklahoman BBQ. You guys have completely nailed the BBQ. I can't even put into words just how good the meat is! So for me I will purchase the meat on its own and do my own sides. Love love love it!!!! Thanks for helping me find a great main meal! Yum!

Rollin Smoke Barbecue is one of those hidden gems of Las Vegas restaurants. We heard about it from a friend, and had to check it out. 

I had the featured Smoked Meatloaf. The meatloaf was bigger than I imagined and set atop mashed potatoes and smothered in BBQ sauce. Then topped with crunchy fried onion rings. It was delicious. I found the sauce to be a bit spicy, but enjoyable nonetheless. 

The staff were all super friendly and the customer service was spot on. The location is a little bit out of the way from the Vegas strip, but it is worth the drive and will definitely be coming back again!

Absolutely the best bbq ever! Everything from pulled pork,  brisket,  sausage,  chicken, we had a platter with it all, it was super good! The staff here is amazing as well! The cashier was here from opening,  and you would never have known it. I will make sure I tell everyone visiting,  you HAVE to eat here!

Ok, so I don't really get what all the hype is about. This place is ok, just ok. The portions are a little small, and the prices not that low. My sense this place is an example of the emperors new clothes, some alleged taste maker gave it a rave review and everyone was afraid to not fall into line. Like I said it wasn't terrible, but it is nothing to write home about either. Life is too short for average BB-Q. Live It Up You Are In Las Vegas For Cryin' Out Loud!

This was my first time here and will definitely be back. My group ordered the brisket, chicken, pulled pork, hot links, spare ribs, beef ribs and baby back ribs. Everything we had was cooked perfectly and absolutely delicious! I highly recommend the bacon potato salad and Mac & Cheese sides.

Everything here is amazing. The outlaw burger!!!!! I need to say it again the outlaw burger.!!.....  as good as a burger gets.  Everything about it is mouthwatering / orgasmic burger..... the wings with medium sauce will have u licking ur fingers. The Brisket The Hot links. The ribs. Everything is amazing . Just go and eat do it now. Highly highly recommended. ...

this is my first yelp review, because it is much deserved ! i am an extremely picky eater, as well as a "harsh critic" . Not only was the customer service provided, EXEMPLARY,  but the food was onnnnnn point !! i met the owner, andddd while dining in, 3 employees asked how everything was, the definition of southern hospitality! Very clean establishment, simple  and welcoming. Funny slogans, and i will definitely be bacc every time i return to Vegas [im from los angeles] . My grandmother is on her way there now lol . great food, great service, 5 stars !!

Gotta give it to em ... they know how to BBQ. This place is absolutely delicious. They've gotten much bigger recently an prices have gone up a little bit but it's well worth it. I love the catfish and the pulled pork

This place is to die for. First place we went to once we arrived into Vegas. Best decision ever. This is off the strip so parking isn't that crazy. If there's no parking in the front there's street parking also. 

Ordered the Outlaw Burger and spudtastic  with chopped brisket. The outlaw burger is huge! Come in with an appetite for this one and has a side of Mac and cheese... So cheesy and saucy. Now that's what I call Mac and cheese!! I wish I ordered just that because that's how fucking good it was. The Spudtastic lived up to its expectations from Yelp reviews. It's like a baked potato on steroids. DELICIOUS. Portions are generous so be prepared!

Next time I'm in Vegas I am going back. Oh man I'm getting hungry thinking about it. This place is a go-to!!

A pleasant surprise upon accidentally running into this unassuming BBQ joint. These two brothers from Razorback country deliver a unique BBQ style. This is not Texas BBQ. This is a unique style found in these young business owner's local spin of ribs, chicken and even their signature Mac n Cheese. Although a bit removed from the Strip , this Chop Shop is rollin' right along to a bright future with their very low overhead and loyal following.
I've tried to bake beans yams green beans corn nuggets the spareribs the hotlink the baby back to the brisket and everything was delicious so far haven't had anything there I didn't like

Good brisket/pulled pork and the corn bread is insane. Also try the bacon potato salad.  RollingSmoke is tucked back behind the strip on a dark street and they close at 8pm Mon-thurs.  I will go back again, just gotta remember to tell them give me plastic wear... It's kinda hard to eat potato salad and Mac n cheese without them.
Absolutely lives up to the hype! Just delicious. The biggin dad's favorite is the way to go

Just went to this place today...since quite a few ppl said it's the BOMB thought we'd try it... we ordered 2 duo plates: ribs/chkn w/collard greens & brisket/pork w/maccheese ...not sure if our expectations are too high but, we're totally disappointed. Portions are way better than Dickeys BBQ but the sides/meat are cold/bland. The sauce us good though... btw doesn't taste/or looked like it came right of the grill either should have taken a picture before we tossed them... and, we called our orders in 15-20 minutes early... still had to wait extra 15 minutes when we got there... just not "THE BOMB" BBQ that everyone has been telling us. We spent $23+ for the 2 combo plates. Southern Pines North Carolina Dickeys BBQ has been the best for us. Sorry for the negative review but I had to tell the truth. I'm sure you'll find my review with the rest of NOT so good reviews.

I am a fan of the ribs, chicken and corn nuggets. The BBQ is very tender and flavorful. I really wanted to like the macaroni & cheese but it didn't really have any color, flavor or real cheesiness to it.

Went back for my second try.   Better this time, but not great!  The workers are all very nice!

Again, I got takeout. Brisket was ALL fat and inedible!!  Beef rib was small, but thick; had good flavor, but the top was too charred and crusty.

The pulled pork and dark-meat chicken was wonderful!  I don't usually order hushpuppies, because I think they're dull. I heard there's had a "kick"-I wasn't disappointed with that!

The sauce was fabulous!  It is very spicy, which I like.  If you don't like the heat...stay out of this kitchen!  I think they must give the questionable stuff to takeout customers so they don't have to hear you complain.

Not sure I'll go back.

OK, SO I'VE BEEN BACK A FEW TIMES SINCE THE LAST REVIEW...THE TRICK IS GPING IN AND ORDERING AT THE PODIUM. Whether eating there or taking to go.  You order and pay first, I leave a generous tip, and get the best BBQ ever since!

I'm going to have to drop my 4 star rating to a 2.5. based on my last experience. I understand about the beef shortage in TX so I understand why rolling smoke raised their prices. 
I always get the AYCE option, and one of their employees remembers me because I always order it.  What I don't understand is why rolling smoke is sending out a quarter of the portions that they used to with each order of food. Before, I would order a meatloaf and get a FULL order( 2 nice slices) of meatloaf. Not a little crumpled portion from the end. Before I would order a of beef ribs and get 2 in an order, not one. This last visit, not only did the order taker miss a few of the items initially ordered, but they NEVER(even in previous visits) ask if you want to order more. You have to compete with the people in line and it creates and awkward situation. All portions sent out were not even close to what I used to get and sadly, I was bringing in people for thier first visit. How are you going to justify an order of wings and only give 2 wings in an order? 
The 4 meat platter came with 2 tiny strips of brisket and the wrong sides. 

You guys gotta find a better system for the AYCE. Maybe a flag on the table so your staff knows who is spending  twice the amount of money than the average guest and could show them a little more attention. Also accuracy in order taking is important too. I didn't mind the mistakes and poor service before, because there was value in what you were serving. 
Now Higher price/way smaller portions/no server/difficulty in ordering at $35 a person plus 20% tip? 
Ouch. That's disappointing. You can't raise prices and give your guests way less. That's a no no. 
Please fix this.

I went here just expecting it to be another hyped up BBQ spot that was going to disappoint me, but boy was I wrong.  Immediately when you walk in the menu is right there HUGE on the wall, I loved that. I didn't have to strain my eyes to see anything and the menu was very straight forward. I ended up getting the Outlaw burger.................................................WOW!!!!! it's everything a burger needs to be. Everything complimented each other very well, the amount of sauce and toppings on my burger were perfect. I was just really shocked. As for my side, I grabbed waffle fries....which are always fire. Definitely hit this place up if you're looking for some real deal BBQ. They definitely have my stamp of approval!!

Right in the curve go too fast and you'll miss it....you order first and they bring it to you....ok I had the bbq sundae omg it was great all the wonderful flavors just melted in my mouth....it comes in about a 24 oz cup clear so you can see the layers I chose brisket add my meat oh my my....bottom is potatoe salad it had jalapenos and u think bacon then beans with links then brisket then top it all off with coleslaw can't beat that for $8. My bf food was a little cold so free banana pudding!!!

I have been a patron of theirs since you could only get it from the side of Russell road and Valley View. It has been several years since they've open the restaurant location. Today I finally had the opportunity to enjoy this heavenly BBQ. The ribs are melt in your mouth, the smoked meatloaf was better than any I have ever tasted! The only reason it didn't get five stars was due to the fact they have such limited hours. Service was good, location not so easy to get to, and the dining rooms acoustics weren't desirable especially when it became busy. I suggest getting there no later than 10:45 am after that a giant wave of hungry lunch patrons start coming through the door. I recommend this BBQ delight to everyone, the portions are definitely shareable.

The pork spare ribs are amazing. Meaty, well-seasoned, great smoke ring, and the flavor was unbelievable. The brisket was quite good and the pulled pork was tender and flavorful. The baked beans and greens were outstanding!
Best bbq in Las Vegas! The following were delicious: burnt ends, brisket, ribs, hot links, and meatloaf !!! The peach cobbler was amazing too!

I saw Rollin Smoke on the tv while in Vegas....decided to try something different.....what a disappointing meal. While trying to decide what to order a young very pleasant waitress/server offered a suggestion....can't remember the dish...but it had 3 diff kind of ribs, she said it would be enough for both myself and husband to share - I would strongly disagree the portions aren't that generous. An older man took our order...unfriendly, he'd be better staying in the back. The meal came with one drink...he slipped another $2 pop on the bill - the order came with a bun....in fact that is a slice of stale bread which the remainder of the meal is stacked upon...interesting! We also ordered a side of onion rings. Food arrived, minus onion rings - they would follow per server. The waffle fries were stone cold....I went to the front - grumpy guy wasn't there so I mentioned it to a server...she could've cared less, I offered her one to touch, it hadn't felt heat for some time, she declined, she said she'd get us fresh ones.....10 mins later, ribs gone - fries arrive - 3 mins later the worst onion rings arrived. I will say the ribs were good, but the kitchen obviously is disorganized and they need new frontline people. I will not follow the recommendations of any tv show again....McD's would have been a better choice for overall satisfaction.

This is not Southern style brisket. It's chewy and fatty (i found three large chunks of fatty brisket that somebody could choke on if they tried to swallow it). Listen, I ate at 36 real southern BBQ joints last summer and this brisket would rank last. Website says he is from Arkansas, but I would like proof because the brisket doesn't qualify as southern. You can tell by the way he chops it, real BBQ brisket is more shredded. He also should know nobody serves brisket on a hoagie roll in the south, it comes on a bun. Rollin Smoke has two sauces, one claims to be hot, but both taste exactly the same, nothing stands out in that respect. Moving onto the side dish, which is in a tiny cup and not worth the $2. It was jalapeno coleslaw and wasn't too bad, but I honestly didn't see any jalapeno's in the cup. It also appears he has changed the prices - up of course - after being open a week. The online menu says a combo includes drink, chips and side for $2, now the chips are excluded. The price of 1/2 rack of ribs is $10 online and $12 on another menu that is off to the side inside the place, but on the official menu it is now $16. The big smoker on the outside and good smell makes this place appealing to the eyes and nose, but it doesn't pass the taste test. If you do go, show the website coupon on your phone to save 10 percent and that way when you get home and eat your nasty brisket at least you will have saved some money and won't feel as bad.

This place is a bit out of the way from the Strip. It's about a 15 minute walk from our hotel at the Trump International. The doorman suggested we take a cab because the restaurant is in a bit sketchy location next to a strip club. As usual, we found this place on Yelp and decided we must visit this place. The place is a bit on the small side and the tables and chairs are a bit stained like the other reviewers mentioned. My wife and I ordered the special for 2 persons and it came out to $20 with a fountain drink. It also came with 2 sides, we ordered the home fries and the mac & cheese. Home fries was tasty but on bit on the greasy side and the mac& cheese seemed a bit tasteless and stale. We ordered brisket pulled pork, and short rib. The short rib was the best of the three. The brisket is a bit on the dry side. My suggestion is double up on the short rib when you order and get the pulled pork or the chicken for $20. 3 choice of meat for $20 enough to feed 2 hungry people from NYC. Not a bad deal at all. All you need is new chairs.

We picked this restaurant based on their rating. All these people were right! 

Walking in, it looks like a regular smokehouse but it is really bad a**. 

We got the baby back ribs and pulled pork sandwich. The hush puppies were the best we've ever had!

If you're a fan of BBQ you have to check out Rollin Smoke BBQ. It is great, quality BBQ! Found in a strip mall behind all the casinos and strip joints, you would never guess this place is serving up delicious BBQ! One of the best BBQ experience I've had.
Walked in and I was immediately engulfed by the sweet smell of BBQ smoke. I bellied up to the counter and looked over the menu. They have all your typical BBQ meats - brisket, chicken, pork, ribs, and hot links - however the taste is definitely not typical! They have sandwiches, plates, and even an AYCE option! I ordered the 3 meat plate (brisket, pork, and hot links) with 2 sides (jalapeño cole slaw, hush puppies) and corn bread. Everything was delicious! There are bottles of BBQ sauce on the tables if you wish to add.The sauce was excellent

You have to try #RSBBQ next time you're in #Vegas!

Loved the food! 

I remembered a BBQ place from DDD in Las Vegas and figured I'd try it on my next trip to Vegas. The place is not far from the strip but does look a bit sketchy from the outside. The inside of the restaurant is very clean and the sports tv's are a bonus.

I tried the pulled pork sliders and the rib platter, everything was tasty. The BBQ sauce is delicious, our ribs were cooked perfectly. 

And the corn bread is too die for!!!!

So Rollin' Smoke has been bookmarked for a good 6 months prior to our visit. Imagine the expectations that build up in 6 months; I already knew what I was going to have.

Pulled Pork Sandwich combo: I was pressured to get hush puppies, which were good for hush puppies (they have a little zing/spice to them from the jalapeño they mix in which made them better than average). As far as the pulled pork, it was some of the best I've had (although fattier than what I've had recently) however the bun it was served on left much to be desired. It was a hoagie type roll with sesame seeds, so the pork was trying to soak through the seem. Thankfully the sandwich didn't last long enough for me to make a huge mess of it. 

Meat Duo: brisket and pulled pork. Jason said he's had better brisket, and prefers Memphis (cause he's a square!) but the pulled pork was good. 

Check in dessert: Butterfinger Bread Pudding: it was tasty, good texture for a bread pudding- I would probably order a regular bread pudding if they were on special when we come back.

We both really liked the sauces they offer on the table (we tried the spicy and sweet sauces) and the service was friendly. They were definitely happy to have gained our business and made sure we really enjoyed our food. 

We'll be back.
Great little spot. Did the brisket three ways (chopped, sliced, and burnt ends). Everything was good but the burnt ends were amazing.

So let me start by saying this is a tough lil spot to find.  If you are not familiar with Las Vegas u will get lost.  There is usually a line to wait in to order your food from a guy sitting at a podium like a judge in court.  The prices are very high.  I ordered a half rack of St. Louis ribs, a half rack of Baby back ribs, Half pound of burnt ends, and a soda.  This came with two sides so i chose mac n cheese and coleslaw.  I paid $50.  WTF...?  

The ribs were awesome but the burnt ends were almost all fat and not burnt.  The mac  n cheese was something like what u get at a bad diner.  Coleslaw...meh.  Soda was great.  lol

I assume a probably wont be back as its a pain to get there and costly.  I can eat at other rib places and get more bang for my buck IMO.

4.8 stars  went ahead and rounded it to 5 


On a previous trip to Las Vegas, we drove past Rollin Smoke BBQ, and they had the smokers going but we want to give another place a try... that place was Memphis BBQ.  You can read my review about Memphis BBQ...  hind sight is 20/20 ... and oh how I wish we would have stopped at Rollin Smoke first.  Live and learn! 

The place smells great when you walk in the door... the guys, there were really nice and welcomed us in...

The menu is diverse... 

I had the three meat plate...  brisket, ribs, and pulled pork. 

Brisket was really good... Ribs were even better... and the Pulled Pork was KILLER! 

Portions were generous... flavors were fantastic!  The potato salad had some spice to it and so did the pickles. 

My wife had two meats, pulled pork and brisket... she raved about both.  She is a huge brisket fan, and she said it reminded her of being in Texas.  She loved it! 

I think the guys there have a handle on the BBQ side of things... it's great! Where I think, they could use some help is in the dessert's area... they were just alright.  I wasn't there to have dessert... so not a big deal... but... it's the only weak link about the place which stood out to me.  Dial that in... it's a 5+ star place. 

Well worth a visit if you want fantastic BBQ!

Really great service with fast moving lines and food came in really quick. Ribs were rollin in flavor, the brisket burnt ends were coo and the hot link had a kick. BBQ on point, so I would recommend to anybody  here in Vegas that like BBQ to come here.
Great food great atmosphere! Highly recommend driving or taking a taxi, as it is in a sketchy location. Well worth the trip!

Ok by FAR the best BBQ I have ever had! Soooooo good! We got the pulled piggy sandwich, hot links, and the BBQ nacho fries all to share. All of it was delicious!! My favorite was the BBQ nacho fries. You HAVE to try them!! So good I can't even explain it! I'm so full I need someone to roll me the rest of the way home :)
Love this place. Try the corn nuggets. It's great. The brisket is amazingly good. Everything here is good. Even the pickles are good. Customer service is an A.

To quote Leonardo Talbertini, "this place was fantastic!"  In Vegas for a business meting and chose to dine in here and get some local BBQ and we are glad we did!  Portions were plentiful, food was fantastic and the service was great as well.  The amount of food you get for the price was also great.  This is a BBQ place that knows what they are doing!

Best pulled pork in Vegas!

You know you're in the right place when you smell the hickory in the air from the smokers in the parking lot. And prepare to fight for parking during the lunch rush. I went to Rollin Smoke days after returning from Lockhart, TX. I went not expecting to be impressed, but the pulled pork wowed me. It's usually something I prefer to make at home because it's not often I like it out. But this is tender, succulent and well smoked. The brisket was less impressive, I found it dry. I'd try it again when the sweet taste of central Texas wasn't so fresh. I might like it better. The combo I ordered also came with a dry burnt bun and I selected the mac & cheese for a side. It was pretty good, but I do prefer a creamier version.

My brother joined me for lunch, he had the baked potato topped with cheese and brisket. His order came out with pulled pork instead. No worries since it was a winner.

This was my first run in with Arkansas BBQ, they definitely make a great pulled pork. The jury is still out on the rest of menu. Must eat more to decide. The staff is super friendly and they're open late on the weekend.

Good BBQ service is slow and they don't pay much attention to you but food is good..........The all you can eat is way over priced. And they charged me for the sweet and spicy BBQ sauce? But the meat is high quality and deserts are really good when available. Get more consistant and bump up the service and they would get a extra star from me.
Just like I remember about a year ago... BBQ B Bangin...
Seriously good ribs prepared in a pit by a man who is passionate about cooking them to perfection John is an excellent host and the restaurant is very low key but it's all about the food here.
Beef ribs are the best in the world!!  Corn nugget is good if you are mood for sweet with crispy. I guarantee you that you will never find other beef ribs like this.

I tell everyone looking for a great BBQ here in Vegas that Rollin Smoke is the best in town! Maybe the best in the region. 

Starting with an option of all you can eat for just under $25 dollars (all day everyday, everything on the menu) and a large amount delicious sides, YOU CANT GO WRONG! 

*THE OUTLAW BURGER is the greatest burger. (beef patty with brisket, onions, bell pepper, onion strings, red cabbage, slaw, lettuce, tomato and cheddar.)

Huge portions of amazing tasting food. A wonderful variety of menu options. Great customer service. Never had an encounter that wasn't less than pleasant. Great prices considering the amount of food you get. Highly recommended!
Honestly, not even close to the best BBQ I've had. Nothing specifically wrong with this place. Good mac and cheese. But just not great.

The meat was pretty good it just needed salt. The sides were very tasty. We tried the ribs, pork & beef, pulled pork, brisket, links,and chicken. If you don't like smoked meat this is not for you. The portion sizes are not very big so we ordered the four meat plate and did the the ribs on the side. Check your order before you leave. So far, this is the best BBQ I've had in Vegas. I liked the ribs and the beans the best, but the yams and potato salad weren't bad. Mac and cheese was pretty good. Waffle fries my least favorite and they needed salt.

Saturday night in Vegas and we were planning on meeting up with our friends for dinner and some fun. The first place we planned to go to was not getting too many rave reviews.
Stephanie S. had the wonderful idea to come here instead for dinner. This place was pretty close to where we were staying on the strip, which made it easy drive for us. Located on the other side of the strip (yes on the seedy side of town) pass a couple of popular strip joints, made a turn thinking did my GPS give me the wrong directions because it's really dark on this street and it looks like it's the industrial area of Vegas. Well you are in the industrial area but it is also a mix of other business as well. Rollin Smoke is in a small shopping center look for a sign that says "Kiesub Center" and you have found it! Did I mention that they are open until 1:30 am every day too?

As we were pulling into the parking lot, I notice two huge bbq smokers outside. Knowing that anything that is put into a smoker is going to be mighty tasty I was ready to order right there in the parking lot!

Walking into this eatery the BBQ smell hits you like a mack truck on the 15. Their menu is large and in charge! 

Everything from an all you can eat BBQ for $24.99 (you get anything on their menu, anytime, any day of the week)

$7.99 sandwich's (like the pulled piggy, smoked brisket ECT)
$8.99 meals (BBQ nacho fries, various wraps, outlaw burger and many options that are more wonderful to choose from)

Then there are the various plates that they have. Minh and I decided on ordering and splitting The Pit Special: 

Four meats (of your choice) and three sides (of your choice) - Brisket, Chicken, two orders of spare ribs. Bacon Potato Salad, Yams, and Corn Nuggets all for $19.99!

They took Minh's name down and we seated our self's in an over sized booth. The owner was there making sure everything was running smoothly. This is a family owned business, which makes it have that charming-family-cozy kind of feeling.
