As we were waiting for our food and other friends to arrive, I was chatting with Stephanie and watching the small eatery fill up with hungry families, club-goers and other various walks of life wanting some stick to your ribs goodness. 

A friendly server brought our food to our table. All I can say is the Pit Special offers a lot of food for your money! There is more than enough to share with another person. 

The corn nuggets were the best ever! Fried on the outside (no grease on any of the balls) and yet soft and fluffy in middle. I was popping these in two at a time (sorry babe if you only got a couple). There are addicting! 

The bacon potato salad was another favorite, chucks of potatoes various seasonings, mayo and probably mustard piled with bits of delicious bacon.  Swoon!

All the meats were tender (they "rub" their own meats daily) you can taste the quality of the meats they have. Not one piece was dry; we did try their homemade BBQ sauce, which was delightful on the brisket. The chicken and ribs had so much meat on it I got overwhelmed for a second. 

This place is a gem in hiding, BBQ in sin city at its best! To the Holland family thank you for making this delicious food for every kind of budget!

I was watching some guy in a business suit bathing his food in BBQ sauce and was thinking "you're putting a little bit too much of that sauce there buddy". It wasn't until my food came out and I had a bite without the sauce that I understood exactly why I should do the same as the business suit guy. Their barbecue sauce is really good. I wish I could bathe in that sauce. Not really that would be gross but you understand the sentiment. 5 stars for that sauce.

They have $7.99 or $8.99 deals and even offer all you can eat barbecue. I ordered the $7.99 trio sliders and got chicken, brisket, and pork. It was so tasty. Presentation is aesthetically pleasing meaning the food is good looking. I do mind that the meat was colder than usual at room temperature or even a little colder. Food should come out piping hot so that once the customer decides to dig in, the food will still be extremely warm and fresh. 3 stars for the food.

The people working there are super cool. We were asked how our food was tasting too many times by 3 different workers. 5 stars for the service.

Setup of the restaurant is weird. The ordering counter is inside one of the dining rooms so the line wraps around the dining tables so if you sit on those dining tables it'd be awkward. There's a connecting room with dining tables and me and my 2 friends avoided sitting on those dining tables by the line so that we sat at a table meant for 2. 2 on the bench and 1 on the chair, 2 shared one end of the table. There are outdoor dining in the front but no one wants to sit in the 100 degree Las Vegas summer weather. It wasn't until we were about to leave that I saw a separate dining table accessible from the outdoor dining on the left side of the restaurant. There could be signs inside the main dining area pointing out that there's that other separate dining room.. Or maybe I'm just oblivious? 2 stars for the restaurant setup.
Great food, the smell is breathtaking and the people are very nice! If you come to Vegas you must eat here if you love BBQ!

I love love love this place!!! As a Vegas local I have been coming here for some time, everything we have ordered brisket to ribs, pulled pork, burgers everything has been cooked to perfection.  Only disappointment is as this place has become more popular the prices have gone up and the portions has gotten smaller.  Hubby always gets meat trio.  You used to get 3 sides with it and now you only get 1 for the same price as before.   A must while in Vegas........I just hope the popularity doesn't diminish the quality over time.

holy. santa claus. s***. if you like bbq, you need to be here. now!

HIGHLY recommend the pulled pork - it's amazing. 

The sweet country sauce is unworldly.

They still got it. We had a little of almost everything & it was all good - I think they changed their rub a little but still good. Hushpuppies a simple thing but not everyone can make them right but theirs are good . Again if you are in town & want real smoked Q it 's the place to go & check out the smoker they had turned into a fish tank it  is cool.
Great food super delicious, got the buffet only thing i didn't really like was mac ncheese but everything else was super good. Wanted to go back but they close on Sunday's
Let the picture speak for itself. A brisket, sausage, and rib sandwich with a side fried okra. Yummy!!!

It is close to impossible to find good BBQ, but after seeing the great reviews and mouthwatering pics of Rollin Smoke on Yelp, I had to come here while in vegas.
Location is easy to get to, small lot to park in.
Having read how full it gets we went shortly after opening at 11 am to find no lines and only a few people dining.
By the time we left an hour later, no tables left, line out the door so plan accordingly. 
They offer 10% off when you show the coupon on their website!
We went with a burger and waffle fries kids meal for my son and he enjoyed it, great waffle fries!
I had the 2 slider combo with baked beans and enjoyed both the brisket and the pulled pork.
Their sauces are amazing, my favorite was the mama's sweet, so tasty, drowned the meats in there, a soft hawaiian bun, it was too tasty.
My husband had the 3 brisket sampler and only enjoyed the chopped one, the sliced was very dry and the burnt ends just soggy fat, so glad I passed on getting just an order of burnt ends.
My husband had the mac n cheese and said it was pretty artificial and the baked beans were also just ok.
In all, fantastic BBQ, I'll be back for the pulled pork and chopped brisket and their best ever BBQ sauces!

The Outlaw Burger is the meal cheat days were made for!
It's gigantic and completely acceptable to share, weighing a monstrous amount and nearly filling an entire takeout box. Piled high with juicy, flavorful brisket (tastes like Texas!), crispy fried bell pepper and onion strings, cheddar cheese, and chipotle aioli, this thing is packed with big, bold flavors. The red cabbage slaw adds the perfect bit of crunch and acidity, bringing what could be an overwhelming mouthful flying back into foodie heaven.  I'm pretty sure I'm going to have wet dreams about this burger.

Initially we were turned away because they had "just closed" only for the owner to come chasing after us, insistent that we could still be served. Right after our order was placed, a family walked in and were turned away. I'm flattered and grateful that we made it in under the wire, but maybe turn off all of the neon flashy BBQ lights if you're closing so that you don't have to ruin anyone's day!

EDIT: I returned for actual barbecue and found the meat to be poor quality and the portions on the stingy side. Pricing is about on par with other spots, and their sauce is good, but either they've gone downhill or the Outlaw burger is about the best they can do.

Meh. Let me start by saying I'm from Chicago. We may not have the most renown BBQ in the country but we have some pretty good BBQ spots. Therefore, I must admit that when it comes to recognizing a good BBQ joint, it's hard to pull a wool over my eyes.

So this place, great service. The guy who took our order was nice; our food didn't take ridiculously long to come out. My wife and I split a trio with chicken, hot links and spare ribs. For $17 & some change, I was disappointed with the portion sizes. 1 hot link (not sure why they said linkS), 2 medium size spare ribs, 1 chicken drumstick & 1 thigh. Sorry, I may be spoiled by Chicago's fine eating rep but $17 at a BBQ joint in Chi-town typically gets you A LOT MORE. I also decided to try a blackberry cobbler (the menu says blueberry but they have blackberry)

Food wise, it was ok. The rub on the ribs were "OK" (I've definitely had better). They weren't super tough but they weren't slide off the bone tender, they were somewhere in the middle. The hot link was actually good but it wasn't a smoked hot link that's standard for a BBQ joint but a pork hot link. The chicken was ok. My wife didn't like the seasoning on it so she peeled back the skin & put BBQ sauce on it. The blackberry cobbler was descent but considering the stark tartness of blackberry, it could've been sweeter to offset the tartness. Likely won't be back here next time in Vegas.

2 words OVERPRICED & OVERRATED! OMG where should I start? When you pull up it smells great and it looks busy which can be a good thing if the food is great. WRONG! Lol I'm guessing this is supposed to be gourmet BBQ? IDK but the food was almost gross. Brisket reminded me of Spam, ribs didn't really have a taste, and the mac & cheese must've been made with sour cream because it was a little too creamy with a weird taste. The kickn beans were bland and undercooked. The hot links I'm guessing Hoffy or Bar S? Yuck. And guess wat? I decided to go all out and order desert. Peach cobbler! Ugh more like bland peach cake!

The prices are high with small portions and meals only come with 1 side! Where they do that at? Let's not even talk about the area this is located in. This was a total fail! Guess I'll just stick with my usual BBQ place and not venture out again.

I'm literally typing this review as my boyfriend and I pull out of the restaurant. 

I wish I could give this place a million stars if I could. My boyfriend and I went in to visit this place with high expectations and it did not disappoint.
Cashier girl Lizelle was super sweet and a delight to order from! We ordered the 3 rib platter and the pulled pork sandwich. They have variety of sauces to pick from and really cool cups for your soda. 
Chef Will brought out our food for us and it was like heaven! I personally just started eating meat again but the ribs were like nothing I ever had before. My boyfriend being a huge carnivore even agreed! 

As we were almost finished eating (not even able to finish half way because it's super filling and huge portions) Chef Will came out to let us try some burnt ends with his special hot sauce! The hot sauce isn't on the counter and he has it in the back. We were so delighted at how sweet and generous he was! Being a flight attendant and food enthusiast I've ate at so many food places but this place is by far one of my favorite places to eat. 

It's a must try if your in the area and even if your not I would make the drive here because this place is special. We will definitely be making our way back as much as we can! 

Ps. Also this place is has been on TV, magazines and winning multiple awards. Now you have to go try it !!

First off, when you get here you wonder if you are the right place. It looks like a hole in the wall from the outside and it isn't in the safest of places (late at night). But once you walk in, you are greeting with a delicous smell of BBQ and walls of true Razorback fans! The inside is completely different the outside. This place is true BBQ. Everything was fantastic and the owner is really, really nice. We all got something different and there wasn't one back thing. I got the beef ribs which were literally fall off the bone. We also got the smoked meatloaf and pulled piggy sandwich. The piggy sandwich was very tender and moist but the star of the meals really was the meatloaf. I don't like meatloaf but I liked this one. It isn't your traditional meatloaf, it is smoked and BBQ. So very good. The portions are huge as well! You really don't need too many sides if any but if you do get some, the greens are good, yams and mac n cheese are good! I bet the rest are as well. I highly recommend going here! Yum!

I don't understand how this place doesn't have 5 stars!!!!!! Maybe the missing .5 comes from the fact that it is floating in a sea of strip club??? This BBQ is BEYOND AMAZING!!!!! You literally can taste the smoke off this meat.....& boy do I like that. So we tried the beef brisket sandwich with the spiced mac & cheese as the side. My sister and bro-in-law got the wings and the trio. Everything was so darn yummy!!! SAVORY! 

The service rocks and I can't help but talk with a Southern drawl with these Alabaman owners. It made me miss the South so whenever I feel nostalgic I know to come here.
I had a great time today going to the barbecue restaurant. It is the first time of that I have been there, and the service is excellent much faster than I expected, and the food was delicious!

Having moved from Kansas City, I wasn't hopeful on finding quality local BBQ that's even in the ballpark. However, this place is light. Great food & service! The building is located in a seedy area and the facilities is a bit of a dive... so, it's the perfect authentic barbecue spot!

The three meat combo is the way to go! Their ribs, pulled pork and brisket will not let you down. I had fried okra as my side & the dipping sauce gives it a unique flair. I'll be heading back for more.
Ate here with a group.  Everyone enjoyed their meal.  Can wait to return to Vegas to eat their again.  I had the brisket dog, so yummy!

Seriously this bbq is so good you will want to smack someone! I'm not a pit master but I know some Q and Rollin smoke is amazing.  Food wasn't oversmoked, meat was tender, and customer service was just phenomenal. I went with a large group so I got to try everything.  The highlights are the brisket and chicken, and I wasn't a big fan of their dessert.  

This is a bbq you should check out when you are in town! Thanks!!!!!

I didn't really know what Arkansas BBQ was prior to coming here. Now, I'm a fan! 

We started with Brenda who was working the counter. She was both friendly and patient with us as we explored the menu. We got ribs and pulled pork and brisket and burnt ends. Add in some greens, cornbread, and mac and cheese and we were ready for a feast!

All of the BBQ was well prepared and the sides were tasty. A nice gentleman came out to check on us as we ate and was pleased we were having a great time scarfing down the food!

Get off the strip for gosh sake, get a car or Uber or taxi or hitchhike or whatever you have to do, and come to Rollin Smoke!

it was damn good!!!! $! hands down the best bbq in viva las vegas they allow you to try everything on the menu with there varity of combos. everything is prepared and cooked to perfection from the entrées, sides, & desserts.

AMAZING!!!! Best. Barbeque. Ever. Where to begin...corn nuggets! Yum! Smoked meatloaf! Awesome! Place is really hidden in a weird part of town and my wife was worried about going in, but she was glad she did. She's in LOVE with this place. Ribs, brisket, and sausage was great. Pork was a bit dry, but that didn't bother us at all. Ended up with to-go boxes for the hotel. Will definitely return next time we're in Las Vegas!
Brisket was amazing, ordered the party pack got some of everything and it was all really good, then the ribs came. The baby back ribs were great. Thanks for the great service also.

I love the food here, best BBQ in Vegas!  Every Saturday night I'm here and I've been meaning to leave a review for these guys. 

Dusty, I love you man!  Keep up the good service!
Unbelievable! I won't be going to Lucilles BBQ anymore.. This place is not only BOMB but the prices are awesome!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Most awesome original real BBQ since I left the south. The smokey atmosphere penetrates you as well as the mouth watering meats this place is like home, man the food here is absolutely the best hands down in Vegas they said there was no good bbq in town, my answer to that is bull$#!t!!! ( it's a family show) but you gotta try it

Spectacular barbecue. We made a special visit for a birthday  and found the burnt ends to be much more moist than any other we've found. The pulled pork was roughly pulled, with crunchy bits as well as perfect strands. The chicken was smoked beautifully. Beans (baked) were spicy, beans (string) were crunchy, corn nuggets naturally sweet and addictive, cornbread flavourful and cakey. Arkansauce was bright and runny. Friendly crew, clean and comfy.
This place was well worth the wait..  It's a little hole in the wall place but the ribs are delicious..  Hands down best bbq in town..
$24.99 All-U-Can-Eat...need I say more!? Tasty bbq and sides galore. Customer service to match their great eats. I love finding gems like RSBBQ - definitely need to be in the know to find this joint!
Best BBQ in Las Vegas hand down. Huge menu, fair prices and great customer service makes for a cool place to gang out, have a beer and eat some great food.

Delicious BBQ located not far from the strip. The pulled pork was delicious as were the pork ribs which fell right off the bone. The spices and sauce on the meat were perfect. This is the best Q I've enjoyed since Franklin BBQ in Austin, which is the best in the country.

Amazing BBQ!! My boyfriend and I discovered Rollin Smoke about a year ago and have been loyal ever since. There mac and cheese is OMG delishhhh! My boyfriend loves to get the "Outlaw Burger" one of his favorites.

Wow! Surprisingly really good BBQ. We didn't know what to expect since the street getting to this establishment looked a little shady. We parked in the lot and walked in. Yup, I can deal with this. No ghetto-ness here! There is a large board with the menu and there is also menus provided by the staff.

You walk up and place your order. We ordered a smoking plate of the pork bbq ribs, bread and the mac n cheese combo and the fiancee ordered a smoked brisket sandwich. We also ordered the blueberry cobbler a la mode.

The ribs were really good. I like my ribs with a lot of sauce so luckily there was a bottle of sauce on each table. There are 2 dining areas with TVs, as well as outdoor seating. The outdoor seating is pretty much used for smokers. 

The staff is really courteous, friendly and informative. If you're new to the restaurant, they are very helpful in making your decision. We did notice a lot of first timers.

The only issue we had, was that our food came out lukewarm. Not sure if the food was sitting out for a few minutes before serving to us, but it would have been tastier if the food was hot upon arrival.

Definitely recommend this place for those looking for a quick good meal off the strip. We had no wait, but after we placed our order, there was a line out the door. A lot of people ended up taking their food to-go, so that's a good thing if you plan to eat inside the restaurant.

Wife & I are at Rollin Smoke Bar-B-Q for the 2nd time in 3 days with 5 days left I'm sure it won't be the last. We are from Cincinnati in Las Vegas on vacation, Jessica took great care of us. The food here is just incredible, we got a great deal with the pit special, 4 meats , 3 sides & 1 drink for only $19.99. We had double hot links, chicken all-white meat & burnt ends. We also added cornbread which tastes like cake, Yum. The people in Vegas are spoiled to have such an incredible Bar-B-Q place. If you're visiting Las Vegas and don't stop by to eat you missed the best food place in Vegas. We cheated and tried another Bar-B-Q place yesterday called John Mull's Road Kill Grill after seeing it on TV, but after eating their food we realized we wasted our gas, time & money as Rollin Smoke is closer and has way better Bar-B-Q. John Mull's Road Kill Grill not only was not close in quality it wasn't even in the same ballpark. Keep up making such great food and we will never stray again, as Rollin Smoke is "DAM  GOOD"!!!!
These guys really know their barbecue.  Everything was amazing.  The outside of the place is super sketchy looking, but don't let that keep you from going in.  It will change your life.  So good.

I don't know what happened but I had a totally different experience at Rollin Smoke then everyone else seems to have had.  We ordered rib tips, links, mac n cheese, mashed potatoes, potato salad, coleslaw, peach cobbler and caramel cake all to go.  It took over 45 min for our order to be ready.  I would think the sides and desserts are already prepared and just need to scooped in a container.  So the wait was for links and rib tips?  The smokers were not on when we were there so we weren't waiting for meat.  

Customer service could have been friendlier.  They customer in front of me asked what sides they had and the guy taking orders just hit the menu where the sides were listed.  I wanted a link and sides but was told I had to get the hotlink sandwich.  I asked "So I can't just get a link?"  He said no not really.  When I pressed the issue he said I can get a 2 item combo and just get all hotlink.  I ordered that but why not just sell a link for $3 or $4 bucks?  After 40 min of waiting and seeing people order after me get their food I asked how long it would be and was told very gruffly that they are "very busy".  They were busy but I ordered before the lunch rush started.  I was also sitting in the booth next to the register so I could hear the orders and knew who was picking up phone orders, etc.  Also during the 45 min I waited at least 5 people told him the coke was out.  It was still out when I left.  

Ok.  On to the most important part the food.  Cause really, I will wait for hours and put up with bad service for some awesome BBQ.  

Sweet Tea- Not good.  I actually switched to soda and I rarely drink soda.  

Rib tips- Hubby thought they were ok.  I'm not a big beef rib person but thought they were ok also.  `

Links- No way that was 2 portions of links from my 2 meat combo.  It wasn't even 1 small link total.  But that is ok since they were so dried out it looked like they were days old.  I have never seen meat that dry in my entire life.  I'm being generous to say they looked like they were sliced the day before and left in the warmer overnight.  

Mac n cheese- very bland, noodles overcooked, could have used salt or real cheese.  

Mashed Potatoes-  Instant.  Yes they use instant potatoes.  All the other stuff there is good.  If they would use real potatoes it would probably be amazing.  

Potato Salad- This was the best out of all the sides.  It was ok but wouldn't order it again.  

Coleslaw- Ok.  

Peach cobbler- Cold.  Who serves cold peach cobbler?  Again ok.  Not great.  

Caramel Cake- Yellow cake topped with caramel syrup, like the kind you buy for sundaes.  This was actually not bad.  I might even try it at home.  

All the sides seemed just a little spice away from being good.  Maybe I went on an off day.  I don't know.  After reading everyone's reviews I was so excited to come here and had high hopes for what I thought was going be my new favorite BBQ place.  I was heartbroken at how bad it was.  At some point I will try again cause these 5 stars reviews have to mean something.  But I'm gonna need my yelpers to go with me cause hubby isn't having it.

Had the catfish po boy with waffle fries and a drink for $18 and some change. They definitely shouldn't call it a po boy cus it's misleading. The catfish is thin and frail with no crunch to it at all. The  bread is a hoagie bun which is too thick of a bread for a po boy. The frail fish sits on top of a bed of romaine lettuce and diced tomatoes. The taste wasn't bad but with the excessive bread and frail non-crispy fish I definitely won't get it again. And my fries were cold and stale like they were fried last night. Def not worth the $18 I spent.

I don't know what happened to this place. This was the first time I have ever eaten RSB and been let down.

Ordered Duo plate with 1 side and bread plus a drink. Opted for the short ribs and brisket with cheesy mac and cheese as the side.

- The meat lacked any flavor and was completely missing that "Wow" factor we experienced on  each previous visits. Plus the meat was actually lukewarm, like it had been sitting out for a bit.  The short ribs were still good, but the brisket was very disappointing. 
- Plus it seems like the portion sizes have gotten smaller. We both looked at our plates and said at the same time, "That's it?". Hmmmm.
- Personal pet peeve of mine: Dropped 4 singles into the toke jar and never even received an acknowledgement. I work for tips and thank EVERYBODY who tokes. It is just rude not to.

I really hope I just caught them on an off day, but now I am going to start exploring other options when craving good BBQ. This was just a very underwhelming experience.

2 stars.

I have experienced better.

I love Rollin Smoke! After spending half a year in Texas, my standards for barbeque have gone up quite a few notches. I didn't expect to find a place that would be on par with good 'ol Texas, but Rollin Smoke definitely takes the award for best barbeque in Las Vegas. 

One of the best things about this place is the staff. Everyone that works there is super friendly, and loves having a conversation with you while they're taking your order. It creates an ambience that really makes you feel at home, which a lot of Vegas restaurants are lacking in. 

You have many different options to choose from including AYCE but honestly, you'd have to come extremely hungry to manage that one. My go to is the three meat combo, which gives you any three meats of your choice, bread, and a side. It's good for those who like a little variety, but also want a little extra to take home. I usually stick with burnt ends a.k.a the only way to eat brisket, ribs, and whatever else I'm feeling that day. They put a little bit of sauce on it for you, but there's also bottles of barbeque sauce at the table so you can go as crazy as you'd like. 

If you're in town and looking for some great barbeque, definitely give Rollin Smoke a try. You won't be disappointed.

BBQ On point! I got to meet the owner the first time I came here, he was cleaning the tables. I asked him what style BBQ was his favorite and where his main influence was from. He told me Arkansas style but less spicy. He also told me that in his opinion Las Vegas doesn't like the real spicy BBQ.

I personally feel like he should just do what he wants to do, but he's the boss. He has great grub. I have now had all but one item on the menu. I can say it's all dynamite. 

The meat is all tender and juicy. the sauce is light in flavor and texture. All the sides are great and fair size. 
My father in law asked me when we were done eating, "can you put this place in my gps?" When I told him yes he had a big smile on his face. We've been going back ever since.

Came back and I think it was even better than before. We had the combo with ribs and brisket and the meatloaf (again). Sides were Mac n cheese, mashed potatoes with the meatloaf and bacon potato salad. The combo came with this melt in your mouth honey cornbread. Seriously the best BBQ I've ever had (don't tell my hubby).

The BBQ is definitely pretty good here.  Maybe some of the best in town.  Granted I haven't really eaten much BBQ in Vegas. We got the platter that had a little bit of everything, brisket, pulled pork, hot links, ribs, chicken, and the infamous corn nuggets.  All were pretty good.  They even have stuff that most BBQ places don't have, like burgers, collared greens, fries, etc.

Of course, like most BBQ places, it's kind of expensive. Parking is horrible so definitely try to go when it's not too busy

I've had Rollin Smoke on my bookmarks for over two years. Finally got to roll on over! Had to roll myself out, too.

We had the pulled piggy sandwich plate and the brisket three ways. We had the mac n cheese and the corn nuggets for our sides. The food was FANTASTIC.
-Pulled piggy sandwich was perfectly smoky and had comparably less fat to other establishments I've been to that have served pulled pork sandwiches.
-Chopped brisket: juicy due to being a bit fattier than my preference, but served like it's supposed to
-Burnt ends: my personal favorite
Sliced brisket: perfectly tender and ready to pull apart
-Corn nuggets: YES PLEASE. I'd eat these all day long if calories didn't count.

Two things I would change about Rollin Smoke if I could: the location (super small parking lot) and the seating arrangements. Unfortunately we came on a really cold day and the seating area is rather sparse. This resulted in the doors opening and closing a lot, so our food got cold pretty quickly.

Verdict: I do NOT plan on waiting another two years to return, so you shouldn't either.

I love LOVE small businesses.  I can't  really call this a "Mom & Pop" place because its more of a manly man joint (which I like). They REALLY care about the food here, it shows and you can taste it.  You can NOT go wrong with ANY choice here.
It's a GREAT place for lunch... I have to find out if they do catering... this is SERIOUS Bbq!!

I forgot to mention that my daughter got her braces off today and she wanted to come get ribs here ASAP!!! LOL

Rollin Smoke wins my vote for best BBQ in Vegas. They are nestled in the heart of the strip club district on Industrial, but worth the drive to the neighborhood. I've been here a few times with large groups of people and I love the pit room in the back, it even has a really cool grill fish tank. 

Rollin Smoke really excels at their BBQ and sauces. We always get the pit special, 4 meats and 3 sides, and it feeds my little family of three. Their ribs and brisket are especially good. They do lack consistency though, the first time I had the brisket I could cut it with a fork and another time it was a bit tough. Either way, you want to slather it in the sauce on the table, it's the perfect tangy sweet spicy BBQ sauce. 

Rollin Smoke is a bit of a let down when it comes to sides. I've tried many of them and the only ones worth mentioning in my opinion are the waffle fries, the green beans, and the hush puppies. You do definitely want a side of corn bread though, it's so good and sitting in a little butter bath. YES! You also want dessert, the banana pudding is pretty darn good and the peach cobbler is good but a little on the sweet side. 

Definitely the best BBQ in Vegas, not the best I've ever had, but the best we've got!
Driving up it smelled sooo good.  Waiting for our order.  Five different meats and four sides.

Given all the yelp hype, Rollin Smoke was not as good as I had hoped.

I really like tender fall off the bone meat with some bold sweet, hot, mild, vinegar based sauce options. While the portions were huge, and the prices good, this didn't quite do it for me.

I'm from Houston Texas the barbecue capital and although I will not tell you that these folks in Las Vegas are as good as Houston Texas for barbecue and even if they were I would not admit it I will tell you it's pretty darn good and pretty darn close and I would come back here again and again so let that be your hands if you're going to go to Las Vegas and you're going to want barbecue you're going to want to stop here
It may not be near our neighborhood but it's worth the drive. In my hungry gals opinion it's the best BBQ we've found in Vegas
This place is great! The corn nuggets and the burger that they're so known for! Is just wooooow!!!
Excellent food and service - even if you aren't a BBQ fan you need to give this place a try!
Let me tell you, this is not the typical place I take my clients to to celebrate closing on a house but the food is AMAZING and you can't beat it. So glad I found such great Barbeque!
Pulled piggy sandwich was awsome!.. ordered and it was out in 5 min. Sad i ate so fast i forgot to take a picture. The sauce was purrrfect. Cole slaw was ehh. Baked beans were ok.

Why are there only excellent reviews here's??????    You folks have absolutely no tastebuds at all....The worst rib tips ever.all bone, all fat all gristle.too expensive. 3rd. Time around been ripped off...HOWEVER  the nicest staff in the world.. Wondering if all these 5 stars are fake posters ????????    Good employees ......bad bbq

The good: fall of the none delicious BBQ , nice flavor, great spice if u enjoy spice , Mac and cheese is cheesy goodness , chicken is juicy and so flavorful ,and  ribs are the best in town beats buzz hands down .                                                         The Bad: Sauce is way too spicy for kids , Mac and cheese is too spicy ,and  brisket was alright nothing to write about. Ordering is confusing and wasn't sure if u seat yourself or wait to be seated , small location , and not a fan of the location                   Tips: if u don't like spicy food u will not enjoy this , limited items for kids to consume , and they are closed Sunday

I do a mean BBQ myself, mixing my own rubs and sauces, so I go to BBQ restaurants for the sides.

In this case, Rolling Smoke hit both the sides AND the meats. I got Burnt Ends and hot links, since I rarely get to cook brisket anymore. Both hit the spot!!

I also got the Bacon Potato salad. Real bacon, plenty of it, and the Cole slaw is a must-try.

Very good menu, great staff, and fast service.On my list for a return visit.

A delicious BBQ place, the portion is definitely worth the price. We had the trio plate which came with 3 choices of meat, 1 side, and a drink for $13. We chose the brisket, pork, and pork ribs. It came smothered in their BBQ sauce, which is slightly tangy and spicy. The pork ribs is the best out of the three...moist and tender; the meat literally falls off the bone. The brisket was a bit dry and the pulled pork was ok, just cover them in BBQ sauce and it'll be fine. 

As for the sides, the mac and cheese was super cheesy, and the coleslaw has a spicy kick to it. The coleslaw helps give a taste variety to the richness of the meats. Definitely worth coming back the next time I'm in Vegas.

Very good.   You get a lot of food (can share portions-and this is advised).  I would recommend just getting platters (no sandwiches-bread will stuff you even more). If you visit Vegas and want barbecue-go here.

Oh man, where do i start...

Now that I have recovered from the behemoth meal that was Rollin Smoke Barbeque, I can now gather myself to write this review.

First of all, if you come here expect to wait in a line. Don't worry though, the line moves fairly quickly.

Here's what we ordered:

1/2 slab baby back rib plate (4/5) - Very meaty ribs, not fall off the bone but still juicy. I give it a 4 instead of a 5 because they didn't remove the casing from the outside of the rib and it made it a little hard to eat. Overall, I liked it and would order again.

Outlaw burger (5/5) - My boyfriend who is a total burger aficionado tells me that this is the best burger he's ever had! Keep in mind that he loves bbq and bbq sauce so this burger did not cramp his style. There are tender pieces of brisket paired with ground beef, fried onion strings, barbeque sauce. Don't be shy because this WILL get messy!

Service is good here and people are really friendly. Unlike other casual dining places, the staff actually comes to check up on you after they've delivered your food. 

Oh yeah and we checked in on yelp and they gave us a free ice cream sundae due to our burger order. Can't beat that!

The reviews for this place are pretty acurate. Good bbq for vegas. Not the best I have had but definitely the best in vegas. Only one signature sauce. Only complaint- the chicken was dry (it happens). Other than that,  no complaints. Good solid bbq. Definitely enjoyed the loaded mash. 
The guy tending to the dining room was very friendly and helpful. 
I would come back.

I WENT HOG WILD!!!!
Tim the Chef OMG he cooks the best greens ever. These people are so kind and the place is so clean. I had the best time eating catfish & greens. I did taste my husband's dish he had pull pork. I also took pictures of the food and Chef Tim also posed for my profile picture. I give them ten stars I think this is the best BBQ in Vegas thus far. I will return ASAP.

When in Vegas, I always come here from now on. These guys know how to do BBQ like it's nobody's business! It's some of the best food you will eat in all of Vegas and at 1/3 of the price of even fast food on the strip. $10 fills me up and i'm a big dude. Super nice people too. Off the strip and worth it!!!

Heard great things and came here with a few of my friends while in Vegas for a soccer tourney.  The menu looked so appetizing and I finally went with the Trio. I also ordered a peach cobbler. 

The pulled pork was amazing!  Best bit of BBQ I've had. The chicken was good. The brisket was kind of fatty. They came out and told me they were out of peach cobbler so I had the berry cobbler instead. If you love cobbler like I do, do NOT order it here!  It is not really cobbler but more like berries poured on top of a cornbread and topped with whip cream. 

My overall meal was good, and my friends had more success with their meals so I give it an overall 4 stars
We googled best BBQ in Vegas and this place popped up...THANK GOD IT DID! AUH-MAZING FOOD!! You will not be disappointed!! "Its Dam Good"!!! Buy a t-shirt too!

Excellent barbeque!! We had the three meat plate with brisket, pork, and hot links. My husband loved the pork. I got the chicken nacho fries and they were amazing!! Ended our meal with peach cobbler. Great experience and not far from the strip. I highly recommend it.

We stopped by here for dinner a few nights ago while traveling through. Things are a little pricier than I would imagine for the amount of food you get. I did the two meat meal for $10.99. I got two short ribs and two strips of brisket on top of a soggy piece of white bread and a side of macaroni and cheese. I thought the short ribs were very good and would recommend those. The brisket was good and the macaroni and cheese was forgettable. My wife got the $7.99 brisket sandwich and thought it was pretty good.

Because we checked in via Yelp, we got a "free dessert." We ordered the Blue Bell Ice Cream Sundae. What they brought us was a shot glass sized plastic cup filled 2/3 with ice cream and 1/3 with whipped cream. If that dessert really costs 3.99, it is a complete rip off. It's more likely that they only gave us a sample size dessert as the "free dessert" that was advertised. Don't they know better than to cut corners with people who use Yelp? Whatever the case, I was less than impressed by that. 

Overall, I might stop back by here to give it another shot if I was in town for a bit and looking for a meal under $15 a plate (although they have many options that would put you over that limit, including an all you can eat thing for $25). But with so many other places to eat in Vegas, it's more likely I'll try somewhere else.
Awesome food, best barbecue in town hands down, with that it can be a little wait because of the line of people they have but hey thats a good sign. Love this place.

This place is a little off the beaten path for Vegas but well worth finding.  We had the brisket sandwich and smoked chicken sandwich.  Both were very tasty.  Exactly what you are looking for when you are craving BBQ.  

Staff is super friendly and service is really quick.  Love the set up of the two dining areas.  Great atmosphere.

I'm more of a baby back rib guy. The lean, tender, fall of the bone meat was the Holy grail. I found beef ribs to be chewy and stringy, until I found this place. They may have pulled a game changer. Their beef ribs were incredible. Better then any pork I have had so far. Frankly I'm going to have to go back and try again just to see if it was a fluke. It may be the best litmus test I have ever had to do.

Yeah. I love it.

Why? 

Good food, good prices and they have one of the gnarliest burgers I have ever seen.  Additionally, the food tastes excellent too.  The burger is little excessive on the onion strings but I'll take it anyway.  It's definitely bursting with flavor.

So this place has been on my radar ever since I saw the pictures of the Outlaw Burger.  Since I love burgers, I had to make it here when I was in the area.  Luckily, I finally had that chance.  So with no hesitation, I walked in, stepped up to the counter and proudly, enthusiastically and anxiously as hell, ordered the Outlaw Burger...with a side of loaded mashed potatoes and cornbread.

After only a few minutes (maybe 10 at the most but probably considerably less) the server delivered my order.  The Outlaw Burger is a monster!  The thing is probably about a foot tall, mostly onion strings but the actual meat and cheese portion of the burger is delicious.  The only downside is that halfway through the thing was falling apart and I pretty much had to eat it like a salad.  I'm not going to complain though because the thing was delicious.

The loaded mashed potatoes were a worthy addition to the meal and really hit the spot.  The sweet cornbread wasn't too bad but I probably would have ordered the corn nuggets or whatever they were called next time given the amount and since I've had sweeter, tastier cornbread before from my local grocer (in Rollin' Smoke's defense, I've yet to find better cornbread outside this particular grocer).

Service was good, the food arrived quickly and it hit the spot for sure.  For an off the beaten path little BBQ joint, this place has it going on.  I'm already thinking about eating here again, the only thing keeping me is a few hundred miles...at least for now.  

I'll be back.
Woke up today craving pork ribs and found this place. I love their menu and the food is delicious. Highly recommend!

BBQ alert! Smoker in the parking lot. Fried okra, pinto beans and corn bread on the menu. Open until 1:30am on the weekend! I've been spending all of my life dreaming of this Southern paradise. Well, at least the part of my life during which I have lived in Las Vegas because prior to that I was in the Southern paradise of Hotlanta. 

Driving here you will have your doubts that you are actually going to end up at an establishment that serves edible items. You may even believe you are being drawn into a cleverly disguised strip club or an automotive shop, but if you have your windows down about half a mile away you will start to smell the que, and you'll know you're headed in the right direction.

I must say that I think their sides are even more delicious than their meat. I sampled their killer fried okra and baked beans, and I would go go back for those alone. But of course, their meat is delicious as well. I went with the two meat sampler and chose pulled pork and brisket. It is a generous heaping of meat. It was hard to tell where the brisket ended and the pork began, but they were both flavorful thanks to a sauce that is more spicy than sweet. The pork was a tad dry, but I didn't let any of it go to waste. 

The environment is definitely casual, and in one room, they are using table cloths because there is apparently a couple of not so attractive tables hiding. However, the table cloths do lead to a lot of stains, so I hope they can wrangle some more attractive tables soon. 

As for service, it is spectacular. The nicest bunch of Arkansas boys you could hope to meet. This should definitely be at the top of your short list of must-try BBQ in Vegas.
Best BBQ in Vegas hands down coming from a Texas boy. worth the drive to the seedy part of town. the smoked meat will make you forget about where you are. GO HAWGS!!!!!

Man on man! Just got done eating here and it was awesome! There were things that I had that I don't recommend like the chicken and pulled pork..not the best that I ever had but you gotta put alot of bbq sauce on it...but the most amazing things were the fried catfish, beef ribs, pork ribs, corn nuggets,brisket, hush puppies. I like the environment here it's very casual where you order your food grab your own drinks and just wait for your food to come out. Plus they are open late so thank you for a great meal I'll be back

You can smell this place all the way from the street. Best barbeque I've ever had. Being from Texas and an expert smoker myself, this says a lot. This guy puts a lot of effort and thought into his cooking. He's not just a pit master, he's a chef. Amazing food!

I had a brisket sandwich, one beef rib and bacon potato salad. Most tender and smoky beef ribs and brisket ever. The sandwich bun was served on a really soft sesame seed hoagie bun and was typed with green onions. No extra sauce necessary. Just the right amount of flavor and nothing overpowering. Lover every bite! No wonder the walls are covered with awards.
Food is great!  Portions great for the money!  Definitely a place to go if you want good food off the strip.

Great service! The cashier gave us an extra drink for free when my boyfriend and I stopped by. Our friends ordered after my boyfriend and I, and got their food before us. A worker noticed we were still waiting for our food for a while and asked for our names so he could check up on our food. He said the Outlaw burger takes a bit more time to cook and put together. Soon after he gave us our food and some stickers too.

I had the bbq nacho fries. They were loaded with brisket, sour cream and cheese. My boyfriend had the outlaw burger. You definitely get your money's worth with that one. We also got mac and cheese for a side. Kind of a small portion but still really yummy. You might as well make it a combo for $3 to add a drink and side. A drink is $2 and a side is $2.50 so might as well make it a combo to get more bang for your buck!

Only complaint is that they need to expand! They've got so many people coming through that we had to stand and wait for a bit til people left so that we could sit and eat.
Finally, real BBQ in las vegas! If you havent been here you better make the trip! I've been to Franklins and Salt Lick in Austin and this is just as good.

Saw them on Drivers, Dine-Ins and Dives with Guy Fieri.  Looked really good and unique. If you blink you'll miss the place because it's behind the casinos in an industrial area. 

Menu is extensive and formidable. I would imagine it would take you 3 months of coming everyday to try it all.

The portions seemed a little small to me. The $3 extra to make it a meal with a side and drink with my pulled piggy sandwich was expensive for the tiny portion they served.  BTW, the sandwich was super delicious.  

The hostess was goofy, energetic, and knew the menu really well.  She was a pleasure to talk to.  I think I would try the other BBQ places featured on yelp just to have a really good comparison as to which was the best.  

Overall, it's a great off the strip place to try.  Really low-key atmosphere.

I was cravin bbq after driving by Memphis BBQ on the way home. We were going to head there, but after checking out the reviews on  Yelp I decided to try Rollin Smoke BBQ! Some of the best bbq I've had in a while that wasn't from a chain (Famous Dave's - which I 'm not knocking as I've had great food there as well). I would go out of my way for TC Rib Crib so I'm glad I found a place closer to home. 

This place is a little hard to get to but so glad we found it. I got the three meat platter with spare two spare ribs, pulled pork, and the FATTY part of the brisket with sides of cheesy mac and yams. The ribs were meaty and tender. Nice char on the meat, great smoky flavor! The pulled pork was tender as well. Great pork flavor. The fatty part of the brisket was killer! Nice burnt fat pieces with succulent strips of beefy goodness. They also threw in regular pieces of brisket which I didn't care for but took it home anyway. I don't care who makes it, I've never cared for brisket as I've always thought  it's a dry piece of meat. It was great cold the next day. The mac n cheese was creamy  enough, but even the extra cheese on top didn't make it "cheesy" enough. The yams were excellent. Lots of brown sugar cinammony goodness! The portions are large and come with a piece of Texas toast under the meats so it soaked up all the pork juices and was an extra added treat! My friend enjoyed his chicken and spare rib plate with jalapeno cole slaw and fried okra. There BBQ sauce is very good! Not too sweet, peppery and flavorul!    

I take away a star because of the brisket and mac n cheese. I would have to try other things before upgrading to a 5. Great, friendly service and good food! I will be back!

Thank you to all the Yelpers who gave this place a good review! 
We went on the weekend and it was Great! Great food, great specials and most importantly Greatfriendly customer service! We are most def coming back here the next time we are in Vegas!!!

At a mere mile away from our hotel, Rollin' Smoke made perfect sense. It also had the highest ratings of any Vegas barbecue joint I researched, which was just icing on the cake. 

In true Las Vegas fashion, Rollin' Smoke offers an all-you-can-eat meal option which encompasses their entire menu! Tempted as I was, my stomach didn't feel quite up to the challenge (partially due to the prior night's "festivities"). I set my sights a little lower and ordered their Pit Special: brisket, pulled pork, burnt ends (instead of the advertised quarter-chicken), spare ribs, and hot links with bacon potato salad, cheesy mac n cheese, and kick'n bbq beans on the side.

The potato salad was, in a word, magnificent. Bacon and green onions give this side a great crunchy texture that brilliantly compliments the creamy mayo base. The beans were nice and sweet, with a great spicy kick on the black end. They certainly weren't lacking for black pepper, that's for sure. Large-size pasta noodles allowed the gooey cheese to get embedded in each nook and cranny of the macaroni. The extra layer of cheddar on top was just what it needed, too, adding another degree of cheesiness.

Rollin' Smoke's brisket comes chopped unless otherwise requested. Chopped or not, there was a ton of bark to go around. I also found a great smoke level in each bite of the incredibly tender brisket. There was just a hint of sauce drizzled on top, which allowed me to taste both it and the delicious meat at the same time.

The rosy smoke-kissed pulled pork looked exceptionally inviting. Upon closer inspection, it came with a smokiness that mirrored its appearance. The meat was also really juicy, with very flavorful chunks of bark throughout. As a Texan it pains me to say this, but I think that I enjoyed their pork more than the brisket.

The hotlinks were damn good. They had a great snap to the casing, with a char that added to the crispness as well. The heat of these links catches you a little off guard. It also masks any potential smokiness, but that's to be expected.

Burnt ends aren't something that I get to enjoy all too often, so I was happy to find them on Rollin' Smoke's menu today. These were worth every bit of the $3.00 upcharge, and then some. Melt-in-your-mouth tender doesn't quite do them justice as a descriptor, but it's the best that I can muster. There was a great smoky flavor, coupled with a somewhat spicy glaze.

The ribs were cooked perfectly, with only a slight tug needed on each bite. Rollin' Smoke managed to produce tender and juicy ribs without cooking them into "falling off the bone" oblivion. The crust had a great blend of spices that combined both heat and sweet. Each bite of rib meat also contained a good smoke level that kept bringing me back for more.

In a town known for celebrity chefs and Michelin-star restaurants, Rollin' Smoke offers a blue-collar alternative so indulgent that you'll forget all about the glitz and glamour of the Strip.

Beef short ribs. Yea buddy. Not super flavorful but a very nice cut of meat. The quality of meat + reasonable portions + affordable = can not go wrong. Be prepared to have a hard time finding a place to sit if you go for lunch.

It was a nice spot to stop by for a little fill me up for the road. I would most likely come back. Maybe try something else, but the pulled pork sandwich was good. For MY personal likings tho, i do love a drenched pulled pork. So the sauces on the side helped a lot. It is a bit pricey, but worth it!
Oh and I'm a HUGE fan of Mac N Cheese, and this one hmmmmm hit the spot!
Yummiest BBB ever !! My new favorite. Great food great customer service! Love love love

Believe the hype. I tried Rollin smoke on 8/5/14 and it was phenomenal. The meats are fresh and juicy, especially the pulled pork, but my favorite are the sides! The corn nuggets and bacon potato salad are to die for. The yams and kickin beans are also great. The staff is friendly and accommodating. Yelp said they closed at 8:00 but they were still accepting guests at 8:30 despite the open sign being turned off. They do not turn away their guests which I thought was interesting. I can't wait to go back!!
Simply delicious, the ribs were super tender and the brisket was out of this world. Friendly staff, and the food was out in no time.
Best BBQ I've had since leaving Texas. The brisket here is solid - which is more than I can say for every other place I've been recently. Made my night!

WARNING! Don't come here in clothes that are dry-clean only unless you want to make an extra stop!

This place is one of Vegas's hidden gems. Located under an overpass on the backside (i.e. More seedy section) of the strip in an industrial area, only the locals know where to find it. You can smell the hickory smoke before you even park the car.

The place is small, and consists of some wooden picnic tables for dining, and a front counter with register. There is only one menu, on the wall behind the counter, so make sure to know what you want before you get to the front. 

I personally suggest the brisket three ways and the chicken sliders (served on sweet Hawaiian rolls to boot). You will not be disappointed in the quality of meat, customer service, or level of smoke infused into your meal. The Arkansauce is pretty darn good too, although the meat doesn't necessarily need it. This place is awesome!

The only down side is you come out smelling like you work in a smoked meat factory, which makes for interesting conversation (including stares and people asking to smell your clothing) when you get back to the office after lunch!

Right off the bat, they answered the phone really friendly and super pleasant. It felt like talking to your favorite family friend. I had lots of questions about portion sizes and sides. I was advised to try the potato salad, Because their mama made it. (Heard in the background say yup) haha. 
Main course : I ordered the baby back and beef ribs, both were off the chart. Meat fell off the bone, and it was cooked with just the right amount of seasonings. Potato salad was indeed really good. 

I did not eat inside but the atmosphere was lively and super chill and diverse. Everybody's head was down looking at their plate. 

Overall, I knew I was in the mood for bbq but with the great customer service on the phone, friendly environment inside, & kick ass food, I'm definitely coming back for more. 

Ps the house sauce and vinaigrette was my favorite.

There are no words!!! Thank you  Rollin Smoke For the welcome !! 
The food is A M A Z I N G Thanks Dave!! ... For our delicious desserts!!!

I am a huge fan of BBQ. Real BBQ, not the garbage you get from chain restaurants.

When my wife asked co workers who have been long time Vegas residents where to get the good BBQ, this was the place frequently mentioned.

Recently we tried this place out, and my brother and nephew went as well.  Everyone was very full and very satisfied when we left.

To find this place is by word of mouth, or you'll have to google it, because it sits a bit behind the Vegas strip in a more industrial area and chances are you would not happen upon it by mistake.

As soon as you drive up, you get that smell. That smoked BBQ smell that makes your mouth instantly water.  

The prices are a little up, but worth it for the food that you get. I personally ordered the three meat plate, which I chose to be the ribs, the pulled pork and the sausage.  My wife got the burnt ends for her meat.  All of it was crazy good.  Large portions, juicy meat and just totally full of flavor.  Be warned that while their food is not crazy spicy hot, there is a little kick to it.  The only thing I didn't find worth it was the side orders, I paid like four bucks for a side of coleslaw that was not life changing. 

My nephew for the Outlaw Burger, which I'll load a picture off. This thing is every bit as big as it looks in the picture, and the hardest time he had was trying to figure out how to eat it.  He said he loved every bite of it, and has talked about coming back to Vegas from Cali to have another one.  

Overall this is some of the best BBQ I've ever had and I liked the squeeze bottles of lots of different flavors of sauces they have all over. If you're in town, you gotta check this place out.
It was good really good you have to get sauces for the ribs and service is good but you gotta get here early

Great Atmosphere!
Very BBQ place-ask. Usual wooden bleacher seat, communal seating (first come first serve, find your own seat! clean after yourself)
A gentleman behind the host podium took orders was very courteous and took care of us well.
Meat were so tender and juicy.
Loved potato salad and waffle chips.
House BBQ sauce went well with meat.
Will be going back!
Would be really great for football game day party trays! Yay!!!

Sooooo good!  Our group went for lunch and you know it's gotta be good when there is a line-up out the door and into the parking lot.  Despite the crowd we ordered and were served within about 20 minutes.  Between us we tried the brisket, pulled pork and chicken.  Consensus was the brisket was the best but all were thoroughly enjoyed.  The atmosphere was pretty basics so don't dress up and expect to leave smelling a little"smokie"..... Very good and great price, you won't be disappointed.
Great AUTHENTIC BBQ. Reminds us of what we would get while living in La. We look forward to coming back to this place!
Tasty BBQ and sides, reasonable prices. seems like honest home cookin'. Would like a little more heat, but won't dock them for it.

Who said great BBQ doesn't exist beyond Texas. They lied. Walk right in and be prepared to be greeted with all things Arkansas. You can't miss the enormous menu and its gargantuan display. 

The menu is part reflection of what they do. I ordered the Rib platter. It comes with three different types of ribs. For $18 this meal is a great value if you want to try them all. Small price to pay for a GLORIOUS meal with big size and taste where the meat falls off the bones (beef). 

The sides I ordered were Mac N Cheese with an extra helping of Corn nuggets for another $2.50. The sides are glorious too. By far the best corn nuggets I had to date. I also received the banana pudding just by checking in thru Yelp, a $4 dessert for free. Just GLORIOUS.

Thanks Yelp and Yelpers for making this place possible to find.

Lastly, this place was featured on an episode of Guy Fieri's "Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives. Enjoy!

Came back again recently. I had to give them credit where credit is due and up my rating from 4 to 5 stars. Some pretty darn good BBQ, great sides, and awesome sweet tea. I will definitely be back whenever I'm in town. Can't go wrong, $11 for 2 meat, 1 side, & drink.

Amazing BBQ, I had the BBQ chicken wrap. It was very good, but that alone wouldn't get me back. Its all about the greens! Best collard greens I've ever had. Place is small, but part of the charm. Definitely worth the visit!

This place is unbelievable. It is not in the best area but the food is always on point. You never don't get a good meal here. My pork was fantastic the bread and meet were perfect. I would suggest to anyone and the service is great. They also just won the national champ for bbq. This place will fill your crave.

Had visitors down on the strip so we went here for somewhere close.  And wow was I surprised.  The brisket was amazing.  The chicken and ribs where Ok.  When I go back,  because it's worth driving down to the strip just for this, I'll just get the brisket.  It didn't have much seating but the food is worth it, I'll eat in the car.

Met Big Mike who gave great recommendations for our groups food! You must the beef rib and brisket burger. The beans and fried okra  for a side were on point and you can't go wrong with any of the food here.  Bring everyone and the price won't kill ya!  A must have in Vegas.

This is a hidden gem.. We were right up the street and the reviews were good. At first it's in a very industrial area so we weren't sure but the food was amazing. Their baked beans had a sweetness to them. Our son even finished his whole meal whereas normally he'd barely touch it. Definitely one of the best bbq places we have ever been to.
Awesome. Looks like a dump from the outside but the inside reminds me of many of bbq places in North Carolina. The pulled pork is perfect. The brisket was delicious. We are fans! Gotta try it.

Busy BBQ joint in a small area not to far from the strip.  The BBQ wasn't awlful but it wasn't out of this world either.  Let's say it's not a place I would wait an hour in line for, and we know we've all done that for some really good BBQ.  Anyway, decided on the rib special for $24.99 which came with 2 St. Louis ribs, 3 babybacks and I beef rib plus one side which we got waffle fries. We also added another beef rib for $6.  And for all those who really like BBQ, they also have AYCE anyday, anytime for $34.99.  

The highlight of the dish was the beef rib.  The meat was fall off the bone super tender.  It tasted like what I expected from a beef rib, but it was lacking a rub or a bbq sauce that would have blown me away.  It was still good though just not great. The St. Louis ribs and babybacks were mediocre and but still tasty.  But based on just what we ordered I would have to say, I have definitely tried better BBQ but the place is worth giving a try.  The menu is huge, so even if your not craving BBQ, you can order other stuff like meatloaf or fried chicken.

THE BEST BBQ I've had yet in Vegas, and I am a BBQ SNOB!  I'd say go straight for the golden goose and get the beef rib.  It may seem pricey, it may seem like the quantity of beef ribs seem nominal, but these beasts are  HUGE, and you taste the love put into making them, I guarantee you!
  Another complaint I have with most BBQ places is that they've just defaulted to doing a BBQ sauce so ridiculously sweet, you might as well just drown your ribs in maple syrup like it's a pancake.  But Rollin' Smoke specializes in my favorite--the vinegar-based savory sauce, which just launches this most tender of beef ribs into orbit on your tastebuds!

The restaurant is located close to the Vegas strip but not in it.  So parking is easy and don't need to park in a structure.

There were quite a bit of people during lunch so we had to wait in line.  The outlaw burger is awesome and delicious.  The spare ribs were alright, and the brisket was a bit dry.  The portions are pretty big so come hungry.

I would come back next time I'm in Vegas.

As with anyone who has been to Vegas a few times, you grow sick of the options on the strip, so one of my goals was to find a few places off the beaten path for us to try this next time around. 

BBQ is really the reason I started yelping and everywhere I go, I usually seek out a BBQ place to try, so when I saw all the positive reviews of Rollin' Smoke, naturally I was a bit excited. 

After our first long night in Vegas, we decided to skip breakfast and hit up Rollin' Smoke for an early lunch. Our cabby didn't know where it was, but it was a fairly quick ride from the strip.

Walking in, you are greeted with a glorious, thick, smoky smell that always accompanies good BBQ. As with all my BBQ reviews, I usually seek out a way to try out most of the meats, so we ordered the three Pit Specials (3 meats, 2 sides) and one order of the Beef Ribs. We quickly realized we ordered too much food for the four of us, but it was no matter, it was all delicious. The meats:

The Pulled Pork - The pulled pork was flavorful and moist, with a moderate smoky flavor. If you like pulled pork, you won't be disappointed by this. 

The Hot Link Sausage - Despite how good the other meats were, the Hot Link made a good run to be one of my favorites. This isn't like most hot links you see which are red in color, both on the sausage meat and on the casing, with that annoying spicy flavor that seems to linger forever. These had a reddish-brown casing and a very delicious and unique flavor too them, with a nice spiciness as well. Definitely recommend. 

The Ribs - The baby backs were delicious. Moist, tender, fall off-the-bone good. They seasoning added some nice flavor as did the moderate-to-strong smokiness. Another awesome dish.

The Brisket - The brisket we were served was from the lean side and had a nice smoke ring to it and despite being from the lean side, was not dry at all. Very solid brisket and only due to the greatness of the other dishes was this our least favorite. 

The Beef Rib - Holy crap, the other reviewers were not wrong. This thing is amazing. It should be called The Flinstone or Brontosaurus Rib. It is massive. It has an amazing bark, strong smokiness, and tons of meat. It wasn't too gristly either, like many beef ribs tend to be. You get two ribs for 15 bucks and you think that is steep until you receive them. That will be more than enough to fill you up. A must order here. 

The Sauce - I think good BBQ can be graded as to whether it needs sauce, and the BBQ here stands on its own. However, the sauce was pretty good if you like sauce. The rust-colored sauce starts out sweet and ends tangy and is fairly runny too. It is great for dipping and doesn't overpower the  meat. 

So the 4.5 star rating for Rollin' Smoke is spot on and consider this to be a 4.5 star review to match as well. This Arkansas-style BBQ just made it on my mandatory to-do list in Vegas for each trip. If you like BBQ, don't pass this place up.

Had the 1/2 rack baby backs. Great flavor and tender meat. There BBQ sauce is a winner. The yams has candied pecans as a topping. Nice touch. This place doesn't have the best location but who cares when the food is this GOOD!

Phenomenal!  This is hands down the best barbeque in Las Vegas.  The real deal!

We ordered, didn't have to wait for very long, and really enjoyed our meal. I had pulled pork and brisket duo, and it did not disappoint.  Sauce on the table went to good use.  My husband had an all you can eat with ribs that fell right off the bone.  He also tried shrimp and rib tips, which he said were terrific.  Hushpuppies were seasoned to perfection and the sides were all delish!!

Definitely adding this to our list of regular stops!  And check in for a dessert, the banana pudding was awesome.
Delicious! First place we ate in Las vegas!! Wish I lived closer so I could eat here more often! I had the club wrap. Yummy!!

Friendly service but like a review I read before going said, if you like Austin, TX or Memphis bbq you will be disappointed. Good meal but wouldn't recommend to friends. Sorry, love local businesses but I was underwhelmed.
Best damn BBQ in Las Vegas, talk about falling off the bone!! The beef rib best I have ever had

Best barbecue in Vegas! My family got the ribs, meatloaf, brisket and hot links... All were amazing! They do run out of items FYI. 

Previously got the corn nuggets and they are also delicious.

Service is nice and fast.

Oh my god this place is amazing. It reminds me of the Deep South. The service is good, and the food is amazing. Go in for lunch and they have great specials. Rarely do good places pop up in this area but this place is a gem.

Phenomenal BBQ!!! Saw this place on an episode of food paradise, and had it bookmarked for the last 6 months. I was worried that after seeing this spot on TV and reading all the great reviews that maybe I had set the bar to high. Turns out Rollin smoke BBQ is the bar! Being somewhat of a BBQ connoisseur I can't say enough good things about this place. Brisket was moist smokey and tender, pulled pork was juicy nice and smokey, and the beef ribs fell off the bone! As for my side I had the potato salad which is very much like a loaded bake potato salad with cheese, chives, and bacon. Service from cashier and mgr was also very friendly and efficient. Everytime I come to Vegas I will be stopping in. Keep it up rolling smoke, you guys are awesome!

I guess I might not be the best person to rate BBQ as I'm really not a big fan of it, but I was disappointed with my dish. I ordered the biggin dad's favorite and I felt big chunks of fat in most of my bites. In addition, I felt that the BBQ was lacking some flavor. 
This is a very laid back place, they do not have waitress service. You come in, place your order, pick a table and someone will deliver your food within 8 minutes. 
This establishment is well known for their outlaw burger which has been featured on the travel channel... Let me tell you, this burger is huuge! I did not get to try it but if think you can handle it, you should definitely get it!

This is my favorite BBQ place in Las Vegas. The pulled pork and ribs are my favorite and the corn nuggets are a must! They're like a side and a dessert all in one. The sweet tea is always spot-on as well. It's usually a pretty steady crowd during lunchtime on weekdays. I've never been there for dinner or on weekends. Everyone I've ever gone here with also loves it.

I cannot wait to go back! The food was awesome! I had the brisket and chicken which had great Smokey flavor and wasn't smothered in sauce.  The prices are reasonable and there are a lot menu items to choose from.  My roommate got the burger and enjoyed it.

Hole in the wall kind of place but nice and full of picnic tables. Incredible BBQ and BBQ sauce. Everything was excellent. Probably the top five BBQ I've had. 
Friendly staff. No Alcohol sold there. Did I mention the food was great? This is a definite place I would use if needing to use for catering.
Mmmmmgood smoking beef ribs on the 4th of July. Sauces like mama sweet, Arkansas,spicy ,sweet potatoes, Mac greens  so.... Much to handle. Tasty, delicious . I'm ready lets eat.

I liked this place overall. Hole in the wall but good. The ribs were so so so good. Barbq sauce was good. Mac n chez was my favorite almost taste like powdered cheese. Peach cobbler was OK. Cole slaw and fries were good

My office had Chef Tim come out and cater today and my, oh, my, was it delicious!  I had the potato salad, bacon beans, and ribs with chicken (clearly it's cheat day). 

The meat was tender, flavored, and gone in 60 seconds.  Your happy ending is the corn bread which you just have to try to understand.  If you're looking for a BBQ caterer I would definitely check them out!  I just noticed they have a store front as well, which is dangerous since I love me some BBQ! :)
The food was terrific and the sauce was amazing, wait I can't forget about the corn bread, Chef Time held it down.

This is the best bbq spot in vegas IMO. I've been to a few places here and it's always been meh. This spot however, DELICIOUS. When we have guests from out of town come to visit, we always bring them here for the brisket burger (which is always massive and freakin yummy), combo plate (they have to sample the other things too!), and the banana pudding! They've won me over. I have not one single complaint about this place. Hopefully they keep up all the good food and service. : )
Beef brisket is insane, the best. I send guest here all the time from both hotels I work at and half the time get a free meal from my guest bringing it back to me.

This place is absolutely ridiculous(in a good way). I had the rib plate(beef, baby back, St. Louis) and my buddy ordered chicken and brisket. We also tried a couple sides, and everything was unreal. One of the best bbq joints I've ever been to, definitely go check it out!

Literally the BEST BBQ in LasVegas..... Great atmosphere & Oversll excellent customer Service as long ass the girl with All the Tattos and Huge Holes in her ears isn't taking orders.... Several issues with her every time I go in there.... But! Hands Down! Best tasting BBQ in LasVegas Ive had everything on the menu besides the pork & the Sides are extremely good BIG BEEF RIBS tender as can be. All Meat is Smoked meat freshly never a bad day consistent great BBQ I been going here since they first opened and witnessed them grow. If you want NON commercial BBQ ....... Well ROLLIN SMOKE IS THE ONLY OPTION IN TOWN!

Best BBQ in Vegas. All of the choices are very good. My favorites are the ribs and brisket. I also love the location. I hope they put more tables outside when it warms up. I gave 4 stars because the sides are much too small. I would rather them up-charge and give you a lot more. You think large when you think BBQ.
good stuff!!!! ribs are tasty .. kinda pricey but worth it..... Keep your cup for free refill next time.

This is a new out of the way bbq restaurant that recently opened on Highland Dr.  I know that Highland is an industrial and seedy area west of the strip, but these guys are turning out some good bbq and making the most of what they have.  I recently tried the Biggin sandwich (brisket, pulled pork and sausage) and it was very tasty.  The sandwich was loaded with meat, literally falling off the bun, all of the meats were tender and had a good smoke flavor.  Along with my sandwich was a side of bacon potatoe salad, which was good.  The potatoe salad had good flavor and bacon in just about every bite.  Total for my sandwich, salad and drink ran me $11, which I think is a good value for quality food.
This is a spicier bbq than most people are used to, but it works.  It reminds me more of a kicked up Kansas City style bbq.  I stuck with the original sauce, which was plenty hot and did not try the spicy or the extra spicy.

All in all this place is making some pretty good bbq, which is much needed in Las Vegas.  The biggest draw back is that they are located on Highland next to Diamond Cabaret and they are only open until 6pm.  I would like to see this place do well, hence my review, but their limited hours and location create much doubt.
Good Luck!
I've been here several times and tried most of the menu. . Excellent every single time.  Highly recommended! !

I am a simple man, and when i am in search of good bbq, i only ask for one thing...flavor.

From the chicken, to the ribs, to the brisket, to a majority of the sides...this place has got it. Just moved out to vegas and this place will be my go-to from now on.

A friend had some Rolling Smoke BBQ catered for a party so I got a chance to try it there, but I finally made my way over to see the place in person.  It was even better in person.  I got a two meat plate with two ribs and sausage.  The ribs were smokey and flavorful.  The sauce complimented them well.  The meat was nice and tender too.  The sausage was smokey and delicious as well.  My friend got a pulled pork sandwich and loved it.  We each got the mac and cheese side.  The mac and cheese is a good enough side to have as a main course.  I also got the corn poppers, which are a must try.  They're delicious and addictive.  The staff was really friendly to me and everyone else I saw in there.  We ate inside, but the outdoor tables looked like a good spot to hang out as well.  The place isn't super fancy, but who wants a super fancy BBQ spot anyway?  When I think of BBQ, I want real good food in a good environment.  This place delivers both.  I will definitely be back next time I'm in town.

This is my second time here and the food is just as good as the first time. Had the rib combo this time and the ribs were delicious. The beef rib was as big as a small roast and tasty. I thought the St Louis ribs were my fav, great flavor and texture. 
Note: the sauces are very good. A word of warning though, they keep the "damn hot" sauce behind the counter, use with caution, it Damn hot!  
This is one of my favorite BBQ joints. I recommend it.

I stopped here on my way home from work, after several coworkers RECOMMENDED I TRY IT.. I got the sandwich platter. You get 2 lbs of meat either one meat or two. I ordered the brisket and the pulled pork. Meal also comes with 2 sides and enough rolls for 4 sandwiches. We ordered the kickin beans and the Mac-n-Cheese. The brisket was not what I expected it was chopped very fine which is good I guess for sandwiches. ( I hope it is not that way in a meal). Pulled pork was excellent and the sauce was good with just right amount of spice. The Beans were a bit too peppery for my tastes but some may enjoy it. Mac-n-Cheese was marginal but not crazy good also heavy use of pepper. Great filling meal, great taste overall. Will go back to try more menu items.

We decided to check this place out after reading all of the super-awesome reviews. 

The seedy neighborhood was easily overlooked when the smokey sweet smell of southern BBQ hit me. The line was out the door but no one seemed to mind the wait. The guy who took our order was a pro and very patient with our indecision and questions. Both the indoor and outdoor dining areas were clean.

The food didn't  quite match up to the expectations, sadly. The burger was pretty dry and the peach cobbler was pretty sad. The brisket was above average, but you could tell that the ribs had been sitting for a while. 

Five stars for the service! Our server was attentive, helpful, and very friendly! 

We're going to try again when they aren't so busy. Hopefully we just caught them on a bad night.

The food is good here but I have had better BBQ. I think the star of the show is their dessert. I loved the banana pudding. Ultimately I thought the place was overpriced and seemed very commercialized. They also glorify their standing on Yelp, I am glad I tried it, but next time I am in Vegas I will be on the hunt for another BBQ joint. 

Not to mention it's pretty cheesy how the workers ask you to give them a 5 star review on yelp, and even go as far as giving you a post it note with all their names on it. Come on now.
This place is amazing! I can't get enough! Everyone is super nice, and the food is phenomenal!

Wasn't all that great to me. Place was really busy. Friendly folks. 
Flavor was just meh. Nothing to bring me back another time.

Best BBQ I've had in Vegas!  The bam bam size beef rib was fall off the bone tender, so tender the lady at the next table was trying to put her beef rib in her to go box and the meat from the rib slipped off the bone into her lap :). The spare ribs and baby back ribs were good, but unfortunately after eating the beef rib first, it just didn't compare.  The BBQ sauce here is the perfect mix of sweet, tangy, and spicy.  And the list of sides makes it hard to decide...unfortunately they were out of fried okra so instead I had a side of corn nuggets, and these things are magical, imagine deep fried cream of corn.  The customer service is great as well, they come around and check on you a few times to make sure you are enjoying the experience.  As I'm writing this review, I'm already planning my next order....perhaps beef rib with beef brisket and I'm determined to have some fried okra next time!
Spudtastic baked potato with brisket is always a winner for me. Get there before noon or after 1:00pm or you'll be waiting in line with the other hungry hogs. Great BBQ!!

Fantastic barbecue, food is awesome. Parking is lacking and I often am forced to go somewhere else because I don't want to hassle with the parking. That clearly doesn't deter other people because they are always packed!
Super good! Cute spot, no frills. The ribs were delish! Ordered the Mac n cheese, fried okra and hush puppies. All really good!
