We nearly missed this place after driving past it a few times (it's a bit hidden in a somewhat shady area of town) but other than that, they've got very good food! Seating is indeed a little cramped but the portion size and taste of the food definitely makes up for it :)
This is the BEST BBQ place in Vegas by far. Outstanding service and Team Smoke makes you feel at home! Must visit!!

This place is amazing showed up and they just had closed and they still made us fresh food and were so nice the place is clean and smells
So good Dave was funny and nice and the food is to die for I'm so happy we found this hidden gem thanks everyone for being amazing

Visiting Las Vegas.  As a true yelper.  I got on to search for my daily craving.  Barbecue it was.  My friends who live here tagged along with me of course.  

The chopped brisket is to die for.  So moist, tender and flavorful.  Amazing mac and cheese. The corn nuggets were good.  My two friends loved their meal.  One not liking their potato salad with bacon.  I sampled it and wasn't a fan either.  

Sweeeeeet Tea was on point.  Didn't need to add sugar. 

My friends that live here have now found their barbecue spot.  THANKS TO ME!  Wink 

It's a cute and cozy spot hidden in a somewhat shopping center.  All of the staff were very welcoming and polite always engaging in a friendly convo. 

I will visit in my future Vegas trips. 

STAY YUMMY!  I'll be back.

Very good food. Friendly service and was very quick.

Highly recommend the pulled pork and waffle fries.

Talk about a hole in the wall foodie's secret! Neither the bellhop at the hotel nor the taxi driver had  heard of this place and we had to pull out our smart phones to map the way there. Located in a semi-industrial area that's just 10 minutes away from the strip, it took a bit of convoluted driving to actually get there. It's not a fancy place, simple benches, plastic utensils, noisy, with an order counter and serve your own drinks, but oh man... the food... the food! (They also have sweetened tea - have to have that in a Southern BBQ place, right? Right??)

This place was suggested by a couple of local friends when I was visiting and we met up for dinner. We got what I think was the "Pit special" which was the variety platter, 5 meats and 3 sides - Pulled pork,1/4  chicken, hot links, ribs and brisket - an extra order of the corn nuggets - think of tater tots made with kernels of corn and corn meal, green beans and coleslaw. The slaw was good but we had to dole out the corn nuggets to be fair or any one of us would have hogged them all.

Best Southern BBQ I've had in a long, long while - so good I did not try any of the other sauces - they make several - on the meat. They did not drown everything in sauce either, but encouraged you to try the various sauces. Crisp, well seasoned chicken skin, saucy (but not too saucy) pulled pork, ribs with just the right amount of char, tender brisket, spicy links... it was all good.

Then it was time for dessert and the chef was walking around talking to customers and we asked about dessert, with a friend asking if "Mama's Banana Puddin" was made of real custard. Hoo boy, you'd think we just insulted his Momma. "You think I would use box vanilla pudding? Man, you gotta stand there and stir that custard by hand or it ain't good! That's the only way you can make Banana puddin!"

We settled on the banana pudding and the blackberry cobbler and shared - because we were so full from dinner (and we had left overs to take home) - we scraped those bowls clean! Talk about greed... I was tempted to get another! The Banana custard was smooth and tasty, the consistency of the custard just perfect - none of that grainy fake pudding mix in that!. The cobbler topping was not overly sweetened which let the blackberry taste shine through.

Altogether, a wonderful gustatory experience - and the cost for this wonderful experience? Oh... about $12 each.

BBQ and sauces are good!  Their front cashier person seems very knowledgeable about the menu and offered suggestions.  I drove from the other side of town to get here and it was worth the drive. Definitely coming back again to try out their larger than life burger.

Tried this spot yesterday and would go back.we spilt the brisket sandwich with a side Mac. Mac was a bit bland and very cheesy would be amazing with Serrano chilies! The brisket was delicious! It had these pepper run that was so good. Cost for sandwich combo was $16.99 and good enough to split. The person working there said the meatloaf was a amazing!
Holy Rollin Smoke!!! What a BBQ! Yes sir, tastes like home cookin down south! Very casual atmosphere, very friendly staff, too. We'll be back!

I've been hearing so much about this place, so when I was craving bbq I wanted to try it. Great menu, great prices, and friendly staff. The meat was seasoned well and tender. I ordered ribs and hot link and my boyfriend ordered brisket, chicken, and hot link. For side dishes we ordered mac and cheese, greens, and loaded mash potatoes. The loaded mash was really good, the greens and mac were mediocre... kind of generic tasting. I will go back though, and try new sides. The spudtastic looks delicious :)

Delicious.  Went here after reading the reviews and since I am always on the lookout for good bbq in vegas.  Now, some people might say there is better bbq in KC or Texas, etc.  Well, I am rating it based on the fact that it is objectively very good, and definitely the best I have had in Las Vegas.  I got the "biggun'" sandwich, which had pulled pork, brisket and hot link.  The hot link was delicious and did not have the overly greasy and oily nature of a standard hotlink, which are often like kielbasas.  The meat was very good as was the sauce.  I had a couple pieces of brisket that were a little overcooked, but overall it was excellent.  I also had some of their st Louis ribs, which were tasty.  Flavorful, tender and fall off the bone, although a little fatty...but that is what you generally get with st Louis ribs.  Fried okra and greens were very good as well, and they had a ton of other sides.  Unfortunately they were out of the cobbler and pudding, so I did not get to try those despite all the claims of excellence. Now, they location and décor are not exactly phenomenal, but I suppose it is what they could afford starting out.  It is close to the strip also which is good if you are in that area.  Overall, super friendly and very delicious, but definitely expensive for BBQ.  Best bbq I have had in vegas though.

The BEST BBQ I have had in a very long time!! I don't think I'll buy BBQ from anywhere else going forward! The beef ribs are AMAZING! Juicy, tender, and smokey mmmmmm so good! And locals get 10% off.. Boom!

I've tried all types of BBQ from Texas to Colorado and I gotta say Rollin Smokes does it right. Their portions are definitely not small so come prepared to open the top button on your pants. We had a party of 5, and we had 6 slabs of ribs (huge portions), Mac & cheese, and hot links. I'll definitely will be back when I'm in vegas again.

Whether you're starving after lap dances at Spearmint Rhino right down the street or just finished smokin some good weed, this is the place to be for some excellent southern BBQ. 

Not the best location in the world (looked dangerous at night), but I will drive anywhere for good food. 

My wife and I pigged out on the pork ribs and meatloaf with sides of the corn cheese nuggets, dirty rice, and mac and cheese. The pork ribs were really soft and tender, but it was their spicy bbq sauce that was the icing on the cake. I'm gonna have to get a bottle of that sauce to take home the next time that I'm there. The meatloaf had a lot different flavors going on, and the smokiness was a bit overpowering. Still good nonetheless. The corn cheese nuggets were bomb! Crispy on the outside and soft and cheesy on the inside. 

They also have an AYCE option for $34.99. If you have the munchies and you're looking to feast, that option will be worth it for you. 

Will definitely be back to try some of their other meats!

Love this place it's in a secluded little area under bridges and near wharehouses- feels miles away from the the Vegas trip but it's just around the corner.  You walk in and theres 1 menu on the wall  1 on the counter 2 rooms of seating and a few large tables outside.  The Menu options are plenty and the prices very reasonable I loved the brisket and their hushpuppies they were packed full of flavor and the service was very friendly!  I was lucky to go when it wasn't to busy but I hear this place gets packed during the lunch hour.  must be a local favorite and that's my kind of spot!  Get away from all those long lines at the buffet and try something good here not those mass produced buffet foods.

I'm not from Nevada. Me & my bf came to Las Vegas for a darts tournament. We love bbq. So I was looking on yelp to see the best bbq. Then this place came up. I love all of the great reviews people was giving this place. So we decided to go. This is after our 1st dart tournament that took so long to get started. 

When we got there a nice small place. We enter inside got in line to place our order looking at the menu a lot of good stuff. The loaded baked potato looked really good. Me & my bf decided to get the pit plate. It comes with spare ribs, brisket, pulled pork,  half chicken plus 3 sides. Which we got mac & cheese, corn bread, & bacon potato.

It didn't take long for our order it came out the minute we sat down. I got the chicken it was very tend & moist I love the skin of the chicken then the ribs was good too. But the best of the best of everything was their mac & cheese. It was so damn cheesy & creamy. I loved it so much. Plus the corn bread was super moist & soft.

I couldn't finish all of my food it was so much left. So we box it all & took it back to our room to have for our next day dart tournament. Overall this is a great place to have some bbq. A mus to place to go.

A rare 5 star review (check my rating distribution). For me to give 5 stars, the place has to be so good that I cannot wait to come back........my first visit, and I'm a.ready planning the next trip! I got the sliced brisket and pulled pork......both were so flavorful that they didn't really need any sauce, but I used just a slight splatter. The brisket had a beautiful smoke ring, and the pork was perfectly tender. The loaded mash was really good as well.....tons of great favors. My wife doesn't like meat, so she got the catfish po boy, and loved it. Then she tried some of my pulled pork, and loved it even more! She now wants to come back and get the pork! Thank you Rollin Smoke, you have brought my wife over to the dark side, and we can now enjoy BBQ together! One last thing, everyone there is super friendly, and even the pit master came out to see how we were enjoying our food. It is evident to me that everyone there really takes pride in serving a superior product! I'll be back, even though it is in a "medium scary" neighborhood!

Best American bbq in Vegas especially for the price you pay. The service is very pleasant and the decor is appropriate. I came here for my fiancés birthday and everyone thought the food was delicious. I can't give it 5 stars because the brisket was not as tender as I had hoped it would be.

Pretty darn good bbq for vegas. I didn't have high hopes at all but their burnt ends and brisket were pretty close to what I ate in Texas. I wish Rolling Smoke was closer to me because I would definitley go there more often!

The BBQ is really delicious here. When we got here two days ago the line only had a couple people in it around 5. By the time we got our food is was almost out the door. The wait isn't bad at all. It's a order, sit and then they will call your name and bring it to you kinda place. 

I'd say try the Mac and cheese, greens and yams bc that's what I had for sides. Cornbread is also yummy, not too sweet. Pull prom and chicken are my favorite meats. 

I'll be coming back here next year when I'm in town next year.

Everything here is delicious! I ordered the trio plate with sliced brisket, chicken, and pulled pork with bacon potato salad & cheezy Mac n cheese! So much food & such original flavored & taste. The best BBQ in Vegas!

This was my first real BBQ experience and I couldn't have asked for anything more! David the owner was so welcoming and helped my boyfriend and I order. We got the half slab beef ribs, Mac n cheese, corn nuggets, and the trio slider combo (2 brisket, 1 chicken) all for under $30! Everything was delicious and juicy. David even came over to check on us at the end of our meal which was greatly appreciated and added to the comfy, homey vibe of the restaurant. It's a little off the strip but definitely worth the drive. I'll be coming back next time I'm in Vegas without a doubt!

Yet another great BBQ place in Vegas In a "shady looking neighborhood in a very small strip mall in the "porn district". BUT worth the trip for sure. The pulled pork was amazing the ribs and other meats all look fantastic, cant afford to try them all, though I will eventually with every trip the Vegas. Inside and out were super clean, love the picnic tables outside wish it wasn't so cold when I was there.
The prices were a bit high but the food was amazing. 
You have made my list for Vegas must visits
Yep, I'm in love. Lived up to the hype. Soo tasty. I don't know how this place slipped under my radar for so long but the food is amazing.

Yelp needs a new star rating for this place. Recently opened an office down the street and stopped in to get some lunch. The place is simple. Large menu on the wall, order counter, self serve soda machine. But that's not what makes them great. I ordered a brisket sandwich. WOW. It was awesome. I have been back every week sense that first visit and have tried many different menu items. Each one has been great. If you like food, you have to eat here. Don't be to choosy, everything is worth trying.

Went here with my wife and 3 young boys.  We all loved it.  It's off the strip but only a short distance.  Well worth the trip if you normally can't get good BBQ.  Our family is used to California grilling/BBQ.  I had the meat trio with spare ribs, pulled pork and sliced brisket.  Ribs tasty, easy off the bone and juicy.  Pork was flavorful with good texture.  Brisket had good flavor but was tougher chew then expected.  Could leave the brisket on the Q another hour.  To be clear I would eat the brisket again and be happy.  

This was family friendly with a great crew who take pride in their product.  All sauces were great.  They had a strong vinegar taste.

Aren't expectations a bitch sometimes?

With over 700 reviews and a 4.5 star average, as well as numerous esteemed Yelpers referring to Rollin Smoke Barbecue as the "best bbq in town" I had fairly high expectations for my first visit. Sadly, I was not blown away.

Allison S., Dyanna L. and I met up at Rollin Smoke with our men for dinner on a recent Saturday evening. From the parking lot the place smelled amazing, so we quickly got in line to order. Rollin Smoke is a order-first-then-seat-yourself kind of establishment which I have no problem with. I do wish the tables were wiped down more regularly though, as the one we were at was rather dirty. 

Our food was ready very quickly. My husband and I both got the 2 meat plate; brisket and chicken for him, ribs and pork for me. Each came with a side (green salad for him, loaded mashed potatoes for me) as well as a 'roll' which is really just a slice of bread. 

For me, good bbq means good ribs, and ribs will always be what I judge BBQ on.  This is where Rollin Smoke fell flat. The ribs were tough, not the fall-off-the-bone that I expected (and read about in other reviews). The flavor was ok, certainly not amazing. The pork was better, my husband's brisket was good, and Allison let me try some of her hot link which was excellent. 

Perhaps it was just an off evening for Rollin Smoke? I will certainly go back and try the ribs again, but for the time being I can not give Rollin Smoke more than an A-OK rating.

NOTE: The price for All-You-Can-Eat has gone up to $34.99. Website is not updated as of 1/5/15.

Yum! I'm definitely not a BBQ fan, so I'm really glad they have other stuff too. I got the shrimp plate, which comes with hush puppies and a side (ordered the mac & cheese). BF got a 1/2lb of pulled pork and 8oz (smallest side size) of waffle fries. YUM YUM. Everything was really yummy. The pulled pork also comes with toast, too. Our table also ordered the nachos (no longer on the menu, but they still made it for us!) and those were HUGE. Tasty, but I was more than happy with just our own items!

Yummy food, excellent service. Great choice for an off the Strip meal.

My son is a sophomore at UNLV and suggested going to Rollin Smoke the next time we were in town and having read in the Las Vegas Review Journal they had been crowned the best BBQ in Vegas was enough to convince me to try it. I was not disappointed at all. I shared the five meat platter with my son. Chicken, smoked polish sausage, brisket, pork rib, pulled pork, and three sides for $27. The greens were beyond passable for being from the south.  I left full and it didn't dent my wallet like many places in Las Vegas can. The topper is the service though. David took my order and got each of our names and shook all of our hands.  Southern Soul Food and hospitality all wrapped into one. A must eat in Las Vegas just don't expect the neon and glitz. The food is the show.

Great atmosphere and great people working here. But unfortunately at least for me, the barbecue was NOT GOOD. It was extremely salty and over seasoned. The Mac and cheese was eh and the mashed potatoes were ok. I've eaten a lot of great bbq which is maybe why I'm so darn picky. But any experienced bbq'er would say the same thing. I will continue on my quest to find a great bbq spot in Vegas, cause this just "ain't it."
this place was defenately worth the off the strip ride.

Much better than the Pawn Stars version because you don't get robbed. They offer a good size portion for the money unlike Harrison's joint. My only qualm about the place was that it's a " good ole boy" establishment and I was getting side looks from a few customers because I'm as non " good ole boy" as you can get. Maybe that's what contributed to my heartburn afterwards? I really don't like being a " person of interest" while I'm eating.
wow finally great barbeque in Las VEgas....

Wow. Just wow.

On recommendations from both here and elsewhere, I decided to stop in tonight.

Ordered the 3 meat plate with chopped brisket, ribs, and chicken.

Service was friendly and fast, and the food came out in under 5 minutes.

Took one bite of the ribs - best I have EVER had. By far.

Chicken - further love.

Brisket - a *relative* meh. Not bad at all, but nowhere close to the ribs and chicken.

The side of fries were also just ok.

One more place I'll seek out each time I'm in Vegas.

My husband and I made a point of stopping here today while on vacation. It's only a few minutes from the strip (2 miles from the Monte Carlo) and is well worth the trip. We both went with the all-you-can-eat deal ($24.99, anything on the menu). I did two rounds: #1 - beef rib, BBQ nacho fries, baby back ribs, cheezy mac and cheese and bacon potato salad. The highlight was definitely the beef rib - juicy and meaty. Round #2 - smoked meatloaf and another baby back rib (no sides). My husband did three rounds - with the shrimp and hot links being his faves. This place is definitely worth getting off the strip for. You won't be sorry.

This is what I've been looking for a good BBQ place that when you walk in you can smell the smoke. You know there not joking here I had the pulled pork sand and yams. The sauce has a nice bite to it and the pork is cooked to perfection, to add they don't kill it with a big piece of bread for the sandwich it's just the right size. Nice and clean and the price is fair
Love the BBQ. The place looks a bit under the weather but the food is delicious!!

THE place for BBQ in Vegas. Check in on Yelp and get a free dessert. The people working here are super friendly and helpful. If you're not a local, do yourself a favor and leave the strip for this place!!

I don't normally go for American bbq, but when I do, this is the only place to be. When you're in Vegas, this is our gem. The meat that is served is ALWAYS tender, and well seasoned. The portions are generally big, and the prices are great for what you're getting. 

When I'm there I always get the Trio Choice of 3 Meats. I pick the 1/4 chicken, brisket and 2 spare ribs which is more than enough for me. This is always shared with someone else for because it's so much meat that its filling. But then again, I'm a girl, and I've seen guys finish their whole entree effortlessly. Again, I love how everything is so tender at this place and just well seasoned. They come with their own bbq sauce which is just ah-mazing! How in the world did they come up with that secret sauce? I'll never know but it's that little condiment that really makes a difference in your overall Rollin Smoke experience. 

This place is always packed with people whether you find yourself in a line to order or dining-in, but their service is swift so don't fret about the line. It's a small eatery but they do have an area where you can seat you and a large party. 

Try this place out! The ratings are high for a reason! :D

Rollin' Smoke has been getting a lot of online press the past few months and I finally got a chance to try them out. The raves are correct. The place is amazing. It is by far the best barbecue in Vegas and some of the best I've had anywhere.

When you pull up into the parking lot, you can see the smokers outside. When you walk in, the smell of barbecue is in the air. The place is inviting and the staff (and owners) are very nice and genuinely proud of their food.

I got the trio platter for $13.99 which includes three meats, a side, and a fountain drink. I chose pork spare ribs (ribs+tips attached), beef brisket, and pulled pork, with mac&cheese as my side. You get two spare ribs as an item in the trio. Other choices were 1/4 chicken or links. It's quite a deal!

The pork spare ribs are amazing. Meaty, well-seasoned, great smoke ring, and the flavor was unbelievable. The brisket was quite good and the pulled pork was tender and flavorful. I wish I would have eaten the brisket and pulled pork before the spare ribs though, because the more delicate flavor of those meats was overtaken by the taste of the ribs.

Midway through my meal, I heard someone order a beef rib. I LOVE beef ribs and it's very rare that a barbecue place serves them. So I had to get that too. $6.99 for a rib, but completely worth it. It is intensely beefy in flavor and gets more and more juicy as you eat it. Sort of tough on the outside, but near the bone it was beyond anything I could have hoped for.

I was so impressed that I was texting my friends all through my meal. I ended up ordering almost $100 of barbecue to take back to my friends. It has been a week now, but my phone still smells like barbecue. One of my friends ordered some smoked hot links, so I got to try that as well and they are really good. I usually scoff at ordering links at a barbecue place, but these were special.

All told, I tried every meat on their menu except for the chicken and the smoked meat loaf. The pork spare ribs take home the ribbon, but everything else was not far behind. My friend's beef ribs did look much smaller than the one I got and he said it was dry all the way through, so ask for a big hefty one to make sure it's tender.

For side dishes, I would not recommend the mac&cheese. It wasn't that good. Other tables had jalapeno cole slaw, bacon potato salad, fried okra, and hush puppies. All those seemed to be well-liked.

The barbecue sauce is made in-house and is very good. It might be very slightly too sweet for my liking, but I order my barbecue with sauce on the side anyway, so I didn't mind much. They also make a spicy barbecue sauce which you can request.

Oh, they also have a buffet option. For $25, you get unlimited everything on their menu. If you like beef ribs, two beef ribs are $15. Eating four beef ribs and a side already puts you ahead.
Beef (short rib) ribs where so tender and succulent! Even my wife who typically doesn't care much for BBQ really loved it.

The good: very good smokey taste, lots of meat, place was nice looking. 
The OK: barbecue sauce wasn't the best, a little too spicy.
The better: they fixed the ordering and the drinks are. Much better.

Amazing. Absolutely amazing. People here are so nice. Brenda is amazing and the nicest person ever, the banana pudding is the strongest most delicious banana pudding you will ever introduce yourself to. The chicken wings are the best chicken wings you will find in Las Vegas. Just over amazing. Thank you Brenda and we will see y'all soon!
Great food with a great price. Location is good and you can eat outside. Food comes out nice and hot. I recommend the arkansas spicy sauce.

Service and food is top notch at Rolling Smoke.  Called in an order for pickup, lunchtime on a Saturday.  We ordered a 1.5 racks of ribs, 1 lb. beef brisket, 3 sides of BBQ sauce, sweet potatoes, & beans.   It got busy quick with all the customers lining up, made me glad I had called in our order early.  Our order wasn't quite ready when we arrived at 12pm as they were still packing the food to go, but the guy at the counter was very nice and offered us drinks while we waited!  We were in & out in about 10-15 minutes after I paid, had a drink of sweet tea, and received our order .  It smelt so good during the car ride home, we tried the food right away.  Ribs fell off the bone, beef was tender, and the sides were all super delicious.  We were very pleased with the smoky flavored barbecue goodness which easily fed a family of 6.  Just awesome food, we'll definitely be back for more!

This place takes pride to a whole 'nother level. You wouldn't believe how fantastic the service is until you experience it yourself. The man himself, David, is a genius with comfort food. I suppose their location is meant to be sort of hidden, almost like you were to try and find it on your way to Arkansas. DO NOT miss out on the banana pudding or the yams!!

Saw the yelp reviews and gave it a shot.
What a great BBQ place.
This is your classic, no frills BBQ joint. The menus are on the wall, you order at a tall podium and the staff brings the food to the table. 
We got there early on a Wednesday and there was no line. While we were there the line grew out the door. 
The fried okra was freshly made and tasty. The jalapeno coleslaw was very good, a nice take on a classic side item.
I had the rib combo, which I wound up making two meals from. Others in our group had the sliders which were very good as well.

If I could give this place 10 stars I would!! The best BBQ ever...the service is excellent and the food was even better. I will come here every time I am in Vegas. The brisket, the ribs, the corn bits, the mac n cheese, the burgers, the meatloaf...we tried everything we could and I will be back for more. It was awesome that the guy at the register asked where I was from and knew who their competition was in San Diego (I wont say any names) and claimed that I would love Rollin' better than them and he was right!!

This place has the best bbq I've ever had! My boyfriend and I shared the three meat trio and we chose the ribs, pulled pork and Brisket. Every single thing we tried was phenomenal. We also had the mac and cheese, everything is just absolutely ridiculously good. I'm going crazy over this place. Definitely happy I decided to come here. I will be coming back every time I come to Vegas FOR SURE.

This was pretty good barbecue. The service was top notch. I had the all you could eat so I could sample. I had the catfish, ribs, chicken, and shrimp. Sides were Mac and cheese, and beans.

Catfish could have used some more seasoning.
Rib meat fell off of the bone.
Chicken was good, but skin was a little tough
Shrimp was delicious.
I have had better beans. But I was surprised by the Mac and cheese. It was very tasty.

Hands down the best BBQ I've had in a while and the best BBQ in Las Vegas...off the strip but not by much....   If you want BBQ do not hesitate to go here.   It's small and casual, Just how a BBQ joint should be 
Plus the soda is a fountain machine that you can refill yourself.    So no going thirsty while eating. Here.     Overall I know I will be back here anytime I come to Vegas and recommend to anyone who wants BBQ

Omg!  YES! Exactly how I had dreamt about it would be.  Lovely lovely meat with great sides. The meat was brisket in three ways, and we had the beans, corn and coleslaw, all shared. 
I will dream about this meal and long for it until next year when going back to Las Vegas.  
In Vegas?  What are you waiting for...GO!

This place is legit! Headed out of town on Memorial Day, and thanks god it was open. The brisket was stupendous and the pulled pork was so tender. A new favorite of mine, and I will go out of my way to visit next time I am in Vegas!

The food was ok at best and a bit pricey.  The location of the restaurant is in industrial area off the strip and small.  Even though the restaurant is small there is plenty of room to sit comfortably.  The staff was ok but the food does take a while be brought out.  The restaurant has an offer on Yelp for a free desert if you check in.... make sure you let them know prior to finishing your order if not they will not honor it.  I told the gentleman at the register just as he gave me my total and another guy who was standing behind him said I should have told them earlier.  He made no attempt to honor the offer he just waited for my payment.

I got the burger and it was petty dang tasty! It is one of the best burgers I've had.

I got a pork rib a la cart and it too was delicious. No BBQ sauce needed...that's when you know you chewing on a good rib.

This place is awesome! The food was unbelievably great! I had the Outlaw Burger and I must say that was undeniably the best hamburger I have ever had. Everyone that visits Vegas has tendency to stick to the big places on the strip but it is well worth your time to explore what else Vegas has to offer. You must try Rollin Smoke! You will not be disappointed.

This place is the shining example of how to run a business. Not only was their bbq out of this world, the service, from start to finish, is stellar.

We were in the area so we stopped in after hearing nothing but good things. Lucky us, we scored a parking spot right up front. When we left, people were parking down the street. Well, I know why!!

My sister and I split the four meat combo. We got brisket, chicken, ribs and pulled pork. My favorite was the pulled pork, but all the meat was excellent! For our sides, we had corn nibblers, hush puppies and jalapeno cole slaw.

Sadly, we eat low carb, so we just had a little bit of each side. I was very very sad that I couldn't inhale all of them. The fact that I left three hush puppies behind literally makes me want to cry! Either way, we were finishing up and one of the guys from the back walked up and asked if the cole slaw wasn't good. You could tell he was concerned and wanted to make sure everything was okay. I explained that I am low carb and low sugar and that I WISH I could eat it all. I explained how good it all was and he gave us a high five. Nicest guy!

So not only is the food great, but the customer service was equally as good. You can tell they care about every aspect of their business, from the quality of the food to the people they serve.

As a fellow small business owner, and one in the food industry, it can get VERY hard to just run an establishment, let alone do it in a way that makes people obsessed with your food. Somehow, they make this place work pretty seamlessly and we will most CERTAINLY be back soon. My dad is going to lose his mind once we bring him here!
Great BBQ spot, food is excellent. Portions were smaller then expected but very good.

This is an amazing BBQ joint! We discovered this place as a referral when we visited the guys from the show Tanked. We haven't been disappointed yet. We usually order the 3 meat and seafood combo. Definitely order the yams, they are very delicious!!!
We had a group and a back room was opened so we could all eat together in our own room!  The staff is really friendly and so helpful!  Love this place! Loved the burger! Can't wait to try more!!

update 6/19 we have continued to visit and have seen the owners making changes to ensure everyone's satisfied. Back to perfect rating for my fave Q. Rolling smoke has been my favorite BBQ in town for over a year, love the brisket, giant beef ribs, and sides.  $24.99 all u can eat dine in special seems like good value. My issue is as it's gotten more popular the wait for ordering and food is tough, especially if I'm with my children. I don't see the owners in anymore and it's not as friendly. My last visit half my to go order was missing (after waiting over 30 min) and the employee made a joke that it was my fault because I initially didn't respond when my name was called (knew my order wasn't one bag).  I would have preferred apology for trying to send me on my way with half of a $40 order! Despite loving the food I'm hesitant to go unless during slow time

I really loved this place! It's in a random sketchy strip mall close to the Strip, but this is legit BBQ. Me and my friend shared a platter with five meats (brisket, pulled pork, sausage, chicken and ribs) that came with three sides. Sausage was a little spicy. We chose mac n cheese, corn nuggets and loaded mashed potatoes as our sides. I LOVED the mashed potatoes, they were the perfect guilty pleasure. My favorite of the five meats was the brisket. Oh and they have a bunch of sauces, from vinegar sauce to mustard sauce to hot sauce. There is indoor and outdoor seating. We chose to sit outside on one of the long picnic benches and it was perfect. Chef Willie brought us a delicious dessert...it was some sort of apple tart topped with vanilla ice cream. I will be back!

Back again for some more Rollin' Smoke. 

Ordered the two meat platter of 3 spare ribs, hot link and side of corn fritter things. 

Ribs had the prescribed smoke ring and were fall off the bone tendered. Most importantly they were not overly smokey. A little smoke goes a long way. 

Hot link good average link. Not overly impressed but decent. Now the spicy BBQ sauce I put on it was Spicy! Wow!  That batch had kick. Very good. 

Lastly, the corn fritters, an interesting take cream corn but fried onto little battered nuggets. You can't stop at one. 

RS BBQ rocks. Always leave satisfied.
Have been to a lot bbq joints across the U.S. And man, this one is up there in the top 5. Been to Vegas for many years and never knew of this place. Everything is amazing and smoked to perfection.
Friendly service and good food. Some of the better BBQ in town. Always does quality caterring. More seating is needed for the lunch time rush.

Chef Tim was amazing as our wedding cater. We loved the food we served at our reception as did our guests. He went above and beyond to help us out since our service was on a Sunday outside. They were more than willing to work with us for our budget as our $$ was shrinking away we worked with them to revamp what we were serving keeping it still as delicious as ever.
Food was just ok chicken was undercooked bbq sauce was thin and to spicy I will not be be returning
Best beef ribs EVER!!!  I'm so happy to find this place in Vegas!!!  Absolutely incredible smoked meats!!!

Off the beaten path of the strip in an area you may not blink an eye at. THIS PLACE IS AMAZING! Affordable and amazing staff. Everyone is kind and the food is to die for. Do not pass on the corn tots.

Biggest complaint they close too early....8pm and also kind of out in the middle of nowhere...although there is a strip club right beside it if you want deserts after the smokey food.

Ordered the trios which had 3 meats and sides. Portions wise it was big and thr food was cheap. The flavour for sure is smokey. I had the pulled pork,  brisket, and ribs. Ribs were ok. Pulled pork didn't seem to have much sauce (I would prefer some sauce). The brisket was too dry maybe they smoked it too long and dried out the meat. The sides I don't have too much to say... none of they were that great. Fries were a little greasy for my liking.

Two associates and I tried this BBQ joint because of all the good reviews posted here.  I guess I should have tried the beef ribs because the brisket I had was overcooked, dry and tough, the pulled pork wasn't tender enough, and you can't order baby back ribs with the combos, only St. Louis.  I had a couple of those and they were OK, just extra fatty.  Overall, I was disappointed because I'm a BBQ aficionado due to my multiple trips to Texas every year. 

 I like BBQ so much I bought a Texas-style smoker with a side firebox and spent a few years perfecting my 'Q smoking skills.  I can do a brisket and pulled pork that are miles ahead of what we got here and my baby backs are killer.  I don't know, maybe it was too late in the day, we got there about 7 PM and despite what it says in the listing, they close at 8 on weekdays.  The pit master, who seems to be a very nice guy and is very friendly, brought a bunch of briskets in that had just come out of the smoker and maybe we got the tail end of the last batch.  Even if that was the case however; what we got shouldn't have been served in my opinion, it was that bad.
This is seriously the best BBQ in Vegas by far.  I've never been disappointed in their food.  The brisket is amazing.  The yams are the best I've ever had in my life.  I'm addicted!

by far the best bbq place in vegas!

love their trio sliders! brisket and hot links are the bomb! + their potato salad!

staff and crew are very friendly and nice! good service! good food!

I give this place a 0 on a scale of 1-10; 10 being the highest. Worst customer service. This place argued with me and wasn't welcoming at all. Although, the food might have been good enough for its pricing, I surely did not have a good expeirence.

The best BBQ in Vegas!!! Hands down to great BBQ and great service... We arrived and greeted right away... One of staff giving piggy stickers to our kids!!! So nice so kid friendly place... Ordered our meal, the BBQ was melt in your mouth goodness !!! Mac&cheese was bomb!!! The portions are big portions worth your money!!! Will definitely a place in Vegas to come back too... Thanks
Without a doubt, great bbq.  Looks like a dive, but the chickrn, brisket and pulled pork were awesome.   Only regret is this place isn't closer to home.

Sooooo, in Vegas again and decided to throw the dice on dinner.  We ended up at Rollin Smoke BBQ.  Not sure what to expect - but, I was feeling lucky.  Winner, winner!  Disclaimer, I don't eat pork.  So, I cannot speak on the goodness of the ribs and pulled pork.  But, what I can tell you is that the brisket (3 ways) was delicious.  My favorite of the three was the burnt ends.  The right amount of flavor and char.  FYI, they have an all you can eat option for a very resoanable price.  That affords the curious grubber a variety of options.  With that, I also tried the smoked chicken, shrimp, mac & cheese, fried okra, and corn nuggets.  My favorite of the sides: corn nuggets.  All the rest were meh.  Admittedly, I'm  a mac & cheese snob...so, it barely stood a chance.  Lastly the desserts...both the banana pudding and peach cobbler left me underwhelned.  At this point you may be wondering why 4 STARS?  The BBQ was excellent.  The service was outstanding. Lizelle welcomed us to the establishment and helped us to make the hard decision of what to get...  Overall, I would definitely come back.  I also recommend you check them out...

Great BBQ in Vegas, excellent service from Will & Lizelle. 

Would definitely go back.

AWESOME!!!! We went multiple times during the  off/slow season in Vegas. Lunch time is always packed. The food is great - greatest BBQ ever - not an exaggeration. The first time I went there, this guy named Mike took our order and got our food. No-nonsense kind of guy - he recommended  the right food for us and it was delicious. You can tell they care - everything is smoked slowly so it's soft and flavorful. There is a review down there about their bread being soggy - who fuckin' cares! It was probably placed there to soak up the excess grease. Grow a pair and eat the meat.

Went here yesterday on a last minute journey for some good, cheap food. We definitely found it! This place was smokin'! 

The place had a large amount of people, but the wait wasn't long at all. This isn't a sit down and get served type restaurant. It's more of an order at the counter and pick where you want to sit joint; a style that is very appropriate for a BBQ place in my opinion. 

We had a party of three so we got to see a decent amount of the menu. My boyfriend got the talked about Outlaw Burger and it was HUGE! Only 12 bucks for the combo, which includes a drink and a side. It comes with a ton of onion strings and an optional sauce if you want to kick up the heat. 

As for myself, I got the Brisket Sandwich Combo($11).
For my side, I got the corn nuggets which were absolutely delicious! I tried a sample in line and it was love at first taste. As for the sandwich, it definitely was good but could have used more sauce. 

Our other party member got the sausage link combo($11) with mac and cheese. He wasnt digging the sausage sandwich but I think he wasn't in a sausage mood, unfortunately. The mac and cheese on the other hand...oh baby! So creamy and delicious. They use shells instead of elbow macoroni which definitely is a strong point for the dish. 

As for the staff, very friendly and made us feel at home.

Overall, everything was amazing! My faves include:
- Corn nuggets
- The Outlaw Burger
- Mac and Cheese 

Definitely going to come back to try other items. Looking forward to the Loaded Mash especially! 

Thanks for the wonderful meal!

Well this confirmed I should have rounded down instead of up after last time.  I think this place probably has its good days and not as good days.  Today was a down day and the 1st time was a better day.  I was at a 3.5 after the 1st time and gave it a 4, today it earned it's three.  

Had the rib combo 3 baby back,  2 spare, 1 beef. The beef rib came out sauced,  I didn't expect that as it didn't last time.  I sent it back and asked for one without sauce. When I got the plate back it was the same rib with sauce rubbed off. This was highly irritating. Wonder what else was done to my food while it was sent back.  I don't dare to let my mind wonder that road.  I should have been served a new rib that had never been sauced.  Not one that was wiped off. Sigh, urg, I seem to be more upset about this the more I think about it. The beef rib was good this time not as good as the 1st time.  The baby backs were better than the spare but both were underdone as neither pulled away from the bone easy and were kinda tough, even though they had good flavor. Definitely not as good as the 1st time. 

The 1st time I also had the brisket which was above average but not great.  Also had pulled pork that was pretty good.  

All the meats here do have varying degrees of a Smokey taste,  as well varying degrees of smoke rings.  So they are cooking these meats with the right methods. 
 
For sides I have enjoyed the corn nuggets and fritters both times, but I am not sure if these are not just prepackaged items instead of homemade. 

Last but not least the desserts. I had the berry cobbler today.  I would definitely stay away from this item as it wasn't very good.  Ordering the peach cobbler and banana pudding seem like your safest and tastiest bets for dessert. 

In summary if this was my 1st time it would be my last time. Still can't believe I didn't get a fresh rib instead they just wiped it off. If this would have been my 1st time they would have been 2 stars based just on that fact alone. Not sure if I will stop back in here or not.  On a good day they are the best in the area. (Really no good bbq in Vegas, so thats not saying much (though I have one that just popped on my radar that I need to try), ). On a bad day well it is just okay. 

Your milage may vary.

Well, I have tried most things they have here. Good ribs, brisket and the burgers are unlike any burger I have had. I am a fan of smoked and/or grilled burgers, but fried not at all..like  Mcdonalds, Wendy's, In-N-Out... RS burgers are big and soft and smoked. If you are a burger fanatic, you should at least try it. But, what I think about when I think of this place is the beef ribs. One rib is a whole meal, they are so big. The beef rib is tender, tasty and totally trimmed of excess fat and gristle. This is the must-try from this place. Beef ribs. Amazing and I want to know how they do that (I'm a cook)! The only issue is finding the place, so head south on Highland from Sahara for about a mile, then you will see it tucked into a little strip-mall. The wait is not short, which is why I only give it 4 stars.

Great bar-b-que and good prices! Lines are always out the door, but the service is quick and friendly. I always the combo plates, so I can try a little everything. They also have an all you can eat menu, but I've never ordered it. The combo plates are large enough.
This place is really good and authentic.  Gives you tons of food!!!  Meatloaf is awesome!!!  Try it.  Desert is not worth much, but we got it for free.
AWESOME food that won't disappoint you!!!! The best BBQ brisket, bakes beans, and corn bread I had ever had.

I really don't write reviews on yelp so I decided to start with this place. I feel this place deserves a 5 star for the simple fact that the service, food, and atmosphere is awesome!! I was on my way to school and my stomach was growling to the max! Luckily and fortunately this place was down the street from school as I was in a hurry for a quick bite. The nice young lady who helped me recommended me the "Outlaw Burger" it won "Best of Vegas" for a reason. That burger was stacked tall with meat, onion strings, bbq sauce and a cherry (pepper) on top with a side of mac and cheese. This burger tested my will, I didn't think I was able to eat this beast. But with determination and a empty stomach, I was able to tame this beast in about 10 minutes :D The burger was tasty and juicy, mac n cheese was delicious! Will be back with a group of my friends to see for themselves how great this place is. Kudos to the staff and the "Outlaw Burger."

This hole in the wall place that is just off the strip is the spot to be for BBQ. I had the Trio plate, and it is "Slap Yo Mamma" Good! Not like the Casinos, this is a sure bet. Prices are great for the Quality BBQ.  If you're still reading this, "stop" and just go To Rollin Smoke BBQ NOW!!! :-)
Don't have to wait long.  Order taken quick food hot people are nice.  Seating good not bad for a quick bite to eat.  Love this place

By far the best barbeque in Las Vegas. Don't waste your time going to the over priced BBQ chain restaurants, they cannot come close to what Rollin Smoke is rolling out. Cannot go wrong with anything on the menu. This place makes my stomach and taste buds happy.

Great hole in the wall find. I had the brisket sandwich and waffle fries and my sister had the trio combo with brisket, ribs and waffle fries.  Her brisket was the ticket! The couple next to us recommended Mac and Cheese and the catfish. Can't wait for the next visit.

Stopped here after a concert... They were out of everything we wanted to try, we were left ordering hot dogs. The food was super greasy. Tried drying the fries with napkins due to them being soaked in oil. We had to just throw them away. The hush puppies were actually really good. I don't think we will be going back.

This place is near where the strippers and the Fashion Show mall is in a very unlikely location for a restaurant to be. But boy is it packed. They serve BBQ of all types. We ordered the combo BBQ to sample their BBQ and also a pulled pork sandwich. It was a large burger. Underneath all that meat was a sausage. Everything was cooked just right. The meat was juicy and came right off the bone.

The place was packed for 2pm on a Saturday, clearly pass its lunch hour but there was a steady stream of customers. If you want hole in the wall, this is the place. Everything about the place tells you these people didn't come from LA or NYC. They came from what, Arkansas? There's a boar's head on the wall to greet you and keep you company when you wait in line.

The menu items are simple. We got mac and cheese, yams, and fried okra. You get a side if you order a soft drink. How can you eat BBQ without a Coke? You just can't, so the side was an added compliment.

There is only 1 restroom though so I suggest you do your business become you come or else it might be a wait. Out of the 3 different styles of BBQ, I'd say they hit it on the head for each one. There is bbq sauce on the table if you like but I found that the ribs were nicely done and I didn't need anymore sauce.

Sauce wise, I think Lucille's might just be a tad better but not by much. I like them to cook their meat as good as this place. Is it always pefect? Nope. The first time that I came here, the baby backs were a little dry but this time everything was cooked right.

I could not finish my meal and took the rest home. If you have trouble locating this place it's across Shetakis distribution and below the Sahara bridge I believe.

I have ate at many Barbecue places all over the country and Rolling Smoke competes with them at a very tasteful pleasure.
The sauce is great, I usually get the pulled pork or the trio plate and I must say is very tasteful.  The potato salad and macaroni and cheese is too die for.  Very well blended and hits the right spots on the tongue.  Oh and you have to try the beans!!! The best beans I have tasted.
The downside since there from Arkansas, they should know about Sweet Tea....which, when they first opened, there tea was very good but then they contracted with Coke and they supplied them with there version of Sweet Tea, which in my opinion they need to stick to Cola. 
So all in all, skip McDonald's take the drive and head over to Highland drive and get your tongue ready for the best barbecue in Vegas.

The Beef Ribs were cooked (smoked) perfect, easily the best Ive ever had (and Ive had my share)..Tender and mouth watering would be the best description. Met the owner and one of his son's, they were the type of people you would invite to sit at your dinner table and talk BBQ with, just nice folks. My wife had the smoked meat loaf and it was awesome also..The BEST BBQ in Las Vegas hands down
We were pleasantly surprised, both by the quality of the barbecue (in Vegas!) and the exceptional service. The sides are also deadly delicious.

I went here on word of mouth, and, I have to say, this place is definitely worth it. I'm from the South (Georgia and Florida) and think this place is really close to my ideal restaurant. I got the pulled pork sandwich and a side of greens. Wasn't to keen on the hoagie roll (mainly because I'm used to pulled pork on hamburger buns), but that's inconsequential due to the fact that the pork was awesome. This is my main method of judging BBQ joints and they passed with flying colors. Added to that, the greens were perfect. If you've been missing collards, mustard, or turnip greens, this is a great combination of all three. Definitely check in first so you can get the dessert. I didn't but the server didn't mind adding the order, which was nice because of the consideration. I got the banana pudding which was good, but I would have liked to have had some bananas in it. Just preference, really, because the overall flavor was inline with what I wanted. Additionally, the service was very courteous and friendly. Overall, it would be really unfortunate to miss this place especially because there are so few good BBQ restaurants in this town. Check it out. This place is worth it.

This was the first visit to Rollin Smoke for my wife and I following a word of mouth recommendation from a couple we met while in line at our hotel check in and we weren't disappointed. I had the trio plate with chicken, brisket and hot links, my wife had brisket and ribs - everything was great with good smoke and rub flavour.  My wife didn't have sauce on hers and in her opinion it wasn't required. I found the sauce delicious but be forewarned, it has some heat to it. The onion rings and corn nuggets were awesome sides, I wish we could have tried some more of them. We most definitely will return on our next visit and will be recommending Rollin Smoke to our friends travelling to the area.

This is my new favorite BBQ spot! The most tender, flavorful spare ribs I've ever eaten. They actually smoke the meat and there is evidence of that, since when I walked in, my eyes started watering immidietely (I have sensitive eyes) from the smoke inside the restaurant. However, that did not hinder my expirience since the food is damn good. I will be taking my food to go until some sort of vents are installed. There are two rooms and some seating outside. It looks like a hole in a wall but those tend to have really good food. I only expirienced the first room (when you just walk in) so may be the second room does not get effected by the smoke or has vents, I would not know. 
Items tried: Spare ribs, wings, chicken, the outlaw burger, waffle fries, mac n cheese, hush puppies. Favorites: Spare ribs, waffle fries (so good!). The others mentioned were pretty good too. Don't belive me? On the fence? Go try it and write about it!

Everything was absolutely delicious here. The prices were reasonable for the amount of food you get as well.

Loved that they made meatloaf out of their brisket!

This little Dive has got it going on!  This BBQ joint is in a undesirable location,  it's  small, with a back woods feel to it And I LOVE EVERYTHING ABOUT THIS PLACE! The food and the southern welcome to Rollin smoke is most memorable! Highly recommend you get some of this ! ....ya like now! 
P.S. we tried  the ribs, collard greens, hot links, brisket and corn nuggets! Nom Nom!

Review #300

4 Stars *****

This place is located in a less than desirable area. It is on Highland Dr near the strip club district. Nonetheless, it was definitely worth the trip.

I am giving my 300th review to Rollin' Smoke BBQ. Definitely a solid 4 star meal when it comes to BBQ beef brisket. I just tried the Brisket 3 Ways which consisted of sliced brisket, chopped brisket, and burnt ends. The meat was very good on its own, but I added some of their Arkansas BBQ sauce to it. I thought their bbq sauce was excellent. They also offered a sweet bbq sauce, but I preferred the tangy version. I also ordered a side of waffle cut fries, which were seasoned very well.

I will definitely be back to try the beef ribs and some other menu items. I will probably add another star on my next visit if the beef ribs are as good as the brisket.

Yummmmmmmmmmmmmy!!!!  Coming from the far NW part of town, this is a bit of a drive.. And the dining experience is certainly nothing special- some picnic tables and paper towels.  But the food is amazing and keeps us coming back for more! Definitely a hidden gem in Vegas - great for locals, so shhhhh don't tell the tourists!! ;)

Spent half a week on the strip trying all the buffets and fancy restaurants, none of them had meat as good as here. Service is so friendly, even bringing out a sample of the corn nuggets for us to try (get them!!!) and made us feel very welcome upon entering this hole in the wall.

The boy and I split the trio. We chose the brisket (chopped per the hostess's recommendation), ribs (fall off the bone ofc), and pulled pork (so much juicy tenderness!). Got their bbq beans (so good ugh) and potato salad (HIGHLY recommend) as sides. Having trouble eating it all, portion is so big!

They also have all their bbq sauces available for you to squirt on your meat (huehuehue) and you should try all of them. Mama's sweet was our favorite. 

This will be one of those restaurants that I will need to visit everytime I'm in the area.

I was craving barbecue while in Vegas and my good friend told me to come here. I ordered the Pit Special and got the brisket, chicken, pulled pork, and ribs with baked beans, mac and cheese, and fried onion strings as my sides. 

All we're delicious however I would probably get the hot links instead of the chicken next time. It satisfied my barbecue craving and the price was definitely reasonable. The staff was friendly as well and the wait wasn't too bad considering the line was out the door around 11am. 

I'll definitely be coming back!

I went to Vegas last weekend and we ate here for an early dinner on Saturday. We got there at 5:30pm and already there was about 10-15 people there. There was 6 people in our group. Everyone's food came out pretty fast but unfortunately they forgot to put in my order so my food came out last. Because of that, the manager (or I think it was the manager) brought me our a complimentary dessert which was awesome. As for the actual BBQ, it was pretty darn good! Can't beat it for the price too. I've had BBQ in Houston so it's not the same but as good as you can get for outside of Texas and especially in Vegas!
I have been here twice and still love it. I got beef ribs and my bf got brisket 3 ways. It was awesome!!!! One of the best bbq place in las vegas.

I was in Vegas a few weeks ago and my friend Julie. Took me hear to try the food since I love BBQ. I must say the food was to die for. The staff and service was great. I've tried a few places in Vegas but this place is the Best by far! If your in Vegas I highly reccomend it!!

Went with my brother for a Saturday lunch and WOW!  That was my first visit but he has been there often.  We shared the "Outlaw" burger, beans and coleslaw.  The "Outlaw" is just massive!  And oh, so delicious!  I've lived in Las Vegas 52 years but hadn't been in that area for a decade or better.  But you can bet I'll be back - we have friends visiting from England in May and by then I will have several tested suggestions for them!!

True, authentic barbecue in Vegas! Food takes some time, but it's expected for the quality that they serve. Don't let the exterior (or interior) fool you, these guys know what they're doing and how to do it well! I ordered the Outlaw Burger as it is touted as a "Best in Vegas" burger. It didn't disappoint, by any means!

I had the pulled piggy and it was very dry. It did go down better with dipped bbq sauce. My brother had the huge outlaw burger and the meat came out perfectly juicy. Pricing was very good, you get a lot of food for the price. Three stars for the hit and miss based on my experience.
Great BBQ. Burger has great seasoning (garlic I think) and the brisket is great. Can't go wrong here, other than eating too much.

One of the best BBQ joints for food. They need to work on cleaning the place. Chairs are cloth and filthy. Tables are family style so you have to be ok eating with new friends. And they need to send someone out regularly to wipe them down.
We had combo ribs plate $17.99 with Mac and cheese side, also a trio meat with 2 x's brisket and spare ribs $14.00 with beans. Ordered a Full slab of Baby backs to go $28.00 It said that every plate came with a dinner roll and a drink. They didn't put the roll on. I questioned the guys delivering  the food they said "no" it doesnt. I re read the board and ask the girl at the register she says "yes". When they deliver the rolls the explanation is that there is a menu change coming. OK I get that. Use a piece of tape and cover the roll if your not giving it out anymore.
Here's my advice. You charge alot for the food don't be short sighted. The roll is pennies on each plate.
I and many others ( long line behind and in front of me) do not mind paying prices if the food is good. Give something away on the plate (roll). One of the guys tried to sell me that the slice of bread that my food was on was the roll?
Look down the road at longevity and you will see if you penny pick people no matter how good the food is we won't come back. 
I again will say some of the best BBQ I have had hands down but they have some kinks to work out.

I like to take into consideration atmosphere, service and quality of food when making a review. Pulling up into an industrial area seemed a bit sketch but upon exiting the vehicle my nostrils were pleasantly filled with the best kind of smoke - Yep the smell of the kind of BBQ that makes your mouth water with expectation.  The service was fast and friendly and everything sampled was melt in your mouth delicious. Had ribs, brisket, hot links, Mac & Cheese, coleslaw & the corn.  Mmmmmmmmm so good and I love that they didn't slather everything in sauce.  NO NEED TO COVER UP OR MASK GREAT FLAVOR!!!

Ended up yelping up a place to grab some bbq.  We ordered bbq fries and baby back ribs, both were delicious.  Lee, the owner I believe, was very helpful making sure we had everything we needed.   Will be going back next time we are in  Vegas we will visiting. 

Highly recommended for fantastic food (get the bbq fries) and the amazing customer service.

Had a brisket sandwich. It's somewhat shredded, and absolutely delicious. The BBQ chicken was very good too. But the Biggin looked fantastic; a link, brisket and pulled pork sandwich. And you have to try the Jalapeño cole slaw!

Omg so I went there yesterday and I can say it takes out famous daves the staff was so friendly including the owner one of the workers I forgot his name but he let us know how they started and everything it was nice that they take their time to talk to customers I loved the BBQ sauce and the damn hot sauce was really good too I walked out of there with 3 jars of BBQ and 1 of their Rub to bring back home .... When I'm in Vegas again this will have to be one of my spots to come to :)
Probably the best American bbq spot to go to in Vegas

I'm most definitely a fan of BBQ so with that being said why wouldn't I try this place out to see what all the hype is about? I've had this bookmarked for at least a couple months but being that is a couple of streets over from the strip I've procrastinated actually driving down here to eat! I left the fashion show mall this past week hungry and not wanting any nasty mall food lol. When I looked around the area for places to eat on yelp, this bookmark popped up! Headed on over in a hurry! When I pulled up I thought the outside was interesting with the picnic tables and yeah just the whole location is weird but needless to say who cares the food is good! The menu is posted on a HUGE window outside so that you are able to get your ordered figured out prior to going inside however in this 1000 degrees of heat I opted to read my menu INSIDE ha! The 3 meat trio priced at about $17.99 was fair and the only thing I didn't like was they could've gave me a little bit more of the mac n cheese for my side :-/ In addition to that order we also got the BBQ Nacho Fries with the brisket! Amazing! Wow all I have to say is if calories aren't a concern and you are in the area looking for great BBQ, LOOK NO FURTHER!
best bbq I've had up here. not as good as the south, but def wasn't disappointed. the sides are really good, and the pulled pork was good

If you like bbq go no further! ! Real smoke.  Girl did the
Chicken and pulled pork,  loaded mashed.  I did ayce only $24.95 & when they say anything off the menu they were not joking.  First round 2 beef ribs super tender just enough cooking tender juicy sweet,  baby back ribs. Beans out of bounds,  steak beans with black pepper,  cayenne spicy good. Mac cheese meah. 2nd round brisket and baby backs so yummy tender brisket smoke rings all with pickles and white bread. Red onion straws and needed cool off had Dessert blue bell ice cream Hershey chocolate syrup.
Seriously don't bother going anywhere else. Hard part I'm 300 miles from home in OC. Tell Dusty pit boss Michael the foodie from OC sent you.

The place smells so good and it's full of mouth watering food. The $20 pit mix is enough for 2 and comes with 3 slides. I highly recommend the corn bread and Mac & cheese for sides, & the brisket, ribs, & chicken for meats. My friend had the peach cobbler that looked delicious so try a little dessert too lol
Amazing food, great prices! Loaction is a little industrial but acceptable.  Can't wait o go back - the brisket is awesome!!!

I moved here from Kansas City, so I was not really set on finding good BBQ here. Then I found Rolling Smoke. The pulled pork is great and the BBQ Nachos are INCREDIBLE. I have nothing but great things to say about this place. If you are wanting to watch sports, there are TV's inside. You can also sit on the picnic tables outside if the weather is nice and doesn't feel like the surface of the sun. I have been 4 times now and the employees have always been great. The manager will even walk around and talk to you to make sure everything is okay if they are there. I am a fan of amazing BBQ but even a bigger fan on customer service. I will continue coming here, forever.

Did I just die and go to BBQ heaven?! This place is AMAZEBALLS! As soon as you open the door you are hit with the most intense fragance of BBQ that will have you salivating! We went overboard and got almost every side they had to offer!! Those Corn nuggets..... OMG!!!! YOU HAVE TO TRY THEM! I had the chopped brisket and pulled pork with corn nuggets and hush puppies. My husband had sliced brisket and pulled pork with mac and cheese and loaded mashed potatoes. My daughter had the chicken wings and fries.The meat was cooked to perfection and moist. I haven't even gotten to the BBQ sauce, which I could almost see myself drinking from the bottle.This place is BBQ perfection! THE BEST BEST BBQ I have ever had!!! Its about a 35 min drive here for us, but totally worth it!

Just stopped by and had the Trio plate with some St. Louis and Babyback ribs to sample as well.... OMG... It was tender and delicious and you could taste just enough of the nice smoke. Brisket had beautiful smoke ring in it, the pulled pork and hot link were incredible and the ribs were great. While my friend enjoyed the babybacks more, I am a little torn as the meaty St. Louis ribs I got were incredible. Tough choice, i think the best to do is get both like I did. Haven't had the bbq chicken yet, but I will be back to try some and I will be sure to sing your praise to people looking for good bbq. I think halfway through my meal I realized i had stopped using my fork long ago and was fingers covered with delicious bbq sauce and goodness. Keep up what you are doing and I will be sure to be back!

If you love that smokey flavor...this is a must try. We got the sampler platter with brisket, ribs, pulled pork and chicken. All were good but I have had better in terms of texture (a little on a dry side for me) and a little on the flavor (minus 1 star). The really got the smokey part down where the brisket leaves the deep red rim below the charred tip.

For sides we got:
corn nuggets -  which was yummy as I never had something like it
collard greens - i loved it as it wasn't too greasy or cooked with bacon. Instead they used pieces of the smoked brisket to cook it in. Delicious and less guilty to eat.
fried okra - never thought this was good but it actually was. 
I wanted corn on a cob as one of the sides but they didn't have any which is the first I've heard at a bbq but since their other choices are good, i wont complain. 

Cost: Very descent. For our 4 choice sampler, 3 small sides and a soda to share ALL for $19.99!! I'm happy with that! 

Seating: Majority are in a big benches. Which you may have to share if it gets crowded. So for some you don't like sharing go when its not prime time or learn to be people friendly. 

Parking: Good amounts of parking but not a lot. Location is good for the boys who loves strip clubs because this bbq joint is near and surrounded by most of them.

Hadn't had good barbecue in a while and this place definitely hit the spot, they were very friendly and knowledgeable about the food, they also make an amazing bbq meatloaf and the rib tips were delicious as well! Great place

Very good! I had the duo combo of Brisket, Short Ribs & beans... Really tasty. Wife had BBQ Meatloaf, said it was best she's had. One of my boys had the Outlaw burger... Foot tall w onion rings. Well worth the price!!!

Hands down amazing BBQ!!!! The brisket is absolutely perfect, the meat falls right off of the rib bones, and all of the sides are on point. We really appreciated the banana pudding one of the guys brought out for our little one!!!
We are looking forward for their second location over by the pawn stars shop in September!!!

Exceptional smoking of the meats. Good potato salad side, the corn bread was original and tasty, pulled pork was particularly good and the ribs were great. I am a BBQ freak and try new places often. Portions were generous. The portions for this my second visit were larger than the last time I visited. (about 6 months ago).

This is the 6th local BBQ joint I have tried and the best so far. 

Definitely top tier.
Real BBQ real close when you're in Vegas.  We got the smoker plate that was around $30.... Well, two of those actually and had plenty left over for the next day.

There is a reason this joint is so well rated and it's not the ambiance. The BBQ is excellent and the prices are very reasonable. My wife and I both tried a combo plate; $11 including a beverage, a side and two meat choices.  The bbq is nicely smoked and the sides are spicy good. The service is fast and pleasant. But don't expect fancy or you'll be disappointed. 
Oh, with a Yelp check-in, we got a free dessert. Nice bonus. 
I bookmarked Rollin Smoke and will return!

This a review on the second time around. The first I went food and service was great the owner (who I believed to be) made sure we were fully satisfied. The second time however the service was ABSOLTUTELY HORRID. They took over an hour to bring out our food. The entire time they never put our order in due to horrible miscommunication that the server made us feel as if it was our fault! The guy even had an attitude. One of the mgrs on duty tried to offer banana pudding  without even knowing i dont like bananas. I even noticed him having some of his thumb in another customers dessert while he dropped it off! So all in all because of the food itself I round up 3.5 to 4. Hopefully the next time we wont have such horrible experience because it is so hard to find great BBQ in Vegas.

Here we go, brace yourselves. I'll be that guy. This is actually a friendlier version of my review for RSB; the original had cuss words and comparisons that probably would get me in trouble that's the version you needed to brace yourselves for.

When it comes to BBQ, American BBQ, I've gone to St. Louis, Memphis, Kansas City, Texas, the Carolinas, various states in the East, South, Mid-West, and West, pre-Yelp and current Yelp days, and have experienced both good and bad BBQ. You can say I've had more than my share of BBQ and can tell a good BBQ from just a decent BBQ place but no way am I an expert. I've hated BBQ spots locals loved. So IMHO and friendlier version RSB is just decent, OK is being nice. I've been here a few times and well I am NOT a fan. Each time I've been disappointed with one thing or another. Yes I've gone back but that's just cause everyone's been raving about RSB and I wanted to give them another shot and then another.

One of my first visits was with a group of 5-6 from work. I don't remember what everyone exactly ordered but remembered me having the chopped pork sandwich and another having the chopped chicken sandwich which neither I can find on the menu, must have been a special. Anyways from both of the sandwiches we created a community pile of what's this!? tiny pieces of chicken bones. There were a lot of chopped up chicken spine and rib bones all mixed in our meats. Even if I was mistakenly served chicken with my pork, bones, really RSB. I had more typed out but I leave it as that. The only good thing about it was I had a free dessert with Yelp check-in. STRIKE ONE.

After writing off RSB for a couple months the group made it back out. This time ribs and Outlaw burgers were ordered. They certainly took their time bringing the ribs out.  Ribs were ordered first and was last to be served. What exactly were they doing!? Warming it up or cooking them as it was ordered. I actually asked for and ate my dessert first cause I was hungry. The ribs that came out was beyond disappointing tough, rubbery, had little taste, and sucked. I've had way better.  I noticed my ribs were different from the others. Oh there's a "rib plate" and a "rib platter special". STRIKE TWO.

After working up an appetite playing basketball all morning I came here looking to finally clear things up and getting the rib platter special. It was a lot of ribs but it lost all its luster. The beef rib wasn't as tender as I was hoping but tender to some liking. The rest were decent nothing exciting just a lot of meat covered in sauce. I smelt all the smoke inside and outside of the RSB but I got only a hint of smoke taste. STRIKE THREE. Throat slash. 

The best BBQ in Vegas!? I don't know about that. Maybe, than again Vegas aren't known for BBQ and the ones I've enjoyed no longer are open so maybe I don't know anything about BBQ plus I sometimes enjoy buffet BBQ ribs. You want more info there's AYCE BBQ for $24.99. It's located off a few side streets near the Strip. They have a small parking lot which is shared with the other businesses. They're from Arkansas. They're friendly but I wouldn't call the service great. There's large tables, small tables, and booths. Lines for ordering can form out the door. Just go if you like go.
Yum, friendly, cheap. low key joint a bit off the strip (need wheels to get there).

How does one put into words the experience of tasting great BBQ?  Rollin Smoke that's how.

Went here tonight with my father and this place far exceeded our expectations.  I thought it was so unique this place offers "all you can eat" for anything and everything on the menu.  I was personally on a mission to devour some St. Louis style BBQ ribs, greens and some "kickin beans" and.........well I can say this: "If these are not served in heaven, then I shall not go"  absolutely remarkable and hands down the very best BBQ in Vegas.  Don't let the "hole in the wall" location fool you, it will be one of the best BBQ experiences of your life.  The owner is very pleasant and takes a great deal of pride in what they serve.  Service was great and food was even better.   THIS IS A MUST VISIT!

Can't say anything bad about this place. Got the rib platter. They were out of baby backs so it was mostly spare ribs with 1 beef rib. Couldn't finish it all because that is a lot of meat and fat for 1 meal. The side I chose was the greens. Bad choice for me because they were too spicy for my pallet and I couldn't eat them. But they were probably perfect, it is just me. Corn bread was very good too.
Excellent BBQ.  Right off of I-15.  Very easy to get too.  This is my new Goto place in Vegas.  The Rob tips are awesome!

Having tried many barbecue places we finally found The Best!  Absolutely the most delicious food!  My husband is a grill master but the ribs here were sooo delicious!   I also had the potato salad with crumbled bacon,  mac n cheese and the bbq beans, my taste buds were in heaven!  If you've tried other bbq restaurants and thought they were missing something you really need to try Rollin Smoke.  The very BEST in Vegas!! Top notch customer service and very clean.
Best BBQ in Vegas, hands down!!  Other than the delicious food they're Super friendly, cozy atmosphere, and affordable.
We just enjoyed a great dinner. The brisket was prefect. The pork was delicious. The yams and macaroni and cheese were tasty. We will definitely be back!

WOW!
The food is amazing....best item by far is their beef ribs and their sauce is oh so delicious.
For some reason I was thinking that they closed at 10pm. I just now realized they close at 8pm, which was the time we arrived at the spot. Not once did any of the workers mention this to us, they are so friendly and welcoming. I must've took forever to figure out what I wanted to order too - now I feel so bad for being a douchebag customer LOL. I even ordered it to go then we ended up eating there instead....and still, not one mention about their closing time. Thank you guys for allowing us to savor your wonderful product way past closing...kudos forrealz! On top of all this, hubby asked me to order another rib piece to go - and boy did we luck out. They happily took our order and sent us off with two pieces instead of one. WINNIN!
Beef ribs = easy 10+
Cheesy mac n cheese = 10
Rib tips = 8
Peach cobbler = 9
Customer Service = 10+

Likelihood to return = you betcha!

If you're a first timer, don't let the location sway you...you will sorrily miss out!
